Title: Java Developer (Berlin, Germany)
Job_Description: We are The Mobile Bank.Our vision is to build a bank the world loves to use.Technology and design empower everything we do.N26 is Europe’s first Mobile Bank with a full European banking license. We redesigned the banking experience to be simple, fast and contemporary. Founded in 2013 by Valentin Stalf and Maximilian Tayenthal, N26 has more than 380 employees and more than 850.000 customers in 17 countries. N26 has raised more than $215 million from investors including Allianz, Tencent, Li Ka-Shing’s Horizons Ventures, Battery Ventures and Valar Ventures, in addition to members of the Zalando management board, Earlybird Venture Capital and Redalpine Ventures.Once here you will?Develop software using Java 8 with Spring Boot and Kotlin.Be able to manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.Continuously improve your skills by taking the initiative to learn and share your knowledge with others.Within cross-functional teams you collaborate towards building scalable products.What you’ll bring alongYou have experience developing software in Java 8 related technologies.You are familiar with the concept of microservice architecture.You are known as a person who does not shy away from a tough problem.Because you know technology keeps evolving, you stay up to date with the current trends in software design.We are an international company and therefore English professional proficiency is a must.What we offerWorking with international, highly engaged peersFreedom to prototype given the challenges we faceGetting things done attitudeFlat hierarchy and open communicationExciting ChallengesPersonalized OnboardingInteresting technical problems to solve as we scaleWorking with engaged, smart engineersFind a career path. Not just a job. Some of our benefits and rewards can be found on our careers website.Sound good? Send us your application online, and we’ll get back to you soon.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Communications System Engineer
Job_Description: If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.   Reporting to the Systems Support Manager, and as a member of the Management Team, the Communications Systems Engineer provides leadership and functional guidance for technical support staff. This position is responsible for technical specification, maintenance and upgrading of systems including telephones, portable and mobile radios, radio consoles, voice recording systems, computer hardware and software, and networks. The Communications Systems Engineer will play a key role in developing Next Generation (NG9-1-1) technologies. Primary duties include: Manage or provide technical oversight to technology projects in accordance with corporate project management framework. Create technological strategies, solutions and capacity for industry initiatives. Liaise with and provide business oversight for Information Technology (IT) managed projects and applications. Work with public safety partners (e.g. Police, Fire, EMS, Bylaw) on supporting systems and integrations. Develop and maintain technical system documentation, diagrams and approve as an engineering authority. Provide guidance and or leadership in developing NG9-1-1 capable systems including Internet Protocol (IP) telephony, advanced analytics and use of cognitive systems.  Qualifications Typically possess a degree in a related field in Engineering, must be registered as a Professional Engineer in Canada, and will be required to obtain registration with The Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) by the first day of work. Minimum of five years of post Professional Engineer experience is required. Strong knowledge of telephony, networks and trunked radio systems. Specific knowledge of IP telephony, Project 25 (P25) radio systems, network security and computer-aided dispatch is considered an asset. Knowledge of Public Safety Answer Point (PSAP) Operations and experience in emergency operations or a call centre environment are also considered assets. Strong project management skills as well as experience with technical writing and business development are essential. Success in this position requires superior technical aptitude, excellent problem solving, supervision and change management skills. Strong communication skills, be able to work under pressure and to maintain confidentiality in a secure environment Equivalent combinations of experience and education may be considered. Pre-employment Requirements An enhanced security clearance and a pre-employment polygraph examination will be conducted. Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.  Union: Exempt   Business Unit: Calgary Community Standards Position Type: Permanent Location: 35 Street N.E. Compensation: Engineer Level F $88,307 - 148,777 per annum Days of Work: This position works a 5 daywork week with one day off in a 3 week cycle. Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week and provides after hours on-call support on a rotating basis. Audience: Internal/External Apply By: May 23, 2018  Job ID #: 300788

Title: Lead Software Engineer (Remote)
Job_Description: Collage.com’s mission is to make custom products easy for everyone. We strive to do this by providing superior software and excellent customer service. We sell an expanding variety of photo and home products, including photo blankets, photo books, canvases, pillows, and more. Our company has been featured on the TODAY Show ( http://blog.collage.com/2013/10/25/total-request-collage-blanket-for-carson-daly/ ), The View ( http://blog.collage.com/2015/10/05/collage-com-on-abcs-the-view/ ), and Good Morning America ( http://blog.collage.com/2015/08/06/collage-com-on-good-morning-america-with-up-to-76-off-gallery-wrap-canvases/ ) many times. We are a 100% employee-owned company that has rapidly grown to 40 employees and $25M annual revenue over the past five years.  As a 100% remote company ( https://remote.co/company/collage-com/ ), we are set up to provide the best possible environment for engineering. The less time developers spend dealing with cumbersome processes, inefficient systems, and commuting, the more time they have to solve problems and make an impact. Collage.com’s co-founders/co-CEOs both come from a technical background and believe in staying at the forefront of best practices so that we can focus on work that matters. We pass almost all of The Joel Test ( https://www.joelonsoftware.com/2000/08/09/the-joel-test-12-steps-to-better-code/ ) (we only fix high-priority bugs before writing new code, but hey, we’re a start-up), use continuous deployment (code goes straight to production after each merge), and are in the process of adopting mobx-state-tree ( https://github.com/mobxjs/mobx-state-tree ) with React ( https://reactjs.org/ ). Strong engineering is a key part of our business strategy -- it lets us build best-in-class design tools faster than our larger competitors.  We are seeking an ambitious and nice lead software engineer who shares our passion for building a great software company. This is a unique opportunity to have a major impact on our engineering team’s growth (we are about ten strong right now) by helping us continually raise the bar. You will be expected to collaborate with other engineers to solve complex technical problems and push us to deliver higher quality code at an ever-increasing rate. We firmly believe in the power of solid architecture, code design, and simplicity over brute force, which is why we do our best to hire 10x senior engineers. If you are seeking an environment where you get to do meaningful work with other great engineers, then we want to hear from you.  Learn more about working and developing software at Collage.com ( http://jobs.collage.com ).  ---------------- Responsibilities ----------------   Write and maintain front-end JavaScript code as part of a mobile-first web application, including UI components and state management logic, as well as back-end PHP and front-end network communication code (back end is approximately 10% of work). Make decisions about code design, architecture, and refactoring to balance technical debt against delivering functionality. Plan and lead testing for complex projects. Review code and mentor other engineers. Provide time estimates and participate in agile development. Review specifications and work with PMs to implement lean methodology.  ----------------------- Required Qualifications -----------------------   5+ years professional application development experience Experience implementing and testing advanced JavaScript code on a team as part of a production web or mobile application Practical experience with MV* architecture (such as Backbone, Vue, React + Redux/Mobx, etc.), unidirectional data flow, and minimal class/object interfaces Spatial/geometric reasoning ability -- for rendering, animation, and image manipulation Ability to quickly understand and work with unfamiliar complex code Pro-active and clear communication is essential for this remote work position  ------------------ Benefits and Perks ------------------   Working from home makes it easier to focus on results and develop professionally while spending less time commuting. (See our opinion piece on perks and work-life balance at mlive.com. ( http://www.mlive.com/opinion/index.ssf/2015/08/perks_schmerks_the_one_thing_t.html )) 401(k) plan, home internet reimbursement, and $3,000 / year in free Collage.com products plus employee discount for friends and family. Collage.com pays 100% of the premium for full health, vision and dental insurance coverage for you and your family in a high-quality Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO plan. Flexible work schedule and unlimited vacation policy (work hard and take time when you need it). We’ll pay for any computer and home office equipment (within reason) that will help you work better.  --------------------- The Interview Process ---------------------  The goal of our interview process is to identify people who will be a good fit for our company and are talented, ambitious engineers. Because you will be working remotely, all of our interviews are done over the phone in close succession to move through the process quickly. We look for candidates with good written and verbal communication skills.  We ask all candidates to demonstrate strong coding ability at the beginning of our interview process. The questions are in Javascript and focus on applying general programming concepts (like concurrency and good code structure) in realistic scenarios that should be familiar to experienced engineers. We do not test for knowledge of esoteric language features, APIs, or algorithms. We prefer engineers who are smart and able to learn over those who are familiar with our exact tech stack.  During the interview process, you will talk to other engineers, your future manager, a product manager, and both founders/CEOs of the company. We believe in transparency, and will give you the opportunity to speak with anyone else you’d like to meet before accepting an offer. You are making an important decision, and we want to make sure you are fully committed to joining our team.

Title: Front End Software Engineer
Job_Description: SigFig is tearing down the barriers to investing. We've raised $60 million to support our growth as the #1 Online Investment Advisor for large Financial Institutions. Help us define the next generation of investing!  As a Software Engineer at SigFig, you will work with a team of brilliant developers to build solutions that analyze billions in investor assets, running complex algorithms and recommendations software to help people make better investment decisions. You’ll help us Platformize (yes that’s a word) our code, build high-impact features, and make it more easily configurable and customizable for a diverse set of needs.. It’s not easy, but it’s an incredible opportunity for people who like technical, people and business challenges.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:  Design, develop, test, deploy and maintain highly performant web applications on our stack (AngularJS, Typescript, Sass, Bootstrap). Work with our amazing product design team to develop and iterate on user interfaces that bring simplicity to complicated financial data. Interact with engineering members across the organization to ensure consistency in engineering practices and foster active exchange of ideas. We have development centers in San Francisco, Tucson, Singapore and India and the ability to work with distributed teams is a key skill. Perform peer code reviews. Review performance, security and flexibility of the code. Participating in SigFig’s agile ceremonies (e.g. daily standup, release and sprint planning, demos, scrum of scrums).  WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOMEBODY WITH:  Degree or diploma from an accredited college or university, or equivalent work experience. Strong Computer Science fundamentals - you understand data structures, algorithms and software design practices. Good expertise with front end technologies (Javascript, AngularJS, Typescript, Sass, Bootstrap) and experience building large scale responsive web applications. Great Communication Skills — You have excellent communication skills and are able to clearly articulate your thoughts during verbal and written communications. The work we do here is very collaborative (and globally distributed), so team players and an experience with fast moving projects is a big plus as well. Self starters with the interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed. Knowledge of server side technologies like Scala, Java, PHP is a plus. Domain Experience is a plus — You understand the financial services domain and have executed projects involving implementation and integration of software solutions with other systems in financial institutions. You understand the need for strong security, audits and performance criteria that are associated with the banking and financial services industry. Passion for finance and investing is a plus.  ABOUT SIGFIG  SigFig is dedicated to making high-quality investment advice more accessible and affordable to investors of all wealth levels. Using a combination of design, data science, and technology, SigFig helps empower investors with the information and guidance they need to achieve their personal financial goals. Through partnerships with some of the world’s largest and most innovative financial institutions, SigFig seeks to help investors and advisors better manage their investments. Its enterprise technology accelerates time to market for its partners, while doing so in a secure, scalable, and compliant way. Its product, design, and growth labs fuel innovation, accelerate adoption, and create delight for clients.  Founded in 2007, SigFig is backed by leading financial institutions including Eaton Vance, Comerica Bank, New York Life, Santander InnoVentures, and UBS, as well as top-tier venture capital firms, including Bain Capital Ventures, DCM Ventures, Nyca Partners, and Union Square Ventures. The company is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Learn more at www.sigfig.com ( http://www.sigfig.com ).

Title: Jr. Assembly & Test Engineer
Job_Description: We are looking for a skilled and motivated individual that shares our team’s passion for virtual reality and bringing great products to market.  As a member of the research and development team you will be responsible for building, testing and debugging prototypes of our room-scale VR technology. A successful candidate will have a good work ethic, soldering experience, familiarity with electronic test equipment and demonstrate a keen desire to develop cutting edge technologies for the exciting world of VR.  General Role & Responsibilities Participate within a cross functional team to meet project milestones and timelines Assembly, testing and debugging of prototypes Work closely with other team members to ensure successful integration of mechanical, electrical and software components Required Skills, Experience and Qualifications Degree in Electrical Engineering or related field or 3 years equivalent work experience Strong understanding of fundamental electronics concepts Some familiarity with Matlab, Python and C/C++ Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work collaboratively with other team members Strong organizational and communication skills Beneficial Qualifications Experience with Git and agile software development practices Experience with micro-controllers Experience soldering and working with surface mount components Basic understand of signal processing techniques and concepts

Title: Front End Developer - International Software Company
Job_Description: Seequent is a world leader in the development of data visualization software. Our solutions (including Leapfrog and Blockbuster) enable people to create rich stories and uncover valuable insights from geological data, and ultimately make better decisions about their earth, environment and energy challenges. Our primary development centres are in New Zealand (head office), Canada and South Africa. We also have offices in Australia, Chile, Brazil, Peru, Russia and the UK. The development team in Calgary is seeking a Front-End Developer to support our web-based communication and visualization product, View. As an experienced Front-End Developer, you see the web as a powerful communication and visualization tool. You have developed in the web space but are looking to really hone your craft and work in web applications that leverage 2D, 3D and 4D visualization. You are well versed in current web technologies and have a good appreciation for design and aesthetics. You want to learn by doing and you live for steep learning curves. In this role, you will bring and maintain a significant knowledge, competence and capability in front-end web development and you work efficiently with designers and product owners. You build general, tested code, and refactor as you go. You can plan quickly and test quickly - you know the plan will change. You will own the forward-facing component of a web application. You will help organize/execute the release of this application and ensure that features are continually tested. You identify and communicate risks and opportunities to business. Requirements Minimum 3 years demonstrated development experience with hand-coding HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript University degree in computer science and/or compelling and extensive experience in real-world applications Confident oral and written communication skills in English Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to develop and build sustainable working relationships Team-oriented attitude and good conflict management skills Ability to manage your own workload effectively and to work efficiently alongside team members Balanced and informed approach to problem solving Tenacity, persistence and focus with the ability to prioritize between multiple tasks Ability to work in a quickly growing, fast paced and constantly changing environment Benefits Our 3D modelling products and collaborative technology are used for projects such as road and rail tunnel construction, groundwater detection and management, geothermal exploration, resource evaluation and estimation, and subterranean storage of spent nuclear fuel. Seequent's global team is diverse – we’re geologists, software engineers, sales people and communication specialists. We’re technical experts who are driven by the challenges our customers face. We leverage the experience of our people to solve the highly complex problems of today, and work toward the bigger solutions of tomorrow. We offer market competitive salaries and support continuing growth and education. If what we do is something that would get you out of bed in the morning, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description: Showpass is a ticketing and event management software company. We empower venue and event organizers to create a rich, connected experience for their customers through next-generation technology. We combine cutting-edge software and hardware for seamless on- and offline sales, while delivering event management tools on the same integrated platform.  But what makes us different?  Showpass offers a unique platform for collaboration between the key groups that power events. From venues, to organizers, to street teams, to event attendees, we are focused on bringing people together through the magic of live events. We also happen to be powered by a very talented team fostering innovation, creativity and disruption. These pillars support the Showpass culture which is built on a love for events, and all things food. That’s what makes us the fastest growing Canadian ticketing company.  THE ROLE: Senior Software Engineer (full-time permanent role)  THE PERKS: A unique and fun place to work – flexible hours and vacation policy, in-house chef, fully stocked snack and fresh pressed juice bar, gym membership, dog-friendly office and parking Competitive compensation and benefits package  THE RESPONSIBILITIES: Facilitate best practices for quality assurance such as code reviews and technical recommendations Work with developers and designers to design new features and optimize the stability and scalability of our servers Stay up to date and knowledgeable on the latest programming tools and practices Write effective tests to find bugs quickly, and teach other developers to do the same Participate in routine standups, code reviews and testing parties  THE QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum 3 years work experience in Python/Django or similar Post secondary education in engineering or computer science would be an asset Natural ability to find and exploit weaknesses in a system Relentless pursuit of perfection in code and design Highly skilled with latest DevOps tools and practices including: Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS Experience with AngularJS or similar frontend frameworks (Backbone, React, Polymer) Experience with testing tools such as CircleCI, mocha, unittest Strong knowledge of database concepts Must work great in a team and also as an individual contributor Analytical thinker with the ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment Must have the hustle and drive to take initiative and make things happen!  NOTE: We will only contact qualified candidates of interest

Title: Test Engineer
Job_Description: Contribute to the company’s success by automating the testing of hardware and software to improve the consistency and coverage of testing on all Frac Automation products. Design, Document, Implement, and maintain test automation systems. Track and improve quality metrics.  Requirements Professional Engineer or Professional Technologist Bachelor of Science or related degree from an accredited university or technical school. A minimum of 2 years experience writing and creating test automation software in a manufacturing environment. Experience in designing cables, and fixtures used to automate testing of products. Knowledge of programming languages like C/C++, C# (.net), VB, Java, LabView. Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint Knowledge and understanding of schematics, P&IDs, process flow diagrams Strong analytical and troubleshooting. Ability and willingness to travel as required, approx. up to 4 weeks per year. Ability and willingness to travel to fracturing jobs and manufacturing sites. Benefits Comprehensive benefits including paid vacations and holidays, supplemental healthcare including paramedical and health savings account, dental; vision, prescriptions, Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) with generous company match, long and short term disability and life insurances, etc.,

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description: Who You Are:  You are an agile developer who loves creating elegant solutions to complex problems. You enjoy coding and find yourself learning the latest development practices, platforms, and design patterns because it’s fun. You are excited by the Web Services technology space, and want to contribute to its evolving styles and patterns. You regularly read code blogs to stay in touch with the development community. You enjoy the challenge of balancing customer needs, business value, and technical solutions. You like collaborating with smart people who help you do more than you thought you could do. Peers are drawn to work with you because you're fun and help them grow.  Your Next Challenge:  Building Getty Images’ world-class API platform using REST principles. Collaborating with stakeholders to meet product goals. Delivering business value frequently, in short development iterations. Designing APIs to access functionality in a large, heterogeneous Enterprise environment. Programming in an Agile development process. Creating middle-tier components and datastores to support Web Services. Delighting our customers with an intuitive and easy-to-use API.  What You’ll Need:  Deep experience with .Net C# and in the development of Web Services. BS Degree in Computer Science, hard science, or relevant experience Strong understanding of code quality and design principles. Strong understanding of web principles like REST, and related web technologies like HTTP. Ability to work well in a highly collaborative team environment. Drive to improve your approach to software development. Knowledge of trends in API design and adoption is desired. Experience building service clients using Ruby, JSON, or Ajax is desired. Experience with Agile software development practices is strongly desired.  #LI-EB1  Who We Are:  Getty Images is the most trusted and esteemed source of visual content in the world, with over 200 million assets available through its industry-leading sites www.gettyimages.com and www.istock.com. The Getty Images website serves creative, business and media customers in almost 200 countries and is the first place people turn to discover, purchase and share powerful content from the world's best photographers and videographers. Getty Images works with over 200,000 contributors and hundreds of image partners to provide comprehensive coverage of more than 130,000 news, sport and entertainment events, impactful creative imagery to communicate any commercial concept and the world's deepest digital archive of historic photography.  Visit Getty Images at www.gettyimages.com to learn more about how the company is advancing the unique role of still and moving imagery in communication and business, and enabling creative ideas to come to life. For company news and announcements, visit our Press Room, and for the stories and inspiration behind our content, visit Stories & Trends. Find Getty Images on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest and Tumblr, or download the Getty Images app where you can explore, save and share the world's best imagery.  Getty Images is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description: About Synopsys Software Integrity Group (SIG) Synopsys Software Integrity Group helps organizations build secure, high-quality software, minimizing risks while maximizing speed and productivity. Synopsys, a recognized leader in application security, provides static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis solutions that enable teams to quickly find and fix vulnerabilities and defects in proprietary code, open source components, and application behavior. With a combination of industry-leading tools, services, and expertise, only Synopsys helps organizations maximize security and quality in DevSecOps and throughout the software development life cycle. For more information, go to www.synopsys.com/software.  General Responsibilities: Architect, design and develop tooling necessary for delivering Enterprise Cloud-based and on-premise Security Solutions. Be able to work with and customize available container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes and OpenShift Origin Research open source solutions for Monitoring (e.g. Prometheus), Secret Management (E.g, Hashicopt Vault), Secure Networking (Project Calico) and adopting them into the CloudOps tool chain Be able to develop strategies and automation necessary for Persistent volumes, High availability, Failover, load balancing, DNS, Secure Communication, Logging, Blue-Green deployments Play key role in architecting and building end-end Continuous Delivery pipeline that takes developer code committed to SCM to production (Glue all pieces together: Build Jobs (CI), blending in automated integration tests, Automates Deployment automation, Host and container security scanning) Work closely with and act as a Cloud/DevOps consultant for Development and QA teams. Qualifications: BSc or MSc in Computer Science or related field/degree 5+ years experience in Software Development and/or DevOps Multiple years of programming experience in Java, Python and/or Golang (GoLang Preferred) Proficient in Shell Scripting Strong knowledge in Operating Systems and Networks Experience with Docker, one or more orchestration systems like Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, Openshift, Apache Mesos, Hashicorp Nomad Knowledge and experience one or more the following technologies: Prometheus, Project Calico. ELK Stack, Jenkins, Hashicorp Vault, Ansible/Chef/Puppet, Spinnaker, Vagrant, Terraform. Benefits: Competitive base salary Annual performance bonuses Health benefits (medical, dental, vision) Matching RRSP contribution program ESPP program Insurance (travel, life, short/long-term disability) Work from home one day a week Monthly commute allowance Wellness program (subsidy) Employee referral bonuses  Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. Title: Generation RAM Data Engineer
Job_Description: Utilize your power plant knowledge, sound engineering judgement, and data automation and management skills to provide technical expertise and troubleshooting expertise to the Generation Fleet to identify ways to reduce risk and losses.  Is this challenge for you? Imagine the possibilities.  Champion the establishment, automation, sustainment, and enhancement of a global process for collection, analysis, reporting, tracking, and performance improvement of Reliability, Availability, and Maintainability (RAM) for all ENMAX Generation facilities in alignment with industry standards and bodies (IEEE, NERC, GADS, etc.) and best practices.  Major Responsibilities: Responsible for the quality, consistency, automation, accuracy, and integrity of Generation fleet RAM data analytics. Accountable for assessing and analyzing RAM data to identify and track production losses and high maintenance costs and to transform and automate the data to information and insights for management decision making Responsible for establishing/determining the Generation RAM annual KPI targets based on historical performance and industry benchmarks, and reporting and tracking of the KPI’s while explaining the technical reasons why actual performance varies from targets on a weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual basis. Identify and forecast losses, repetitive failures, and other problems that adversely affect plant operations. These problems include capacity, availability, reliability, heat rate, cost impact, or regulatory compliance issues. Responsible for generation fleet events data integrity, accuracy, automation and completion in alignment with Plant operations and IEEE Standard. Responsible for maintaining and enhancing Facility Characteristics databases and analytics for all facilities (including generation technology performance related info such as min-up time, ramp rate, etc. in different operating modes – min stable, baseload, duct firing, etc.) Lead the development of RAM databases, data management, and automation within ENMAX information systems. Perform analytics and forecasting using complex data analysis techniques, coding and scripting, statistical methods, modeling and prediction, fault tree analysis, Weibull analysis, and/or Six Sigma (6σ) methodologies. Using BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.), create and maintain automated analytics and reports to predict RAM performance and track KPI’s. Provides input to risk management plans that will anticipate reliability-related and non-reliability-related risks that could adversely impact plant operations. Provide technical training to all applicable personnel regarding RAM practices and techniques.  Education Required: Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer/software Engineering or related degree. Masters of Science or Masters of Engineering in the related field is preferred P.Eng status with The Association of Professionals in Engineering and Geoscientists in Alberta (APEGA)  Qualifications & Experience: Minimum of 7 of experience in electricity Generation/Operations fields working with plant RAM data management, analysis, and automation Must have plant operations experience Experience in maintenance and reliability principles and practices as well as implementation experience of these programs to improve these practices Expert analytical and mathematical skills Good knowledge of application of Computerized Maintenance Monitoring Systems (MAXIMO, SAP, etc.) including management of data from these systems Expert level knowledge of power plant systems and their interaction as one asset Expert level knowledge of SQL, visual basic, .NET, C++, C#, R, Python, or other coding language. Expert level in using Excel (macro code writing), Power Pivots, Clustering, and Data integration Must have experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, SAS, etc.) Expert level knowledge in RAM analysis techniques Expert level knowledge of IEEE standards and NERC GADS in relation with RAM analytics and reporting Expert level knowledge of big data management, warehousing, relational databases  Personal Qualities: Highly detailed oriented yet be able to apply critical thinking and engineering judgment in assessing results and providing quality work Ability to work independently and provide recommendations to senior management with confidence Maintain strong working relationships with staff, clients, and stakeholders Experience working in multi-discipline groups of professional employees Capable of influencing change High level of coordination and collaboration skills Takes ownership for his/her own development needs and identifies training and learning opportunities  Did we mention the ENMAX Advantage?  We offer competitive compensation including a comprehensive flexible benefits program, free parking and much more. If you share our values and would like to make a difference with your career, join the team and see where the ENMAX possibilities can take you.  Location: 141 50 AVE SE Calgary, AB  Note: ENMAX welcomes all qualified applicants to apply, it is our aim to have a workplace which reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. ENMAX employees are encouraged to pursue professional development opportunities through our internal Learning Centre . Must be legal to work in Canada and requires the successful completion of a criminal background check. Two pieces of valid Government issued ID will be required. Two professional references will be requested. Education requirements for this position will be verified by a third party.  Please visit our careers page to learn more about other opportunities at ENMAX Corporation.

Title: Sr. Software Developer
Job_Description: Senior Software Engineer, Product Development and Delivery  Summary We are seeking an outstanding Senior Software Engineer to develop commercial software solutions within the Identity and Access Management (IAM) domain. Incumbents in this role have thorough knowledge in multiple development technologies across the entire technology stack (end to end). This Senior Software Engineer will be expected to learn and apply a broad spectrum of programming languages, design principles, tools and technologies in developing solutions. This individual will be working directly with emerging Cloud technologies on a highly visible business-critical platform; providing substantial opportunity for technical skills development and career growth.  General Job Duties Participate as part of a project team to design, code, test, and implement moderately complex software solutions. Foster inter-team cooperation as part of a project/program. Follow industry good coding practices to ensure high quality deliverables with minimal defects. Follow established testing procedures to ensure application is thoroughly tested throughout the development phase. Report to management on project status, identify issues that may impede attainment of goals, and accept direction on corrective measures. Provide technical direction to more junior Software Development Personnel. Continuously expand knowledge in areas of specialization. Perform other duties as required. Specific Job Duties Operate as a Senior Software Engineer in a .NET development team for a software platform that provides Identity and Access Management (IAM) services across other business platforms. Assist in analyzing customer requirements and providing robust technical designs to drive software implementation. Support leadership in implementing best practices for software development around coding standards, patterns, and software development lifecycle and change management. Support and champion the Agile Scrum development methodology. Collaborate with Development Leads, Developers, Product Managers, Business Analysts, and IT Leadership. Education/Experience Requirements Bachelors in Computer Science, related field or equivalent experience. 7+ years of experience in software development. Thorough knowledge of technologies primarily in the Microsoft development stack, such as C# ASP .Net MVC, WCF, and SQL Server. Thorough knowledge of web development technologies, such Javascript, CSS, HTML. Specifically, JQuery, AngularJS, and Bootstrap. Thorough understanding on web development concepts, such as RESTful services and Cross-browser compatibility. Thorough understanding on design principles such as Object Oriented Design, SOLID Principles, and various Design Patterns. Thorough understanding on Test Driven Development Demonstrated ability to engage self-guided analysis and problem solving. Working knowledge of Agile development methodologies. Ability to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical personnel. Passion and curiosity for challenging technical problems Working knowledge of Java is a plus. Professional certification is a plus. AWS knowledge is a major plus. Occasional travel may be required. Organizational Relationships Reports to Development Lead. Acts as a major contributor on programs of all sizes. Interacts with other colleagues at all levels in the conduct of day-to-day activities. External Relationships Actively participates in industry forums and user groups. FLSA Status – US Only Exempt It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below).  EEO is the Law EEO is the Law Supplement Right to Work Pay Transparency Policy E-Verify   Current Colleagues If you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.

Title: Python Developer
Job_Description: Develop Python scripts to address IAM process automation requirements on behalf of an internal team of solution architects and developers. Translate business process definitions into Python components, built using a well defined framework and shipped with our IAM products. As a member of the global Hitachi family, you will receive competitive pay and excellent benefits.  Responsibilities: Understanding, supporting, and improving an extensive Python code framework. Implementing business processes as components within an existing framework. Utilizing test driven development. Writing documentation (docstrings and guides). Qualifications: You should join our team if: You can write complex scripts in Python to capture business logic and automate system management tasks. You have experience leveraging complex libraries and APIs. You have familiarity with the git revision control system. You have experience designing and debugging complex systems. You have strong verbal and written communication skills in English. You can collaborate easily with co-workers and work well with minimal supervision. You can handle multiple concurrent projects. You can work well under pressure to meet deadlines. You should REALLY join our team if: You have experience on large-scale development projects with tight deadlines. You have familiarity with test automation and regression testing. You have Relational Database and SQL knowledge: MSSQL, Oracle DB. You have worked with Web technologies: HTML, AJAX, JQUERY. You have public github/bitbucket profiles with candidate developed code. You can provide links to open source project contributions. Compensation/ benefits: Competitive salary. Extensive health benefits paid by the employer. RRSP and bonus plans. Paid vacation. Flexible work hours. Informal and rewarding work environment staffed with IT experts. Be part of a growing, stable company with a great reputation. Hitachi ID Systems is an equal opportunity employer. Together we succeed. Location: Calgary, Alberta To apply: Send a resume by e-mail to jobs@Hitachi-ID.com. Be sure to include both "Job ID 999-33" in the subject line. E-mails that do not include this will not be delivered to the appropriate person. For technical positions, the resume must be either ASCII text or in PDF format. For other positions, MS-Word is also acceptable.  Qualified applicants will be contacted within two weeks for a preliminary phone interview. Successful applicants will be invited to return for a second interview and a skills evaluation.

Title: BIM Modelers/Engineers
Job_Description: BIM Modelers/Engineers Calgary Duties include creating Building Information Models (BIM) for structural and precast concrete projects, from conceptual sales models to detailed fabrication models. Duties include 3D BIM Modeling of concrete, steel, rebar, connections and various other building components. Candidates must be knowledgeable with design and construction, interpreting architectural and structural drawings, and have desire to pursue exciting emerging 3D BIM technologies. Candidates must have excellent verbal and written communication skills and be able to work in a team atmosphere. Related experience and technical skills in structural and CAD/BIM software is an asset. Requirements: Degree/diploma from a recognized institution Experience with 3D software and must have good computer skills Knowledge of concrete and steel constructionExperience reading architectural and structural drawingsPrevious 3D BIM modeling an asset

Title: Intermediate Software Developer (Pason Power)
Job_Description: The Role The Pason Power team focuses on the monitoring and intelligent control of distributed energy storage systems. There will be a number of potential applications ranging from installation of energy storage with solar/PV systems to utility companies looking to build a responsive and adaptable electrical grid. You will have the opportunity to combine your experience with Pason’s in data acquisition and embedded control systems combined with cutting edge Internet of Things (IoT) and cloud technologies to provide a best in class solution.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities Work as a part of an agile scrum team, contributing to the development of the Pason Power product line Contribute to the development of Pason Power web applications and monitoring & control systems Work alongside data science engineers to improve and optimize control system algorithms Maintain and extend reliable communications with external hardware devices using protocols such as Modbus, CANbus, ZigBee, etc. Further the integration with cloud services and IoT transport mechanisms Write unit and integration tests Troubleshoot and provide timely solutions for production issues Understand and contribute to the development of system architecture Participate in Code Reviews Participate in team technical discussions, challenge ideas and present solutions and approaches to be considered by the team Participate and contribute in weekly Agile meetings, discuss and present work accomplished and provide constructive feedback to help improve the team Contribute to our evolving development environment through research, experiment with new technologies and attend conferences or courses. Educate your peers on what you have learned. Travel to our Houston office 1-2 weeks per year to spend time working in person with the technical team there  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Expertise in any of the following programming languages: Python, JavaScript, Java, C/C++ or C# Experience with the React.js framework Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git Proficiency in Linux Experience working with hardware / IoT device control systems Experience with Test Driven Development / Behavioral Driven Development Experience providing leadership in technical teams Experience working with protocols such as Modbus, CANbus, ZigBee etc. Familiar with RESTful APIs Familiar with container technologies (Docker) Familiar with messaging protocols such as MQTT or AMQP Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience NoSQL database experience (MongoDB, DynamoDB, InfluxDB, etc.) Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc.) A knack for benchmarking and optimization Agile/Scrum experience Experience in integration and unit testing Ability to work in a team or as an individual.  Qualifications Education  Preferred Bachelors or better in Computer Science or related field. Bachelors or better in Engineering - Electrical and Computer or related field. Experience Required 3 years: or more of software development experience on commercial development teams Preferred Experience on complex and technically diverse projects would be an asset

Title: Junior System Integration (V&V) Engineer
Job_Description: Company Overview At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible.  Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. Project/Program Overview General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is staffing for an exciting opportunity to deliver a world class secure next-generation communications system for the Ministry of Defence (MoD) in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles.  General Dynamics Calgary is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. Software will be developed for Windows 10 laptops, tablets and for General Dynamics developed hardware products running Linux. The project includes all phases including System Design, Software and Hardware Design, System Integration, and System Validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area.  The systems integration and verification and validation (SI V&V, or SI) team will consist of several smaller integration teams, each focusing on integration a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Systems integration teams will work closely with the software development teams and will follow the Scrum framework for software development. As a member of a Scrum team, the successful candidates will work together to design, implement, and test software features for the product.  Responsibilities Typical Duties  The responsibilities and range of activities will vary depending on experience, but in general will include: Work cooperatively within a Scrum team or with multiple Scrum teams to take on new integration test tasks Perform detailed design, implementation, and test activities in order to complete Sprint tasks Share knowledge and skills with other Scrum (development and test) team members Development of acceptance test cases and procedures that validate hardware, firmware, software, and system functionality Ability to review system, subsystem and product requirement specifications, interface control documents, design documents and use cases in order to develop test cases Executing test cases in a lab environment; analyzing, interpreting and documenting results Writing defect and test summaries and test reports to demonstrate progress and communicate this as required Some generation and maintenance of test scripts for automated testing Analysis and management of requirements mapping to test cases Qualifications Required Skills & Experience Some understanding of test engineering, ideally with knowledge of SAFe agile and/or iterative development methods Demonstrate strong communication skills, both written and verbal Demonstrate strong problem solving and an ability to conduct detail analysis leading to good conclusions Enthusiastic contributor, willing to learn new skills, and takes pride and ownership of work Ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision Has a desire to learn, and ideally experience in; defining, developing and executing integration tests for communications and networking systems. Experience in investigation and working collaboratively to resolve software defects Experience with test engineering processes and tools Knowledge and use of requirements writing tools and test writing tools, an asset Familiarity with radios, voice/data networks and Internet Protocols (IP), an asset Willing to develop knowledge and skills in automated test frameworks and implemented automated integration testing An ability to adapt quickly Education Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required Candidates with diplomas will be considered with adequate additional experience  Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position.  General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Software Engineer, Staff
Job_Description: Responsible for designing, developing, troubleshooting, or debugging software programs. Develops software tools including operating systems, compilers, routers, networks, utilities, databases and internet-related tools, etc. Determines hardware compatibility and/or influences hardware design.  Relevant experience in programming software for operating systems utilizing machine assembly and/or job control languages, and expert knowledge of software capabilities. Experience on development of complex software projects and familiar with C/C++ coding. Requires a strong background in data structures and algorithms. Demonstrates good analysis and problem-solving skills. Knowledge and experience of CAD tool development are required.  Typically requires a minimum of 8+ years of related experience. At this level, post-graduate coursework or knowledge base equivalent may be desirable. Having wide-ranging experience, uses professional concepts and company objectives to independently resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways. Understands customer wants and needs. Customarily exercises a high level of independent judgment and interpretation in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria to obtain results. Frequently performs in project leadership role. Drives programs and business initiatives. Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and projects. Offers new solutions or direction and is able to encourage and motivate others to support new solution or direction. May advise senior management on specialized technical or business issues. May coordinate activities of other personnel as a team lead. Represents the organization as the principle contact on business unit and/or company-wide projects. Interacts with management and senior external personnel on matters requiring coordination across internal groups. Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise.

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Job_Description: Position Overview  Replicon is looking for software developers who are passionate about coding and technology to work on our Time Intelligence platform. Our SaaS application is used globally by thousands of customers and millions of users. We want to build out our team with more engineers who are also passionate about building great applications and care about giving our customers a great user experience.  What you need to bring: Coding skills across the entire stack – UI, Services and Data Familiarity with IaaS (AWS, Azure, GCP) A technology toolbelt that includes leading edge languages and tools with knowledge on when and why to use them You adopt industry best practices in all of your projects - TDD, CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, linting You are pragmatic enough to deliver an MVP, but aspirational enough to think about how it will work with millions of users You take ownership and pride in everything you do and you will stand by what you deliver Readiness to hit the ground running – you may not know how to solve everything right off the bat, but you will put in the time and effort to understand so that you can How we work: An agile development environment delivering functionality to production every day Team lunches, team events, flexible work environment A relentless desire to continuously improve

Title: Data Science Developer - Student
Job_Description: Data Science Developer - Student Location: Calgary, AB, CA Company: ExxonMobil   Job description  As a member of the Architecture & Technology team, you will work closely with Technology Architects to develop prototype solutions using machine learning and deep learning to address challenging business problems. This may involve technologies, such as Python, Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow, cognitive API frameworks and others. This includes interfacing with business and technical contacts, seeking new and innovative approaches, developing prototypes and explaining ideas to a broad audience.  Examples of specific job responsibilities:  Development of Prototype Solutions Leveraging Machine Learning Learning about a spefic business opportunity or problem Seeking innovative solution approaches involving data science/machine learning/artificial intelligence Acquisition and preparation of data needed for development of models Development of predictive models Documentation and presentation of key ideas   Evaluation of New Technologies and Frameworks Participate in evaluation of new products and solutions Advise on technologies used by these products   Development of prototype solutions Using Pre-built Components Utilize technologies, such as Amazon Alexa, Cognitive APIs from Microsoft/Google/Amazon and Microsoft Bot Framework to build prototypes and demonstration solutions   Technology Awareness Learn about latest advances in deep learning and data science Reproduce algorithms described in published research in the area of deep learning using company’s computing plafroms and data Learn about latest AI offerings from vendors, such as Microsoft, Amazon, Google and others Learn about existing tools/technologies that are offered by ExxonMobil IT    Qualifications  Academic: 3rd or 4th year Computer/Electrical/Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or Statistics students interested in a career in data science Enrolled in Masters-level degree program in the area of Machine Learning, Data Science or Computer Science preferred To be considered for employment, your most recent unofficial transcript(s) must be submitted with your application   Other: Ability to build data preparation scripts using Python and other higher-level tools Ability to write machine learning models in Python utilizing libraries, such as Scikit-Learn and Tensorflow Interest in learning about latest advances in machine learning and deep learning Strong interpersonal, listening, verbal and written communication skills Ability to work effectively in a team environment to accomplish organizational goals Demonstrate sound analytical and problem-solving skills Highly motivated individual able to work with minimum supervision Capability to rapidly learn and apply new IT technologies and then to teach and train others Flexibility in dealing with changing priorities and short deadlines  Start date: September 2018 (start date negotiable) Work term: 12 months preferred, 8 months considered Location: Calgary, Alberta    Your benefits  This position will provide you with an opportunity to leverage your skills in support of a large integrated energy company. For example: Work in a high caliber, collaborative learning environment Receive on-the-job experience, coaching and training Gain technical and business background in the operations of the oil & gas resource industry through participation in various networking programs Work with a geographically dispersed team Work directly with the client business unit to deliver IT solutions to meet critical business needs    Who we are  At ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada ULC (EMBSCC) we are an integral part of a worldwide network of business support centres that provide financial, technical, information service, transactional, and customer service support for ExxonMobil’s global operations. Other considerations For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required. We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.  Eligibility to work in Canada Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada. Proof of eligibility must be in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, Canadian certificate of permanent residence or work permit. Document must be current and valid (not expired, cancelled or voided). Work permit must be valid for the duration of the term. Proof of eligibility is required if an offer is made. Failure to provide the appropriate documentation within a reasonable timeframe (generally 6 weeks prior to your start date) may result in the offer being rescinded or a delay in your start date. Application deadline: June 3, 2018     The ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. In certain situations, ExxonMobil may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions within the Company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including Imperial Oil and affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates.  Job Segment: Database, Developer, Electrical, Engineer, Computer Science, Technology, Engineering

Title: Software Integrations Developer
Job_Description: Are you an experienced software/web developer? Don't miss this opportunity to work on software which is used worldwide on high profile marine projects! Enjoy competitive compensation, full benefits, and bonus program! About the Organization Trusted by shipbuilders, naval architects and marine engineers, SSI develops Autodesk-based solutions for the shipbuilding and offshore industry. With the majority of US naval ships now being built with SSI solutions, and prestigious names in global marine construction increasingly choosing SSI, we are poised for well-managed and sustainable growth.  Based in Victoria, BC with a satellite office in Alabama, we are proud to offer our team an environment that facilitates fascinating and challenging work with a healthy work/life balance. A career with us gives you the opportunity to work on complex and graphically-oriented software that is used on high profile marine projects worldwide. These exciting projects include the recently built Staten Island ferries, as well as a myriad of both international and US defense projects. The ability to see the results of your efforts in the real world is what makes a career with SSI so rewarding.  In 2013, SSI was awarded the VIATec award for Business of the Year in Ocean Products - a true testament to our success within the industry. For more information, please visit our website.  About the Opportunity Currently, SSI is looking for a Software Integrations Developer to join their team in Victoria, BC.  Using your comprehensive knowledge of web services, XML, relational databases, and API design, you will integrate our leading-edge shipbuilding design software with those of our partners while using your communications and organization skills to liaise with the clients and vendors to design and test the integrations.  In order to qualify for this role, you will have a post-secondary education in Computer Science or Engineering with a minimum of 5 years of experience in software and web development, as well as a minimum of 3 years of experience in XML and RESTful web services.  You will also possess:  Knowledge of C# and C++ Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio Familiarity with object-oriented design patterns Knowledge of complex data structures and algorithms Experience with automated testing methodologies Experience with SQL Server (or other relational databases) The following are considered assets:  Experience with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems Experience working with remote teams, spanning multiple time zones Experience working in an Agile Environment (Scrum) Experience with Atlassian Tools (JIRA, Confluence) Experience with Software Versioning and Revision Control Systems (SVN) You will do well in this role if you can work independently but also within a collaborative environment. Sound judgment and decision making skills are essential.  Please note: you must be a Canadian or US citizen and be based in, or willing to relocate to, Victoria, British Columbia, Canada in order to be considered for this role.  If you are a creative, energetic, and dynamic professional who wants to work on complex, graphically oriented software, this could be the role for you!  About the Benefits At SSI, the core of our success lies in the creative, energetic and dedicated people who make up our team. Title: Systems Engineer
Job_Description: Tucows has been on the Internet since people unironically called it the Information Superhighway. Today, we’re the second largest domain wholesaler in the world with Millions of domains under management (OpenSRS / Enom). We’re doing all kinds of interesting things including running an MVNO cell phone service (Ting) and building fiber to the premises networks in towns and cities across the US (Ting Internet). We offer individual and small business domains and integration with Shopify, Squarespace and many others (Hover). We’re a team of over 600 serving tens of millions of customers around the world. Our growth has been incredible (NASDAQ: TCX, TSX: TC). It has also been smart and measured. Our success is built on a solid technology foundation thanks to a culture of DevOps excellence. That’s where you come in. As a Systems Engineer you’ll seed innovation and creativity in a dynamic, fast-paced successful and yet stable company. Description The Systems Engineer will be responsible for day to day operations including migrating production systems into a new architecture, taking advantage of the latest DevOps methodologies and tools. You will be working in a dynamic environment and proposing creative and effective solutions to operational challenges. Key skills and experience 4+ years of experience with configuration management Preferably SaltStack; Chef or Puppet is acceptable. Able to create new pillars and state files. Handle issues that arise with running a configuration management platform. Extensive experience with Linux We are using Debian, but at this level, it is expected that you can easily pick up other flavors. Package management (building, maintaining, etc.)  2+ years of Python Ability to write code to automate routine Operations’ tasks Ability to integrate into various APIs to create a cohesive platform. Nice to have skills and experience Leadership skills Standard internet services like DNS/HTTP Managing containerized systems Experience with continuous deployment best practices You might remember Tucows as the place to download software before software download sites got gross... not to mention almost entirely irrelevant. That was indeed us. That was also a long time ago on a server far, far away.

Title: Software Integrations Developer
Job_Description: Are you an experienced software/web developer? Don't miss this opportunity to work on software which is used worldwide on high profile marine projects! Enjoy competitive compensation, full benefits, and bonus program! About the Organization Trusted by shipbuilders, naval architects and marine engineers, SSI develops Autodesk-based solutions for the shipbuilding and offshore industry. With the majority of US naval ships now being built with SSI solutions, and prestigious names in global marine construction increasingly choosing SSI, we are poised for well-managed and sustainable growth.  Based in Victoria, BC with a satellite office in Alabama, we are proud to offer our team an environment that facilitates fascinating and challenging work with a healthy work/life balance. A career with us gives you the opportunity to work on complex and graphically-oriented software that is used on high profile marine projects worldwide. These exciting projects include the recently built Staten Island ferries, as well as a myriad of both international and US defense projects. The ability to see the results of your efforts in the real world is what makes a career with SSI so rewarding.  In 2013, SSI was awarded the VIATec award for Business of the Year in Ocean Products - a true testament to our success within the industry. For more information, please visit our website.  About the Opportunity Currently, SSI is looking for a Software Integrations Developer to join their team in Victoria, BC.  Using your comprehensive knowledge of web services, XML, relational databases, and API design, you will integrate our leading-edge shipbuilding design software with those of our partners while using your communications and organization skills to liaise with the clients and vendors to design and test the integrations.  In order to qualify for this role, you will have a post-secondary education in Computer Science or Engineering with a minimum of 5 years of experience in software and web development, as well as a minimum of 3 years of experience in XML and RESTful web services.  You will also possess:  Knowledge of C# and C++ Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio Familiarity with object-oriented design patterns Knowledge of complex data structures and algorithms Experience with automated testing methodologies Experience with SQL Server (or other relational databases) The following are considered assets:  Experience with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems Experience working with remote teams, spanning multiple time zones Experience working in an Agile Environment (Scrum) Experience with Atlassian Tools (JIRA, Confluence) Experience with Software Versioning and Revision Control Systems (SVN) You will do well in this role if you can work independently but also within a collaborative environment. Sound judgment and decision making skills are essential.  Please note: you must be a Canadian or US citizen and be based in, or willing to relocate to, Victoria, British Columbia, Canada in order to be considered for this role.  If you are a creative, energetic, and dynamic professional who wants to work on complex, graphically oriented software, this could be the role for you!  About the Benefits At SSI, the core of our success lies in the creative, energetic and dedicated people who make up our team. Although the work may be challenging, we foster a fun, flexible and friendly working environment with:  A casual, relaxed work environment Flexible work hours that support a work-life balance Seasonal social events (Friday pub lunches, potlucks, Pi day, Christmas parties, theme days, and more) Weekly onsite yoga classes Paid time off to attend blood donation drives Upon joining SSI, you can expect to receive a competitive annual salary of $60,000 - $75,000 per year depending on skills and experience, plus great employee benefits, including:  ParaMedical, Dental, and Vision Life insurance and long-term disability benefits Profit Sharing Plan Three weeks’ vacation Education assistance, professional development, opportunities for career growth, and training If you enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment and want to take your career to the next level with a local employer of choice – Apply to SSI today For full details and to apply, please visit http://jobs.applyfirst.ca/jobs...

Job_Description: Responsible for designing, developing, troubleshooting, or debugging software programs.
