Title: Solutions Engineer
Job_Description: We're looking for an enthusiastic and talented solutions engineer to join our sales team. Do you enjoy solving challenges, working as a team and building strong relationships? If so, than this role may be for you!  The Solution Engineer provides support for technical elements of the sales cycle and is the primary internal resource for the sales team. Responsible for actively driving and managing the technology evaluation stage of the sales process, working in conjunction with internal teams to ensure that clients are set up for success, post-sales.  As an expert in Benevity products and services, the Solution Engineer will serve customers by identifying their needs and recommending possible adaptations of products and services that may be implemented and supported by the Client Services team. He or she will maintain a connection with various departments including client services, product and technical services. The Sales Engineer will be responsible for gathering and communicating key client information to the Relationship and Implementation Management teams to ensure timely and successful client implementations.  The person in the role is a solutions-oriented individual with a high technical aptitude and strong interpersonal skills. He or she is a great juggler of priorities, capable of communicating complex information simply, and enjoys working with clients to understand possible solutions for their needs.  Our Sales team members are located across North America, so we welcome exceptional, passionate applicants from all over the United States & Canada. If making an impact matters to you, and working with a company that helps clients to change the world sounds like an exciting adventure, then read on!  Who we are  Benevity is the global leader in online workplace giving, matching, volunteering and community investment software. Many of the world’s most iconic brands rely on Spark, Benevity’s award winning cloud solution, to power corporate “Goodness Programs” that attract, retain and engage today’s diverse workforce by connecting people to the social causes that matter to them.  Better Work and a Better World: that’s what we’re all about. We’re a software company in the business of doing good, building better ways for companies to connect with their customers and employees around causes and prosocial behaviour (we make “doing well by doing good” more than just a tagline!). We’re growing fast and looking for more great people to join us.  We have that fun, flexible tech culture that people love, and we have a heart. We’re a registered B Corporation, which means we’re part of a new breed of companies committed to higher social and sustainability standards.  The Why  The Solution Engineer expedites the sales process by assisting Sales Executives with technical discussions, articulating the technology and product positioning to both business and technical users, contributing to client satisfaction and implementation success.  Finds solutions to unique client issues by using the tools available, contributing to organizational profitability and revenue growth.  The What  Bridge the gap between sales and client services to reduce implementation timelines and improve visibility into resource allocation and planning  Gather and articulate important client information through internal channels (SalesForce, Confluence) to build a strong client profile  Maintain and communicate the latest Spark features and capabilities to the sales team so we are continuously able to provide the best solutions for potential buyers  Streamline the implementation process by gathering relevant information and preparing clients for next steps during sales cycle  Communicating client requests and requirements to product and technical teams to ensure implementation success  Work with Marketing and other internal teams to develop sales tools that help present complex information in a way that potential buyers can understand  Identify current and future customer service requirements by establishing personal rapport with potential and actual customers and other persons in a position to understand service requirements  Gain buyer acceptance by explaining and demonstrating the fi t of the Benevity solution through proof of concept (POC) solutions  Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies  Contribute to the Marketing and Product team’s effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed; providing information and commentary pertinent to deliberations; recommending options and courses of action  Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed  The How  2+ years experience in Sales Engineering or related role  Learn quickly and adapt even more quickly  Ability to manage competing priorities and work effectively under the pressure of time constraints in a fast-paced, complex, collaborative and team-oriented environment  Highly developed interpersonal and written/spoken communication skills  Able to maintain strong relationship both internally and with clients  Experience with Salesforce is a strong asset  Strong understanding of SaaS software solutions  In-depth knowledge of Community Investment industry  Technical understanding – not afraid to question and investigate so that challenges can be resolved quickly  Professional, motivated and flexible – enthusiastic about using process to deliver but understand that there’s a time and a place to go with the fl ow  Motivated self-starter that works well both alone and with a team  Business analysis and problem solving skills  It is our hope and belief that you apply because you believe the same things we do – that global Goodness is an achievable goal! While we sincerely appreciate the time and effort you put into your application, unfortunately only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Software Engineer
Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking a Software Engineer for a permanent job opportunity, scheduled to begin immediately.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Defining and documenting Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS) architectures and performance requirements;  Working with cross-functional teams to solve platform level issues;  Managing development of high precision algorithm; and,  Managing development of multi-sensor fusion algorithms.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: PhD is required or Masters with twelve plus (12+) years of experience;  Ten plus (10+) years of working experiences in the GNSS field (signal processing, sensor fusion, or receiver architectures);  Experience with Embedded SW development, RTOS;  Signal processing and DSP algorithms knowledge;  Strong working knowledge of sensor fusion;  Strong working knowledge of high precision GNSS; and,  Excellent communication skills with the ability to work in a group and coordinate projects.  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.

Title: Software System Engineer-Sr.
Job_Description: Founded in 2003, InvenSense Inc., a TDK Group Company, is the world’s leading provider of MEMS sensor platforms. InvenSense’s vision of Sensing Everything™ targets the consumer electronics and industrial markets with integrated Motion and Sound solutions. Our solutions combine MEMS (micro electrical mechanical systems) sensors, such as accelerometers, gyroscopes, compasses, and microphones with proprietary algorithms and firmware that intelligently process, synthesize, and calibrate the output of sensors, maximizing performance and accuracy. InvenSense’s motion tracking, audio and location platforms, and services can be found in many of the world’s largest and most iconic brands including smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones, gaming devices, internet of things, automotive products, and remote controls for smart TVs.InvenSense is headquartered in San Jose, CA and has offices in Boston, China, Taiwan, Korea, Japan, France, Canada, Slovakia, and Italy. We’re looking for top-notch MEMS Engineers to join our global team. If you’re interested in being a part of our journey and helping us grow to become the leading provider of SoC platform solutions, we definitely want to hear from you.As a Senior Software Systems Engineer at TDK-InvenSense, you will work closely with Software Systems group to embark on creating new market and application for TDK-Products. The team is focused on building next generation of precision IMU module comprising of HW/SW/System that fits the needs of Industrial and Automotive markets with the capability of real-time signal processing and algorithm integrated into the module.Duties and responsibilitiesIn this role, you will be responsible for the development of firmware and software modules on different embedded platforms and going through the entire product and application release cycle in close collaboration with other technical teamsDay to day responsibilities include development and design of software applications and research comprising of automotive, industrial and consumer. Design include software architecture, code reviews, maintenance and modification of existing firmware and software modules. Implementation of different communication interfaces from I2C, SPI, UART, USB, Ethernet, CAN and porting optimized algorithms from a higher-level scripting language to lower-level embedded C.Analyzes requirements to determine the feasibility of the design for time and cost constraintsDesign test and characterizations plans, track and fix SW issuesDevelop code to do board bring up and test hardware and components functionallyProfessional and clear verbal and written communicationsRequired Experience and SkillsBackground in designing firmware with different kind of sensors in an RTOS and non-RTOS environmentExperience in working with different MCU architecturesMust be familiar and practically implemented algorithms and different embedded protocols such SPI, I2C, USART etc. experience in working with Bluetooth Low Energy SW stacks will be considered as a plus.Excellent knowledge of C and have experience with different embedded IDEs and compiler toolchains such as IAR, Atmel Studio, Keil, GCC-ARMPrevious experience in porting algorithms from higher level scripting languages such as MATLAB and Python to Embedded-CFamiliar with hardware debuggingExperience in Microphone, MEMS-Motion, Pressure sensors, Gas sensors, Ultrasonic, Camera, Radars, Lidar sensors is considered a plusExperience in FPGA integration will be considered a plusJob Types: Full-time, PermanentEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Calgary, ABLanguage:English

Title: Junior Occupational Hygienist
Job_Description: Junior Occupational Hygienist - (18000208) Description  Golder Associates Ltd. is currently recruiting for a contractual Junior Occupational Hygiene Technologist to join our Calgary or Edmonton office. You will be a member of our OHSBE group which consists of occupational hygienists, hazardous materials professionals, safety professionals and technologists. As a consultant, you will be providing occupational hygiene support to a variety of client types. You will be initially work under the supervision of project managers and senior team members, with the opportunity to rapidly assume increasing autonomy and responsibility. Golder provides mentoring of junior staff, all required safety and technical training courses, on the job shadowing and training to maximize your learning opportunity.  Your role and responsibilities include:   Preparing and calibrating sampling equipment for field use Conducting site assessments for asbestos, mold, lead, PCB's, etc. Sample collection in the field, data interpretation and preparation of reports Interpreting and/or analyzing sample/data results in relation to legislative requirements and industry accepted guidelines and criteria Supervising asbestos abatement activities Identifying site issues or project concerns and recommending corrective actions Conducting air quality assessments, including indoor air and occupational hygiene (ie. IAQ, welding fume, noise) Basic client liaison to ensure health, safety and occupational hygiene needs are addressed and met Participate in the Health and Safety program Participate in the Quality Control program Flexibility in meeting client schedules - evening, night and weekend work maybe required Office and field related work and periodic overtime work will be required Travel within the country will be required    Qualifications  The successful candidate will possess the following skills and attributes:   Enrollment in occupational hygiene, safety, chemical or environmental programs Knowledge of occupational hygiene and asbestos-related issues considered an asset Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication and critical thinking skills Possess a reliable vehicle, with appropriate registration and insurance Requirement to wear personal protective equipment - ie. respiratory protection, hard hat, high-visibility vests, fire retardant coveralls, safety boots and safety glasses A desire to broaden range of professional skills Able to adapt quickly, while managing a busy workload Have proven problem-solving skills Office Software applications (Word, Excel, Outlook) Enthusiastic and versatile, willing to take on responsibility Strong people skills and an ability to work in a team environment   As an employee at Golder Associates:  You will have the opportunity to purchase shares in Golder Associates Many career and personal development opportunities and support of personal growth Be part of the employee mentoring program Competitive benefits and remuneration packages to fit your needs Regularly ranked as one of the best companies to work for  As a global, employee-owned organisation with over 50 years of experience, Golder Associates is driven by our purpose to engineer earth’s development while preserving earth’s integrity. From more than 180 offices worldwide, our over 8000 employees deliver solutions that help our clients achieve their sustainable development goals by providing a wide range of independent consulting, design and construction services in our specialist areas of earth, environment and energy.  For more information, visit golder.com.  Primary Location: CA-AB-CALGARY Schedule: Full-time Employee Status: Contractual Job Posting: Feb 13, 2018, 11:45:40 AM

Title: Sr. Software Engineer – Test Automation
Job_Description: Sr. Software Engineer - Test Automation  We are looking for a Sr. Software Engineer, Test Automation to drive the development of our automated tests and infrastructure on the Synopsys Software Integrity Group line of products. The position entails developing and maintaining automated tests in our automated testing system using a combination of Java, Perl, Ruby, and shell scripts. The successful candidate will be responsible for automating test cases in our test automation framework as well as augmenting the framework to evolve with the products under which it is used to test. The ideal candidate is results driven and motivated by team success. They can work in a dynamic environment consisting of a cross functional team. This position requires someone who is comfortable with daily team communication and collaboration while also being able to work independently.  As a member of this team, you will:  Develop and maintain automated test code written in a combination of Perl, Java and Ruby Gather testing requirements from the product teams and align the automated testing goals to ensure successful delivery of SIG products Plan and design automated performance tests to be executed against multiple applications in a CI/CD environment Enhance, maintain and adapt existing automated tests as the product under test evolves Report issues found by the automated tests to the product developers  Qualifications The successful candidate will possess all or most of the following qualifications:  4+ years of experience in a test automation software development role BS in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field Strong proficiency in Java and other Object Oriented programming languages such as C++/C#/Ruby/Python Perl experience is a major advantage Significant experience developing automated integration and end-to-end tests in a CI/CD environment Experience in web test automation using Selenium Web driver is a plus REST/SOAP Automation, familiarity or expertise using tools like JMeter and SoapUI Experience developing highly reusable, maintainable and efficient testing frameworks Strong command line skills in shells such as bash, sh or powershell Comfortable working on the command line of multiple operating systems such as Linux, Windows, Solaris and BSD Relational database and SQL experience is beneficial Demonstrates good analysis and problem-solving skills Excellent analytical skills Proven to be deadline and results driven working in a high paced, independent working environment Strong English communicator (written and verbal) You care (about others, about doing a good job, about details) A pleasure to work with Conscientious  Synopsys offers the most comprehensive portfolio of software security solutions in the market. We go beyond traditional testing services to help our clients identify, remediate, and prevent vulnerabilities in the applications that power their businesses. Our holistic approach to application security offers a balance of managed and professional services and products tailored to fit customers’ specific needs. We don’t stop when the test is over. Our experts also provide remediation guidance, program design services, and training that empower customers to build and maintain secure applications.  Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are committed to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact hr-help-canada@synopsys.com.

Title: Software Engineer (Product Owner), Senior - EvO (P4)
Job_Description: Company Overview At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible.  Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. Project/Program Overview General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting opportunity for a Product Owner in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles.  Our Calgary team is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. The project includes all phases including system design, software and hardware design, system integration, and system validation. The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. The Scrum teams operate within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be a Product Owner for one of the Scrum teams. Responsibilities Typical Duties: The Product Owner is a content management leader who prioritizes and grooms the Product Backlog and ensures that the team understands what they are working on. The Product Owner’s responsibilities include: Working with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) Product Manager and other stakeholders to understand their needs Having a vision and roadmap for what the Product Owner wishes to be built Clearly expressing this vision in understandable Product Backlog items Ordering and prioritizing the items in the Product Backlog to best achieve goals and missions Optimizing the value of the work the Development Team performs Ensuring that the Product Backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the Scrum team will work on next Ensuring the Development Team understands items in the Product Backlog to the level needed The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the Product Backlog Qualifications  Required Skills & Experience: Minimum of four years experience in software engineering Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods Strong attention to detail Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Strong problem solving and analysis skills Skills & Experience – Nice to Have: Previous experience as a Product Owner or Scrum Master on an Agile team Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification Previous experience leading teams in an agile environment Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0) Education: Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required.  Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position.  General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: System Engineer (Contract)
Job_Description: Company Overview At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. Perform system requirements analysis Perform system design and/or analysis functions based on requirements Define SAFe Capabilities and Features Prepare and review system specifications, system design documents, and interface design documents Provide design information to hardware and software engineers implementing the system Prepare and review test plans, procedures and results Identifying defects, resolving issues and verification Support the change management process as the system design evolves Documenting the analysis, design and test in accordance with development standards Planning of activities/tasks for each design iteration Reporting progress against plans Qualifications Required Experience:  Experience is required in a number of the following areas: Disciplined approach to system engineering with knowledge of the full system life cycle. Title: Process Engineer- Intermediate

Title: Senior Software Developer (Monitoring & Control Systems)
Job_Description: The Role The Pason Power team focuses on the monitoring and intelligent control of distributed energy storage systems. There will be a number of potential applications ranging from installation of energy storage with solar/PV systems to utility companies looking to build a responsive and adaptable electrical grid. You will have the opportunity to combine your experience with Pason’s in data acquisition and embedded control systems combined with cutting edge Internet of Things (IoT) and cloud technologies to provide a best in class solution.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities Work as a part of a scrum team, contributing to the development of the Pason Power product line Provide mentorship and guidance to other software developers Enhance and extend our IoT software platform at the edge which monitors and controls power electronics hardware and stationary battery systems Work alongside data science engineers to improve and optimize control system algorithms Maintain and extend reliable communications with external hardware devices using protocols such as Modbus, CANbus, Zigbee, etc Further the integration with cloud services and IoT transport mechanisms Write unit and integration tests Implement security best practices and protection regarding edge device and cloud communications Troubleshoot and provide timely solutions for production issues Understand and contribute to the development of system architecture Participate in Code Reviews Participate in team technical discussions, challenge ideas and present solutions and approaches to be considered by the team Participate and contribute in weekly Agile meetings, discuss and present work accomplished and provide constructive feedback to help improve the team Contribute to our evolving development environment through research, experiment with new technologies and attend conferences or courses. Educate your peers on what you have learned. Travel to our Houston office 1-2 weeks per year to spend time working in person with the technical team there  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Expertise in any of the of the following programming languages: Python, JavaScript, Java, C/C++ or C# Experience working with hardware / IoT device control systems Experience with Test Driven Development / Behavioral Driven Development Experience providing leadership in technical teams Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git Proficiency in Linux Experience in integration and unit testing Ability to work in a team or as an individual. Experience doing code review Familiar with RESTful APIs Familiar with container technologies (Docker) Familiar with messaging protocols such as MQTT or AMQP Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience NoSQL database experience (MongoDB, DynamoDB, InfluxDB, etc) Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc) A knack for benchmarking and optimization Agile/Scrum experience  Qualifications Education  Preferred Bachelors or better in Computer Science or related field. Bachelors or better in Engineering - Electrical and Computer or related field. Experience Required 6 years: or more of software development experience on commercial development teams Preferred Experience on complex and technically diverse projects would be an asset

Title: Customer Solutions Engineer
Job_Description: Zedi is a leading technology and services company in the field of production operations. Through technology backed by expert consultation and services, we help our customers realize their production potential. With our unique combination of award-winning software, automation, measurement, artificial lift and field services, we offer complete solutions for the challenges our customers encounter.  Zedi is seeking a Customer Solutions Engineer to join our innovative team in Calgary. This role has direct involvement with the end-to-end design of SCADA automation systems in Canadian and international markets. The ideal candidate will have a BSc. and a minimum of four years’ in this field along with a work ethic that aligns with Zedi’s Core Values-  Deliver on our promises, Reward creative teamwork, Communicate with clarity, Growth through innovation Prioritize workplace health and safety  Key Roles and Responsibilities:  End-to-end design of SCADA automation systems for Oil & Gas well sites, batteries and plant facilities in the Canadian and International markets. Generation, Review and Approval of Technical Drawings (P&ID;, electrical panel IFC drawings, network architectures, system block diagrams, etc). Creating Bills of Materials (BOMs), Rough Orders of Magnitude (ROMs) and formal proposals Creating, reviewing and approving engineering documentation such as FEED (Front-End Engineer and Design) Studies, Standard Operating Procedures, Acceptance Tests and Scopes of Work. Commissioning and Acceptance Testing various RTUs, PLCs and automation solutions back to Zedi’s web-based HMI interface, Zedi Access. Interfacing with customer management, operations, engineering and field teams during design review and project status meetings. Providing Tier 3 technical support to internal and external customers. Performing Technical Sales Support for existing and new clients with the Zedi Business Development Team. Delivering corporate and technical presentations to clients and potential partners. Modeling and analyzing production parameters and recommending appropriate Zedi Artificial Lift Solutions to achieve desired production.  The ideal candidate will possess the following:  BSc. in Engineering, Engineering Technologist or equivalent (Electrical, Computer, Mechanical or Petroleum preferred) APEGA or ASET Member (P.Eng, C.E.T., M.I.T.) Minimum 4 years’ experience in the Oil & Gas Industry Experience with SCADA/Automation systems and Field Instrumentation Experience with Ethernet, Radio, Cellular, and Satellite communication Knowledge of communication protocols and complex networking Proficient with Microsoft operating systems and program suites  Key Competencies:  Ability to work in a team environment Ability to coordinate with multiple departments Ability to take initiative and work independently Able to meet tight deadlines and manage multiple priorities Strong written and verbal communication skills Responsibility and capability of seeing tasks through to completion Analytical and Troubleshooting skills Ability to learn new skills quickly Project Coordination Experience with programming languages such as Assembly, C, C++, Visual Basic, Ladder Logic Knowledge of safety regulations, the electrical codes and regulatory production guidelines Experience with SCADA software such ROCLink 800, Telepace, WinCCU, AutoSol Oil and Gas + SCADA/Automation field experience  Trainable Competencies:  Experience with RODSTAR, SROD or equivalent artificial lift modeling software International Business Experience  To apply please to go to www.zedisolutions.com. We thank all applicants for their interest in Zedi; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Systems Integration Engineer
Job_Description: Due to continued growth, iSolutions Consulting is looking for a System Integration Specialist with experience in the Upstream Oil & Gas and / or Power Industries to join our team.The System Integration Specialist position is an Engineering position which requires advanced knowledge in a wide range of software systems employed by iSolutions. The ideal candidate would have experience working with OSISoft PI, Aspentech IP.21 or Honeywell PHD Data historians. The System Integration Specialist is responsible for commissioning these systems, implementing process graphics, constructing data integrations to and from underlying control systems such as Emerson DeltaV or Rockwell FactoryTalk. Knowledge of high availability data historian architectures is important to this role.The System Integration Specialist will be responsible for performing the duties listed below including:Plant and Corporate Historian CommissioningPlant and Corporate Historian Data IntegrationsDesigning and implementing software solutions that leverage historian dataQuality assurance/regression testing of software solutionsSystem architecture design and documentationConducting customer stakeholder meetings / solution walk-throughsLeading junior-level resources through system commissioning tasks and quality assurance proceduresIn addition to utilizing vendor-supplied integration packages, the need will occasionally arise to write custom code for interfacing with these systems. For this reason, working experience with one or more of the following software technologies is required:ASP.Net 2.0+,ADO.NetSQL Server 2005+Oracle PL/SQLSQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)The position requires a Bachelors degree in Instrumentation Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Process Control Engineering, Computer Science Software or Electrical Engineering or a related field and at least 4 years relevant experience. Relevant experience with the upstream Oil and Gas and or power industries is required.iSolutions services a large number of name-brand customer in the oil & gas and power domains. We offer our consultants access to interesting and challenging work assignments, performance based compensation & fast-tracked career progression for those with the drive to succeed. iSolutions Inc. is a Data Management consulting company that specializes in designing, implementing and supporting real-time, historian based, reporting and integration solutions for Oil/Gas and Power Generation/Transmission companies. Our implementations allow clients to make educated, site specific production and operational decisions based on the analysis of real time data from integrated field and plant systems.

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Nodejs, React, AWS Position
Job_Description: Position Overview  Replicon is looking for an experienced web applications software engineer who is passionate about coding and technology to work on our Time Intelligence platform. We are building workforce management solutions for global enterprise customers and growing rapidly. The entire multi-tenant SaaS solution is built using modern AWS cloud tech stack utilizing open source technologies.  About you:  You are passionate about technology and coding best practices. Self initiating, takes pride in ownership, naturally collaborative personality, shares knowledge, likes to learn new technologies, keeps up with technology trends and has worked on recent projects utilizing a modern tech stack. This is a crucial senior team member role that requires full ownership of taking solutions from requirements analysis to production deployment.  What else you need to bring: Expertise in full stack web applications development Expert coding skills across the entire stack – UI, Services and Data Recent experience of working with cloud providers (AWS, Azure or Google) Expertise in JavaScript, Node.js and your favorite modern UI development framework (we use React) Highly skilled in developing beautiful looking, rich interactive web user interfaces (modern CSS skills) Quick learner - we understand you will not know everything but should have demonstrated competency to learn and grow Extra credit: A portfolio of your accomplishments outside of work (Git repo, open source contributions, technical blog, presentations, etc.) Experience with Mobile Apps, UI development How we work: An agile development environment delivering functionality to production every week Collaborative team involving development, test automation and DevOps Continuous learning culture with Lunch & Learns and peer collaboration/mentoring

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description: ResponsibilitiesResearch and develop advanced machine learning algorithms and big data analysis in the medical industryLeverage and improve upon state-of-the-art machine learning methods to solve challenging problems across a variety of domainsResearch and develop advanced image processing algorithmsWork closely with a team of developers to design and develop medical image post-processing softwareWork closely with regulatory and quality assurance engineers to ensure development of quality softwareWork closely with scientific advisers and physicians to develop algorithms for solving clinical problemsMust have skills & experienceMSc or PhD in Engineering, Computer Science or related fieldStrong theoretical knowledge, including mathematical foundations of modern machine learning systems and techniquesStrong programming skills in C++, Python, and TensorFlowBeneficial skills & experienceExperience with QT, OpenGL, and OpenCVExperience with DICOM images (MR and CT)Experience with macOS, Linux, and Windows command line interfaceExperience in the medical imaging software industryWho are weCircle Cardiovascular Imaging Inc. develops and sells cardiac post-processing software that allows for the evaluation and analysis of MR and CT images. Title: Senior Software Engineer DevOps
Job_Description: Position Overview  DevOps Engineers are responsible for creating and improving the tools and processes that power the building, validation, deployment, and monitoring of Replicon's globally distributed multi-tenant SaaS systems. DevOps are spreading and evangelizing the DevOps culture throughout Replicon.  Working at Replicon is an opportunity to take on the unique challenges of a successful, large scale SaaS business application that existed before "web applications" as we know them today even existed. We have unusual challenges in such as extreme data consistency & reliability (nobody puts up with being paid incorrectly), large scale, complex legacy systems, enterprise-scale customizability, all combined with a friendly non-technical user experience. It's a "never-stop-learning" environment, where you'll be working with a strong technical team.  Responsibilities include: Remove impediments in the technical development processes to support high-frequency, low lead-time software deployments Isolate risk of deployment or software failures to minimize scope and impact of production incidents Collaborate effectively with multiple product teams with unique internal processes and technologies Identifies where development and operational practices are outside industry norms; doesn't accept "we've always done it this way", works to do it better Effectively implements automation to augment or replace manual processes; prefers adopting rather than building software where appropriate Participates in the on-call rotation to efficiently triage critical production incidents, reduce incident severity, and document incident in detail for product team follow-up Qualifications: Deep understanding of web technologies (HTTP, DNS, TLS/SSL, web services, load balancing) Experience with AWS (have used S3, EC2, RDS); would accept experience with Azure and/or Google Cloud Experience with automation tools (eg. Docker, Terraform, Jenkins, CodePipeline) Familiar with agile processes/scrum and TDD Built or have supported CI and CD processes Experience with post mortems/failure analysis - identifying the root cause & contributing factors of incidents Experience with a SaaS, globally-distributed multi-tenant system would be a preference Experience with a micro-services architecture, or the transition towards one

Title: Firmware Developer
Job_Description: David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to recruit a Firmware Engineer/Developer based in Calgary, AB. Title: Applications Engineer
Job_Description: The Applications Engineer is responsible for providing sizing, preliminary engineering, estimating, and technical support for gas processing and compression equipment (new units and retrofits). Working in conjunction with the sales team as the key technical advisor and advocate for our products, must be able to articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users. Will provide technical support to the sales process for the development of equipment, identify and estimate new product opportunities, and interface between customer needs and engineering scope.  Responsibilities - will include, but not be limited to the following:  Process simulation and component sizing of gas processing equipment Performance and sizing of gas compression equipment Confirm availability of major equipment and critical path components, and reliability of suppliers to meet customers specifications and required delivery schedule Scope definition, specification review, cost estimation, preparation of detailed, accurate technical proposals Understanding of industry codes and market standards Assist service branches and technical support group with modelling and optimization of existing field equipment Functional interaction with process equipment division personnel on design, pricing and fabrication and construction issues. Interface with all operational departments including engineering and production during the project execution phase, transfer of scope definition and approval drawing assistance Maintain customer and vendor relationships, participate in clarification meetings as required Occasional site visits to gather package details needed for quotes Development of equipment and module design and pricing for use as standard product.  Education and Experience  Engineering Degree, Engineering Technologist or other related discipline 2 to 3 years’ experience in gas processing / compression and fabrication / packaging considered a strong asset Able to develop and maintain customer and vendor relationships Must be self-motivated and team oriented Strong organizational and time management skills Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines with minimal supervision Competent with computer software including VMGSim, industry specific OEM software, etc.  May be assigned other duties, in addition to or in lieu of those described above, and any duties are subject to change at any time according to the needs of the location or company.

Title: Sales Engineer (Calgary)
Job_Description: Title: Sales Engineer  Location: Calgary  Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Role: Splunk is seeking a highly motivated, results oriented individual to join our dynamic presales team. You will work together with Splunk’s direct sales team on the solution and technical aspects of selling Splunk’s solutions to our largest commercial Enterprise clients. Our clients span all business sectors and sizes. You'll be the subject matter expert for our team serving our customers and prospects in the Calgary region. Would you like the opportunity to work at a fast-growing company that is changing the way that information is used to support business decisions? You will have the responsibility for actively driving and leading the technology evaluation stage of the sales cycle. Working in conjunction with the sales team as the key technical advisor, you will be an advocate for Splunk’s products and services. Additionally, you will position Splunk's technology and solutions to both business and technical users. You will identify all technical issues of your assigned accounts to assure complete client satisfaction throughout the sales process, and establish and maintain positive relationships with your client's technical staff. Responsibilities: Ability to demonstrate Splunk products and services to customers on site, remotely via webinar sessions, and at field events such as conferences and trade shows. Experience responding to functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs is also important. Self-motivated with a proven track record in technical software sales and knowledge of technology. Strong presentation skills and ability to communicate clearly to emails and RFPs when submitting reports. Ability to be organized and analytical, and will be able to eliminate sales obstacles using creative and adaptive approaches. Comfortable working for a dynamic technical organization with a fast growing customer base. IMPORTANT: We can teach you the technology, coach you on soft skills and educate you on processes. You should have a strong sense of self-motivation, an insatiable curiosity about what “is possible” with technology, the desire to work with an awesome team and a positive, fun-loving attitude. Requirements: 5+ years related experience in selling and supporting software products to IT organizations. Knowledge of virtualization (VMware/Citrix/Hyper-V). Network Administration/Architecture/Management Knowledge. Unix/Windows – Administration Experience. Domain expertise with IT operations, security or compliance. Familiar with Computer Programming - C/C++, Shell, Perl, Python Programming. Knowledge of “Big data” technologies (Map-Reduce, Hadoop, HBase, Cloudera, Cassandra). Comfortable approaching total strangers and quickly extracting technical know-how from them. Should be available to travel to visit prospects and customers. Strong written and verbal communications skills. Located in Calagary Education: Bachelor of Science degree in EE, CE, Computer Science, MIS, or Business. We’ll break the rules if you’re awesome. Liberal Arts majors/minors are great to see. We love individuals with a broad range of interests; art, science, research, writing, music, whatever you’re into. Are you looking for an incredible place to work that celebrates innovation, leadership and creativity? Please contact us. Splunk offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits. When you join Splunk you'll be working with a team of smart people who are as passionate about our products as our customers' success. We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which you are applying.

Title: Systems Engineer - EvO (P3)
Job_Description: Company Overview At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible.  Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. Project/Program Overview General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is growing their Calgary team and currently have new opportunities for System Engineers, P3 for our EvO program. We are staffing for an existing program to deliver a world class next-generation secure communications system for the Ministry of Defence (MoD) in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. Our Calgary team is developing key software and hardware products as part of this offering to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services.  The program includes system design, software and hardware design, system integration, and system validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. The system engineering team consists of several design teams, each focusing on a specific set of software or hardware components and services. This program is being delivered using a Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be system engineer within an Agile Release Train that has been established to define and develop the system solution. Responsibilities Typical Duties:  The responsibilities and range of activities will vary, but in general will include: Participate in an interdisciplinary integrated project team environment under the supervision of more senior engineers and leads Perform system requirements analysis Perform system design and/or analysis functions based on requirements Define SAFe Features that describe the work to be executed. Prepare and review system specifications, system design documents, and interface design documents Provide design information to hardware and software engineers implementing the system Prepare and review test plans, procedures and results Investigate defects and propose solutions Support the change management process as the system design evolves Document the analysis, design and test in accordance with development standards Plan activities/tasks for each design iteration Report progress against plans Qualifications Required Skills & Experience: Experience is required in a number of the following areas: 4+ years of experience in systems engineering or similar discipline Disciplined approach to system engineering with knowledge of the full system life cycle Experience with model based design tools (PTC Integrity Modeler in particular) and SysML DOORS Requirements Management Rational Team Concert Tactical Communications and Networking Systems Information Management Systems Voice and Multimedia Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Strong problem solving and analysis skills Enthusiastic contributor, willing to learn new skills and take on ownership of work Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision Experience with Agile product development methods  Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required  Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position.  General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: ANT+ Applications Engineer 2
Job_Description: At Garmin Cochrane, we create more than just products – we inspire solutions and innovations that change and shape how we live, work and play. You’ll get to work alongside top talent and partners in the cycling, running, and sport and fitness industry from around the globe. You’ll enable compelling ecosystems such as ANT+ with the ANT 2.4 GHz ultra-low power wireless protocol, work on cutting-edge technology projects like optical heart-rate sensing, and sport and fitness products such as Vivoactive, Vector, and Varia.  Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, we’re located just 15 minutes outside of Calgary in Cochrane, Alberta. A retreat from fast-paced cities – Cochrane allows us to build relationships with the community and focus on what we do best – creating innovative solutions for unique use-cases in the ultra-low power wireless and sport industries. With many other tech companies calling Cochrane home, we can’t think of a better place to be!  Here’s why you want to work for us.  You’ll bring products to life. Become a key contributor to our exciting portfolio of Garmin products and ecosystems, and help us bring sport and fitness devices and standards from concept to market.  You’ll love our office culture. Company BBQs, active sports, casual dress, volunteer opportunities and the occasional sneak peak of new release movies (Star Wars, anyone?) allows team members to get to know each other outside the office.  You’ll receive fantastic benefits. Opportunities for professional development, no waiting period for vacation or our extensive benefit plan, RRSP matching, stock purchase options, product discounts and flexible work schedules are available for all team members.  Here’s what we’re looking for from you A passion for programming in C/C++/C#, you have a strong understanding of how the languages work and can use them to get the results you want on existing software. Experience and aptitude in requirements gathering and analysis with customers and partners Strong communicator who enjoys talking to people Excellent organizational skills Experience creating and documenting design specifications and bringing those designs to life Experience/interest in working with the ANT Wireless Protocol and other wireless technologies BSc Degree in Computer Science, Software/Electrical/Computer/Aerospace Engineering, Math, Physics or similar technical field of study with a 3.0 cumulative GPA, or equivalent practical experience Proficiency in C/C++, C#; Python experience is a bonus.  Desirable Qualifications: Experience developing software for Windows; familiarity with object-oriented design Experience developing embedded software for microcontrollers in small electronic devices A keen interest in fitness, cycling, running, health and wellness Interest in and ability to learn other programming languages as needed Proven ability to develop innovative and creative solutions to complex problems Familiarity with ANT/ANT+

Title: Geotechnical Engineer - Advanced Numerical Modelling
Job_Description: As a Geotechnical Engineer with advanced numerical modeling capability, you will be joining our close-knit Geotechnical Engineering team who are working on our strong portfolio of major water supply and hydropower dams, mine waste and tailings storage facilities, and infrastructure projects in Canada and internationally. In this role, you will collaborate with our talented professionals who are committed to delivering high quality engineering solutions to our clients. KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. This role will give you the opportunity to: Gain experience working on our portfolio of projects including water supply and hydropower dams, mine waste and tailings storage facilities, and geohazard risk mitigation. Develop and oversee site investigations and monitoring programs, complete engineering studies, and undertake conceptual to detailed engineering designs. Lead and oversee advanced 2D and 3D numerical static and dynamic modeling assignments. Use your problem-solving and modeling skills to find innovative solutions to complex technical issues. Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry. Work in a dynamic One Team company culture that supports career development. Contribute to the growth of the Resources Group and engage and mentor junior staff. Build and maintain strong relationships with our Clients and our multidisciplinary project teams. Travel primarily in Western Canada and potentially to our overseas project locations. If you have more than five years of relevant experience and are registered or eligible to register as a Professional Engineer in Canada, and hold a Masters degree or Ph.D. in geotechnical engineering with a strong emphasis on numerical modeling and analysis, preferably related to dams, tailings management in the oil sands, mining, hydropower or related industries, we want to hear from you! We value your: Working knowledge and demonstrated practical application of advanced 2D and 3D numerical static and dynamic modeling software, including FLAC, to define the problem and develop solutions. Solid understanding of soil and rock characteristics and behavior. Technical experience in dam engineering and tailings and mine waste engineering including liquefaction susceptibility and deformation assessments. Strong initiative, innovation and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive toward long-term success. Superior verbal and written communication skills including your experience in writing engineering reports and technical papers, preparing and delivering technical presentations to clients and Review Boards, and overseeing preparation of design drawings. Exceptional team spirit, interpersonal skills and your ability to build long-term, successful relationships with our clients and our project teams. About Us: Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, geotechnical, hydropower, water resources, transportation, oil & gas, and environmental sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton, and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the, Mining, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Oil and Gas industry. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. Are you up to the challenge? If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number 1331-A18. We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Title: Web Application Software Developer
Job_Description: Job title: Web Application Software DeveloperDepartment: Product DevelopmentLocation: Calgary, CanadaJOB DESCRIPTIONAbout Network InnovationsNetwork Innovations is a leading provider of Satellite & Communications services including VSAT networks, Mobile broadband, Push-to-Talk and Satphone solutions. NI serves clients across the globe in the Government, Media, Energy, Maritime, and Aero markets. With headquarters in Calgary, Canada, we have regional offices across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, and we work with over 200 partners operating globally.Job purposeThis role is responsible for designing, developing, and testing web applications (front and back end) that are available 24/7 with thousands of active users and API sessions. Title: Senior Front-End Developer
Job_Description: About The Uncomplicated FamilyThe Uncomplicated Family (TUF) is a progressive health innovation company and passionate team who embrace commitment, innovation and compassion to enhance the quality of life for individuals, families and communities who are affected by disabilities. Our teams include: Speech-Language Pathologists, Occupational Therapists, Physiotherapists, Family Support Personnel, Software Developers and Engineers, Researchers, and Psychologists. The Uncomplicated Family Corporate Group includes Kids Uncomplicated Inc. (Clinical and Family Support Services) and Communities Uncomplicated Inc. (Software Development: Teleroo™ Technology).Teleroo™ is an award-winning group of technologies that has resulted in remarkable outcomes for children, families, and practitioners. Teleroo™ breaks down conventional barriers such as location, time constraints and budget to increase access to quality interventions to assist in service provision. Our technologies include a robust video-based platform for team collaboration, along with iOS therapy tool apps. The Teleroo™ Gateway platform was recently relaunched in collaboration with QoC Health. The successful candidate will work exclusively on Teleroo™ Technology with the Uncomplicated Family and QoC teams operating out of The Uncomplicated Family headquarters inCalgary, Alberta.About QoC HealthQoC Health is a diverse healthcare company that offers platform technology to design and build engagement-focused solutions leveraging new service delivery models. QoC focuses on connecting patients into circles of care and making it easier for healthcare organizations to get connected with their patients. Our engagement platform allows for perfect fit tools and solutions designed to integrate across a wide range of healthcare areas. From Wound Care to Aging Well and everything in between, our technologies help shift care to the community and keep patients out of hospital.The TUF/QoC CultureA passionate, cross-disciplinary team of technologists, healthcare professionals, and researchers, the TUF/QoC team loves what they do, and strives to achieve great things everyday. Motivated, genuine, and fun, the team is driven by innovation, challenging the status quo, with a focus toward the future. As part of the team you will have opportunities to bring solutions to some of our toughest client care challenges, across a diverse range of clients from around the globe, with opportunities to learn and grow from every project. We’re driven to improve care for everyone, help us shape the future!Role DescriptionWe are looking for a motivated Sr. Front-end Developer with strong front end, JavaScript, UI/UX experience who has worked with a range of frameworks to join our team. Title: Software Integrations Developer
Job_Description: Are you an experienced software/web developer? Don't miss this opportunity to work on software which is used worldwide on high profile marine projects! Enjoy competitive compensation, full benefits, and bonus program! About the Organization Trusted by shipbuilders, naval architects and marine engineers, SSI develops Autodesk-based solutions for the shipbuilding and offshore industry. With the majority of US naval ships now being built with SSI solutions, and prestigious names in global marine construction increasingly choosing SSI, we are poised for well-managed and sustainable growth.  Based in Victoria, BC with a satellite office in Alabama, we are proud to offer our team an environment that facilitates fascinating and challenging work with a healthy work/life balance. A career with us gives you the opportunity to work on complex and graphically-oriented software that is used on high profile marine projects worldwide. These exciting projects include the recently built Staten Island ferries, as well as a myriad of both international and US defense projects. The ability to see the results of your efforts in the real world is what makes a career with SSI so rewarding.  In 2013, SSI was awarded the VIATec award for Business of the Year in Ocean Products - a true testament to our success within the industry. For more information, please visit our website.  About the Opportunity Currently, SSI is looking for a Software Integrations Developer to join their team in Victoria, BC.  Using your comprehensive knowledge of web services, XML, relational databases, and API design, you will integrate our leading-edge shipbuilding design software with those of our partners while using your communications and organization skills to liaise with the clients and vendors to design and test the integrations.  In order to qualify for this role, you will have a post-secondary education in Computer Science or Engineering with a minimum of 5 years of experience in software and web development, as well as a minimum of 3 years of experience in XML and RESTful web services.  You will also possess:  Knowledge of C# and C++ Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio Familiarity with object-oriented design patterns Knowledge of complex data structures and algorithms Experience with automated testing methodologies Experience with SQL Server (or other relational databases) The following are considered assets:  Experience with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems Experience working with remote teams, spanning multiple time zones Experience working in an Agile Environment (Scrum) Experience with Atlassian Tools (JIRA, Confluence) Experience with Software Versioning and Revision Control Systems (SVN) You will do well in this role if you can work independently but also within a collaborative environment. Sound judgment and decision making skills are essential.  Please note: you must be a Canadian or US citizen and be based in, or willing to relocate to, Victoria, British Columbia, Canada in order to be considered for this role.  If you are a creative, energetic, and dynamic professional who wants to work on complex, graphically oriented software, this could be the role for you!  About the Benefits At SSI, the core of our success lies in the creative, energetic and dedicated people who make up our team. Although the work may be challenging, we foster a fun, flexible and friendly working environment with:  A casual, relaxed work environment Flexible work hours that support a work-life balance Seasonal social events (Friday pub lunches, potlucks, Pi day, Christmas parties, theme days, and more) Weekly onsite yoga classes Paid time off to attend blood donation drives Upon joining SSI, you can expect to receive a competitive annual salary of $60,000 - $75,000 per year depending on skills and experience, plus great employee benefits, including:  ParaMedical, Dental, and Vision Life insurance and long-term disability benefits Profit Sharing Plan Three weeks’ vacation Education assistance, professional development, opportunities for career growth, and training If you enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment and want to take your career to the next level with a local employer of choice – Apply to SSI today For full details and to apply, please visit http://jobs.applyfirst.ca/jobs...

Title: Embedded Systems Engineer , Calgary, Alberta
Job_Description: We are looking for an Embedded Systems Engineer to join our first-class team engaged in bringing an amazing new product to market. You will be responsible for electronics engineering design of new systems and circuits, and the extension and support of existing systems, including component selection, embedded firmware design and implementation, schematic design and PCB implementation.  Responsibilities:  Define firmware test requirements and processes to ensure product meets customer and reliability requirements Translate high-level product requirements into technical hardware and embedded firmware specifications Develop embedded software solutions for new and existing products Design, test and debug embedded hardware designs Perform schematic capture and circuit simulations to define and verify the suitability of a design Be involved in selection of integrated circuits and peripherals Communicate with suppliers and vendors to evaluate and approve electronic components and processors for custom display systems Design for EMC and Safety compliance and understanding of current standards Participate in project planning activities, and provide work effort estimates as a member of an Agile Team Participate in high level design reviews with other team members, including review of schematics, mechanical drawings, reports and other design documentation Participate in prototyping, validation and test plan development. Partner with Application Software Engineers to integrate test code into prototypes, to test and validate functionality Work with the QA team to review, investigate, troubleshoot, and fix hardware related issues Required Qualifications:  Education: Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering degree or equivalent 5+ years of relevant embedded system design experience (including C or C++ programming) Experience with battery powered embedded consumer devices Proven record of successfully delivering complex embedded systems to production Experience with Real Time Operating Systems such as FreeRTOS or Embedded Linux Proven proficiency in communication bus logic (SPI, I2C, UART, TCP/IP, USB) Experience with common embedded systems IDE platforms such as CCS or IAR Experience with MSP430 and Cypress PSoC or similar devices Strong digital hardware design knowledge Experience using soldering equipment and building prototyping PCB assemblies Experience effectively using laboratory equipment and microcontroller debuggers to aid in development Experience with Altium Designer Working knowledge and experience of safety and EMI/EMC specifications, standards and practices Experience with product certification (CSA, UL, CE) Ability to work with minimal instructions or directions Well organized, good time management and ability to work on several parallel projects Good verbal and written communications skills Additional Desired Qualifications:  Experience with Wireless communication (ZigBee, 802.11, Bluetooth), Switch Mode Power Supply design, and PCB layout and design Knowledge of how to perform electrical signal characterization, specifically to ensure EMI/EMC compliance Previous experience in development of FPGA firmware

Title: Junior Geotechnical/Geohazard Engineer
Job_Description: We are currently seeking a Junior Geotechnical/Geohazard Engineer to join our team in Calgary.   Reporting to a Senior Geotechnical Engineer, the Geotechnical/Geohazard Junior holds a role supporting a wide variety of projects across our western Canadian offices. The role will be an opportunity to gain experience and knowledge working with senior experienced professionals, in the office and in the field    Job Duties: Acting as a design engineer resource for a variety of projects and clients Assist in the development and growth of the Calgary team with a focus on energy and infrastructure developments Support the development of the Environment & Geoscience business by developing relationships with existing and future client contacts, attending meetings, and supporting BD initiatives Preparation of proposals Provision of practical and economic solutions to clients Preparation of technical reports associated with the project scope of work  Qualifications: University degree or diploma in a related discipline (i.e. geoscience or civil engineering, etc.); a post-graduate degree would be considered an asset Minimum of <4 years relevant experience in a consulting environment; Willing to work extended and irregular hours within western Canada when necessary; Currently registered or eligible to register as a member of APEGA; Ability to work on multiple projects and meet established deadlines; Effective interpersonal skills, a strong client-service focus and the ability to work in a team environment are essential; Strong business development skills; Experience using specialized equipment and software (e.g. GeoStudio or equivalent) would be considered an asset; Strong report writing and verbal communication skills in the English language; and Valid driver’s licence with a clean driving abstract.  Experience in the following areas would be an asset: Slope Stability, mitigation design and monitoring Terrain Mapping Landslide Detection Slope Hazard Assessment Fluvial Geomorphology Flood Hazard Assessment Hydrologic Modelling River Surveying Debris Flows Foundation Design Retaining wall design Mining Infrastructure design Site Investigation- drilling   Our commitment to excellence extents do our workplace where we offer a flexible work environment, competitive compensation and benefits including a generous RRSP program and an employee Share Ownership Plan, in-house training programs, a strong emphasis on health and safety, support for continuing education and professional development and the opportunity to work with and learn from senior technical experts and professionals.  For more information, please visit our website at www.snclavalin.com  While SNC-Lavalin would like to thank all those that apply, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.  Worker Type Employee  Job Type Regular   At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

Title: Telecom Software Engineer
Job_Description: Our IT recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is looking for a strong Telecom Software Engineer who would be interested in a long-term contract opportunity.  This role encompasses a range of responsibilities in the area of software design and implementation, testing and support.  The role requires the development of multiple customer specific applications which provides service routing network management functionality and integration into industry cloud management platforms (OpenStack, CloudStack and VMware vRO/vRA/vCD).  The application will provide services which make use of the product functionality of the client VSP, 5620 SAM and 7×50 Service Routers.  The candidate should have extensive experience in Java and web technologies, and implementation of applications using open source frameworks.  The candidate should also have experience in modeling and implementing software in IP networking and network management domains.  The candidate will need to have integration experience with Cloud technologies and frameworks such as OpenStack, CloudStack, vRealize Orchestrator, vRealize Automation and vCloud Director.  The candidates overall roles and responsibilities include:  Experience with virtualization technology such as KVM, ESXi, docker, Xen and Hyper-V. Substantial experience in software design, architecture and development. Substantial experience in web, distributed, real-time applications using Java. Experience in integrating 3rd party and Open Source software, OSS/BSS and devops environment. IP networking and network management domain experience. Design of web services, SOAP, or REST interfaces. Implementation of commercial and open source server technologies like Apache httpd, Apache Tomcat, Oracle JBoss. Knowledge of git and SVN.  If you are looking to apply to the role, be sure to send us a most recent version of your CV. Our staff will review everything and follow up with those who would be an ideal fit for the requirement.

Title: DCS Technologist/Engineer

Our corporate mantra of "Vision, Talent and Technology" defines both who we are as a company and why you'd want to work at True North. We employ some of the most skilled and versatile people in our industry, who consistently design advanced solutions that when deployed allow our customers to have modern, reliable control and monitoring systems. Fueled by the momentum of our vendor-neutral, relationship based, people-focused model, True North is poised for strong continued growth. Proud to be recognized by PROFIT Magazine on the prestigious PROFIT HOT 50 list makes us one of Canada's Top Growth Companies. True North has many compelling reasons to join our team. Not only do we provide our employees with high engagement in their work, we offer an environment that will treat you more like a friend than a numbered employee. Team building is a core value at True North, you can lace up your skates and join the company hockey team, or enjoy our annual Christmas party at Banff's Rimrock Hotel. At True North we play as hard as we work and we endeavour to include everyone. Position We are currently recruiting for a DCS Technologist/Engineer. The ideal candidate will have the following: Minimum 5 years experience in mid to large size projects Experience with SAGD facilities Participate in P&ID and HAZOP, and other design reviews Prepare Functional Requirements, Detail Design Specifications, and Software Test Plans Participate in Alarm Rationalizations and Alarm Management reviews FAT, SAT and commissioning activities. Technical skills in Emerson DeltaV, Honeywell Experion, ABB 800xA or Yokogawa DCS systems Configure control strategies and shutdown keys Prepare and follow Control Narratives Able to travel to site for commissioning and start-up activities Provide team mentorship, training and coaching Please submit your cover letter and resume with "DCS Technologist/Engineer" as the subject line to careers@truenorthautomation.com We thank all interested applicants, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.
