Title: Software Development Manager
Job_Description: About Solium  Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry’s service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.  Why work at Solium  Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for:  Software Development Manager  Solium is looking for a helms-person to help pilot their financial services Death Star through more than $10,000,000,000 of transactions per year.  If you:  Are a leader who believes in leader-leader self-organizing teams and is willing to work on that evolution Are a coach who supports broad growth because you know that developers have careers and not just jobs Are a pragmatic problem solver who can identify process inefficiencies and find creative ways to eliminate them Are excited by the challenge of helping us evolve from a midsize SaaS application to a global enterprise platform Then we are looking for you!  We are big fans of Turn the Ship Around! by L. David Marquet, and are working to build and reinforce a culture of action and ownership. You will help foster leadership through all levels of the organization. You are not a master developer, but have a strong technical background and familiarity with patterns and practices. You know that agile is a description, not a dogma, and that continuous improvement is achievable.  Requirements:  Foster a team culture that encourages ownership, continual learning, and customer delight Provide hands-on coaching and mentoring to Software Developers for technical and soft skill growth Work with product owners and clients to contribute to strategic growth of the platform Remove barriers to keep product teams close to the client and product to find value in what we build Champion product ownership and spread leadership throughout the team Ruthlessly identify process weakness and build and use metrics to drive improvement Take a lead role in recruiting and hiring Software Developers Familiarity with the enterprise Java technology stack. While we are not dogmatic about what technologies we use, this is the one we are using right now. Apply now!

Title: Customer Success Engineer: Canada
Job_Description: Tachyus delivers the leading prescriptive analytics platform to oil and gas producers. Our customers include many of the largest companies and state-owned entities on the planet with whom we have complex high-value relationships. We need a Customer Success Engineer to ensure that our Canada customers are delighted working with Tachyus so that they renew deals worth tens of millions or more to Tachyus.  The right candidate will bring experience working with SAGD, Thermal and/or waterflood assets as well as managing relationships with petroleum engineers and geologists and a deep network of existing contacts across Canada. Tachyus Customer Success Engineers work with our Customer Success Managers and IT experts to maximize the happiness of existing customers, ensure renewals, and achieve successful upsells. The right hire will present crucial petrotechnical information, train customer petroleum engineers how to use Tachyus software, and manage key customer relationships to delight our Canada customers.  We are looking for someone who will represent Tachyus with customers in Canada but is also open to traveling to multiple neighboring regions. Responsibilities Identify and grow opportunities within assigned oil and gas producers and collaborate with Tachyus business development to extend our solutions footprint (more solutions to more assets) Train customers' petroleum engineers on how to use Tachyus' breakthrough technology Present valuable petrotechnical findings to Tachyus customers Ensure continued rapid revenue growth for Tachyus in Canada Operate as the lead point of contact for any and all petrotechnical matters specific to Tachyus customers once the solutions are deployed Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships Develop a trusted advisor relationship with key customer stakeholders and engineering champions Communicate clearly the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders Obtain referrals from customers to increase the portfolio of Tachyus success stories Forecast and track key account metrics Assist with high severity requests or issue escalations as needed Requirements Experience operating SAGD, thermal and/or waterflood assets Extensive existing oil and gas domain experience Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively about crucial petrotechnical information Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills Excellent verbal and written communications skills Curiosity to build and define new ways of doing business as an early member of a startup customer success engineering team At least a bachelors in petroleum engineering Experience operating SAGD, thermal and/or waterflood assets Extras Track record implementing software solutions for major enterprise accounts Experience with software production management systems Experience writing software or analyzing data Business development experience At least a masters in petroleum engineering and/or computer science

Title: Sr. Technical Support Engineer
Job_Description: About Synopsys Software Integrity Group (SIG) Synopsys Software Integrity Group helps organizations build secure, high-quality software, minimizing risks while maximizing speed and productivity. Synopsys, a recognized leader in application security, provides static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis solutions that enable teams to quickly find and fix vulnerabilities and defects in proprietary code, open source components, and application behavior. With a combination of industry-leading tools, services, and expertise, only Synopsys helps organizations maximize security and quality in DevSecOps and throughout the software development life cycle. For more information, go to www.synopsys.com/software.  Every software company has bugs in their code. We help those companies find the defects that cause their products to fail!  Our products involve highly-sophisticated, cutting-edge software algorithms to detect critical defects and security vulnerabilities in source code. Therefore, our technical support issues can be highly complex - solving them requires intelligence, insight, and true technical expertise.  We are searching to find a smart, motivated Technical Support Engineer with C/C++, C#, and/or Java programming experience. We want to hire people who are eager to help the best engineers from the world's top companies (our customers) solve complex problems in their source code and development environments.  If you have this programming knowledge and a passion for helping engineers find solutions for software quality and security needs, then Synopsys is the right place for you.  General Responsibilities  The Technical Support Engineer will be responsible for resolving customer problems. In this role, you will work closely with R&D and technical support staff to provide high-quality support to our customers.  Tasks essential to this position include:  You will be the Single Point of Contact for many of our strategic customers. You will be the customers trusted advisor and advocate, understand the customer’s environment and business goals and work closely with the account team when needed Troubleshoot incoming customer problems through email and/or phone Work with support team and developers to provide resolution to customer issues Research and respond to customer requests and provide detailed explanations to address questions and concerns from some of the worlds brightest developers and software architects Create knowledge items for recurring issues  Qualifications  BS/BA degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience Minimum 6+ years experience in technical support and/or C/C++/C# or Java programming with expert support skills Outstanding written and verbal communication skills Experience with variety of industry hardware platforms and operating systems (Linux/Unix, Windows, etc.). Ability to troubleshoot technical problems and demonstrate resourcefulness in obtaining necessary diagnostic information Ability to quickly assimilate complex problems and develop a resolution strategy Experience in multiple compiler environments gives you top priority in our hiring queue! Extensive technical expertise; the ability to solve problems and determine the root cause of issues Ability to use development tools, software, and advanced troubleshooting procedures. Must be able to tailor content to meet the needs of the client – experience with Salesforce.com a plus Enjoy fast-paced, energetic environment. Entrepreneurial and results-oriented with a strong work ethic Can handle multiple critical client support issues and can effectively communicate this to senior management Smart, creative, energetic, conscientious, and enthusiastic persona Team player with a customer-focused attitude  Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are committed to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact hr-help-canada@synopsys.com.

Title: Senior Front-end Software Engineer
Job_Description: Collage.com’s mission is to make custom products easy for everyone. We strive to do this by providing superior software and excellent customer service. We sell an expanding variety of photo and home products, including photo blankets, photo books, canvases, pillows, and more. Our company has been featured on the TODAY Show ( http://blog.collage.com/2013/10/25/total-request-collage-blanket-for-carson-daly/ ), The View ( http://blog.collage.com/2015/10/05/collage-com-on-abcs-the-view/ ), and Good Morning America ( http://blog.collage.com/2015/08/06/collage-com-on-good-morning-america-with-up-to-76-off-gallery-wrap-canvases/ ) many times. We are a 100% employee-owned company that has rapidly grown to 40 employees and $25M annual revenue over the past five years.  As a 100% remote company ( https://remote.co/company/collage-com/ ), we are set up to provide the best possible environment for engineering. The less time developers spend dealing with cumbersome processes, inefficient systems, and commuting, the more time they have to solve problems and make an impact. Collage.com’s co-founders/co-CEOs both come from a technical background and believe in staying at the forefront of best practices so that we can focus on work that matters. We pass almost all of The Joel Test ( https://www.joelonsoftware.com/2000/08/09/the-joel-test-12-steps-to-better-code/ ) (we only fix high-priority bugs before writing new code, but hey, we’re a start-up), use continuous deployment (code goes straight to production after each merge), and are in the process of adopting mobx-state-tree ( https://github.com/mobxjs/mobx-state-tree ) with React ( https://reactjs.org/ ). Strong engineering is a key part of our business strategy -- it lets us build best-in-class design tools faster than our larger competitors.  We are seeking an ambitious and nice senior front-end engineer who shares our passion for building a great software company. This is a unique opportunity to have a major impact on our engineering team’s growth (we are about ten strong right now) by helping us continually raise the bar. You will be expected to collaborate with other engineers to solve complex technical problems and push us to deliver higher quality code at an ever-increasing rate. We firmly believe in the power of solid architecture, code design, and simplicity over brute force, which is why we do our best to hire 10x senior engineers. If you are seeking an environment where you get to do meaningful work with other great engineers, then we want to hear from you.  Learn more about working and developing software at Collage.com ( http://jobs.collage.com ).  ---------------- Responsibilities ----------------   Write and maintain front-end JavaScript code as part of a mobile-first web application, including UI components and state management logic. Make decisions about code design, architecture, and refactoring to balance technical debt against delivering functionality. Plan and lead testing for complex projects. Review code and mentor other engineers. Provide time estimates and participate in agile development. Review specifications and work with PMs to implement lean methodology.  ----------------------- Required Qualifications -----------------------   5+ years professional application development experience Experience implementing and testing advanced JavaScript code on a team as part of a production web or mobile application Practical experience with MV* architecture (such as Backbone, Vue, React + Redux/Mobx, etc.), unidirectional data flow, and minimal class/object interfaces Spatial/geometric reasoning ability -- for rendering, animation, and image manipulation Ability to quickly understand and work with unfamiliar complex code Pro-active and clear communication is essential for this remote work position  ------------------ Benefits and Perks ------------------   Working from home makes it easier to focus on results and develop professionally while spending less time commuting. (See our opinion piece on perks and work-life balance at mlive.com. ( http://www.mlive.com/opinion/index.ssf/2015/08/perks_schmerks_the_one_thing_t.html )) 401(k) plan, home internet reimbursement, and $3,000 / year in free Collage.com products plus employee discount for friends and family. Collage.com pays 100% of the premium for full health, vision and dental insurance coverage for you and your family in a high-quality Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO plan. Flexible work schedule and unlimited vacation policy (work hard and take time when you need it). We’ll pay for any computer and home office equipment (within reason) that will help you work better.  --------------------- The Interview Process ---------------------  The goal of our interview process is to identify people who will be a good fit for our company and are talented, ambitious engineers. Because you will be working remotely, all of our interviews are done over the phone in close succession to move through the process quickly. We look for candidates with good written and verbal communication skills.  We ask all candidates to demonstrate strong coding ability at the beginning of our interview process. The questions are in Javascript and focus on applying general programming concepts (like concurrency and good code structure) in realistic scenarios that should be familiar to experienced engineers. We do not test for knowledge of esoteric language features, APIs, or algorithms. We prefer engineers who are smart and able to learn over those who are familiar with our exact tech stack.  During the interview process, you will talk to other engineers, your future manager, a product manager, and both founders/CEOs of the company. We believe in transparency, and will give you the opportunity to speak with anyone else you’d like to meet before accepting an offer. You are making an important decision, and we want to make sure you are fully committed to joining our team.

Title: Verification & Validation Engineer
Job_Description: As Software Verification & Validation (V&V) Engineer, reporting to the V&V team lead, you will influence business success by applying your extensive engineering background and expertise in software testing strategies within a high-tech industry. Your work will impact all phases of the product development and deployment lifecycle. You will support planning activities and deliverables for ongoing release cycles; supporting an exciting new range products; carry out tasks and activities across the product verification teams located in Calgary.  Responsibilities Execute test deliverables in collaboration with multidisciplinary teams and our global customer base. Develop validation and verification plans for Safety Critical Systems products. Develop test specifications, test reports, test metrics and validation protocols for integration and performance testing. Implement and document effective processes to enable robust validation and verification of software products. Execute tests using automated and manual verification methods for both software and hardware. Establish test case traceability to requirements and specifications. Support testing done across the hardware, software and systems disciplines to ensure new products meet or exceed their performance and quality goals. Collaborate with other team members to set up and execute technology demonstrations to existing and potential new customers. Conduct occasional dynamic testing of GPS/GNSS technology.  Qualifications Must-Have: Post-secondary degree in a technical field, preferably in Computer Science, Electrical, Computer, Software Engineering. Validation and Verification experience within a cross functional development team environment. Software test tool development experience (including use of C/C++, Python, LabView). 5+ years of experience in a high technology manufacturing environment. Knowledge of GPS/GNSS technology Valid Driver's License Ability to travel approximately 10% (mostly North America, possibly international) Key Success Factors: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to clearly communicate ideas and solutions to others. Ability to work in a collaborative team environment. Ability to multitask and manage multiple project paths. Strong English language communication skills, both oral and written. Nice-to-Have: An understanding of real time operating systems and embedded firmware development Understanding of signal processing algorithms Knowledge of, or some experience in, the automotive industry Knowledge of ISO 26262/ASPICE PAM 3.0 NovAtel designs, manufactures and sells high precision OEM positioning technology. Our GNSS products and services are used in more than 60 countries around the globe to deliver precise positioning solutions in precision agriculture, defense, mapping, autonomous vehicles, survey and many other industries. Title: BAS Engineering Specialist - Entry Level
Job_Description: Convergint Technologies is one of North America’s fastest growing systems integrators. With a dedicated focus on Building Automation systems, Electronic Security and Fire Alarm & Life Safety, we provide a wide range of product solutions in each business area and are committed to being the industry's best service provider.  We are currently recruiting for a BAS Engineering Specialist (Entry level) for our growing business at our Calgary location. Under general supervision, the BAS Engineering Specialist has overall responsibility for the application engineering, programming, troubleshooting, start-up, and check-out of assigned installed or retrofit projects including a variety of projects that vary in complexity. Individuals work shall be in accordance with the established quality standards. He/she is the technical support contact for our customer and is responsible for maximizing customer satisfaction with installed Building Automation Systems. The entry level BAS Engineering Specialist will ensure projects are effectively executed to budgeted cost and time schedules.  Main Job Responsibilities:   Carries out in-depth analysis of plans, functional specifications and contracts in order to determine and advise on overall project requirements; manage a variety of aspects of project including estimating, design, tracking, start up and planning phases; material and equipment procurement. Follow and maintain in-house engineering standards, libraries and procedures. Provides input, reviews and may prepare shop drawings and wiring diagrams, based on project plans and specifications, showing location of devices, equipment, and wiring etc. Liaise with project managers, clients, contractors, partners and vendors to manage and coordinate project execution to completion. Advises Project Manager regarding appropriate products needed for installation, identifying any items which have longer lead times, and track materials on an ongoing basis to ensure timely arrival/delivery to the project site. Prepares and/or reviews formal submittal booklets, containing schematics, and technical literature as necessary to support each contract. Provides on site assistance with the installation and start up, check out and turnover processes. Coordinates project schedule and field labor on all assigned projects; proactively communicates project schedules, project change proposals (as applicable) and related project activities on a regular basis with customer and seek to continuously improve customer satisfaction. Assists the Project Manager in utilizing financial systems to review actual vs. estimated job cost and to provide timely and accurate project cost reports; identify reasons for low job site productivity and determine impact on the project. Acts as “our customer’s best service provider” at all times thereby ensuring Convergint Technologies is the customer’s first choice for service.   Key Knowledge, Skills and Experience:   Diploma in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or Engineer in Training (EIT) strongly preferred Relevant trade designation (e.g. Electrician, HVAC certificate, etc.) an asset Minimum of three years of previous building automation industry experience required Minimum of 2 years of AutoCAD experience Exceptional customer focus and ability to work under pressure; ability to maintain awareness of, and seek to meet the needs and wants of the customer without being prompted Solid knowledge of engineering principles and practices related to building automation systems Solid programming skills and proven ability to troubleshoot problems and look for solutions Must be a self-starter and work well Strong mechanical and electrical aptitude (e.g. works with a variety of hand and power tools such as drill, screwdriver, wire stripper, hacksaw, crimper) Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills Solid organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously Proficient computer skills including MS Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel); previous exposure to AutoCAD viewing software Solid networking & IT skills (Building Automation primarily)   Convergint Technologies LTD is an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes applications from candidates, regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, sex, age or mental or physical disability. We Offer:  Competitive wage; Immediate comprehensive benefit plan (medical, dental, etc.); Employer contribution to RRSP; Work environment committed to safety; Reimbursement to support continuous learning We have a great company culture, engage in Corporate Social Responsibility, work hard, and promote fun & laughter on a daily basis. Title: ANT+ Applications Engineer 2
Job_Description: At Garmin Cochrane, we create more than just products – we inspire solutions and innovations that change and shape how we live, work and play. You’ll get to work alongside top talent and partners in the cycling, running, and sport and fitness industry from around the globe. You’ll enable compelling ecosystems such as ANT+ with the ANT 2.4 GHz ultra-low power wireless protocol, work on cutting-edge technology projects like optical heart-rate sensing, and sport and fitness products such as Vivoactive, Vector, and Varia.  Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, we’re located just 15 minutes outside of Calgary in Cochrane, Alberta. A retreat from fast-paced cities – Cochrane allows us to build relationships with the community and focus on what we do best – creating innovative solutions for unique use-cases in the ultra-low power wireless and sport industries. With many other tech companies calling Cochrane home, we can’t think of a better place to be!  Here’s why you want to work for us.  You’ll bring products to life. Become a key contributor to our exciting portfolio of Garmin products and ecosystems, and help us bring sport and fitness devices and standards from concept to market.  You’ll love our office culture. Company BBQs, active sports, casual dress, volunteer opportunities and the occasional sneak peak of new release movies (Star Wars, anyone?) allows team members to get to know each other outside the office.  You’ll receive fantastic benefits. Opportunities for professional development, no waiting period for vacation or our extensive benefit plan, RRSP matching, stock purchase options, product discounts and flexible work schedules are available for all team members.  Here’s what we’re looking for from you A passion for programming in C/C++/C#, you have a strong understanding of how the languages work and can use them to get the results you want on existing software. Experience and aptitude in requirements gathering and analysis with customers and partners Strong communicator who enjoys talking to people Excellent organizational skills Experience creating and documenting design specifications and bringing those designs to life Experience/interest in working with the ANT Wireless Protocol and other wireless technologies BSc Degree in Computer Science, Software/Electrical/Computer/Aerospace Engineering, Math, Physics or similar technical field of study with a 3.0 cumulative GPA, or equivalent practical experience Proficiency in C/C++, C#; Python experience is a bonus.  Desirable Qualifications: Experience developing software for Windows; familiarity with object-oriented design Experience developing embedded software for microcontrollers in small electronic devices A keen interest in fitness, cycling, running, health and wellness Interest in and ability to learn other programming languages as needed Proven ability to develop innovative and creative solutions to complex problems Familiarity with ANT/ANT+

Title: Web Application Software Developer

NI serves clients across the globe in the Government, Media, Energy, Maritime, and Aero markets. With headquarters in Calgary, Canada, we have regional offices across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, and we work with over 200 partners operating globally.Job purposeThis role is responsible for designing, developing, and testing web applications (front and back end) that are available 24/7 with thousands of active users and API sessions. Active participation in defining the services architecture and interfaces is expected, and you will have the opportunity to work with product management and customers to shape our products.These web applications will aid our customers and service partners to easily use, deploy, and manage network services provided by NI.Duties and responsibilitiesDesign, prototype, implement, test, and document full stack (front and back end) web applications, and RESTful APIs.Design for usability with responsive web user interfaces.Design for scalability and reliability (24/7 operations – minimal maintenance down time) with continuous integration.Work with DevOps to deploy and maintain system components into QA and Production environments, and to create tools to quantify performance and reliability.Assist QA in developing automated testsIncorporate security into web services, APIs, and user interfaces.Work with Product Management (and Sales Engineers) to define the product requirements and ensure customer needs are being met.Estimate timelines and provide risk assessments for planning and tracking work. Provide feedback for continuous improvement of processes.Provide Tier-3 support to customers and work with Technical Support to improve their knowledge and tools for troubleshooting.QualificationsRequired Experience & SkillsDegree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent discipline6+ years of full stack application development for always on web applications with global user base, large traffic volume, and multi-national operationsProficient in Java (JEE) technologies including Spring MVC, Struts, Hibernate, RESTful JSON/XML, WebSocketsProficient in responsive user interface development in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript using Angular or Vue.jsFamiliar with SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL), and able to design/modify relational schemas, adapt Stored ProceduresComfortable in cross technology Enterprise Application environment – mostly Java (JEE) on Linux, but some C#/.NETNice to have3+ years with micro services architecture in a continuous integration environmentImplemented Single Sign On and OAUTH mechanismsFamiliar with Docker and Cloud Infrastructure (AWS, Microsoft Azure)Familiar with network management concepts: SNMP, Equipment and Link monitoring, Logical Network Mapping, GeolocationMindsetCustomer focusComplex problem solving: Systems-level approach to softwareCreative, collaborative, and open-mindedStrong communicatorPassion and pride in your workWorking conditionsThis is a full-time position in a professional office environment with flexible work hours. Occasional after-hours work will be necessary to provide tier-3 technical customer support or for a meeting with an overseas team member. Occasional travel is expected (including internationally) for projects or conferences.Job Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Calgary, AB

Title: Senior Front-End Developer
Job_Description: About The Uncomplicated FamilyThe Uncomplicated Family (TUF) is a progressive health innovation company and passionate team who embrace commitment, innovation and compassion to enhance the quality of life for individuals, families and communities who are affected by disabilities. Our teams include: Speech-Language Pathologists, Occupational Therapists, Physiotherapists, Family Support Personnel, Software Developers and Engineers, Researchers, and Psychologists. The Uncomplicated Family Corporate Group includes Kids Uncomplicated Inc. (Clinical and Family Support Services) and Communities Uncomplicated Inc. (Software Development: Teleroo™ Technology).Teleroo™ is an award-winning group of technologies that has resulted in remarkable outcomes for children, families, and practitioners. Teleroo™ breaks down conventional barriers such as location, time constraints and budget to increase access to quality interventions to assist in service provision. Our technologies include a robust video-based platform for team collaboration, along with iOS therapy tool apps. The Teleroo™ Gateway platform was recently relaunched in collaboration with QoC Health. The successful candidate will work exclusively on Teleroo™ Technology with the Uncomplicated Family and QoC teams operating out of The Uncomplicated Family headquarters inCalgary, Alberta.About QoC HealthQoC Health is a diverse healthcare company that offers platform technology to design and build engagement-focused solutions leveraging new service delivery models. QoC focuses on connecting patients into circles of care and making it easier for healthcare organizations to get connected with their patients. Our engagement platform allows for perfect fit tools and solutions designed to integrate across a wide range of healthcare areas. From Wound Care to Aging Well and everything in between, our technologies help shift care to the community and keep patients out of hospital.The TUF/QoC CultureA passionate, cross-disciplinary team of technologists, healthcare professionals, and researchers, the TUF/QoC team loves what they do, and strives to achieve great things everyday. Motivated, genuine, and fun, the team is driven by innovation, challenging the status quo, with a focus toward the future. As part of the team you will have opportunities to bring solutions to some of our toughest client care challenges, across a diverse range of clients from around the globe, with opportunities to learn and grow from every project. We’re driven to improve care for everyone, help us shape the future!Role DescriptionWe are looking for a motivated Sr. Front-end Developer with strong front end, JavaScript, UI/UX experience who has worked with a range of frameworks to join our team. This is a full-time position based out ofCalgarywhere you will work with the development team, project managers and designers to build and customize robust frontend applications and libraries for our existing engagement platform and API’s. This is truly a leadership role, with excellent opportunity for ownership of an important and expanding aspect of the business.ResponsibilitiesAs a Senior Front-end Developer you will be responsible for architecting, building and optimizing reusable front end HTML5 / JavaScript / Java libraries, API’s, UI Modules, UI Widgets, and SDK’s to accelerate building robust web applications based on our engagement platform.In addition, you will:Participate in the discovery, design and specification of apps.Translate functional requirements into effective and intuitive applications.Build and customize front-end web applications using JavaScript and HTML5 based apps.Lead, train, and mentor new developers that join the team.Participate in the development and architecture planning for our engagement platform, providing insight and guidance on improvements to better support application development.Required Skills5+ years of professional software development experience3+ years experience developing front-end web applications in JavaScript3+ years experience with JavaScript, jQuery, TypeScriptExperience with web technologies (HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery , CSS3, SASS)Experience building responsive web applicationsAbility to translate functional requirements into effective and intuitive responsive web applicationsRESTful web service integration experienceExperience working with 3rd party data sources and API’sExperience with Analytics and VisualizationWorking knowledge of source code management tools (Git, GitHub)Ability and desire to write self-explanatory and reusable codeExcellent problem solving skills and loves technical challengesAttention to detail and a passion for qualityExcellent communication and creative problem solving skillsNice to Have SkillsExperience with encryption methodologies (SHA256, BCrypt, PBKDF2)Working knowledge of HL7Working knowledge of build management tools (Maven, Gradle)Working knowledge of Health Care related privacy policies, including PHIPA and HIPAAExperience with live/on demand Video Streaming (TokBox, WebRTC, Vidyo, Wowza)Experience with messaging service providers (Twilio)Work Arrangement: Position Type: Full-Time, RegularHours of work: 37.5 hours per weekStart Date: When a suitable candidate is foundCompensation: Competitive and will be discussed during the interview processBenefits: Three weeks of paid vacation; paid sick/personal time; benefits package includes Health, Dental, Vision, and Employee Family Assistance Plan coverage.If you are interested in this rewarding and exciting opportunity, please respond to this ad with your cover letter and resume.This posting will remain open until a suitable candidate is found and only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Thank you for your interest.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Principal Quality Assurance Engineer
Job_Description: Department overview: Financial Risk Analytics is part of the IHS Markit group and provides industry leading risk analytics solutions to sell side institutions within the financial markets. Risk management and risk regulation is continuously driving demand for more accurate calculations and risk system vendors are continuously striving for improvements in performance and scalability. The product has been designed, built and continuously improved over a ten year period. It is carefully architected to scale from running on a single laptop for demonstration purposes right through to running on 1,000+ core distributed grids.  Financial Risk Analytics provides solutions for Credit Risk PFE, Market Risk VaR and sensitivities, Credit Value Adjustment (CVA), Initial Margin (IM) and regulatory calculations such as EC, RC, IRC and CRM,  Position summary IHS Markit is seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst to join the Financial Risk Analytics group. The successful candidate will be involved in all aspects of testing with emphasis on test automation. We are looking for a pragmatic advocate of quality and someone that is willing to take a lead role. As part of the Quality Assurance team, you will help develop automated tests for our suite of windows and linux software including grid-based simulation software. A programming (mandatory) and an investment banking background (ideal) as you work closely with financial engineering, product development groups, and work directly to support our customers. We are looking for a methodical problem solver that is comfortable mentoring and working with a team.  Duties & accountabilities Develop detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts to support regression, functional, load and stress testing for rest, client/server, and computational grid-based applications. Automation of testing including updates to and creation of automated test scripts for system, load and performance testing.Design and maintain automated test frameworks, including support of agile and test-driven development Conduct full product testing (component, system, integration, performance, etc.) including automation of the testing wherever possible. Help define and develop Quality Assurance strategies Identify, document and track software defects to resolution Establish and maintain multi-platform test environments Support customers on all Financial Risk Analytics products Business competencies Education and experience Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline Strong knowledge of Quality Assurance concepts and methodologies Minimum 8 years of testing experience in a software development organization Understanding of the operating and data models of risk solutions, particularly in investment banking Commercial awareness Excellent knowledge of REST and network application testing. Strong analytical ability and programming skills (preferably in PowerShell, Python) Experience with performance and load testing tools.Jmeter expertise. Experience with agile software development methodologies and test-driven development Working knowledge Hadoop would be valuable.HBase, HDFS, Yarn, Hive, etc. Exposure to Apache NiFi, Apache Kafka. Strong knowledge of Windows, Windows Server platforms and Linux.  Personal competencies Personal impact Strong organizational, planning, and analytical skills Communication Excellent written and verbal communication skills Must be able to communicate at a senior level with all areas of the company within the financial services risk management domain Teamwork Strong collaboration skills in a team environment   We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster & Supplement, Right to Work and Pay Transparency Policy. IHS Markit is a participant in E-Verify (see links below). We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment drug testing. EEO is the Law EEO is the Law Supplement Right to Work Pay Transparency Policy E-Verify   Current Colleagues If you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.

Title: Wireless Telecommunication Engineer - Calgary
Job_Description: Cima+ is looking for a Telecommunication Wireless Engineer for our Calgary, Edmonton or Vancouver office We are interested in qualified individuals, with 7 or more years of experience in multiple aspects of wireless communication. CIMA+ is involved with a various set of clients with a wide variety of requirements. Main clients include large Oil and Gas industries, transit operators, health care institutions, first responders, municipalities and colleges/Universities. If you like diversity, this position is for you. The successful candidate should have broad technical expertise in telecommunication with a special focus on wireless communication. The candidate demonstrates strong organization skills and excellent interpersonal abilities. We are looking for an individual who wants to be challenged and is ready to join a dynamic growing team. CIMA+ is a well-established, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm established in Eastern Canada that has been rapidly expanding operations into Western Canada.  Responsibilities Be involved in all phases and types of telecommunication projects with emphasis on wireless projects including: Needs assessment; Specifications; Conceptual design; Cost Estimations; Detailed design; Procurement; Installation supervision; Test plans and validation Responsible for major account and project management Develop and maintain relationship with existing and new clients Participate actively in the proposal process Oversee the on-site system installation. Qualifications / Experience Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent Minimum 7 years of relevant experience and P.Eng. Licence; Experience designing, installing and validating systems in heavy industrial environment is highly desirable. Experience in a Transit environment is considered an asset. Experience with many of the following technologies is required: Microwave point-to-point (licence and unlicensed) links. Point to Multipoint wireless technologies. Wifi / WiMax Land Mobile radio systems (P25, DMR, NXDN, TETRA) Cellular technologies including LTE and DAS. Working knowledge of Ethernet/IP Switching and routing (VLANs, OSPF, MPLS) RF Propagation analysis using modern software suites like (E.g. iBwave suite, pathloss 4.0/5.0). The candidate should demonstrate experience in building and maintaining a relationship with a client; creating network architectures; creating high level and detailed design solutions; participating in feasibility studies; creating test plans; supervising installation; validating the installed systems; project management skills. Experience in greenfield and brownfield installations. Experience working for an engineering firm would be considered an asset

Title: Applications Engineer, Agriculture
Job_Description: Our customers have ideas. Lots of them. Turning those ideas into a competitive advantage is what we do. As part of the Hexagon group of companies, NovAtel's integrated global positioning solutions deliver success time and time again on land, sea and in the air. We help many of the world's leading companies stay in the lead by consistently delivering OEM global satellite positioning products that are recognized for their technical innovation, unsurpassed quality and industry-leading customer support. Applications Engineering provides general product and application support for NovAtel Hardware and Software, and on related GNSS & INS topics, along with field services to NovAtel’s worldwide customer base. While part of the Applications Engineering team, this position will have a focus on supporting NovAtel’s Precision Agriculture market. The team also provides other services internally and externally to Customers, Sales, Product Management, Project Management and Marketing to help ensure the cohesive and comprehensive delivery of products and materials. Working closely with internal engineering teams ensures escalated issues are resolved in a timely manner while continuing to be the customer liaison and maintaining the customer interface.  Responsibilities As our Applications Engineer, Agriculture you would be responsible for: Providing front line product and application support on NovAtel Hardware, Software, and related GNSS & INS topics to internal and external customers Providing customer training, demonstrations, technical assistance, and technical sales support Liaising with other departments regarding technical matters Formulating and implementing procedures and plans for resolving problems Performing software testing, verification, bug reports, and field trial coordination Reviewing technical documentation materials and manuals Generating application notes for frequently asked questions and knowledge base  Qualifications Must-Have: Geomatics or Electrical Engineering degree with 2+ years of related industry experience Self-motivated team player with proven problem solving skills. Outgoing and energetic with exceptional people skills. Multi-tasking with excellent verbal and written skills. Ability and willingness to travel, worldwide. Key Success Factors: High attention to detail and highly organised Strong multitasker with keen ability to prioritize Comfortable working individually but know when to ask for help Work well in a collaborative environment Nice-to-Have: Background includes experience working directly with customers, preferably in the delivery of support or services Background includes experience in GNSS and INS systems installation and/or troubleshooting in precision agriculture related applications. Title: Cloud Solution Architect
Job_Description: If you are looking to work on the most cutting edge cloud and automation technologies and support multiple large complex deployments, together with a world class experienced hands on team, look no further.  TriNimbus is the leading AWS partner in Canada offering cloud services consulting specialized in Amazon (AWS) deployments and management for clients in North America. We are looking for a dynamic person who thrives on working on multiple projects dealing with a variety of layers and technologies.  Come join a culture where we treat our team like adults. Where collaboration and transparency are core values and your appetite to learn new things is embraced.  Our ideal candidate would be a resourceful, flexible, self motivated, takes initiative and rolls with it. The "traditional" job requirements:  Minimum of 5 years of experience in roles like release & build operations, DevOps, managed large-scale infrastructure, etc.  Strong experience with deploying and managing SaaS and other hosted products and environments  Proven knowledge of networking concepts and services for security, reliability and scalability  Hands-on experience building and managing virtualized environments - AWS experience is a big asset  Hands-on experience with a breadth of technologies across operating systems, application servers, database and middleware infrastructure - being comfortable with both Linux and Windows environments is required  Proven knowledge of software architectures for performance, scalability and high availability - experience developing and deploying software products is a very strong asset.  Strong scripting skills - deployment automation and configuration management experience along with experience working with tools like Chef, Puppet, Ansible and Salt are strong assets.  Proven technical leadership with experience in dealing directly with customers or clients along with coordinating a small team of IT and/or software engineers and contractors is advantageous to the role  The ability to present solutions to Clients and software teams at various stages from sales to implementation.  The "inside" scoop on the job: You are excited to build solutions in the cloud and think any other option is misguided ;-)  You love getting dirty and do things yourself - from setting up iptables firewall in Linux, to troubleshooting database replication problems in Oracle or chasing missing dependencies in Maven builds  You believe automation is the only way and can talk for hours why  You get excited by the possibility to work on systems that need to scale and handle millions of users but don't mind working on setting up Anti Virus or configuring a small business app deployment for customers if needed  If you like learning new technologies and get a kick from applying them to solve customer problems we want you!  TriNimbus architects deploy and manage some of the most complex deployments on the AWS platform using all the latest AWS building blocks and surrounding ecosystem of tools. Including areas like DevOps, Big Data, IoT and Serverless. We are thought leaders in the space committed to strengthening the AWS community in Canada hosting user group meetups across the country. We have offices in Vancouver, Toronto, Calgary and Montreal with a growing team of senior software engineers and architects.  Compensation is based on experience.

Title: Technical Product Analyst (.Net)
Job_Description: Are you passionate about making a difference in the world? Do you want to act as a catalyst helping to infuse a culture of goodness? Have you been a technical product manager, senior developer, software architect, engineering manager or just have some great experience working with business and technology? We may have just the right role for you! As Benevity’s Technical Product Analyst, you’ll be responsible for providing technical expertise to internal stakeholders and clients, while liaising with an outsourced team of passionate engineers and business analysts.  In this role, you’ll be expected to use your product and technical knowledge to provide input and guidance on the product roadmap, advocating for “back end” investment areas. You’ll be Benevity’s resident in-house expert and troubleshooter for the technical aspects of the product. You’ll support our implementation, services, and sales teams with your deep understanding of the system and the data it collects.  Who we are  Better Work and a Better World: at Benevity that’s what we’re all about. We’re a software company in the business of doing good, building better ways for companies to connect with their customers and employees around causes - we make “doing well by doing good” more than just a tagline. We’re growing fast and looking for more great people to join us.  We’re not Bono, just a passionate crew of workhorses out to change the world. We have that fun, flexible tech culture that people love (ok, some people – you know who you are!) – and we have a heart. We’re a registered B Corporation, which means we’re part of a new breed of companies committed to higher social and environmental standards.  You’ll join a dedicated, passionate team that creates innovative solutions for our raving fans (er, clients). And you’ll get to rub shoulders with some of the most iconic and notable companies and charities in the world to help them make a difference (in even better ways). Our entrepreneurial environment appeals to self-driven, flexible team players who learn quickly, aren’t afraid to tackle hard problems and don’t mind wearing jeans to work. Sound cool? Join us!  What You Will Do   Leverage your knowledge of the product and expertise to derive an optimal solution. Assess and analyze business strategy, market requirements, current state, and technology choices to evaluate and recommend solution alternatives. Lead elicitation activities and author documentation of the system, architecture, and processes. Bring outsourced knowledge in-house. Understand (and document) the system from a data security, compliance, and infrastructure operations perspective. Oversee the relationship with our development outsource partner. Liaise between outsource partner and Operations, ensuring smooth deployments and stable performance. Conduct decision, business rules, and risk analysis. Work closely with Product Management to ensure a balanced backlog of work that addresses technical debt, reduces operational friction, and designs for the future. Identify opportunities to expand the application of the technology. Assist in analysis / troubleshooting of issues. Support Sales and Marketing during the RFP process.  What You Bring   An analytical mindset; people have said you have a gift for seeing how seemingly disparate and unrelated events or processes are related Strong written and verbal communication skills, able to communicate with both technical and business audiences Demonstrable .NET experience including development, code analysis with debug / troubleshooting, and interpretation (to determine the underlying business logic and function of an existing piece of code). Data and process modelling. Use case diagrams and entity relationship diagrams should be old hat. Experience with end-to-end software development projects, preferably using a variety of different software development methodologies Experience working with relational databases, BI/Reporting, ETL and integration projects Experience managing (or at least working closely with) outsourced development teams Background in computer science, engineering or related field A passion for the Benevity mission  What You Can Expect   Enjoy a fast-paced environment, with a history of proven success in a dynamic, rapidly growing company. Demonstrate extraordinary time-management skills and organizational capabilities. Be an innovative thinker, keen to be part of a growing company that is all about helping businesses do things differently to get better returns on their social good programs. B uild trust, value others, communicate effectively, drive execution, foster innovation. Focus on the client, collaborate with others, solve problems creatively and demonstrate high integrity. Professional internal and external relationships that meet company core values.  It is our hope and belief that you apply because you believe the same things we do – that global Goodness is an achievable goal! While we sincerely appreciate the time and effort you put into your application, unfortunately only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Manager, Operations
Job_Description: At Brookfield (Canada) Inc. we are in the business of owning, managing and developing premier office properties globally. The quality and location of our landmark office properties continue to attract the best and most successful organizations across these regions. In Canada, we own and manage properties in three major cities - Toronto, Ottawa and Calgary. We are a leader in the commercial real estate market because of our greatest asset, our people. We look for talented individuals to join our growing organization and share our passion towards service excellence for our tenants and clients. If you possess outstanding interpersonal skills, are customer driven, and are innovative, then we encourage you to take your career to the next level and apply for this exciting opportunity with us. DESCRIPTION: This position is responsible for managing the day-to-day functions of the facility including but not exclusive to: mechanical system operation and maintenance, building envelope inspections and maintenance, elevators/escalators and electrical distribution systems. Responding to tenant inquiries and requests, and working in conjunction with Construction to support base building capital projects and tenant improvements. RESPONSIBILITIES: Liaise with Tenant Services regarding any requests for services or information. Ensure issues and concerns are resolved to the tenant’s satisfaction. Work in collaboration with Construction staff to develop capital plan, review drawings and conduct pre-construction checks. Work with Construction staff on construction inspections and post construction inspections. Work in conjunction with Security to ensure the access and SWP processes are adhered to. Fire alarm panel management is in accordance with the Fire Panel Manual. Regularly inspects, supervises and coordinates the repair and maintenance of any building mechanical, electrical, life safety and envelope systems. Oversee the preventative maintenance system and that it is implemented, completed and maintained on all base building equipment and systems. The preventative maintenance includes boilers, chillers, cooling towers, compartment fans, primary and secondary loops. Organize and oversee mechanical and electrical contractors performing base building and tenant improvement work. Prepare cost estimates, specifications, and recommendations on equipment purchases and capital expenditures. Develop department policies, procedures and guidelines, maintenance programs for buildings, and related systems and maintain related records. Ensure all systems are operating in an efficient and safe manner. Ensure that all related safety guidelines set out in provincial Environmental Health and Safety legislation, and company policies and procedures are met. Provide guidance and direction to operations staff on a day-to-day basis. Provide regular feedback, conduct performance reviews and make staffing decisions within Operations. Be proactive in responding to personnel related issues and provide coaching and counselling as required. Other duties as assigned. SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS: This position requires an individual with superior customer service and interpersonal skills, complemented by the ability to effectively organize and manage people, time and multiple priorities. The ideal candidate provides leadership, sets an example to the team through his/her positive attitude, and always represents Brookfield in a friendly and professional demeanor, whether working with colleagues, contractors, or tenants. Strong communication skills and the ability to troubleshoot and resolve a wide variety of technical problems are required. EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS: Minimum of five (5) years’ experience working in a similar setting in commercial real estate. Experience in a multi-use setting is preferred. Previous supervisory experience is required. Experience in managing and monitoring contract work is a must. Previous project management experience is required. Strong technical knowledge in building systems and repairs. Must be able to review and interpret architectural, structural, plumbing, and electrical diagrams, and plans and specifications. Knowledge of local building codes is an asset. Familiarity with fire alarm systems, construction scheduling and project management. Must be able to prepare and administer operating budgets. Able to effectively meet deadlines and manage multiple priorities. Energetic, enthusiastic, flexible and adaptable to a wide variety of duties and settings. Attention to detail and quality control. Computer literate including a working knowledge of MS Office 2010 and ability to learn new technical software as required. Overtime and on call hours may be required. EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES: Certified 4th Class Engineer or equivalent. Possess or working toward a RPA, FMA, or SMA designation. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for pre-screening will be contacted. Brookfield Properties (Canada) Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to the inclusion and accommodation of all individuals.

Title: PLC / DCS Engineers / Technologists – All Levels
Job_Description: True North Automation provides a wide range of fully customized, vendor-neutral industrial engineering and automation solutions to companies across Canada, throughout the United States and around the world. Our corporate mantra of "Vision, Talent and Technology" defines both who we are as a company and why you'd want to work at True North. We employ some of the most skilled and versatile people in our industry, who consistently design advanced solutions that when deployed allow our customers to have modern, reliable control and monitoring systems. Fueled by the momentum of our vendor-neutral, relationship based, people-focused model, True North is poised for strong continued growth. Proud to be recognized by PROFIT Magazine on the prestigious PROFIT HOT 50 list makes us one of Canada's Top Growth Companies. True North has many compelling reasons to join our team. Not only do we provide our employees with high engagement in their work, we offer an environment that will treat you more like a friend than a numbered employee. Team building is a core value at True North, you can lace up your skates and join the company hockey team, or enjoy our annual Christmas party at Banff's Rimrock Hotel. At True North we play as hard as we work and we endeavour to include everyone. Position We are currently recruiting for PLC and DCS Engineers / Technologists. This challenging opportunity is to be an integral part of our controls and automation team. The successful candidate will be responsible for specification, configuration and commissioning of PLC and DCS systems. Main Responsibilities Design and configuration of PLC and DCS systems. Manage scope, schedule and budget on projects. Participate in P&ID, HAZOP and other design reviews. Provide high quality written documentation and engineering work packages. Perform ongoing maintenance and support on previous projects. Commissioning, testing and troubleshooting remotely and on-site. Maintain 100% customer satisfaction. Qualifications Bachelors in Engineering or Diploma in Technology in a related field. PLC Experience with one of the following: Rockwell, Schnieder / Modicon, GE and Siemens or others. DCS Experience with one of the following: ABB, Honeywell Experion, DeltaV or others. Communication Experience with one of the following: DeviceNet, Modbus, Profibus, FFieldbus or others. Strong software computer proficiencies: MS Office,SQL, VBScript, Access an asset. Able to adapt to various situations quickly, while adhering to daily deadlines. Superb communication written and spoken. Availability to Travel approximately 20% of the time with a valid driver's license. Experience in Oil / Gas, Manufacturing, Mining, Forestry, Waste Water, Water, Food and Beverage. Please submit your cover letter and resume with "PLC / DCS Engineers / Technologists" as the subject line to careers@truenorthautomation.com We thank all interested applicants, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

Title: Junior Geotechnical/Geohazard Specialist
Job_Description: We are currently seeking an Junior Geotechnical/Geohazard Specialist to join our team in Calgary .  Reporting to the Principal Geotechnical Engineer, the Geotechnical/Geohazard Junior holds a role supporting a wide variety of projects across our western Canadian offices. The role will be an opportunity to gain experience and knowledge working with senior experienced professionals, in the office and in the field  Qualifications: University degree or diploma in a related discipline (i.e. geoscience or civil engineering, etc.); a post-graduate degree would be considered an asset Minimum of <4 years relevant experience in a consulting environment; Willing to work extended and irregular hours within western Canada when necessary; Currently registered or eligible to register as a member of APEGA; Ability to work on multiple projects and meet established deadlines; Effective interpersonal skills, a strong client-service focus and the ability to work in a team environment are essential; Strong business development skills; Experience using specialized equipment and software (e.g. Lpile, GRL-WEAP, GeoStudio or equivalent) would be considered an asset; Strong report writing and verbal communication skills in the English language; and Valid driver’s licence with a clean driving abstract.  Experience in the following areas would be an asset: Slope Stability, mitigation design and monitoring Terrain Mapping Landslide Detection Slope Hazard Assessment Fluvial Geomorphology Flood Hazard Assessment Hydrologic Modelling River Surveying Debris Flows Foundation Design Retaining wall design Mining Infrastructure design Site Investigation- drilling  Job Duties: Acting as the lead resource/project manager for a variety of projects and clients Assist in the development and growth of the Calgary team with a focus on energy and infrastructure developments Support the development of the Environment & Geoscience business by developing relationships with existing and future client contacts, attending meetings, and supporting BD initiatives Preparation and review of proposals Provision of practical and economic solutions to clients Preparation and review of technical reports associated with the project scope of work Ensuring technical quality of work including review of client deliverables (proposals, reports and mapping) Provide guidance, training and direction to junior and intermediate staff to ensure the completion of the project scope of work.  Our commitment to excellence extents do our workplace where we offer a flexible work environment, competitive compensation and benefits including a generous RRSP program and an employee Share Ownership Plan, in-house training programs, a strong emphasis on health and safety, support for continuing education and professional development and the opportunity to work with and learn from senior technical experts and professionals.  For more information, please visit our website at www.snclavalin.com  While SNC-Lavalin would like to thank all those that apply, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.  Local candidates will be preferred and no relocation package will be offered  “We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.”  Worker Type Employee  Job Type Regular   At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

Title: Electrical Engineer
Job_Description: Phoenix Technology Services is a progressive and innovative Calgary based directional drilling company. Driven by our client’s needs, we are committed to providing more efficient and cost-effective drilling operations.We have an opening for an Electrical Engineer based out of our SE Technical Centre. Reporting to the Electrical Engineering Manager (EEM), the Electrical Engineer (EE) will be a member of the Engineering department whose goal is to assure reliability, cost effectiveness and safety of proprietary technologies as well as supporting the needs of the Company. The incumbent will be responsible for a broad spectrum of initiatives involving the Engineering and Manufacturing, Reliability and Survey Domain teams as well as occasional tech support for field operations. Key areas of accountability will focus on providing analytical expertise and supporting surveying, directional drilling and calibration of MWD directional sensors.Responsibilities also include: Develop and maintain calibration infrastructure (hardware, firmware, software) relating to directional sensors and capture learnings (e.g., processes, methods, algorithms, etc.) in a knowledge base.Work with the Survey Domain team as an expert responder to inquiries and provide guidance and expertise on application of MSA (Multi-station Analysis) and research into continuous improvements.Develop work instructions, sensor verification, calibration techniques and processes associated with the fleet of directional sensors, in collaboration with Manufacturing and Service Technicians.Work with Reliability team to triage and troubleshoot directional sensor failures and document corrective actions.Analyze performance of vendor products, document findings and communicate with vendors on continuous improvements.Participate in hardware, firmware, peer design reviews, and general troubleshooting and triage activity.Prepare supplemental technical, design, specification, testing, training and procedural documentation as needed.Provide in-person training and support to groups within Phoenix as required.Provide occasional support for service and field operations.Maintain complete and comprehensive records of daily activities and report to the EEM on a weekly basis.Occasional travel may be required.The successful candidate will have a Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, or Engineering Physics from an accredited University or College and is a member of APEGA in good standing or eligible for licensing in Alberta. This individual will have experience with embedded firmware coding and debugging in C environment, version control systems, preferably Subversion, Altium Schematic Design and PCB layout, and demonstrated experience with Matlab and Labview tools. Knowledge in oilfield drilling operations, MWD surveying technology and applications and familiarity with Visual Studio, .net and C# language are assets. They will also have good working knowledge of electrical hardware and firmware design best practices, strong documentation skills for design, testing and reporting as well as demonstrated understanding of quality assurance methods and reliability of electronic systems. This candidate is a quick learner with strong work ethic, goal focused and attentive to detail and will also have exceptional interpersonal and written communication skills, strong troubleshooting skills, is deeply analytical, with a passion for applied mathematics (electromagnetics and kinematics).Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Electrical Engineering: 1 yearEducation:Bachelor's

Title: Senior Front-End Developer

front-end web applications using JavaScript and HTML5 based apps.Lead, train, and mentor new developers that join the team.Participate in the development and architecture planning for our engagement platform, providing insight and guidance on improvements to better support application development.Required Skills5+ years of professional software development experience3+ years experience developing front-end web applications in JavaScript3+ years experience with JavaScript, jQuery, TypeScriptExperience with web technologies (HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery , CSS3, SASS)Experience building responsive web applicationsAbility to translate functional requirements into effective and intuitive responsive web applicationsRESTful web service integration experienceExperience working with 3rd party data sources and API’sExperience with Analytics and VisualizationWorking knowledge of source code management tools (Git, GitHub)Ability and desire to write self-explanatory and reusable codeExcellent problem solving skills and loves technical challengesAttention to detail and a passion for qualityExcellent communication and creative problem solving skillsNice to Have SkillsExperience with encryption methodologies (SHA256, BCrypt, PBKDF2)Working knowledge of HL7Working knowledge of build management tools (Maven, Gradle)Working knowledge of Health Care related privacy policies, including PHIPA and HIPAAExperience with live/on demand Video Streaming (TokBox, WebRTC, Vidyo, Wowza)Experience with messaging service providers (Twilio)Work Arrangement: Position Type: Full-Time, RegularHours of work: 37.5 hours per weekStart Date: When a suitable candidate is foundCompensation: Competitive and will be discussed during the interview processBenefits: Three weeks of paid vacation; paid Title: Technical System Support Analyst
Job_Description: For oil and gas field service companies who need web based fleet management tools, AssetWorks Field Service Solutions (FSS) improves operator safety, streamlines operations, & reduces fleet related operating costs. FSS has the ability to address the nuances of the oil/gas field services market with features such as oil/gas map data layers, lone worker, satellite communication backup, private roads etc., while addressing common transportation issues like Hours of Service and driver behaviour.   The Position   This is a contract position.   The technical system support analyst is responsible with maintaining the ongoing relationship with clients once the deployment phase of their project is complete. This includes general day-to-day support calls, issue troubleshooting, software/hardware/services, add-ons and periodic software updates.   Job Description: The Person  The successful candidate must have a mix of technical and interpersonal skills to maintain an ongoing personal relationship with clients. Typically the successful candidate will require one to three years of technical customer care experience and a certificate / diploma in information systems, technology or engineering. As well, the successful candidate should have excellent customer service skills including a patient courteous manner and a clear voice.  Responsibilities: Preparing client hardware shipments Taking support calls over the phone Responding to client email requests Acquiring and maintaining technical knowledge of FSS, mobile devices, and the system as a whole  Requirements: Diploma/degree in relevant field of study (Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineer) is required 2-5 yrs. experience in a technical system support role is required Knowledge of the oil and gas industry is an asset Familiarity with the android operating system Experience writing basic queries in SQL Knowledge of mobile communications Excellent oral and written communication skills Ownership of issues through resolution Ability to multi-task and work under pressure   Worker Type: Temporary (Fixed Term)   Number of Openings Available: 1
