Title: Fracture Mechanics Program Engineer
Job_Description: Your Opportunity Finding efficient, safe, and economical ways to develop and deliver oil and gas is an ongoing challenge. From the Arctic to the Canadian oil sands and the US shale plays, our Oil & Gas team partners with clients to provide engineering, procurement, construction management (EPCM), integrity, permitting, survey, and environmental services across the upstream, midstream, and downstream oil and gas industry. We design and support the lifecycle maintenance of facilities, pipelines, terminals, and refineries, as well as critical infrastructure like processing plants and field facilities. Through our partnerships, industry experience, and use of technology, we develop new and inventive ways to solve emerging issues, meet regulations, and increase productivity. Explore your career options with us.  We are currently seeking a Fracture Mechanics Program Engineer to join our Oil & Gas group in Southeast Calgary.  The Fracture Mechanics Program Engineer shall have strong technical, organizational and people skills, with a focus on integration of fracture mechanics into the integrity assessments and integrity program development. At all times, the focus will be efficient, timely and high quality deliverables to the client through an attention to details.  The role will require selection and application of appropriate materials testing, Fitness-for-Service and engineering methods and principles to conduct detailed engineering assessment of material imperfections relating to steel and pipe manufacturing, construction and joining as well as environmental and mechanical effects. Project experience with low-frequency long seam ERW and fatigue will be an asset. The candidate shall have a strong work ethic, enjoy working in a team environment and will desire to have a career in the integrity management field. Your Duties  Application of Pipeline Facility Fitness-for-Service codes and standards Project management, responsible for overall project cost, schedule and deliverables Sharing knowledge through informal presentations and one-on one coaching & mentoring Set an example through responsible, safety-conscious conduct Meet all requirements of Client and Stantec Quality Systems Strengthen technical knowledge through on-the-job, informal and formal training Be familiar with and ensure appropriate industry-accepted methods are utilized at all times Be familiar with applicable codes and regulations Liaise and interact with Stantec peers Establish and maintain positive client relationships Your Capabilities and Credentials Graduate or Post-graduate Engineering Degree in Fracture Mechanics Eligible for P.Eng. registration with APEGA 3+ years of laboratory experience in tensile, Charpy V-notch, CTOD, metallurgical and fractography analysis Crack Defect assessment experience, including application of CorLas, BS7910, API 579, API 1104, CSA Z662 Annex K BMT Flawcheck and Quest Signal software Experience with Canadian standards, practices and applicable legislation Demonstrated technical proficiency Strong interpersonal, communication, analytical and problem solving skills Demonstrated process improvement skills Demonstrated initiative, flexibility and adaptability  We would like to thank all candidates who apply; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: Maintenance Site Supervisor
Job_Description: About Us For over half a century, Bethany has been improving the lives of Alberta seniors and adults with disabilities by providing housing, health and community services that honour their spirit and individuality.  Bethany Riverview is a purpose-built, 210 bed seniors’ residence designed for complex dementia care and support. It will be the only care centre of its kind serving southern Alberta and will open in Fall 2018. Bethany Riverview will feature an indoor atrium, supportive technologies including Momentum resident safety system, integrated electronic health record, and an on-site daycare and bistro, all contained within a beautiful, state of the art facility. Employees at Bethany Riverview will receive enhanced training and an extended orientation in order to fully support our specialized programs and atmosphere. Bethany Riverview will be more than a building. It will be place for caring and connection for seniors, families, friends, volunteers and employees. Our employees adhere to a philosophy of care which celebrates aging in a dementia friendly environment absent of uniforms in which everyone participates equally in daily activities, including mealtimes and therapy. Our employees are committed to providing innovative, empathetic care to our residents in a joyful environment where residents and their families interact freely with employees, visitors and the environment. We offer competitive salaries, attractive benefits and pension programs, growth through learning and development, and numerous opportunities to give back to the community – just a few of the things that led to Bethany being named one of Alberta’s Top Employers for eleven consecutive years in 2018. It’s simple — we invest in our people because they are the reason for our success.  We are delighted that you are considering joining our team! We are looking for people who are passionate about people, working to enhance everyone’s quality of life at every stage of the journey.  About the Role At Bethany, a career as Maintenance Site Supervisor is both personally and professionally challenging and rewarding. In this leadership position, you will be responsible for the operation of the Maintenance Department, including the effective and efficient use of physical, financial and human resources within the department’s budgetary guidelines. The Maintenance Supervisor is responsible for the stewardship of Bethany Riverview’s physical assets, and the provision of a safe, comfortable, well maintained physical environment responsive to the needs of residents, employees and volunteers.  What You Will Do: Reporting to the Calgary Area Supervisor, in this role you will oversee the day-to-day operations of the Bethany Riverview Maintenance team, ensuring the efficient and safe operations of the facility.   Individual responsibilities will fall under the following areas of focus: Resident Centered Care – Promotes service excellence through responsiveness of requests from residents, families, volunteers and employees Documentation – Accurately and comprehensively tracks information and interventions related to departmental policies and procedures Safety - Contributes to a safe environment for residents, the team and self by understanding and adhering to safety guidelines and practices at all times Proactive Learner – Demonstrates the vision and values of Bethany and lives out the mission of Creating Caring Communities Team Work – Cares for an works cooperatively with others as an effective team member Leadership – Enables a high performance culture through leading, developing and coaching employees.  What You Bring: Grade 12 Education or recognized equivalent Current ABSA certificate 4th Class Power Engineer Certificate Supervisory management training is considered an asset 3 + years in a supervisory role Experience writing maintenance contracts and equipment specifications, budgetary and accounting procedures pertaining to building, equipment and life support systems Previous experience with management systems in an industrial or institutional environment. Able to work effectively in a physically and mentally demanding environment. Must demonstrate an acceptable level of reading, writing, and comprehension of English language skills. Knowledge of blue print and specifications reading and implementation. Proven ability to organize and prioritize various demands Must have a strong working knowledge of fire codes, building codes, and general safety regulations. Working knowledge of computer software  How to Apply: Like what you see and think you have what it takes to join our team? Apply Online before 23:00 on June 1, 2018 at: http://bethanyseniors.com/careers/  All applicants are thanked for their interest but only qualified candidates will be contacted. Bethany Care Society is an equal opportunity employer. Successful candidates will be required to obtain a Criminal Background Check. Bethany Care Society complies with the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA). By forwarding your resume to Bethany you are consenting to the collection and use of your personal information for this job competition. Your information will be kept strictly confidential.

Title: Java Developer (Berlin, Germany)
Job_Description: We are The Mobile Bank.Our vision is to build a bank the world loves to use.Technology and design empower everything we do.N26 is Europe’s first Mobile Bank with a full European banking license. We redesigned the banking experience to be simple, fast and contemporary. Founded in 2013 by Valentin Stalf and Maximilian Tayenthal, N26 has more than 380 employees and more than 850.000 customers in 17 countries. N26 has raised more than $215 million from investors including Allianz, Tencent, Li Ka-Shing’s Horizons Ventures, Battery Ventures and Valar Ventures, in addition to members of the Zalando management board, Earlybird Venture Capital and Redalpine Ventures.Once here you will?Develop software using Java 8 with Spring Boot and Kotlin.Be able to manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.Continuously improve your skills by taking the initiative to learn and share your knowledge with others.Within cross-functional teams you collaborate towards building scalable products.What you’ll bring alongYou have experience developing software in Java 8 related technologies.You are familiar with the concept of microservice architecture.You are known as a person who does not shy away from a tough problem.Because you know technology keeps evolving, you stay up to date with the current trends in software design.We are an international company and therefore English professional proficiency is a must.What we offerWorking with international, highly engaged peersFreedom to prototype given the challenges we faceGetting things done attitudeFlat hierarchy and open communicationExciting ChallengesPersonalized OnboardingInteresting technical problems to solve as we scaleWorking with engaged, smart engineersFind a career path. Not just a job. Some of our benefits and rewards can be found on our careers website.Sound good? Send us your application online, and we’ll get back to you soon.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Software Integrations Developer
Job_Description: Are you an experienced software/web developer? Don't miss this opportunity to work on software which is used worldwide on high profile marine projects! Enjoy competitive compensation, full benefits, and bonus program! About the Organization Trusted by shipbuilders, naval architects and marine engineers, SSI develops Autodesk-based solutions for the shipbuilding and offshore industry. With the majority of US naval ships now being built with SSI solutions, and prestigious names in global marine construction increasingly choosing SSI, we are poised for well-managed and sustainable growth.  Based in Victoria, BC with a satellite office in Alabama, we are proud to offer our team an environment that facilitates fascinating and challenging work with a healthy work/life balance. A career with us gives you the opportunity to work on complex and graphically-oriented software that is used on high profile marine projects worldwide. These exciting projects include the recently built Staten Island ferries, as well as a myriad of both international and US defense projects. The ability to see the results of your efforts in the real world is what makes a career with SSI so rewarding.  In 2013, SSI was awarded the VIATec award for Business of the Year in Ocean Products - a true testament to our success within the industry. For more information, please visit our website.  About the Opportunity Currently, SSI is looking for a Software Integrations Developer to join their team in Victoria, BC.  Using your comprehensive knowledge of web services, XML, relational databases, and API design, you will integrate our leading-edge shipbuilding design software with those of our partners while using your communications and organization skills to liaise with the clients and vendors to design and test the integrations.  In order to qualify for this role, you will have a post-secondary education in Computer Science or Engineering with a minimum of 5 years of experience in software and web development, as well as a minimum of 3 years of experience in XML and RESTful web services.  You will also possess:  Knowledge of C# and C++ Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio Familiarity with object-oriented design patterns Knowledge of complex data structures and algorithms Experience with automated testing methodologies Experience with SQL Server (or other relational databases) The following are considered assets:  Experience with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems Experience working with remote teams, spanning multiple time zones Experience working in an Agile Environment (Scrum) Experience with Atlassian Tools (JIRA, Confluence) Experience with Software Versioning and Revision Control Systems (SVN) You will do well in this role if you can work independently but also within a collaborative environment. Sound judgment and decision making skills are essential.  Please note: you must be a Canadian or US citizen and be based in, or willing to relocate to, Victoria, British Columbia, Canada in order to be considered for this role.  If you are a creative, energetic, and dynamic professional who wants to work on complex, graphically oriented software, this could be the role for you!  About the Benefits At SSI, the core of our success lies in the creative, energetic and dedicated people who make up our team. Although the work may be challenging, we foster a fun, flexible and friendly working environment with:  A casual, relaxed work environment Flexible work hours that support a work-life balance Seasonal social events (Friday pub lunches, potlucks, Pi day, Christmas parties, theme days, and more) Weekly onsite yoga classes Paid time off to attend blood donation drives Upon joining SSI, you can expect to receive a competitive annual salary of $60,000 - $75,000 per year depending on skills and experience, plus great employee benefits, including:  ParaMedical, Dental, and Vision Life insurance and long-term disability benefits Profit Sharing Plan Three weeks’ vacation Education assistance, professional development, opportunities for career growth, and training If you enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment and want to take your career to the next level with a local employer of choice – Apply to SSI today For full details and to apply, please visit http://jobs.applyfirst.ca/jobs...

Title: Software Developer
Job_Description: Innova Power Solutions is a Calgary based company that designs and manufactures battery packs and tools for the down hole directional drilling industry. Innova is leading the down hole battery industry through innovation and application of innovative technology.Duties include :Confer with engineers and others to design and to obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfacesModify existing software to correct errors, allow it to adapt to new hardware, or to improve its performanceAnalyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraintsCoordinate software system installation and monitor equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met.Design, develop and modify software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design.Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software EngineeringProficiency in multiple programming languages, preferably - Java - Python - any SQL flavourGit/mercurial experienceSoftware engineering best practices: unit testing, TDD, continuous integration, etcDesired Skills and Experience:Master's degree in Computer ScienceGroovyJavascriptC/C++/C#Experience with OpenERP/Odoo- Postgre SQLLinux development experience- Jenkins CI, Redmine, Sonarqube experienceMath background (Linear algebra, calculus, statistics)Job Type: Full-time

Title: Web Application Software Developer
Job_Description: Job title: Web Application Software DeveloperDepartment: Product DevelopmentLocation: Calgary, CanadaJOB DESCRIPTIONAbout Network InnovationsNetwork Innovations is a leading provider of Satellite & Communications services including VSAT networks, Mobile broadband, Push-to-Talk and Satphone solutions. NI serves clients across the globe in the Government, Media, Energy, Maritime, and Aero markets. With headquarters in Calgary, Canada, we have regional offices across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, and we work with over 200 partners operating globally.Job purposeThis role is responsible for designing, developing, and testing web applications (front and back end) that are available 24/7 with thousands of active users and API sessions. Active participation in defining the services architecture and interfaces is expected, and you will have the opportunity to work with product management and customers to shape our products.These web applications will aid our customers and service partners to easily use, deploy, and manage network services provided by NI.Duties and responsibilitiesDesign, prototype, implement, test, and document full stack (front and back end) web applications, and RESTful APIs.Design for usability with responsive web user interfaces.Design for scalability and reliability (24/7 operations – minimal maintenance down time) with continuous integration.Work with DevOps to deploy and maintain system components into QA and Production environments, and to create tools to quantify performance and reliability.Assist QA in developing automated testsIncorporate security into web services, APIs, and user interfaces.Work with Product Management (and Sales Engineers) to define the product requirements and ensure customer needs are being met.Estimate timelines and provide risk assessments for planning and tracking work. Provide feedback for continuous improvement of processes.Provide Tier-3 support to customers and work with Technical Support to improve their knowledge and tools for troubleshooting.QualificationsRequired Experience & SkillsDegree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent discipline6+ years of full stack application development for always on web applications with global user base, large traffic volume, and multi-national operationsProficient in Java (JEE) technologies including Spring MVC, Struts, Hibernate, RESTful JSON/XML, WebSocketsProficient in responsive user interface development in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript using Angular or Vue.jsFamiliar with SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL), and able to design/modify relational schemas, adapt Stored ProceduresComfortable in cross technology Enterprise Application environment – mostly Java (JEE) on Linux, but some C#/.NETNice to have3+ years with micro services architecture in a continuous integration environmentImplemented Single Sign On and OAUTH mechanismsFamiliar with Docker and Cloud Infrastructure (AWS, Microsoft Azure)Familiar with network management concepts: SNMP, Equipment and Link monitoring, Logical Network Mapping, GeolocationMindsetCustomer focusComplex problem solving: Systems-level approach to softwareCreative, collaborative, and open-mindedStrong communicatorPassion and pride in your workWorking conditionsThis is a full-time position in a professional office environment with flexible work hours. Occasional after-hours work will be necessary to provide tier-3 technical customer support or for a meeting with an overseas team member. Occasional travel is expected (including internationally) for projects or conferences.Job Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Calgary, AB

Title: ANT+ Applications Engineer 2
Job_Description: At Garmin Cochrane, we create more than just products – we inspire solutions and innovations that change and shape how we live, work and play. You’ll get to work alongside top talent and partners in the cycling, running, and sport and fitness industry from around the globe. You’ll enable compelling ecosystems such as ANT+ with the ANT 2.4 GHz ultra-low power wireless protocol, work on cutting-edge technology projects like optical heart-rate sensing, and sport and fitness products such as Vivoactive, Vector, and Varia.  Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, we’re located just 15 minutes outside of Calgary in Cochrane, Alberta. A retreat from fast-paced cities – Cochrane allows us to build relationships with the community and focus on what we do best – creating innovative solutions for unique use-cases in the ultra-low power wireless and sport industries. With many other tech companies calling Cochrane home, we can’t think of a better place to be!  Here’s why you want to work for us.  You’ll bring products to life. Become a key contributor to our exciting portfolio of Garmin products and ecosystems, and help us bring sport and fitness devices and standards from concept to market.  You’ll love our office culture. Company BBQs, active sports, casual dress, volunteer opportunities and the occasional sneak peak of new release movies (Star Wars, anyone?) allows team members to get to know each other outside the office.  You’ll receive fantastic benefits. Opportunities for professional development, no waiting period for vacation or our extensive benefit plan, RRSP matching, stock purchase options, product discounts and flexible work schedules are available for all team members.  Here’s what we’re looking for from you A passion for programming in C/C++/C#, you have a strong understanding of how the languages work and can use them to get the results you want on existing software. Experience and aptitude in requirements gathering and analysis with customers and partners Strong communicator who enjoys talking to people Excellent organizational skills Experience creating and documenting design specifications and bringing those designs to life Experience/interest in working with the ANT Wireless Protocol and other wireless technologies BSc Degree in Computer Science, Software/Electrical/Computer/Aerospace Engineering, Math, Physics or similar technical field of study with a 3.0 cumulative GPA, or equivalent practical experience Proficiency in C/C++, C#; Python experience is a bonus.  Desirable Qualifications: Experience developing software for Windows; familiarity with object-oriented design Experience developing embedded software for microcontrollers in small electronic devices A keen interest in fitness, cycling, running, health and wellness Interest in and ability to learn other programming languages as needed Proven ability to develop innovative and creative solutions to complex problems Familiarity with ANT/ANT+

Title: Wireless Telecommunication Engineer - Calgary
Job_Description: Cima+ is looking for a Telecommunication Wireless Engineer for our Calgary, Edmonton or Vancouver office We are interested in qualified individuals, with 7 or more years of experience in multiple aspects of wireless communication. CIMA+ is involved with a various set of clients with a wide variety of requirements. Main clients include large Oil and Gas industries, transit operators, health care institutions, first responders, municipalities and colleges/Universities. If you like diversity, this position is for you. The successful candidate should have broad technical expertise in telecommunication with a special focus on wireless communication. The candidate demonstrates strong organization skills and excellent interpersonal abilities. We are looking for an individual who wants to be challenged and is ready to join a dynamic growing team. CIMA+ is a well-established, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm established in Eastern Canada that has been rapidly expanding operations into Western Canada.  Responsibilities Be involved in all phases and types of telecommunication projects with emphasis on wireless projects including: Needs assessment; Specifications; Conceptual design; Cost Estimations; Detailed design; Procurement; Installation supervision; Test plans and validation Responsible for major account and project management Develop and maintain relationship with existing and new clients Participate actively in the proposal process Oversee the on-site system installation. Qualifications / Experience Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent Minimum 7 years of relevant experience and P.Eng. Licence; Experience designing, installing and validating systems in heavy industrial environment is highly desirable. Experience in a Transit environment is considered an asset. Experience with many of the following technologies is required: Microwave point-to-point (licence and unlicensed) links. Point to Multipoint wireless technologies. Wifi / WiMax Land Mobile radio systems (P25, DMR, NXDN, TETRA) Cellular technologies including LTE and DAS. Working knowledge of Ethernet/IP Switching and routing (VLANs, OSPF, MPLS) RF Propagation analysis using modern software suites like (E.g. iBwave suite, pathloss 4.0/5.0). The candidate should demonstrate experience in building and maintaining a relationship with a client; creating network architectures; creating high level and detailed design solutions; participating in feasibility studies; creating test plans; supervising installation; validating the installed systems; project management skills. Experience in greenfield and brownfield installations. Experience working for an engineering firm would be considered an asset

Title: Sr. Software Engineer – Test Automation
Job_Description: Sr. Software Engineer - Test Automation  We are looking for a Sr. Software Engineer, Test Automation to drive the development of our automated tests and infrastructure on the Synopsys Software Integrity Group line of products. The position entails developing and maintaining automated tests in our automated testing system using a combination of Java, Perl, Ruby, and shell scripts. The successful candidate will be responsible for automating test cases in our test automation framework as well as augmenting the framework to evolve with the products under which it is used to test. The ideal candidate is results driven and motivated by team success. They can work in a dynamic environment consisting of a cross functional team. This position requires someone who is comfortable with daily team communication and collaboration while also being able to work independently.  As a member of this team, you will: Develop and maintain automated test code written in a combination of Perl, Java and RubyGather testing requirements from the product teams and align the automated testing goals to ensure successful delivery of SIG productsPlan and design automated performance tests to be executed against multiple applications in a CI/CD environmentEnhance, maintain and adapt existing automated tests as the product under test evolvesReport issues found by the automated tests to the product developers Qualifications The successful candidate will possess all or most of the following qualifications: 4+ years of experience in a test automation software development roleBS in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related fieldStrong proficiency in Java and other Object Oriented programming languages such as C++/C#/Ruby/PythonPerl experience is a major advantageSignificant experience developing automated integration and end-to-end tests in a CI/CD environmentExperience in web test automation using Selenium Web driver is a plusREST/SOAP Automation, familiarity or expertise using tools like JMeter and SoapUIExperience developing highly reusable, maintainable and efficient testing frameworksStrong command line skills in shells such as bash, sh or powershellComfortable working on the command line of multiple operating systems such as Linux, Windows, Solaris and BSDRelational database and SQL experience is beneficialDemonstrates good analysis and problem-solving skillsExcellent analytical skillsProven to be deadline and results driven working in a high paced, independent working environmentStrong English communicator (written and verbal)You care (about others, about doing a good job, about details)A pleasure to work withConscientious Synopsys offers the most comprehensive portfolio of software security solutions in the market. We go beyond traditional testing services to help our clients identify, remediate, and prevent vulnerabilities in the applications that power their businesses. Our holistic approach to application security offers a balance of managed and professional services and products tailored to fit customers’ specific needs. We don’t stop when the test is over. Our experts also provide remediation guidance, program design services, and training that empower customers to build and maintain secure applications.  Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are committed to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact hr-help-canada@synopsys.com.

Title: Post Doctoral Fellowship, Human Interaction and Analytics wi...
Job_Description: Position Description Area: Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments Duration: 2 years Start Date: As soon as possible, until the position is filled Annual Stipend: $45,000 CAD/year The Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering in the Schulich School of Engineering at the University of Calgary is accepting applications for a Postdoctoral Fellow in “Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments”. Job Description: Focusing on Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments, the R&D project is to address the challenges of accurately communicating/displaying multi-dimensional information to human users in the most efficient and effective manner. Based on a Virtual-Reality (VR) platform of interactive and visual analytics, a key aspect of the project is accommodating human cognitive constraints to achieve new insights about highly complex multisensory data and to handle ill-defined and unstructured phenomena. The project is funded by the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council (NSERC) of Canada. The working environment includes the Schulich School of Engineering at the University of Calgary. The Postdoctoral Fellow will have opportunities to engage in research collaborating closely with researchers/engineers/scientists from national and international research institutes and industry. The position offers a unique multidisciplinary opportunity to be part of cutting edge R&D on VR applications. R&D Objectives: The research of the Postdoctoral Fellow will focus on the following objectives: Neural mechanisms of multi-sensory integration for facilitating interactive and visual analytics of complex data; Algorithms of the multi-sensory integration based upon the neural mechanisms; Evaluation of the prototype of VR systems. Qualifications: PhD in the computer science, engineering, or other related fields: The applicant must have completed (or be within three months of completing) their degree. Applicants who hold the degree must have obtained it within the last five years or have been actively working in a related field. Brain-Machine Interfaces (BMI) and neurosciences: Sound experience in BMI and good knowledge of neurosciences are essential. Familiarization with EEG devices, eye trackers and associated data processing are very desirable. Preference will be given to applicants with demonstrated BMI research activities. Software development: Solid and demonstrated software development experience is essential. Working knowledge of Machine Learning would be desirable. Usability Engineering: Knowledge of testing and evaluating the usability of software/hardware systems is desirable. Knowledge and experience of VR technologies would be an asset. Communication: The applicant must possess excellent English written and verbal communication. The role will involve a significant amount of communication between varying levels of personnel in academia and industries. The applicant must be capable of communicating potential complex concepts in terms understandable by the various groups involved. Working Style: The applicant must be capable of working in a self-directed/motivated manner and within a team environment. Application details: Send (via email) a letter of interest, a CV, and samples of publications to: Prof. Yaoping Hu  Email: huy@ucalgary.ca Dept. of Electrical and Computer Engineering Schulich School of Engineering University of Calgary 2500 University Drive, NW Calgary, Alberta, Canada T2N 1N4 Applications will be accepted until the position is filled. Additional Information To learn more about postdoctoral scholar opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our Postdoc Careers website. For more information about the Schulich School of Engineering visit Careers in the Schulich School of Engineering. About the University of Calgary The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca. To succeed as one of Canada’s top universities, where new ideas are created, tested and applied through first-class teaching and research, the University of Calgary needs more of the best minds in our classrooms and labs. We’re increasing our scholarly capacity by investing in people who want to change the world, bringing the best and brightest to Calgary to form a global intellectual hub and achieve advances that matter to everyone. About Calgary, Alberta Calgary is one of the world's cleanest cities and has been named one of the world's most livable cities for years. Calgary is a city of leaders – in business, community, philanthropy and volunteerism. Calgarians benefit from the strongest economy in the nation and enjoy more days of sunshine per year than any other major Canadian city. Calgary is less than an hour’s drive from the Rocky Mountains and boasts the most extensive urban pathway and bikeway network in North America. The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.

Title: TECHNICAL WELDING ASSOCIATE 3
Job_Description: This position will be responsible for testing welders for “B Pressure” renewals, as well as job tests, developing welding procedure specifications, and providing consulting and quoting services to clients under the direction of the Welding Services Manager.  SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES Work with engineers, technologists and trades people to help our clients succeed in the construction of critical oil and gas infrastructure projects Interpret regulatory and statutory requirements, codes and customer specifications relating to fabrication, welding and materials. Determine client requirements, develop testing protocol for welding procedure specifications, and provide clients with quotations for new projects Monitor welding parameters, and write procedure qualification records and welding procedure specifications Prepare in-house work orders that communicate testing requirements to other departments and maintain traceability of samples and associated documentation Interpret laboratory test report results Evaluate client procedures for code compliance and provide recommendations Conduct welder performance qualification testing Assist engineers and the Welding Services Manager with high level welding procedures for various applications Assist clients with the implementation of welding processes and technologies Help to resolve manufacturing and field issues Provide consulting services to clients under the direction of the Welding Services Manager Participate in peer reviews of welding documentation Keep a clean working environment; Work in compliance with safety regulations. Participate in quality improvement and cost reduction efforts. May be assigned and coordinate special or ad hoc projects as needed. PROFILE  Education: Post secondary education in Welding Engineering, Welding Engineering Technology or Manufacturing Engineering Technology Program (three year program) is required Welding Examiner Certificate of Competency issued by ABSA is required C.E.T., P.Tech. or P.Eng. required CSA W178.2 Level 1 or 2 Welding Inspector Certificate of Compliance is required  Experience: 3-5 years of previous experience in the welding technology field is required.  REQUIRED SKILLS  Specific technical skills:   Must be able to read, understand and follow work instructions in a safe, accurate and timely manner.  Candidates must be proficient in using various types of computer software (Word, Excel. PowerPoint & Outlook).  Proven ability to manage, coordinate and prioritize multiple projects in a fast-paced, high pressure, highly professional environment in order to meet tight deadlines.  Candidates must demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills including grammar and composition.  Ability to work well with others & independently.  Proven time management skills and a strong attention to detail.  Works well under pressure.  Extended hours and shift work may be required from time to time.  Travel to other SGS locations or client location may be required from time to time.  Ensures full compliance with the company’s Health & Safety, Code of Integrity, and Professional Conduct policies.  Must demonstrate a strong working knowledge of ASME Section IX, Section VIII Div. 1, B31.1, B31.3, and CSA Z662  Familiarity with API, NACE and AWS codes and standards would be an asset  Ability to compose clear and concise technical reports with attention to detail.  Superior organizational, time management, communication and interpersonal skills are essential  Must have valid driver's license Must be able, willing and authorized to travel throughout Canada, the United States and if required outside North America

Title: Sr. Technical Support Engineer
Job_Description: About Synopsys Software Integrity Group (SIG) Synopsys Software Integrity Group helps organizations build secure, high-quality software, minimizing risks while maximizing speed and productivity. Synopsys, a recognized leader in application security, provides static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis solutions that enable teams to quickly find and fix vulnerabilities and defects in proprietary code, open source components, and application behavior. With a combination of industry-leading tools, services, and expertise, only Synopsys helps organizations maximize security and quality in DevSecOps and throughout the software development life cycle. For more information, go to www.synopsys.com/software.  Every software company has bugs in their code. We help those companies find the defects that cause their products to fail!  Our products involve highly-sophisticated, cutting-edge software algorithms to detect critical defects and security vulnerabilities in source code. Therefore, our technical support issues can be highly complex - solving them requires intelligence, insight, and true technical expertise.  We are searching to find a smart, motivated Technical Support Engineer with C/C++, C#, and/or Java programming experience. We want to hire people who are eager to help the best engineers from the world's top companies (our customers) solve complex problems in their source code and development environments.  If you have this programming knowledge and a passion for helping engineers find solutions for software quality and security needs, then Synopsys is the right place for you.  General Responsibilities  The Technical Support Engineer will be responsible for resolving customer problems. In this role, you will work closely with R&D and technical support staff to provide high-quality support to our customers.  Tasks essential to this position include:  You will be the Single Point of Contact for many of our strategic customers. You will be the customers trusted advisor and advocate, understand the customer’s environment and business goals and work closely with the account team when needed Troubleshoot incoming customer problems through email and/or phone Work with support team and developers to provide resolution to customer issues Research and respond to customer requests and provide detailed explanations to address questions and concerns from some of the worlds brightest developers and software architects Create knowledge items for recurring issues  Qualifications  BS/BA degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience Minimum 6+ years experience in technical support and/or C/C++/C# or Java programming with expert support skills Outstanding written and verbal communication skills Experience with variety of industry hardware platforms and operating systems (Linux/Unix, Windows, etc.). Ability to troubleshoot technical problems and demonstrate resourcefulness in obtaining necessary diagnostic information Ability to quickly assimilate complex problems and develop a resolution strategy Experience in multiple compiler environments gives you top priority in our hiring queue! Extensive technical expertise; the ability to solve problems and determine the root cause of issues Ability to use development tools, software, and advanced troubleshooting procedures. Must be able to tailor content to meet the needs of the client – experience with Salesforce.com a plus Enjoy fast-paced, energetic environment. Entrepreneurial and results-oriented with a strong work ethic Can handle multiple critical client support issues and can effectively communicate this to senior management Smart, creative, energetic, conscientious, and enthusiastic persona Team player with a customer-focused attitude  Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are committed to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact hr-help-canada@synopsys.com.

Title: Junior Structural (Bridges) Engineer
Company: ISL Engineering and Land Services Ltd
Job_Description: ISL Engineering and Land Services Ltd. is an award-winning full-service consulting firm dedicated to working with all levels of government and the private sector to deliver planning and design solutions for transportation, water, and land projects. Our commitment to client success is built on a strong foundation: we know the communities we serve. This local knowledge, combined with our range of expertise and depth of experience, helps us meet the unique challenges of every project and better understand the role of sustainable solutions in all phases of a project’s life cycle. ISL Engineering and Land Services is proud to be among Canada’s 30 most environmentally-conscious employers as well as a Platinum Level Small and Medium Best Employer in Canada. ISL supports diversity and is an employment equity employer. ISL offers opportunities for career development, an employer paid benefits plan, Group RRSP program and competitive salaries with opportunities for an annual bonus. ISL Engineering and Land Services is seeking a full time Junior Structural Engineer to join our Calgary Bridges team. A strong interest in bridge projects, organizational skills, and good communication skills are a real asset.  Responsibilities: Design of bridge structures and related components including: Superstructure design Substructure and foundation design Retaining wall design Structural analysis and design from the preliminary design phases through to construction; Use of modelling and analysis software (SAP, CSiBridge, MIDAS); Preparation of structural calculations and analysis models (SAP, CSiBridge, MIDAS); Prepare and review mark-ups required for drawing production; Follow and Participate in Engineering Process and Quality Management Procedures; Preparation of tender, specifications and contract documents; Report/proposal writing; Construction field reviews and site audits; Assist with construction administration; Related duties as assigned.  Requirements: Degree in Civil Engineering, structural specialization; Must have experience in prestressed and post-tensioned concrete design; Highly motivated, enthusiastic team player; Able to work independently and as an engaged team member; Excellent verbal and communications skills; Able to organize time to meet various project deadlines. Want to find out more about this or other ISL career opportunities? Visit us online at www.islengineering.com  Department: Structural-Bridges This is a permanent full time position

Title: Engineering Manager
Job_Description: Longview Aviation Asset Management (LAAM) was established in 2016 to provide attractive financing and lease options, as well as trade-in aircraft capabilities, for aircraft supported and manufactured by Viking Air Limited (Viking). In 2018, LAAM, in partnership with Viking, formally launched the CL-415EAF "Enhanced Aerial Firefighter" conversion program. The CL-415EAF combines the proven performance of the CL-215 airframe with modern upgrades to create the next generation of the world’s only purpose-built aerial firefighter and multi-mission amphibious platform. We are immediately seeking an experienced Aerospace Engineering Manager to join our rapidly expanding team in Calgary. The Engineering Manager is responsible for managing the Methods Engineering functions. Implements industry-standard continuous improvement methodologies to ensure that the product consistently meets all required quality standards while reducing production costs and cycle times. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop & manage a Methods Team in a production plant environment Develop & plan for manufacturing plan deliverables such as product flow, layout, cycle, visual aids, workbooks instructions, tooling, etc. Assess risks and develop a mitigation plan for processes and equipments (FMEAs) Analyse & optimize material flow. Manages development, implementation, optimization and build sequence planning, documentation, provisioning and tooling requirements for parts or assemblies. Manages MET’s in root cause analysis of production issues and errors. Conduct business/process analysis as required Use sound benchmarking principals and techniques as required for analysis Maintain and develop knowledge of new manufacturing processes within the aerospace industry and in the plant Possess a sound understanding of basic industrial engineering principles as they relate to work study, process analysis and resource planning Leading METs developing and revising Engineering Masters (EM’s), planning documents and workbooks ensuring that they properly define HOW the aircraft assembly, subassemblies and parts are manufactured in accordance with the type design by, Identifying tool and equipment requirements for their accountable work areas and to participate in their specifying, sourcing, acquisition and implementation, Defining standard work under LAAM work instructions Supporting Production in solving tactical problems. Defining parts repair processes Repair Design Develop repair designs / solutions for non-conformances Perform analysis in support of repair dispositions Recommend and develop permanent design changes for recurring non-conformances and drawing errors Develop and implement repairs using the standard repair manual Manage flow of repair solutions to meet the production priorities Provide status reports on the development of repair solutions Engineering Support Evaluate and resolve engineering-related production problems Investigate defective, damaged, or malfunctioning parts, assemblies, equipment, or systems to determine nature and scope of problem Support methods engineering and design change using the ECN process Provide engineering support to quality control, material, production, and other department personnel EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Degree or diploma in Engineering; or equivalent combination of education and experience (e.g., senior Aircraft Maintenance Engineer) 5-10 years of progressive hands-on experience in a manufacturing environment, preferably in the aerospace industry Knowledge of the repair, fabrication and assembly of aircraft parts Strong written and verbal communication skills Working knowledge of cost accounting and cost estimating Experience in an AMO environment would be an asset. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES: Knowledge of Aerospace engineering and manufacturing principles and techniques. Ability to apply sound engineering principles to operational and process design issues. Ability to read and interpret aircraft engineering drawings. Ability to communicate well orally and in writing. Ability to communicate and document information using a computer and required software. Ability to manage and act on multiple projects and priorities at one time. Ability to work effectively either independently or with others on flexible work assignments. JOIN THE TEAM AND BENEFIT FROM: Competitive salary Full extended health and benefit plan The opportunity to join an organization from the ground floor Great task diversity and unique challenges Company RRSP matching Interviews start ASAP! Apply today for consideration! (No cover letter required)

Title: Continuous Improvement - Black Belt - Calgary
Job_Description: The Continuous Improvement Black Belt (CI BB) is responsible delivering the KN Production System improvements, through the development and implementation of technical solutions, equipment and overall optimization of space, equipment and manpower to meet new or changed processing requirements. This also includes the delivery of Deep Dive Value Stream Analysis KN’s lean focused end to end site deployment methodology. This is a “hands-on”, “roll-up your shirt sleeves” position that will lead mid-level to complex projects, provide guidance to less senior engineers and be adept at team education, training and facilitation. The incumbent should look forward to spending considerable time on the floor in operations and directly interfacing w/supervision and associates as well as senior operations management. If you enjoy a challenging work environment where you can make a real contribution this is a position you should consider.   Please note the distribution centre is located in Calgary. Responsibilities: • Provide support to the implementation of the Kuehne-Nagel Production System (KNPS) in all areas of the operation including :  Delivery of Deep Dive Value Stream Analysis Implementation of GRIP KN’s productivity management tool KNExcellence, training, audits and delivery (KN’s operational site maturity model) Utilize the principles, methods and tools of Lean-Six Sigma to identify areas for time and cost savings, participate in improvement projects and implement solutions. Develop baselines and track over-all savings Analyze appropriateness of current technology and make equipment recommendations. Develop process flow and vsm analyses to capture current operations and identify process improvements; support and facilitate Kaizen and 6S events and process improvement teams Support production and staff planning, line balancing and capacity analysis. Conduct manpower studies to determine labor standards. Review storage utilization and suggest re-layouts. Review labor performance, reporting methods, systems and procedures. Coordinate with management, suppliers, contractors concerning procedures, purchases and specifications Deliver Lean and Six Sigma training at GB and YB Levels with MBB support Other duties as required by the company.     Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial or Mechanical Engineering or a related engineering discipline LEAN-Six Sigma Black Belt certification or equivalent experience and Green Belt Certification MBA or MS Industrial Engineering or related field preferred 5+ years relevant work experience  Skills and/or Experience:   LEAN-Six Sigma and related methodologies; Facility and operations design; Work measurement methodologies and tools (MOST, MTM, etc); Process measurement and analysis including SPC and Cpk; Statistical analysis software such as Minitab or Qimacros preferred; Warehouse management, inventory management, manufacturing execution systems; Process optimization utilizing computer simulation; Team facilitation, education and training; Proficiency with MS Office suite, Visio, MS Projects; Experience in manufacturing and distribution-warehousing preferred; Good analytical & statistical acumen; Excellent written/oral communication skills as wells as presentation and team facilitation skills; Strong analytical and problem solving skills; Working Environment: Office, warehouse and/or manufacturing. We offer competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits package, employee discounts, tuition reimbursement, excellent training programs and a highly dynamic global work environment. At this time, we are considering only local candidates who are able to work without employer sponsorship. No agencies or phone calls, please. Only those candidates whose experience best meets our requirements will be contacted. Kuehne + Nagel Ltd. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  With over 76,000 employees at some 1,200 locations in over 100 countries, the Kuehne + Nagel Group is one of the world’s leading logistics companies. Its strong market position lies in the seafreight, airfreight, contract logistics and overland businesses, with a clear focus on high value-added segments such as IT-based integrated logistics solutions.

Title: Senior Full Stack Java Engineer

Driven by GuildOne’s Synergy DNA(TM) technology, solutions are designed to transform complex data from various systems into valuable information assets that are easily understood shared and exploited. Integrated solutions include software and services enabling organizations to acquire a clearer understanding of operations, make more informed business decisions, identify gaps and streamline business processes, recover lost revenue, yield better bottom line results and achieve compliance.  We are JVM based, and live and work in Calgary, Alberta, Canada.  Your Opportunity  GuildOne is seeking an experienced Senior Full Stack Java Engineer to design and develop elegant and performant code. Our ideal candidate will have a strong work ethic, fantastic attitude and be comfortable tackling any challenge set before him or her. They will work collaboratively to ensure consistent and performant approaches for the entire user experience and analytic code developed inside the system. Expert knowledge of Java, Scala or Kotlin.  Experience with TDD.  Experience with agile development within commercial projects or elite non-commercial research.  Adept at learning and applying new technologies and solving new problems.  Technical team leader or manager in Agile development.  Experience interacting with senior level management and executives.  Communication and collaboration skills to participate & shape the architecture, high-level designs and detailed designs of systems.  Experience blending analytic and simulation modelling approaches to problem-solving.  Effective organizational skills with strong attention to detail.  Strong communication skills - both written and verbal.  While we sincerely appreciate the time and effort you put into your application, unfortunately, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Sustainability Specialist - Footprint
Job_Description: Footprint is looking to grow our team in Alberta in the Calgary office with the addition of a Sustainability Specialist. You’re a sustainability champion with a passion for improving the energy efficiency of the building environment. You enjoy taking on new challenges, but you’re most excited when you can buckle down and efficiently get work done. You’re not afraid to speak up and ask tough questions, and you pride yourself on your friendly yet direct communication skills. That’s why, whether you’re solving problems on your own or as part of a team, you excel. You don’t like being micro-managed, and are looking for an opportunity to work directly with senior leadership – to step up, learn more, and go further in your career.  Does this sound like you? If so, here are some of the more detailed responsibilities you can expect in this position:  Coordinate and facilitate LEED certification of new construction and existing building projects. Collect, analyze and compile shop drawings as well as other technical and statistical information relating to LEED and other sustainability projects. Liaise with all project team members including the owner’s, representatives and other consultants throughout the project to ensure smooth project delivery. Develop and maintain data collection, record keeping and databases as required to support projects. Prepare concise reports and written materials of a technical nature, in order to update the project team on the progress of the project. Prepare energy incentive applications and supporting documents for projects. Facilitate energy incentive applications process for new constructions and retrofit projects. Report to the principal and/or project manager regarding project process; including informing them of contentious issues. Respond to both internal and external communications regarding project status and deadlines. Perform site inspections related to sustainability considerations including indoor air quality during construction, erosion and sedimentation control. Facilitate the energy incentive application process. Prepare energy incentive applications and supporting documents for new constructions and retrofit projects. Attend project meetings as required. Prepare presentations for clients and owners, where required. A few more qualifications which will help you with these responsibilities:  Possess a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in architecture, engineering or environmental science and/or related field. Minimum 1 year of relevant experience in the field of environmental sustainability. Attain LEED Green Associate designation within six months of employment and will be expected to obtain their LEED AP with specialization within one year. Demonstrate a strong interest in energy conservation, energy modelling and sustainable design. Will be expected to develop a working knowledge of building energy modeling techniques and software programs within one year of employment. Familiar with municipal green standards and provincial building codes. Strong written and oral communication skills; able to communicate with both internal and external clients. Able to work in complex environment driven by project deadlines. Highly innovative with an attention to detail; quick learner. Able to work independently as well as part of a team. Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills. To apply for this position, please email your resume and cover letter to careers@sa-footprint.com. Please place job title in the subject line of the email.  Appropriate accommodations will be provided to candidates upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process. Successful applicants will be advised of Footprint's accommodation policies at the time an employment offer is extended.  Only qualified candidates will be contacted.  About Footprint  Footprint is a consulting practice comprised of a highly-specialized team of engineers, planners, architects, designers, and sustainability professionals. With offices across Canada, Footprint provides an evolving list of services, including sustainability certification and strategy, energy modelling, measurement and verification, existing building services, and dayling analysis. The Footprint team draws extensively from our technical background on a diverse range of projects - many of which are leading national examples of sustainable design. Their team has earned the trust of public and private clients in markets across Canada, and consider it their responsibility to provide reliable and unparalleled service through every stage of a project. A proud member of the Smith + Andersen Group of Companies, Footprint's foundations lie in technical expertise gained from a proven consulting engineernig firm. To find out more about Footprint, please visit their website: sa-footprint.com  About Smith + Andersen  Smith + Andersen is a trusted Canadian consulting engineering firm with offices in Vancouver, Kelowna, Calgary, Edmonton, Winnipeg, London, Toronto, Ottawa, and Halifax. Founded in 1965, Smith + Andersen has organically grown from an established reputation as trusted mechanical and electrical consultants, reaching new levels of engineering and design excellence in the communications, security and audiovisual fields, and providing enhanced services such as lighting, buildnig automation systems, and intelligent integrated systems design. Thanks to their client-focussed approach, Smith + Andersen is able to apply efficient, sustainable, and reliable design and engineering solutions on the most exciting projects across Canada. From fully-integrated hospitals and welcoming schools, to healthy workplaces and secure transit stations, their team has established lasting relatinoships with public and private sector clients across the country. To find out more about Smith + Andersen, please visit their website: smithandandersen.com

Title: Civil Engineer EIT
Job_Description: Your Opportunity Our Water sector, which brings together many of the world’s top engineers and scientists, sees water a bit differently—as a single holistic system rather than as unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. We use this perspective to help communities tap into water’s potential. Throughout the life cycle of capture, use, reuse, and discharge, our team optimizes every facet of a water system.  Whether a project calls for planners, designers, construction managers, or facility operators, we have the right experts to provide creative, yet practical, water solutions. Through our cost-effective strategies, we’re helping communities increase their water efficiency and protect their water resources for future generations. Join our team as we create new ways to tap into water’s vast potential.  Stantec is currently looking to add a Civil Engineer in Training to support our growing Water Resources practice. We encourage you to apply if you possess or would like to gain experience in a broad range of water-related engineering projects, with specific emphasis on industrial stormwater management water resources infrastructure projects. Applicants should be capable of working effectively with teams and clients, and be willing to learn from peers and supervisors  Your Duties Cooperatively support multidisciplinary teams on small- to mid-sized projects and work on several projects concurrently.Perform preliminary and detailed analysis for industrial stormwater runoff.Perform detailed analysis for hydraulic and hydrologic modeling using PCSWMM modeling software.Preparation of studies, design criteria, design reports, plans and specifications, and quality assurance reviews of related designs and construction plans to ensure technical accuracy.Inspect construction for compliance with design drawings and specifications.Assist in project administration including writing reports, gathering information, preparing proposals and budgets, and completing progress reports.Evaluate alternatives and resolve technical questions.Work in a manner to ensure your personal safety and that of fellow employees by following company health and safety guideline and policies.  Your Capabilities and Credentials Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Civil or Water Resources Engineering. Registration as an Engineer-in-Training with APEGA or qualifications to obtain this registration at the start of employment. Strong organizational skills and multitasking ability. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work with engineering staff at all levels. Ability to prepare complete, concise and organized engineering calculations and analyses. Desire to grow in your career in a challenging environment that fosters self-improvement though leadership, mentoring, and a diversity of experience. Strong willingness to be a part of a large global engineering company, and to work with teams in other offices around the world. You will be based out of Calgary, but the position may require occasional project travel throughout western Canada Qualified candidates who are highly motivated and eager to commit to Stantec's strategic initiative to become a Top 10 global design firm should submit their resume and cover letter online at www.stantec.com/careers.

Title: Tools and Infrastructure Engineer
Job_Description: Benevity is seeking a Tools and Infrastructure Engineer to join a team that is responsible for solving challenges around developing software at scale without sacrificing stability, quality, velocity or code health. This position empowers you to build elegant tools that enable the entire engineering organization to be more productive and efficient. It exposes you to a wide array of interesting technical challenges due to increased visibility into every other engineering team and their systems. You'll engage in helping and mentoring them to take benefit of a shared tool ecosystem.  Who we are  Better Work and a Better World: at Benevity that’s what we’re all about. We’re a software company in the business of doing good, building better ways for companies to connect with their customers and employees around causes - we make “doing well by doing good” more than just a tagline. We’re growing fast and looking for more great people to join us.  We’re not Bono, just a passionate crew of workhorses out to change the world. We have that fun, flexible tech culture that people love (ok, some people – you know who you are!) – and we have a heart. We’re a registered B Corporation, which means we’re part of a new breed of companies committed to higher social and environmental standards.  You’ll join a dedicated, passionate team that creates innovative solutions for our raving fans (er, clients). And you’ll get to rub shoulders with some of the most iconic and notable companies and charities in the world to help them make a difference (in even better ways). Our entrepreneurial environment appeals to self-driven, flexible team players who learn quickly, aren’t afraid to tackle hard problems and don’t mind wearing jeans to work. Sound cool? Join us! What You'll Do  What You Will Do  Lead/contribute to engineering efforts from design to implementation, solving complex technical challenges around developer and engineering productivity and velocity  Design and build advanced automated build, test and release infrastructure  Work closely with internal users throughout the development and testing process to understand their needs and rapidly iterate on solutions  Integrate, extend, and maintain existing tools and infrastructure  Create and improve automation of the Jenkins pipeline and optimize it based on various KPIs  Provision and support various environments used during the development and test lifecycle  Develop CLIs, GUIs, and APIs to address different needs and types of stakeholders  Identify opportunities to adopt and adapt new tools and techniques from the industry  Actively participate in regular team meetings, discussing issues related to productivity, process, workflow and quality  Ensure that the tools are scalable, well documented and easy to understand  What You Bring  Post-secondary diploma, certificate or degree in an IT-related discipline  3 to 5 years of development experience with a strong coding skillset in at least one of Java, Go, JavaScript or PHP  Experience with containerization/virtualization technologies like Docker, Vagrant and VMware  Experience with Amazon Web Services ecosystem: EC2, S3, RDS (MySQL), VPC and IAMs  Experience with Configuration Management tools like Ansible (preferred), Chef or Puppet  Proven ability to quickly learn and work with new tools and technologies
