Title: Customer Solutions Engineer
Job_Description: Zedi is a leading technology and services company in the field of production operations. Through technology backed by expert consultation and services, we help our customers realize their production potential. With our unique combination of award-winning software, automation, measurement, artificial lift and field services, we offer complete solutions for the challenges our customers encounter.  Zedi is seeking a Customer Solutions Engineer to join our innovative team in Calgary. This role has direct involvement with the end-to-end design of SCADA automation systems in Canadian and international markets. The ideal candidate will have a BSc. and a minimum of four years’ in this field along with a work ethic that aligns with Zedi’s Core Values-  Deliver on our promises, Reward creative teamwork, Communicate with clarity, Growth through innovation Prioritize workplace health and safety  Key Roles and Responsibilities:  End-to-end design of SCADA automation systems for Oil & Gas well sites, batteries and plant facilities in the Canadian and International markets. Generation, Review and Approval of Technical Drawings (P&ID;, electrical panel IFC drawings, network architectures, system block diagrams, etc). Creating Bills of Materials (BOMs), Rough Orders of Magnitude (ROMs) and formal proposals Creating, reviewing and approving engineering documentation such as FEED (Front-End Engineer and Design) Studies, Standard Operating Procedures, Acceptance Tests and Scopes of Work. Commissioning and Acceptance Testing various RTUs, PLCs and automation solutions back to Zedi’s web-based HMI interface, Zedi Access. Interfacing with customer management, operations, engineering and field teams during design review and project status meetings. Providing Tier 3 technical support to internal and external customers. Performing Technical Sales Support for existing and new clients with the Zedi Business Development Team. Delivering corporate and technical presentations to clients and potential partners. Modeling and analyzing production parameters and recommending appropriate Zedi Artificial Lift Solutions to achieve desired production.  The ideal candidate will possess the following:  BSc. in Engineering, Engineering Technologist or equivalent (Electrical, Computer, Mechanical or Petroleum preferred) APEGA or ASET Member (P.Eng, C.E.T., M.I.T.) Minimum 4 years’ experience in the Oil & Gas Industry Experience with SCADA/Automation systems and Field Instrumentation Experience with Ethernet, Radio, Cellular, and Satellite communication Knowledge of communication protocols and complex networking Proficient with Microsoft operating systems and program suites  Key Competencies:  Ability to work in a team environment Ability to coordinate with multiple departments Ability to take initiative and work independently Able to meet tight deadlines and manage multiple priorities Strong written and verbal communication skills Responsibility and capability of seeing tasks through to completion Analytical and Troubleshooting skills Ability to learn new skills quickly Project Coordination Experience with programming languages such as Assembly, C, C++, Visual Basic, Ladder Logic Knowledge of safety regulations, the electrical codes and regulatory production guidelines Experience with SCADA software such ROCLink 800, Telepace, WinCCU, AutoSol Oil and Gas + SCADA/Automation field experience  Trainable Competencies:  Experience with RODSTAR, SROD or equivalent artificial lift modeling software International Business Experience  To apply please to go to www.zedisolutions.com. We thank all applicants for their interest in Zedi; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Water Resources Engineer
Job_Description: Dillon is a well established, employee-owned professional consulting firm operating across Canada and internationally. We provide a wide range of consulting and design services related to the infrastructure, real estate, resource, industrial and government sectors in Canada and abroad.  We are currently seeking candidates for the position of Water Resources Engineer in our Calgary office. Responsibilities Strong leadership and project management of stormwater management projects for land development and/or public sector clients. Management and leadership of client relationships, developing new business opportunities, and the geographic expansion of Dillon’s services. Leadership of technical training and professional guidance to our growing professional and technical staff within the Calgary office. Input to the career development of more junior staff, including technical direction, training recommendations, coaching and mentoring. Contribution to Dillon’s corporate profile through active participation in professional associations and committees. Business travel upon request. Qualifications A degree in water resources or civil engineering. A post graduate degree in water resources engineering would be considered an asset. Licensed to practice as a professional engineer, or eligible to be licensed within six months in the province of Alberta. Minimum of 10 years' experience in water resources engineering. Experience Highly proficient in the preparation of watershed studies, master drainage plans, stormwater management plans, and site servicing plans. Expert knowledge of industry standard hydrologic and hydraulic modeling software packages. Proficient in the analysis, design and contract administration of stormwater management infrastructure for green-field developments and in retrofit situations. Extensive knowledge of local municipality standards, specifications, tendering and approvals process. Demonstrated abilities in multidisciplinary project teamwork and coordination. Proven skills in client relationship and business development. Exceptional communication, report writing, organization and interpersonal skills. Proficient in project proposal preparation and presentations. International experience would be an asset.

Title: Industrial Engineering Analyst
Job_Description: At EVRAZ North America, we manufacture engineered steel products for rail, energy and industrial end markets at six production sites located in the USA (Portland, Oregon; Pueblo, Colorado) and Canada (Regina, Saskatchewan; Calgary, Camrose and Red Deer, Alberta). We are the largest North American producer by volume in the rail and large diameter pipe markets, and we hold leading positions in the Western Canada oil country tubular goods, small diameter pipe and West Coast plate markets.  Job Description and Responsibilities  EVRAZ is seeking an Industrial Analyst for our Calgary facility. This new role will analyze production methods and data by studying key inputs and outputs at all stages of EVRAZ’s production model. The successful candidate will be a strong partner to our operations teams and drive strategies that leverage materials and resources to generate the highest productivity and efficiency at the lowest cost of production. This position reports to the Director of Operations.  Review of material flows, determine potential improvements to reduce pipe handling Determination of optimal plant load balance through analysis of optimal crew levels per line on tons of production Analysis of headcount per line and determines operators availability based on work load Review of cycle times; determine cycle activities subject to improvement and conducts bench marks with similar lines to determine actions to improve cycle times Study of change overs: utilize SMED type methodology to improve change over times Examine material yield losses, determines technological losses vs. scrap losses and completes analysis of potential technological and control improvements to reduce yield losses Conversion cost analysis: break cost down between “price” and “consumption” and help determining actions to reduce “consumption” or alternatives to overall improve cost per ton Determine production capacity of lines (existing and future) Support basic engineering designs of new lines or modifications to existing lines to have optimal performance Assist engineering team to calculate investment benefits (IRR, NPV, etc.) Utilize lean tools to support continuous improvement of plant performance  Job Requirements  Industrial or Manufacturing Engineer, Engineering Technologist Self-starter with the ability to multi-task while maintaining accuracy and meet deadlines Excellent written and verbal communication skills Lean tools training Excellent skills in MS Office Excel and Word Proficient with AutoCAD Knowledge of simulation software (i.e. Arena or ProModel) is recommended  All applicants must be legally able to work in Canada without sponsorship.  EVRAZ is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Individuals with Disabilities, and Veterans.  At EVRAZ North America, we manufacture steel. We also manufacture excellence, drive success and build careers for our employees. Our people come from diverse backgrounds, but share a common set of values and the same goal of creating the best possible solution for our customers.  With more than 4,500 team members in the U.S. and Canada, EVRAZ offers well-paying jobs and a comprehensive range of employee benefits. Our total compensation package includes benefits such as:  Competitive wages and bonus opportunities Family medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost Short and long term disability programs Competitive retirement plans Paid vacations Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company Tuition reimbursement Wellness program

Title: Infrastructure and Capital Projects Senior Associate
Job_Description: Service: Financial Advisory  Job Type: Permanent  Primary Location: Calgary, Alberta, Canada  All Available Locations: Calgary  External Posting Description    Deloitte is one of Canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across Canada. At Deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges.   Even the best-managed ventures are vulnerable to external influences - that’s where Deloitte’s Financial Advisory experts step in. As a member of our Financial Advisory team, you’ll help small start-ups to massive multinationals face business issues with informed confidence. Using your technical skills and leveraging our global network of experts, you’ll provide advice to companies in every industry, and in every situation. As a result, our clients will be better placed to take control and receive the best solutions to their complex challenges.   The Infrastructure and Capital Projects group provides a variety of consulting services to capital project owners, contractors, architect and engineering firms, governmental agencies, developers, and other organizations with a significant interest in the successful development and delivery of a capital projects and Turnarounds/Outages. We provide advisory and analytics, audit and assessment, and claims management services to clients in a variety of industries, including oil and gas, mining, power and utilities, transportation, manufacturing, consumer business and public sector. Our team of experienced engineers, quantity surveyors, project managers, construction managers, architects, and auditors possess comprehensive design and construction industry experience, and practical and effective project management, consulting, and communication skills, as well as strong professional qualities. Furthermore, through our access to the global network of member firms, the Deloitte Infrastructure and Capital Projects group offers a broad range of integrated services in varied professional disciplines and diverse locations.   We are rapidly growing our Infrastructure and Capital Projects practice in Calgary and require expertise at a Senior Associate level. As a Senior Associate, you will be responsible for supporting various aspects of our assignments, including:   Analyzing project costs and schedules, and applying an analytic process and tools to assess project performance and identify risks; Reviewing and developing effective project delivery organizations; Developing and maintaining project reporting and performance management dashboards using data analysis and visualization software; Collecting, organization and managing project data and documentation; Assisting with project and portfolio management maturity assessments; Reviewing contracts and assisting with contract compliance audits; Assisting with the development, implementation and monitoring of risk management programs Performing process and control reviews and organizational assessments; Developing project plans and processes and implementing project controls and governance structures; and Evaluating and developing construction claims including the review and analysis of delays and damages.    External Posting Qualifications   The successful candidate will possess the following qualifications:  Bachelor degree in Engineering or Architecture, relevant Construction Management Certification or related experience is required; 2-6 years of experience on major projects from an engineering, construction management, construction claims analysis, or project controls perspective and experience with contract administration and contractors, architectural/engineering firms, or construction project owners; Prior experience in conducting research, synthesizing data, conducting qualitative and quantitative analysis, writing reports and preparing presentations; Ability to thrive in a team and collaborative setting, to contribute and share innovative ideas, to regularly seek guidance and feedback, and work to ensure the success of the team; Ability to work independently, when required, take initiative, maintain a positive attitude and willingness to learn; Excellent verbal and written communication skills; Excellent problem solving skills; Proficient use of MS Office software (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint); and Strong commitment to professional and client service excellence.  Prior experience in the following areas would be considered an asset:  Working in a professional services or consulting environment; Analysis of complex engineering or construction projects, particularly with respect to project controls, performance measurement, risk management, and reporting; Using project and construction management software, and other data analysis and visualization tools; Developing project cost estimates and budgets; Construction claims and dispute resolution, including construction cost and delay analysis; Developing project schedules using software, such as Primavera, Microsoft Project, and other commonly used construction applications; and Process mapping and the use of related software, such as Visio.      Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.   We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Requisition code: 30644-en_US

Title: Systems Engineer
Job_Description: Tucows has been on the Internet since people unironically called it the Information Superhighway. Today, we’re the second largest domain wholesaler in the world with Millions of domains under management (OpenSRS / Enom). We’re doing all kinds of interesting things including running an MVNO cell phone service (Ting) and building fiber to the premises networks in towns and cities across the US (Ting Internet). We offer individual and small business domains and integration with Shopify, Squarespace and many others (Hover). We’re a team of over 600 serving tens of millions of customers around the world. Our growth has been incredible (NASDAQ: TCX, TSX: TC). It has also been smart and measured. Our success is built on a solid technology foundation thanks to a culture of DevOps excellence. That’s where you come in. As a Systems Engineer you’ll seed innovation and creativity in a dynamic, fast-paced successful and yet stable company. Description The Systems Engineer will be responsible for day to day operations including migrating production systems into a new architecture, taking advantage of the latest DevOps methodologies and tools. You will be working in a dynamic environment and proposing creative and effective solutions to operational challenges. Key skills and experience 4+ years of experience with configuration management Preferably SaltStack; Chef or Puppet is acceptable. Able to create new pillars and state files. Handle issues that arise with running a configuration management platform. Extensive experience with Linux We are using Debian, but at this level, it is expected that you can easily pick up other flavors. Package management (building, maintaining, etc.)  2+ years of Python Ability to write code to automate routine Operations’ tasks Ability to integrate into various APIs to create a cohesive platform. Nice to have skills and experience Leadership skills Standard internet services like DNS/HTTP Managing containerized systems Experience with continuous deployment best practices You might remember Tucows as the place to download software before software download sites got gross... not to mention almost entirely irrelevant. That was indeed us. That was also a long time ago on a server far, far away.

Title: Truss Design Technician
Job_Description: Contractor First / Palliser Truss is an industry leader in the building supply business that enjoys year over year growth. We are experts in the building materials industry and are proud to have been in business and serving our customers for over 50 years.We are proud to offer our employees a safe and rewarding place to work along with excellent benefits, compensation plans and industry leading Group Pension and RRSP programs. We are an employer who believes in giving back to our employees as well as to the various communities where we operate. In addition, we don't merely offer our employees a job, but rather a career path as there are many rewarding opportunities for our staff to take advantage of and grow with us.We are currently seeking an experienced, professional and detail oriented person to join our Contractor First / Palliser Truss location as a Truss Design Technician.ACCOUNTABILITIES: The Truss Design Technician works with the Truss Design Manager to estimate design and perform site consultations of complex roof truss systems. They consult with Engineers, Architects, City Building Officials and Contractors on individual projects and provide technical assistance to customers and the sales department as required. Other duties include coordinating truss components with regards to receiving the plans, quoting jobs, and creating the order while following up to ensure on time completion of projects.QUALIFICATIONS: A minimum of two (2) years of experience with Truss design and forest products.A diploma from a two (2) year technical program at a technical college such as SAIT is an asset.Functional computer and math skillsThe ability to read and interpret blueprints and structural working drawings.Fluent in English (spoken and written) with excellent listening, communication and interpersonal skills.Detail oriented with strong organizational skills.Ability to perform at a high level in a fast paced, demanding work environment.Professional, courteous and punctual with a focus on customer service.Must have a positive attitude and be a team player.Basic understanding of the building code and construction market.Experience with Mitek software; experience with AutoCAD is an asset.Job Type: Full-time

Title: ANT+ Applications Engineer 2
Job_Description: At Garmin Cochrane, we create more than just products – we inspire solutions and innovations that change and shape how we live, work and play. You’ll get to work alongside top talent and partners in the cycling, running, and sport and fitness industry from around the globe. You’ll enable compelling ecosystems such as ANT+ with the ANT 2.4 GHz ultra-low power wireless protocol, work on cutting-edge technology projects like optical heart-rate sensing, and sport and fitness products such as Vivoactive, Vector, and Varia. Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, we’re located just 15 minutes outside of Calgary in Cochrane, Alberta. A retreat from fast-paced cities – Cochrane allows us to build relationships with the community and focus on what we do best – creating innovative solutions for unique use-cases in the ultra-low power wireless and sport industries. With many other tech companies calling Cochrane home, we can’t think of a better place to be! Here’s why you want to work for us. You’ll bring products to life. Become a key contributor to our exciting portfolio of Garmin products and ecosystems, and help us bring sport and fitness devices and standards from concept to market. You’ll love our office culture. Company BBQs, active sports, casual dress, volunteer opportunities and the occasional sneak peak of new release movies (Star Wars, anyone?) allows team members to get to know each other outside the office. You’ll receive fantastic benefits. Opportunities for professional development, no waiting period for vacation or our extensive benefit plan, RRSP matching, stock purchase options, product discounts and flexible work schedules are available for all team members. Here’s what we’re looking for from you A passion for programming in C/C++/C#, you have a strong understanding of how the languages work and can use them to get the results you want on existing software. Experience and aptitude in requirements gathering and analysis with customers and partners Strong communicator who enjoys talking to people Excellent organizational skills Experience creating and documenting design specifications and bringing those designs to life Experience/interest in working with the ANT Wireless Protocol and other wireless technologies Qualifications  BSc Degree in Computer Science, Software/Electrical/Computer/Aerospace Engineering, Math, Physics or similar technical field of study with a 3.0 cumulative GPA, or equivalent practical experience Proficiency in C/C++, C#; Python experience is a bonus. Desirable Qualifications: Experience developing software for Windows; familiarity with object-oriented design Experience developing embedded software for microcontrollers in small electronic devices A keen interest in fitness, cycling, running, health and wellness Interest in and ability to learn other programming languages as needed Proven ability to develop innovative and creative solutions to complex problems Familiarity with ANT/ANT+

Title: CAD Technician/VDC Technician Early Career

Our work includes highways, bridges, mass transit systems, mine site development, hydroelectric powerhouses, dams and industrial facilities. About Kiewit As one of North America's largest, most respected construction and engineering organizations, with 2017 revenues of $8.7 billion, Kiewit exists to make a difference. We improve and connect communities across the United States, Canada, Mexico and Australia through complex projects in transportation, water/wastewater, power, oil, gas and chemical, building, industrial and mining. Our services are as diverse as the skills of our 22,000-strong workforce to whom we provide challenging, honest work in a caring and collaborative culture. A sense of adventure, pride and fulfillment is built in to every career at Kiewit. How We’re Different Consistently ranked within the top five of the “Top 400 Contractors” according to Engineering News-RecordNamed to the Best Workplaces in Canada by the Great Place to Work Institute Canada for the sixth year in a rowExtended health, dental and vision insurance where employees can get expert support for work, life, and everything in betweenRRSP plan that includes company dollar-for-dollar match on contributions up to 6 percent of weekly base wagesOur employees are entitled to accrue at least 20 days paid time off each year, in addition to statutory holidays per each province’s guidelinesWe spend an average of $8,500 per employee each year on training and career development, and reimburse up to $5,250 per year in outside tuition costs Kiewit believes in equal opportunity in employment practices without discrimination, and complies with all laws regarding human rights in the provinces where we operate.

Title: District Manager
Job_Description: Job Description Reporting to the Regional Vice President, the District Manager is responsible for safety and profitability of operations within the assigned district. The focus of this position is to meet client commitments and pursue future growth opportunities in the district related to our core Industrial Services business. Services offered include: demand and long-term industrial maintenance support, plant shutdowns and turnarounds, field construction and project management. The District Manager leads the execution of ClearStream’s policies and procedures and is a role model to field supervision and crews, promoting ClearStream’s values and culture. Key Responsibilities: Lead and foster a positive safety culture via the delivery of ClearStream’s HSE policies, programs and initiatives. Display passion and personal investment in the HSE performance of the district. Provide input for the development of project work and planning. Provide recommendations including the execution of field work and project schedules. Engage client and internal support functions (HSE, Recruitment, Quality, Finance, Supply Chain, IT). Execute field activities in conformance with client requirements (drawings, specifications, schedules, cost estimates, procedures, quality requirements and safety standards) and ClearStream operational procedures/manuals. Ensure that field activities in the assigned territory meet or exceed safety, quality, schedule and cost through the efficient use of all resources including manpower, materials, tools, and equipment. Ensure that daily and weekly short-range planning is maintained down to the foreman level. Monitor productivity and cost; implement appropriate action as required. Monitor and control change/scope creep; ensure change orders are approved prior to the performance of work. Ensure and/or perform on-site management, supervision and coordination of all subcontracted work. Ensure compliance with internal and external legal, regulatory and contractual obligations. Lead and foster an aligned corporate culture ensuring operational supervision is engaged with ClearStream’s core values, policies and processes. Oversee on-site management, supervision and coordination of all subcontracted work. Analyze manpower in order to assist with recruitment, training and retention of staff. Pursue opportunities in the assigned territory for business growth and expansion through networking and local community involvement. Support and actively participate in the Strategic Account Management plan. Develop local business plans and implement annual operational strategies in the context of overall ClearStream business strategy. Participate in developing annual goals of revenue and profitability for the District; develop short and long term forecasts; accountable for the overall financial performance of the District including budget development, forecasting, monitoring, variance analysis and reporting on financial targets.  INDIVIDUAL PROFILE Minimum 5 years’ oil & gas and/or industrial/pipeline contracting service experience in a supervisory/manager level role. Experience includes managing demand maintenance model, construction, fabrication, plant shutdowns, labour supply. Demonstrated experience and successful management of multiple projects with budgets of $5 - 20 million, utilizing upwards of 200 craft personnel and multiple contractors. Technical expertise in the mechanical/piping sector including shutdown/turnaround execution, long term maintenance programs, operations coordination, equipment management, cost estimating and bid development. Experience and ability to read and interpret Requests for Proposals including technical mechanical/piping drawings and utilize MS office software and estimating, scheduling and/or project management programs. Highly effective at translating business priorities into operating realities with a proven ability to work at all levels (with customers and internally) to execute operating plans safely, within budget, with quality and schedule requirements. A very effective, people-oriented leader with a reputation for quickly building credibility and successfully attracting, mentoring, motivating and respecting employees. Leads by example by building and maintaining positive working relationships with customers and internally resulting in continuous improvement and operational excellence. Brings an entrepreneurial spirit and a proven record of developing and managing new business opportunities through an established network of relationships in the industrial sector. Excellent personal and professional ability to prepare, present, participate in and facilitate group meetings and business presentations. Experience analyzing project/operational financial data and implementing performance action plans to improve operational results. Strong knowledge of short and long term budgeting, forecasting and project management. Experience living and working in small to mid-size communities; representing the company and being recognized as an active community member. Recognized as being a collaborator. Effective and contributing member of the team. Professional Engineer with preference for mechanical, or; Journeyman Mechanical Trades Certification.

Title: Scheduler
Job_Description: Requisition ID: 74081  As a Scheduling Specialist, you’ll play a key role in planning and scheduling activities on a varity of Energy projects. This hands-on role will give you the opportunity to directly impact the scheduling outcome over a broad range of projects in various stages of development and progress. By analyzing,monitoring and maintianing the project’s progress, you’ll prepare and analyze reports, develop alternative solutions, and drive successful project completion. Primary Responsibilities: Work closely with project managers, engineers, designers, procurement staff, construction managers, contractors and other project services staff to provide detailed planning and scheduling of projects from conceptual planning through engineering and construction;Develop and maintain resource loaded schedules, including lists of activities, major milestones, critical approvals, long lead procurement items and other critical project deliverables to be scheduled and tracked for the projects;Develop schedule logic and realistic activity durations;Analyze available manpower and resources, commodity charts, trends, schedule variations, schedule performance and schedule forecast;Assess the impact(s) of design changes and schedule slippages and inform company management and clients of all schedule updates;Apply knowledge of engineering, procurement, and construction terminology and concepts to develop and maintain critical path logic networks; accumulate and access historical data for use in maintaining realistic future planning and forecasting;Provide guidance, direction, and specialized assistance for the resolution of difficult project schedule problems. May interface with clients, attend regular meetings;Be able to comfortably and accurately communicate the plan to management and the project team. Qualifications: A minimum of two (2) years of industrial construction scheduling experience;Proficency in planning and scheduling using Primacera P6 in the Energy industry;Bachelor’s degree in construction management, engineering, or technical training and related experience;Working knowledge of standard cost control methods utilized in the execution of various types of project (EPC, Joint Venture, Lump Sum, time and Material, Maintenance);Proficiency in various project controls software such as PrimaveraExcel and any earned value software. About Kiewit As one of North America's largest, most respected construction and engineering organizations, with 2017 revenues of $8.7 billion, Kiewit exists to make a difference. We improve and connect communities across the United States, Canada, Mexico and Australia through complex projects in transportation, water/wastewater, power, oil, gas and chemical, building, industrial and mining. Our services are as diverse as the skills of our 22,000-strong workforce to whom we provide challenging, honest work in a caring and collaborative culture. A sense of adventure, pride and fulfillment is built in to every career at Kiewit. How We’re Different Consistently ranked within the top five of the “Top 400 Contractors” according to Engineering News-RecordNamed to the Best Workplaces in Canada by the Great Place to Work Institute Canada for the sixth year in a rowExtended health, dental and vision insurance where employees can get expert support for work, life, and everything in betweenRRSP plan that includes company dollar-for-dollar match on contributions up to 6 percent of weekly base wagesOur employees are entitled to accrue at least 20 days paid time off each year, in addition to statutory holidays per each province’s guidelinesWe spend an average of $8,500 per employee each year on training and career development, and reimburse up to $5,250 per year in outside tuition costs. Kiewit believes in equal opportunity in employment practices without discrimination, and complies with all laws regarding human rights in the provinces where we operate.

Title: Construction Supervisor
Job_Description: Construction Supervisor - Calgary Alberta ( Job Number:  170000HK ) Description My Field. My Craft. My Legacy .  You have talent, and PCL recognizes the value that each skilled craft person brings to the work site. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of construction jobs with a company that is recognized as a leader in the construction industry. Be part of world-class projects and a culture that is built on employee success and sharing of collective experiences.  PCL has one of the best safety records in the industry. On our construction jobs, PCL has a goal of zero incidents which continues to be a top priority; it is important that you go home uninjured at the end of every day. With PCL’s mentorship culture, you will be able to share your talents as well as learn from some of the best in the industry. Whether your focus is civil infrastructure, heavy industrial, or buildings, PCL has construction jobs that will showcase your skills.  Your talent drives your legacy with PCL.  We are seeking experienced Construction Supervisors located in Calgary, AB.  To apply for this position email calgarybuilders@pcl.com and quote Requisition #170000HK in the subject line.  Responsibilities Work with the project manager to create, maintain and execute project plan, schedule and ensure compliance with budget Supervise and coordinate site construction activity with PCL own forces work and sub trades Create site plans and safe work procedures Ensure implementation of PCL's safety program to ensure a safe work environment on the project site Work with engineers, designers and inspectors to meet the clients project requirements Perform some Carpentry tasks as required on the project including hoardings, framing, backing, door hardware and site housekeeping Qualifications 5 or more years of construction experience in field supervision in commercial or civil construction Hold a valid Journeyman trade certificate or civil engineering technology diploma. Preference will be given to certified Carpenters Working knowledge of Microsoft Office software including Excel, Word, and Outlook Carpentry or concrete experience considered an asset Experience with utilities, earthworks and site works considered an asset. Work Conditions  This position is based on a standard 44 hour work week. Suitable candidates must be available to work overtime, evenings, weekends and out of town. This position is physically demanding and requires commitment to working safe on our jobsites.  The PCL family of companies are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for, and we aspire to be the most respected builder, renowned for excellence, leadership, and unsurpassed value.   Let us help you build your Legacy today. Company : PCL Builders Inc. Job Posting : May 7, 2018 Closing Date : Aug 6, 2018 Primary Location : Canada-Alberta-Calgary

Title: Sustainability Specialist - Footprint
Job_Description: Footprint is looking to grow our team in Alberta in the Calgary office with the addition of a Sustainability Specialist. You’re a sustainability champion with a passion for improving the energy efficiency of the building environment. You enjoy taking on new challenges, but you’re most excited when you can buckle down and efficiently get work done. You’re not afraid to speak up and ask tough questions, and you pride yourself on your friendly yet direct communication skills. That’s why, whether you’re solving problems on your own or as part of a team, you excel. You don’t like being micro-managed, and are looking for an opportunity to work directly with senior leadership – to step up, learn more, and go further in your career.  Does this sound like you? If so, here are some of the more detailed responsibilities you can expect in this position:  Coordinate and facilitate LEED certification of new construction and existing building projects. Collect, analyze and compile shop drawings as well as other technical and statistical information relating to LEED and other sustainability projects. Liaise with all project team members including the owner’s, representatives and other consultants throughout the project to ensure smooth project delivery. Develop and maintain data collection, record keeping and databases as required to support projects. Prepare concise reports and written materials of a technical nature, in order to update the project team on the progress of the project. Prepare energy incentive applications and supporting documents for projects. Facilitate energy incentive applications process for new constructions and retrofit projects. Report to the principal and/or project manager regarding project process; including informing them of contentious issues. Respond to both internal and external communications regarding project status and deadlines. Perform site inspections related to sustainability considerations including indoor air quality during construction, erosion and sedimentation control. Facilitate the energy incentive application process. Prepare energy incentive applications and supporting documents for new constructions and retrofit projects. Attend project meetings as required. Prepare presentations for clients and owners, where required. A few more qualifications which will help you with these responsibilities:  Possess a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in architecture, engineering or environmental science and/or related field. Minimum 1 year of relevant experience in the field of environmental sustainability. Attain LEED Green Associate designation within six months of employment and will be expected to obtain their LEED AP with specialization within one year. Demonstrate a strong interest in energy conservation, energy modelling and sustainable design. Will be expected to develop a working knowledge of building energy modeling techniques and software programs within one year of employment. Familiar with municipal green standards and provincial building codes. Strong written and oral communication skills; able to communicate with both internal and external clients. Able to work in complex environment driven by project deadlines. Highly innovative with an attention to detail; quick learner. Able to work independently as well as part of a team. Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills. To apply for this position, please email your resume and cover letter to careers@sa-footprint.com. Please place job title in the subject line of the email.  Appropriate accommodations will be provided to candidates upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process. Successful applicants will be advised of Footprint's accommodation policies at the time an employment offer is extended.  Only qualified candidates will be contacted.  About Footprint  Footprint is a consulting practice comprised of a highly-specialized team of engineers, planners, architects, designers, and sustainability professionals. With offices across Canada, Footprint provides an evolving list of services, including sustainability certification and strategy, energy modelling, measurement and verification, existing building services, and dayling analysis. The Footprint team draws extensively from our technical background on a diverse range of projects - many of which are leading national examples of sustainable design. Their team has earned the trust of public and private clients in markets across Canada, and consider it their responsibility to provide reliable and unparalleled service through every stage of a project. A proud member of the Smith + Andersen Group of Companies, Footprint's foundations lie in technical expertise gained from a proven consulting engineernig firm. To find out more about Footprint, please visit their website: sa-footprint.com  About Smith + Andersen  Smith + Andersen is a trusted Canadian consulting engineering firm with offices in Vancouver, Kelowna, Calgary, Edmonton, Winnipeg, London, Toronto, Ottawa, and Halifax. Founded in 1965, Smith + Andersen has organically grown from an established reputation as trusted mechanical and electrical consultants, reaching new levels of engineering and design excellence in the communications, security and audiovisual fields, and providing enhanced services such as lighting, buildnig automation systems, and intelligent integrated systems design. Thanks to their client-focussed approach, Smith + Andersen is able to apply efficient, sustainable, and reliable design and engineering solutions on the most exciting projects across Canada. From fully-integrated hospitals and welcoming schools, to healthy workplaces and secure transit stations, their team has established lasting relatinoships with public and private sector clients across the country. To find out more about Smith + Andersen, please visit their website: smithandandersen.com

Job_Description: Connect with us LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter   Thinking about a change?  We recognize that the construction industry is changing at a rapid pace and we continually strive to be at the forefront. One – three years of satisfactory work experience in related area, which includes exposure to relevant construction, administrative or industrial work environments. Project Management experience or interest to grow this area of knowledge Interest/experience in technology-related projects would be an asset.  Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it! Title: Junior Geotechnical or Civil Engineer
Job_Description: Reporting to the Team Lead, you will be a key team member in a close-knit civil/geotechnical team that provides Engineering solutions to our Clients in Alberta, Canada and around the world. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of large-scale, world-class projects involving the design, construction and operations for oil sands and mining projects and a wide range of civil engineering projects including roads, railways, water resource dams, oil and gas facilities and heavy civil infrastructure. KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada, United States and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and Saskatchewan and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. This role will give you the opportunity to: Work on a variety of local and international projects that may include site characterization, geohazard risk assessment and control, terrain analysis, slope stability, numerical modeling, foundation design, tailings dam design, mine and tailings planning, mine pit slope design, embankment dams and earthworks design. Get involved in site investigation and drilling programs, core logging, lab testing, instrumentation installations and monitoring and data review and analysis. Build and develop strong relationships with multidisciplinary project teams, sub-contractors, clients, and other project stakeholders. Use your problem-solving ability to find innovative solutions to technical challenges. Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry in a supportive, dynamic company culture that supports career development. Travel to various project sites in Alberta and British Columbia with potential opportunities to travel internationally on mining projects. If you have a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Geotechnical or Civil Engineering, are registered, or are eligible to register as an Engineer-In-Training in the province of Alberta, and have up to 24 months of related work experience we want to hear from you! We value your: Strong initiative, innovation and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive toward long-term success. Flexibility, adaptability and willingness to learn and travel. Being able to work as part of an established team. Interpersonal, decision-making and technical skills. Experience in CAD software, such as AutoCAD and Civil 3D. Experience in various design software, such as Slope/W, Seep/W, Soil Vision, FLAC. Ability to manage workload to meet Client requirements. About Us: Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, hydropower, environmental, transportation, geotechnical, oil & gas, and water resources sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the Oil and Gas industry, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Mining. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. Are you up to the challenge? If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number 1342-A18. We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Title: I & C Intermediate/Senior Technologist, Designer, Engineer
Job_Description: Exergy Solutions is a different engineering design firm located in Calgary, Alberta. Exergy provides a unique blend of advice and skilled professionals to help customers improve their technical drawings and asset information. Exergy’s services include drafting as-builts, document management, field redlining, design and additive manufacturing. Our team is growing! We are a team of talented individuals focused on delivering consistent quality to our customers. We are looking for an Intermediate/Senior technologist, designer or engineer with knowledge in both Instrumentation and Controls. Requirements Knowledgeable in control system design architecture including discipline P&ID input, loop drawings, shutdown key development and control philosophies Working knowledge in a wide range of Distributed Control Systems including Honeywell DCS, Rockwell, and other platforms Work with process, mechanical, electrical disciplines and control system development partners in creating automated designs. Verify consistency between control systems and the cause and effect diagrams Plan, coordinate and prepare for productive field visits to verify site documentation Prepare written reports of findings and documentation issues found in collaboration with other members of the design team. Manage multiple ongoing projects and keeping track of daily progress Support electrical design team members in verifying single line diagrams and area classification drawings Responsible for DCS development, design and programming for R&D projects and field pilots. Conscious promotion of Exergy Solutions to clients and prospects Benefits Skills and Experience Design Technologist with ASET, CET, RET, or P.Tech(Eng) or Engineer with a P. Eng accredited by APEGA 10+ years for Senior – 6-10 years for Intermediate working in the Oil and Gas industry. Alberta gas and liquids processing experience will be considered first Degree or Diploma in Electrical, Automation, Instrumentation or Computer Science Engineering/Technology Diploma Experience in both PLC and DCS configuration and graphic development, RTU experience would be an asset Labview experience would be an asset for R&D projects Excellent writing skills and experience preparing technical reports Communication - solid command of the English language, persuasive, good negotiation skills, have the best interest of the company and client Solid time management with ability to work on multiple projects Advanced software computer skills - Word, Excel, and Outlook Excellent work ethic, organizational skills and attention to detail Strong sense of responsibility and initiative is expected to drive results Travel up to 25% of the time within Western Canada. Must have valid drivers license

Title: Continuous Improvement - Black Belt - Calgary
Job_Description: The Continuous Improvement Black Belt (CI BB) is responsible delivering the KN Production System improvements, through the development and implementation of technical solutions, equipment and overall optimization of space, equipment and manpower to meet new or changed processing requirements. This also includes the delivery of Deep Dive Value Stream Analysis KN’s lean focused end to end site deployment methodology. This is a “hands-on”, “roll-up your shirt sleeves” position that will lead mid-level to complex projects, provide guidance to less senior engineers and be adept at team education, training and facilitation. The incumbent should look forward to spending considerable time on the floor in operations and directly interfacing w/supervision and associates as well as senior operations management. If you enjoy a challenging work environment where you can make a real contribution this is a position you should consider.   Please note the distribution centre is located in Calgary. Responsibilities: • Provide support to the implementation of the Kuehne-Nagel Production System (KNPS) in all areas of the operation including :  Delivery of Deep Dive Value Stream Analysis Implementation of GRIP KN’s productivity management tool KNExcellence, training, audits and delivery (KN’s operational site maturity model) Utilize the principles, methods and tools of Lean-Six Sigma to identify areas for time and cost savings, participate in improvement projects and implement solutions. Develop baselines and track over-all savings Analyze appropriateness of current technology and make equipment recommendations. Develop process flow and vsm analyses to capture current operations and identify process improvements; support and facilitate Kaizen and 6S events and process improvement teams Support production and staff planning, line balancing and capacity analysis. Conduct manpower studies to determine labor standards. Review storage utilization and suggest re-layouts. Review labor performance, reporting methods, systems and procedures. Coordinate with management, suppliers, contractors concerning procedures, purchases and specifications Deliver Lean and Six Sigma training at GB and YB Levels with MBB support Other duties as required by the company.     Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial or Mechanical Engineering or a related engineering discipline LEAN-Six Sigma Black Belt certification or equivalent experience and Green Belt Certification MBA or MS Industrial Engineering or related field preferred 5+ years relevant work experience  Skills and/or Experience:   LEAN-Six Sigma and related methodologies; Facility and operations design; Work measurement methodologies and tools (MOST, MTM, etc); Process measurement and analysis including SPC and Cpk; Statistical analysis software such as Minitab or Qimacros preferred; Warehouse management, inventory management, manufacturing execution systems; Process optimization utilizing computer simulation; Team facilitation, education and training; Proficiency with MS Office suite, Visio, MS Projects; Experience in manufacturing and distribution-warehousing preferred; Good analytical & statistical acumen; Excellent written/oral communication skills as wells as presentation and team facilitation skills; Strong analytical and problem solving skills; Working Environment: Office, warehouse and/or manufacturing. We offer competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits package, employee discounts, tuition reimbursement, excellent training programs and a highly dynamic global work environment. At this time, we are considering only local candidates who are able to work without employer sponsorship. No agencies or phone calls, please. Only those candidates whose experience best meets our requirements will be contacted. Kuehne + Nagel Ltd. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  With over 76,000 employees at some 1,200 locations in over 100 countries, the Kuehne + Nagel Group is one of the world’s leading logistics companies. Its strong market position lies in the seafreight, airfreight, contract logistics and overland businesses, with a clear focus on high value-added segments such as IT-based integrated logistics solutions.

Title: Senior Manager, Engineering
Job_Description: Have you worked in a leadership role within Engineering, and have 7 years’ experience? Do you have working knowledge of steel in a manufacturing environment?Standen’s has been a Calgary fixture since 1924 - we make leaf spring suspensions, tillage tools and other heat-treated steel alloy products for the transportation and agriculture industries.We are a company that actively engages employees through a robust safety program; one that works in synergy with our quality and environment programs. We are COR certified and registered to the ISO 9001 & 14001 management programs.What we can offer: A competitive compensation package including:Company paid health benefits (including dental, extended medical);Company sponsored matching pension plan;An inclusive corporate culture, inviting your input on:Health and Wellness Programs;Industry leading Modified Work Program;An understanding of our employee’s needs:Onsite café with a variety of menu options daily;Opportunities for paid training and development, support for professional growth and movement within the company; andA dynamic and rewarding position that offers you the chance to make an impact every day.The Specifics: The Engineering Manager plans, organizes and directs engineering to meet company objectives for design, new product development and improvement of existing product and process lines by performing duties personally or through a support staff of product and process engineers. The Engineering Manager is accountable and responsible to sign off on all engineered drawings and represent the company through membership in good standing with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA).What we need from you: Meet or exceed customer expectations;Manage the department effectively measured by being on time and on budget monthly & annually;Innovate and develop new products measured through a successful APQP process;Manage employees by meeting or exceeding responsibilities and accountabilities for employee learning and leadership development.What the role is responsible for: Communication:  read, analyse & interpret complex documents and respond to inquiries or complaints; able to express and explain complex theories, solutions and ideas to a diverse audience;Mathematical:  apply advanced concepts such as exponents, logarithms, quadratic equations, along with frequency distribution, test reliability, analysis of variance, sampling theory and factor analysis;Reasoning:  define problems, collect data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, interpret technical instructions in diagram form with concrete and abstract variables;Supervisory:  manage and develop product and process engineers, technicians, administrative support staff and carries out all responsibilities according to safety, quality and other corporate policies and procedures; plans, assigns, directs work, appraises performance, rewards and addresses complaints and solves problems.What kind of work environment: Office environment; computer & software use; some phone use;Manufacturing environment;Some travel to customer and vendor locationsAll interested applicants are invited to submit a cover letter and resume here, indicating hourly wage expectations, no later than May 10, 2018, please reference #2018SMENG.Standen’s is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that welcomes a diverse workforce. NO THIRD PARTY OR OUTSIDE AGENCIES PLEASE.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Steel Manufacturing: 7 yearsEngineering: 7 yearsEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Calgary, ABLicence:Professional EngineerLanguage:English

Title: Technical Drafting Coordinator
Job_Description: Grow with PERI! If you are an energetic, motivated and driven individual, you want to be part of our dynamic engineering team. PERI is a leading global company in formwork, scaffolding and related engineering with over 1300 Engineers and 8,100 employees worldwide. Our comprehensive product range is the basis for the most cost-effective solutions in concrete construction. PERI offers excellent engineering expertise, efficient logistics operations, practical instruction and construction site support, hands on training and exceptional technical documentation. PERI takes an avid interest in the growth and development of all employees as they are the driving force behind the company’s continued success. The world of formwork and scaffolding is an exciting area in which to work, wherein employees are continually exposed to rewarding and enjoyable challenges that offer individuals the opportunity to develop unique and creative solutions for every type of project. Scope of the Position: Technical Coordinator is a position ideal for someone who is looking for an opportunity to learn and develop through involvement in a large variety of tasks, and particularly of interest to someone who is willing to take a leadership position in PERI Canada’s involvement in virtual construction. Additional areas of focus include engineering standards development, training tool creation, and engineering documentation. Kay Tasks and Responsibilities:    Provide Virtual Construction (BIM, 3D drafting) project leadership Engineering Standards development Creation and Organization of Training Resources for Product Training and Engineering Training PDM (PERI Data Management) program organization PERI software support (e.g. price list updates, standard template updates, etc.), including related internal communications PERI Drafting Standards Creation of Technical Checklists Other duties as assigned  Qualifications and Requirements: Graduate of a Civil Engineering Technologist program 2 to 4 years of experience in a Civil/Structural environment An interest in, passion for, and experience in Virtual Construction (BIM, 3D drafting) Excellent oral, written communication and math skills Proficient in the use of AutoCAD, Revit and the Microsoft Office suite of programs Experience with HTML editor an asset Bilingual in English & French an asset A self-starter and independent thinker Ability to build relationships and trust Works well independently as well as in a team environment with people at all levels Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment High level of personal motivation Strong follow-through, problem solving and attention to detail.  Working Conditions: 8-hour work day Operation of desktop computer and peripherals Working in an office environment Extended periods of sitting Travel for training and internal meetings Occasional customer meetings offsite Position is overtime eligible, in accordance with company policy We thank all applicants for their interest in the position, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  Accommodation for candidates with disabilities is available throughout the recruitment process upon request.   PERI is an equal Opportunity Employer

Title: Software Engineer, Development Services , Intermediate
Job_Description: Company Overview At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible.  Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. Project/Program Overview General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting opportunity for a Development Services Software Developer in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles.  Our Calgary team is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services.  The Development Services System Team, working in a scaled agile framework, is responsible for developing and implementing the strategy for a continuous integration and delivery pipeline. The environment is using industry standard best practices to allow the software being developed to be tested, integrated, packaged, and deployed using automated tools and virtualized environments. Responsibilities  Typical Duties:  As a member of the Development Services System Team, the successful candidate will: Create and maintain infrastructure, including continuous integration, automated builds, and automated build verification testing Create platforms and environments for solution demos, development, quality assurance, user acceptance testing and staging Create products, utilities, and scripts to automate deployment Coordinate with other Agile Teams in order to efficiently share responsibilities, therefore increasing overall performance Qualifications Required Skills & Experience: Interest and/or experience in continuous integration, continuous deployment, release management, and automation Strong scripting abilities Strong knowledge of Linux and the Microsoft Windows OS family Some familiarity with the following tools: Nexus OSS, Jenkins, Docker, Parasoft Development Test Plaftorm and GitLab Knowledge of agile development methods Strong problem solving and analysis skills Strong attention to detail Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Strong interpersonal skills Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of Scrum or the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0) Education: Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required.  Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position.  General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace.Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Senior Controls Specialist
Job_Description: As a Senior Controls Specialist within our Calgary office, you will excel in in a multi-faceted role supporting our clients in the Automation Solutions space. You will develop and articulate solutions to complex client automation projects, oversee project execution at a high level providing conceptual and technical expertise, develop and maintain client relationships and provide mentorship, coaching and leadership to your team members. Ultimately, you will provide superior client experiences partnering with your internal team to cohesively deliver a vision, energy, and intensity that exceeds client expectations.  What Would a Typical Day Look Like?  Technically, Controls Specialists will both execute and partner with project team leads in areas including:  Electrical design  PLC/HMI programming  System Architecture design  System Virtualization  Startup and commissioning and testing systems at our build facility  Travel to customer site to integrate systems  Exercise Project Management skills by developing project schedules and budgets in collaboration with clients and internal project management resources, ensuring completion of all project deliverables to the satisfaction of the client while fostering a culture of safety  Provide specific technical expertise and guidance in the development of employee skills, acting as a mentor and coach for junior employees as a cohesive team player  Participate in planning sessions with the Branch and Business Development Manager that will identify opportunities for new proposals, drafting of proposals, and explain/negotiate proposals with clients as well as partake in client meetings to help solidify JMP s position and increase client confidence in the JMP team  Interface with customers and offer strong technical expertise and advisement as part of the project team  What Qualifies You for this Opportunity?  Post-secondary degree/diploma in Engineering from a recognized engineering faculty or equivalent qualification  10+ years experience in the Automation industry as an Engineer, Technologist and/or project engineer, technically delivering on projects  3+ years proven track record of establishing and fostering solid client relationships  Proven track record in the design, procurement, programming, testing, commissioning and maintenance of control systems, including PLCs (Schneider/Rockwell), DCS, SCADA (Honeywell), Instrumentation, HMIs and Information Software  Experience with network architecture design and system virtualization (VMWare)  Experience with AutoCAD, Electrical Design, and a basic knowledge of the CEC  A proven self-starter with a positive, can-do attitude who is motivated by solving complex challenges  Strong client-focused approach, dedicated to providing exceptional client experiences to our internal and external customers  Exceptional leadership skills with the ability to engage, motivate and develop a team to achieve results  Ability to multi-task, exercise good judgment and prioritize workload through outstanding organizational skills  Excellent verbal and written communication skills with highly developed relationship management expertise, able to interact with various levels within the clients organization  Proven commitment to safety  Motivated & passionate about working with people and overcoming challenges through collaboration and a win-win paradigm  Reliable transportation and an ability to travel; Controls Specialists at JMP should have the ability to travel within the US and Canada  Who is JMP?  A mature, North American company founded in 1987 with 14 business units across the US and Canada, JMP serves the Fortune 1000 space providing engineering services and turnkey solutions in the areas of process automation, control system integration, information and analytic solutions and smart robotic applications.  We are CFE Media s 4 th fastest growing Systems Integrator in the world on the 2018 System Integrator Giants list, a Best Workplaces Canada award recipient from 2013 through 2017 and the only company in the world who is a Rockwell Automation Solution Partner, CSIA and RIA Certified.  Why Join the JMP Team?  At JMP we invest in our employees. JMP provides a very challenging work environment and believes in treating all employees with respect and providing equitable compensation. We empower our employees to use their creativity and problem solving skills daily. We have a solid performance management system and a supportive leadership team to help us achieve our personal and corporate objectives.  Accommodations  JMP Engineering has an accommodation program in place that provides reasonable accommodations for employees with disabilities. If you require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please contact Human Resources  We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Explore the possibilities
Job_Description: Who you are You are a full-stack SOA engineer / generalist. Experience and (just as important) interest in working in a variety of layers and technologies within a SOA is a must for our team. This includes (walking down the stack): AngularJS/Angular SPA development, MVC-based web architecture, external RESTful APIs, distributed request handling services, no-SQL and relational SQL databases, big data processing (e.g. data bus architecture, Hadoop / MPP data warehouse, etc.), and data visualization (e.g. ESRI, Open Layers, D3, Tableau, Spotfire, Microsoft BI). Experience in all these layers is not strictly required, but we do like to see experience working in more than one, as well as eagerness to work on projects that might slice through them all (because they often will). You have a track record of significant, specific, and self-directed contributions to large and challenging projects. What we're getting at here is "grit" or "street cred" some proof that this isn’t your first rodeo, and you have learned some lessons the hard way. Also, it’s not just a job, but something you enjoy. You lead with humility and confidence. Our engineers have the opportunity (and are expected) to exercise a high degree of leadership and expertise in their daily work, having strongly held and defensible ideas, and advocating for what they believe is right. But they also need to be eager to hear differing opinions, adept at identifying and evaluating tradeoffs, willing to be proven wrong, and quick to walk through fire to help out their follow teammates. You have 5-20 years of product-driven software development experience using a modern, object-oriented language. Memory-managed languages are best - .e.g. C#, Java, Python, Ruby, etc. We do a lot of development in C#/.NET, Java and Python, but specific experience here is not required.  What you'll do at IHS Markit Contribute to a cross-functional team building new capabilities for web based platforms. Monitor and support critical production services, while looking to continuously improve performance, resilience and transparency. Use your expertise to create next generation front end applications. Use your expertise to setup secure web and API integrations for external clients. Act as point of contact for the team on a rotating basis.  How you'll do it at IHS Markit Leverage your years of industry experience to provide your team with feedback and expertise, balancing a variety of roles including that of developer, architect, tester and technical writer. Satisfy your natural craving for problem solving by building and designing complex applications. You're smart and motivated enough to find a way, even if you don't know how yet. You will help balance project timelines and team commitments in an exciting, fast-paced environment. Google is your friend. It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below).  EEO is the Law EEO is the Law Supplement Right to Work Pay Transparency Policy E-Verify   Current Colleagues If you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.

Title: Specialist Internal Controls
Job_Description: Reporting to the Manager Internal Control, the Specialist Internal Control will contribute to the achievement of CP’s financial and operational goals through effective risk management by assisting in the development and sustainment of internal control policies, procedures and processes.  POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES: Assists the Manager Internal Control with the overall management of the SOX 404/302 program for CP;  Manages quarterly certification of controls process by business process owners and VPs;  Plans and reviews internal controls testing to ensure completion of annual SOX program in an efficient and effective manner and in compliance with regulatory requirements;  Works closely with external auditors, internal audit and business process owners to coordinate efficient and effective execution of testing plan including scheduling of testing and remediation of control deficiencies;  Takes lead in preparing reporting to senior management of control deficiencies and status of remediation;  Takes every opportunity to continuously improve CP’s internal controls framework;  Assists management in the maintenance of the risk and control library in the corporate Governance Reporting and Compliance software including the sustainment of all internal control documentation.;  Monitors CP processes and the regulatory environment (PCAOB, SEC,COSO, etc.) for changes that could impact CP internal control framework.  POSITION REQUIREMENTS: Undergraduate degree in Commerce, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics or other relevant fields required;  Professional Accounting Designation required;  3-5 years in accounting, auditing and / or controls design or assessment;  Detail working knowledge of PCAOB requirements and COSO framework;  Effective relationship builder;  Continuous improvement mindset;  Strong attention to detail;  Experience in planning and project/task management;  Strong communication skills (written and oral);  Drive for results / self-motivated.  WHAT CP HAS TO OFFER: Flexible and competitive benefits package  Competitive company pension plan  Employee Share Purchase Plan  Performance Incentive Program  Annual Fitness Subsidy  ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: As an employer with national presence, the possibility does exist that the location of your position may be changed based on organizational requirements.  Background Investigation: The successful candidate will need to successfully complete the following clearances:  Criminal history check  Reference check  Management Conductor Program: Becoming a qualified conductor or locomotive engineer is the single best way for a management employee to learn the business at CP. You may be required to obtain a certification or to maintain your current certification/qualification as a conductor or locomotive engineer.  CP is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of employment equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals. All applicant information will be managed in accordance with the federal Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act ("PIPEDA").

Title: Senior Engineer, Projects
Job_Description: Requisition Id: 15373 Department: Project Engineering Department Summary of Responsibilities Pembina is seeking an Engineer, Projects to join our Conventional Business Unit (CBU) in Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Supervisor, Project Engineering, this position’s responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Managing assigned projects to achieve safety, schedule, budget and quality targets Working within Project Management Office (PMO) and Pembina Project Delivery and Governance framework to execute projects Development of Project Management Office (PMO) documents as required Coordinating and working with internal project services groups such as Supply Chain Management (SCM), Document Control, and Pembina Land, Aboriginal, Regulatory, Environment (LARE) group Working with the internal and external engineering teams to coordinate the delivery of technical deliverables Working with the Pembina commissioning and Operations teams as necessary to ensure the project is appropriately commissioned and turned over Working with the Pembina document control team to ensure all project deliverables are appropriately numbered, compiled and available for turnover to close out the project Maintaining appropriate cost control and schedule to ensure successful project management and forecasting are in place Coordinate and manage as necessary to establish construction contracts, construction supervisors, EHS professionals and other support staff as necessary to ensure successful field execution of the project Coordinate as necessary with Sherwood Park Control
