Centre (SPCC) and SCADA to coordinate commissioning activities, shutdown activities and other non-routine events as necessary for successful project execution Promoting and implementing Pembina safety culture and targets within projects Other general coordination duties as required to ensure the necessary stakeholders are considered as part of the project Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in an industry related field Preferred candidate would have at least 10 years of combined construction and engineering project experience with either a P.Eng. or CET designation Project Management Professional (PMP) designation is preferred Demonstrated experience in project management between design engineering, field execution teams, commissioning teams and Code inspectors Previous EPC design experience is a definite asset Fluent in the tools of project management including cost control, scheduling, contracts, execution planning, commissioning and project closeout. Effective communicator (both written and verbal) Proven leadership skills in matrix environment Ability to adapt and thrive in changing circumstances and environments Aptitude to learn new skills, methods and software Self-starter that is a solution oriented problem solver Strong negotiator and consensus builder Proficient contract knowledge  No agency calls please. Pembina is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Pembina Pipeline Corporation has been serving the transportation and midstream service needs of North America's energy industry for over 60 years. We process, terminal and transport our customers' products safely - all while protecting the environment and delivering on our commitments to our shareholders and community stakeholders. When we build something, we do it right. Powering Pembina's growth are our smart, creative and energetic people who allow us to remain a disciplined and responsible energy transportation and service provider and a trusted member in our communities. Our expectations are high, and so are our rewards. We treat our people well – whether it’s through our total compensation package, our community engagement and volunteer opportunities, or our numerous fun social activities. Pembina is a proud recipient of the 2018 Canada’s Top 100 Employers and Alberta's Top 70 Employers (2014-2017). We are also a strong supporter of Skills Canada. >

Title: Senior CloudOps Engineer
Job_Description: Senior Software Engineer, CloudOps  Job Responsibilities: Architect, design and develop tooling necessary for delivering Enterprise Cloud-based and on-premise Security Solutions. Be able to work with and customize available container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes and OpenShift Origin Research open source solutions for Monitoring (e.g. Prometheus), Secret Management (E.g, Hashicopt Vault), Secure Networking (Project Calico) and adopting them into the CloudOps tool chain Be able to develop strategies and automation necessary for Persistent volumes, High availability, Failover, load balancing, DNS, Secure Communication, Logging, Blue-Green deployments Play key role in architecting and building end-end Continuous Delivery pipeline that takes developer code committed to SCM to production (Glue all pieces together: Build Jobs (CI), blending in automated integration tests, Automates Deployment automation, Host and container security scanning) Work closely with and act as a Cloud/DevOps consultant for Development and QA teams. Qualifications: BSc or MSc in Computer Science or related field/degree 5+ years experience in Software Development and/or DevOps Multiple years of programming experience in Java, Python and/or Golang (GoLang preferred) Proficient in Shell Scripting Strong knowledge in Operating Systems and Networks Experience with Docker, one or more orchestration systems like Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, Openshift, Apache Mesos. Knowledge and experience one or more the following technologies: Prometheus, Project Calico. ELK Stack, Jenkins, Hashicorp Vault, Ansible/Chef/Puppet, Spinnaker, Vagrant, Terraform. The Compensation Competitive base salary Annual performance bonuses Health benefits (medical, dental, vision) Matching RRSP contribution program ESPP program Insurance (travel, life, short/long-term disability) Work from home one day a week Monthly commute allowance Wellness program (subsidy) Employee referral bonuses Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are committed to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact hr-help-canada@synopsys.com.

Title: Senior Engineer specializing in Computational Fluid Dynamics
Job_Description: Pi Engineering is a growing piping and pipeline engineering consulting firm. Pi offers engineers an opportunity to work for a variety of clients in an virtual environment with opportunity for growth.  We want to hear from you if you have experience with any of the following:  Transient fluid dynamics (AFT Impulse) Pump trip (start/stop), valve closing/opening, pressure relief, etc. Slugging analysis Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) Multi-phase, high velocity, flow induced vibration Gas dynamics, relief valve transients Minimum Requirements:  Bachelors degree in engineering Calgary, Alberta Resident, or willing to relocate at applicants cost APEGA P. Eng 5-10 years experience Ablity to train, develop, and lead a group of engineers Develop and maintain client relationships AFT Impulse Experience with steady-state and transient analysis of compressible and/or in-compressible fluids with ANSYS, COMSOL, Abaqus or other CFD software. Strong understanding of theory and its application to fluid dynamic problems Organized and able to work without direction Demonstrated history of delivering high-quality error-free work to clients Why Pi Engineering?  Flexible office environment Flexible hours Independence Competitive compensation Training opportunities Get in on the ground floor of a rapidly growing company – opportunities for profit sharing and ownership Pi Engineering boasts a client portfolio of over 70 businesses, including small service companies, EPCMs, and Oil & Gas operators and owners. We maintain a maximum ratio of supervisor to EIT ratio of 5 to ensure a healthy learning environment and a high level of workmanship.  Our service offering includes: piping stress analysis, piping engineering, plant and facility piping, equipment piping design and stress analysis, dynamic analysis, finite element analysis (FEA), trouble-shooting, and training.  To apply, submit your resume and cover letter with compensation expectations.  No Phone Calls Please

Title: Software Integrations Developer
Job_Description: Are you an experienced software/web developer? Don't miss this opportunity to work on software which is used worldwide on high profile marine projects! Enjoy competitive compensation, full benefits, and bonus program! About the Organization Trusted by shipbuilders, naval architects and marine engineers, SSI develops Autodesk-based solutions for the shipbuilding and offshore industry. With the majority of US naval ships now being built with SSI solutions, and prestigious names in global marine construction increasingly choosing SSI, we are poised for well-managed and sustainable growth.  Based in Victoria, BC with a satellite office in Alabama, we are proud to offer our team an environment that facilitates fascinating and challenging work with a healthy work/life balance. A career with us gives you the opportunity to work on complex and graphically-oriented software that is used on high profile marine projects worldwide. These exciting projects include the recently built Staten Island ferries, as well as a myriad of both international and US defense projects. The ability to see the results of your efforts in the real world is what makes a career with SSI so rewarding.  In 2013, SSI was awarded the VIATec award for Business of the Year in Ocean Products - a true testament to our success within the industry. For more information, please visit our website.  About the Opportunity Currently, SSI is looking for a Software Integrations Developer to join their team in Victoria, BC.  Using your comprehensive knowledge of web services, XML, relational databases, and API design, you will integrate our leading-edge shipbuilding design software with those of our partners while using your communications and organization skills to liaise with the clients and vendors to design and test the integrations.  In order to qualify for this role, you will have a post-secondary education in Computer Science or Engineering with a minimum of 5 years of experience in software and web development, as well as a minimum of 3 years of experience in XML and RESTful web services.  You will also possess: Knowledge of C# and C++ Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio Familiarity with object-oriented design patterns Knowledge of complex data structures and algorithms Experience with automated testing methodologies Experience with SQL Server (or other relational databases)  The following are considered assets: Experience with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems Experience working with remote teams, spanning multiple time zones Experience working in an Agile Environment (Scrum) Experience with Atlassian Tools (JIRA, Confluence) Experience with Software Versioning and Revision Control Systems (SVN) You will do well in this role if you can work independently but also within a collaborative environment. Sound judgment and decision making skills are essential.  Please note: you must be a Canadian or US citizen and be based in, or willing to relocate to, Victoria, British Columbia, Canada in order to be considered for this role.  If you are a creative, energetic, and dynamic professional who wants to work on complex, graphically oriented software, this could be the role for you!  About the Benefits At SSI, the core of our success lies in the creative, energetic and dedicated people who make up our team. Although the work may be challenging, we foster a fun, flexible and friendly working environment with:  A casual, relaxed work environment Flexible work hours that support a work-life balance Seasonal social events (Friday pub lunches, potlucks, Pi day, Christmas parties, theme days, and more) Weekly onsite yoga classes Paid time off to attend blood donation drives Upon joining SSI, you can expect to receive a competitive annual salary of $60,000 - $75,000 per year depending on skills and experience, plus great employee benefits, including:  ParaMedical, Dental, and Vision Life insurance and long-term disability benefits Profit Sharing Plan Three weeks’ vacation Education assistance, professional development, opportunities for career growth, and training If you enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment and want to take your career to the next level with a local employer of choice – Apply to SSI today For full details and to apply, please visit http://jobs.applyfirst.ca/jobs...

Title: Geotechnical Engineer - Advanced Numerical Modelling
Job_Description: As a Geotechnical Engineer with advanced numerical modeling capability, you will be joining our close-knit Geotechnical Engineering team who are working on our strong portfolio of major water supply and hydropower dams, mine waste and tailings storage facilities, and infrastructure projects in Canada and internationally. In this role, you will collaborate with our talented professionals who are committed to delivering high quality engineering solutions to our clients. KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. This role will give you the opportunity to: Gain experience working on our portfolio of projects including water supply and hydropower dams, mine waste and tailings storage facilities, and geohazard risk mitigation. Develop and oversee site investigations and monitoring programs, complete engineering studies, and undertake conceptual to detailed engineering designs. Lead and oversee advanced 2D and 3D numerical static and dynamic modeling assignments. Use your problem-solving and modeling skills to find innovative solutions to complex technical issues. Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry. Work in a dynamic One Team company culture that supports career development. Contribute to the growth of the Resources Group and engage and mentor junior staff. Build and maintain strong relationships with our Clients and our multidisciplinary project teams. Travel primarily in Western Canada and potentially to our overseas project locations. If you have more than five years of relevant experience and are registered or eligible to register as a Professional Engineer in Canada, and hold a Masters degree or Ph.D. in geotechnical engineering with a strong emphasis on numerical modeling and analysis, preferably related to dams, tailings management in the oil sands, mining, hydropower or related industries, we want to hear from you! We value your: Working knowledge and demonstrated practical application of advanced 2D and 3D numerical static and dynamic modeling software, including FLAC, to define the problem and develop solutions. Solid understanding of soil and rock characteristics and behavior. Technical experience in dam engineering and tailings and mine waste engineering including liquefaction susceptibility and deformation assessments. Strong initiative, innovation and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive toward long-term success. Superior verbal and written communication skills including your experience in writing engineering reports and technical papers, preparing and delivering technical presentations to clients and Review Boards, and overseeing preparation of design drawings. Exceptional team spirit, interpersonal skills and your ability to build long-term, successful relationships with our clients and our project teams. About Us: Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, geotechnical, hydropower, water resources, transportation, oil & gas, and environmental sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton, and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the, Mining, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Oil and Gas industry. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. Are you up to the challenge? If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number 1331-A18. We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Title: Software Developer
Job_Description: Innova Power Solutions is a Calgary based company that designs and manufactures battery packs and tools for the down hole directional drilling industry. Innova is leading the down hole battery industry through innovation and application of innovative technology.Duties include :Confer with engineers and others to design and to obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfacesModify existing software to correct errors, allow it to adapt to new hardware, or to improve its performanceAnalyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraintsCoordinate software system installation and monitor equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met.Design, develop and modify software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design.Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software EngineeringProficiency in multiple programming languages, preferably - Java - Python - any SQL flavourGit/mercurial experienceSoftware engineering best practices: unit testing, TDD, continuous integration, etcDesired Skills and Experience:Master's degree in Computer ScienceGroovyJavascriptC/C++/C#Experience with OpenERP/Odoo- Postgre SQLLinux development experience- Jenkins CI, Redmine, Sonarqube experienceMath background (Linear algebra, calculus, statistics)Job Type: Full-time

Title: Web Application Software Developer
Job_Description: Job title: Web Application Software DeveloperDepartment: Product DevelopmentLocation: Calgary, CanadaJOB DESCRIPTIONAbout Network InnovationsNetwork Innovations is a leading provider of Satellite & Communications services including VSAT networks, Mobile broadband, Push-to-Talk and Satphone solutions. NI serves clients across the globe in the Government, Media, Energy, Maritime, and Aero markets. With headquarters in Calgary, Canada, we have regional offices across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, and we work with over 200 partners operating globally.Job purposeThis role is responsible for designing, developing, and testing web applications (front and back end) that are available 24/7 with thousands of active users and API sessions. Active participation in defining the services architecture and interfaces is expected, and you will have the opportunity to work with product management and customers to shape our products.These web applications will aid our customers and service partners to easily use, deploy, and manage network services provided by NI.Duties and responsibilitiesDesign, prototype, implement, test, and document full stack (front and back end) web applications, and RESTful APIs.Design for usability with responsive web user interfaces.Design for scalability and reliability (24/7 operations – minimal maintenance down time) with continuous integration.Work with DevOps to deploy and maintain system components into QA and Production environments, and to create tools to quantify performance and reliability.Assist QA in developing automated testsIncorporate security into web services, APIs, and user interfaces.Work with Product Management (and Sales Engineers) to define the product requirements and ensure customer needs are being met.Estimate timelines and provide risk assessments for planning and tracking work. Provide feedback for continuous improvement of processes.Provide Tier-3 support to customers and work with Technical Support to improve their knowledge and tools for troubleshooting.QualificationsRequired Experience & SkillsDegree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent discipline6+ years of full stack application development for always on web applications with global user base, large traffic volume, and multi-national operationsProficient in Java (JEE) technologies including Spring MVC, Struts, Hibernate, RESTful JSON/XML, WebSocketsProficient in responsive user interface development in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript using Angular or Vue.jsFamiliar with SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL), and able to design/modify relational schemas, adapt Stored ProceduresComfortable in cross technology Enterprise Application environment – mostly Java (JEE) on Linux, but some C#/.NETNice to have3+ years with micro services architecture in a continuous integration environmentImplemented Single Sign On and OAUTH mechanismsFamiliar with Docker and Cloud Infrastructure (AWS, Microsoft Azure)Familiar with network management concepts: SNMP, Equipment and Link monitoring, Logical Network Mapping, GeolocationMindsetCustomer focusComplex problem solving: Systems-level approach to softwareCreative, collaborative, and open-mindedStrong communicatorPassion and pride in your workWorking conditionsThis is a full-time position in a professional office environment with flexible work hours. Occasional after-hours work will be necessary to provide tier-3 technical customer support or for a meeting with an overseas team member. Occasional travel is expected (including internationally) for projects or conferences.Job Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Calgary, AB

Title: Senior Front-End Developer
Job_Description: About The Uncomplicated FamilyThe Uncomplicated Family (TUF) is a progressive health innovation company and passionate team who embrace commitment, innovation and compassion to enhance the quality of life for individuals, families and communities who are affected by disabilities. Our teams include: Speech-Language Pathologists, Occupational Therapists, Physiotherapists, Family Support Personnel, Software Developers and Engineers, Researchers, and Psychologists. The Uncomplicated Family Corporate Group includes Kids Uncomplicated Inc. (Clinical and Family Support Services) and Communities Uncomplicated Inc. (Software Development: Teleroo™ Technology).Teleroo™ is an award-winning group of technologies that has resulted in remarkable outcomes for children, families, and practitioners. Teleroo™ breaks down conventional barriers such as location, time constraints and budget to increase access to quality interventions to assist in service provision. Our technologies include a robust video-based platform for team collaboration, along with iOS therapy tool apps. The Teleroo™ Gateway platform was recently relaunched in collaboration with QoC Health. The successful candidate will work exclusively on Teleroo™ Technology with the Uncomplicated Family and QoC teams operating out of The Uncomplicated Family headquarters inCalgary, Alberta.About QoC HealthQoC Health is a diverse healthcare company that offers platform technology to design and build engagement-focused solutions leveraging new service delivery models. QoC focuses on connecting patients into circles of care and making it easier for healthcare organizations to get connected with their patients. Our engagement platform allows for perfect fit tools and solutions designed to integrate across a wide range of healthcare areas. From Wound Care to Aging Well and everything in between, our technologies help shift care to the community and keep patients out of hospital.The TUF/QoC CultureA passionate, cross-disciplinary team of technologists, healthcare professionals, and researchers, the TUF/QoC team loves what they do, and strives to achieve great things everyday. Motivated, genuine, and fun, the team is driven by innovation, challenging the status quo, with a focus toward the future. As part of the team you will have opportunities to bring solutions to some of our toughest client care challenges, across a diverse range of clients from around the globe, with opportunities to learn and grow from every project. We’re driven to improve care for everyone, help us shape the future!Role DescriptionWe are looking for a motivated Sr. Front-end Developer with strong front end, JavaScript, UI/UX experience who has worked with a range of frameworks to join our team. This is a full-time position based out ofCalgarywhere you will work with the development team, project managers and designers to build and customize robust frontend applications and libraries for our existing engagement platform and API’s. This is truly a leadership role, with excellent opportunity for ownership of an important and expanding aspect of the business.ResponsibilitiesAs a Senior Front-end Developer you will be responsible for architecting, building and optimizing reusable front end HTML5 / JavaScript / Java libraries, API’s, UI Modules, UI Widgets, and SDK’s to accelerate building robust web applications based on our engagement platform.In addition, you will:Participate in the discovery, design and specification of apps.Translate functional requirements into effective and intuitive applications.Build and customize front-end web applications using JavaScript and HTML5 based apps.Lead, train, and mentor new developers that join the team.Participate in the development and architecture planning for our engagement platform, providing insight and guidance on improvements to better support application development.Required Skills5+ years of professional software development experience3+ years experience developing front-end web applications in JavaScript3+ years experience with JavaScript, jQuery, TypeScriptExperience with web technologies (HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery , CSS3, SASS)Experience building responsive web applicationsAbility to translate functional requirements into effective and intuitive responsive web applicationsRESTful web service integration experienceExperience working with 3rd party data sources and API’sExperience with Analytics and VisualizationWorking knowledge of source code management tools (Git, GitHub)Ability and desire to write self-explanatory and reusable codeExcellent problem solving skills and loves technical challengesAttention to detail and a passion for qualityExcellent communication and creative problem solving skillsNice to Have SkillsExperience with encryption methodologies (SHA256, BCrypt, PBKDF2)Working knowledge of HL7Working knowledge of build management tools (Maven, Gradle)Working knowledge of Health Care related privacy policies, including PHIPA and HIPAAExperience with live/on demand Video Streaming (TokBox, WebRTC, Vidyo, Wowza)Experience with messaging service providers (Twilio)Work Arrangement: Position Type: Full-Time, RegularHours of work: 37.5 hours per weekStart Date: When a suitable candidate is foundCompensation: Competitive and will be discussed during the interview processBenefits: Three weeks of paid vacation; paid sick/personal time; benefits package includes Health, Dental, Vision, and Employee Family Assistance Plan coverage.If you are interested in this rewarding and exciting opportunity, please respond to this ad with your cover letter and resume.This posting will remain open until a suitable candidate is found and only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Thank you for your interest.Job Type: Full-time

Title: ANT+ Applications Engineer 2
Job_Description: At Garmin Cochrane, we create more than just products – we inspire solutions and innovations that change and shape how we live, work and play. You’ll get to work alongside top talent and partners in the cycling, running, and sport and fitness industry from around the globe. You’ll enable compelling ecosystems such as ANT+ with the ANT 2.4 GHz ultra-low power wireless protocol, work on cutting-edge technology projects like optical heart-rate sensing, and sport and fitness products such as Vivoactive, Vector, and Varia.  Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, we’re located just 15 minutes outside of Calgary in Cochrane, Alberta. A retreat from fast-paced cities – Cochrane allows us to build relationships with the community and focus on what we do best – creating innovative solutions for unique use-cases in the ultra-low power wireless and sport industries. With many other tech companies calling Cochrane home, we can’t think of a better place to be!  Here’s why you want to work for us.  You’ll bring products to life. Become a key contributor to our exciting portfolio of Garmin products and ecosystems, and help us bring sport and fitness devices and standards from concept to market.  You’ll love our office culture. Company BBQs, active sports, casual dress, volunteer opportunities and the occasional sneak peak of new release movies (Star Wars, anyone?) allows team members to get to know each other outside the office.  You’ll receive fantastic benefits. Opportunities for professional development, no waiting period for vacation or our extensive benefit plan, RRSP matching, stock purchase options, product discounts and flexible work schedules are available for all team members.  Here’s what we’re looking for from you A passion for programming in C/C++/C#, you have a strong understanding of how the languages work and can use them to get the results you want on existing software. Experience and aptitude in requirements gathering and analysis with customers and partners Strong communicator who enjoys talking to people Excellent organizational skills Experience creating and documenting design specifications and bringing those designs to life Experience/interest in working with the ANT Wireless Protocol and other wireless technologies BSc Degree in Computer Science, Software/Electrical/Computer/Aerospace Engineering, Math, Physics or similar technical field of study with a 3.0 cumulative GPA, or equivalent practical experience Proficiency in C/C++, C#; Python experience is a bonus.  Desirable Qualifications: Experience developing software for Windows; familiarity with object-oriented design Experience developing embedded software for microcontrollers in small electronic devices A keen interest in fitness, cycling, running, health and wellness Interest in and ability to learn other programming languages as needed Proven ability to develop innovative and creative solutions to complex problems Familiarity with ANT/ANT+

Title: Remote UX Researcher
Job_Description: Why MonetizeMore: To empower publishers that monetize via ads. Vision: Empower publishers via content, ad technology, free tools and personalized communication to increase their RPMs and solve common ad related problems. MonetizeMore builds industry leading ad technology that is seen by more than 300M people per month. The company has been running for 8 years achieving consistent double digit growth each year with a team of 100+ team members spread across the globe. MonetizeMore offers location and schedule freedom to every one of its team members. That means that you would have the lifestyle autonomy to choose to work from anywhere in the world, during the time of day you prefer. This new-age work lifestyle would enable you to engineer your ideal lifestyle. Say goodbye to endless commutes, stuffy business attire and the arbitrary 9 – 5 work day. Take your life back into your hands by joining the MonetizeMore team! The product team is the fastest and most innovative team in the company. Use modern design and development practices that are disrupting the ad technology industry. Solve problems that have never been solved before. Join a company culture that replaces constant meetings and interruptions with innovation that continues to break boundaries. Take your skillset to the next level with some of the best minds in the ad technology industry to make a real difference with MonetizeMore. The User Experience Researcher will be primarily responsible for designing, conducting, analyzing, and reporting on user-centered design research and usability testing for the company’s ad platform PubGuru, including identification of user needs and goals, task and workflow modeling, ethnography and persona development as well as rapid iterative usability testing, and more formal, in-depth user testing. A successful User Experience Researcher must be able to work with minimal supervision on multiple concurrent projects. User experience (UX) is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love working with. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to yield insights that inform product strategy and guide the design of the experiences we create. We collaborate closely with executives, product managers, software engineers, advertising operations agents and many others to solve complex challenges and craft powerful experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Your key responsibilities would be to: Conduct independent research on multiple aspects of products and experiences. Collect and analyze user behavior through online experiments, user surveys, and structured user sessions. Work with Designers, Product Managers, Engineers, Ad Ops Agents and other team members to prioritize research opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment. Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research. Advocate research findings to diverse audiences through written reports and in-person presentations Work with key stakeholders to define new features and their technical requirements. Create complex user journeys and UX wireframes for new features of our SaaS solution. Collaborating with product designers on high-fidelity user interface mockups and working prototypes. Clearly present user research and user journeys in stakeholder meetings. Work with development team to implement the approved designs.  Your candidate qualifications are expected to be: Bachelor's degree in Anthropology, Human Factors, Psychology, HCI/Computer Science or other related fields or equivalent practical experience. 3+ years of product design experience Comfortable inside a Kanban-board Project Management environment Effective interpersonal, communication, negotiation and collaboration skills. Establishing process for effective feature requirements gathering Experience mocking up information architecture diagrams, user journeys and product wireframes. Has a user research/design portfolio to showcase. (B2B examples a plus) Experience with modern design tools Balsamiq/Illustrator/Sketch/InVision Strong communication skills; English language fluency. Understanding of development workflows Passion to stay up with the latest trends in user research and product design  If you think you are a good fit to join the MonetizeMore team, please apply and give specific reasons what sets you apart. We hire individuals not robots so don’t be afraid to show a little personality ;)

Title: Senior Project Manager
Job_Description: Title Senior Project Manager  Location Calgary, AB  Job Information Reporting to Manager of Project Management, the Senior Project Manager will support Whissell’s vision, mission, S.P.I.R.I.T of values and three daily pillars of safety, quality and efficiency. Working closely with the Regional Operations Manager and a Project Coordinator, the Senior Project Manager will manage site level activities as well as provide direction, coordination, control and completion of assigned projects by coordinating with both field level personnel (including Superintendents) and at the head office. The duties and responsibilities of the Project Manager may be adjusted to meet specific jobsite requirements. If the project is staffed with a Project Coordinator some of the above duties may be delegated to the Project Coordinator however, the Project Manager will still be responsible for the competent performance of all such duties. Core Responsibilities: Duties and Required Skills Act as the focal point for managing multiple projects across multiple clients, and interact with the Technical Leads/Managers, Customer, and Project Team to resolve any emerging issues Oversee and manage construction projects including the development of work plans, schedules, budgets, manpower and equipment needs Scheduling of internal pre-commencement meeting to review project specifications, bid and establish construction approach and manage permit and approvals acquisition, safety and environmental compliance Lead the development of project master CPM schedules Respond to RFP’s, create statement of works (SOW’s) and Project Change Notices for the client on behalf of the Project teams Ensure projects are executed, controlled and monitored to result in on-time, on-budget delivery, at a quality level satisfying requirements and client expectations Ensure scope changes are proactively identified and successfully negotiated with the customer Supervise and control the execution of the construction, including the fiscal and administrative functions of the project Supervise and manage project team Establish and maintain a professional relationship with the Owner, Project Engineers, local businesses, and police and fire departments Ensure strict adherence to contract specifications Compile and track quantities and costs; document, plan revisions, change notices, change orders, and all other paperwork required on the project Control purchasing, procurement, and subcontract management Plan and maintain ongoing material and resources requirements with Superintendent Coordinate and document inspections with owner representatives and Superintendent on completed work including CCC and FAC Comply with Whissell and local Occupational Health and Safety regulations Identify any additional work opportunities on the site and with the Regional Operations Manager Essential Qualifications: Eng, CET or 10+ years related industry experience or combination Ability to read and understand blueprints, specifications, schedules and costing reports Thorough understanding of construction process, environmental regulations and safety practices Self-motivated with strong time management skills Previous experience using B2W software an asset PLEASE NOTE: All Whissell employees are required to pass a Pre-Employment Drug & Alcohol Test and provide a valid Driver’s Abstract (no more than three months old) prior to starting work. To apply, email resume to careers@whissell.ca or fax to 403.236.8834, Attn: Human Resources. Whissell Contracting Ltd. would like to thank all applicants for their submissions, however, only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies please.

Title: Industrial Sales Consultant, OCI
Job_Description: Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? At Olympus, we help make people’s lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling, every day. We’re currently looking for an Industrial Sales Consultant to join us in the Calgary, Alberta area.  Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.  The Industrial Sales Consultant is responsible for developing a sales strategy for a defined territory, implementing the sales plan, promoting and demonstrating the company’s products and services, with the goal of attaining a sales target. The incumbent will be responsible for knowing the technical features of all of the products within their product line and be able to effectively demonstrate the products to the customer. In addition to technical knowledge, he/she will also be responsible for knowing how to perform and manage the selling process of a technical selling cycle.  Job Duties: As a Industrial Sales Consultant you will be empowered and inspired to do your best work. You will contribute to our mission by providing sales, service and support. A typical day for you will include:  Traveling the majority of the time to meet customer for the purpose of product demonstrations and selling product. Maintaining responsibility for attaining the sales targets and objectives within the sales territory. This is accomplished by completing a sales plan each year, identifying key prospects and customers, and then working and reviewing the sales plan. Meeting the sales target for their territory on all products. Visiting customers to demonstrate product and discuss sales opportunities on a daily basis in the assigned territory. Working closely with others at Olympus to coordinate the overall selling efforts of the company. Completing, working, reviewing, and improving a Sales Plan that includes an action plan for increasing sales to active customers and prospective customers, scheduling full coverage of the territory, maintaining a high level of in-field time, and continually improving product presentation skills and product knowledge. Responding to all customer phone calls and emails in a timely manner. Generating leads for the other Olympus sales representatives. Completing timely quotations to customers working through the sales engineers and support staff. Using the Olympus CRM package for completing daily tasks and management reporting. Timely completion of all periodic sales reports, quotations, calendar events, and opportunity management. Coordinating sales to key accounts with the regional managers, other sales representatives. Following up on all leads provided by Olympus. Prospecting and cold calling to identify new business opportunities. Performing all other essential duties as assigned. Job Requirements: REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  University Degree or equivalent experience in business, marketing, engineering, or non-destructive testing discipline. Minimum of 3 years of proven successful experience in equipment sales. Ability to travel, up to 75%.  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:  Ability to effectively communicate. Ability to effectively communicate with customers the importance of using Olympus products. Ability to give effective presentations to customers. Ability to provide detailed, written reports that effectively communicate the needs of customers. Ability to understand mechanical equipment and concepts so they will be able to understand the application of the product. Knowledge of how to use word processing, spreadsheets, and computer presentation software. Ability to learn technical software applications that are used with the products.  We realize work isn’t just a job to you.  It’s a big part of your life, but not the only part. That’s why we offer competitive salaries, annual bonus program and comprehensive medical benefits, as well as tuition reimbursement, flexible schedules, parental and adoption leave, on-site services and Colleague Affinity Networks — so you can be ready for where life can take you.  Work LocationCanada Field OCI Job Family Sales Auto req ID3680BR Company URL Olympus America Inc About Us At Olympus, we put a lot of good back into the world, and what we do really matters. We are committed to making people’s lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling every day by crafting innovative optical and digital solutions in medical technologies, microscopy, industrial solutions, cameras, and audio recorders. We view our relationship with and commitment to our employees with the same passion. Everything we do at Olympus is a reflection of our vision, and everyone here helps to make it a reality. We’re invested in our employees, great ideas, and how they impact the communities around us. We see the world through multiple lenses and come together to find the right answers; the best solutions. THAT’S OLYMPUS. TRUE TO YOU. TRUE TO SOCIETY. TRUE TO LIFE. Olympus America Inc Olympus embraces diversity and inclusion. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, our policies as well as our values prohibit unlawful discrimination based on an employee's or applicant's race, color, sex, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, genetic information, ancestry, military or veteran status, or any other federal, state or local protected classification. EOE Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled

Title: Designer (EIT), Bridges
Job_Description: Description CALGARY In Canada, more than 8,000 of our people foster innovation every day because we know that our future world will be vastly different from today. Our reach includes environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transport networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources. Through our Future Ready initiative, we bring clarity and vision to some of Canada's most complex challenges and opportunities. The excellence we bring to our work and to work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We’re a Forbes Top Employer in Canada, one of the Corporate Knights' Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned ReNew Canada's Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada’s Top 100 Infrastructure Projects. In 2018, LinkedIn ranked us number 7 on their Top Companies list. At WSP, we see the future more clearly and design for it today - we put innovation, and the highest ethical standards and professionalism at the centre of all we do. Find out what we have to offer. POSITION DESCRIPTION WSP is currently seeking a Designer (EIT) to join our Bridges department, located at our Calgary office. Reporting to the Manager, Bridges, this exciting opportunity will provide you with the opportunity to participate in the delivery of transportation structure projects, including the design of highway, railway, and pedestrian bridges, retaining walls, transit stations, and drainage structures. RESPONSIBILITIES Responsibilities will include design of highway, railway, and pedestrian bridges and design guidance to other team members as well as a wide range of project requirements including but not limited to: Preliminary and detailed design of bridges and other civil structures; Structural inspection and construction field review; Report preparation; Cost estimating; Preparation and review of drawings; Contract specifications / documentation; Contract administration service; Liaison with all discipline members, sub-consultants, clients, and agencies; and Other duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS Undergraduate degree in civil engineering from an accredited university Post-graduate degree would be an asset; 1+ years of demonstrated experience in the area of structural design and bridge engineering with a recognized consulting engineering firm; Should be eligible for professional licensing with APEGA; Experience using AASHTO would be an asset; Seismic designs experience would be an asset; Superior technical understanding, design abilities and current on bridge technologies; Working knowledge of software used for structural analysis in design such as CSiBridge, Midas, SAP, SFrame, etc; Specific areas of expertise required are in the planning, preliminary and detailed design, and construction of bridges of standard and complex geometry, retaining walls and culverts. A thorough knowledge of current design codes (CAN/CSA-S6-14 in particular) and standards is essential; Experience with design of rehabilitation of existing structures; Experience with bridge condition surveys and construction phase structural liaison; and Excellent written and oral communication skills. Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits). To learn more about our firm and the projects we have been involved in, please visit our World of Possibilities microsite. WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted. WSP Canada Inc.      Are you a returning applicant?   Previous Applicants:  Email:  Password:     If you do not remember your password click here. Title: Senior Design Engineer
Job_Description: Job Description: At EXP, we know that great experiences start with the right people. We believe that work should be challenging, and the challenge should be fun. We also believe that exponential possibilities are more likely to occur with a respectful, satisfying and empowering company. We value and respect our employees - their experience and expertise as well as their energy, passion and diversity - and their innovative approach to work and to life. Your Challenge EXP Global Inc. is searching for a Senior Design Engineer to join our Land Development / Infrastructure team in our Calgary, AB office. Reporting to the Discipline Manager, the successful applicant will undertake detailed design work in conjunction with Project Managers for large-scale development projects. Your Responsibilities Lead the design process and provide design oversight for complex Land Development and Infrastructure projects including large scale residential, industrial, and commercial developments in and around Calgary.  Duties will include:  Provide detailed engineering design solutions and input  on the design process for key complex projects, including providing support to Project Managers and other design team members  Write, sign and seal reports/drawings as required Review project designs, specifications, and contract  documents at a Project Manager’s direction  Monitor project schedule and budgets within your area  of responsibility and report status to the senior project manager on a regular basis  Liaise with clients, municipal approving authorities  and contractors, as needed  Pursue the obtaining of all necessary approvals and  permits for projects, including those from municipalities and provincial (Alberta) agencies  Have a strong working knowledge and extensive  experience in AutoCAD Civil 3D  Participate in business development efforts including  writing and pricing proposal efforts, securing new projects/clients, as needed  Coordinate design and field staff required for internal  project teams, including directing, coordinating, and reviewing work done by staff  Ensure health and safety policies are adhered to at all  sites and report to Manager and Joint Health and Safety Committee Members  Job Requirements: The Skills and Knowledge You Bring  Professional Engineer (P.Eng) or eligibility for  license/equivalent  Minimum 10 years of experience in the Land Development  industry, with a focus on large development projects  Brownfield redevelopment experience is an asset Strong detail orientation University Bachelor’s degree in Civil engineering Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal  communication skills  Project Management experience Fully conversant with Microsoft software applications Organized, works well under pressure and able to deal  with situations with tact  A valid driver's license and vehicle is required Demonstrated ability to perform individually or as a  member of project teams  Ability to multi-task is critical, must be able to meet  deadlines What EXP Can Offer With a mission to understand, innovate, partner and deliver, EXP provides engineering, architecture, design and consulting services to the world’s built and natural environments. Our heritage dates back to 1906, when the earliest of EXP’s predecessor companies started its engineering infrastructure practice. Today, over 3,000 creative EXP professionals across North America provide the passion and expertise needed to deliver successful projects around the world. Our promise is to offer you a challenging career in a positive and dynamic work environment, and it's a promise we take seriously. Join a dynamic team at EXP that provides you with innovative projects, the capacity to develop your career, a full range of benefits, flexible working hours, and much more! When you explore what EXP has to offer, you’ll find exponential possibilities. For more information, visit www.exp.com. #LI-AO1

Title: Sr. HV Substation Engineer
Job_Description: Senior engineer position that independently applies advanced engineering techniques and analysis within the discipline. Develops designs that require innovation and ingenuity. Work is performed with minimal supervision and has considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.  Carry out the responsibilities of a Lead Engineer on small to medium sized projects or Area Lead on large sized projects or provide technical support / leadership on a project. Promote workshare execution  Perform studies and develop scope of work and execution of the engineering work  Power system studies using PSS/E, CYME, ETAP, SKM.  Power system modelling experience for the following types of studies:  Load Flow & Short Circuit.  Motor Starting (Synchronous and Induction).  Grounding.  Coordination Studies.  Power Factor Correction.  Harmonic Analysis.  Stability.  Power system modelling using EMTP/ATP or equivalent software for:  TRV.  Switching Surge.  Insulation Coordination.  Pipeline Induction.  Philosophy development, settings development and logic development for high voltage transmission line and substation protection.  Substation Physical Layout/Arrangement.  Coordinate project electrical activities with a utility and other disciplines for their area of responsibility  Develop and maintain electrical project schedule, progress reports and cost estimates. Execute change management proces  Supervise Juniors & Intermediate electrical engineers and designers. Interface with design group to monitor and control project schedule, electrical hours and electrical cost for their area of responsibilites  Ensure consistency and integrity of electrical design throughout project and review design for logic and functionalites  Perform pre-commissioning and start-up activities for electrical systems  Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering required  Minimum of 7-9 years' experience with specifications, engineering, design, construction and start-up for low and medium voltage plant distribution systems with EPC consulting firms for small to large oil & gas related projects or power plant projects is required  Excellent oral and written communication skills required  Experience in motors and VFD design is required  Membership with APEGA or eligible to get membership in APEGA is required  Eligibility for a Professional Engineering certification is required  Advanced MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) preferred  At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.

Title: Senior iOS Developer
Job_Description: At Robots and Pencils, we’re expanding and looking for an iOS Developer to join our talented and world class robot team. What do we mean by world class? You’ll get to work with one of the developers who built udacity, and with former lead engineers from major tech companies like Yahoo, Apple, and Google.  Who you are: You are someone who prefers to communicate through code. You love to create and have a strong desire to learn. In fact, you’re the first to rattle off which WWDC video would help your coworker.  You can speak to language best practices, understand when it’s reasonable to swizzle methods, have a strong understanding of generics and protocol oriented programming, and know the advantages and tradeoffs between closure/blocks and delegates. You’re also diligent about meeting allocated budgets and can work within time constraints, but you will never sacrifice quality.  On top of this, you are comfortable working in cross-functional teams and can share insights and expectations with stakeholders, Clients, team members, and various levels of management.  What you’ll do: Design, program and test software. Author and maintain relevant documentation for developers, Clients, and users. Develop and refine prototypes to confirm requirements. Program according to project plans (versions, sprints). Lead release and post-release activities, such as support, versioning, and maintenance. Collaborate with our pencils (designers) to create interfaces that conform to Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines. Peer review other team members’ code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own code. Support sales and project managers with technical insights, leading to the creation of budgets and schedules for projects.  About Robots and Pencils: Robots and Pencils is a digital innovation agency companies engage to create what's next. Trusted by some of the world's best brands, we help our Clients use mobile, web, and frontier technologies to transform their businesses.  In 2009, we created Robots and Pencils with the then-contrarian view that mobile would be more transformative than the internet. Today, our thinking is rooted in the belief that, in the age of unprecedented technology acceleration, maintaining a competitive advantage requires new strategies and a focus on innovation.  Our approach has been to create a company designed to follow the talent, allowing us to amass an unfair share of hyper-skilled people who call Robots and Pencils home. A team of people who not only develop innovative solutions to transform businesses, but also create products that have been previously inconceivable.  At R&P;, we believe that our products and workplace are better with a diverse team makeup. Our Talent offers a variety of backgrounds, skillsets, and expertise from across the globe. Thank you Recruiters, but we’re not looking for help with this.  Requirements: 8+ years of delivering software with preference given to those who have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent High level of working knowledge with native iOS and/or Mac development using Xcode, Swift, and Objective C High level of working knowledge with a distributed Version Control System Experience with testing and behavior driven development

Title: Senior Consultant (Modern Desktop)
Job_Description: Job Description – Senior Consultant (Modern Desktop)  STRATIFORM  Stratiform Inc. was founded in 2012 and has quickly grown to prominence with a hand-picked team consisting of Architect, Engineer and Developer Subject Matter Experts (SMEs). Stratiform SMEs are known throughout Canada as some of the best in the IT industry, and based on our reputation with customers in the market for delivering excellence across the Microsoft Platform. At Stratiform, we have become one of Microsoft’s go-to cloud partners in Canada.  Key Responsibilities (Senior Consultant):  You will be responsible for performing technical delivery and advisory services. The key focus will be execution of implementation, deployment, and upgrade projects, with a consultative approach aimed at promoting modern technologies in the customer workplace. You will be working with and supporting customers in small, medium, and large environments. The scope of work is extensive, and all candidates must have a broad range of Microsoft functional and technical capabilities and specifically, proficiency with the following technologies: Windows 10, System Center (specifically SCCM), and Application Packaging and Deployment  Provide advice, oversight, and project delivery services Execute requirements gathering and decision guidance workshops Health checks & assessments  Develop IP for all service offerings – templates, best practices, operations runbooks, architecture and design documents, training/knowledge transfer packs  Provide pre-sales technical support and product demos/deep dives for customers  Provide mentorship and internal support to a peer group of consultants  Engage the enthusiast community by participating in technical events and blogging  Contribute to the Stratiform brand  Required Skills & Experience:  4+ years of Windows 10 administration or solid experience in systems development, network operations, software support or I.T. consulting Effective learning skills, works well in a team environment The ability to accurately and effectively communicate both the technical and non-technical aspects of modern desktop technologies and products to a variety of stakeholders within a wide array of presentation settings 4-6 years of experience in a technical consulting or Enterprise technical support environment with demonstrated knowledge supporting: Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10 operating systems and Windows Server 2012 R2 and earlier Microsoft Windows Server Hyper-V Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) Active Directory, Infrastructure Services, Identity Management Microsoft Security concepts DNS, DHCP, TCP/IP, routing, and network security Strong organization, time management, project management and negotiation skills desired Ability to handle customer critical issues and work in difficult situations Desired Skills & Experience:  Experience in Microsoft Management technologies, including Active Directory services, hybrid and modern SCCM strategies, WSUS, InTune, AutoPilot Knowledge of the following would be advantageous: MDT (BDD), PowerShell, OS release branches, repackaging applications and virtualization of OS and applications. Continuous learning mindset – We are seeking people that think differently and are biased toward action to accomplish great things. Expert level of Microsoft enterprise software product offerings Strong Communication Skills (including technical writing) Excellent demonstrated customer service skills Candidates must be able to work independently. Characteristics of importance include but are not limited to customer service, problem solving, communication skills, and the ability to read/interpret the needs/wants of customer executives and leaders.  Physical Requirements:  Office environment with computer work. May have extensive periods of sitting, typing and phone use (may include headset). May need to lift up to 10 lbs.  As a condition of employment, this job is subject to the successful completion of the following Pre-employment conditions: Reference Checks, Criminal Background Checks and a Driver’s Abstract if required for the role.

Title: Field Engineer - Infrastructure
Job_Description: Career Opportunity – Field Engineer – Infrastructure Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, you’ll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. You’ll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. We rank among Canada’s largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If you’re eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). About The Role As a Field Engineer at Graham you will: Assist Project Managers and Estimators in pursuing and securing new work. Take an active role in transitioning new projects from the pursuit phase to the execution phase with the support of the Project Manager and Superintendent. Take on a field-based leadership role during the execution of projects, supporting the Superintendent and Project Manager in any capacity required to ensure that the project’s objectives are successfully achieved. Assist with the development and maintenance of project schedules using P6 software. Assist in the development and monitoring of project budgets and overall project performance. Implement project-specific safety and quality plans and update them as required during the project. Assist the Superintendent in developing workface plans for critical construction tasks. Manage project documentation requirements; proactively address submittals, RFI’s, and other project documentation in order to ensure that construction work can proceed without delay. Assist with surveying and project layout as required; maintain and update red-line drawings. Assist with coordinating subcontractors, vendors, and project support staff. Attend relevant project meetings and liaise with clients and consultants to the extent required. Prepare memos, letters, meeting minutes, subcontracts, and other forms and documents. Assist with estimating and soliciting subcontractors and/or suppliers for information and pricing To be Successful at Graham, you will have the following qualifications and experience: Degree in Engineering or Diploma in Engineering Technology. 2 - 5 years of relevant construction field experience. Willing to relocate and/or travel to projects in various locations throughout Alberta. Experience working at a General Contractor, including construction management knowledge of projects in the water/wastewater and/or transportation sectors. Good communication, problem-solving, organizational and interpersonal skills. Computer literate in Microsoft Office, Primavera P6, and AutoDesk. Compensation and Benefits: Competitive salary with annual bonus potential Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan. Ownership and long term equity opportunities About Us What we can offer you: Strong commitment to safety in the workplace Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. We're Building careers, not filling jobs. View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you. Graham Management Services LP 10840 27th Street SE Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 Fax: 403.570.5190

Title: Business Development Executive
Job_Description: Bilton Welding and Manufacturing Ltd. are currently seeking a Business Development Executive to join our Sales team in Calgary.Key Responsibilities: Make outbound calls to potential and existing customers by telephone or e-mail.Develop, manage, and nurture new business accounts and partnerships to accomplish profit and volume goals.Analyze the effectiveness of sales programs; recommend and implement changes based on findings.Complete proposals that are accurate, thorough, and timely.Ensure targets are met or exceeded in the district.Overcome business and technical objections of prospective customers.Address customer concerns in a professional, productive, and timely manner.Prepare accurate business transactions reports.Prepare and keep Business Development data base current and help with budgets.Work with sales representatives to keep account activities and literature current, accurate, and complete.Attend trade shows as necessaryQualifications: 10 years of direct work experience in the oil and gas industry.Experience in all aspects of sales, including growth strategies, distribution channel management, account development, and business planning.Ability to examine and re-engineer sales operations, form new policies, develop and implement new strategies.Solid negotiation, conflict resolution, and people management skills.Able to build and maintain lasting relationships with corporate departments, key business partners, and customers.Knowledge of cost analysis, fiscal management, and budgeting techniques.Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing.Ability to coordinate and organize meetings, exhibits, and other events.High level of proficiency with Microsoft software packages.Work schedule: Monday to Friday 8:00AM-4:30PM (Some flexibility will be required, based on business demands)We are looking for someone with high energy, creative solutions, and willing to roll up the sleeves to get the job done. Title: Junior Structural (Bridges) Engineer
Company: ISL Engineering and Land Services Ltd
Job_Description: ISL Engineering and Land Services Ltd. is an award-winning full-service consulting firm dedicated to working with all levels of government and the private sector to deliver planning and design solutions for transportation, water, and land projects. Our commitment to client success is built on a strong foundation: we know the communities we serve. This local knowledge, combined with our range of expertise and depth of experience, helps us meet the unique challenges of every project and better understand the role of sustainable solutions in all phases of a project’s life cycle. ISL Engineering and Land Services is proud to be among Canada’s 30 most environmentally-conscious employers as well as a Platinum Level Small and Medium Best Employer in Canada. ISL supports diversity and is an employment equity employer. ISL offers opportunities for career development, an employer paid benefits plan, Group RRSP program and competitive salaries with opportunities for an annual bonus. ISL Engineering and Land Services is seeking a full time Junior Structural Engineer to join our Calgary Bridges team. A strong interest in bridge projects, organizational skills, and good communication skills are a real asset.  Responsibilities: Design of bridge structures and related components including: Superstructure design Substructure and foundation design Retaining wall design Structural analysis and design from the preliminary design phases through to construction; Use of modelling and analysis software (SAP, CSiBridge, MIDAS); Preparation of structural calculations and analysis models (SAP, CSiBridge, MIDAS); Prepare and review mark-ups required for drawing production; Follow and Participate in Engineering Process and Quality Management Procedures; Preparation of tender, specifications and contract documents; Report/proposal writing; Construction field reviews and site audits; Assist with construction administration; Related duties as assigned.  Requirements: Degree in Civil Engineering, structural specialization; Must have experience in prestressed and post-tensioned concrete design; Highly motivated, enthusiastic team player; Able to work independently and as an engaged team member; Excellent verbal and communications skills; Able to organize time to meet various project deadlines. Want to find out more about this or other ISL career opportunities? Visit us online at www.islengineering.com  Department: Structural-Bridges This is a permanent full time position
