Title: User Experience ( Human Factors) Specialist
Job_Description: Company Overview At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible.  Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. Project/Program Overview The General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada User Experience team delivers a safe and user-friendly experience across all hardware and software deliverables, from the simplest devices to the most complex systems. We take an interdisciplinary and iterative approach to development, focused on understanding and meeting human needs. We actively do this through collaboration, frequent prototyping and user engagement.  We currently need a talented Human Factors Engineer to join our UX team in an agile work environment to work alongside other human factors engineers, designers, our engineering community, the customer and the end users to create great product designs for the user.  Responsibilities Typical Duties: Review product and system specifications for HFE content and define requirements and user needs Apply HFE / GUI standards (commercial and military), processes and contractual requirements to the product and system design Create human engineering designs to meet problem space definition Prototyping, identifying and documenting GUI designs and/or the operator interface of products, and/or installation designs Review drawings of equipment or software implementation and provide feedback/direction to the hardware or design team Conduct, facilitate and document user focus group discussions and/or usability evaluations and disseminate the analysis Conduct internal subject matter testing or more formal verification testing to confirm human engineering, user experience or design requirements Present HFE requirements, designs and participate in design review meetings Qualifications Required Skills & Experience: The ideal candidate will have knowledge/skills in one or many of the following topics; software product design, prototyping, usability testing Experience in User Centered Design (UCD),specifically user centered design process, user need definition observational techniques and user trials/fields trials Experience with human factors integration /human system integration in the following areas; understanding of the human factors domain area, operational scenario development, user analysis, functional analysis, task analysis and documenting OMI The ideal candidate may have experience in one or more of the following fields; cognitive ergonomics, ergonomics, human computer interaction, hardware and firmware design, vehicle modeling and simulation, safety and Agile UX programs Education: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Human Factors Engineering, Industrial Design, Kinesiology, Computer Science, Systems Design, Ergonomics, Psychology or related discipline with course work in human factors engineering/ergonomics/human computer interaction. Competencies: The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate the following competencies: Implementation of human factors, and/or human-computer interaction and end user needs into a design Collaborate with others on designs Accountable to projects and team members for on time delivery of work Follows user-centered design practices and procedures Works under supervision Applies own judgement and discretion but ensures peer review Organizes own time to deliver against tasks Understands costs associated with their work Asks questions, checks for understanding, provides explanation clearly and precisely Establishes co-operative relationships Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position.  General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: BIM Coordinator
Job_Description: Thinking about a change? We recognize that the construction industry is changing at a rapid pace and we continually strive to be at the forefront. Our core values empower people to deliver great careers and develop creative solutions for complex problems on some of the most intricate projects. It doesn’t matter what your expertise and craft is – there are no boundaries. We are a group of leading professionals with a variety of expertise: engineers, investment bankers, superintendents, estimators, software engineers, accountants, lawyers, marketing and communications consultants, sustainability professionals, and project managers. As you can see, we are a diverse bunch.  In case you’re curious, here’s what the industry thinks of us and some cool things we have done. You as a BIM Coordinator will: Facilitate and support the virtual design and construction initiatives on site and in the field, with consultants, trades and the project team Facilitate with the start up and implementation of BIM process on a project level with the assistance, guidance and oversight of the Corporate BIM development manager. Coordinate with Project Managers, Construction Managers and Site Superintendents to develop a project specific process for utilizing or creating 3D information for the purpose of estimating, logistics, planning, scheduling, clash detection analysis, RFI’s, coordination, field layout and/or facilitates management. Create project specific protocols, such as BIM Execution Plans, regarding communication and data exchange, nomenclature, format, 3D workspace orientation to ensure interoperability as required. Assist in the creation of project specific contract language for tender packages for 3D submission process and 3D as-builts for facilities management. Is this the right role for you? Educational and Industry experience requirements include; Engineering degree or equivalent combinations of technical training plus extensive experience/knowledge of Design, Manufacturing, Construction & Building Operations. Proficiency with computers especially with BIM software including; Revit, ArchiCAD, Bentley, Navisworks, Digitial Project, ProjectWise, Vico, Tekla Structures, etc Thorough understanding of corporate and industry practices, processes, standards etc. and their impact on project activities is vital. EllisDon is proud to provide this unique career opportunity within a progressive environment with continuous learning and opportunity for growth, as well as a competitive compensation package.  Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it! We are an equal opportunity employer. While only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview, be sure to continually check our website for other related positions as they are posted.  Accommodation for Applicants will be made during the recruitment process when requested.  Apply today at www.ellisdon.com

Title: Intermediate Mechanical Engineer – Job No. MEINT0309
Job_Description: As a Mechanical Engineer at Integrated Sustainability in Calgary Alberta, you will participate in all areas and phases of various sized projects. Reporting to the Manager of Facilities Engineering you will be an integral part of the Engineering team, developing technical solutions in the water, waste and energy fields.  Your mechanical design experience and communication skills will allow you to take a leadership role in a challenging and dynamic team environment.  Integrated Sustainability:  Integrated Sustainability Consultants Ltd. is an innovative leading provider of professional services based out of Calgary that integrates world-class front-end project consulting and delivery teams to execute sustainable Water, Waste and Energy solutions. Our goal is to engage public, industrial, and natural resource sector clients from early project thinking to successfully engineered project delivery completion by an employee owned team who value long-term social and environmentally sustainable solutions.  We are passionate about managing the water lifecycle from source protection and resource management, to water and wastewater treatment and disposal. We strive to find total lifecycle solutions through a risk management approach, while implementing efficient fit-for-purpose engineering design and scientific solutions. To meet these challenges, we have attracted a dynamic, energetic team of professionals who are highly recognized specialists in their field of expertise and love coming to work every day!  We have been recognized as a Top Service Provider (Environmental Consultants) by the Consumer Choice awards in for the last two years, as the 2015 Water Management Company of the Year through the Oil & Gas Awards and the 2014 ATB Small Business of the Year through the Calgary Chamber of Commerce and are committed to employing the best people.  Position Requirements:  Bachelor’s Degree in mechanical engineering from an accredited post secondary institution 5-10 years applicable engineering experience in North American industrial water treatment, oil and gas, mining, or other process industries, including at least 3-5 years in engineering or consulting Registration with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) or equivalent General mechanical engineering experience including rotating equipment, tanks, vessels, pumps and vendor package equipment Excellent English communication skills, and experience in preparing and reviewing technical reports Proven leadership and communication skills, with business development and client communication skills Experience in working in a leadership role within a multi-disciplinary engineering team Thorough understanding of other disciplines’ roles in the design process Ability to work under own initiative to meet deadlines and manage priorities The following experience would be an asset: Water treatment Oil & gas, mining HVAC Site work Materials Engineering Rotation Equipment: low – mid horsepower compression Rotation Equipment: mid – high horsepower pumping including experience with centrifugal and positive pumping displacement Pipeline design and installation experience per CSA & AWWA codes Responsibilities:  Coordinate small to large sized teams and projects with water, waste and energy as central concepts Undertake and oversee detailed data characterization and analysis Complete front end feasibility, preliminary and detailed engineering design in a variety of technical contexts Undertake construction management and system optimization where required to meet clients’ requirements Develop and implement complex science, engineering and field programs Foster critical relationships with clients, technical and non-technical staff, government representatives, and technology suppliers Supervise junior technical and field staff Preparation, selection and approval of mechanical specifications for processing equipment, pressure vessels, piping systems, components, pumps, compressors, heat exchangers and tanks Applying design standards and principles in compliance with all applicable Codes and Specifications such as API, ASME, ANSI, etc. Coordinating with vendors and other engineering disciplines regarding package equipment Establishing cost and schedule for project deliverables Preparing progress reports Works and communicates well in a team oriented setting within a rapidly changing environment and with minimum supervision Interface with other departments as required to develop and implement multi-disciplinary project strategies Assisting in field during construction and commissioning Undertake process lead roles for process & facilities deliverables: Design Basis, PFDs, Material Balance, Process Narratives, P&IDs, Line Lists, Tie-In Lists, Mechanical Equipment Lists, Instrument Datasheets Must be fluent in English and legally able to work in Canada To apply, please fill out the following form. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Resume  Authorized to work in Canada?  Yes  No  Salary Expectations    Need assistance with this form?

Title: Intermediate Geotechnical Engineer
Job_Description: Intermediate Geotechnical Engineer - (18000700) Description  At Golder, we thrive on challenges.  Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.  Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?  Golder has a new opportunity for an Intermediate Geotechnical Engineer to join our team on a full time basis. **This position is based London, Ontario**  An overview of your role will include:   Preparation of technical proposals and reports Mentoring and/or directing junior staff on projects Design, manage, and undertake a wide variety of geotechnical investigation programs, of various scales Assisting in the development of client relationships, business plan development  Managing technical and financial aspects of geotechnical assignments ranging to as much as $20,000     Qualifications  You will have a background in:   University graduate with a degree in Geotechnical, Geological or Civil (Geotechnical) Engineering (Master’s preferred) Currently registered or eligible for registration with PEO A minimum of 5 years of relevant working experience since graduation A sound base in the applicable of Geotechnical Engineering to problem solving Experience in problem-solving with common industry commercial computer software for foundation design, slope stability and finite element/difference analyses Strong interpersonal communication and critical thinking skills Strong written and oral communication skills Experience with solving field construction testing and engineering problems  Your benefits at Golder will include:   Competitive benefits and remuneration packages Option to purchase shares in Golder Employee owned structure - own the business, own the result Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects On the job training, mentoring and coaching Global projects and travel opportunities   One of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 11 consecutive years  Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 40 countries, Golder’s 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.  Golder is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. As such, Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities, upon request.  To learn more about our company and culture click here to view The Promise of Golder video.  Primary Location: CA-AB-CALGARY Schedule: Full-time Employee Status: Regular Travel: Yes, 50 % of the Time Experience (Minimum Yrs.): 5 Job Posting: Apr 24, 2018, 7:12:19 AM

Title: Software Integrations Developer
Job_Description: Are you an experienced software/web developer? Don't miss this opportunity to work on software which is used worldwide on high profile marine projects! Enjoy competitive compensation, full benefits, and bonus program! About the Organization Trusted by shipbuilders, naval architects and marine engineers, SSI develops Autodesk-based solutions for the shipbuilding and offshore industry. With the majority of US naval ships now being built with SSI solutions, and prestigious names in global marine construction increasingly choosing SSI, we are poised for well-managed and sustainable growth.  Based in Victoria, BC with a satellite office in Alabama, we are proud to offer our team an environment that facilitates fascinating and challenging work with a healthy work/life balance. A career with us gives you the opportunity to work on complex and graphically-oriented software that is used on high profile marine projects worldwide. These exciting projects include the recently built Staten Island ferries, as well as a myriad of both international and US defense projects. The ability to see the results of your efforts in the real world is what makes a career with SSI so rewarding.  In 2013, SSI was awarded the VIATec award for Business of the Year in Ocean Products - a true testament to our success within the industry. For more information, please visit our website.  About the Opportunity Currently, SSI is looking for a Software Integrations Developer to join their team in Victoria, BC.  Using your comprehensive knowledge of web services, XML, relational databases, and API design, you will integrate our leading-edge shipbuilding design software with those of our partners while using your communications and organization skills to liaise with the clients and vendors to design and test the integrations.  In order to qualify for this role, you will have a post-secondary education in Computer Science or Engineering with a minimum of 5 years of experience in software and web development, as well as a minimum of 3 years of experience in XML and RESTful web services.  You will also possess:  Knowledge of C# and C++ Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio Familiarity with object-oriented design patterns Knowledge of complex data structures and algorithms Experience with automated testing methodologies Experience with SQL Server (or other relational databases) The following are considered assets:  Experience with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems Experience working with remote teams, spanning multiple time zones Experience working in an Agile Environment (Scrum) Experience with Atlassian Tools (JIRA, Confluence) Experience with Software Versioning and Revision Control Systems (SVN) You will do well in this role if you can work independently but also within a collaborative environment. Sound judgment and decision making skills are essential.  Please note: you must be a Canadian or US citizen and be based in, or willing to relocate to, Victoria, British Columbia, Canada in order to be considered for this role.  If you are a creative, energetic, and dynamic professional who wants to work on complex, graphically oriented software, this could be the role for you!  About the Benefits At SSI, the core of our success lies in the creative, energetic and dedicated people who make up our team. Although the work may be challenging, we foster a fun, flexible and friendly working environment with:  A casual, relaxed work environment Flexible work hours that support a work-life balance Seasonal social events (Friday pub lunches, potlucks, Pi day, Christmas parties, theme days, and more) Weekly onsite yoga classes Paid time off to attend blood donation drives Upon joining SSI, you can expect to receive a competitive annual salary of $60,000 - $75,000 per year depending on skills and experience, plus great employee benefits, including:  ParaMedical, Dental, and Vision Life insurance and long-term disability benefits Profit Sharing Plan Three weeks’ vacation Education assistance, professional development, opportunities for career growth, and training If you enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment and want to take your career to the next level with a local employer of choice – Apply to SSI today For full details and to apply, please visit http://jobs.applyfirst.ca/jobs...

Title: Software Developer
Job_Description: Innova Power Solutions is a Calgary based company that designs and manufactures battery packs and tools for the down hole directional drilling industry. Innova is leading the down hole battery industry through innovation and application of innovative technology.Duties include :Confer with engineers and others to design and to obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfacesModify existing software to correct errors, allow it to adapt to new hardware, or to improve its performanceAnalyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraintsCoordinate software system installation and monitor equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met.Design, develop and modify software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design.Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software EngineeringProficiency in multiple programming languages, preferably - Java - Python - any SQL flavourGit/mercurial experienceSoftware engineering best practices: unit testing, TDD, continuous integration, etcDesired Skills and Experience:Master's degree in Computer ScienceGroovyJavascriptC/C++/C#Experience with OpenERP/Odoo- Postgre SQLLinux development experience- Jenkins CI, Redmine, Sonarqube experienceMath background (Linear algebra, calculus, statistics)Job Type: Full-time

Title: Web Application Software Developer
Job_Description: Job title: Web Application Software DeveloperDepartment: Product DevelopmentLocation: Calgary, CanadaJOB DESCRIPTIONAbout Network InnovationsNetwork Innovations is a leading provider of Satellite & Communications services including VSAT networks, Mobile broadband, Push-to-Talk and Satphone solutions. NI serves clients across the globe in the Government, Media, Energy, Maritime, and Aero markets. With headquarters in Calgary, Canada, we have regional offices across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, and we work with over 200 partners operating globally.Job purposeThis role is responsible for designing, developing, and testing web applications (front and back end) that are available 24/7 with thousands of active users and API sessions. Active participation in defining the services architecture and interfaces is expected, and you will have the opportunity to work with product management and customers to shape our products.These web applications will aid our customers and service partners to easily use, deploy, and manage network services provided by NI.Duties and responsibilitiesDesign, prototype, implement, test, and document full stack (front and back end) web applications, and RESTful APIs.Design for usability with responsive web user interfaces.Design for scalability and reliability (24/7 operations – minimal maintenance down time) with continuous integration.Work with DevOps to deploy and maintain system components into QA and Production environments, and to create tools to quantify performance and reliability.Assist QA in developing automated testsIncorporate security into web services, APIs, and user interfaces.Work with Product Management (and Sales Engineers) to define the product requirements and ensure customer needs are being met.Estimate timelines and provide risk assessments for planning and tracking work. Provide feedback for continuous improvement of processes.Provide Tier-3 support to customers and work with Technical Support to improve their knowledge and tools for troubleshooting.QualificationsRequired Experience & SkillsDegree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent discipline6+ years of full stack application development for always on web applications with global user base, large traffic volume, and multi-national operationsProficient in Java (JEE) technologies including Spring MVC, Struts, Hibernate, RESTful JSON/XML, WebSocketsProficient in responsive user interface development in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript using Angular or Vue.jsFamiliar with SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL), and able to design/modify relational schemas, adapt Stored ProceduresComfortable in cross technology Enterprise Application environment – mostly Java (JEE) on Linux, but some C#/.NETNice to have3+ years with micro services architecture in a continuous integration environmentImplemented Single Sign On and OAUTH mechanismsFamiliar with Docker and Cloud Infrastructure (AWS, Microsoft Azure)Familiar with network management concepts: SNMP, Equipment and Link monitoring, Logical Network Mapping, GeolocationMindsetCustomer focusComplex problem solving: Systems-level approach to softwareCreative, collaborative, and open-mindedStrong communicatorPassion and pride in your workWorking conditionsThis is a full-time position in a professional office environment with flexible work hours. Occasional after-hours work will be necessary to provide tier-3 technical customer support or for a meeting with an overseas team member. Occasional travel is expected (including internationally) for projects or conferences.Job Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Calgary, AB

Title: Cardlock Sales Representative
Job_Description: Our role is to provide top level technical talent to some of the planets strongest companies in the energy and technology industries, as well as the public sector. This is where you come in.  If you are a results oriented and experienced outside sales representative who is capable of maximizing fuel sales within the Canadian market, focusing on Western Canadian, we have an opportunity for you. Our Downtown Calgary Energy client is actively looking for a Cardlock Sales Representative who will be providing fuelling solutions to customers across a diverse range of industries. This position is charged with maximizing sales primarily through Commercial Cardlock facilities, along with bulk plants and direct sales to end users.  A commercial Sales Representative needs to be confident when making calls on head office and field level opportunities while maintaining positive relationships with customers, dealers and operations personnel which is essential to facilitate sales through Cardlock facilities. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are critical along with the ability to interact with individuals with diverse backgrounds.  Specific responsibilities will include: Active solicitation of Cardlock and Fleet in a defined sales territory.  Persistently and successfully follow up on all leads to convert to profitable sales as this role is focused on new account generation and requires a direct selling, hunter mentality.  Develop and execute specific tactical plans that ensure account penetration as well as the achievement of territory sales goals including volume and profit key performance indicators. This includes preparation and execution sales proposals, communications, presentations and other customer correspondence, networking with key decision makers and industry contacts within a designated territory at industry events, 25-30 customer calls/week with a focus account acquisition and growth, while building long term relationships. Implementation of strategies aimed at increasing market share and margins.  Business travel within a territory is a requirement of this role. Approximately 50-75% of time will be spent traveling within a defined territory.  Analyze Sales Reporting generated by Business Resources Group to identify sales opportunities and track industry changes that may create opportunities and or pose threats. Create and execute action plans on identified sales opportunities.  Strategically manage and maintain a portfolio of existing key medium to large accounts achieving a balanced effort on new customer acquisition and incremental sales from existing customers.  Crucial focus on customer relationship management including pricing, problem resolution, cross commodity selling and proactive identification of issues and buying behaviors.  MUST HAVE QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelors Degree in Business or Marketing  A minimum 5 years of relevant professional sales experience in a commercial or industrial capacity  Strong communication, presentations and written skills  Extensive selling, cold calling, and closing techniques with a well-defined sales process  Successful track record in outside sales consistently meeting all sales and profit targets  A background and knowledge in commercial fuel sales, trucking, or industrial supply industries  Working knowledge of the cardlock fuels industry with a network of contacts  Knowledge and familiarity with Customer Relationship Management software in a sales environment including Salesforce  Ability to work independently with strong self-management and problem-solving skills  Experience with financial analysis including margins and revenue along with budgeting and forecasting  Extensive travel is a requirement for the position  NICE TO HAVE QUALIFICATIONS: An MBA would be an asset  Sales related training, education, or professional development  Experience creating and managing sales contracts including terms and conditions as well as exception management  Intermediate Microsoft Skills including excel, word and power point  Desire to be an effective and engaged member of a high performing team  Organization, ingenuity, integrity, and leadership skills  Ability to make decision independently in a fast paced environment  Drives for results setting high standards, taking personal accountability and delivering on commitments  Notes: This position can be based out of either CALGARY or VANCOUVER  Extensive travel is a requirement for the position  Annual base salary + competitive commission structure to be discussed with candidates selected for interview  Mileage allowance of $1000/month; overages are at management discretion for long-haul trips  About the Ian Martin Group: Founded by engineers to support the needs of technical organizations, the Ian Martin Group has been creating authentic connections around meaningful work since 1957. As North America’s most progressive recruitment and project-staffing firm, we specialize in engineering and IT recruiting to help organizations of all sizes hire better. The Ian Martin Group is a certified B Corporation, which means we meet comprehensive standards that measure our impact on employees, suppliers, community, and the environment.  We will review applications as they are received, and we will contact candidates whose skills and experience best suit this role.

Title: Civil Engineer/Technologist
Job_Description: AECOM's Transportation Engineering Group in Calgary is currently seeking a Roadway Designer. Working within the Transportation team, this position is ideal for someone who wants to learn from experienced professionals and have the opportunity to grow a career with a leading design firm.  The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  + Using Civil3D to develop roadways, highways, intersections, transit, utilities and other transportation project designs and 3D design models  + Develop project specific design criteria and verify that applicable codes and engineering standard practices are being met  + Ensure that quality project designs are completed on time and on budget through implementation of quality reviews  + Take direction from Management and Project Managers  + Efficiently work as part of a multi-disciplinary team  + Independently evaluating, selecting, and applying standard engineering techniques, procedures and criteria and using judgement in making minor adaptations and modifications  + Overseeing\\Managing certain aspects of design for roadway projects  + Develop reports, plans, specifications and cost estimates  + Participate in developing project proposals  Minimum Requirements  + Technical or Associate’s degree or equivalent.  + 4+ years of experience of direct transportation engineering design and strong familiarity of Canadian design standards  + Strong proficiency in CIVIL 3D and AutoTURN for roadway design and other design software  + Experience includes transportation project related contract specifications and interdisciplinary coordination  + Strong analytical, verbal and written communication skills  Preferred Qualifications  + Undergraduate Engineering degree or diploma from a recognized post-secondary institution  + 8+ years of direct experience with transportation engineering design and strong familiarity of Canadian design standards  + Proficiency in Civil 3D and AutoTURN  + Proficiency with 3D corridor Modeling using Civil3D  + Design experience with Alberta Transportation, City of Calgary, British Columbia Ministry of Transportation  + Skills in MicroStation/InRoads and other design software are advantageous  + Familiarity with stormwater/utility design, erosion and sediment control design  + Familiarity of Microsoft Office  + Member of Professional Association with either APEGA or ASET  What We Offer  AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E; is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees.  _NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, AECOM will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.

Job_Description: Our Calgary based client is seeking a professional Estimator to join an energetic and dynamic team environment in the Millwork/Commercial Construction industry.Primary Responsibilities: Set up cost monitoring and reporting systemsPrepare estimates for expenses, overheads, labour and/or material costs,Maintain directory of supplies and trade contractorsLiaise, consult and communicate with engineers, architects, owners, contractors and subcontractors on changes and adjustments to cost estimatesQualifications and Credentials: 3 -5 years of Estimating experienceExperience with Architecture; Commercial and/or Industrial ConstructionRead and interpret blueprints, maps, drawings and specificationsCabinetmaker Trade Certification, Gold Seal Membership in the Canadian Construction Association, CADDComputer knowledge of AutoCAD, Take-Off or similar estimating software, spreadsheet, database, and word processing programs.Committed to meeting deadlinesMotivated, self-starter, good organizational and time management skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsJob Types: Full-time, Permanent

Title: SENIOR PROJECT ENGINEER
Job_Description: Do you thrive working in a customer centered team environment? Would you like to work in a dynamic role with lots of learning opportunities? Our client, an energy company, is currently seeking a Senior Project Engineer – Process to join their team on a six month contract. If you are looking for a great opportunity, and this sounds like you, then apply today. Title: Western Canada Account Manager
Job_Description: The ATS Spec is a Marketing and Software company for the Mechanical and Architectural Construction Industry. We create content and systems for all parties in the Mechanical and Architectural design and sales chain including ATS Spec and ATS Project Tracker.ATS is, first and foremost, about delighting our clients and we are deeply committed to providing them with exceptional service. We are recognized for our technical expertise and experience, which we apply to help our clients succeed. We have a strong work ethic and will do all that we can to assist our clients complete their projects efficiently. Our thriving and motivated culture is the heartbeat of our organization and we hope you will become a part of it! We are seeking a highly energetic and aggressive Western Canada Account Manager.Key to our business, the Market Development Team is deeply committed to fostering client relationships and providing exceptional customer service. A huge time savings for our clients, the overall goal is to have the design community in the individual territories actively use our services, and assist designers with generating construction documents by using our online tools. Our team of young, friendly professionals have strong problem-solving abilities and work effectively handling multiple tasks.As our Western Canada Account Manager, you will: Work towards and maintain a high-level understanding of our sponsor’s product offerings;Call on design professionals including mechanical and plumbing engineers in the Western Canada market, to introduce and promote our company’s services;Plan and execute seminars and one-on-one meetings at these design offices to introduce, train or update on our company’s free tools and services;Establish long term relationships with our key clients while identifying new opportunities;Serve as a consultant or a member of the design team to all clients, providing specifications and product recommendations;Track down major projects and the designers on these projects to encourage them use our free services;Coordinate with manufacturer sponsor’s factory representatives to generate specification packages;Work with multi-faceted teams to meet customer requirements, and to provide the most up to date product information to industry professionals;Use Customer Relationship Management systems (CRM) to for reporting, maintaining and expanding customer base;Detail activities, progress, market information, new ideas, expenses and other relevant data as appropriate or as requested.As our Western Canada Account Manager, you must have: A college degree and/or experience in related field;At least 3 years construction industry experience in sales and business development;A good understanding of construction industry practices, products and standards, and the ability to interpret construction documents and specifications;An architectural or design background, and working knowledge of local Building CodesAn outgoing personality with exceptional communication skills, both written, verbal & presentation skills;Professional demeanor and appearance;Flair for polished presentations;Technology and Internet savvy;Mechanically inclined with knowledge of plumbing, hydronic products and systemsWillingness to travel. Title: Geotechnical Engineer
Job_Description: LOCATION: Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) JOB NUMBER: 19401  Job Overview  Reporting to the manager, geotechnical engineering, this person is responsible for the geotechnical aspects of waste dumps, reclamation stockpiles, tailing facilities (dykes), and pitwall structures that are associated with both mining and closure landform applications. You will be responsible for managing geotechnical risks across the site in both operating and closure environments, as well as our tailings facility management system which promotes all aspects of risk reduction and continuous improvement in tailings facility management and dam safety.  Key Accountabilities  Deliver and manage complex engineering designs for dykes, pitwalls and dumps/stockpiles suitable for submission to government for approval Work at various levels of projects from conceptual to detailed design as required for the stage of the project: design, construction, operations, closure and de-licensing Liase with stakeholders including planners, regulatory, projects, operations (mining and tailings), and construction groups to deliver safe, robust and reliable engineering designs. Be part of a team to deliver the project for Suncor’s best interests and problem solve issues that arise in the field Complete projects as a delivery of IFC to stakeholders Manage technical issues and ensure geotechnical integrity through all of the life cycle stages of structures, design, construction, operations, closure, de-licensing Work on technical projects such as weak pre-sheared soils, liquefiable material, fine tailings all within an operating environment. Present projects to external review boards for risk identification Work within the geotechnical group to continually improve our standards, procedures and dam safety programs Mentor junior and intermediate staff in all aspects of geotechnical engineering, communication and project management as it applies Contribute to technical advancement of staff in other groups Work with external technical groups for the advancement of geotechnical and tailings engineering Required Qualifications  Experience and Education  Minimum 10 years relevant engineering experience in large civil earthworks projects, which include, design, construction and operations Experience in the oil and gas or mining environment is strongly preferred Engineering degree in Civil/Geological/Mining engineering, Master’s degree in Geotechnical Engineering considered an asset Presently registered or eligible to register immediately as a Professional Engineer with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) Possess a valid driver’s licence with a clean driving record Skills and Knowledge  Proficient in Microsoft Office suite, AutoCAD and geotechnical modelling software (Geostudio, FLAC, etc.) Effective communicator that is capable of understanding, anticipating and responding to the ongoing needs of mining, tailings and reclamation engineering and operations groups. (ie. strong technical, oral and written communication skills.) Proven project management skills and leadership abilities, including skills in developing and managing the performance of professional engineers, and building effective engineering work processes Well-developed critical thinking, with an ability to apply logic and challenge assumptions, conclusions and make appropriate recommendations You continually seek greater knowledge about the systems, processes and hazards in the workplace, in order to understand not just what you do but why you do it You hold others accountable and expect others to do the same Ability to contribute to a team environment while at times working independently Working Conditions  This is a Calgary based office position Occasional trips to site are required Why Suncor Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including:  Competitive base salary and compensation programs Attractive annual incentive program Flexible benefits package Rewarding pension and savings plans Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed.  Business Overview Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada.  And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels.  As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day.  Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communitities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.  Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news.  Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.  JOB CATEGORY: Engineering

Title: Project Manager - Power Delivery Projects
Job_Description: Current ENMAX employees are encouraged to apply through their internal Workday access.   Posted: May 11, 2018 Closing Date: May 25, 2018 Position Type: Permanent Union: MP (Exempt)  Vision – To be Canada’s leader in the electricity industry.  Mission – We power the potential of people, businesses and communities by safely and responsibly providing electricity and energy services in ways that matter to them today and tomorrow.  Is this challenge for you? Imagine the possibilities.  You will be responsible for managing complex major projects through to successful completion.  Responsibilities: Manage complex distribution, substations, transmission, network, customer driven, and major projects within schedule, cost and regulatory requirements. Coordinate and lead matrixed project teams by setting clear expectations and utilizing resources efficiently. Oversee all project components including scope, cost, schedule, EHS, quality management, change management, and customer satisfaction. Develop and maintain detailed executable project plans and control of critical timelines/milestones. Effectively and accurately report project status, change requests, schedule and finances to internal and external customers. Provide guidance and leadership to project engineers, design engineers, construction managers, project controls, and supply chain management personnel. Manage qualified subcontractors as required to deliver project scopes and adhere to project schedules. Assist with development of capital business cases, budget development, monthly forecasting and variance rationale. Provide support to the management team for implementing process changes and improvements. Accountable for the safe execution of their projects.  Qualifications: Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering 10+ years’ experience with a power utility with directly applicable experience in construction and project management. P.Eng status with The Association of Professionals in Engineering and Geoscientists in Alberta (APEGA). PMP designation or willingness to obtain designation. Hands on experience with heavy industrial design, construction, and project management. Demonstrated ability to deliver projects to cost, schedule, quality, and EHS objectives while also delivering high customer satisfaction. Strong computers skills in MS Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word) Experience using scheduling software (MS Projects, Primavera, Maximo etc…). Experience in project cost control; schedule and critical path analysis would be an asset.  Personal Qualities: Excellent analytical and organizational skills and ability to manage a wide variety of issues and multiple projects. Driven to provide predictability and a high focus on customer satisfaction. Demonstrated excellence in communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively manage project expectations and communicate with team members. Proven, strong leadership, negotiation and conflict resolution skills. Strong team player and ability to work independently. Excellent decision making abilities with sound judgment. Sound knowledge of project management with the ability to meet project objectives.  ENMAX Values – Safety, Integrity, Accountability, Service, Teamwork, Agility, Innovation  If you share our values and would like to make a difference with your career, join the team and see where the ENMAX possibilities can take you.  What We Offer !  We offer competitive compensation including a comprehensive flexible benefits program, non-downtown location that includes great building amenities such as free onsite fitness facility with programming geared to employees needs, onsite child care centre (upon availability, offered from our ENMAX Place location 141 – 50 Ave. SE), free parking and much more.  Location: 141 - 50th Avenue SE, Calgary, AB  Note: ENMAX welcomes all qualified applicants to apply, it is our aim to have a workplace which reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. ENMAX employees are encouraged to pursue professional development opportunities through our internal Learning Centre . Must be legal to work in Canada and requires the successful completion of a criminal background check. Two pieces of valid Government issued ID will be required. Two professional references will be requested. Education requirements for this position will be verified by a third party.   Please visit our careers page to learn more about other opportunities at ENMAX Corporation.

Title: Mechanical Engineer - Building Systems

Duties: As a Mechanical Engineer you will: Perform analysis and design of more complex mechanical systems for various construction projects  Establish parameters for the computer analysis and design software used in modelling the project systems and elementsPerform fundamental engineering calculations to determine systems configuration and capacity Review working drawings and schedules, and make edits, alterations, and/or recommendations as required Liaise with other disciplines and key stakeholders to exchange information, provide project status updates, and coordinate resources Perform site surveys and field reviews to ensure accurate documentation existing and new construction conditions. Liaise with onsite contracting forces, attend construction meetings, and reviews construction claims and quotes Provides direction, guidance, and mentorship to junior staff members Qualifications: The ideal candidate: Possesses excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem solving skills Must be proficient in MS Office Applications and CAD software, including AutoCAD Demonstrates advanced understanding of quality standards relative to mechanical system analysis, and technical familiarity with calculation software and design methodologies, codes, and standards Post-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in Mechanical Engineering Must have 6-9 years of mechanical engineering and design experience Licensed Professional Engineer

Title: Intermediate Geotechnical Specialist
Job_Description: Job Description   We are currently seeking an Intermediate Geotechnical Specialist to join our team in Calgary or Edmonton.  Reporting to the Principal Geotechnical Engineer, the Geotechnical Specialist holds an intermediate technical and business development role in support of a wide variety of projects across our western Canadian offices.  Qualifications: University degree or diploma in a related discipline (i.e. geoscience or civil engineering, etc.); a post-graduate degree would be considered an asset Minimum of 4-6 years relevant experience in a consulting environment; Willing to work extended and irregular hours within western Canada when necessary; Currently registered or eligible to register as a member of APEGA; Ability to work on multiple projects and meet established deadlines; Effective interpersonal skills, a strong client-service focus and the ability to work in a team environment are essential; Strong business development skills; Experience using specialized equipment and software (e.g. Lpile, GRL-WEAP, GeoStudio or equivalent) would be considered an asset; Strong report writing and verbal communication skills in the English language; and Valid driver’s licence with a clean driving abstract.  Experience in the following areas would be an asset: Slope Stability, mitigation design and monitoring Foundation Design Infrastructure design Retaining wall design Mining geotechnical engineering Tailings engineering Materials laboratory testing interpretation Site Investigation- drilling  Job Duties: Acting as the lead resource/project manager for a variety of projects and clients Assist in the development and growth of the Calgary team with a focus on energy and infrastructure developments Support the development of the Environment & Geoscience business by developing relationships with existing and future client contacts, attending meetings, and supporting BD initiatives Preparation and review of proposals Provision of practical and economic solutions to clients Preparation and review of technical reports associated with the project scope of work Ensuring technical quality of work including review of client deliverables (proposals, reports and mapping) Provide guidance, training and direction to junior and intermediate staff to ensure the completion of the project scope of work  Our commitment to excellence extents do our workplace where we offer a flexible work environment, competitive compensation and benefits including a generous RRSP program and an employee Share Ownership Plan, in-house training programs, a strong emphasis on health and safety, support for continuing education and professional development and the opportunity to work with and learn from senior technical experts and professionals.  For more information, please visit our website at www.snclavalin.com While SNC-Lavalin would like to thank all those that apply, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.  Local candidates will be preferred and no relocation package will be offered  “We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.”  Worker Type Employee  Job Type Seasonal (Seasonal)   At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

Title: Account Manager
Job_Description: SUBNET Solutions Inc. is a global software solutions provider for electrical utilities. SUBNET focuses on Making Power Grids More Intelligent®. Founded in 1992, SUBNET is an industry leader providing intelligent solutions that securely connect real time electrical utility field information with utility business systems to enable Smart Grid solutions. Over 200 utilities worldwide rely on SUBNET software to safely manage and monitor thousands of substations. SUBNET is a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner and a Cisco Developer Network Connected Energy Partner. SUBNET has offices located in Calgary, Edmonton, and throughout the United States, South Africa and Australia. Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding career with a dynamic company? SUBNET is growing and is looking for a career driven Account Manager. Job Summary: The SUBNET Account Manager is a strategic member of the sales team who manages the relationships with our key customers and develope new business. This management includes creating the plans necessary to increase SUBNET product adoption with those customers and new businesses as well as ensuring that customer satisfaction is high. The SUBNET Account Manager keeps current with a customer by scheduling regular customer calls, attending the same events that customers are attending, and scheduling periodic visits on-site. Also, they continuously keep current with the industry leads and increase the customer base in their assigned regions. The SUBNET Account Manager coordinates customer activities and information with both the SUBNET services and SUBNET software departments to ensure the communication between SUBNET and the customer is consistent, clear, and in alignment with sales goals. It is expected that a SUBNET Account Manager has a technical understanding of the products SUBNET develops and the solutions they are intended to provide. Much of the customer touch-points are with engineers, and a technical understanding of the product is necessary for effective communication. SUBNET takes a pro-active approach to customer relationship management. We want to make an impact with our customers, not just be visible. Accountabilities & Responsibilities: This position is accountable for: Building and executing a SUBNET account plan that is approved and incorporated into SUBNET’s larger business sales objectives. Understanding technical problems addressed by the products including key regulations, business drivers, evolving business needs, etc. Techncial leadership has been provided for business development including product demonstrations, RFI responses, and sales support for RFP/RFQ responses Translating business and user requirements into accurate system requirements/specification documents, through systems and data analysis, while managing traceability of satisfaction criteria throughout the project delivery. Achieving the goals set forth within the SUBNET account strategy. Own all primary Customer communication and resolve account related escalations regarding SUBNET products. Owernership of aspects of project plans including the creation, performance and customer acceptance Delivering of engineering implementation, installation, commissioning and instruction services This position is responsible for: Use existing sales templates to design Account PPT and Create quotes for products, CCE Program, services, training, ASE Test Sets per the SUBNET standard quote process Managing maintenance of customer data in SUBNET tracking system (CRM) and ensuring that each qualified Opportunity notes are tracked within CRM using established CRM Templates. Assist Account Managers in activities to help execute key customer strategies. Provide internal sales support to the Director of Sales with regard to customer and operational requests. Set up part numbers for re-occurring orders (customer standardization). Coordination and promotion of Training Tours, as well as helping to maintain the Trainers schedule Follow-up on customer product trials and training attendance. Prepare various reports for sales including sales forecasts, CCE License Lists, and other miscellaneous reports as required and attending internal SUBNET Training Cold Calling/lead generation as well as gathering customer needs and conducting lead qualification. Managing the Request for Proposal and/or Request for Information process for assigned accounts Liaise with Customer Services to resolve customer issues Maintaining a high level of expertise in utility communication systems and SUBNET products and solutions Responsible for Overall Sales Performance of accounts in your territory Liaise with other Account Managers to generate new opportunities for SUBNET products and services Participate in the creation of presentations or case studies for presentations at conferences and tradeshows Ownership of aspects of project test plans including the creation, performance and customer acceptance Develop, support and provide effective demonstrations/presentations of SUBNET Products which address clients’ needs and competitive situations. Jointly develop project plans with our customers and SUBNET in order to successfully manage the solutions that exceed our customer’s expectations Contribute to product specifications with emphasis on customer requirements Obtain customer technical information including existing technical architecture, technical requirements, future needs, and existing pain points and creating work back plans for the delivery of product or solution. Work with customers to identify and define project requirements and opportunities. Facilitate case studies and success stories with customers SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE  Experience with SCADA communications, automation, and system integration. Experience with Microsoft desktop, embedded, and network environments. Excellent organization, time management, and interpersonal skills. Understanding of business environments and terminologies. Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions. Detail-oriented with a strong customer service focus. Advanced problem solving skills and the ability to work with innovative solutions. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Excellent presentation skills.  QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE: High school diploma required. Technical competence is an asset (understand software, hardware, networks, etc..). BCOM or related business diploma or degree preferred (or appropriate related experience). Minimum 5 years of strategic sales experience in a business-to business sales environment. Experience doing business in the T&D utilities space an asset. Proven sales track record for exceeding sales targets and quotas. Minimum 3 years’ experience with strategic account planning. The following is considered as asset: Ability to verbally communicate in more than one language Compensation & Benefits: Compensation: Negotiable, Full-time Salaried Benefits: Full benefits including disability, life insurance, medical, dental and vision for employees and their families. Flex days in addition to vacation. Education reimbursement program. Employee Personal Spending Account. Employee/Employer Matching GRSP/401K Program How to Apply: By email: jobs@SUBNET.com

Title: Strategic Account Manager - Calgary, AB
Job_Description: PROFILE As part of the Javelin Western Canada Sales Team and reporting to the Western Canada Sales Manager, this role is responsible for developing, maintaining and growing client relationships and ensuring customers and prospects fully understand the value of SOLIDWORKS and other Javelin solutions. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES  50% direct sales to existing customers in an assigned territory and 50% net new business Initiate sales activities to inspire, educate and develop account relationships for SOLIDWORKS suite of products and Javelin's solutions Provide territory management data: forecasts, account management documentation, and activity reports to management providing the basis for sales planning Identify, evaluate and respond to key business issues of the account and develop, present and demonstrate SOLIDWORKS and Javelin's capabilities to the potential customer Introduce and integrate our technical team as well as SOLIDWORKS and Solution Partner resources to the customer to demonstrate capabilities With the assistance of Application Engineers, develop, deliver and lead professional technology proposals A SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL POSSESS THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA: 3-5 years of experience in Software Sales or Technology Solution sales University or college degree preferred but experience and results achievement considered equal Consistent track record of successful business to business software or professional services sales Demonstrable professional sales skills and solid references Excellent communication and presentation skills Effective time management and organizational abilities Experience selling SOLIDWORKS or competitive products an asset but not required An innovative and 'make it happen' attitude Capable of appreciating and meeting aggressive sales goals Experience with a CRM system, preferably NetSuite Experience with CAD preferred but not required Must have a reliable means of transportation and a valid Driver's license Travel to the United States of America may be required occasionally

Title: Desktop Product Manager
Company: Leica Geosystems AG - Part of Hexagon
Job_Description: Leica Geosystems and MicroSurvey Software is looking for several new members to join our expanding development team in Kelowna, BC. We build office and mobile software solutions for Land Surveyors, Civil Engineers, Mapping Professionals, Police Officers, and Accident Reconstruction Specialists.  The Desktop Product Manager is responsible for integrating new ideas, technology and customer requirements to existing product lines. To understand the market and identify high value product features and functionality plus identify new product line opportunities. Gaining and maintaining an understanding of key market segment demographics and provide a customer driven innovative perspective on product development. The Desktop Product Manager will be responsible for the product planning and execution throughout the product lifecycle. To work collaboratively with other company departments to develop and bring products to market in a cost efficient manner. To work with sales to develop effective distribution channels for the products. The product manager takes a lead role in competitive analysis, product positioning and pricing to achieve company financial goals.  Responsibilities and Duties Gain a deep understanding of customer experience, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas that grow market share, improve customer experience and drive growth. Determines customers' needs and desires by specifying the research needed to obtain market information. Assesses market competition by comparing the company's product to competitors' products. Create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners. Brings new Desktop Products to market by analyzing proposed product requirements, product development programs and preparing financial analyses. Translate product strategy into detailed customer stories and product requirements. Work closely with engineering teams to develop cost estimates and schedules to deliver a product to market quickly with optimal resource utilization. Responsible for managing the Desktop Product roadmap and prioritizing activities based on business opportunity and customer impact. Manage development priorities and maintain priority lists in a software development project management system. Develop product pricing, positioning and channel distribution strategies. Drive Desktop Product launches including working with public relations, executives, and other product management team members. Direct maintenance activities for product versions, part numbers and product documentation. Contribute to the creation of a Desktop Product business plan that is based on the market analysis and defines the multi-generation market requirements for the product. This includes factors such as product features, product positioning, promotion, distribution and support as well as the market share, revenue and financial targets. Act as a product evangelist to build awareness and understanding. Represent the company by visiting customers to solicit feedback on company products and services and conducting product demonstrations. Qualifications and Skills 2+ years of product development experience desired. Those without prior product development experience may still apply as training may be provided for the right candidate. 2+ years geospatial product and market experience Intermediate to advanced working knowledge of industry standard geospatial products such as CAD, data collection, least squares, GIS and other market or segment related products is required. Bachelor’s Degree, Engineering Degree or Technology Diploma in a geospatial or related science or discipline Demonstrated successful experience working in a hands-on, fast-paced, creative, entrepreneurial environment, in a cross-functional capacity. Strong interpersonal, leadership and product management skills and the ability to work with diverse teams in multiple locations. Ability to travel within the Canada, USA and internationally occasionally.

Title: Mechanical Designer II
Job_Description: Successful candidate will work in a dynamic team on the design of mechanical building services. The successful candidate should have the capability to work in a fast paced environment, with the ability to communicate and interact directly with other disciplines (architects, electrical/structural engineers, etc.). The projects will be based primarily on commercial building design.  -  Design of mechanical systems (HVAC, plumbing, fire protection, and controls) in commercial buildings.  -  Develop construction documents (plans, details, schematics) in AutoCAD, and in some cases Revit.  -  Review of all project specifications.  -  Coordinate with other disciplines for information related to the area of responsibility.  -  Perform detailed calculations in sizing and selection of HVAC equipment.  -  Assist senior engineer/designer in carrying out technical tasks.  Qualifications  -  Minimum of 5 years of working in a consulting firm.  -  Minimum of 5 years of Canadian experience.  -  Minimum of 5 years working experience with Alberta Building Code, Alberta Fire Code, National Plumbing Code, and other applicable building codes and standards.  -  Knowledge of ASHRAE and SMACNA standards.  -  Minimum of 5 years working experience with mechanical building systems, and designing building services within the commercial building sector.  -  Minimum of 5 years working experience with heating water, chilled water, refrigeration, and plumbing systems in a plant environment.  -  Project track record of design for HVAC, Plumbing, Fire Protection, and Building Automation Systems design for small to medium size projects.  -  Proficiency with AutoCAD.  -  Experience in using Trane Trace or similar software for load calculations.  -  Experience with Revit would be considered an asset.  -  Demonstrated experience or track record of managing multiple projects and working in a fast paced environment while being able to work independently.  -  Demonstrated ability to resolve technical problems during the full project lifecycle.  -  Proficient with computers and standard office software applications.  -  Excellent communication and inter-personal skills.  -  Energetic personality, team player, committed to excellence, focus on quality and detail-oriented.

Title: Mechanical Designer – Air Coolers
Job_Description: Exchanger Industries is a leading designer and manufacturer of custom heat transfer equipment for the global oil, natural gas, and petrochemical industries world-wide. Since our incorporation in 1961, we have grown extensively, to be recognized as a world leader in thermal heat transfer technology, and one of the largest manufacturers of heat exchangers in Canada.Are you a design drafter with experience designing Air Coolers? Are you looking to “design” your future? Are you an expert in Autodesk Inventor 3D-CAD? If so, we want you and your energy to join our team!Scope: Reporting to the Drafting Design Manager, the incumbent of this position will play a key role on the mechanical design & drafting team, leveraging 3D-CAD and ASME standards to model and prepare detail design drawings for a global supply chain and in-house manufacturing. The incumbent of this position must be technically flexible, a quick learner, and able to deliver a high degree of work quality which consistently meets and exceeds customer expectations.Primary models and detail drawings of Shell & Tube, and Air Cooled heat exchangers;Generate manufacturing drawings for client / regulatory review and fabrication ensuring that all drawings and materials are in accordance with code and internal standards;Complete quality assurance checks of other mechanical designers and assist with training, guiding, and helping other designers newer to 3D-CAD;Manage revision controlled documentation and drawings using Autodesk Vault data management software;Working closely with other engineers, drafting personnel, and project managers in a team environment to make sure all project deadlines and targets are met.Contribute to other project process improvementsCollaborate with project team members on creation of both technical and process documents to further enhance communication and development of 3D design and drafting.*Desired Skills and Experience: 5+ years’ experience in 3D CAD mechanical design using Autodesk Inventor;Experience with Solid Works is an advantage;Proven track record working in a fast paced, deadline driven project environment;Able to work cross functionally within project teams to ensure deliverables are being met according to project schedule and client requirements;Experience with Autodesk Inventor iLogic/API a strong asset;Experience reading and interpreting regulatory codes and customer standards, exposure to ASME section VIII is considered an asset;Experience and understanding of indented bill of materials as they relate to the manufacturing order of operations;Excellent analytical and problem solving skills,
