Title: Sr. Technical Support Engineer - Robotics Manufacturing Auto...
Job_Description: Senior Technical Support Engineer – Robotics Manufacturing AutomationAbout YouYou want to work for a fast-paced company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You have a strong sense of personal ownership and responsibility for completion of objectives on time. You want to figure out why things tick which makes you tick but very little ticks you off. You want to think outside of the box and continually challenge your own limits, as well as those around you. You have a mad scientist mentality where you want to be part of the robots building robots revolution.About ATTAboticsATTAbotics provides a robotic warehousing and fulfillment system that has is being noticed by industry experts including some of the top global automation companies in the world. ATTAbotics has a very disruptive technology that has the potential to redefine the eCommerce and warehousing fulfillment market. ATTAbotics has taken a different perspective on the technology. Instead of developing technology to speed the human workload, ATTAbotics is creating a robotic centric storage and retrieval system. A goods to person system that can be deployed in an extremely small space, for a lower entry level cost, providing industry leading throughput.Who you are and what we need: Experience asking clients targeted questions to quickly understand the root of the problemTalk clients through a series of actions, either via phone, email or chat, until they’ve solved a technical issueProperly escalate unresolved issues to appropriate internal teamsPrioritize and manage several open issues at one timeFollow up with clients to ensure their systems are fully functional after troubleshootingPrepare accurate and timely reportsDocument technical knowledge in the form of notes and manuals5+ years of experience as a Technical Support Engineer (both hardware and software), Desktop Support Engineer, IT Help Desk Technician or similar roleHands-on experience with Windows/Linux/Mac OS environmentsSolid understanding of computer systems, mobile devices and other tech productsAbility to diagnose and troubleshoot advanced technical issuesFamiliarity with remote desktop applications and help desk application (e.g. Salesforce Service Cloud)Excellent problem-solving and communication skillsAbility to provide step-by-step technical help, both written and verbalBS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant fieldAdditional certification in Microsoft, Linux, Cisco or similar technologies is a plusIf this description describes you perfectly and the work environment you know you can thrive in, send us your resume as well as describe to us what you’re passionate about and we may just reach out to you.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Technical Support: 10 yearsEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Calgary, AB

Title: Assistant Professor, Micro/Nano Systems Fabrication and Inte...
Job_Description: Position Description The Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE) in the Schulich School of Engineering at the University of Calgary is pleased to invite applications for a tenure-track position at the rank of Assistant Professor in the area of Micro/Nano Systems Fabrication and Integration with an anticipated start date of September 1, 2018. Position Description Applicants must have a doctoral degree, or will have earned a doctoral degree by the anticipated start date, in Electrical Engineering or in a closely related discipline. Applicants must demonstrate potential for excellence in Micro/Nano systems research within the University of Calgary strategic research areas. The successful candidate must have demonstrated experimental research and hands-on fabrication experience in at least one of the following: Biomedical microsystems engineering, Electrical bio-systems, Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS), Bio-MEMS, and/or Radio Frequency-MEMS Micro-sensors and micro-sensor fabrication. Relevant professional experience with industry will be considered an asset. The successful candidate will be expected to establish and lead an externally funded research program and supervise graduate students, develop an independent experimental research program in his/her area of expertise, leverage the capabilities of the Schulich School of Engineering clean-room facility (https://schulich.ucalgary.ca/research/facilities-and-centres/microsystems-hub) for his/her research, and, with time, assume responsibility for directing the facility by representing and promoting it nationally and internationally and interfacing with industrial partners. Applicants must also demonstrate potential for excellence in teaching. The successful applicant will be expected to teach at both the undergraduate and graduate levels. He or she will be expected to develop a graduate level course in his/her area of expertise to complement the offerings of the Department. In addition to the research and teaching responsibilities, the successful individual will participate in professional and university service. Applicants must be registered (or be eligible for registration) as a Professional Engineer with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) within two years of initial appointment. Applications are encouraged as soon as possible, but will be accepted until June 8, 2018. Interested individuals are requested to submit a detailed curriculum vitae, vision statement for leveraging Microsystems hub capabilities (maximum one page), statement of research interests (maximum two pages), statement of teaching focus and philosophy (maximum two pages), copies of all academic transcripts, and the name and contact information of at least three referees to: Dr. Abraham Fapojuwo, Chair, Hiring Committee Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering Schulich School of Engineering Applications should be sent via email to Heather Hanley (heather.hanley@ucalgary.ca). Salary is competitive and will be determined according to the successful applicant's accomplishments, experience, and qualifications. About the Department The Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering offers BSc degrees in Electrical and Software Engineering. The Department also offers MEng, MSc, and PhD degrees in Electrical, Computer and Software Engineering with specializations in software engineering, energy and environment, environmental engineering, and energy and environmental systems. The Department is home to 600 undergraduate students, approximately 200 graduate students, and 42 faculty members including 6 research chairs. The Department is a research leader in a variety of areas including power- and energy-control systems, radio systems, telecommunications and wireless technologies, micro/nano technology systems, bioelectricity, biomedical instrumentations and image processing, and software engineering. The successful applicant is expected to work collaboratively with existing faculty members having mutual research interests on finding practical solutions to real-world problems. The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their academic and professional success while they are here. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority. In this connection, at the time of your application, please answer the following question: Are you a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident of Canada? (Yes/No) Additional Information To learn more about academic opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our Academic Careers website. For more information about the Faculty of Science visit Careers in the Faculty of Science. About the University of Calgary  The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca.  About Calgary, Alberta Calgary is one of the world's cleanest cities and has been named one of the world's most livable cities for years. Calgary is a city of leaders - in business, community, philanthropy and volunteerism. Calgarians benefit from a growing number of world-class dining and cultural events and enjoy more days of sunshine per year than any other major Canadian city. Calgary is less than an hour's drive from the majestic Rocky Mountains and boasts the most extensive urban pathway and bikeway network in North America.

Title: Rentals Maintenance Technician
Job_Description: As the leading integrated energy services company, Shawcor is responsible for protecting the integrity of operational assets across the world.  Succeeding in our current markets and pursuing our growth vision is made possible by our people. In addition to intelligence, dedication and professionalism, we look for individuals who embody our values. These include integrity, execution and technology, with a foundation of accountability, respect and doing the right thing.  Integrity is the foundation on which we were built. And it’s not just in how we operate—it’s behind every product we engineer. Its part of every new project we take on. And it’s the promise that we give our customers.  At Shawcor, we have built a true team environment where all employees are empowered to contribute to the success of the company. The Composite Production Systems business unit offers several types of corrosion-resistant, flexible composite linepipes for different applications based on our customers’ needs. In fact, our composite linepipe has a service life of 20 years, with no need for expensive maintenance and long-term chemical inhibitor programs. We want you to join our team! Summary: The Rentals Maintenance Technician is responsible for carrying out maintenance, service and modifications to rental assets in accordance to company and manufactures policies ensuring that the maintenance programs in effect are followed along with proper documentation. Primary responsibilities will include servicing and maintaining rental equipment and completing maintenance logs with a commitment to the culture of customer service. Field fitting installations and Solution center coverage when required which will include loading trucks and general cleaning. Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to, input and tracking data entry of raw and finished materials in the WMS, using software programs such as IFS and Microsoft Office. Strong multi-tasking skills and an excellent awareness to detail are integral in this position. A high level of initiative, diligence, organization, and thoroughness is also required.  Responsibilities:   Ensure that all assigned maintenance activities are performed in accordance to the maintenance program and that maintenance schedules are met with work of high quality and accuracy. Inspect, maintain, service and test rental equipment Perform incoming/outgoing inspections on complete kits Complete all necessary documentation (paperwork, logs, tags, etc.) to allow for tracking of all repairs, concerns and costs Suggest improvements and modifications to increase equipment efficiencies and life span To work with safety as a top priority to eliminate accidents and incidents Apply excellent housekeeping practices Field Services installations of fittings with a high quality and accuracy  Solution center coverage  Knowledge:  3-5 years of experience Education: High School  Understanding of maintenance / operations as it relates to the safe and efficient operation of small engines Small engine and hydraulics knowledge and experience Strong initiative and ability to work independently with minimal supervision  Computer experience in Windows, Microsoft Office and ERP systems Demonstrated problem solving, trouble shooting and analytical skills  Clean Driver’s Abstract   We thank all applicants for their interest; however we cannot accept telephone calls regarding this position. All recruiting activities are managed via our applicant tracking system. Please apply online to be considered for this opportunity.  Shawcor welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. To begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout our recruitment process, please contact our HR team at accessibility@shawcor.com.

Title: ANT+ Applications Engineer 2
Job_Description: At Garmin Cochrane, we create more than just products – we inspire solutions and innovations that change and shape how we live, work and play. You’ll get to work alongside top talent and partners in the cycling, running, and sport and fitness industry from around the globe. You’ll enable compelling ecosystems such as ANT+ with the ANT 2.4 GHz ultra-low power wireless protocol, work on cutting-edge technology projects like optical heart-rate sensing, and sport and fitness products such as Vivoactive, Vector, and Varia.  Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, we’re located just 15 minutes outside of Calgary in Cochrane, Alberta. A retreat from fast-paced cities – Cochrane allows us to build relationships with the community and focus on what we do best – creating innovative solutions for unique use-cases in the ultra-low power wireless and sport industries. With many other tech companies calling Cochrane home, we can’t think of a better place to be!  Here’s why you want to work for us.  You’ll bring products to life. Become a key contributor to our exciting portfolio of Garmin products and ecosystems, and help us bring sport and fitness devices and standards from concept to market.  You’ll love our office culture. Company BBQs, active sports, casual dress, volunteer opportunities and the occasional sneak peak of new release movies (Star Wars, anyone?) allows team members to get to know each other outside the office.  You’ll receive fantastic benefits. Opportunities for professional development, no waiting period for vacation or our extensive benefit plan, RRSP matching, stock purchase options, product discounts and flexible work schedules are available for all team members.  Here’s what we’re looking for from you A passion for programming in C/C++/C#, you have a strong understanding of how the languages work and can use them to get the results you want on existing software. Experience and aptitude in requirements gathering and analysis with customers and partners Strong communicator who enjoys talking to people Excellent organizational skills Experience creating and documenting design specifications and bringing those designs to life Experience/interest in working with the ANT Wireless Protocol and other wireless technologies BSc Degree in Computer Science, Software/Electrical/Computer/Aerospace Engineering, Math, Physics or similar technical field of study with a 3.0 cumulative GPA, or equivalent practical experience Proficiency in C/C++, C#; Python experience is a bonus.  Desirable Qualifications: Experience developing software for Windows; familiarity with object-oriented design Experience developing embedded software for microcontrollers in small electronic devices A keen interest in fitness, cycling, running, health and wellness Interest in and ability to learn other programming languages as needed Proven ability to develop innovative and creative solutions to complex problems Familiarity with ANT/ANT+

Title: Senior Front-End Developer
Job_Description: About The Uncomplicated FamilyThe Uncomplicated Family (TUF) is a progressive health innovation company and passionate team who embrace commitment, innovation and compassion to enhance the quality of life for individuals, families and communities who are affected by disabilities. Our teams include: Speech-Language Pathologists, Occupational Therapists, Physiotherapists, Family Support Personnel, Software Developers and Engineers, Researchers, and Psychologists. The Uncomplicated Family Corporate Group includes Kids Uncomplicated Inc. (Clinical and Family Support Services) and Communities Uncomplicated Inc. (Software Development: Teleroo™ Technology).Teleroo™ is an award-winning group of technologies that has resulted in remarkable outcomes for children, families, and practitioners. Teleroo™ breaks down conventional barriers such as location, time constraints and budget to increase access to quality interventions to assist in service provision. Our technologies include a robust video-based platform for team collaboration, along with iOS therapy tool apps. The Teleroo™ Gateway platform was recently relaunched in collaboration with QoC Health. The successful candidate will work exclusively on Teleroo™ Technology with the Uncomplicated Family and QoC teams operating out of The Uncomplicated Family headquarters inCalgary, Alberta.About QoC HealthQoC Health is a diverse healthcare company that offers platform technology to design and build engagement-focused solutions leveraging new service delivery models. QoC focuses on connecting patients into circles of care and making it easier for healthcare organizations to get connected with their patients. Our engagement platform allows for perfect fit tools and solutions designed to integrate across a wide range of healthcare areas. From Wound Care to Aging Well and everything in between, our technologies help shift care to the community and keep patients out of hospital.The TUF/QoC CultureA passionate, cross-disciplinary team of technologists, healthcare professionals, and researchers, the TUF/QoC team loves what they do, and strives to achieve great things everyday. Motivated, genuine, and fun, the team is driven by innovation, challenging the status quo, with a focus toward the future. As part of the team you will have opportunities to bring solutions to some of our toughest client care challenges, across a diverse range of clients from around the globe, with opportunities to learn and grow from every project. We’re driven to improve care for everyone, help us shape the future!Role DescriptionWe are looking for a motivated Sr. Front-end Developer with strong front end, JavaScript, UI/UX experience who has worked with a range of frameworks to join our team. This is a full-time position based out ofCalgarywhere you will work with the development team, project managers and designers to build and customize robust frontend applications and libraries for our existing engagement platform and API’s. This is truly a leadership role, with excellent opportunity for ownership of an important and expanding aspect of the business.ResponsibilitiesAs a Senior Front-end Developer you will be responsible for architecting, building and optimizing reusable front end HTML5 / JavaScript / Java libraries, API’s, UI Modules, UI Widgets, and SDK’s to accelerate building robust web applications based on our engagement platform.In addition, you will:Participate in the discovery, design and specification of apps.Translate functional requirements into effective and intuitive applications.Build and customize front-end web applications using JavaScript and HTML5 based apps.Lead, train, and mentor new developers that join the team.Participate in the development and architecture planning for our engagement platform, providing insight and guidance on improvements to better support application development.Required Skills5+ years of professional software development experience3+ years experience developing front-end web applications in JavaScript3+ years experience with JavaScript, jQuery, TypeScriptExperience with web technologies (HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery , CSS3, SASS)Experience building responsive web applicationsAbility to translate functional requirements into effective and intuitive responsive web applicationsRESTful web service integration experienceExperience working with 3rd party data sources and API’sExperience with Analytics and VisualizationWorking knowledge of source code management tools (Git, GitHub)Ability and desire to write self-explanatory and reusable codeExcellent problem solving skills and loves technical challengesAttention to detail and a passion for qualityExcellent communication and creative problem solving skillsNice to Have SkillsExperience with encryption methodologies (SHA256, BCrypt, PBKDF2)Working knowledge of HL7Working knowledge of build management tools (Maven, Gradle)Working knowledge of Health Care related privacy policies, including PHIPA and HIPAAExperience with live/on demand Video Streaming (TokBox, WebRTC, Vidyo, Wowza)Experience with messaging service providers (Twilio)Work Arrangement: Position Type: Full-Time, RegularHours of work: 37.5 hours per weekStart Date: When a suitable candidate is foundCompensation: Competitive and will be discussed during the interview processBenefits: Three weeks of paid vacation; paid sick/personal time; benefits package includes Health, Dental, Vision, and Employee Family Assistance Plan coverage.If you are interested in this rewarding and exciting opportunity, please respond to this ad with your cover letter and resume.This posting will remain open until a suitable candidate is found and only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Thank you for your interest.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Software Developer
Job_Description: Innova Power Solutions is a Calgary based company that designs and manufactures battery packs and tools for the down hole directional drilling industry. Innova is leading the down hole battery industry through innovation and application of innovative technology.Duties include :Confer with engineers and others to design and to obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfacesModify existing software to correct errors, allow it to adapt to new hardware, or to improve its performanceAnalyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraintsCoordinate software system installation and monitor equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met.Design, develop and modify software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design.Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software EngineeringProficiency in multiple programming languages, preferably - Java - Python - any SQL flavourGit/mercurial experienceSoftware engineering best practices: unit testing, TDD, continuous integration, etcDesired Skills and Experience:Master's degree in Computer ScienceGroovyJavascriptC/C++/C#Experience with OpenERP/Odoo- Postgre SQLLinux development experience- Jenkins CI, Redmine, Sonarqube experienceMath background (Linear algebra, calculus, statistics)Job Type: Full-time

Title: Web Application Software Developer
Job_Description: Job title: Web Application Software DeveloperDepartment: Product DevelopmentLocation: Calgary, CanadaJOB DESCRIPTIONAbout Network InnovationsNetwork Innovations is a leading provider of Satellite & Communications services including VSAT networks, Mobile broadband, Push-to-Talk and Satphone solutions. NI serves clients across the globe in the Government, Media, Energy, Maritime, and Aero markets. With headquarters in Calgary, Canada, we have regional offices across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, and we work with over 200 partners operating globally.Job purposeThis role is responsible for designing, developing, and testing web applications (front and back end) that are available 24/7 with thousands of active users and API sessions. Active participation in defining the services architecture and interfaces is expected, and you will have the opportunity to work with product management and customers to shape our products.These web applications will aid our customers and service partners to easily use, deploy, and manage network services provided by NI.Duties and responsibilitiesDesign, prototype, implement, test, and document full stack (front and back end) web applications, and RESTful APIs.Design for usability with responsive web user interfaces.Design for scalability and reliability (24/7 operations – minimal maintenance down time) with continuous integration.Work with DevOps to deploy and maintain system components into QA and Production environments, and to create tools to quantify performance and reliability.Assist QA in developing automated testsIncorporate security into web services, APIs, and user interfaces.Work with Product Management (and Sales Engineers) to define the product requirements and ensure customer needs are being met.Estimate timelines and provide risk assessments for planning and tracking work. Provide feedback for continuous improvement of processes.Provide Tier-3 support to customers and work with Technical Support to improve their knowledge and tools for troubleshooting.QualificationsRequired Experience & SkillsDegree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent discipline6+ years of full stack application development for always on web applications with global user base, large traffic volume, and multi-national operationsProficient in Java (JEE) technologies including Spring MVC, Struts, Hibernate, RESTful JSON/XML, WebSocketsProficient in responsive user interface development in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript using Angular or Vue.jsFamiliar with SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL), and able to design/modify relational schemas, adapt Stored ProceduresComfortable in cross technology Enterprise Application environment – mostly Java (JEE) on Linux, but some C#/.NETNice to have3+ years with micro services architecture in a continuous integration environmentImplemented Single Sign On and OAUTH mechanismsFamiliar with Docker and Cloud Infrastructure (AWS, Microsoft Azure)Familiar with network management concepts: SNMP, Equipment and Link monitoring, Logical Network Mapping, GeolocationMindsetCustomer focusComplex problem solving: Systems-level approach to softwareCreative, collaborative, and open-mindedStrong communicatorPassion and pride in your workWorking conditionsThis is a full-time position in a professional office environment with flexible work hours. Occasional after-hours work will be necessary to provide tier-3 technical customer support or for a meeting with an overseas team member. Occasional travel is expected (including internationally) for projects or conferences.Job Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Calgary, AB

Title: Civil Engineer - Senior Level
Job_Description: Barr is seeking an engineer with demonstrated experience leading, managing, and mentoring multi-discipline project teams. Project assignments may include the following: leading, managing, and executing work on public and private infrastructure projects; leading project teams in planning and/or designing major engineering projects; preparing and making presentations to clients and potential clients; successfully leading, managing, and delivering projects on time and on budget; leading the work of the project team including engineers, drafters, and designers; and coordinating with other disciplines. The position also includes planning and executing business development efforts. Typical business development activities include building and maintaining client relationships, tracking marketing leads and project opportunities, developing and presenting proposals and presentations, and networking and sharing Barr’s capabilities with existing and potential clients. The work may at times involve short-term out-of-town assignments. NOTE: Applicants must be able to work in locations that feature rough terrain typical of construction sites and facilities that have limited accessibility, moving machinery, and other conditions typical of industrial facilities. Assignments may involve work on waste disposal sites and sites requiring cleanup of hazardous materials. A physical exam may be required; safety training will be provided.  Minimum Qualifications BS in Civil Engineering or related degree 10 or more years of relevant work experience Professional member of the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) or ability to obtain membership within one year Flexible working style, self-initiative, self-motivation, and a willingness to work with teams to meet clients' needs and project schedules Demonstrated experience meeting timelines and achieving project expectations Demonstrated client relationship development skills Conscientiousness concerning the accuracy, appropriateness, and timeliness of results Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills Demonstrated technical project leadership, management, and organizational skills Legal authorization to work in Canada without the need for sponsorship Legal authorization to work in the U.S. without the need for sponsorship Acceptable driving record   Preferred Qualifications 15 or more years of relevant work experience Alberta public infrastructure or transportation related work experience Mining infrastructure related work experience Demonstrated project leadership and management experience on multi-discipline project teams Demonstrated strong business-development skills Engineering consulting or related experience M.S. in Civil Engineering or closely-related discipline Familiarity with AutoCAD and Civil 3D or other CADD-based civil design software Knowledge and experience in related disciplines such as Geotechnical or Structural Engineering   Barr Engineering and Environmental Science Canada, Ltd. reserves the right to consider other legitimate, non-discriminatory factors that are not specifically listed. Title: Geotechnical Engineer - Senior Level
Job_Description: Barr is seeking an engineer with demonstrated experience leading, managing, and mentoring multi-discipline project teams as a practice builder. This position provides the opportunity to build a practice around a core team to work on a variety of consulting projects involving traditional geotechnical engineering designs such as shallow and deep foundations; slope stability; seepage; bearing capacity; settlement; pavements; retaining walls; and dams. Projects focus on geotechnical and civil engineering design and analysis and include the preparation of plans and specifications, planning and oversight of investigations and analysis, writing technical reports, and cost estimating. The position will include project management for scope, schedule, and budget compliance, and will require working with engineers in other Barr offices. Administrative responsibilities such as business development, project management, mentoring and coaching, project planning and scheduling, and workload estimating make up a significant part of this role. This position will require out-of-town work assignments to meet the needs of our clients including field work such as client meetings and presentations, construction review, and facility inspections. NOTE: Applicants must be able to work in locations that feature the rough terrain typical of construction sites and to enter and work within facilities that include limited accessibility, moving machinery, and other conditions typical of industrial facilities. While the position is located in the Calgary office, fulfillment of the position responsibilities will require periodic travel. Applicants may be asked to participate in a drug screening program at the request of specific clients.  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in civil engineering with a geotechnical emphasis 10+ years of relevant work experience involving geotechnical engineering Professional member of the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) or ability to obtain membership within one year Strong technical understanding of a wide range of civil engineering such as structural, water resources with an emphasis on geotechnical analysis and design Demonstrated flexibility, willingness to modify schedule as required to meet deadlines and/or client needs Demonstrated technical project leadership, management, and organizational skills Demonstrated client relationship development/business development experience Desire to help build the geotechnical group in our Calgary office Computer skills including modeling software (such as FLAC, Plaxis, MODFLOW and/or GeoStudio), word processing and spreadsheets Willingness to travel domestically and internationally to support project needs Good verbal and written communication skills Acceptable driving record Legal authorization to work in Canada without the need for sponsorship Legal authorization to work in the U.S. without the need for sponsorship  Preferred Qualifications 15+ years of relevant work experience Graduate degree in geotechnical engineering Experience with civil infrastructure including roadway, foundation, retaining wall, and bridge design Experience with dams, including hydropower and tailings dam design, management and operation Experience or familiarity with geotechnical engineering in support of buried pipelines Engineering consulting or related experience Knowledge of the geotechnical markets in western Canada Strong, proven business development skills Strong relationships with clients and the ability to foster ongoing relationships Desire to become involved in the greater geotechnical community by performing research, giving presentations, and preparing publications Proven experience collaborating and maintain relationships across offices  Barr Engineering and Environmental Science Canada, Ltd. reserves the right to consider other legitimate, Title: Senior Cost Estimator
Job_Description: Description Calgary, AB In Canada, more than 8,000 of our people foster innovation every day because we know that our future world will be vastly different from today. Our reach includes environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transport networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources. Through our Future Ready initiative, we bring clarity and vision to some of Canada's most complex challenges and opportunities. The excellence we bring to our work and to work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We’re a Forbes Top Employer in Canada, one of the Corporate Knights' Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned ReNew Canada's  Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada’s Top 100 Infrastructure Projects. In 2018, LinkedIn ranked us number 7 on their Top Companies list. At WSP , we see the future more clearly and design for it today - we put innovation, and the highest ethical standards and professionalism at the centre of all we do. Find out what we have to offer. POSITION DESCRIPTION Our Oil & Gas Facilities Engineering group is currently experiencing tremendous growth, opening opportunities for enthusiastic, motivated and dedicated individuals who enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. We are looking for an experienced Senior Cost Estimator who wants to work on a variety of projects from small well tie-ins to large multi-million dollar SAGD facilities.  RESPONSIBILITIES Reporting to the Manager of Project Controls, you will be responsible for coordinating and developing full estimating services including basis of estimate on EPC Projects. These will range from conceptual, factored estimates to detailed estimates depending on the level of project definition and client requirements. Prepare capital cost estimate plan based on project schedule and issue plan for review and implementation in a timely fashion; Review proposal specifications, drawings, attend pre-bid meetings to help determine scope of work and required contents of estimate Establish unit costs, labour rates, productivity factors and location impacts; Manage and coordinate the development of various types of estimates including scoping through to detail engineering studies; Review and incorporate applicable historical data, unit cost labour rates and labour units and man-hour figures for estimates; Collaborate with procurement, project engineers and other members of the project control team for tender evaluations and project cost forecasting; Develop and review capital estimates ensuring all estimates are produced to a high standard and in a timely manner; Review and verify total installed multi-disciplined cost estimates submitted by contractors; Maintain estimating databases and tools; Communicate with clients on matters relating to cost estimates.  QUALIFICATIONS Our successful candidate will ideally have 10+ years’ experience in a similar role. In addition, you will also have: An excellent understanding of the AACE estimate class definitions and when each is prepared during the project cycle; Understand the standard construction practices; The ability to develop the construction indirect costs based on the project execution plan; Ability to visualize the whole project, but work in detail on various components; Highly analytical and methodical in developing work systems; Ability to use cost-estimating software to prepare cost quotes and bids; Ability to multi-task, work on several projects or tasks at once, manage time, organize and set priorities; Strong communication skills, bot verbal and business writing; Self-starter with ability to work independently with minimal supervision.  Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. Title: Intermediate Civil Designer – Job No. CIINT0405
Job_Description: As an Intermediate Civil Designer at Integrated Sustainability Consultants, you will have the opportunity to expand your career through working on exciting and high profile water and waste projects.  You will participate in all areas of our portfolio and project phases, from feasibility level to detailed design/execution for $50M + projects. Reporting to the Manager of Civil Infrastructure, you will be an integral part of our Engineering Team developing and implementing technical solutions in both the office and the field.  Your experience in industry and/or consulting, as well as your project and people skills will enable you to make a difference in our industry and inspire new and better ways to implement engineering solutions.  Company Overview:  Integrated Sustainability Consultants Ltd. is a Calgary based innovative leading provider of professional services that integrates world-class project consulting and delivery teams to execute sustainable Water, Waste and Energy solutions. Our goal is to engage public, industrial, and natural resource sector clients from early project thinking to successfully engineered project delivery completion by an employee owned team who value long-term social and environmentally sustainable solutions.  We are passionate about the water lifecycle from source protection and resource management, to water and wastewater treatment and disposal. We strive to find full lifecycle solutions through a risk management approach, while implementing efficient fit-for-purpose engineering design and scientific solutions. To meet these challenges, we have attracted a dynamic, energetic team of professionals who are highly recognized specialists in their field of expertise and love coming to work every day!  Responsibilities:  Develop finished grading drawings, sketches, and Engineering Packages from general conceptual information and design notes using a variety of 2D and 3D CAD software for Water Infrastructure Projects Applying design standards and principles in compliance with all applicable Codes and Specifications such as CSA, NBC, API, ASME, ANSI, etc. Checking work and assisting in training of less experienced drafting and design personnel Supporting field teams as needed during construction including surveying, field construction observation, inspection, and administration of field works Liaising with clients, vendors, engineers and other disciplines to achieve high quality and constructible design packages Position Requirements:  4 – 7 years of proven experience in civil engineering design, 3D modelling and drafting Diploma in Civil Design Course or Engineering Design Technology (or equivalent) is required Must qualify for registration with Association of Science and Engineering Technology Professionals of Alberta Initiative and accountability – self-starter, take ownership and responsibility Proven ability to multitask efficiently and flexibility to respond to changes in priorities Strong organizational and time management skills – ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines Excellent written and verbal communication skills Fluent in English and legally permitted to work in Canada Decision-making and problem solving ability Proven understanding of design and drafting principles with practical engineering skills in a consulting environment Thorough understanding of applicable codes and standards Proficient computer skills and advanced knowledge of CADD, Civil 2D/3D software, and Microsoft Excel Experience in field survey data collection including using differential GPS systems and Total Station equipment is an asset Experience with borehole logging and geodatabase development is an asset Experience with structural modeling an asset Must be fluent in English and have strong written and verbal communication skills Must legally able to work in Canada To apply, please fill out the following form. Title: Civil Engineer EIT
Job_Description: Your Opportunity Our Water sector, which brings together many of the world’s top engineers and scientists, sees water a bit differently—as a single holistic system rather than as unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. We use this perspective to help communities tap into water’s potential. Throughout the life cycle of capture, use, reuse, and discharge, our team optimizes every facet of a water system.  Whether a project calls for planners, designers, construction managers, or facility operators, we have the right experts to provide creative, yet practical, water solutions. Through our cost-effective strategies, we’re helping communities increase their water efficiency and protect their water resources for future generations. Join our team as we create new ways to tap into water’s vast potential.  Stantec is currently looking to add a Civil Engineer in Training to support our growing Water Resources practice. We encourage you to apply if you possess or would like to gain experience in a broad range of water-related engineering projects, with specific emphasis on industrial stormwater management water resources infrastructure projects. Applicants should be capable of working effectively with teams and clients, and be willing to learn from peers and supervisors  Your Duties  Cooperatively support multidisciplinary teams on small- to mid-sized projects and work on several projects concurrently. Perform preliminary and detailed analysis for industrial stormwater runoff. Perform detailed analysis for hydraulic and hydrologic modeling using PCSWMM modeling software. Preparation of studies, design criteria, design reports, plans and specifications, and quality assurance reviews of related designs and construction plans to ensure technical accuracy. Inspect construction for compliance with design drawings and specifications. Assist in project administration including writing reports, gathering information, preparing proposals and budgets, and completing progress reports. Evaluate alternatives and resolve technical questions. Work in a manner to ensure your personal safety and that of fellow employees by following company health and safety guideline and policies.  Your Capabilities and Credentials Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Civil or Water Resources Engineering. Registration as an Engineer-in-Training with APEGA or qualifications to obtain this registration at the start of employment. Strong organizational skills and multitasking ability. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work with engineering staff at all levels. Ability to prepare complete, concise and organized engineering calculations and analyses. Desire to grow in your career in a challenging environment that fosters self-improvement though leadership, mentoring, and a diversity of experience. Strong willingness to be a part of a large global engineering company, and to work with teams in other offices around the world. You will be based out of Calgary, but the position may require occasional project travel throughout western Canada  Qualified candidates who are highly motivated and eager to commit to Stantec's strategic initiative to become a Top 10 global design firm should submit their resume and cover letter online at www.stantec.com/careers.

Title: Senior Estimator - Civil Works
Job_Description: 05/01/2018  001477  Long term   Pomerleau is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder.  Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do.  WHAT WILL YOU DO IN A WEEK? :  As Senior Estimator within the Civil division, you will work in collaboration with the Civil Director and other experienced members of your team in sustaining and advancing Pomerleau's growth in Western Canada.  You will be responsible for compiling accurate estimates for projects such as bridges, highways, interchanges and tunnels which will include the following: Analyze plans and specs in a general way to have an overview of the project in order to:Visualize the scope of the work to execute;Find out which specialties are involved in the work;Verify if the project features some special work;Assess the time required to accomplish one’s work while respecting the date to submit the bid.Verify if a site visit is mentioned in the call for bids and inform the head estimator of such a fact;Draw up and send bond and insurance requests for each project in the bid process in collaboration with the administrative assistant;Draw up the list of specialties and the list of subcontractors to reach for each these specialties;Draw up the list of materials and the list of suppliers to reach for each of these materials;Produce the bill of materials for the specialties determined by the head estimator;Provide the purchasing department with the necessary information to search for prices pertaining to some materials used for the project;Prepare the summary of quantities according to the study of the plans and specs for each section of the specs, including relevant information;Set up study in estimation software and include subcontracted tasks, self-performed tasks, work teams, work rates, work ratios, quantities to achieve, etc.;Analyze the project carefully and plan for construction methods involving indirect costs, such as temporary roads and accesses, specific tools, formwork, equipment, site conditions, construction lead times, etc.;Plan and prepare resource table or supervise this work with the methods engineer;Analyze changes in addenda issued during the call for bids period;Set up price binder in collaboration with the administrative assistant for the estimation department;Receive, from subcontractors and suppliers, prices relating to their specialties;Receive , from the purchasing department, prices pertaining to supplier materials;Assist the head estimator in determining material and labor prices for each of the jobs to be performed and in the study of bids received from subcontractors through the BSDQ;Open envelopes from the BSDQ upon receiving them and file prices received in price binder;Make sure all prices received by phone, email, and fax at the BSDQ are complete according to plans and specs of the bid project;Prepare general project costs—supervision, general conditions, offices, insurance, specific equipment, safety, quality, etc.;Take part in bid closing;Establish a preliminary work schedule, including the resources—work force, supervision, equipment—on the construction site;Ensure proper archiving of the bid and assess results;Take part in the transfer meeting.  DO YOU HAVE THESE QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS? :  Post secondary education in Civil Engineering or other construction related programAt least 5 years of relevant experience estimating Civil construction projects for a general contractorPrevious experience with bridges, interchanges and tunnels is strongly preferredGood knowledge in excavation and formworkHigh-level skills in plan and specs readingResults driven, detail oriented and an analytical mindset with a desire to develop a long term career in Estimating WHY JOIN POMERLEAU`S TEAM? :  Competitive salary 4 weeks’ vacation Group insurance (health spending account) Group RRSP Monthly public transit pass paid by employer Fitness center membership: 50% reimbursed by employer Employee assistance program Ongoing training offered throughout the year Young, dynamic environment Excellent career opportunities Summer hours PARTICULARITY:  The retained candidate will be subject to an administrative security check At Pomerleau, we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for?

Job_Description: We are currently seeking a Mechanical Engineer to join our team in our Calgary office. Title: Project Manager - Mechanical
Job_Description: Job Field: Project Management Job Type: Full time Length of Assignment:  SUMMARY  BGIS, A Brookfield Company, is looking for a Project Manager - Mechanical to join our growing team! We are currently seeking a Project Manager with mechanical design experience for the Calgary area, who would have to manage several building projects in client leased and owned buildings as well as provide mechanical expertise for mechanical designs/scopes. The type of projects are primarily replacement of electro-mechanical equipment and building components due to end of life, addition of electro-mechanical equipment due to growth of our client's network, increasing electro-mechanical resiliency and upgrade of existing building equipment to meet the latest environmental requirements. Many of these buildings house telecom (voice, internet and TV), IT equipment (data centres), studio’s and offices which are essential to client services, therefore proper planning, scope and risk management are required in the realization of the projects.  The position would be for an intermediate to senior candidate and the individual is expected to be autonomous and would receive some coaching. The position also requires good communication and customer relation with our internal clients.  The Project Manager will perform/have the following duties/responsibilities as regrouped in the three main areas below:  1. Project Delivery in Mission Critical Environments: Replacement or addition of building systems such as electrical, stand-by power, UPS, mechanical, HVAC, plumbing, fire detection, sprinkler, DDC, etc. in buildings housing telecom equipment, data centers, production studios (radio and television); Taking into account building codes, occupational health and labor regulations; Taking into account complexity of construction issues and risk mitigation for work in a live technical environments; Work with internal groups such as program management, engineering. procurement, transaction management and operations teams, internal clients (requester of the project such as telecom, IT or production operating groups) to ensure the appropriate project delivery and maintaining good relations. 2. Project Management Processes and Quality Assurance:  Use project plans, schedules and budgets to ensure the highest quality of delivery in accordance to project requirements (key date and client standards); Ensure that the team (consultants, contractors, Real Estate Engineering, buildings operation) delivers projects for the client, on time, within budget and according to internal customer requirements; Take a pro-active approach in the planning of key activities and therefore eliminate surprises/delays; Obtain competitive prices and ensure that the client receives the maximum value for the products and services; Suggest when appropriate ways to improve existing processes or reduce cost without reducing on required quality 3. Communication and reporting:  Produce reports in order to keep the various internal groups informed on the project progress (schedule and budget), potential problems to come with a mitigation plan; Develop and maintain good working relations with our internal groups (engineering, program, operations and internal clients) in order to demonstrate the added value that the Real Estate groups bring to their business As Mechanical Engineer, the role is to:  Provide technical support to buildings operation when there are mechanical issues on HVAC, water towers, chillers, condensers, CRAH and CRAC units, pumps, valves, sprinkler systems, emergency generator ventilation/exhaust systems Prepare risk mitigation strategies based on reliability and resiliency Base on project requirements (life cycle, growth, de-risk, improvements) provide mechanical technical expertise in preparing the scope/design intent which will then be used to tender for consultant design Work with and review consultant mechanical design to ensure they are as per client Standards and scope Provide mechanical expertise for commissioning of mechanical systems during projects The approximate work load split between the project manager role and mechanical engineering role is expected to be PM = 80% and Mech Eng = 20%). Although the engineer will be located in Calgary, some of the sites that he will have to manage are located in other regions of Alberta such as Edmonton and Manitoba such as Winnipeg both also covers rural sites in those provinces. So the engineer will be expected to travel at times.  Essential skills/competencies:  University degree in Project Management and/or Mechanical Engineering from a recognised university Registered professional engineers in Alberta PMP certification would be preferred A minimum of 5 years of project management and/or construction experience A minimum of 5 years of mechanical system design and construction supervision Experience in managing projects in Data Center or telecommunication industry preferred. Knowledge/experience in use of Project Management software/tools (Microsoft Project, Excel, Power Point, PMWeb, etc.), Good knowledge in the following areas: codes, detailed estimating, SOX Autonomous, but also a team player Flexible to deal with tight deadlines and a quickly changing environment Detail oriented with strong analytical and problem solving skills Fluent in English (oral and written) with excellent communication abilities; knowledge of French (an asset but not mandatory)

Title: Geotechnical / Civil Engineer
Job_Description: As a Geotechnical / Civil Engineer, you will be joining our close-knit Geotechnical/Civil Engineering team working on world-class mining projects which are at the leading edge of emerging technologies in the industry. In this role, you will collaborate with our talented professionals who are committed to delivering high quality engineering solutions to our clients. KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada, United States and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and Saskatchewan and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. This role will give you the opportunity to: Work on a variety of projects including tailings dam design, mine and tailings planning support, mine pit slope design, embankment dams and earthworks design, site characterization, geohazard risk assessment and control, terrain analysis, slope stability assessments, seepage analyses, numerical modeling, and foundation design. Lead project designs including the preparation of technical reports and the development of construction drawings and tender packages. Build and develop strong relationships with our Clients, our multidisciplinary project teams, sub-contractors and other project stakeholders. Use your problem-solving skills to find innovative solutions to technical issues. Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry. Work in a dynamic One Team company culture that supports career development. Contribute to the growth of the Resources Group and engage and mentor junior staff. Travel primarily in Western Canada and potentially to our overseas project locations. If you are registered or eligible to register as a Professional Engineer in Canada, have a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Geotechnical or Civil Engineering and a minimum of 6 years of related tailings and dam engineering experience in mining, we want to hear from you! We value your: Strong initiative and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive towards achieving long-term success. Demonstrated leadership, project management, decision-making and coaching skills, especially your ability to engage, train and mentor young professionals. Flexibility, adaptability and willingness to travel and passion for learning. Ability to work in a performance focused, collaborative team environment. Strong verbal and written communication skills including your experience in writing technical reports and preparing tender documents. Experience in various design software, such as Slope/W or Seep/W. Experience with 2D and 3D numerical modeling programs relating to slope stability and deformation analysis such as Clara or FLAC. Ability to execute projects to meet Client requirements. Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to build long-term, successful relationships with our clients. Strong business acumen. About Us: Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, geotechnical, hydropower, water resources, transportation, oil & gas, and environmental sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton, and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the, Mining, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Oil and Gas industry. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. Are you up to the challenge? If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number 1324-A18. We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Title: Water Resources Engineer

Title: Software Integrations Developer
Job_Description: Are you an experienced software/web developer? Don't miss this opportunity to work on software which is used worldwide on high profile marine projects! Enjoy competitive compensation, full benefits, and bonus program! About the Organization Trusted by shipbuilders, naval architects and marine engineers, SSI develops Autodesk-based solutions for the shipbuilding and offshore industry. With the majority of US naval ships now being built with SSI solutions, and prestigious names in global marine construction increasingly choosing SSI, we are poised for well-managed and sustainable growth.  Based in Victoria, BC with a satellite office in Alabama, we are proud to offer our team an environment that facilitates fascinating and challenging work with a healthy work/life balance. A career with us gives you the opportunity to work on complex and graphically-oriented software that is used on high profile marine projects worldwide. These exciting projects include the recently built Staten Island ferries, as well as a myriad of both international and US defense projects. The ability to see the results of your efforts in the real world is what makes a career with SSI so rewarding.  In 2013, SSI was awarded the VIATec award for Business of the Year in Ocean Products - a true testament to our success within the industry. For more information, please visit our website.  About the Opportunity Currently, SSI is looking for a Software Integrations Developer to join their team in Victoria, BC.  Using your comprehensive knowledge of web services, XML, relational databases, and API design, you will integrate our leading-edge shipbuilding design software with those of our partners while using your communications and organization skills to liaise with the clients and vendors to design and test the integrations.  In order to qualify for this role, you will have a post-secondary education in Computer Science or Engineering with a minimum of 5 years of experience in software and web development, as well as a minimum of 3 years of experience in XML and RESTful web services.  You will also possess:  Knowledge of C# and C++ Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio Familiarity with object-oriented design patterns Knowledge of complex data structures and algorithms Experience with automated testing methodologies Experience with SQL Server (or other relational databases) The following are considered assets:  Experience with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems Experience working with remote teams, spanning multiple time zones Experience working in an Agile Environment (Scrum) Experience with Atlassian Tools (JIRA, Confluence) Experience with Software Versioning and Revision Control Systems (SVN) You will do well in this role if you can work independently but also within a collaborative environment. Sound judgment and decision making skills are essential.  Please note: you must be a Canadian or US citizen and be based in, or willing to relocate to, Victoria, British Columbia, Canada in order to be considered for this role.  If you are a creative, energetic, and dynamic professional who wants to work on complex, graphically oriented software, this could be the role for you!  About the Benefits At SSI, the core of our success lies in the creative, energetic and dedicated people who make up our team.
