Title: Software Integrations Developer
Job_Description: Are you an experienced software/web developer? Don't miss this opportunity to work on software which is used worldwide on high profile marine projects! Enjoy competitive compensation, full benefits, and bonus program! About the Organization Trusted by shipbuilders, naval architects and marine engineers, SSI develops Autodesk-based solutions for the shipbuilding and offshore industry. With the majority of US naval ships now being built with SSI solutions, and prestigious names in global marine construction increasingly choosing SSI, we are poised for well-managed and sustainable growth.  Based in Victoria, BC with a satellite office in Alabama, we are proud to offer our team an environment that facilitates fascinating and challenging work with a healthy work/life balance. A career with us gives you the opportunity to work on complex and graphically-oriented software that is used on high profile marine projects worldwide. These exciting projects include the recently built Staten Island ferries, as well as a myriad of both international and US defense projects. The ability to see the results of your efforts in the real world is what makes a career with SSI so rewarding.  In 2013, SSI was awarded the VIATec award for Business of the Year in Ocean Products - a true testament to our success within the industry. For more information, please visit our website.  About the Opportunity Currently, SSI is looking for a Software Integrations Developer to join their team in Victoria, BC.  Using your comprehensive knowledge of web services, XML, relational databases, and API design, you will integrate our leading-edge shipbuilding design software with those of our partners while using your communications and organization skills to liaise with the clients and vendors to design and test the integrations.  In order to qualify for this role, you will have a post-secondary education in Computer Science or Engineering with a minimum of 5 years of experience in software and web development, as well as a minimum of 3 years of experience in XML and RESTful web services.  You will also possess:  Knowledge of C# and C++ Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio Familiarity with object-oriented design patterns Knowledge of complex data structures and algorithms Experience with automated testing methodologies Experience with SQL Server (or other relational databases) The following are considered assets:  Experience with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems Experience working with remote teams, spanning multiple time zones Experience working in an Agile Environment (Scrum) Experience with Atlassian Tools (JIRA, Confluence) Experience with Software Versioning and Revision Control Systems (SVN) You will do well in this role if you can work independently but also within a collaborative environment. Sound judgment and decision making skills are essential.  Please note: you must be a Canadian or US citizen and be based in, or willing to relocate to, Victoria, British Columbia, Canada in order to be considered for this role.  If you are a creative, energetic, and dynamic professional who wants to work on complex, graphically oriented software, this could be the role for you!  About the Benefits At SSI, the core of our success lies in the creative, energetic and dedicated people who make up our team. Although the work may be challenging, we foster a fun, flexible and friendly working environment with:  A casual, relaxed work environment Flexible work hours that support a work-life balance Seasonal social events (Friday pub lunches, potlucks, Pi day, Christmas parties, theme days, and more) Weekly onsite yoga classes Paid time off to attend blood donation drives Upon joining SSI, you can expect to receive a competitive annual salary of $60,000 - $75,000 per year depending on skills and experience, plus great employee benefits, including:  ParaMedical, Dental, and Vision Life insurance and long-term disability benefits Profit Sharing Plan Three weeks’ vacation Education assistance, professional development, opportunities for career growth, and training If you enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment and want to take your career to the next level with a local employer of choice – Apply to SSI today For full details and to apply, please visit http://jobs.applyfirst.ca/jobs...

Title: Project Engineer (Process/Mechanical)
Job_Description: A thriving energy industry is critical to a healthy economy for Alberta and Canada. Breakthroughs in technology can drastically reduce the environmental footprint, greenhouse gas emissions and overall performance of this important industry. Exergy is expanding it's capability to study design alternatives to tackle some of the oil sands biggest challenges. We are a dynamic and disruptive group ready make a positive change to our industry. If you love to invent, build and tinker this is the place for you! We are looking for an individual who can help grow Exergy's business in the area of research, innovation and FEED stage project development. This is an opportunity to work with a highly creative team and make a real impact. This role requires a multi-talented individual with the capability to perform hands-on work to construct machines in our operating additive manufacturing and process automation lab. The individual must be open-minded to try new approaches to problem solving and expand their knowledge and experience in a broad range of disciplines. Area of duties and responsibilities but not limited to;  Bring creative engineering solutions to Exergy's customers Meeting with clients and prospects to represent the Exergy brand Direct responsibility for coordination of the design and drafting team Confident and knowledgeable to carry out all process/mechanical engineering functions Equipment selection, sizing and vendor selection PFD, material balance and P&ID design development Responsible for construction and operation of lab apparatus with assistance from co-workers Field work for P&ID verification and pilot plant activity (<10%) Project management budgeting, planning and scheduling Approval of timesheets and resource planning Mentor and guide more junior team members Establish the companies engineering and design practices Requirements Qualifications  10+ years experience in process or mechanical engineering Degree / diploma from an accredited design institution Understanding and experience with Oil Sands extraction and tailings would be an asset Knowledge in mineral processing, setting and particle separation is an asset Overall understanding of project development or some project engineering experience Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint, Word Experience with AutoCAD, Solidworks, Fusion 360 is preferred Understanding of popular process simulation software such as Hysys and VMG would be an asset WHMIS and H2S Alive required (Training can be provided) Must be a member of APEGA with P.Eng. Benefits We offer a comprehensive employer paid benefits program **Online applications accepted only. Please do not contact us by phone.

Title: Samsung Sales Engineering Manager
Job_Description: POSITION OPEN: Samsung Sales Engineering Manager  EMPLOYEE TYPE: Full-time  OVERVIEW: The Sales Engineer is responsible for pre & post-sales support for B2B customers. The primary responsibility is to ensure a best-in-class deployment experience for customers migrating to Samsung optimized enterprise solutions. This role will also function as an overall technical SME on Samsung mobile devices, MDM partners and provide deep dive technical training and competitive analysis.  POSITION DESCRIPTION:  Responsible for pre-sales technical support in full sales cycle including discovery, opportunity evaluation, pilot support, and opportunity closure in both Enterprise and SMB accounts. Coordinates solutions design with Sales team, Product team, and Solution providers to ensure accuracy and feasibility Conduct Proof of Concept evaluations to implement solutions to demonstrate the ability to meet client objectives including, full management of the PoC process and reporting. Responsible for staying up to date on all the technical aspects of Samsung Enterprise solutions, with a sharp focus on Samsung Knox. Responsible for building a tight relationship with Samsung’s Key Knox MDM partners with a focus on migration from competing platforms. Close collaboration with various internal Samsung B2B sales teams, (Direct, Carrier, and Channel) will be necessary to ensure alignment with stated sales goals and strategies. Establish relationships with the various internal and external resources needed to deliver best in class experiences when deploying Samsung optimized solutions. Deliver technical presentations, training, demos and product overviews and deep-dives on product features. Can include participation in events (i.e. Tradeshow/Channel recruitment and training). Manage a large volume of pre/post sales technical issues with a focus on challenges arising from customers migrating onto Samsung Optimized solutions. Document technical issue resolutions, known issues, root cause analysis, troubleshooting details in a comprehensive Knowledge Base. Logging activities and maintaining prospect’s technical profile in CRM. Providing regular reports on account activities (account visits, calls, etc.). Develop and maintain expert-level knowledge of Samsung’s B2B product and service offerings. Attends company trainings to stay abreast of the latest internal technologies and product line developments. Keeps informed of latest industry news, trends, products, services, competitors and relevant existing and emerging technologies. Frequent travel to partner/customer facilities, remote facilities, industry events, and trade shows more than 30 to 50% of time.  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE: Have 5 - 7+ years of experience in mobile solution sales and support with a technical/engineering background preferred. Have 5 - 7+ years of experience working in the enterprise sales space with exposure to multiple industry verticals preferred. Minimum 3 years previous technical sales support experience or equivalent, preferably for both SAAS and enterprise, on-premise technology solutions preferred. Must have experience working with external vendors in multiple industry verticals. Demonstrated experience with deployment of complex technical solutions in a large enterprise environment. Detailed technical knowledge of the wireless industry to include mobile hardware (Smartphones and Tablets), applications (OS and End-user Apps) and services. Deep understanding of the integration of mobile solutions into corporate network environments and email platforms, mainly Microsoft Exchange and Lotus Notes. Efficient in troubleshooting application, device, and network communications Must be able to write, read, analyze, interpret, present, and explain mobile technical products and development materials. A Knowledge of BES, MobileIron, Airwatch, SAP, Citrix, SOTI, MaaS360e and other MDM solutions a must. Understanding of web applications and their architecture and design Knowledge of Application stores and the associated enterprise customer requirements a plus. Bachelor’s degree in Business or Engineering from accredited college or university. Experience with wireless network configuration and troubleshooting preferred Must have experience with Microsoft Standard Office Suite and extensive use of presentation software within a Windows/NT LAN/WAN network environment.  BENEFITS: Premium offers a competitive salary along with a full benefits package including health, dental, vision, life insurance, long-term disability, and paid time off. All supplementary benefits and employment practices are in compliance with all Canadian employment laws.  COMPANY: Premium has been pioneering bold strategies, tools and technologies since 1985 with a single goal: to help our partners advance their industries and the lives of their consumers. Experts in strategy, merchandising, brand advocacy and support, we employ a tailored approach to answering each client's unique business needs. Together with our clients, we're inventing and leading a new era in retail, moving forward by moving beyond what's expected.   PREMIUM CAREERS: Retail experience? Check. An unbeatable work ethic? Check. A burning desire to be part of a team delivering results for a cutting-edge roster of clients? Check. You just might be Premium. Propel brands to new heights with integrity and imagination. Join our team and be the next big thing.   Premium is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we will accommodate your needs under the Human Rights Code. Upon individual request, hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application, interview or selection processes, please contact the Human Resources Department for assistance. Due to the high volume of applicants, only those moving forward in the next step of the selection process will be contacted.

Title: ANT+ Applications Engineer 2
Job_Description: At Garmin Cochrane, we create more than just products – we inspire solutions and innovations that change and shape how we live, work and play. You’ll get to work alongside top talent and partners in the cycling, running, and sport and fitness industry from around the globe. You’ll enable compelling ecosystems such as ANT+ with the ANT 2.4 GHz ultra-low power wireless protocol, work on cutting-edge technology projects like optical heart-rate sensing, and sport and fitness products such as Vivoactive, Vector, and Varia.  Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, we’re located just 15 minutes outside of Calgary in Cochrane, Alberta. A retreat from fast-paced cities – Cochrane allows us to build relationships with the community and focus on what we do best – creating innovative solutions for unique use-cases in the ultra-low power wireless and sport industries. With many other tech companies calling Cochrane home, we can’t think of a better place to be!  Here’s why you want to work for us.  You’ll bring products to life. Become a key contributor to our exciting portfolio of Garmin products and ecosystems, and help us bring sport and fitness devices and standards from concept to market.  You’ll love our office culture. Company BBQs, active sports, casual dress, volunteer opportunities and the occasional sneak peak of new release movies (Star Wars, anyone?) allows team members to get to know each other outside the office.  You’ll receive fantastic benefits. Opportunities for professional development, no waiting period for vacation or our extensive benefit plan, RRSP matching, stock purchase options, product discounts and flexible work schedules are available for all team members.  Here’s what we’re looking for from you A passion for programming in C/C++/C#, you have a strong understanding of how the languages work and can use them to get the results you want on existing software. Experience and aptitude in requirements gathering and analysis with customers and partners Strong communicator who enjoys talking to people Excellent organizational skills Experience creating and documenting design specifications and bringing those designs to life Experience/interest in working with the ANT Wireless Protocol and other wireless technologies BSc Degree in Computer Science, Software/Electrical/Computer/Aerospace Engineering, Math, Physics or similar technical field of study with a 3.0 cumulative GPA, or equivalent practical experience Proficiency in C/C++, C#; Python experience is a bonus.  Desirable Qualifications: Experience developing software for Windows; familiarity with object-oriented design Experience developing embedded software for microcontrollers in small electronic devices A keen interest in fitness, cycling, running, health and wellness Interest in and ability to learn other programming languages as needed Proven ability to develop innovative and creative solutions to complex problems Familiarity with ANT/ANT+

Title: Geotechnical Engineer - Advanced Numerical Modelling
Job_Description: As a Geotechnical Engineer with advanced numerical modeling capability, you will be joining our close-knit Geotechnical Engineering team who are working on our strong portfolio of major water supply and hydropower dams, mine waste and tailings storage facilities, and infrastructure projects in Canada and internationally. In this role, you will collaborate with our talented professionals who are committed to delivering high quality engineering solutions to our clients. KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. This role will give you the opportunity to: Gain experience working on our portfolio of projects including water supply and hydropower dams, mine waste and tailings storage facilities, and geohazard risk mitigation. Develop and oversee site investigations and monitoring programs, complete engineering studies, and undertake conceptual to detailed engineering designs. Lead and oversee advanced 2D and 3D numerical static and dynamic modeling assignments. Use your problem-solving and modeling skills to find innovative solutions to complex technical issues. Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry. Work in a dynamic One Team company culture that supports career development. Contribute to the growth of the Resources Group and engage and mentor junior staff. Build and maintain strong relationships with our Clients and our multidisciplinary project teams. Travel primarily in Western Canada and potentially to our overseas project locations. If you have more than five years of relevant experience and are registered or eligible to register as a Professional Engineer in Canada, and hold a Masters degree or Ph.D. in geotechnical engineering with a strong emphasis on numerical modeling and analysis, preferably related to dams, tailings management in the oil sands, mining, hydropower or related industries, we want to hear from you! We value your: Working knowledge and demonstrated practical application of advanced 2D and 3D numerical static and dynamic modeling software, including FLAC, to define the problem and develop solutions. Solid understanding of soil and rock characteristics and behavior. Technical experience in dam engineering and tailings and mine waste engineering including liquefaction susceptibility and deformation assessments. Strong initiative, innovation and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive toward long-term success. Superior verbal and written communication skills including your experience in writing engineering reports and technical papers, preparing and delivering technical presentations to clients and Review Boards, and overseeing preparation of design drawings. Exceptional team spirit, interpersonal skills and your ability to build long-term, successful relationships with our clients and our project teams. About Us: Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, geotechnical, hydropower, water resources, transportation, oil & gas, and environmental sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton, and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the, Mining, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Oil and Gas industry. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. Are you up to the challenge? If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number 1331-A18. We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Title: Systems Engineer
Job_Description: Tucows has been on the Internet since people unironically called it the Information Superhighway. Today, we’re the second largest domain wholesaler in the world with Millions of domains under management (OpenSRS / Enom). We’re doing all kinds of interesting things including running an MVNO cell phone service (Ting) and building fiber to the premises networks in towns and cities across the US (Ting Internet). We offer individual and small business domains and integration with Shopify, Squarespace and many others (Hover). We’re a team of over 600 serving tens of millions of customers around the world. Our growth has been incredible (NASDAQ: TCX, TSX: TC). It has also been smart and measured. Our success is built on a solid technology foundation thanks to a culture of DevOps excellence. That’s where you come in. As a Systems Engineer you’ll seed innovation and creativity in a dynamic, fast-paced successful and yet stable company. Description The Systems Engineer will be responsible for day to day operations including migrating production systems into a new architecture, taking advantage of the latest DevOps methodologies and tools. You will be working in a dynamic environment and proposing creative and effective solutions to operational challenges. Key skills and experience 4+ years of experience with configuration management Preferably SaltStack; Chef or Puppet is acceptable. Able to create new pillars and state files. Handle issues that arise with running a configuration management platform. Extensive experience with Linux We are using Debian, but at this level, it is expected that you can easily pick up other flavors. Package management (building, maintaining, etc.)  2+ years of Python Ability to write code to automate routine Operations’ tasks Ability to integrate into various APIs to create a cohesive platform. Nice to have skills and experience Leadership skills Standard internet services like DNS/HTTP Managing containerized systems Experience with continuous deployment best practices You might remember Tucows as the place to download software before software download sites got gross... not to mention almost entirely irrelevant. That was indeed us. That was also a long time ago on a server far, far away.

Title: Software Development Manager
Job_Description: About Solium  Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry’s service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.  Why work at Solium  Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for:  Software Development Manager  Solium is looking for a helms-person to help pilot their financial services Death Star through more than $10,000,000,000 of transactions per year.  If you:  Are a leader who believes in leader-leader self-organizing teams and is willing to work on that evolution Are a coach who supports broad growth because you know that developers have careers and not just jobs Are a pragmatic problem solver who can identify process inefficiencies and find creative ways to eliminate them Are excited by the challenge of helping us evolve from a midsize SaaS application to a global enterprise platform Then we are looking for you!  We are big fans of Turn the Ship Around! by L. David Marquet, and are working to build and reinforce a culture of action and ownership. You will help foster leadership through all levels of the organization. You are not a master developer, but have a strong technical background and familiarity with patterns and practices. You know that agile is a description, not a dogma, and that continuous improvement is achievable.  Requirements:  Foster a team culture that encourages ownership, continual learning, and customer delight Provide hands-on coaching and mentoring to Software Developers for technical and soft skill growth Work with product owners and clients to contribute to strategic growth of the platform Remove barriers to keep product teams close to the client and product to find value in what we build Champion product ownership and spread leadership throughout the team Ruthlessly identify process weakness and build and use metrics to drive improvement Take a lead role in recruiting and hiring Software Developers Familiarity with the enterprise Java technology stack. While we are not dogmatic about what technologies we use, this is the one we are using right now. Help lead the team to balance commercial viability, scalability, security, and technical innovation to evolve the Shareworks platform Qualifications:  Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, or Equivalent experience Familiarity with development and deployment of enterprise applications Working knowledge of management techniques and strategies 8+ years’ experience as a developer or engineer 5+ years’ experience as a development or engineering team lead (or other technical management) If you've read this far and you're thinking "I want to be a part of this", we agree! Apply now!

Title: Construction Supervisor
Job_Description: Construction Supervisor - Calgary Alberta ( Job Number:  170000HK ) Description My Field. My Craft. My Legacy .  You have talent, and PCL recognizes the value that each skilled craft person brings to the work site. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of construction jobs with a company that is recognized as a leader in the construction industry. Be part of world-class projects and a culture that is built on employee success and sharing of collective experiences.  PCL has one of the best safety records in the industry. On our construction jobs, PCL has a goal of zero incidents which continues to be a top priority; it is important that you go home uninjured at the end of every day. With PCL’s mentorship culture, you will be able to share your talents as well as learn from some of the best in the industry. Whether your focus is civil infrastructure, heavy industrial, or buildings, PCL has construction jobs that will showcase your skills.  Your talent drives your legacy with PCL.  We are seeking experienced Construction Supervisors located in Calgary, AB.  To apply for this position email calgarybuilders@pcl.com and quote Requisition #170000HK in the subject line.  Responsibilities Work with the project manager to create, maintain and execute project plan, schedule and ensure compliance with budget Supervise and coordinate site construction activity with PCL own forces work and sub trades Create site plans and safe work procedures Ensure implementation of PCL's safety program to ensure a safe work environment on the project site Work with engineers, designers and inspectors to meet the clients project requirements Perform some Carpentry tasks as required on the project including hoardings, framing, backing, door hardware and site housekeeping Qualifications 5 or more years of construction experience in field supervision in commercial or civil construction Hold a valid Journeyman trade certificate or civil engineering technology diploma. Preference will be given to certified Carpenters Working knowledge of Microsoft Office software including Excel, Word, and Outlook Carpentry or concrete experience considered an asset Experience with utilities, earthworks and site works considered an asset. Work Conditions  This position is based on a standard 44 hour work week. Suitable candidates must be available to work overtime, evenings, weekends and out of town. This position is physically demanding and requires commitment to working safe on our jobsites.  The PCL family of companies are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for, and we aspire to be the most respected builder, renowned for excellence, leadership, and unsurpassed value.   Let us help you build your Legacy today. Company : PCL Builders Inc. Job Posting : May 7, 2018 Closing Date : Aug 6, 2018 Primary Location : Canada-Alberta-Calgary

Title: Software Integrations Developer
Job_Description: Are you an experienced software/web developer? Don't miss this opportunity to work on software which is used worldwide on high profile marine projects! Enjoy competitive compensation, full benefits, and bonus program! About the Organization Trusted by shipbuilders, naval architects and marine engineers, SSI develops Autodesk-based solutions for the shipbuilding and offshore industry. With the majority of US naval ships now being built with SSI solutions, and prestigious names in global marine construction increasingly choosing SSI, we are poised for well-managed and sustainable growth.  Based in Victoria, BC with a satellite office in Alabama, we are proud to offer our team an environment that facilitates fascinating and challenging work with a healthy work/life balance. A career with us gives you the opportunity to work on complex and graphically-oriented software that is used on high profile marine projects worldwide. These exciting projects include the recently built Staten Island ferries, as well as a myriad of both international and US defense projects. The ability to see the results of your efforts in the real world is what makes a career with SSI so rewarding.  In 2013, SSI was awarded the VIATec award for Business of the Year in Ocean Products - a true testament to our success within the industry. For more information, please visit our website.  About the Opportunity Currently, SSI is looking for a Software Integrations Developer to join their team in Victoria, BC.  Using your comprehensive knowledge of web services, XML, relational databases, and API design, you will integrate our leading-edge shipbuilding design software with those of our partners while using your communications and organization skills to liaise with the clients and vendors to design and test the integrations.  In order to qualify for this role, you will have a post-secondary education in Computer Science or Engineering with a minimum of 5 years of experience in software and web development, as well as a minimum of 3 years of experience in XML and RESTful web services.  You will also possess:  Knowledge of C# and C++ Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio Familiarity with object-oriented design patterns Knowledge of complex data structures and algorithms Experience with automated testing methodologies Experience with SQL Server (or other relational databases) The following are considered assets:  Experience with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems Experience working with remote teams, spanning multiple time zones Experience working in an Agile Environment (Scrum) Experience with Atlassian Tools (JIRA, Confluence) Experience with Software Versioning and Revision Control Systems (SVN) You will do well in this role if you can work independently but also within a collaborative environment. Sound judgment and decision making skills are essential.  Please note: you must be a Canadian or US citizen and be based in, or willing to relocate to, Victoria, British Columbia, Canada in order to be considered for this role.  If you are a creative, energetic, and dynamic professional who wants to work on complex, graphically oriented software, this could be the role for you!  About the Benefits At SSI, the core of our success lies in the creative, energetic and dedicated people who make up our team. Although the work may be challenging, we foster a fun, flexible and friendly working environment with:  A casual, relaxed work environment Flexible work hours that support a work-life balance Seasonal social events (Friday pub lunches, potlucks, Pi day, Christmas parties, theme days, and more) Weekly onsite yoga classes Paid time off to attend blood donation drives Upon joining SSI, you can expect to receive a competitive annual salary of $60,000 - $75,000 per year depending on skills and experience, plus great employee benefits, including:  ParaMedical, Dental, and Vision Life insurance and long-term disability benefits Profit Sharing Plan Three weeks’ vacation Education assistance, professional development, opportunities for career growth, and training If you enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment and want to take your career to the next level with a local employer of choice – Apply to SSI today For full details and to apply, please visit http://jobs.applyfirst.ca/jobs...

Title: Geotechnical Engineer - Senior Level
Job_Description: Barr is seeking an engineer with demonstrated experience leading, managing, and mentoring multi-discipline project teams as a practice builder. This position provides the opportunity to build a practice around a core team to work on a variety of consulting projects involving traditional geotechnical engineering designs such as shallow and deep foundations; slope stability; seepage; bearing capacity; settlement; pavements; retaining walls; and dams. Projects focus on geotechnical and civil engineering design and analysis and include the preparation of plans and specifications, planning and oversight of investigations and analysis, writing technical reports, and cost estimating. The position will include project management for scope, schedule, and budget compliance, and will require working with engineers in other Barr offices. Administrative responsibilities such as business development, project management, mentoring and coaching, project planning and scheduling, and workload estimating make up a significant part of this role. This position will require out-of-town work assignments to meet the needs of our clients including field work such as client meetings and presentations, construction review, and facility inspections. NOTE: Applicants must be able to work in locations that feature the rough terrain typical of construction sites and to enter and work within facilities that include limited accessibility, moving machinery, and other conditions typical of industrial facilities. While the position is located in the Calgary office, fulfillment of the position responsibilities will require periodic travel. Applicants may be asked to participate in a drug screening program at the request of specific clients.  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in civil engineering with a geotechnical emphasis 10+ years of relevant work experience involving geotechnical engineering Professional member of the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) or ability to obtain membership within one year Strong technical understanding of a wide range of civil engineering such as structural, water resources with an emphasis on geotechnical analysis and design Demonstrated flexibility, willingness to modify schedule as required to meet deadlines and/or client needs Demonstrated technical project leadership, management, and organizational skills Demonstrated client relationship development/business development experience Desire to help build the geotechnical group in our Calgary office Computer skills including modeling software (such as FLAC, Plaxis, MODFLOW and/or GeoStudio), word processing and spreadsheets Willingness to travel domestically and internationally to support project needs Good verbal and written communication skills Acceptable driving record Legal authorization to work in Canada without the need for sponsorship Legal authorization to work in the U.S. without the need for sponsorship  Preferred Qualifications 15+ years of relevant work experience Graduate degree in geotechnical engineering Experience with civil infrastructure including roadway, foundation, retaining wall, and bridge design Experience with dams, including hydropower and tailings dam design, management and operation Experience or familiarity with geotechnical engineering in support of buried pipelines Engineering consulting or related experience Knowledge of the geotechnical markets in western Canada Strong, proven business development skills Strong relationships with clients and the ability to foster ongoing relationships Desire to become involved in the greater geotechnical community by performing research, giving presentations, and preparing publications Proven experience collaborating and maintain relationships across offices  Barr Engineering and Environmental Science Canada, Ltd. reserves the right to consider other legitimate, non-discriminatory factors that are not specifically listed.  We require proof of eligibility to work in Canada.  Barr Engineering Company strives to make www.barr.com accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance with completing the application process, please call 952-832-2600, or toll free at 800-632-2277. Title: Senior Cost Estimator
Job_Description: Description Calgary, AB In Canada, more than 8,000 of our people foster innovation every day because we know that our future world will be vastly different from today. Our reach includes environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transport networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources. Through our Future Ready initiative, we bring clarity and vision to some of Canada's most complex challenges and opportunities. The excellence we bring to our work and to work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We’re a Forbes Top Employer in Canada, one of the Corporate Knights' Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned ReNew Canada's  Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada’s Top 100 Infrastructure Projects. In 2018, LinkedIn ranked us number 7 on their Top Companies list. At WSP , we see the future more clearly and design for it today - we put innovation, and the highest ethical standards and professionalism at the centre of all we do. Find out what we have to offer. POSITION DESCRIPTION Our Oil & Gas Facilities Engineering group is currently experiencing tremendous growth, opening opportunities for enthusiastic, motivated and dedicated individuals who enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. We are looking for an experienced Senior Cost Estimator who wants to work on a variety of projects from small well tie-ins to large multi-million dollar SAGD facilities.  RESPONSIBILITIES Reporting to the Manager of Project Controls, you will be responsible for coordinating and developing full estimating services including basis of estimate on EPC Projects. These will range from conceptual, factored estimates to detailed estimates depending on the level of project definition and client requirements. Prepare capital cost estimate plan based on project schedule and issue plan for review and implementation in a timely fashion; Review proposal specifications, drawings, attend pre-bid meetings to help determine scope of work and required contents of estimate Establish unit costs, labour rates, productivity factors and location impacts; Manage and coordinate the development of various types of estimates including scoping through to detail engineering studies; Review and incorporate applicable historical data, unit cost labour rates and labour units and man-hour figures for estimates; Collaborate with procurement, project engineers and other members of the project control team for tender evaluations and project cost forecasting; Develop and review capital estimates ensuring all estimates are produced to a high standard and in a timely manner; Review and verify total installed multi-disciplined cost estimates submitted by contractors; Maintain estimating databases and tools; Communicate with clients on matters relating to cost estimates.  QUALIFICATIONS Our successful candidate will ideally have 10+ years’ experience in a similar role. In addition, you will also have: An excellent understanding of the AACE estimate class definitions and when each is prepared during the project cycle; Understand the standard construction practices; The ability to develop the construction indirect costs based on the project execution plan; Ability to visualize the whole project, but work in detail on various components; Highly analytical and methodical in developing work systems; Ability to use cost-estimating software to prepare cost quotes and bids; Ability to multi-task, work on several projects or tasks at once, manage time, organize and set priorities; Strong communication skills, bot verbal and business writing; Self-starter with ability to work independently with minimal supervision.  Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits). Title: Senior Geotechnical Specialist
Job_Description: We are currently seeking an Senior Geotechnical Specialist to join our team in Calgary or Edmonton .  Reporting to the Principal Geotechnical Engineer, the Geotechnical Specialist holds an intermediate technical and business development role in support of a wide variety of projects across our western Canadian offices.  Qualifications: University degree or diploma in a related discipline (i.e. geoscience or civil engineering, etc.); a post-graduate degree would be considered an asset Minimum of 10 years relevant experience in a consulting environment; Currently registered or eligible to register as a member of APEGA; Ability to work on multiple projects and meet established deadlines; Effective interpersonal skills, a strong client-service focus and the ability to work in a team environment are essential; Strong business development skills; Experience using specialized equipment and software (e.g. Lpile, GRL-WEAP, GeoStudio or equivalent) would be considered an asset; Strong report writing and verbal communication skills in the English language; and Valid driver’s licence with a clean driving abstract.  Experience in the following areas would be an asset: Slope Stability, mitigation design and monitoring Foundation Design Infrastructure design Retaining wall design Mining geotechnical engineering Tailings engineering Materials laboratory testing interpretation Site Investigation- drilling  Job Duties: Acting as the lead resource/project manager for a variety of projects and clients Develop and maintain client relationships Assist in the development and growth of the Calgary team with a focus on energy and infrastructure developments Support the development of the Environment & Geoscience business by developing relationships with existing and future client contacts, attending meetings, and supporting BD initiatives Preparation and review of proposals Provision of practical and economic solutions to clients Preparation and review of technical reports associated with the project scope of work Ensuring technical quality of work including review of client deliverables (proposals, reports and mapping) Provide guidance, training and direction to junior and intermediate staff to ensure the completion of the project scope of work Our commitment to excellence extents do our workplace where we offer a flexible work environment, competitive compensation and benefits including a generous RRSP program and an employee Share Ownership Plan, in-house training programs, a strong emphasis on health and safety, support for continuing education and professional development and the opportunity to work with and learn from senior technical experts and professionals.  For more information, please visit our website at www.snclavalin.com  While SNC-Lavalin would like to thank all those that apply, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.  Local candidates will be preferred and no relocation package will be offered  “We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.”  Worker Type Employee Job Type Regular At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

Title: Intermediate Civil Designer – Job No. CIINT0405
Job_Description: As an Intermediate Civil Designer at Integrated Sustainability Consultants, you will have the opportunity to expand your career through working on exciting and high profile water and waste projects.  You will participate in all areas of our portfolio and project phases, from feasibility level to detailed design/execution for $50M + projects. Reporting to the Manager of Civil Infrastructure, you will be an integral part of our Engineering Team developing and implementing technical solutions in both the office and the field.  Your experience in industry and/or consulting, as well as your project and people skills will enable you to make a difference in our industry and inspire new and better ways to implement engineering solutions.  Company Overview:  Integrated Sustainability Consultants Ltd. is a Calgary based innovative leading provider of professional services that integrates world-class project consulting and delivery teams to execute sustainable Water, Waste and Energy solutions. Our goal is to engage public, industrial, and natural resource sector clients from early project thinking to successfully engineered project delivery completion by an employee owned team who value long-term social and environmentally sustainable solutions.  We are passionate about the water lifecycle from source protection and resource management, to water and wastewater treatment and disposal. We strive to find full lifecycle solutions through a risk management approach, while implementing efficient fit-for-purpose engineering design and scientific solutions. To meet these challenges, we have attracted a dynamic, energetic team of professionals who are highly recognized specialists in their field of expertise and love coming to work every day!  Responsibilities:  Develop finished grading drawings, sketches, and Engineering Packages from general conceptual information and design notes using a variety of 2D and 3D CAD software for Water Infrastructure Projects Applying design standards and principles in compliance with all applicable Codes and Specifications such as CSA, NBC, API, ASME, ANSI, etc. Checking work and assisting in training of less experienced drafting and design personnel Supporting field teams as needed during construction including surveying, field construction observation, inspection, and administration of field works Liaising with clients, vendors, engineers and other disciplines to achieve high quality and constructible design packages Position Requirements:  4 – 7 years of proven experience in civil engineering design, 3D modelling and drafting Diploma in Civil Design Course or Engineering Design Technology (or equivalent) is required Must qualify for registration with Association of Science and Engineering Technology Professionals of Alberta Initiative and accountability – self-starter, take ownership and responsibility Proven ability to multitask efficiently and flexibility to respond to changes in priorities Strong organizational and time management skills – ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines Excellent written and verbal communication skills Fluent in English and legally permitted to work in Canada Decision-making and problem solving ability Proven understanding of design and drafting principles with practical engineering skills in a consulting environment Thorough understanding of applicable codes and standards Proficient computer skills and advanced knowledge of CADD, Civil 2D/3D software, and Microsoft Excel Experience in field survey data collection including using differential GPS systems and Total Station equipment is an asset Experience with borehole logging and geodatabase development is an asset Experience with structural modeling an asset Must be fluent in English and have strong written and verbal communication skills Must legally able to work in Canada To apply, please fill out the following form. Title: Civil Engineer EIT
Job_Description: Your Opportunity Our Water sector, which brings together many of the world’s top engineers and scientists, sees water a bit differently—as a single holistic system rather than as unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. We use this perspective to help communities tap into water’s potential. Throughout the life cycle of capture, use, reuse, and discharge, our team optimizes every facet of a water system.  Whether a project calls for planners, designers, construction managers, or facility operators, we have the right experts to provide creative, yet practical, water solutions. Through our cost-effective strategies, we’re helping communities increase their water efficiency and protect their water resources for future generations. Join our team as we create new ways to tap into water’s vast potential.  Stantec is currently looking to add a Civil Engineer in Training to support our growing Water Resources practice. We encourage you to apply if you possess or would like to gain experience in a broad range of water-related engineering projects, with specific emphasis on industrial stormwater management water resources infrastructure projects. Applicants should be capable of working effectively with teams and clients, and be willing to learn from peers and supervisors  Your Duties Cooperatively support multidisciplinary teams on small- to mid-sized projects and work on several projects concurrently.Perform preliminary and detailed analysis for industrial stormwater runoff.Perform detailed analysis for hydraulic and hydrologic modeling using PCSWMM modeling software.Preparation of studies, design criteria, design reports, plans and specifications, and quality assurance reviews of related designs and construction plans to ensure technical accuracy.Inspect construction for compliance with design drawings and specifications.Assist in project administration including writing reports, gathering information, preparing proposals and budgets, and completing progress reports.Evaluate alternatives and resolve technical questions.Work in a manner to ensure your personal safety and that of fellow employees by following company health and safety guideline and policies.  Your Capabilities and Credentials Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Civil or Water Resources Engineering. Registration as an Engineer-in-Training with APEGA or qualifications to obtain this registration at the start of employment. Strong organizational skills and multitasking ability. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work with engineering staff at all levels. Ability to prepare complete, concise and organized engineering calculations and analyses. Desire to grow in your career in a challenging environment that fosters self-improvement though leadership, mentoring, and a diversity of experience. Strong willingness to be a part of a large global engineering company, and to work with teams in other offices around the world. You will be based out of Calgary, but the position may require occasional project travel throughout western Canada Qualified candidates who are highly motivated and eager to commit to Stantec's strategic initiative to become a Top 10 global design firm should submit their resume and cover letter online at www.stantec.com/careers.

Title: Senior Estimator - Civil Works
Job_Description: 05/01/2018  001477  Long term   Pomerleau is recognized as one of Canada’s leaders in the construction industry, in the institutional, commercial, industrial and civil engineering sectors. Clients benefit from our expertise as general contractor, construction manager, project manager and design-builder.  Pomerleau believes in delivering excellence. Every Pomerleau employee upholds this value, leading to the achievement of superior results in every sector where we do business. Pomerleau: proud individuals who share a vision and are passionate about what they do.  WHAT WILL YOU DO IN A WEEK? :  As Senior Estimator within the Civil division, you will work in collaboration with the Civil Director and other experienced members of your team in sustaining and advancing Pomerleau's growth in Western Canada.  You will be responsible for compiling accurate estimates for projects such as bridges, highways, interchanges and tunnels which will include the following: Analyze plans and specs in a general way to have an overview of the project in order to:Visualize the scope of the work to execute;Find out which specialties are involved in the work;Verify if the project features some special work;Assess the time required to accomplish one’s work while respecting the date to submit the bid.Verify if a site visit is mentioned in the call for bids and inform the head estimator of such a fact;Draw up and send bond and insurance requests for each project in the bid process in collaboration with the administrative assistant;Draw up the list of specialties and the list of subcontractors to reach for each these specialties;Draw up the list of materials and the list of suppliers to reach for each of these materials;Produce the bill of materials for the specialties determined by the head estimator;Provide the purchasing department with the necessary information to search for prices pertaining to some materials used for the project;Prepare the summary of quantities according to the study of the plans and specs for each section of the specs, including relevant information;Set up study in estimation software and include subcontracted tasks, self-performed tasks, work teams, work rates, work ratios, quantities to achieve, etc.;Analyze the project carefully and plan for construction methods involving indirect costs, such as temporary roads and accesses, specific tools, formwork, equipment, site conditions, construction lead times, etc.;Plan and prepare resource table or supervise this work with the methods engineer;Analyze changes in addenda issued during the call for bids period;Set up price binder in collaboration with the administrative assistant for the estimation department;Receive, from subcontractors and suppliers, prices relating to their specialties;Receive , from the purchasing department, prices pertaining to supplier materials;Assist the head estimator in determining material and labor prices for each of the jobs to be performed and in the study of bids received from subcontractors through the BSDQ;Open envelopes from the BSDQ upon receiving them and file prices received in price binder;Make sure all prices received by phone, email, and fax at the BSDQ are complete according to plans and specs of the bid project;Prepare general project costs—supervision, general conditions, offices, insurance, specific equipment, safety, quality, etc.;Take part in bid closing;Establish a preliminary work schedule, including the resources—work force, supervision, equipment—on the construction site;Ensure proper archiving of the bid and assess results;Take part in the transfer meeting.  DO YOU HAVE THESE QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS? :  Post secondary education in Civil Engineering or other construction related programAt least 5 years of relevant experience estimating Civil construction projects for a general contractorPrevious experience with bridges, interchanges and tunnels is strongly preferredGood knowledge in excavation and formworkHigh-level skills in plan and specs readingResults driven, detail oriented and an analytical mindset with a desire to develop a long term career in Estimating WHY JOIN POMERLEAU`S TEAM? :  Competitive salary 4 weeks’ vacation Group insurance (health spending account) Group RRSP Monthly public transit pass paid by employer Fitness center membership: 50% reimbursed by employer Employee assistance program Ongoing training offered throughout the year Young, dynamic environment Excellent career opportunities Summer hours PARTICULARITY:  The retained candidate will be subject to an administrative security check At Pomerleau, we focus on results-oriented, passionate and rigorous people who participate in ambitious and complex projects. You have the profile we are looking for?

Title: Manager, Strategic Infrastructure
Job_Description: THE OPPORTUNITYThe Manager of Strategic Infrastructure leads an engineering team responsible for forecasting the technical direction of municipal infrastructure related to growth and development in the City of Brandon. This will include working closely with:the Asset Management Section in providing information that is consistent in with the Asset Management Governance Policy;the Design and Construction Section to ensure annual work programs complement overall infrastructure strategies; and,the City Planning Section to ensure that the City’s municipal infrastructure needs and concerns are address and consistent with the City of Brandon’s long-term Growth Strategy.Projects vary in scope and size ranging from large subdivisions to complex regional and city-wide utility and infrastructure projects.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESInfrastructure PlanningProvides review and direction on technical projects;Serves as the project manager on various municipal projects;Works with consultants to ensure the City’s infrastructure modelling needs are met;Coordinates with other City departments in related operations;Ensures that future infrastructure is consistent with maintaining the integrity of the water, wastewater, and storm networks in the City;Reviews development proposals to evaluate infrastructure impact, opportunities, and requirements;Partners and collaborates with clients to understand their needs and provide appropriate solutions;Conducts peer reviews of the detailed design of infrastructure projects from time to time;Presents reports and presentations as required to staff, Planning District Board, Planning Commission, City Council and committees;Participates in departmental budget planning (capital and operating);Attends and presents on behalf of the City on area of responsibility at public hearings, evening meetings or public open houses;Provides recommendations and advice to the department heads, City Council, departments/ divisions and the public on a wide variety of infrastructure matters;Liaises with service users and providers to deliver exceptional customer service;Ensures the services of the Section and/or Department are aligned with the City’s vision.Leadership and Employee DevelopmentDirect reports are engineering technicians involved with water, sanitary, storm water and traffic management plans;Participates in initiatives, decisions, committees, and policy development for the Engineering Department;Delivers training to City staff on issues related to the City infrastructure;Liaises with other Departments and Divisions associates on issues to ensure continued operations;Demonstrates a commitment to the organization by actively participating in committees, programs, and organizational initiatives;Influences and inspires others to achieve organizational, individual and departmental goals and objectives;Builds and maintains positive and healthy relationships;Promotes and guides others to understand delivery of effective services and achievement of objectives and their interrelationship;Promotes harmonious employee relations while guiding and coaching the section and department associates.Management and AdministrationDevelops, maintains and coordinates the implementation of Engineering Department policies and programs relating to infrastructure planning and conceptual design with the assistance of the Planning Section and outside agencies which interact with the section;Manages Section staffing including participating in hiring, coordinating, coaching and leading activities, and participating in daily operations and completing payroll functions for Section;Responsible for all aspects of the operating and capital budgets in the strategic infrastructure section, including budget reviews at the pre-determined intervals as directed by Finance;Assists in developing and maintaining capital and operating budgets including collection, evaluation, and compilation of information for submission;Participates in labour management discussions and ensures adherence to applicable collective agreements, legislation, policies, or procedures;Monitors Strategic Infrastructure Section services and identifies and resolves issues.THE PERSONA Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering or related Engineering program;Membership in or ability to acquire membership in the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists in the Province of Manitoba (APEGM) or any other professional association related to one’s qualifications.A proven track record of progressive leadership.Minimum of five (5) years’ experience in infrastructure project management.Minimum of five (5) years’ experience in planning and development of municipal infrastructure.Experience working with collective agreements or corporate policies is preferred.SkillsDemonstrated initiative to plan, organize, and prioritize workload leading to successful implementation of comprehensive programs in a constantly changing dynamic team environment;Demonstrated leadership including establishing focus, providing motivational support, fostering teamwork, and empowering others;Demonstrated effective oral and written communication with the general public, other Division employees, City Council, and external organizations, agencies, and regulatory bodies;Demonstrated success in securing commitment and support for areas of expertise;Proficient use of computer equipment, operating systems, office automation and database software.KnowledgeWorking knowledge of legislation, regulations, policy, etc. relevant to area of expertise;Thorough knowledge of various engineering principles and models used in Municipal Engineering including but not limited to; water distribution, wastewater collection, land drainage and traffic;Knowledge of municipal and Engineering construction materials and knowledge of the practices and equipment used in municipal engineering construction and maintenance;Knowledge of City protocol used to manage situations effectively in all areas of the organization and in the community;Practical knowledge of the principles and practices of long range land use planning and urban growth management as related to the Division, including the Growth Strategy, Development Plan, Secondary Plans, Neighbourhood Plans and the land development process, generally.AbilitiesAbility to conceptualize servicing solutions for the overall City and its component parts;Ability to apply various management concepts and practices to effectively plan, organize and direct the activities of the Section;Ability to assign, plan and direct the work of other team members in a manner conducive to full performance and high morale;Ability to resolve issues timely and in a manner which reflects positivity for the department;Ability to write clear, concise reports and express ideas orally on technical subjects in a manner that provides adequate support of conclusions and recommendations;Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with City employees, consultants, contractors, developers, officials and the general public;Willingness to participate in training and self-development programs;Willingness to adapt to new technological changes and improvements;Ability to hold and maintain a valid Manitoba Class 5 driver’s license.PRIME SKILLS AND ATTRIBUTESLeadership Skills - Demonstrates progressive leadership style while giving guidance and support, a mentor and positive role model combined with a practical and common-sense approach. Progressive forward thinker capable of making a value-added contribution with minimal supervision. Is able to direct people in the meeting of corporate objectives and expectations. Will possess strong interpersonal and motivational skills as they direct and coach their staff. A mentor and positive role model who has the ability to communicate potential opportunities to departments while empowering staff and incorporating the views of others.Management Skills - Demonstrates a style, which actively promotes involvement with, staff, with an emphasis on motivating, strategic thinking and encouragement of people, teams and activities. A proven record of being able to motivate, plan, direct and evaluate people and activities of a broad based municipal organization.Visionary - Understands and interprets trends and management challenges with clarity, energy and confidence.Interpersonal Skills - Works well with people from all disciplines and is sensitive to diverse needs with the proven ability to integrate teams. Ability to deal effectively, both verbally and in writing, with the public and other city departments and agencies, including ability to deal with possible conflict situations effectively. Team player. Ability to handle sensitive and confidential subject matters.A Professional - Acts as an integral part of an administrative team and displays a style with high ethical standards, an honest, open and consistent approach to working with staff and citizens. Believes in involving people in processes to establish priorities and shows sensitivity to changing approaches. Shows strong common sense and intuitive judgement abilities.Action-oriented – Self-motivated and enthusiastic with the ability to work with considerable independence and to demonstrate initiative, creativity and resourcefulness in establishing and achieving business objectives. Possess follow through skills to bring closure to projects. The individual will have foresight and the ability to comprehend potential results arising from complex decisions.Teamwork – Strongly supports a team approach in managing both staff and programs and leads by example.Corporate and Strategic Planning - Provides executive leadership to all planning initiatives and ensures accountability for achievement of results throughout the municipality.Financial Management - A proven ability to work in a fiscal environment of restraint and leads with a strong sense of service. Efficient in budgeting, financing and information reporting. Demonstrates an understanding of financial sustainability.Self-Confidence - Possesses confidence in own skills and abilities, is able to make difficult decisions and stand by them and demonstrate a positive attitude. Able to network effectively and build rapport at all levels of the organization. Ability to work with ambiguity. Committed to personal excellence with strong work ethic. Understands the working of collective agreements and supervising unionized employees.Organizing Skills - Simplifies often complex and lengthy matters and runs an administration that is service-oriented. Ability to quickly prioritize work activity as work is subject to frequent interruptions and conflicting priorities. Ability to work through frequent periods of stress associated with resolving problems and meeting deadlines. Timely decision-making with sound judgment. Detail-oriented, but able to see the “big picture”.Politically Astute - Knows and understands legislative and regulatory processes and has an intuitive ability to read the political implications of recommendations and actions.Customer Service – Confidence in ensuring customer needs are identified and addressed; ensuring appropriate consultation with all stakeholders and timely, cost effective and quality service.Human Resource Management – Requires excellent human resource knowledge and interpersonal skills to work positively with management, staff and unions. Sensitive and caring with the ability to bring diverse individuals and program initiatives together using strong negotiation and conflict resolution skills.COMPENSATIONA competitive compensation package will be provided including an attractive base salary and excellent benefits. Further details will be discussed in a personal interview.FOR INFORMATION: PLEASE CONTACTLaura YoungbergDavies Park530, 1000 – 7 Avenue SWCalgary, AB T2P 5L5Phone: (403) 263-0600Additional information can be found at: www.daviespark.comJob Type: Full-timeExperience:Infrastructure Project Manager: 5 yearsPlanning and Development Municipal: 5 yearsEducation:Bachelor's

Title: Project Manager - Mechanical
Job_Description: Job Field: Project Management Job Type: Full time Length of Assignment:  SUMMARY  BGIS, A Brookfield Company, is looking for a Project Manager - Mechanical to join our growing team! We are currently seeking a Project Manager with mechanical design experience for the Calgary area, who would have to manage several building projects in client leased and owned buildings as well as provide mechanical expertise for mechanical designs/scopes. The type of projects are primarily replacement of electro-mechanical equipment and building components due to end of life, addition of electro-mechanical equipment due to growth of our client's network, increasing electro-mechanical resiliency and upgrade of existing building equipment to meet the latest environmental requirements. Many of these buildings house telecom (voice, internet and TV), IT equipment (data centres), studio’s and offices which are essential to client services, therefore proper planning, scope and risk management are required in the realization of the projects.  The position would be for an intermediate to senior candidate and the individual is expected to be autonomous and would receive some coaching. The position also requires good communication and customer relation with our internal clients.  The Project Manager will perform/have the following duties/responsibilities as regrouped in the three main areas below:  1. Project Delivery in Mission Critical Environments: Replacement or addition of building systems such as electrical, stand-by power, UPS, mechanical, HVAC, plumbing, fire detection, sprinkler, DDC, etc. in buildings housing telecom equipment, data centers, production studios (radio and television); Taking into account building codes, occupational health and labor regulations; Taking into account complexity of construction issues and risk mitigation for work in a live technical environments; Work with internal groups such as program management, engineering. procurement, transaction management and operations teams, internal clients (requester of the project such as telecom, IT or production operating groups) to ensure the appropriate project delivery and maintaining good relations. 2. Project Management Processes and Quality Assurance:  Use project plans, schedules and budgets to ensure the highest quality of delivery in accordance to project requirements (key date and client standards); Ensure that the team (consultants, contractors, Real Estate Engineering, buildings operation) delivers projects for the client, on time, within budget and according to internal customer requirements; Take a pro-active approach in the planning of key activities and therefore eliminate surprises/delays; Obtain competitive prices and ensure that the client receives the maximum value for the products and services; Suggest when appropriate ways to improve existing processes or reduce cost without reducing on required quality 3. Communication and reporting:  Produce reports in order to keep the various internal groups informed on the project progress (schedule and budget), potential problems to come with a mitigation plan; Develop and maintain good working relations with our internal groups (engineering, program, operations and internal clients) in order to demonstrate the added value that the Real Estate groups bring to their business As Mechanical Engineer, the role is to:  Provide technical support to buildings operation when there are mechanical issues on HVAC, water towers, chillers, condensers, CRAH and CRAC units, pumps, valves, sprinkler systems, emergency generator ventilation/exhaust systems Prepare risk mitigation strategies based on reliability and resiliency Base on project requirements (life cycle, growth, de-risk, improvements) provide mechanical technical expertise in preparing the scope/design intent which will then be used to tender for consultant design Work with and review consultant mechanical design to ensure they are as per client Standards and scope Provide mechanical expertise for commissioning of mechanical systems during projects The approximate work load split between the project manager role and mechanical engineering role is expected to be PM = 80% and Mech Eng = 20%). Although the engineer will be located in Calgary, some of the sites that he will have to manage are located in other regions of Alberta such as Edmonton and Manitoba such as Winnipeg both also covers rural sites in those provinces. So the engineer will be expected to travel at times.  Essential skills/competencies:  University degree in Project Management and/or Mechanical Engineering from a recognised university Registered professional engineers in Alberta PMP certification would be preferred A minimum of 5 years of project management and/or construction experience A minimum of 5 years of mechanical system design and construction supervision Experience in managing projects in Data Center or telecommunication industry preferred. Knowledge/experience in use of Project Management software/tools (Microsoft Project, Excel, Power Point, PMWeb, etc.), Good knowledge in the following areas: codes, detailed estimating, SOX Autonomous, but also a team player Flexible to deal with tight deadlines and a quickly changing environment Detail oriented with strong analytical and problem solving skills Fluent in English (oral and written) with excellent communication abilities; knowledge of French (an asset but not mandatory)

Title: Geotechnical / Civil Engineer
Job_Description: As a Geotechnical / Civil Engineer, you will be joining our close-knit Geotechnical/Civil Engineering team working on world-class mining projects which are at the leading edge of emerging technologies in the industry. In this role, you will collaborate with our talented professionals who are committed to delivering high quality engineering solutions to our clients. KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada, United States and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and Saskatchewan and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. This role will give you the opportunity to: Work on a variety of projects including tailings dam design, mine and tailings planning support, mine pit slope design, embankment dams and earthworks design, site characterization, geohazard risk assessment and control, terrain analysis, slope stability assessments, seepage analyses, numerical modeling, and foundation design. Lead project designs including the preparation of technical reports and the development of construction drawings and tender packages. Build and develop strong relationships with our Clients, our multidisciplinary project teams, sub-contractors and other project stakeholders. Use your problem-solving skills to find innovative solutions to technical issues. Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry. Work in a dynamic One Team company culture that supports career development. Contribute to the growth of the Resources Group and engage and mentor junior staff. Travel primarily in Western Canada and potentially to our overseas project locations. If you are registered or eligible to register as a Professional Engineer in Canada, have a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Geotechnical or Civil Engineering and a minimum of 6 years of related tailings and dam engineering experience in mining, we want to hear from you! We value your: Strong initiative and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive towards achieving long-term success. Demonstrated leadership, project management, decision-making and coaching skills, especially your ability to engage, train and mentor young professionals. Flexibility, adaptability and willingness to travel and passion for learning. Ability to work in a performance focused, collaborative team environment. Strong verbal and written communication skills including your experience in writing technical reports and preparing tender documents. Experience in various design software, such as Slope/W or Seep/W. Title: Water Resources Engineer
Job_Description: Dillon is a well established, employee-owned professional consulting firm operating across Canada and internationally. We provide a wide range of consulting and design services related to the infrastructure, real estate, resource, industrial and government sectors in Canada and abroad.  We are currently seeking candidates for the position of Water Resources Engineer in our Calgary office. Management and leadership of client relationships, developing new business opportunities, and the geographic expansion of Dillon’s services. Leadership of technical training and professional guidance to our growing professional and technical staff within the Calgary office. Input to the career development of more junior staff, including technical direction, training recommendations, coaching and mentoring.
