Title: Front-end Developer
Job_Description: We are seeking a Front-end Developer to contribute to converting our large Rails app to an API driven progressive web application. You will help define our patterns and best practices, as well as tune the end user experience and performance issues that come with a transition of this scale. There is an opportunity to be a leader and mentor both technically and culturally within our growing team. <br/><br/> We are a software company thats transforming the practice of law, for good. We provide a world-leading, cloud-based practice management solution for legal professionals that makes their lives simpler and helps them build a better practice. As a Deloitte Technology Fast 50 winner for three years running, and with a team of over 200 global Clions, Clio is one of Canadas fastest growing technology companies. <br/><br/> We are proud to be one of Canadas 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures, and named Employer of the Year by Techvibes. We are a tight-knit group of bright, driven, and genuine individuals who work hard and play to win. Join us. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong> <br/><br/> Our team is proactive, collaborative and passionate about what we do. We value each others opinions and are relentless in our drive to grow, learn and perform at a high level. We don't play the "blame-game", but still hold each other accountable and to a high standard. We are a team that understands we only win by working together.  <ul> <li>3+ years of JavaScript experience in a team environment;</li> <li>Computing Science (or equivalent) degree;</li> <li>Know how to write code that performs at scale;</li> <li>You are curious and are always striving to improve yourself, and your team;</li> <li>You are a rational and critical thinker who seeks solutions when you find problems;</li> <li>You are a humble team player who leads by example.</li> </ul> <strong>What you'll be doing:</strong>  <ul> <li>Delivering customer value through beautiful UIs with CSS and HTML;</li> <li>Modernizing our front-end client, developing in AngularJS with JavaScript/TypeScript;</li> <li>Converting a large Rails app to a API driven progressive web application;</li> <li>Updating our front-end build pipeline from a Rails based implementation to Webpack</li> <li>Shaping how we drive towards that goal and help solve real world problems in the process;</li> <li>Participating in code reviews and paired programming.</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus points if you have:</strong>  <ul> <li>Angular 1.X experience or other modern Javascript framework experience;</li> <li>Have previous experiences from similar environments you are eager to share;</li> <li>Have a record of experimenting with modern JS libraries, paradigms, and patterns.</li> </ul> <strong>Why Clio?</strong> <br/><br/> We could talk to you about our ping pong table, beer taps, yoga classes, and nap room, but, we know youre looking for more than that. Instead, here are a few of the things that set us apart and make us the employer of choice for top talent in Canada and beyond:  <ul> <li>The chance to do work that matters on a product that truly changes lives. This is the place for driven people who want to make their mark.</li> <li>The freedom to choose your own path (and change it) to build a meaningful career that works for you.</li> <li>Excellent health and dental coverage, vacation time, parental leave options and education spending</li> <li>An RRSP matching program</li> <li>Regular games nights and team outings with the best coworkers youll ever work with</li> </ul> <strong>Diversity and Inclusion</strong> <br/><br/> We believe that ensuring diversity and inclusion will produce a better place to work and a better product. We encourage all candidates to apply. <br/><br/> You must be eligible to work in Canada.

Title: Director, Software Engineering
Job_Description: Here’s what you need to know about our <strong>Product</strong> team: The BlueCat Product team prides ourselves on our diversity and innovation at our core. Delivery of a quality and cutting edge product is our priority. Most importantly, we always have fun while doing it. We run an Agile shop across all three of our products and rely on product demos and daily standups to keep each other in the loop on all of the amazing things that are happening at BlueCat while keeping each other transparent and challenged. <br/><br/> BlueCat is looking for a Director, Software Development to work in our Toronto Head Quarters. <br/><br/> The Director role will be responsible for multiple agile teams that are building massively scalable SaaS products in the networking and network security space. You’ll be directly responsible for managers and team leads who will benefit from your experience with AWS based SaaS application development. We have a large and growing group of talented engineers leveraging AWS, Docker and microservices architectures. You’ll work closely with a variety of dynamic teams, including Product Management, Architecture, Operations and Customer Care, understanding what it takes lead great teams that build great software. You are expected to guide, mentor and get the best out of everyone while having fun. <br/><br/> The most important aspect of this team is that we’re never satisfied with status quo. We continually learn, adapt and extend. BlueCat is an agile shop, so we expect you to Get Sh!t Done by experimenting, failing, learning and most importantly, pushing forward. <br/><br/> BlueCat is a highly collaborative place to work. We prefer walking up to someone’s desk over sending an email. We support, thank and congratulate each other. <br/><br/> <strong>This job might be for you if you:</strong> <ul> <li>Have spent the last decade successfully building, deploying and managing massively large scale distributed internet systems and products</li><li>Have spent the past 5 years managing multiple agile teams</li><li>Have actually used AWS as part of a solution in production and are cozy with continuous delivery and continuous deployment topics</li><li>Are extremely comfortable when navigating the world of open source tools and frameworks</li><li>Are comfortable communicating with people at all levels, both written and verbal</li> </ul> <strong>You’re practically a shoe in if you:</strong> <ul> <li>Are motivated by helping your teams grow as much as by working on cool technology</li><li>Have experimented with data analytics and machine learning</li> </ul> <strong>BlueCat’s core values are:</strong> <ul> <li>Curiosity - We care and inquire about the challenges and needs of our customers.</li><li>Clarity - We keep communication crisp, clear, and responsive.</li><li>Collaboration - We win with each other, never alone.</li><li>Transparency - We ensure all relevant information is available – no questions are off limits.</li><li>Ownership - We are responsible and accountable for getting things done.</li> </ul> <strong>What you’ll get from us:</strong> <br/><br/> Fast growth for BlueCat means fast growth for you! With the world’s biggest and hottest logos as our clients, we are a well-established business that still operates with the fun culture of a start-up. We get to work hard and still have all the fun without all of the risk! Experienced leaders make sure we keep going to the moon and beyond. <br/><br/> While we’re growing together, we’ll have your back with solid compensation/bonuses, education budgets, record breaking sales quarters, and a company culture that values curiosity, clarity, collaboration, transparency and ownership. <br/><br/> If you’re as excited about the future of our company as we are, we would love to hear from you! <br/><br/> Accommodations will be provided throughout the recruitment, hiring and employment process in accordance with the AODA and the Ontario Human Rights Code.

Title: SharePoint Solution Developer/Architect
Job_Description: <strong>Company:</strong> <br/><br/> Solvera Solutions is a leader in the delivery of innovative IT and business solutions to the western Canadian market, helping our clients leverage the power of technology to achieve transformational growth. Solvera’s two-pronged business strategy of providing exceptional client care and people care has fuelled the company’s impressive growth and firmly established Solvera’s reputation for providing highly capable local resources and high quality results in SAP Solutions, Strategic Consulting, and Business Solutions service areas. <br/><br/> Solvera is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies and enjoys a very positive reputation as one of Canada’s Best Small and Medium Employers. <br/><br/> <strong>Application Services:</strong> <br/><br/> Solvera Architects, Developers and Business Analysts provide top-quality Java, .NET, C++, Visual Basic and/or SharePoint consulting services to clients across western Canada. Solvera’s development team composition ranges from relatively recent graduates to the best and most experienced in the industry. We provide a dynamic working and learning environment that leverages the contributions of the entire team and provides enhanced mentoring for emerging resources. <br/><br/> Solvera has an immediate need for an experienced SharePoint Solution Architect to support clients with solution architecture services. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Developing and implementing architecture and development models and frameworks</li> <li>Conducting systems analysis, collecting business requirements, defining functional specifications and developing use cases</li> <li>Developing, testing, implementing and supporting SharePoint applications</li> <li>Working on assigned development projects which will include a number of applications requiring new development, or upgrades/enhancements</li> <li>Working effectively within a team, supporting other members of the team in achieving business objectives and providing client services</li> </ul> <strong>Desired Skills and Experience:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Completion of a recognized post-secondary education program in Information Technology</li> <li>Three or more years of application architecture experience specifically relating to SharePoint</li> <li>Capacity to understand the broader implications of business strategy across all business units</li> <li>Previous experience designing business services and core business processes</li> <li>Previous experience eliciting, formulating, functional and non-functional requirements</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal communication skills and ability to work well in a team environment</li> <li>Ability to communicate technical ideas using non-technical language</li> <li>Microsoft SharePoint Certification (MCTS) an asset</li> <li>Fluency in written and oral English</li> <li>Ability to work legally in Canada</li> <li>Relocation assistance is not available for this position</li> </ul> <strong>Reporting Relationship</strong> <br/><br/> In addition to reporting to a specified person on client assignments, Solvera consultants report directly to a Solvera Delivery Manager, with dotted line reporting to their Practice Leader on professional development matters. <br/><br/> <strong>Total Compensation:</strong> <br/><br/> Solvera’s total compensation program includes market-competitive base compensation, bonus opportunities to recognize individual and corporate success and an outstanding benefits package.

Title: Engineer, Operations
Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 17961 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the manager, Autonomous Haul System (AHS) Engineering, you will be accountable to collect and analyze performance data from both field and office environments. This is a dynamic role, where you will interact within a multi-functional team to continually assess and optimize our AHS fleet output. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Demonstrate safety leadership for yourself and others consistently</li><li>Provide in-depth understanding of AHS operations data with an emphasis on data integrity and standardization across all work teams</li><li>Perform frequent and varied data analysis and create unique reports for distribution to mining teams</li><li>Lead the change management process through version upgrades for Front Runner and any other major upgrades impacting the our AHS operations teams</li><li>Build and execute scopes for production studies on all aspects of the autonomous load-haul-place cycle</li><li>Collaborate with the operations team regularly to examine and investigate performance focus areas</li><li>Conduct field investigations such as time motion studies, payload performance and specific equipment performance areas</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education: <ul> <li>Minimum five years of large scale open pit mine operations experience, including both field and technical roles; oil sands experience is critical</li><li>Experience in autonomous mining operation is highly desirable</li><li>University degree in mining engineering or related field</li><li>Professional Engineering designation with APEGA or eligibility to register with APEGA</li><li>High School Diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)</li><li>Possess a valid driver’s licence and a clean driving record</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge: <ul> <li>Strong understanding of oil sands mine operating practices, including technical knowledge and process skills</li><li>Excellent change management skills with the ability to think tactically and strategically</li><li>Familiarity with Modular Mining Systems dispatch software is an asset</li><li>Strong analytical skills and proficiency in Microsoft Excel with a proven foundation in SQL and VBA</li><li>Focus on teamwork with a track record of effective interaction within a multi-disciplinary team environment</li><li>You constantly ask what could go wrong and check for out-of-the-ordinary conditions and learn to anticipate potential problems</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>This position will initially be based in Fort McMurray, Alberta and will then transition to a position in Calgary, Alberta with frequent site travel</li><li>The schedule is seven days on, seven days off while in Fort McMurray</li><li>While in Fort McMurray, transportation and housing will be provided</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Engineering

Title: Industrial Engineering Analyst
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/>  <div> <strong>Industrial Engineering Analyst</strong><br/><br/><strong>City:</strong> Calgary / <strong>State:</strong> Alberta</div><br/>  <div>At EVRAZ North America, we manufacture engineered steel products for rail, energy and industrial end markets at six production sites located in the USA (Portland, Oregon; Pueblo, Colorado) and Canada (Regina, Saskatchewan; Calgary, Camrose and Red Deer, Alberta). We are the largest North American producer by volume in the rail and large diameter pipe markets, and we hold leading positions in the Western Canada oil country tubular goods, small diameter pipe and West Coast plate markets.<br/><br/><strong>Job Description and Responsibilities</strong><br/><br/>EVRAZ is seeking an Industrial Analyst for our Calgary facility. This new role will analyze production methods and data by studying key inputs and outputs at all stages of EVRAZ’s production model. The successful candidate will be a strong partner to our operations teams and drive strategies that leverage materials and resources to generate the highest productivity and efficiency at the lowest cost of production. This position reports to the Director of Operations.  <ul> <li>Review of material flows, determine potential improvements to reduce pipe handling</li> <li>Determination of optimal plant load balance through analysis of optimal crew levels per line on tons of production</li> <li>Analysis of headcount per line and determines operators availability based on work load</li> <li>Review of cycle times; determine cycle activities subject to improvement and conducts bench marks with similar lines to determine actions to improve cycle times</li> <li>Study of change overs: utilize SMED type methodology to improve change over times</li> <li>Examine material yield losses, determines technological losses vs. scrap losses and completes analysis of potential technological and control improvements to reduce yield losses</li> <li>Conversion cost analysis: break cost down between “price” and “consumption” and help determining actions to reduce “consumption” or alternatives to overall improve cost per ton</li> <li>Determine production capacity of lines (existing and future)</li> <li>Support basic engineering designs of new lines or modifications to existing lines to have optimal performance</li> <li>Assist engineering team to calculate investment benefits (IRR, NPV, etc.)</li> <li>Utilize lean tools to support continues improvement of plant performance</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Requirements</strong>   <ul> <li>Industrial or Manufacturing Engineer, Engineering Technologist</li> <li>Self-starter with the ability to multi-task while maintaining accuracy and meet deadlines</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Lean tools training</li> <li>Excellent skills in MS Office Excel and Word</li> <li>Proficient with AutoCAD</li> <li>Knowledge of simulation software (i.e. Arena or ProModel) is recommended</li> </ul> <strong>All applicants must be legally able to work in Canada without sponsorship.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>EVRAZ is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Individuals with Disabilities, and Veterans.</strong> <br/><br/> At EVRAZ North America, we manufacture steel. We also manufacture excellence, drive success and build careers for our employees. Our people come from diverse backgrounds, but share a common set of values and the same goal of creating the best possible solution for our customers. <br/><br/> With more than 4,500 team members in the U.S. and Canada, EVRAZ offers well-paying jobs and a comprehensive range of employee benefits. Our total compensation package includes benefits such as:  <ul> <li>Competitive wages and bonus opportunities</li> <li>Family medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost</li> <li>Short and long term disability programs</li> <li>Competitive retirement plans</li> <li>Paid vacations</li> <li>Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company</li> <li>Tuition reimbursement</li> <li>Wellness program</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>

Title: UI Developer
Job_Description: <div><div> <strong>UI Developer</strong><br/><br/>We can transform banking, reimagine it, make banking work for people. We’re on a journey to make meaningful impacts on an industry that has the power to transform a person’s life. When we talk about transformation at ATB Financial, we’re not just talking about pie in the sky ideas, we’re listening and collaborating to bring those ideas to life. To put it simply, we’re on a mission to reinvent how banking can support people's lives. We’re going to provide meaningful solutions to problems, deepen our connection with customers and while we’re at it, transform ourselves from the inside out.  <br/><br/> We need collaborative visionaries and executors who are eager to listen to our customers in order to do things other banks wouldn’t do. We’re building a team of relentless, passionate and inquisitive ATB transformers to build our bench strength in disrupting ourselves before we get disrupted.  <br/><br/> Want to be a part of our story? If you’re looking for an organization where you can use your talents to do remarkable things, you may be the alpha to our beta and we encourage you to read on. <br/><br/> <strong>TEAM TRANSFORMATION:</strong> <br/><br/> We’re invested in transparency being a key part of our recruitment process, so we encourage you to check out and join our Team Transformation Talent Community on LinkedIn to gain real insight on our culture and what it's really like to be an ATB Transformer. You can check it out and join us at https://www.linkedin.com/groups/13551363. <br/><br/> Also, to learn more our work and the transformative projects we have on the go connect with us at https://atbalphabeta.com/. <br/><br/> <strong>THE OPPORTUNITY:</strong> <br/><br/> As part of the Digital Transformation pillar at ATB, you will be working directly with a new team that is creating a new set of digital products and experiences for people that embrace technology and want to think about banking in a different way. <br/><br/> We are looking for UI Developers to turn designs into code to create incredible user experiences. You will work with the UX designers to define how the application looks and feels and implementing reusable components that the development team can use.  <br/><br/> <strong>You will find success based on your ability to:</strong> <ul> <li>Collaborate with designers and other stakeholders on the User Experience Design</li> <li>Develop new front end components as defined in the Style Guide</li> <li>Create reusable, testable code</li> <li>Update and maintain components as designs evolve based on testing & feedback</li> <li>Optimize components for speed and re-usability</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:</strong> <ul> <li>Strong capabilities in HTML5 and CSS</li> <li>Experience with SCSS, Lodash, styled-components, or similar style-focused JS libraries is an asset</li> <li>Experience with Bootstrap or React-Bootstrap</li> <li>Experience with React, Redux, Jest, and Webpack or similar JS libraries</li> <li>Full-Stack experience is an asset</li> <li>Knowledge of functional and object-oriented programming paradigms</li> <li>Good understanding of modern Javascript single page applications</li> <li>Experienced with Agile methodologies</li> <li>Experience with collaboration tools such as Slack, G-Suite, JIRA, Confluence and others</li> <li>Proven experience in a technology related position or field is an asset, but above everything else curiosity, hunger, inquisitiveness and passion are required!</li> </ul> <strong>ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>You focus on impact over hard work:</strong> what isn't of a concern is the hours you work, but your results and impact on team members and customers</li> <li><strong>You like to solve difficult problems, together:</strong> no one said transforming banking was going to be easy, but we’re collectively reimagining it and there are no solo heroes welcome</li> <li><strong>You operate with a mentality of Build-Measure-Learn:</strong> our agile mindset is not just for our technical teams, it's a mindset that every one of us is asked to operate from. We move fast, we make mistakes but we measure the impact, learn, grow and change as a result </li> <li><strong>You focus on 10X and leave the incremental thinking at home:</strong> if something doesn't have significant impact, you are the person to challenge whether or not it's worth doing</li> <li><strong>You do it with passion or not at all:</strong> you’re inspired by our purpose and you see the link between yourself and the work you are doing to transform banking </li> <li><strong>You’re comfortable with being uncomfortable:</strong> we won’t always have the answers and change is a constant in our world. As a Transformer you trust in our vision and own an attitude of willingness and patience </li> </ul> As a team member with the Transformation team at ATB, you can expect:  <ul> <li>No day will ever be the same - we’re learning, iterating and making big steps towards our vision of transforming an entire industry, everyday</li> <li>The ability to grow a career within an inspiring, impact focused culture where you are surrounded by changemakers and leaders that empower you to use your voice to make banking work for people</li> <li>To be a part of the energy of an organization that is unlike any other, where you may pinch yourself on the daily and wonder how you got so lucky</li> <li>Bragging rights! You get to call yourself a Transformer and an ATBer and know you play a direct role in helping us become a cutting edge financial institution (it’s going to feel more like a technology company, but either way it’s hella cool.) </li> </ul>   <br/> And being part of ATB Financial you get: <ul> <li>An excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. </li> <li>Amazing benefits for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments needs.</li> <li>Be a part of an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans.</li> </ul> If you want to know more, read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page. <br/><br/> Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the high number of resumes we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> If your application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview. <br/><br/> Please click the following link for information on communities where ATB thrives. <br/><br/> #LI-PRIO</div>  </div>  <br/>Apply

Title: Communications Protocol Developer
Job_Description: Open Systems International, Inc. (OSI) www.osii.com is a fast-paced, growing, high technology company, headquartered in Medina, Minnesota. As a world leader in the Operations Technology (OT) field, OSI develops and supplies state-of-the-art energy management, optimization and control software solutions to energy utility companies worldwide. <br/><br/> In this position, you will create compelling applications that enable our customers to view, control and analyze their electrical infrastructure. All of this is done using the latest technologies in a fast-paced, collaborative environment at our forward-looking company. Specific, on-the-job training will be provided. In this position, you will have the following responsibilities: <ul>  <li>Develop the applications that collect data from millions of sensors, integrating protocol data, qualities, and timestamps into OSI's SCADA product infrastructure.</li>  <li>Design APIs, interfaces and process interaction data flows to optimize performance, ensure no data loss and maximize throughput.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Bachelors or Masters degree from an accredited institution in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field.</li> <li>5+ years of experience in protocol development.</li> <li>C development skills plus experience in one or more of the following: C#, C++, Java, Python, etc.</li> <li>Networking knowledge and protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, DNS, XMPP, HTTP, MSRP, XCAP, SOAP, REST, DNP, etc.).</li> <li>Familiar with platform independent tools and libraries.</li> <li>Strong attention to detail with background in practical understanding of industry-standard protocols and devices.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> OSI offers a comprehensive benefit package including bonuses, profit sharing and a generous amount of paid time off and paid holidays. Additional perks include casual dress code, flexible work hours, free beverages, employee events, onsite fitness center, exciting travel opportunities, employee referral bonus programs, and monthly birthday and anniversary celebrations. Check out our <strong>Life at OSI</strong> Facebook page to see more. <br/><br/> As an employee of OSI you will have access to cutting edge technologies in a fun, professional, positive and dynamic work environment. We have excellent opportunities for growth and development.

Title: Business Development Manager (DM)
Job_Description: We are looking for a <strong>Business Development Manager</strong> (District Manager) to promote our services to small local businesses. <ul> <li>Motivated/Self-starter individual</li> <li>Sales Professional that thrives in an independent work environment, meeting with business owners and entrepreneurs every day</li><li>The ideal candidate should enjoy both prospecting for new clients and meeting with existing clients</li><li>Sales Management aspirations and/or experience is welcome as we usually promote from within</li> </ul> <strong>Job Type</strong>: Full-time <br/><br/> <strong>Excellent Compensation</strong>: Salary + Commission + Bonus + Monthly Expense <br/><br/> <strong>Earning Potential</strong>: $70,000.00 to $100,000.00 /year <br/><br/> <strong>Benefits</strong>: Medical, Dental, Eye care, Prescription Drugs, RRSP Matched Contribution, Life Insurance/LTD Coverage <br/><br/> This position requires access to a vehicle and a valid driver’s licence. <br/><br/> Apply now! <br/><br/> <em>CFIB is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities through the interview process and while employed. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.</em>

Title: Specialist, Engineering Inspection
Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 22463 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the director of asset integrity, your knowledge and experience will guide Suncor’s direction in pressure equipment integrity management (PEIM) to enable safe, and reliable operation of our assets. You will drive operational excellence around inspection of pressure equipment by acting as leader of inspection collaboration groups and by providing your expertise across all Suncor operations on critical pressure equipment inspection programs and high risk issues. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Lead the Suncor inspection technical excellence network, a collaboration group of inspection specialists representing all Suncor facilities</li><li>Ensure rapid and quality resolution to high criticality pressure equipment inspection and materials issues when requested by a business unit, which may include failure investigations and root cause analysis, as well as recommendations to operate, repair or replace equipment.</li><li>Share any findings that may be applicable to the wider Suncor enterprise</li><li>Drive operational excellence by identifying and closing gaps in pressure equipment inspection, materials and reliability practices by preparing training or developing new documents</li><li>Evaluate, introduce, disseminate, and apply new inspection techniques, standard methodologies and insights from outside Suncor by acting as a corporate representative to industry committees and networks, such as API, AFPM, CGSB and ASNT</li><li>Manage and provide guidance on selection, deployment, implementation and upkeep of static equipment inspection database software</li><li>Provide mentorship on turnaround inspection work scope establishment, review and challenges</li><li>Promote continuous improvement by participating in audits related to best practices, standards, owner-user programs, risk based work scope reviews (RBSR) and other initiatives</li><li>Support equipment and pipeline integrity assessments, life predictions, life extension studies, and inspection interval planning</li><li>Travel to sites and go to the field when required to provide support on critical issues</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education: <ul> <li>20 or more years of inspection experience with pressure equipment in the oil refining and Oil Sands industries</li><li>Registration as a professional engineer is not required, but is an asset</li><li>API, CGSB, ASNT, CWB, AWS, NACE or other Inspection certifications are an asset</li><li>Possess a valid driver’s license and a clean driving record</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge: <ul> <li>Hands-on experience in PEIM in facilities, including quality assurance and quality control, inspection, engineering, NDE, maintenance and repair, and inspection record keeping, as well as degradation mechanisms, prevention and control.</li><li>Corrosion hazard assessments (corrosion control documents and integrity operating windows), piping and pipeline integrity management plans, equipment integrity plans, risk-based inspection programs, owner-user programs and fitness for service assessments</li><li>Process unit equipment types, operation, and the typical damage mechanisms in refineries and upgraders</li><li>Inspection turnaround scope development and planning processes</li><li>API, ASME, ASTM, AWS, NACE, NBIC, ISO, CGSB, CSA, and other codes, standards, recommended practices, or jurisdictional requirements for pressure equipment in Alberta, Ontario, Quebec, BC, and Colorado</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Engineering

Title: Embedded Software Developer
Job_Description: Building our People and our Products is what Inspires Us. <br/><br/> Job Posting for: Embedded Software Developer <br/><br/> Reports to: Engineering Manager, Firmware <br/><br/> Location:Calgary <br/><br/> Employment Type: Permanent, Full-time <br/><br/> <strong>About the Company</strong> <br/><br/> INOVA aspires to be THE land seismic technology company by developing reliable seismic instruments that enable geophysical service providers to efficiently design and execute complex seismic acquisition programs on behalf of our energy and production customers around the world. <br/><br/> We are a global organization with technical professionals who focus on innovation in land seismic product development to ensure our products remain on the cutting-edge of innovation, guided by the practical reality of what contractors require to reliably execute complex seismic programs in the most difficult operating environments. In addition, we manufacture these innovative seismic instruments with a strong commitment to quality and safety. Our global sales and service teams market our innovative products and concentrate on providing Best in Class customer satisfaction. <br/><br/> <strong>Purpose of the Job:</strong> <br/><br/> The Embedded Software Developer will be a key member of the firmware team. This employee will deliver and support a package of high quality, feature rich firmware for INOVAs land seismic data acquisition systems for oil and gas exploration. <br/><br/> Duties and job requirements include, but are not limited to: <br/><br/> Responsible for the design and development of embedded software in a Microsoft Windows environment as part of a team of embedded software and hardware developers <br/> Perform the testing and integration of firmware and software with other components of the system <br/> Responsible for submitting software to a version control system using bug tracking software <br/> Work in accordance with all legislation and company policy requirements pertaining to employee safety, health and wellness <br/><br/> <strong>Education and Work Experience:</strong> <br/><br/> 2- 5 years experience in developing software for embedded real-time multithreaded applications <br/> Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Mathematics or Physics <br/><br/> <strong>Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Previous experience with multiprocessor and FPGA based designs <br/> Familiarity with embedded RTOSs such as VxWorks, eCos, FreeRTOS <br/> Strong C/C++ programming and debugging skills <br/> Experience with Eclipse development environment and GNU toolchain <br/> Excellent analytic, problem solving, and troubleshooting skills <br/> Preferred skills: Device drivers for control of hardware circuits and interfaces including Flash, EEPROM, SPI, I2C, USB, RS-232, and 1-wire; ARM, MSP430, and Nios processors <br/> Working knowledge of digital oscilloscopes, analyzers, and JTAG debuggers <br/><br/> We sincerely thank you for your interest in this position, however, we will only contact applicants selected for an interview.

Title: Software Development Manager!
Job_Description: Who we are <br/><br/> We have built Curve Dental into an industry-leading provider of beautiful cloud software for the dental industry. With development operations based in Calgary for over 12 years, we recently received private equity investment (Battery Ventures) so that we can accelerate our growth and further dominate the dental software industry. <br/><br/> Who we are looking for <br/><br/> We employ developers who are passionate about software development and technically excellent. Our developers work across the full stack of an application and understand that a project is not done until it has been deployed to production for our users. We want developers who can contribute positively to our culture and teach us things we didn't know before. Those same developers are always hungry to learn and improve in any way they can. <br/><br/> Our development managers combine all of the above alongside superior leadership and people skills, a talent for project management and taking on a scrum-master role, expert-level technical ability and the desire to promote quality and standards in all areas of building product, and a true desire to build high-performing teams. Let's not forget the love of getting hands well and truly dirty in code too! <br/><br/> If you want to be coding all day every day then this is NOT the opportunity for you; please check out our Full Stack Software Developer posting. Otherwise read on, my friend... <br/><br/> Things were looking for in terms of more specific skill-sets and experience: <br/><br/> 3+ years of experience leading or managing software developers for a software company building large-scale web applications using open source technologies <br/> 8+ years of experience building large scale enterprise software <br/> Experience mentoring and leading software engineers and small teams through strong interpersonal and organisational skills <br/> Experience writing user stories and breaking down high-level requirements into smaller well-defined work tasks <br/> Extensive programming experience in a language that demands strong OO skills (C# / Java / C++ / etc.). Note that we don't use all these technologies; these are examples of the types of skills we look for. Experience with PHP is a definite plus, as is experience with REST. Ideally, youve been coding since you were old enough to read. <br/> Extensive experience working with JavaScript frameworks in a rich web application. Experience with AngularJS and Angular is a definite plus. <br/> Code reviews are a part of everyday life in your work (both as a reviewer and reviewee) <br/> Advanced knowledge of how applications interact with databases, mainly through ORM technologies and also through stored procedures, triggers, etc. <br/> Proficiency in Unix / Linux environments <br/> Evangelism of automated testing in all its forms in your previous work; you've written way more unit tests than application code. <br/> Project management experience (specifically with Agile Scrum teams) with a solid track record of delivering high-quality software within estimated times while handling multiple sizable projects concurrently. <br/> Ability to lead constructive and objective estimation sessions with a view to longer term project planning <br/> Ability to effectively manage dependencies and remove obstacles to ensure team productivity <br/> Keeps stakeholders proactively informed about project status and plans <br/> Experience working and collaborating with many different areas of a business such as product management, software architects, business analysts, user experience designers and customer support teams. <br/> Experience of recruiting software developers is a bonus <br/><br/> How to Apply <br/><br/> Send your resume to devjobs@curvedental.com with the subject line YOUR NAME: Software Development Manager! Remember to make the name substitution, select the level of experience you have and to include the exclamation mark :-) <br/><br/> Don't just send us your standard cover letter; simply answer the following 3 questions: <br/><br/> What do you know about our business and industry? <br/> Why is what we do important to our clients? <br/> What is your favourite aspect of our business, and why? <br/><br/> This particular role is at Curve Dental's office in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. To find out more about Curve Dental and what it's like to work with us go to www.curvedental.com/jobs.

Title: QA (Software) and Regulatory Manager
Job_Description: Who we are looking for <br/><br/> We have built Curve Dental into an industry-leading provider of beautiful cloud software for the dental industry. With development operations based in Calgary for over 12 years, we recently received private equity investment (Battery Ventures) so that we can accelerate our growth and further dominate the dental software industry. <br/><br/> In this position you will lead a team of QA analysts that test every release of our SaaS product, Curve Hero. Your team will be responsible for manual and automated testing, including building new automation and analyzing the results. You will work with teams across the company to coordinate and schedule testing resources, and raise issues to senior management when necessary. Though not heavily involved in the day to day testing you may need to occasionally roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty by reviewing test plans, test cases and test results and sometimes even testing things yourself. <br/><br/> This position is also responsible for overseeing the companys ISO certification process and quality management system. In this role you will coordinate all necessary activities and resources to ensure that the company successfully maintains its ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 13485:2016 certification. You will also work with senior management to help ensure that medical device licensing is maintained for our product. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Management <br/><br/> Manage a QA team made up of QA Analysts, Software Developers in Test who are focused on manual and automated testing (as well as regulatory personnel as the team grows) <br/> Lead resource management across projects, recruiting, mentorship, and performance management for the QA team <br/> Work with senior management to track and manage budgetary and resourcing needs for the QA team <br/> Report on overall team and departmental performance to senior management <br/><br/> Process <br/><br/> Responsible for the overall QA process for manual and automated testing <br/> Responsible for driving quality across all disciplines, providing guidance, feedback, and suggestions to improve quality practices across the company <br/> Establish, build and grow an automated testing discipline within the company <br/> Define and evolve ongoing QA process improvements including management of QA outputs, work processes, adoption and implementation of best practices and tools, etc <br/> Establish methods for monitoring and reporting on overall product quality and test coverage with a view to improving both <br/><br/> Product <br/><br/> Work with project leads to plan, estimate and coordinate QA resources, activities and dependencies in order to meet project needs and deliverables <br/> Work with project leads to define and monitor quality objects and report on overall product quality with a view to meeting and exceeding those objectives <br/> Review QA outputs including test plans, test cases, and results for quality, consistency and appropriateness <br/> Ensure QA resources are delivering on project needs <br/><br/> Regulatory <br/><br/> Oversee the ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 13485:2016 Quality Management System <br/> Plan and coordinate activities required to maintain ISO certification (under MDSAP) including audits <br/> Coordinate regulatory (Health Canada and FDA) filings as needed to maintain medical device licensing, working with senior management <br/> Coordinate cross functional stakeholders and contributors in the process of maintaining and improving the Quality management System <br/> Ensure that company stakeholders are following defined standard operating procedures <br/> Periodically review changes to FDA and Health Canada Medical Device Regulations and manage impacts to the quality management system <br/> Periodically conduct internal audits on the quality management system processes <br/><br/> <strong>Key Job Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Must Haves:</strong> <br/> 5 years of experience in hands-on testing and 3 years of experience as a manager <br/> Hands on experience in both manual and automation testing <br/> Strong technical background with experience in web technologies <br/> Strong familiarity with the tools that agile development and QA teams use for managing their work <br/> Ability to plan, estimate and coordinate tasks and resources is a must. Some experience with project management is a bonus. <br/> Strong verbal and written communications skills <br/> Ability to work closely with cross functional teams at all levels of the organization <br/> Post-secondary education in engineering, computer science, information systems, or other related field <br/><br/> <strong>Nice to haves, but not mandatory:</strong> <br/> Familiarity with ISO 9001 and 13485 quality standards and quality management systems <br/> Familiarity with FDA and Health Canada Medical Device Regulations <br/><br/> How to Apply <br/><br/> Send your resume to qajobs@curvedental.com with the subject line YOUR NAME: QA (Software) and Regulatory Manager! Remember to make the name substitution, and to include the exclamation mark :-) <br/><br/> Don't just send us your standard cover letter; simply answer the following 3 questions: <br/><br/> What do you know about our business and industry? <br/> Why is what we do important to our clients? <br/> What is your favourite aspect of our business, and why? <br/><br/> This particular role is at Curve Dental's office in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. To find out more about Curve Dental and what it's like to work with us go to www.curvedental.com/jobs

Title: Reliability Engineer
Job_Description: Our role is to provide top level technical talent to some of the planets strongest companies in the energy and technology industries, as well as the public sector. This is where you come in. We have a distinctly different approach to our contractor engagement and have a team of specialists to ensure success on your assignment. <br/> Our Calgary Downtown Energy client is seeking a Reliability Engineer to support with a push of 6-7 projects that require execution in 2018. As a Reliability Engineer, you will be responsible for analyzing SAGD oil sands operating data, maintenance history, and reliability data to identify opportunities and propose recommendations. This role will work alongside 4 other Reliability Engineers with blended experience in both Analytics and Steam who are highly collaborative, share knowledge, and driven to impact the bottom line. <br/> With standard working hours, this is a 10-month contract, based out of our clients Calgary office with some travel to Sunrise Oilsands required (once every several months). The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, focused, collaborative, and highly analytical with the ability to read, analyze, and identify data into tangible information. <br/> Job Responsibilities include:Analyze equipment performance based on operating data and maintenance history. Ensure that equipment is operating close to design parameters to identify efficiency degradation, optimize energy consumption, and minimize waste. <br/> Periodically review equipment maintenance records to identify recurring problems. Evaluate preventive (PM) and predictive (PdM) maintenance programs and recommend solutions. <br/> Review SAP data and make recommendations about the quality of data - problem description, cause and damage codes, and work description. High quality SAP data is essential to applying reliability concepts and analytics. <br/> Perform asset criticality review and validate existing FMEA to confirm relevance of the FMEA <br/> Apply engineering concepts and operational knowledge to resolve equipment performance and reliability issues. <br/><br/> Qualifications:4 to 6 years of experience with SAGD technologies and processes <br/> Knowledgeable about Defect Elimination (DE), Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) and Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA) processes <br/> Demonstrated experience with developing business cases based on reliability data <br/> Knowledgeable about the concepts of Lean Six Sigma (LSS) <br/> Good working knowledge of MS Office <br/> Proficiency within SAPs PPM module <br/> Effective interpersonal, innovation, and organizational skills <br/> Strong presentation skills; the ability to understand audiences and relay messages/goals in a way thats understood <br/><br/> Education/Experience:2 or more years of experience with conventional and/or heavy oil production, and/or refining technologies and processes <br/> P.Eng or eligibly to register as a P.Eng <br/> Experience working within reliability software such as Meridium <br/> Knowledgeable about condition monitoring technologies such as vibration, ultrasound, infrared, and lubricant analysis <br/><br/> <strong>About the Ian Martin Group:</strong> <br/> Founded by engineers to support the needs of technical organizations, the Ian Martin Group has been creating authentic connections around meaningful work since 1957. As North Americas most progressive recruitment and project-staffing firm, we specialize in engineering and IT recruiting to help organizations of all sizes hire better. The Ian Martin Group is a certified B Corporation, which means we meet comprehensive standards that measure our impact on employees, suppliers, community, and the environment. <br/> We will review applications as they are received, and we will contact candidates whose skills and experience best suit this role. <br/> <strong>EWEMI</strong>

Title: Business Development Director Franchising
Job_Description: We’re on a journey to become the ‘bank of choice’ for the franchising sector. We’re looking for enthusiastic people with the business development, sales and analytical skills to provide industry-leading financial solutions that continue to differentiate BMO in this growing and diverse sector. <br/><br/> BMO’s financing programs meet the unique needs of franchise networks from start-up to multi-unit consolidations. We’re building our reputation in the franchising sector, and opportunities to provide banking and financing solutions are available. Our holistic approach to the franchising sector is complemented by our partnership with BMO Business Banking, BMO Retail Banking, BMO Private Banking and BMO Capital Markets. <br/><br/> BMO expansion includes introducing Business Development Directors as franchising sector market leaders into six regions nationally with high concentrations of franchise networks. <br/><br/> What is the opportunity? <br/><br/> Reporting directly to the Head, Franchise Sector, the Business Development Director is accountable for the implementation of the franchising sector strategy to optimize the client experience and loyalty, drive sales results and maximize sustainable profitability in alignment with BMO’s risk appetite. <br/><br/> What will you do? <br/><br/> The Business Development Director acts as the industry segment leader for their designated geographic region. They will represent BMO in external communications including promotional opportunities including industry conferences and symposia, on professional committees and in community activities, all to network for profitable client relationships. <br/><br/> The Business Development Director will: <br/><br/> • Generate new and profitable business in the franchise industry segment; <br/><br/> • Define the desired client experience within their region; <br/><br/> • Maintain an active outreach with key clients and prospects, and to work collaboratively with the district business banking team to identify prospective clients, drive growth and aid in retention efforts of the franchise portfolio; <br/><br/> • Leverage partnerships with internal BMO parties such as retail and private bankers to deliver a holistic offering and enhanced client experience; <br/><br/> • Provide leadership on all matters related to financing solutions for the franchise sector for the region’s business bank and all banking partners; <br/><br/> • Develop and manage relationships with key influencers and partners in the franchise ecosystem for the region, which includes regional and national sponsorships. <br/><br/> Qualifications <br/><br/> What you bring to the table: <br/><br/> • Demonstrated history of business development and sales. <br/><br/> • Experience and demonstrated strong knowledge of the franchise industry. <br/><br/> • Inclusive of a minimum of 3 years’ relationship management experience providing business banking solutions to franchise networks. <br/><br/> • Established presence in the franchise ecosystem. <br/><br/> • Comfortable when interacting with business leaders, up to the C-suite level. <br/><br/> • Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written. <br/><br/> • Strong negotiation skills. <br/><br/> • Strong due diligence skills, including loan structure terms & conditions.

Title: Software Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>Who You Are:</strong> <br/><br/> You love developing elegant solutions to complex problems. You are a developer who enjoys coding and find yourself exploring the latest code development practices, platforms and design patterns because it's fun.
