Getty Images works with over 200,000 contributors and hundreds of image partners to provide comprehensive coverage of more than 130,000 news, sport and entertainment events, impactful creative imagery to communicate any commercial concept and the world's deepest digital archive of historic photography. <br/><br/> Visit Getty Images at www.gettyimages.com to learn more about how the company is advancing the unique role of still and moving imagery in communication and business, and enabling creative ideas to come to life. For company news and announcements, visit our Press Room, and for the stories and inspiration behind our content, visit Stories & Trends. Find Getty Images on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest and Tumblr, or download the Getty Images app where you can explore, save and share the world's best imagery. <br/><br/> Getty Images is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.

Title: Principal / Associate Director Software Developer
Job_Description: This position is the second level in the Software Development Career Path. The primary responsibility of this position is to design, develop and deliver GIS (Geographic Information System) software solutions for IHS Markit use. Solutions will include support and growth of common mapping components, incorporation of third party GIS technology (e.g. ESRI, FME), GIS data and services. Incumbent has in-depth knowledge across a broad spectrum of programming languages in GIS automation and data processing techniques and applies both existing and new technologies in developing solutions. <br/><br/> General Job Duties <br/> Participate in the design, planning and development of solutions based on industry requirements. <br/> Participate as part of a project team to design, code, test and implement moderately complex programs to support the portfolio management process. <br/> Manage small to mid-level sized programs or portions of a program. <br/> Establishes testing procedures to ensure application is thoroughly tested throughout development and before release. <br/> Monitor and report to management on project status, identify issues that may impede attainment of goals, recommend and implement corrective measures. <br/> Provide technical direction and training to more junior Software Development personnel. <br/> Perform other duties as required. <br/><br/> Specific Job Duties <br/> Duties will include but may not be limited to: <br/><br/> Requirements analysis, design and implementation of the geoprocessing software. This design, development and implementation work may include software development, process development, data layer development or other development to support GIS viewing platforms. <br/> Development of GIS automation scripts using FME or Arcpy. <br/> Automated testing scripts <br/> Creation of devops monitoring functionality <br/> Management and maintenance of processes and environments running the processes (ie. FME Server, Desktops, etc). <br/> User support and assistance with on demand processing of created scripts, software, or processes. <br/><br/> Education/Experience Requirements <br/> Bachelors in Computer Science, Geography, GIS or related field or equivalent experience. <br/> 8+ years of experience in GIS software development, geoprocessing services, cartography principles, topplogy and database design <br/> Thorough knowledge of one or more technologies (e.g., FME, Python and ArcObjects). <br/> Knowledgeable in one or more technologies, ESRI spatial technologies (ArcGIS Desktop, ArcGISServer), FME Desktop and/or Server, and GIS Databases (FileGeodatabase, Shapefiles, Oracle, SQL Server and PostgreSQL SDE database technologies). <br/> Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. <br/> Strong interpersonal skills – must be able to work effectively as part of a project/program team and foster team cooperation. <br/> Previous experience designing and developing GIS automation scripts is required. <br/> Previous experience with creating, loading and editing GIS data. <br/> Stays current with rapidly changing technology and applies it to business needs. <br/> Must be able to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical personnel. <br/><br/> Organizational Relationships <br/> Reports directly to Senior Manager, Product Development <br/> Acts in a lead capacity on small to mid-sized programs, but has no direct supervisory responsibility. <br/> Interacts with other colleagues at all levels in the conduct of day-to-day activities. <br/><br/> External Relationships <br/> Participates in meetings with customers to assess business needs. <br/> Actively participates in industry forums and user groups.

Title: Software Engineer
Job_Description: <div>Cisco people are not happy merely moving the security innovation needle a few millimeters – we want to blow it off the dial. Every day we look for new ways to merge innovative security technology with Cisco’s 25+ years of networking expertise to redefine network security. We need like-minded colleagues who dream big about transforming security and networks, and who expect to reap the rewards for their high-visibility creations. <br/><br/> <strong> Who You’ll Work With</strong> <br/><br/> This is an opportunity to work within the Cisco AMP team on our AMP Private Cloud product. The Cisco AMP team has a dynamic work environment that inspires employees to create opportunities by daily honing their talents and skills. Employees are self-motivated, results driven and engaged. We recognize and reward quality results and commitment to our company’s purposes and principles. You will be working within a team of exceptional software engineers, who are always ready to share their knowledge and skills. <br/><br/> <strong>What You’ll Do</strong> <br/><br/> The Cisco AMP team is responsible for shipping client software for all flavours of Windows, Mac, Linux, and Android, supported by a Linux backend containing MongoDB, Cassandra, ElasticSearch, MySQL, Hadoop, Hive, RabbitMQ, Ruby, and custom C code, all Chef managed <ul> <li>We deploy across a cloud infrastructure including Amazon’s EC2 and our own hardware running Joyent’s SDC, and have condensed these services down into a single instance with our Private Cloud</li><li>Active participation in design and code reviews</li><li>Implementing product features and fixing existing bugs logged in the bug database</li><li>Developing and maintaining internal tools for automated functional, integration and performance testing</li><li>Supporting Tier 3 Technical support by debugging and bug fixing production issues</li><li>We know how to ship software and shipping software feels good</li><li>We are looking for a software engineer to join us, focusing on our Private Cloud appliance</li> </ul> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <ul> <li>Have high personal integrity and ethical standards</li><li>Strong team oriented</li> <li>Passionate about designing and building high-quality software</li><li>Excellent communication skills</li><li>An unquenchable desire to learn</li><li>2+ years of experience in software development</li><li>Experience with Unix shell scripting: sh and Bash</li><li>Experience with any of the following scripting programming languages: Ruby, Python, Perl</li><li>Experience with source control management systems: i.e., git, subversion, CVS</li><li>Practical experience with SQL</li><li>Good understanding of administrating Linux systems</li><li>Experience with system and application debugging and performance optimization</li><li>Good understanding of computer networking protocols</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Desired Skills:</strong></div><ul><li>Experience with compiled languages such as: C, C++, Go, Rust</li><li>Understanding of secure coding practices</li><li>Contributions to open source projects</li><li>Experience with system configuration management systems: Chef, CFengine, Puppet, Ansible, SaltStack</li><li>Working knowledge with common compile, build, and packaging tools, i.e., gcc, make, rpmbuild</li><li>Working knowledge of some of the following technologies: memcache, NGINX HAproxy, MongoDB, Cassandra, RabbitMQ, MySQL, ElasticSearch</li><li>Understanding of modern PC hardware</li> </ul> About Cisco <br/><br/> The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will impact everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco.</div>

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Job_Description: <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div>  <br/><div>Replicon is looking for software developers who are passionate about coding and technology to work on our Time Intelligence platform. Our SaaS application is used globally by thousands of customers and millions of users. We want to build out our team with more engineers who are also passionate about building great applications and care about giving our customers a great user experience.</div>   <br/><strong><div>What you need to bring:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Coding skills across the entire stack UI, Services and Data</li> <li>Familiarity with IaaS (AWS, Azure, GCP)</li> <li>A technology toolbelt that includes leading edge languages and tools with knowledge on when and why to use them</li> <li>You adopt industry best practices in all of your projects - TDD, CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, linting</li> <li>You are pragmatic enough to deliver an MVP, but aspirational enough to think about how it will work with millions of users</li> <li>You take ownership and pride in everything you do and you will stand by what you deliver</li> <li>Readiness to hit the ground running you may not know how to solve everything right off the bat, but you will put in the time and effort to understand so that you can</li> </ul>  <strong><div>How we work:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>An agile development environment delivering functionality to production every day</li> <li>Team lunches, team events, flexible work environment</li> <li>A relentless desire to continuously improve</li></ul>

Title: Software Engineer (Product Owner), Senior - EvO (P4)
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting opportunity for a Product Owner in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> Our Calgary team is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. Software will be developed for Windows 10 laptops and for General Dynamics developed hardware products running embedded Linux. The project includes all phases including system design, software and hardware design, system integration, and system validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. <br/><br/> The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. The Scrum teams operate within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be a Product Owner for one of the Scrum teams. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <br/><br/> The Product Owner is a content management leader who prioritizes and grooms the Product Backlog and ensures that the team understands what they are working on. The Product Owner’s responsibilities include: <ul> <li>Working with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) Product Manager and other stakeholders to understand their needs</li><li>Having a vision and roadmap for what the Product Owner wishes to be built</li><li>Clearly expressing this vision in understandable Product Backlog items</li><li>Ordering and prioritizing the items in the Product Backlog to best achieve goals and missions</li><li>Optimizing the value of the work the Development Team performs</li><li>Ensuring that the Product Backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the Scrum team will work on next</li><li>Ensuring the Development Team understands items in the Product Backlog to the level needed</li><li>The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the Product Backlog</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Minimum of four years experience in software engineering</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li> </ul> Skills & Experience – Nice to Have: <ul> <li>Previous experience as a Product Owner or Scrum Master on an Agile team</li><li>Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification</li><li>Previous experience leading teams in an agile environment</li><li>Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0)</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Geotechnical Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 19401 <br/>   <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the manager, geotechnical engineering, this person is responsible for the geotechnical aspects of waste dumps, reclamation stockpiles, tailing facilities (dykes), and pitwall structures that are associated with both mining and closure landform applications. You will be responsible for managing geotechnical risks across the site in both operating and closure environments, as well as our tailings facility management system which promotes all aspects of risk reduction and continuous improvement in tailings facility management and dam safety. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Deliver and manage complex engineering designs for dykes, pitwalls and dumps/stockpiles suitable for submission to government for approval</li><li>Work at various levels of projects from conceptual to detailed design as required for the stage of the project: design, construction, operations, closure and de-licensing</li><li>Liase with stakeholders including planners, regulatory, projects, operations (mining and tailings), and construction groups to deliver safe, robust and reliable engineering designs. </li><li>Be part of a team to deliver the project for Suncor’s best interests and problem solve issues that arise in the field</li><li>Complete projects as a delivery of IFC to stakeholders</li><li>Manage technical issues and ensure geotechnical integrity through all of the life cycle stages of structures, design, construction, operations, closure, de-licensing</li><li>Work on technical projects such as weak pre-sheared soils, liquefiable material, fine tailings all within an operating environment.</li><li>Present projects to external review boards for risk identification</li><li>Work within the geotechnical group to continually improve our standards, procedures and dam safety programs</li><li>Mentor junior and intermediate staff in all aspects of geotechnical engineering, communication and project management as it applies</li><li>Contribute to technical advancement of staff in other groups</li><li>Work with external technical groups for the advancement of geotechnical and tailings engineering</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education <ul> <li>Minimum 10 years relevant engineering experience in large civil earthworks projects, which include, design, construction and operations</li><li>Experience in the oil and gas or mining environment is strongly preferred</li><li>Engineering degree in Civil/Geological/Mining engineering, Master’s degree in Geotechnical Engineering considered an asset</li><li>Presently registered or eligible to register immediately as a Professional Engineer with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA)</li><li>Possess a valid driver’s licence with a clean driving record</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge<ul> <li>Proficient in Microsoft Office suite, AutoCAD and geotechnical modelling software (Geostudio, FLAC, etc.)</li><li>Effective communicator that is capable of understanding, anticipating and responding to the ongoing needs of mining, tailings and reclamation engineering and operations groups. (ie. strong technical, oral and written communication skills.)</li><li>Proven project management skills and leadership abilities, including skills in developing and managing the performance of professional engineers, and building effective engineering work processes</li><li>Well-developed critical thinking, with an ability to apply logic and challenge assumptions, conclusions and make appropriate recommendations</li><li>You continually seek greater knowledge about the systems, processes and hazards in the workplace, in order to understand not just what you do but why you do it</li><li>You hold others accountable and expect others to do the same</li><li>Ability to contribute to a team environment while at times working independently</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>This is a Calgary based office position</li><li>Occasional trips to site are required</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communitities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Engineering

Title: Solutions Engineer
Job_Description: We're looking for an enthusiastic and talented solutions engineer to join our sales team. Do you enjoy solving challenges, working as a team and building strong relationships? If so, than this role may be for you! <br/><br/> The Solution Engineer provides support for technical elements of the sales cycle and is the primary internal resource for the sales team. Responsible for actively driving and managing the technology evaluation stage of the sales process, working in conjunction with internal teams to ensure that clients are set up for success, post-sales. <br/><br/> As an expert in Benevity products and services, the Solution Engineer will serve customers by identifying their needs and recommending possible adaptations of products and services that may be implemented and supported by the Client Services team. He or she will maintain a connection with various departments including client services, product and technical services. The Sales Engineer will be responsible for gathering and communicating key client information to the Relationship and Implementation Management teams to ensure timely and successful client implementations. <br/><br/> The person in the role is a solutions-oriented individual with a high technical aptitude and strong interpersonal skills. He or she is a great juggler of priorities, capable of communicating complex information simply, and enjoys working with clients to understand possible solutions for their needs. <br/><br/> Our Sales team members are located across North America, so we welcome exceptional, passionate applicants from all over the United States & Canada. If making an impact matters to you, and working with a company that helps clients to change the world sounds like an exciting adventure, then read on! <br/><br/> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> Benevity is the global leader in online workplace giving, matching, volunteering and community investment software. Many of the world’s most iconic brands rely on Spark, Benevity’s award winning cloud solution, to power corporate “Goodness Programs” that attract, retain and engage today’s diverse workforce by connecting people to the social causes that matter to them. <br/><br/> Better Work and a Better World: that’s what we’re all about. We’re a software company in the business of doing good, building better ways for companies to connect with their customers and employees around causes and prosocial behaviour (we make “doing well by doing good” more than just a tagline!). We’re growing fast and looking for more great people to join us. <br/><br/> We have that fun, flexible tech culture that people love, and we have a heart. We’re a registered B Corporation, which means we’re part of a new breed of companies committed to higher social and sustainability standards. <br/><br/> <strong>The Why</strong>  <ul> <li>The Solution Engineer expedites the sales process by assisting Sales Executives with technical discussions, articulating the technology and product positioning to both business and technical users, contributing to client satisfaction and implementation success.</li> <li>Finds solutions to unique client issues by using the tools available, contributing to organizational profitability and revenue growth.</li> </ul> <strong>The What</strong>  <ul> <li>Bridge the gap between sales and client services to reduce implementation timelines and improve visibility into resource allocation and planning</li> <li>Gather and articulate important client information through internal channels (SalesForce, Confluence) to build a strong client profile</li> <li>Maintain and communicate the latest Spark features and capabilities to the sales team so we are continuously able to provide the best solutions for potential buyers</li> <li>Streamline the implementation process by gathering relevant information and preparing clients for next steps during sales cycle</li> <li>Communicating client requests and requirements to product and technical teams to ensure implementation success</li> <li>Work with Marketing and other internal teams to develop sales tools that help present complex information in a way that potential buyers can understand</li> <li>Identify current and future customer service requirements by establishing personal rapport with potential and actual customers and other persons in a position to understand service requirements</li> <li>Gain buyer acceptance by explaining and demonstrating the fi t of the Benevity solution through proof of concept (POC) solutions</li> <li>Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies</li> <li>Contribute to the Marketing and Product team’s effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed; providing information and commentary pertinent to deliberations; recommending options and courses of action</li> <li>Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed</li> </ul> <strong>The How</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years experience in Sales Engineering or related role</li> <li>Learn quickly and adapt even more quickly</li> <li>Ability to manage competing priorities and work effectively under the pressure of time constraints in a fast-paced, complex, collaborative and team-oriented environment</li> <li>Highly developed interpersonal and written/spoken communication skills</li> <li>Able to maintain strong relationship both internally and with clients</li> <li>Experience with Salesforce is a strong asset</li> <li>Strong understanding of SaaS software solutions</li> <li>In-depth knowledge of Community Investment industry</li> <li>Technical understanding – not afraid to question and investigate so that challenges can be resolved quickly</li> <li>Professional, motivated and flexible – enthusiastic about using process to deliver but understand that there’s a time and a place to go with the fl ow</li> <li>Motivated self-starter that works well both alone and with a team</li> <li>Business analysis and problem solving skills</li> </ul> It is our hope and belief that you apply because you believe the same things we do – that global Goodness is an achievable goal! While we sincerely appreciate the time and effort you put into your application, unfortunately only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Software Engineer in Test II
Job_Description: Who You'll Work With <br/> The Advanced Threat Security Team in Cisco's Security Business Group is building a global scale, multi product security platform with an emphasis on Threat Intelligence and Incident Response support. <br/> Our system runs as a distributed cluster in the cloud and shrunk down to a single on-premises appliance. This keeps us focused on simple solutions, clear abstractions between services, composition of services, functional data processing, and minimal state. <br/> Our team is distributed across the U.S. and works from home with occasional office visits and travel -- this requires excellent written communications, self-confidence, trust in your co-workers, and assuming ownership of the problems you encounter. <br/>  <br/> What You'll Do <br/> This is an exciting opportunity to work with the Cisco AMP engineering group based in Calgary to assure quality for the Advanced Malware Protection platform. The hired employee will be responsible for testing on Windows, Linux, and Mac platforms as well as operating within a cloud architecture in both a manual and automated fashion. Furthermore, that person will be required to read technical documents, create test cases/test plans, contribute to overall design, and perform other tasks to improve software quality. <br/><br/> Who You Are   <ul> <li>Ability to work independently when writing test cases, test plans, and other supporting documentation</li> <li>Prior experience in collaborating with both technical engineers and non-technical customers</li> <li>Experience testing in mixed OS environments including Windows, Mac, and Linux</li> <li>Development or automated testing experience in either Ruby or Python</li> <li>Testing and/or configuration of security products</li> </ul>  Why Cisco <br/> We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren't afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. <br/>  <br/> We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers. <br/>  <br/> We Are Cisco.<br/>  <div>dicedev #GD2015</div>

Title: Software Test Developer
Job_Description: Nureva is looking for an experienced <strong>Software Test Developer</strong> to join our team whichdesign and builds our Product Development test automation processes. You are well-versed with the process of ensuring products will be brought to market with quality. Reporting to the Manager, Test Implementation, you will work with development, DevOps and existing QA staff to enhance automation in the current QA process. This ongoing effort will increase repeatability and reliability in test execution and increase our test coverage. <br/><br/> You are diligent, proactive and have a reputation as an excellent problem solver. You enjoy collaborating with small teams and have the resourcefulness and initiative to ask the right questions to develop thorough test coverage. You take ownership of your deliverables and take pride in the knowledge that your efforts will have an impact on end-users. You will work with a diverse team of developers and designers who are passionate about technology, user experience and market success. <br/><br/> <strong>What you will do</strong>  <ul> <li>Work closely with the development teams to understand the product architecture, function, intended user experience, and performance expectations.</li> <li>Develop documentation for test plans, results and reports.</li> <li>Design and develop software automated test frameworks and test suites within an Agile development team.</li> <li>Maintain a comprehensive awareness of the technology landscape and identify opportunities for future test suite enhancements</li> <li>Design, develop, validate, maintain a QA automation framework and architecture</li> <li>Automate test cases that are part of a continuous delivery workflow, while minimizing the need for manual test repetition</li> <li>Guide other QA Analysts and development team to write effective automated tests that are reliable, repeatable and visible</li> <li>Assist in UI experience testing as required</li> <li>Ensure accurate test reports for internal and external audiences as required</li> <li>Assist in mentoring and training of new staff as required.</li> </ul> <strong>What you bring:</strong>  <ul> <li>A degree in computer science, software engineering or equivalent experience</li> <li>Ability to write both manual and automated tested cases</li> <li>Experience in software development with strong knowledge of C#, .NET, and JavaScript. Familiarity with PowerShell is an asset</li> <li>Experience with RESTful Web APIs</li> <li>Experience in test automation within Microsoft Visual Studio, Team Services, WPF applications and JS/HTML browser-based applications. Familiarity with Selenium, ROBOT or other modern automation tools is also an asset</li> <li>Familiarity of Agile software development methods</li> <li>Familiarity with local and cloud virtualization methods</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li> </ul> We offer a competitive total compensation package, an open and collaborative office in downtown Calgary, and a great team environment. <br/><br/> Apply by close of business <strong>June 15th, 2018</strong>. Please outline how you will make a difference on our team. We will spend time to ensure that you understand the role and our company to ensure that we are a good fit for you.

Title: Embedded Software Developer
Job_Description: Building our People and our Products is what Inspires Us. <br/><br/> Job Posting for: Embedded Software Developer <br/><br/> Reports to: Engineering Manager, Firmware <br/><br/> Location:Calgary <br/><br/> Employment Type: Permanent, Full-time <br/><br/> <strong>About the Company</strong> <br/><br/> INOVA aspires to be THE land seismic technology company by developing reliable seismic instruments that enable geophysical service providers to efficiently design and execute complex seismic acquisition programs on behalf of our energy and production customers around the world. <br/><br/> We are a global organization with technical professionals who focus on innovation in land seismic product development to ensure our products remain on the cutting-edge of innovation, guided by the practical reality of what contractors require to reliably execute complex seismic programs in the most difficult operating environments. In addition, we manufacture these innovative seismic instruments with a strong commitment to quality and safety. Our global sales and service teams market our innovative products and concentrate on providing Best in Class customer satisfaction. <br/><br/> <strong>Purpose of the Job:</strong> <br/><br/> The Embedded Software Developer will be a key member of the firmware team. This employee will deliver and support a package of high quality, feature rich firmware for INOVAs land seismic data acquisition systems for oil and gas exploration. <br/><br/> Duties and job requirements include, but are not limited to: <br/><br/> Responsible for the design and development of embedded software in a Microsoft Windows environment as part of a team of embedded software and hardware developers <br/> Perform the testing and integration of firmware and software with other components of the system <br/> Responsible for submitting software to a version control system using bug tracking software <br/> Work in accordance with all legislation and company policy requirements pertaining to employee safety, health and wellness <br/><br/> <strong>Education and Work Experience:</strong> <br/><br/> 2- 5 years experience in developing software for embedded real-time multithreaded applications <br/> Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Mathematics or Physics <br/><br/> <strong>Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Previous experience with multiprocessor and FPGA based designs <br/> Familiarity with embedded RTOSs such as VxWorks, eCos, FreeRTOS <br/> Strong C/C++ programming and debugging skills <br/> Experience with Eclipse development environment and GNU toolchain <br/> Excellent analytic, problem solving, and troubleshooting skills <br/> Preferred skills: Device drivers for control of hardware circuits and interfaces including Flash, EEPROM, SPI, I2C, USB, RS-232, and 1-wire; ARM, MSP430, and Nios processors <br/> Working knowledge of digital oscilloscopes, analyzers, and JTAG debuggers <br/><br/> We sincerely thank you for your interest in this position, however, we will only contact applicants selected for an interview.

Title: Junior Software Developer
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has exciting new Junior Software Developer opportunities with our Calgary team. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> Our Calgary team is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. Software will be developed for Windows 10 laptops and for General Dynamics developed hardware products running embedded Linux. The project includes all phases including system design, software and hardware design, system integration, and system validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. <br/><br/> The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. As a member of a Scrum team, the successful candidates will design, implement, and test software features for the product. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <ul> <li>Participate in Scrum events, including Sprint Planning, Daily Scrum, Sprint Review, and Sprint Retrospective</li><li>Continually refine Sprint backlog into smaller tasks</li><li>Work cooperatively with the development team to take on new tasks</li><li>Perform detailed design, implementation, and unit testing activities in order to complete Sprint tasks</li><li>Ensure completed tasks meet the Definition of Done and the Acceptance Criteria</li><li>Share knowledge and skills with other development team members</li><li>Participate in the refinement of the product backlog</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Experience with C++ or other higher level programming languages</li><li>Experience with developing software in a Linux operating system (kernel 3.X)</li><li>Experience with developing software in a Windows operating system (Windows 7, 8, 10)</li><li>Experience with UML and modelling techniques</li><li>Experience with unit testing and test driven development</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li> </ul> Skills & Experience – Nice to Have: <ul> <li>Experience with Service-oriented architecture including Web Services, WebSockets, and RESTful APIs</li><li>Experience with cross-platform development</li><li>Experience with pub/sub and request/response messaging patterns</li><li>Experience with XML</li><li>Experience with network device management technologies such as SNMP and NETCONF</li><li>Experience with multimedia technologies such as SIP, RTP, and RTCP</li><li>Experience with 3GPP IMS standard</li><li>Experience with transport layer technologies such as TCP/IP and UDP</li><li>Experience with networking technologies such as IPv4, IPv6, VLANs, 802.3, Routing Protocols (OSPF, IS-IS, BGP4), 802.1x, DSCP, and DHCP</li><li>Experience with directory services technologies (e.g., LDAP, X.500)</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent discipline is required</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Software Developer/Engineer
Job_Description: <ul>  <li>Design, Document, Implement, and maintain software used in Human Machine Interface’s (HMI’s).</li> <li>Responsible for creating mockup’s of the required screens and working closely with senior developers and/or product managers to ensure all user requirements are being met.</li> <li>Responsible for documenting the design, creating code and following the software development process which includes but is not limited to: Code Reviews, pair programming, creating unit tests, doing design reviews, etc.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>3yrs of experience in writing HMI software.</li></ul>  <ul>  <li>Experience in Beijer IX or XTERM HMI’s would be an asset.</li> <li>Must have knowledge of programming languages like C/C++, C# (.net), VB, Java, LabView and others.</li> <li>Excellent communication (written and verbal), analytical and interpersonal skills</li> <li>Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint</li> <li>Ability to handle multiple tasks under tight deadlines</li> <li>Applicable knowledge and understanding of schematics, P&IDs, process flow diagrams Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills and the experience to handle the pressure of resolving issues under high pressure.</li> <li>Effective time management skills and ability to handle a fast-paced environment.</li> <li>Ability and willingness to travel up 4 weeks per year.</li> <li>Must be willing to travel to Frac’ing job site or manufacturing yards.</li>  <li> Professional Engineer or Professional Technologist or have accredited certification in some programming language desired.</li> <li>Bachelor of Science or related degree or certificate from an accredited university or technical school or the equivalent combination of education and experience.</li>  </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Comprehensive benefits including paid vacations and holidays, supplemental healthcare including paramedical and health savings account, dental; vision, prescriptions, Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) with generous company match, long and short term disability and life insurances, etc.,

Title: Software Developer - Portal
Job_Description: Imagine yourself as part <br/> of one of the most dynamic companies in the healthcare technology industry <br/> today! QHR Technologies is a division of Shoppers Drug Mart, a Loblaw Company. <br/> QHR is leading the way in Canadian healthcare technology, by providing solutions <br/> to assist healthcare professionals enrich their practices and improve the <br/> quality of care delivered to all Canadians across the country. We are looking <br/> for talented, inspired, and motivated people to join our incredible team and <br/> experience a workplace culture that stands above the rest! Competitive salaries <br/> and generous perks are just a few of the reasons that QHR has been voted one of <br/> BC's Top Employers and Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for 2017. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> We deliver a <br/> comprehensive suite of technologies to enable secure medical record management <br/> and office automation for clinical environments. Our Electronic <br/> Medical Record (EMR) software Accuro®EMR has the largest adoption in Canada and <br/> serves thousands of practitioners and millions of patients. Our patient platform Medeo leverages that market <br/> penetration and connects patients to their healthcare providers.  <br/> As we continue to expand our integrations into patient and pharmacy workflows, <br/> we are looking for strong Angular or full-stack developers to be part of our <br/> team and to help shape our next generation of products and services. <br/><br/> <strong>About You:</strong>  <ul>   <li>You are enthusiastic about making a significant difference in the <br/>  lives of your customers through your work.</li> <li>You are passionate about software development and take security <br/>  seriously.</li> <li>You love building beautiful applications that are easy to <br/>  understand and use.</li> <li>You care deeply about your code and couldn’t imagine writing <br/>  software without TDD and Continuous Integration.</li> <li>You are a continual learner, love new ideas and have a natural <br/>  curiosity to keep improving.</li> <li>You understand the value of timely releases to market, and know <br/>  when not to budge on software quality.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>   <li>A degree or diploma in Engineering, Computer Science or a related <br/>  field.</li> <li>At least 3 years of experience in web application development, <br/>  ideally in Angular.</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus points if you <br/> have experience with:</strong>  <ul>   <li>High data security/privacy environments</li> <li>Spring / Spring Boot</li> <li>OAuth flows</li> <li>CA API Gateway, OrionHealth Rhapsody</li> <li>SQL Server or other database systems</li> <li>RabbitMQ or other messaging systems</li> <li>Board/Card games</li> <li>Foosball</li> </ul>

Title: Software Developer
Job_Description: Our Calgary location is currently looking for a <strong><u>full-time Software Developer</u></strong> to be part of a team that is responsible for delivering timely, high quality releases that delight our customers in the upstream oil & gas sector. You’d be designing, coding and testing enhancements to our Harmony desktop application which is mostly written in C++ but uses some C# and is looking into expanding into web technologies. <br/><br/> <strong>About You:</strong>  <ul> <li><strong>You’re highly collaborative</strong> - you have an affinity for finding solutions through discussions with team members</li><li><strong>You’re a problem solver</strong> – you enjoy solving complex problems, and are comfortable exploring them even if the problem and solution are not yet well-defined</li><li><strong>You’re always improving something</strong> – whether it’s learning a new programming language, or finding better ways to do things in your team or organizationally, continuous improvement is important to you</li><li><strong>You’re practical</strong> – you assess the circumstances and make the best decision based on the facts</li> </ul>  <strong>Some of the things you’d be doing as a developer on our team:</strong>  <ul> <li>Be an active and collaborative team member as part of an agile development team of 5-9 people</li><li>Design, code and test enhancements for a Windows-based desktop application written in C++ and/or C#, with SQL Server as its backend database</li><li>Work closely with customer stakeholders to ensure we’re adding value for our users</li><li>Work closely with other developers, for example by pair programming and participating in code reviews</li><li>Troubleshoot and fix bugs</li><li>Contribute to testing of user stories, features and releases</li><li>Assist our customer facing support team in solving client issues, when necessary</li><li>Contribute insights and suggestions as part of our continuous improvement</li><li>Generally pitch in wherever needed to help get a high quality release out on time</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications that would make you a good fit for this role:</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum B.Sc. in software engineering, computer engineering, computer science, or equivalent experience</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience writing code in a high-level object-oriented programming language, ideally C++ and/or C#</li><li>Experience with WPF and XAML</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience with SQL Server databases</li><li>Experience in web development (particularly Angular and/or React, Javascript, CSS)</li><li>Familiarity with object oriented software design</li><li>Experience with unit testing</li><li>Familiarity with, or interest in, agile principles, values and practices</li> </ul>  We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Please refer to the <strong>EEO is the Law Poster & Supplement, Right to Work and Pay Transparency Policy. IHS Markit is a participant in E-Verify (see links below)</strong>.
