Title: Software Development Manager!
Job_Description: Who we are <br/><br/> We have built Curve Dental into an industry-leading provider of beautiful cloud software for the dental industry. With development operations based in Calgary for over 12 years, we recently received private equity investment (Battery Ventures) so that we can accelerate our growth and further dominate the dental software industry. <br/><br/> Who we are looking for <br/><br/> We employ developers who are passionate about software development and technically excellent. Our developers work across the full stack of an application and understand that a project is not done until it has been deployed to production for our users. We want developers who can contribute positively to our culture and teach us things we didn't know before. Those same developers are always hungry to learn and improve in any way they can. <br/><br/> Our development managers combine all of the above alongside superior leadership and people skills, a talent for project management and taking on a scrum-master role, expert-level technical ability and the desire to promote quality and standards in all areas of building product, and a true desire to build high-performing teams. Let's not forget the love of getting hands well and truly dirty in code too! <br/><br/> If you want to be coding all day every day then this is NOT the opportunity for you; please check out our Full Stack Software Developer posting. Otherwise read on, my friend... <br/><br/> Things were looking for in terms of more specific skill-sets and experience: <br/><br/> 3+ years of experience leading or managing software developers for a software company building large-scale web applications using open source technologies <br/> 8+ years of experience building large scale enterprise software <br/> Experience mentoring and leading software engineers and small teams through strong interpersonal and organisational skills <br/> Experience writing user stories and breaking down high-level requirements into smaller well-defined work tasks <br/> Extensive programming experience in a language that demands strong OO skills (C# / Java / C++ / etc.). Note that we don't use all these technologies; these are examples of the types of skills we look for. Experience with PHP is a definite plus, as is experience with REST. Ideally, youve been coding since you were old enough to read. <br/> Extensive experience working with JavaScript frameworks in a rich web application. Experience with AngularJS and Angular is a definite plus. <br/> Code reviews are a part of everyday life in your work (both as a reviewer and reviewee) <br/> Advanced knowledge of how applications interact with databases, mainly through ORM technologies and also through stored procedures, triggers, etc. <br/> Proficiency in Unix / Linux environments <br/> Evangelism of automated testing in all its forms in your previous work; you've written way more unit tests than application code. <br/> Project management experience (specifically with Agile Scrum teams) with a solid track record of delivering high-quality software within estimated times while handling multiple sizable projects concurrently. <br/> Ability to lead constructive and objective estimation sessions with a view to longer term project planning <br/> Ability to effectively manage dependencies and remove obstacles to ensure team productivity <br/> Keeps stakeholders proactively informed about project status and plans <br/> Experience working and collaborating with many different areas of a business such as product management, software architects, business analysts, user experience designers and customer support teams. <br/> Experience of recruiting software developers is a bonus <br/><br/> How to Apply <br/><br/> Send your resume to devjobs@curvedental.com with the subject line YOUR NAME: Software Development Manager! Remember to make the name substitution, select the level of experience you have and to include the exclamation mark :-) <br/><br/> Don't just send us your standard cover letter; simply answer the following 3 questions: <br/><br/> What do you know about our business and industry? <br/> Why is what we do important to our clients? <br/> What is your favourite aspect of our business, and why? <br/><br/> This particular role is at Curve Dental's office in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. To find out more about Curve Dental and what it's like to work with us go to www.curvedental.com/jobs.

Title: Software Development Intern
Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/>As the world&apos;s leading international pure-play geophysical company, we offer unique seismic solutions that help the oil and gas industry meet energy demands responsibly. <br/><br/> To build on the success of our business we are continuing to strengthen, mobilize, and energize our most important asset: <strong>our people.</strong> <br/><br/> We actively encourage technical excellence, problem-solving, innovation and teamwork.<br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/>The Software Development Intern will work with the Project Development Manager (PDM) to define requirements in sufficient detail for successful development of assigned software features. The Software Developer will also design, develop and implement high quality software that fulfills the defined requirements, and assist the Quality Assurance team with testing tools.<br/><br/>Qualifications<br/><br/><strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Setup of a fully automated software testing framework.</li><li>Maintain the current software version.</li><li>Deliver software design and code on schedule.</li><li>Report progress on a frequent basis to the project manager.</li><li>Maintain code with the approved source control system and update the source control problem tracking system.</li><li>Stay up to date with the latest technologies.</li> </ul> <strong>Job Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>Must be enrolled in an accredited North American university with a focus on geophysics, physics, mathematics, computer science, engineering or related science degrees. Enrollment in advanced degrees is desirable.</li><li>Past experience on software development projects beyond school work is preferred.</li><li>Good written and verbal communication skills - essential for interacting with users and colleagues.</li><li>Must be able to clearly present design ideas and programming results to colleagues.</li><li>The ability to function in a team environment or an individual setting</li><li>Analytical and creative problem solving skills. Strong ability to recognize errors, troubleshoot and identify solutions independently.</li><li>Good practical knowledge of the programming languages and software development tools necessary for creating the target software applications.</li><li>Fluent in C++ is a must. Experience in automated software testing is preferred.</li> </ul> <strong>Other Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent work ethic and positive attitude; demonstrated to be dependable and trustworthy, and practices personal and professional integrity at all times.</li><li>Enthusiastic approach to personal and professional development and life-long learning.</li><li>Position will be for a defined period of time from May until August.</li> </ul>  Additional Information<br/><br/><strong>Why choose CGG?</strong> <br/><br/> Joining a company with a culture of learning and a world-class structured career development pathway, our graduates can develop their technical, commercial and personal skills for the future via a suite of internal courses led by our own CGG University. <br/><br/> We encourage you to take ownership of your development by identifying opportunities to further progress your own skills and experience. <br/><br/> CGG focuses on the strengths and talents of our people and develop learning opportunities that encourage development at every step of your career.

Title: Software Developer (Product Owner)
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting contract opportunity for a Product Owner in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Missions Systems-Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. The Scrum teams operate within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be a Product Owner for one of the Scrum teams. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <ul> <li>The Product Owner is a content management leader who prioritizes and grooms the backlog and ensures that the team understands what they are working on. The Product Owner’s responsibilities include:</li><li>Working with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) product manager and other stakeholders to understand their needs</li><li>Provides vision and roadmap for what the Product Owner wishes to be built</li><li>Clearly communicates this vision in understandable product backlog items</li><li>Ordering and prioritizing the items in the product backlog to best achieve goals and missions</li><li>Optimizing the value of the work the development team performs</li><li>Ensuring that the product backlog is visible, transparent, clear to all, and shows what the Scrum team will work on next</li><li>Ensuring the development team understands items in the product backlog to the level needed</li><li>The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the product backlog</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Minimum of four years experience in software engineering</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li> <li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li> </ul> Skills & Experience – Nice to have: <ul> <li>Previous experience as a Product Owner or Scrum Master on an Agile team</li><li>Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification</li><li>Previous experience leading teams in an agile environment</li><li>Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0)</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required</li> </ul> Other: <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace.Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Site Reliability Software Developer
Job_Description: <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><br/>  <div> <div>Site Reliability Developers/Engineers (SREs) are responsible for creating and improving the tools and processes that power the building, validation, deployment, and monitoring of Replicon's globally distributed multi-tenant SaaS systems. SREs are spreading and evangelizing the DevOps culture throughout Replicon.</div><br/>  <div>Working at Replicon is an opportunity to take on the unique challenges of a successful, large scale SaaS business application that existed before "web applications" as we know them today even existed. We have unusual challenges in such as extreme data consistency & reliability (nobody puts up with being paid incorrectly), large scale, complex legacy systems, enterprise-scale customizability, all combined with a friendly non-technical user experience. It's a "never-stop-learning" environment, where you'll be working with a strong technical team.</div>  <br/><strong><div>Responsibilities include:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Remove impediments in the technical development processes to support high-frequency, low lead-time software deployments</li> <li>Isolate risk of deployment or software failures to minimize scope and impact of production incidents</li> <li>Collaborate effectively with multiple product teams with unique internal processes and technologies</li> <li>Identifies where development and operational practices are outside industry norms; doesn't accept "we've always done it this way", works to do it better</li> <li>Effectively implements automation to augment or replace manual processes; prefers adopting rather than building software where appropriate</li> <li>Participates in the on-call rotation to efficiently triage critical production incidents, reduce incident severity, and document incident in detail for product team follow-up</li> </ul>  <strong><div>Qualifications:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Deep understanding of web technologies (HTTP, DNS, TLS/SSL, web services, load balancing)</li> <li>Experience with AWS (have used S3, EC2, RDS); would accept experience with Azure and/or Google Cloud</li> <li>Experience with automation tools (eg. Docker, Terraform, Jenkins, CodePipeline)</li> <li>Familiar with agile processes/scrum and TDD</li> <li>Built or have supported CI and CD processes</li> <li>Experience with post mortems/failure analysis - identifying the root cause & contributing factors of incidents</li> <li>Experience with a SaaS, globally-distributed multi-tenant system would be a preference</li> <li>Experience with a micro-services architecture, or the transition towards one</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>

Title: Sales Engineer
Job_Description: <div><div>Job Summary<br/><br/><strong>Rubrik’s Sales Engineer Job Description</strong> <br/><br/> Ready for an opportunity to make a substantial impact with a disruptive tech company while building your pre-sales career? Rubrik, Inc. has an amazing product, a supercharged team and the financial backing of Lightspeed Ventures, Greylock Partners and Khosla Ventures. Bottom line, if you have limitless drive and like to win, we want to talk to you! <br/><br/> Rubrik is looking for Sales Engineers to provide technical direction and business guidance to the regional sales team. As a Sales Engineer, you will be accountable for regional revenue goals by driving innovative technical programs and overseeing day-to-day account-level activities. You will be responsible for evangelizing, positioning, and architecting the industry's first hyper-converged hybrid cloud data management platform for a mix of enterprise, mid-market, and small business customers throughout your region. <br/><br/> <strong>About the position:</strong> <ul> <li>Provides technical leadership and direction to customers and internal staff in the development of fully integrated technology solutions in support of pre-sales activities in the assigned market.</li><li>Assists in the analysis, design and development of fully integrated technology solutions.</li><li>Demonstrates technical leadership and subject matter expertise on Rubrik’s products, distributed architectures, file systems, and competitive storage offerings in the SAN product space.</li><li>Acts as technical expert and consultant to develop and propose solutions that meet the technology and business requirements of assigned customers.</li><li>Makes technical and sales presentations to customer's technical staff and senior management.</li> <li>Serves as a trusted technology advisor to customers and serves as an internal resource on technical issues or specific business applications within an assigned market segment.</li><li>Successfully builds relationships with the account team, partners and customers in support of sales team objectives and engages and leverages corporate resources, abilities, budgets and personnel as appropriate.</li><li>Leads technical sales calls</li><li>Qualifies sales opportunities in the terms of customer technical requirements, competition, decision making process and funding.</li> </ul> <strong>About you:</strong> <ul> <li>5-7 years of sales engineering experience preferably in a software or data center environment.</li><li>Driven – need for success, highly energetic with a strong hands-on, “can do” approach.</li><li>The successful candidate must have a fundamental breadth of technical knowledge in cloud data management, backup and disaster recovery and data analytics.</li><li>Entrepreneurial - willing to go the extra mile, strong work ethic, resourceful, “get it done” attitude</li><li>Strives in moving in a fast-paced environment; including handling multiple calls/demos per day with immediate follow up.</li><li>A high level of business acumen and experience working with Cx0 level personnel, bringing technology solutions to solve business challenges.</li><li>Smart, adaptable and open-minded</li><li>Bachelor’s degree required or equivalent experience</li></ul></div> </div>

Title: Principal Civil Engineer
Job_Description: Recognized as a leader in the EPC industry and ranked as the #2 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine for the second consecutive year , we who provide planning, design, build, and maintenance of upstream and midstream oil and gas facilities and infrastructure. With over 5,000 employees across North America, we service exploration, production, storage, and transportation of crude oil and natural gas to end users, both offshore and onshore. We bring together many different aspects including Pipeline and Facilities groups, onshore and offshore offices, and engineering services to help meet the demands of our clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Responsible for design and coordination work and leading civil task forces as assigned. Independently applies advances engineering techniques and analysis within the discipline. Develops designs that require innovation and ingenuity. Work is performed with minimal supervision and this position has considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments. <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Directing Engineers and Designers</li><li>Supervising engineering design and drafting activities</li><li>Interfacing with client, project personnel and attending project meetings</li><li>Evaluating civil/structural deliverables and manpower requirements</li><li>Mentoring less experienced employees</li><li>Providing technical direction and decision making on designs for foundations, structural steel, reinforced concrete, earthwork and site drainage</li><li>Developing, monitoring and controlling project schedules</li><li>Preparing and monitoring progress reports</li><li>Preparing cost estimates for bids and proposals</li><li>Evaluating developmental performance of staff</li><li>Organizing and maintaining departmental design guidelines</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Recognized Bachelor's degree in Civil/Structural Engineering required</li><li>12-15 years' of relevant experience required</li><li>Membership with APEGA or eligible to get membership in APEGA is required</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills required</li><li>Strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills required</li><li>Experience with structural engineering software such as STAAD, and S-Frame preferred</li><li>Advanced MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) preferred</li> </ul> At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.

Title: Samsung Sales Engineering Manager
Job_Description: <div><div>  <div>  <div><strong>POSITION OPEN:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Samsung Sales Engineering Manager</strong></div> <div><strong>EMPLOYEE TYPE:</strong> <br/><br/> Full-time</div> <div><strong>OVERVIEW:</strong> <br/><br/> The Sales Engineer is responsible for pre & post-sales support for B2B customers. The primary responsibility is to ensure a best-in-class deployment experience for customers migrating to Samsung optimized enterprise solutions. This role will also function as an overall technical SME on Samsung mobile devices, MDM partners and provide deep dive technical training and competitive analysis.</div> <div><strong>POSITION DESCRIPTION:</strong> <br/><br/> ​  <ul>   <li>Responsible for pre-sales technical support in full sales cycle including discovery, opportunity evaluation, pilot support, and opportunity closure in both Enterprise and SMB accounts.</li>   <li>Coordinates solutions design with Sales team, Product team, and Solution providers to ensure accuracy and feasibility</li>  <li>Conduct Proof of Concept evaluations to implement solutions to demonstrate the ability to meet client objectives including, full management of the PoC process and reporting.</li>   <li>Responsible for staying up to date on all the technical aspects of Samsung Enterprise solutions, with a sharp focus on Samsung Knox.</li>  <li>Responsible for building a tight relationship with Samsung’s Key Knox MDM partners with a focus on migration from competing platforms.</li>  <li>Close collaboration with various internal Samsung B2B sales teams, (Direct, Carrier, and Channel) will be necessary to ensure alignment with stated sales goals and strategies.</li>  <li>Establish relationships with the various internal and external resources needed to deliver best in class experiences when deploying Samsung optimized solutions.</li>  <li>Deliver technical presentations, training, demos and product overviews and deep-dives on product features. Can include participation in events (i.e. Tradeshow/Channel recruitment and training).</li>   <li>Manage a large volume of pre/post sales technical issues with a focus on challenges arising from customers migrating onto Samsung Optimized solutions.</li>  <li>Document technical issue resolutions, known issues, root cause analysis, troubleshooting details in a comprehensive Knowledge Base.</li>  <li>Logging activities and maintaining prospect’s technical profile in CRM.</li>   <li>Providing regular reports on account activities (account visits, calls, etc.).</li>   <li>Develop and maintain expert-level knowledge of Samsung’s B2B product and service offerings.</li>  <li>Attends company trainings to stay abreast of the latest internal technologies and product line developments.</li>   <li>Keeps informed of latest industry news, trends, products, services, competitors and relevant existing and emerging technologies.</li>  <li>Frequent travel to partner/customer facilities, remote facilities, industry events, and trade shows more than 30 to 50% of time.</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div><strong>MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:</strong>  <ul>   <li>Have 5 - 7+ years of experience in mobile solution sales and support with a technical/engineering background preferred.</li>   <li>Have 5 - 7+ years of experience working in the enterprise sales space with exposure to multiple industry verticals preferred.</li>  <li>Minimum 3 years previous technical sales support experience or equivalent, preferably for both SAAS and enterprise, on-premise technology solutions preferred.</li>  <li>Must have experience working with external vendors in multiple industry verticals.</li>  <li>Demonstrated experience with deployment of complex technical solutions in a large enterprise environment.</li>  <li>Detailed technical knowledge of the wireless industry to include mobile hardware (Smartphones and Tablets), applications (OS and End-user Apps) and services.</li>   <li>Deep understanding of the integration of mobile solutions into corporate network environments and email platforms, mainly Microsoft Exchange and Lotus Notes.</li>   <li>Efficient in troubleshooting application, device, and network communications</li>   <li>Must be able to write, read, analyze, interpret, present, and explain mobile technical products and development materials.</li>   <li>A Knowledge of BES, MobileIron, Airwatch, SAP, Citrix, SOTI, MaaS360e and other MDM solutions a must.</li>  <li>Understanding of web applications and their architecture and design</li>   <li>Knowledge of Application stores and the associated enterprise customer requirements a plus.</li>   <li>Bachelor’s degree in Business or Engineering from accredited college or university.</li>   <li>Experience with wireless network configuration and troubleshooting preferred</li>   <li>Must have experience with Microsoft Standard Office Suite and extensive use of presentation software within a Windows/NT LAN/WAN network environment.</li> </ul>   </div> <br/> <div><strong>BENEFITS:</strong> <br/><br/> Premium offers a competitive salary along with a full benefits package including health, dental, vision, life insurance, long-term disability, and paid time off. All supplementary benefits and employment practices are in compliance with all Canadian employment laws.</div> <div><strong>COMPANY:</strong> <br/><br/> Premium has been pioneering bold strategies, tools and technologies since 1985 with a single goal: to help our partners advance their industries and the lives of their consumers. <br/><br/> Experts in strategy, merchandising, brand advocacy and support, we employ a tailored approach to answering each client's unique business needs. Together with our clients, we're inventing and leading a new era in retail, moving forward by moving beyond what's expected.</div><br/>   <div><strong>PREMIUM CAREERS:</strong> <br/><br/> Retail experience? Check. An unbeatable work ethic? Check. A burning desire to be part of a team delivering results for a cutting-edge roster of clients? Check. You just might be Premium. <br/><br/> Propel brands to new heights with integrity and imagination. Join our team and be the next big thing.</div><br/>   <div>Premium is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we will accommodate your needs under the Human Rights Code. Upon individual request, hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application, interview or selection processes, please contact the Human Resources Department for assistance. Due to the high volume of applicants, only those moving forward in the next step of the selection process will be contacted.</div> </div>  </div>  </div><div></div>

Title: R&D Software Intern - SCA
Job_Description: <DIV>The Schneider Electric industrial software business and AVEVA have merged to trade as AVEVA Group plc, a UK listed company. The Schneider Electric and Life is On trademarks are owned by Schneider Electric and are being licensed to AVEVA by Schneider Electric.</DIV> <br/> <strong></strong><br/>  <DIV>Schneider Electric Software’s merger with Aveva creates an innovative and trusted provider of software and services that improve productivity and profitability for production, manufacturing and infrastructure industries. Our software solutions allow customers to deliver sustainable performance with flexibility and agility to address evolving market requirements. Over 4,400 employees thrive in more than 30 countries.</DIV>  <br/>Schneider Electric is looking for an intern to assist the R&D Software Development Team, Project Management Team and with various administrative and research tasks. <br/><br/> - Must currently be enrolled in a University or a University Graduate - Computer Science and Software required. <br/><br/> - Strong writing, verbal communication, and project management abilities. <br/><br/> - Relevant software development and software testing knowledge and experience <br/><br/> - Intermediate programming and statistical analysis abilities <br/><br/> - Experience with SQL and Microsoft Reporting Services (SSRS) desired.

Title: Software Developer - AssetWorks Field Service Solutions (FSS)
Job_Description: <strong><u>Job Summary:</u> <br/>  <br/> </strong> <br/> Intermediate Software Developer <br/>  <br/> <strong><u>Job Description:</u> <br/><br/> </strong> <br/> For field service companies who need web based fleet management tools, AssetWorks Field Service Solutions (FSS) improves operator safety, streamlines operations, & reduces fleet related operating costs. Unlike other fleet management tools which are often AVL only focused and fairly one dimensional, FSS has the ability to address the nuances of a wide variety of field service industries with features such as custom map data layers, incident reporting, lone worker monitoring, customized work flows, satellite communication backup, private roads etc, while addressing common transportation issues like Hours of Service and driver behaviour. This provides AssetWorks a competitive edge in this market. <br/> There are ongoing requirements to expand the FSS product to support new industry requirements, adapt to new web and mobile technologies and maintain a system that clients depend on 24x7 for their operations. We are seeking qualified individuals to join our software development team in the Calgary, AB office. <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> The successful applicant will work a team of experienced developers and will be involved in all stages of the development process from research, specification development and review, implementation and testing to pilot and support. There will be involvement on all aspects of the solution from the web client through to the mobile devices. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Requirements</u>:</strong>  <ul> <li>BSc in computer science or computer/software engineering;</li><li>Strong C# / Microsoft .NET programming experience;</li><li>MS SQL DBMS experience</li><li>Practical experience with unit testing and overall testing strategies;</li><li>Ability to work collaboratively within a team;</li><li>Strong diagnostic and troubleshooting skills;</li><li>Capable of clear and concise written and oral communications.</li> </ul>  <strong><u>Assets</u>:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience in WPF and web development;</li><li>Experience with mobile application programming</li><li>Experience with Oracle DBMS</li><li>Experience using source control (i.e. TFS);</li> </ul>  We are seeking candidates with at least 2 years of relevant experience. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Worker Type:</u> <br/>  <br/> </strong> <br/> Regular <br/>  <br/> <strong><u>Number of Openings Available:</u> <br/>  <br/> </strong> <br/> <strong>1</strong>

Title: Sales Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>Title:</strong> Sales Engineer <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary <br/><br/> Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. <br/><br/> <strong>Role:</strong> <br/><br/> Splunk is seeking a highly motivated, results oriented individual to join our dynamic presales team. You will work together with Splunk’s direct sales team on the solution and technical aspects of selling Splunk’s solutions to our largest commercial Enterprise clients. Our clients span all business sectors and sizes. You'll be the subject matter expert for our team serving our customers and prospects in the Calgary region. <br/><br/> Would you like the opportunity to work at a fast-growing company that is changing the way that information is used to support business decisions? You will have the responsibility for actively driving and leading the technology evaluation stage of the sales cycle. Working in conjunction with the sales team as the key technical advisor, you will be an advocate for Splunk’s products and services. Additionally, you will position Splunk's technology and solutions to both business and technical users. You will identify all technical issues of your assigned accounts to assure complete client satisfaction throughout the sales process, and establish and maintain positive relationships with your client's technical staff. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Ability to demonstrate Splunk products and services to customers on site, remotely via webinar sessions, and at field events such as conferences and trade shows.</li><li>Experience responding to functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs is also important.</li><li>Self-motivated with a proven track record in technical software sales and knowledge of technology.</li><li>Strong presentation skills and ability to communicate clearly to emails and RFPs when submitting reports.</li><li>Ability to be organized and analytical, and will be able to eliminate sales obstacles using creative and adaptive approaches.</li><li>Comfortable working for a dynamic technical organization with a fast growing customer base.</li><li><strong>IMPORTANT:</strong> We can teach you the technology, coach you on soft skills and educate you on processes. You should have a strong sense of <strong>self-motivation</strong>, an <strong>insatiable</strong> <strong>curiosity</strong> about what “is possible” with technology, the desire to work with an <strong>awesome</strong> <strong>team</strong> and a <strong>positive,</strong> <strong>fun-loving</strong> attitude.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>5+ years related experience in selling and supporting software products to IT organizations.</li><li>Knowledge of virtualization (VMware/Citrix/Hyper-V).</li><li>Network Administration/Architecture/Management Knowledge.</li><li>Unix/Windows – Administration Experience.</li><li>Domain expertise with IT operations, security or compliance.</li><li>Familiar with Computer Programming - C/C++, Shell, Perl, Python Programming.</li><li>Knowledge of “Big data” technologies (Map-Reduce, Hadoop, HBase, Cloudera, Cassandra).</li><li>Comfortable approaching total strangers and quickly extracting technical know-how from them.</li><li>Should be available to travel to visit prospects and customers.</li><li>Strong written and verbal communications skills.</li><li>Located in Calagary</li>  </ul> <strong>Education:</strong> <br/><br/> Bachelor of Science degree in EE, CE, Computer Science, MIS, or Business. We’ll break the rules if you’re awesome. Liberal Arts majors/minors are great to see. We love individuals with a broad range of interests; art, science, research, writing, music, whatever you’re into. <br/><br/> Are you looking for an incredible place to work that celebrates innovation, leadership and creativity? Please contact us. Splunk offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits. When you join Splunk you'll be working with a team of smart people who are as passionate about our products as our customers' success. <br/><br/> We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which you are applying.

Title: Software Coop Student - Fall Term 8 Months
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is looking for a computer engineering, software engineering, or computer scientist for an eight month work term to help deliver a world class Tactical Communication and Information System (TacCIS) to a new customer. Our Canadian teams will design, integrate, manufacture, verify, deliver, install and support the TacCIS System. The TacCIS Project will integrate proven GDMS products along with customer supplied Radios and Encryption equipment to form a modern tactical vehicle CIS solution. <br/><br/> The project phases include System Design, Software and Hardware Design, System Integration, and System Validation. Following the Engineering Phase, the project will lead into production and through life support services. The Project will be a multi-site development in Ottawa and Calgary with activities spanning several product development groups across the Land and Joint Solutions business area. <br/><br/> The TacCIS Software Team will work collaboratively with the System Engineering team on evaluating, selecting, modifying, and integrating existing software solutions into the system architecture, as well as designing, implementing, and testing new solutions for components, services, and GUIs that do not exist. The following are some of the Computer Software Configuration Items (CSCIs) in the system that the software team will provide or integrate with; Smart Display Operating System, Drivers and Software, Tactical Integration Framework, Time Services and Network Services. <ul> <li>Participate in sprint planning, retrospectives, daily scrums and backlog refinement as part of an Agile development team</li><li>Software development for a web-based application</li><li>User interface and embedded software development for a Linux device</li><li>Develop web-based applications</li><li>Develop solutions to integrate software components</li><li>Develop user interface and embedded software</li><li>Develop and execute test scripts</li><li>Integrate computer data terminals and networking hardware</li><li>Create and update technical documentation</li><li>Ensure completed tasks meet the acceptance criteria and the definition of done</li><li>Participate in system demonstrations</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience developing applications for an embedded system</li><li>Experience with computer programming in C, C++ and Python</li><li>User interface development in JavaScript</li><li>Hands-on experience installing and configuring Linux based operating systems</li><li>Familiarity and understanding of network and Linux security</li><li>Experience configuring an IPv4 network</li><li>Work effectively in a team environment</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Adaptable to a fast paced learning environment</li> </ul> <strong>Assets</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with networking technologies such as VLANs, routing protocols (OSPFv2 or RIPv2), or IPv6</li><li>Experience with network device management technologies such as SNMP and NETCONF</li><li>Experience with cybersecurity techniques and public key encryption (IPSEC)</li><li>Experience with audio and multimedia processing</li><li>Understanding of Object Oriented Programming principals</li><li>Embedded software development on a Raspberry Pi</li><li>Qt User Interface development</li><li>Knowledge using Git for source code management</li><li>Virtual machine setup and troubleshooting</li><li>Building and installing Linux on a processing circuit board</li><li>Circuit board component assembly</li><li>Knowledge of the Agile process for development</li><li>Audio and multimedia processing</li><li>Network and Linux security</li><li>Virtual machine setup and troubleshooting</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Education</strong> <br/> Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering program or equivalent. <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Ad Tech Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>Company Overview</strong> <br/><br/> MonetizeMore is an ad optimization company that dramatically increases ad revenues of websites and creates innovative ad optimization technology. <br/><br/> MonetizeMore manages all aspects of publishers ad inventories as a trusted partner. This includes, but is not limited to: <br/><br/> DFP implementation and optimization <br/> Optimization amongst hundreds of ad networks including Facebook, Google Adsense and AdX <br/> Header Bidding implementation and optimization <br/> Building ad optimization technology to further increase ad revenues, automate ad operations and ensure quality user experience. <br/><br/> We are a group of 60+ team members that are ambitious, innovative and passionate about making a positive difference in the ad tech industry. Each team member values and gets the full benefit of location and schedule freedom. This allows each team member to engineer the perfect lifestyle for themselves while still being involved in a challenging and progressive career. We truly believe that if someone can live their ideal lifestyle, they will be enabled to perform to the best of their abilities. <br/><br/> MonetizeMore is seven years old, a Google Adsense Certified Partner, and a leader in ad optimization technology and strategy. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> MonetizeMore is looking for an Ad Tech Engineer comfortable in an Agile Development environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong>  <ul> <li>Use Javascript, Python/Flask, PostgreSQL, Linux, Docker, Git, Cloud Services and any other new tech that accomplishes the tasks.</li> <li>Develop APIs and hook up to third parties APIs to automate manual work.</li> <li>Develop user interfaces for third-party reporting or internal business processes.</li> <li>Integrate multiple services to maximize Ad monetization.</li> <li>Write Javascript code that tracks and acts upon billions of actions.</li> <li>Work in an Agile environment where requirements are clear and tasks are small and modular.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience</li> <li>3+ years of programming experience</li> <li>2+ years of experience in web development - Flask, Django, Ruby on Rails or similar</li> <li>2+ years Experience with software development for an Ad tech Industry</li> <li>SQL database experience, schema design, optimization, query analysis, database administration</li> <li>Knowledge of DHTML, experience with ReactJS, AngularJS or similar</li> <li>Experience on Linux platforms basic administration, builds, software deployment, writing Shell scripts</li> <li>GIT experience</li> <li>English language fluency</li> <li>Good communication skills, self motivated</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits and Perks</strong>  <ul> <li>Location freedom (100% remote working set-up)</li> <li>You get to create your own schedule</li> <li>Competitive compensation package</li> </ul>

Title: QA (Software) and Regulatory Manager
Job_Description: Who we are looking for <br/><br/> We have built Curve Dental into an industry-leading provider of beautiful cloud software for the dental industry. With development operations based in Calgary for over 12 years, we recently received private equity investment (Battery Ventures) so that we can accelerate our growth and further dominate the dental software industry. <br/><br/> In this position you will lead a team of QA analysts that test every release of our SaaS product, Curve Hero. Your team will be responsible for manual and automated testing, including building new automation and analyzing the results. You will work with teams across the company to coordinate and schedule testing resources, and raise issues to senior management when necessary. Though not heavily involved in the day to day testing you may need to occasionally roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty by reviewing test plans, test cases and test results and sometimes even testing things yourself. <br/><br/> This position is also responsible for overseeing the companys ISO certification process and quality management system. In this role you will coordinate all necessary activities and resources to ensure that the company successfully maintains its ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 13485:2016 certification. You will also work with senior management to help ensure that medical device licensing is maintained for our product. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Management <br/><br/> Manage a QA team made up of QA Analysts, Software Developers in Test who are focused on manual and automated testing (as well as regulatory personnel as the team grows) <br/> Lead resource management across projects, recruiting, mentorship, and performance management for the QA team <br/> Work with senior management to track and manage budgetary and resourcing needs for the QA team <br/> Report on overall team and departmental performance to senior management <br/><br/> Process <br/><br/> Responsible for the overall QA process for manual and automated testing <br/> Responsible for driving quality across all disciplines, providing guidance, feedback, and suggestions to improve quality practices across the company <br/> Establish, build and grow an automated testing discipline within the company <br/> Define and evolve ongoing QA process improvements including management of QA outputs, work processes, adoption and implementation of best practices and tools, etc <br/> Establish methods for monitoring and reporting on overall product quality and test coverage with a view to improving both <br/><br/> Product <br/><br/> Work with project leads to plan, estimate and coordinate QA resources, activities and dependencies in order to meet project needs and deliverables <br/> Work with project leads to define and monitor quality objects and report on overall product quality with a view to meeting and exceeding those objectives <br/> Review QA outputs including test plans, test cases, and results for quality, consistency and appropriateness <br/> Ensure QA resources are delivering on project needs <br/><br/> Regulatory <br/><br/> Oversee the ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 13485:2016 Quality Management System <br/> Plan and coordinate activities required to maintain ISO certification (under MDSAP) including audits <br/> Coordinate regulatory (Health Canada and FDA) filings as needed to maintain medical device licensing, working with senior management <br/> Coordinate cross functional stakeholders and contributors in the process of maintaining and improving the Quality management System <br/> Ensure that company stakeholders are following defined standard operating procedures <br/> Periodically review changes to FDA and Health Canada Medical Device Regulations and manage impacts to the quality management system <br/> Periodically conduct internal audits on the quality management system processes <br/><br/> <strong>Key Job Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Must Haves:</strong> <br/> 5 years of experience in hands-on testing and 3 years of experience as a manager <br/> Hands on experience in both manual and automation testing <br/> Strong technical background with experience in web technologies <br/> Strong familiarity with the tools that agile development and QA teams use for managing their work <br/> Ability to plan, estimate and coordinate tasks and resources is a must. Some experience with project management is a bonus. <br/> Strong verbal and written communications skills <br/> Ability to work closely with cross functional teams at all levels of the organization <br/> Post-secondary education in engineering, computer science, information systems, or other related field <br/><br/> <strong>Nice to haves, but not mandatory:</strong> <br/> Familiarity with ISO 9001 and 13485 quality standards and quality management systems <br/> Familiarity with FDA and Health Canada Medical Device Regulations <br/><br/> How to Apply <br/><br/> Send your resume to qajobs@curvedental.com with the subject line YOUR NAME: QA (Software) and Regulatory Manager! Remember to make the name substitution, and to include the exclamation mark :-) <br/><br/> Don't just send us your standard cover letter; simply answer the following 3 questions: <br/><br/> What do you know about our business and industry? <br/> Why is what we do important to our clients? <br/> What is your favourite aspect of our business, and why? <br/><br/> This particular role is at Curve Dental's office in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. To find out more about Curve Dental and what it's like to work with us go to www.curvedental.com/jobs

Title: Firmware Engineers , Junior - Senior Level
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is staffing Firmware Engineers from junior to senior level for award of a new contract to deliver a world class Tactical Communication and Information System (TacCIS) to a new customer. Our Canadian team will be partnered to deploy a vehicle installed with field-proven TacCIS architecture and system components which is cost effective, modular and scalable to support different vehicle variant roles.The vehicle TacCIS provides the vehicle crew with intercom and radio voice services and is capable of transmitting high-speed Position Awareness (PA), Command & Control (C2) and sensor data on the move as a component of a larger Battalion-level TacCIS. <br/><br/> The project will involve participation from System Design, Software and Platform Design, System Integration, and System Validation domain stakeholders. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning groups across General Dynamics Mission Systems-International.The firmware development team will be primarily focused on evolving and customizing existing Ethernet Local Area Network domain firmware to be applied to the customer requirements. <br/><br/> Typical Duties <ul> <li>Assisting and supporting lead engineers and team members</li> <li>Performing some basic design and/or analysis functions based on requirements</li><li>Documenting the analysis, design and test in accordance with development standards</li><li>Participate in integrated team activities with System Engineering, Development and System Integration</li><li>Developing and performing tests and debug of code</li><li>Identifying defects, resolving issues and verification</li><li>Supporting and performing system level test and integration efforts</li><li>Participating in code reviews</li><li>All other duties as required</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience <ul> <li>Able to apply problem solving skills to daily activities</li><li>Experience developing system software</li><li>Experience in programming in C/C++</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li> <li>Excellent communication and time management skills</li><li>Strong problem solving and root cause analysis skills</li><li>Enthusiastic contributor, willingness to learn new skills and takes on ownership of work</li><li>Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li> </ul> Skills & Experience Nice to Have <ul> <li>Experience with DevOps tools such as IBM Jazz Rational Team Concert for Requirements Management, Quality Management, and Configuration/Change Management</li><li>Experience with scripting languages such as bash, powershell</li><li>Experience with data model generation, database schemas, relational models, object models, data access layers, and CRUD operations</li><li>Experience with policy-based/highly configurable software</li><li>Experience with distributed database models</li><li>Experience with pub/sub and request/response messaging patterns</li><li>Experience with multimedia technologies such as SIP, RTP, and RTCP</li><li>Experience with transport layer technologies such as TCP/IP and UDP</li><li>Experience with networking technologies such as IPv4, IPv6, VLANs, 802.3, Routing Protocols (OSPF, IS-IS, BGP4), 802.1x, DSCP, and DHCP</li><li>Experience with network device management technologies such as SNMP and NETCONF.</li><li>Experience with cross-platform development</li> </ul> Education <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Engineer, Operations
Job_Description: <div><strong>LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB) <br/> <strong>JOB NUMBER:</strong> 17961 <br/><br/> <strong>Job Overview</strong> <br/><br/> Reporting to the manager, Autonomous Haul System (AHS) Engineering, you will be accountable to collect and analyze performance data from both field and office environments. This is a dynamic role, where you will interact within a multi-functional team to continually assess and optimize our AHS fleet output. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Demonstrate safety leadership for yourself and others consistently</li><li>Provide in-depth understanding of AHS operations data with an emphasis on data integrity and standardization across all work teams</li><li>Perform frequent and varied data analysis and create unique reports for distribution to mining teams</li><li>Lead the change management process through version upgrades for Front Runner and any other major upgrades impacting the our AHS operations teams</li><li>Build and execute scopes for production studies on all aspects of the autonomous load-haul-place cycle</li><li>Collaborate with the operations team regularly to examine and investigate performance focus areas</li><li>Conduct field investigations such as time motion studies, payload performance and specific equipment performance areas</li> </ul> <strong>Required Qualifications</strong> <br/><br/> Experience and Education: <ul> <li>Minimum five years of large scale open pit mine operations experience, including both field and technical roles; oil sands experience is critical</li><li>Experience in autonomous mining operation is highly desirable</li><li>University degree in mining engineering or related field</li><li>Professional Engineering designation with APEGA or eligibility to register with APEGA</li><li>High School Diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)</li><li>Possess a valid driver’s licence and a clean driving record</li> </ul> Skills and Knowledge: <ul> <li>Strong understanding of oil sands mine operating practices, including technical knowledge and process skills</li><li>Excellent change management skills with the ability to think tactically and strategically</li><li>Familiarity with Modular Mining Systems dispatch software is an asset</li><li>Strong analytical skills and proficiency in Microsoft Excel with a proven foundation in SQL and VBA</li><li>Focus on teamwork with a track record of effective interaction within a multi-disciplinary team environment</li><li>You constantly ask what could go wrong and check for out-of-the-ordinary conditions and learn to anticipate potential problems</li> </ul> <strong>Working Conditions</strong> <ul> <li>This position will initially be based in Fort McMurray, Alberta and will then transition to a position in Calgary, Alberta with frequent site travel</li><li>The schedule is seven days on, seven days off while in Fort McMurray</li><li>While in Fort McMurray, transportation and housing will be provided</li> </ul> <strong>Why Suncor</strong> <br/> Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you&apos;re genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including: <ul> <li>Competitive base salary and compensation programs</li><li>Attractive annual incentive program</li><li>Flexible benefits package</li><li>Rewarding pension and savings plans</li> </ul> Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we&apos;re living up to our commitment to keeping you informed. <br/><br/> <strong>Business Overview</strong> <br/> Suncor Energy is Canada&apos;s energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada. <br/><br/> And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels. <br/><br/> As part of Suncor&apos;s team, you&apos;ll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada&apos;s largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you&apos;ll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day. <br/><br/> Suncor promotes diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Suncor is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Suncor is committed to accessibility and accommodations will be provided to applicants upon request. At Suncor, we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential. <br/><br/> Not sure if this particular listing is the right opportunity for you? Please join our Talent Community at www.suncor.com and click on Careers, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job listings and employment news. <br/><br/> <strong>Please note that our job postings are typically open for two weeks, so if you are interested and qualified, apply now.</strong> <br/><br/> JOB CATEGORY: Engineering</div>

Title: Full Stack Software Developer
Job_Description: <p><strong>Company Background:</strong></p> <p>3esi-Enersight is the leading global provider of solutions for integrated planning in upstream oil and gas. Our software connects all E&P data and workflows from strategy to execution through innovative technology, expert consulting and first-rate customer service.<br></p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop high quality, well performing, modular, configurable, commercial software products for the upstream oil and gas industry</li> <li>Take shared ownership of software development methodology and practices</li> <li>Work with a team to deliver software functionality</li> <li>Ensure software deliverables align with the technical architecture, development standards and quality practices</li> <li>Assist in building and executing integrated unit tests for all code modules</li> <li>Develop well documented, intent-revealing code</li> <li>Participate in peer review activities</li> <li>Create a learning environment through collaboration, shared knowledge, and leadership.</li> <li>Mentor peers and less experienced software developers regarding design, programming approaches, application knowledge and technical product knowledge</li> </ul> <p><strong>Key Competencies:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Proficient with JavaScript/Typescript and .NET Framework/Core</li> <li>Experience with a modern front-end framework like React/Redux</li> <li>Experience with unit testing frameworks</li> <li>Extensive object-oriented analysis and design experience</li> <li>Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts</li> <li>Ability to work on Agile/Scrum based team</li> <li>Knowledge of oil and gas industry and associated workflows is an asset</li> </ul> <p><strong></strong><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li>5+ years’ experience creating and maintaining high performance web based applications with a large user base</li> <li>Undergraduate degree in a technical or business field, or relevant software development experience</li> </ul> <b>What's in it for you?</b><br> <ul> <li>The People: We have an amazing team filled with very smart people and a highly collaborative environment.</li> <li>The Technology: We are in the process of transitioning our existing products to a cloud-based delivery model. If you have an interest in microservices, distributed systems, containerization and the associated technologies then this will be an exciting place for you to work.</li> <li>The Business: We are a software company devoted to providing planning tools to the upstream oil & gas industry. Our clients require our software whether the industry is booming or in a downturn, which creates a relatively stable environment. The business domain is both challenging and interesting as we are required to solve complex business problems.</li> <li>Other benefits: <ul> <li>Scrum based development process</li> <li>Organized into small, co-located, self-organizing, cross-functional development teams</li> <li>Extra-curricular team projects (e.g. building an arcade for the game room)</li> <li>Foosball table</li> <li>Snacks and pop provided</li> <li>X-box gaming area</li> <li>Comprehensive health and dental benefits</li> <li>Awesome building amenities, including a huge underground bike cage, change rooms with showers and towel service, and a fitness centre</li> <li>Transportation subsidy</li> </ul> </li> </ul> <br>
