Title: Software Developer
Job_Description: We're active members of the communities we serve. That's why at Stantec, we always <strong>design with community in mind</strong>. <br/><br/> The Stantec community unites approximately 22,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. Our work—engineering, architecture, interior design, landscape architecture, surveying, environmental sciences, project management, and project economics, from initial project concept and planning through design, construction, and commissioning—begins at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. With a long-term commitment to the people and places we serve, Stantec has the unique ability to connect to projects on a personal level and advance the quality of life in communities across the globe. Stantec trades on the TSX and the NYSE under the symbol STN. Visit us at stantec.com or find us on social media. <br/><br/> We have an exciting opportunity for a contract <strong>Software Developer</strong> in our <strong>Calgary, AB</strong> office. <br/><br/> We are looking for an individual that is motivated, talented, and committed to enhancing individual, team, and company performance. <br/><br/> <strong><em>This role is an eight (8) month contract with the possibility for extension or conversion to permanent employment.</em></strong> <br/><br/> Your primary responsibilities as a Software Developer will include: <ul> <li>Documenting the types and structure of the data as well as mapping and tracing data from system to system to solve a given business or system problem</li><li>Manage data integration from different sources into the database and apply QC/QA processes</li><li>Develop flowcharts, layouts, and documentation to identify requirements and solutions</li><li>Write well-designed, testable code</li><li>Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility</li><li>Integrate software components into a fully functional software system</li><li>Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures</li><li>Document and maintain software functionality</li><li>Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Minimum of a Bachelor’s or Associate’s Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or GIS related field</li><li>Familiarity with Agile development methodologies</li><li>Experience with software design and development in a test-driven environment</li><li>Minimum of 5 years’ experience in database development and/or software development</li><li>Minimum of 5 years of experience with tools and technologies: C# program on desktop WinForm, WPF, UWP, and ASP.Net / ASP.Net Core, Webform, MVC, JavaScript/JQuery</li><li>Minimum of 5 years’ experience with SQL Server, T-SQL, and Microsoft Business Intelligence Tools</li><li>Ability to work independently and multi-task effectively</li><li>Demonstrated understanding of projects from the perspective of both client and business</li><li>Good communication skills (both oral and written)</li><li>Experience with Microsoft Azure is an asset</li><li>Experience of FME desktop and Server an asset</li><li>Experience of Tensorflow as an asset</li> </ul>

Title: Business Development Manager – TD Mutual Funds
Job_Description: Company Overview <br/> <div>Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward. <br/><br/> Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com</div>  <br/>Department Overview <br/> <div>TD Asset Management (TDAM) is a member of TD Bank Financial Group and is one of Canada’s largest investment management firms. As of June 30, 2017, TDAM and its affiliates manage over $347 billion in assets on behalf of pension, insurance, endowment/foundation and corporate clients, as well as high-net worth clients and retail mutual funds, across both active fundamental and quantitative-based solutions. On the retail investment side, TDAM is the third largest mutual fund company in Canada and manages assets on behalf of more than 1.9 million investors and offers one of the most broadly diversified fund families in Canada. A cornerstone of TDAM’s success has been the ability to partner with its clients to develop customized solutions that meet their evolving needs and objectives.<br/><br/>TDAM’s Advisor Distribution team offers a range of mutual funds and managed portfolios through a national sales and service team of over 100 people. The sales team is responsible for selling TD Mutual Funds through external advisors (Brokers and Planners), contributing to TD MF assets of over $100 Billion. TDAM in total manages over $260 Billion in AUM, making it one of the largest asset managers in Canada.</div> <br/> <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> <div>The Business Development Manager works in partnership with a Regional Vice President to prospect and maintain business relationships with Brokers/Planners/Financial Advisors within a defined territory. <br/> The goal of the position is to increase the market share of TD Mutual Funds within the industry by promoting our products and services to existing clients while soliciting prospective clients. This is a well-paid position which provides excellent opportunities for growth within TDAM and the larger TD organization and ability to develop sales techniques, relationship management skills and analyze and use capital markets knowledge daily, relaying TDAM’s outlook and solutions to a set of sophisticated clientele. <br/> <strong>Job Description:</strong>   <ul> <li>Ensure full knowledge of most current fund and market trends including – product/portfolio features, benefits, sales tools/processes, and investment strategies .</li> <li>Build client relationships with prospective, existing and dormant accounts, primarily over the telephone to generate new business through proactive contacts and regular follow-ups.</li> <li>Periodically attend client events/meetings and represent TDAM at conferences.</li>   <li>Consistently meet quarterly outbound contact targets, gross/net sales and growth of advisor.</li> <li>Work with entire sales team to deliver strategic activity at all levels – at the advisor, segmentation, territory, calendar and events level.</li> <li>Be a solution provider to advisors by asking great questions to uncover a need and then present a compelling product solution</li> <li>Work to diversify sales at the advisor and product level to ensure sustainability of sales momentum</li> <li>Deliver solution information, Portfolio Manager insights, macro-economic guidance and practice management advice.</li>  </ul>  </div>  <br/><strong>Requirements</strong> <br/> <div>   <ul> <li>Strong Financial acumen – Financial designations (CFA, CFP, CIM) and/ or academic background in finance, economics, etc. (undergraduate degree or graduate).</li> <li>Previous experience working with Investment Advisors (Brokers/Planners) and detailed knowledge of their business practices.</li> <li>Genuine interest/curiosity about capital markets and finance, driven to continually self-learn.</li> <li>IFIC Canadian Investment Funds Course and/or CSC.</li> <li>In-depth knowledge of the structure and features of mutual funds and the competitive landscape of the industry. Prior experience in industry an asset.</li> <li>Proven ability to prospect and build relationships.</li> <li>Computer proficiency with MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook).</li> <li>Ability to work effectively within a close team environment, excellent attitude and receptivity to coaching.</li> <li>Entrepreneurial and relationship building</li> <li>Client-service orientation</li> <li>Strong communication skills (verbal/written)</li> </ul> <strong>#LI-POST</strong></div> <br/> Hours <br/> <div>Mon – Fri</div> <br/> Inclusiveness <br/> <div>At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.</div> <br/>

Title: Ad Tech Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>Company Overview</strong> <br/><br/> MonetizeMore is an ad optimization company that dramatically increases ad revenues of websites and creates innovative ad optimization technology. <br/><br/> MonetizeMore manages all aspects of publishers ad inventories as a trusted partner. This includes, but is not limited to: <br/><br/> DFP implementation and optimization <br/> Optimization amongst hundreds of ad networks including Facebook, Google Adsense and AdX <br/> Header Bidding implementation and optimization <br/> Building ad optimization technology to further increase ad revenues, automate ad operations and ensure quality user experience. <br/><br/> We are a group of 60+ team members that are ambitious, innovative and passionate about making a positive difference in the ad tech industry. Each team member values and gets the full benefit of location and schedule freedom. This allows each team member to engineer the perfect lifestyle for themselves while still being involved in a challenging and progressive career. We truly believe that if someone can live their ideal lifestyle, they will be enabled to perform to the best of their abilities. <br/><br/> MonetizeMore is seven years old, a Google Adsense Certified Partner, and a leader in ad optimization technology and strategy. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Summary</strong> <br/><br/> MonetizeMore is looking for an Ad Tech Engineer comfortable in an Agile Development environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong>  <ul> <li>Use Javascript, Python/Flask, PostgreSQL, Linux, Docker, Git, Cloud Services and any other new tech that accomplishes the tasks.</li> <li>Develop APIs and hook up to third parties APIs to automate manual work.</li> <li>Develop user interfaces for third-party reporting or internal business processes.</li> <li>Integrate multiple services to maximize Ad monetization.</li> <li>Write Javascript code that tracks and acts upon billions of actions.</li> <li>Work in an Agile environment where requirements are clear and tasks are small and modular.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience</li> <li>3+ years of programming experience</li> <li>2+ years of experience in web development - Flask, Django, Ruby on Rails or similar</li> <li>2+ years Experience with software development for an Ad tech Industry</li> <li>SQL database experience, schema design, optimization, query analysis, database administration</li> <li>Knowledge of DHTML, experience with ReactJS, AngularJS or similar</li> <li>Experience on Linux platforms basic administration, builds, software deployment, writing Shell scripts</li> <li>GIT experience</li> <li>English language fluency</li> <li>Good communication skills, self motivated</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits and Perks</strong>  <ul> <li>Location freedom (100% remote working set-up)</li> <li>You get to create your own schedule</li> <li>Competitive compensation package</li> </ul>

Title: Software Coop Student - Fall Term 8 Months
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is looking for a computer engineering, software engineering, or computer scientist for an eight month work term to help deliver a world class Tactical Communication and Information System (TacCIS) to a new customer. Our Canadian teams will design, integrate, manufacture, verify, deliver, install and support the TacCIS System. The TacCIS Project will integrate proven GDMS products along with customer supplied Radios and Encryption equipment to form a modern tactical vehicle CIS solution. <br/><br/> The project phases include System Design, Software and Hardware Design, System Integration, and System Validation. Following the Engineering Phase, the project will lead into production and through life support services. The Project will be a multi-site development in Ottawa and Calgary with activities spanning several product development groups across the Land and Joint Solutions business area. <br/><br/> The TacCIS Software Team will work collaboratively with the System Engineering team on evaluating, selecting, modifying, and integrating existing software solutions into the system architecture, as well as designing, implementing, and testing new solutions for components, services, and GUIs that do not exist. The following are some of the Computer Software Configuration Items (CSCIs) in the system that the software team will provide or integrate with; Smart Display Operating System, Drivers and Software, Tactical Integration Framework, Time Services and Network Services. <ul> <li>Participate in sprint planning, retrospectives, daily scrums and backlog refinement as part of an Agile development team</li><li>Software development for a web-based application</li><li>User interface and embedded software development for a Linux device</li><li>Develop web-based applications</li><li>Develop solutions to integrate software components</li><li>Develop user interface and embedded software</li><li>Develop and execute test scripts</li><li>Integrate computer data terminals and networking hardware</li><li>Create and update technical documentation</li><li>Ensure completed tasks meet the acceptance criteria and the definition of done</li><li>Participate in system demonstrations</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience developing applications for an embedded system</li><li>Experience with computer programming in C, C++ and Python</li><li>User interface development in JavaScript</li><li>Hands-on experience installing and configuring Linux based operating systems</li><li>Familiarity and understanding of network and Linux security</li><li>Experience configuring an IPv4 network</li><li>Work effectively in a team environment</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Adaptable to a fast paced learning environment</li> </ul> <strong>Assets</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with networking technologies such as VLANs, routing protocols (OSPFv2 or RIPv2), or IPv6</li><li>Experience with network device management technologies such as SNMP and NETCONF</li><li>Experience with cybersecurity techniques and public key encryption (IPSEC)</li><li>Experience with audio and multimedia processing</li><li>Understanding of Object Oriented Programming principals</li><li>Embedded software development on a Raspberry Pi</li><li>Qt User Interface development</li><li>Knowledge using Git for source code management</li><li>Virtual machine setup and troubleshooting</li><li>Building and installing Linux on a processing circuit board</li><li>Circuit board component assembly</li><li>Knowledge of the Agile process for development</li><li>Audio and multimedia processing</li><li>Network and Linux security</li><li>Virtual machine setup and troubleshooting</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>Education</strong> <br/> Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering program or equivalent. <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Application Development Manager
Job_Description: POSITION: Software Development Manager <br><br> <strong>HOW TO APPLY:</strong> <ul> <li>*Please apply through company online job postings only, candidates who do not follow this may be disqualified</li> <li>*No phone calls or emails please</li> <li>*Only qualified applicants will be contacted</li> </ul> <strong>COMPANY BACKGROUND:</strong> <br><br> With more than 20 people, having managed over 50+ software projects, Vog App Developers is an all Canadian app development team. Recognized as one of Canada's top 10 mobile app developers, we focus on building custom mobile applications for local businesses, entrepreneurs or anybody looking to innovate. Our entrepreneurial team works with a variety of Canadian clients, and continues to grow in size and reputation. "We build more than just apps, we build businesses." We consider every individual to be unique and different from one another, which is why we drive and challenge staff members to innovate and share new ideas. Our team members enjoy the ability apply their skills in a supportive environment with knowledgeable software developers and designers. <br><br> BENEFITS: <ul> <ul> <li>Flexible work environment (work from home)</li> <li>Local team, so you don’t have to wait around for support</li> <li>Competitive pay</li> <li>Monthly team events</li> <li>Complimentary office food and beverage</li> <li>Training and mentorship</li> </ul> </ul> <ul> <li>Opportunity for growth within company</li> </ul> ROLE SUMMARY: <br><br> He/she will be responsible for working closely with sales to translate client needs into technical project requirements. He/she will coordinate and manage a projects development starting from design to completion. He/she will balance their abilities in people and technical management in order to build innovate applications for our customers. <br><br> REPORTS TO: CEO/Owner <br><br> ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES: <ul> <li>Manage the development of more than one project at a time while under time constraints.</li> <li>Analyze and define project deliverables based on client needs.</li> <li>Research and implement competitive technologies.</li> <li>Develop a detailed project plan and track progress</li> <li>Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation.</li> <li>Manage changes and updates to scope of work.</li> <li>Consult with client regarding technical inquiries</li> <li>Define, prioritize, categorize, and monitor feature progress and backlogs.</li> <li>Forecast time required to complete tasks.</li> <li>Identify talent required to complete project while working with HR.</li> <li>Implement agile software management methodologies.</li> <li>Manage frontend and backend mobile/web developer progress and performance.</li> <li>Provide programming support and training when needed.</li> <li>Work closely with QA analyst to ensure.</li> <li>Work closely with account managers to define costs and timelines.</li> <li>Build and provide detailed project reports.</li> <li>Provide coaching to supervised team members.</li> <li>Audit developer time tracking and code.</li> <li>Perform risk management to minimize project risks</li> </ul> EXPERIENCE/SKILL REQUIREMENTS: <ul> <li>Previous experience leading a team, or working with a team that released an app <li>Bachelor’s or associate degree related to project management and/or computer science.</li> </ul> OTHER REQUIREMENTS: <ul> <li>Must be able to pass a criminal reference check if needed.</li> <li>Must have a valid SIN.</li> <li>Must be legally allowed to work in Canada.</li> <li>Ability to work in Calgary Office is an asset.</li> </ul>

Title: QA (Software) and Regulatory Manager
Job_Description: Who we are looking for <br/><br/> We have built Curve Dental into an industry-leading provider of beautiful cloud software for the dental industry. With development operations based in Calgary for over 12 years, we recently received private equity investment (Battery Ventures) so that we can accelerate our growth and further dominate the dental software industry. <br/><br/> In this position you will lead a team of QA analysts that test every release of our SaaS product, Curve Hero. Your team will be responsible for manual and automated testing, including building new automation and analyzing the results. You will work with teams across the company to coordinate and schedule testing resources, and raise issues to senior management when necessary. Though not heavily involved in the day to day testing you may need to occasionally roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty by reviewing test plans, test cases and test results and sometimes even testing things yourself. <br/><br/> This position is also responsible for overseeing the companys ISO certification process and quality management system. In this role you will coordinate all necessary activities and resources to ensure that the company successfully maintains its ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 13485:2016 certification. You will also work with senior management to help ensure that medical device licensing is maintained for our product. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Management <br/><br/> Manage a QA team made up of QA Analysts, Software Developers in Test who are focused on manual and automated testing (as well as regulatory personnel as the team grows) <br/> Lead resource management across projects, recruiting, mentorship, and performance management for the QA team <br/> Work with senior management to track and manage budgetary and resourcing needs for the QA team <br/> Report on overall team and departmental performance to senior management <br/><br/> Process <br/><br/> Responsible for the overall QA process for manual and automated testing <br/> Responsible for driving quality across all disciplines, providing guidance, feedback, and suggestions to improve quality practices across the company <br/> Establish, build and grow an automated testing discipline within the company <br/> Define and evolve ongoing QA process improvements including management of QA outputs, work processes, adoption and implementation of best practices and tools, etc <br/> Establish methods for monitoring and reporting on overall product quality and test coverage with a view to improving both <br/><br/> Product <br/><br/> Work with project leads to plan, estimate and coordinate QA resources, activities and dependencies in order to meet project needs and deliverables <br/> Work with project leads to define and monitor quality objects and report on overall product quality with a view to meeting and exceeding those objectives <br/> Review QA outputs including test plans, test cases, and results for quality, consistency and appropriateness <br/> Ensure QA resources are delivering on project needs <br/><br/> Regulatory <br/><br/> Oversee the ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 13485:2016 Quality Management System <br/> Plan and coordinate activities required to maintain ISO certification (under MDSAP) including audits <br/> Coordinate regulatory (Health Canada and FDA) filings as needed to maintain medical device licensing, working with senior management <br/> Coordinate cross functional stakeholders and contributors in the process of maintaining and improving the Quality management System <br/> Ensure that company stakeholders are following defined standard operating procedures <br/> Periodically review changes to FDA and Health Canada Medical Device Regulations and manage impacts to the quality management system <br/> Periodically conduct internal audits on the quality management system processes <br/><br/> <strong>Key Job Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Must Haves:</strong> <br/> 5 years of experience in hands-on testing and 3 years of experience as a manager <br/> Hands on experience in both manual and automation testing <br/> Strong technical background with experience in web technologies <br/> Strong familiarity with the tools that agile development and QA teams use for managing their work <br/> Ability to plan, estimate and coordinate tasks and resources is a must. Some experience with project management is a bonus. <br/> Strong verbal and written communications skills <br/> Ability to work closely with cross functional teams at all levels of the organization <br/> Post-secondary education in engineering, computer science, information systems, or other related field <br/><br/> <strong>Nice to haves, but not mandatory:</strong> <br/> Familiarity with ISO 9001 and 13485 quality standards and quality management systems <br/> Familiarity with FDA and Health Canada Medical Device Regulations <br/><br/> How to Apply <br/><br/> Send your resume to qajobs@curvedental.com with the subject line YOUR NAME: QA (Software) and Regulatory Manager! Remember to make the name substitution, and to include the exclamation mark :-) <br/><br/> Don't just send us your standard cover letter; simply answer the following 3 questions: <br/><br/> What do you know about our business and industry? <br/> Why is what we do important to our clients? <br/> What is your favourite aspect of our business, and why? <br/><br/> This particular role is at Curve Dental's office in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. To find out more about Curve Dental and what it's like to work with us go to www.curvedental.com/jobs

Title: Full Stack Software Developer
Job_Description: <p><strong>Company Background:</strong></p> <p>3esi-Enersight is the leading global provider of solutions for integrated planning in upstream oil and gas. Our software connects all E&P data and workflows from strategy to execution through innovative technology, expert consulting and first-rate customer service.<br></p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop high quality, well performing, modular, configurable, commercial software products for the upstream oil and gas industry</li> <li>Take shared ownership of software development methodology and practices</li> <li>Work with a team to deliver software functionality</li> <li>Ensure software deliverables align with the technical architecture, development standards and quality practices</li> <li>Assist in building and executing integrated unit tests for all code modules</li> <li>Develop well documented, intent-revealing code</li> <li>Participate in peer review activities</li> <li>Create a learning environment through collaboration, shared knowledge, and leadership.</li> <li>Mentor peers and less experienced software developers regarding design, programming approaches, application knowledge and technical product knowledge</li> </ul> <p><strong>Key Competencies:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Proficient with JavaScript/Typescript and .NET Framework/Core</li> <li>Experience with a modern front-end framework like React/Redux</li> <li>Experience with unit testing frameworks</li> <li>Extensive object-oriented analysis and design experience</li> <li>Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts</li> <li>Ability to work on Agile/Scrum based team</li> <li>Knowledge of oil and gas industry and associated workflows is an asset</li> </ul> <p><strong></strong><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li>5+ years’ experience creating and maintaining high performance web based applications with a large user base</li> <li>Undergraduate degree in a technical or business field, or relevant software development experience</li> </ul> <b>What's in it for you?</b><br> <ul> <li>The People: We have an amazing team filled with very smart people and a highly collaborative environment.</li> <li>The Technology: We are in the process of transitioning our existing products to a cloud-based delivery model. If you have an interest in microservices, distributed systems, containerization and the associated technologies then this will be an exciting place for you to work.</li> <li>The Business: We are a software company devoted to providing planning tools to the upstream oil & gas industry. Our clients require our software whether the industry is booming or in a downturn, which creates a relatively stable environment. The business domain is both challenging and interesting as we are required to solve complex business problems.</li> <li>Other benefits: <ul> <li>Scrum based development process</li> <li>Organized into small, co-located, self-organizing, cross-functional development teams</li> <li>Extra-curricular team projects (e.g. building an arcade for the game room)</li> <li>Foosball table</li> <li>Snacks and pop provided</li> <li>X-box gaming area</li> <li>Comprehensive health and dental benefits</li> <li>Awesome building amenities, including a huge underground bike cage, change rooms with showers and towel service, and a fitness centre</li> <li>Transportation subsidy</li> </ul> </li> </ul> <br>

Title: Firmware Engineers , Junior - Senior Level
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is staffing Firmware Engineers from junior to senior level for award of a new contract to deliver a world class Tactical Communication and Information System (TacCIS) to a new customer. Our Canadian team will be partnered to deploy a vehicle installed with field-proven TacCIS architecture and system components which is cost effective, modular and scalable to support different vehicle variant roles.The vehicle TacCIS provides the vehicle crew with intercom and radio voice services and is capable of transmitting high-speed Position Awareness (PA), Command & Control (C2) and sensor data on the move as a component of a larger Battalion-level TacCIS. <br/><br/> The project will involve participation from System Design, Software and Platform Design, System Integration, and System Validation domain stakeholders. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning groups across General Dynamics Mission Systems-International.The firmware development team will be primarily focused on evolving and customizing existing Ethernet Local Area Network domain firmware to be applied to the customer requirements. <br/><br/> Typical Duties <ul> <li>Assisting and supporting lead engineers and team members</li> <li>Performing some basic design and/or analysis functions based on requirements</li><li>Documenting the analysis, design and test in accordance with development standards</li><li>Participate in integrated team activities with System Engineering, Development and System Integration</li><li>Developing and performing tests and debug of code</li><li>Identifying defects, resolving issues and verification</li><li>Supporting and performing system level test and integration efforts</li><li>Participating in code reviews</li><li>All other duties as required</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience <ul> <li>Able to apply problem solving skills to daily activities</li><li>Experience developing system software</li><li>Experience in programming in C/C++</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li> <li>Excellent communication and time management skills</li><li>Strong problem solving and root cause analysis skills</li><li>Enthusiastic contributor, willingness to learn new skills and takes on ownership of work</li><li>Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li> </ul> Skills & Experience Nice to Have <ul> <li>Experience with DevOps tools such as IBM Jazz Rational Team Concert for Requirements Management, Quality Management, and Configuration/Change Management</li><li>Experience with scripting languages such as bash, powershell</li><li>Experience with data model generation, database schemas, relational models, object models, data access layers, and CRUD operations</li><li>Experience with policy-based/highly configurable software</li><li>Experience with distributed database models</li><li>Experience with pub/sub and request/response messaging patterns</li><li>Experience with multimedia technologies such as SIP, RTP, and RTCP</li><li>Experience with transport layer technologies such as TCP/IP and UDP</li><li>Experience with networking technologies such as IPv4, IPv6, VLANs, 802.3, Routing Protocols (OSPF, IS-IS, BGP4), 802.1x, DSCP, and DHCP</li><li>Experience with network device management technologies such as SNMP and NETCONF.</li><li>Experience with cross-platform development</li> </ul> Education <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Intermediate Project Engineer – Process –
Job_Description: <div><div> Intermediate Project Engineer – Process – Calgary SE</div><br/>  <div> <div>  <div> <strong>Openings</strong> 1</div> <div> <strong>Location Name</strong> Enerflex - Canada - Alberta - Calgary <br/> Calgary, Alberta, CA</div> <div> <strong>Operating Unit</strong> Enerflex - Canada</div> <div> <strong>Date Posted</strong> May 03, 2018</div> <div> <strong>Profession</strong> Engineering</div> <div> <strong>Experience Level</strong> Not Specified</div> <div> <strong>Job Type</strong> Permanent, Full Time</div> <div> <strong>Education Level</strong> University - Bachelors</div> <div> <strong>Job ID</strong> job-3209</div> </div><div> Position Summary</div> <div><strong>Company Profile:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex Ltd. is a single source supplier of natural gas compression, oil and gas processing, refrigeration systems, and electric power generation equipment – plus related engineering and mechanical service expertise. The Company’s broad in-house resources provide the capability to engineer, design, manufacture, construct, commission, and service hydrocarbon handling systems. Enerflex’s expertise encompasses field production facilities, compression and natural gas processing plants, refrigeration systems, and electric power equipment servicing the natural gas production industry. Headquartered in Calgary, Canada, Enerflex has more than 2,000 employees globally and operates in over seven regions around the world. <br/><br/> Enerflex puts its Values of Integrity, Commitment, Creativity and Success into action in all aspects of business. The Company values passionate people who want to put their career into overdrive. We will help match your skills with a position that challenges you to reach new heights, rewards you for outstanding performance and allows you to grow with the Company throughout your life-long career. Join the Enerflex team and apply now. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex is looking for an Intermediate <strong>Project Engineer - Process</strong> to lead engineering projects in a high energy manufacturing environment. Reporting directly to the Manager, Process Engineering, this role would be in charge of designing and building large million dollar plus gas processing facilities, while working with our fabrication department to see the project come to life in our facility. This position is responsible for all aspects of the project from design through to commissioning. Work with a strong leadership team who will mentor you through every aspect of the job and share valuable industry knowledge. <br/><br/> Candidate must be able to work in a customer centred team environment. Focus is on projects being accurate, complete and timely. <br/><br/> With a foundation of integrity, the candidate would use commitment and creativity to drive our organization forward. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> This role will offer the right candidate variety in their daily work life, learning opportunities and the chance to add value to our current gas processing projects. We require someone with strong communication skills, matched with sound problem solving and decision making skills. Your ability to ensure project deliverables are accurate, complete and timely while remaining customer focused, will enable you to deliver the results you need to be successful in this role. You must be able to work effectively within a multi-stakeholder environment and seek to be collaborative on all fronts.  <ul> <li>Design process flow and piping / instrument diagrams</li> <li>Review general arrangements and 3D model</li> <li>Ensure accuracy, completeness and timeliness on responsible projects</li> <li>Take part in HAZOP and SIL review meetings.</li> <li>Implement project specifications</li> <li>Size PSV’s and control valves based on process information</li> <li>Size tanks, PVRV’s and EPRV’s</li> <li>Size vessels and piping based on process information</li> <li>Select and order all hand valves and instrumentation on a portion of a gas plant project</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>5-10 Years of experience with an Engineering Degree or Technical Diploma.</li> <li>Preference for P. Eng designation</li> <li>Working knowledge of gas processing and fabrication</li> <li>Experience in pressure vessel and piping design is required.</li> <li>ASME Section VIII and B31.3 helpful but not required</li> <li>Experience sizing pressure relief valves, control valves and piping will be considered an asset</li> <li>Experience with Hysis process simulation software will be considered an asset</li> </ul> <strong>What Enerflex Offers You:</strong><ul> <li>Competitive Compensation</li> <li>Employer Paid Health and Dental Benefits</li> <li>Employee Share Purchase Program</li> <li>Employer Matched Pension Program</li> <li>Vacation and Flex Days</li> <li>Safety Focused Culture</li> <li>Incentive Programs</li> <li>Professional Development Opportunities</li> </ul> <strong>Interested:</strong> Please apply online at www.enerflex.com Careers & Training → Current Openings.</div> <div> <div> Facebook <br/>  Twitter <br/>  Print <br/>  Email <br/><br/> 0Share</div>  </div><br/>  <div> Powered by <br/> Hire Ground Software</div><br/>   <div> Technical Support for Applying Online</div> </div> 	</div>  <br/>

Title: Software Developer
Job_Description: We're active members of the communities we serve. That's why at Stantec, we always <strong>design with community in mind</strong>. <br/><br/> The Stantec community unites approximately 22,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. Our work—engineering, architecture, interior design, landscape architecture, surveying, environmental sciences, project management, and project economics, from initial project concept and planning through design, construction, and commissioning—begins at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. With a long-term commitment to the people and places we serve, Stantec has the unique ability to connect to projects on a personal level and advance the quality of life in communities across the globe. Stantec trades on the TSX and the NYSE under the symbol STN. Visit us at stantec.com or find us on social media. <br/><br/> We have an exciting opportunity for a contract <strong>Software Developer</strong> in our <strong>Calgary, AB</strong> office. <br/><br/> We are looking for an individual that is motivated, talented, and committed to enhancing individual, team, and company performance. <br/><br/> <strong><em>This role is an eight (8) month contract with the possibility for extension or conversion to permanent employment.</em></strong> <br/><br/> Your primary responsibilities as a Software Developer will include: <ul> <li>Documenting the types and structure of the data as well as mapping and tracing data from system to system to solve a given business or system problem</li><li>Manage data integration from different sources into the database and apply QC/QA processes</li><li>Develop flowcharts, layouts, and documentation to identify requirements and solutions</li><li>Write well-designed, testable code</li><li>Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility</li><li>Integrate software components into a fully functional software system</li><li>Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures</li><li>Document and maintain software functionality</li><li>Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Minimum of a Bachelor’s or Associate’s Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or GIS related field</li><li>Familiarity with Agile development methodologies</li><li>Experience with software design and development in a test-driven environment</li><li>Minimum of 5 years’ experience in database development and/or software development</li><li>Minimum of 5 years of experience with tools and technologies: C# program on desktop WinForm, WPF, UWP, and ASP.Net / ASP.Net Core, Webform, MVC, JavaScript/JQuery</li><li>Minimum of 5 years’ experience with SQL Server, T-SQL, and Microsoft Business Intelligence Tools</li><li>Ability to work independently and multi-task effectively</li><li>Demonstrated understanding of projects from the perspective of both client and business</li><li>Good communication skills (both oral and written)</li><li>Experience with Microsoft Azure is an asset</li><li>Experience of FME desktop and Server an asset</li><li>Experience of Tensorflow as an asset</li> </ul>

Title: Energy Components Developer Analyst
Job_Description: <div><div> <p><strong>YOUR OPPORTUNITY:</strong><br> The Information Systems(IS) Energy Conponents Developer Analyst is responsible for the analysis, design and building of systems through the development of application logic, user interfaces, data interfaces, data conversion scripts and reports. An IS Developer Analyst works under the guidance and direction of IS Business Systems Analyst to support the portfolio of applications for Field Data Reporting, Property Accounting and Marketing.<br>  <br> <strong>COMPETITIVE SALARY - STOCK OPTIONS - STOCK SAVINGS PLAN - ANNUAL BONUSES – BENEFITS!</strong><br>  <br> <strong>HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?</strong><br> • Participate in supporting and enhancing the portfolio of applications for Field Data Reporting<br> • Analyzing, designing and developing applications<br> • Developing and maintaining functional/technical specifications and documentation<br> • Troubleshooting problems that occur in the everyday use of applications<br> • Fixing program bugs and/or data errors identified during troubleshooting<br> • Manage multiple tasks at the same time with high levels of effectiveness<br> • Demonstrate the ability to handle complex work<br>  <br> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS: </strong><br> • 5 – 10 years of experience as a Developer Analyst working with Field Data Capture applications preferably using Energy Components and PM Suite.<br> • Technical experience supporting EC Architecture including Configurations, Integration Services and Jasper Reporting. Experience with PI and Honeywell historians.<br> • Highly developed analytical skills<br> • Excellent interpersonal, team and communication skills<br> • Strong multi-tasking and prioritizing abilities<br> • A post-secondary degree in Computer Science or a related field of study<br> • Demonstrated proficiency in N-tier application analysis, design and development using Java Enterprise, JBoss/Wildfly, Eclipse, TFS, Microsoft VB.NET/ASP.Net, Web Services/APIs<br> • Experience supporting 3rd party applications on Windows, Linux and Unix<br> • Experience with Oracle SQL and Oracle PL/SQL, MSRS, MS Orchestrator</p>  <p>To see related Information Technology roles at CNRL, visit: <u>www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Information-Technology</u></p>  <p><strong>About Canadian Natural</strong><br> At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." As a leading oil and gas producer, our diverse combination of assets include light oil, heavy oil, in situ oil sands production, oil sands mining and upgrading facilities, and natural gas. At Canadian Natural, safety is a core value. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.</p>  <p>Canadian Natural Resources Limited - CNRL - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.</p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>

Title: Junior Software Developer- Rigsite
Job_Description: The Role <br/>  <br/> Pason is seeking junior Java/C++ software developers with Linux OS and middle-ware software background that will provide creative solutions to our customer’s business needs, while constantly improving our own ability to deliver quality products. We provide experience with real-time embedded software, touch-screen GUI design, data storage technologies, networking, Linux kernel, and/or many other application technologies. <br/>  <br/> Essential Duties and Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Design, implement and test software features for the Rigsite drilling system utilizing our extensive suite of development tools</li> <li>Implement in a variety of languages, primarily Java, Python and Perl on Linux</li> <li>Work with hardware engineers and software architects to implement embedded software systems on custom networked hardware platforms</li> <li>Analyze and improve system performance, reliability and manageability</li> <li>Investigate and resolve issues ranging from bugs to root-cause analysis for development and field environments</li> <li>Understand internal and external customers’ needs by formalizing requirements for new products and projects while working with the key stakeholders</li> <li>Contribute to teams by describing your project’s progress, identifying risks and issues and providing mitigation strategies</li> <li>Contribute to our evolving development environment through research, experimenting with new technologies and courses</li> </ul>  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities   <ul> <li>Well-developed communication skills with strong commitment to quality</li> <li>Ability to work in a team or as an individual with a passion for software development</li> <li>Proficient with MySQL, Java, Python and Perl on Linux environment</li> <li>Knowledge of Linux OS and multi-threaded development</li> <li>Experience with developer tools like Eclipse, Crucible, Gradle, Jenkins, SVN and Git</li> <li>Experience in applying UML and design patterns to create software solutions</li> <li>Knowledge of the oil and gas industry, and instrumentation and drilling rigs is an asset</li></ul>

Title: Customer Success Engineer: Canada
Job_Description: <div><p></p><div>Tachyus delivers the leading prescriptive analytics platform to oil and gas producers. Our customers include many of the largest companies and state-owned entities on the planet with whom we have complex high-value relationships. We need a Customer Success Engineer to ensure that our Canada customers are delighted working with Tachyus so that they renew deals worth tens of millions or more to Tachyus.</div><div><br></div><div>The right candidate will bring experience managing relationships with petroleum engineers and geologists and a deep network of existing contacts across Canada. Tachyus Customer Success Engineers work with our Customer Success Managers and IT experts to maximize the happiness of existing customers, ensure renewals, and achieve successful upsells. The right hire will present crucial petrotechnical information, train customer petroleum engineers how to use Tachyus software, and manage key customer relationships to delight our Canada customers.</div><div><br></div><div>We are looking for someone who will represent Tachyus with customers in Canada but is also open to traveling to multiple neighboring regions.</div><p></p></div><div><div>Responsibilities<ul><ul><li>Identify and grow opportunities within assigned oil and gas producers and collaborate with Tachyus business development to extend our solutions footprint (more solutions to more assets)</li><li>Train customers' petroleum engineers on how to use Tachyus' breakthrough technology</li><li>Present valuable petrotechnical findings to Tachyus customers</li><li>Ensure continued rapid revenue growth for Tachyus in Canada</li><li>Operate as the lead point of contact for any and all petrotechnical matters specific to Tachyus customers once the solutions are deployed</li><li>Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships</li><li>Develop a trusted advisor relationship with key customer stakeholders and engineering champions</li><li>Communicate clearly the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders</li><li>Obtain referrals from customers to increase the portfolio of Tachyus success stories</li><li>Forecast and track key account metrics</li><li>Assist with high severity requests or issue escalations as needed</li></ul></ul></div></div><div><div>Requirements<ul><ul><li>Extensive existing oil and gas domain experience as a service provider</li><li>Proven track record implementing software solutions for major enterprise accounts</li><li>Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively about crucial petrotechnical information</li><li>Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communications skills</li><li>Curiosity to build and define new ways of doing business as an early member of a startup customer success engineering team</li><li>At least a bachelors in petroleum engineering</li><li>Experience operating SAGD, thermal and/or waterflood assets</li></ul></ul></div></div><div><div>Extras<ul><ul><li>Experience with software production management systems</li><li>Experience writing software or analyzing data</li><li>Business development experience</li><li>At least a masters in petroleum engineering and/or computer science</li></ul></ul></div></div><div></div>

Title: Senior Technical Lead - Environment
Job_Description: <div><div> WSP is currently seeking a Senior Technical Lead to join our Environmental team in Calgary, AB. <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Provide technical leadership for the environmental team in Calgary, AB</li>  <li>Provide senior-level review and advice throughout the project cycle; particularly pertaining to contaminated sites and due diligence liability assessments.</li>  <li>Manage personnel, projects, and clients simultaneously while fostering a workplace that adheres to WSP’s core values;</li>  <li>Represents company projects to stakeholders including regulators, industry groups, environmental groups, landowners, First Nations, and the public;</li>  <li>Collaborating with other managers and team members on multi-disciplinary projects, including working closely with our engineering colleagues</li>  <li>Provide day-to-day technical leadership, training and mentorship</li>  <li>Design, management and implementation of remediation programs for oil & gas, commercial and industrial properties through the application of advanced remediation techniques (e.g. soil vapor extraction, bioventing, multi-phase vacuum extraction, product recovery, chemical oxidation, pump and treat etc.);</li>  <li>Development/coordination of quantitative risk assessments and Tier 2 remediation guideline modifications (e.g. pathway exclusion, site-specific data modelling adjustment, subsoil salinity tool [SST]).</li>  <li>Guidance in the preparation of consulting reports and completion of senior review of reports for QA/QC;</li>  <li>Participation in the on-going improvement of company policy, procedures and protocols (office, field and safety);</li>  <li>Contributing to business development strategies;</li>  <li>Assisting in recruiting additional team members, as required.</li>  <li>Other duties as assigned/required.</li> </ul> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong>  <ul>  	<li>10+ years of related work experience</li>  <li>Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in an environmental science</li>  <li>Previous experience in environmental consulting, with exposure to project management</li>  <li>Professional designation is a requirement (e.g. P. Geol., P.Ag., P. Biol);</li>  <li>Thorough knowledge of environmental legislation applicable to site remediation and reclamation as they apply to the oil and gas industry in Alberta and Saskatchewan;</li>  <li>Able to travel to the field periodically for safety auditing and senior site supervision;</li>  <li>Strong organizational and communication skills;</li>  <li>Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment;</li>  <li>Valid safety certificates are preferred while a valid driver’s license is required.</li>  <li>Commitment to client service and support;</li> </ul> Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits). <br/><br/> To learn more about our firm and the projects we have been involved in, please visit our <strong>World of Possibilities</strong> microsite. <br/><br/> <strong><em>WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</em></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.</em></strong> <br/><br/> Company: WSP Canada Inc.</div> </div><div></div>

Title: Junior Geotechnical/Geohazard Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong>We are currently seeking a Junior Geotechnical/Geohazard Engineer to join our team in Calgary. <br/><br/> Reporting to a Senior Geotechnical Engineer, the Geotechnical/Geohazard Junior holds a role supporting a wide variety of projects across our western Canadian offices. The role will be an opportunity to gain experience and knowledge working with senior experienced professionals, in the office and in the field<br/><br/><strong>Job Duties:</strong> <ul> <li>Acting as a design engineer resource for a variety of projects and clients</li><li>Assist in the development and growth of the Calgary team with a focus on energy and infrastructure developments</li><li>Support the development of the Environment & Geoscience business by developing relationships with existing and future client contacts, attending meetings, and supporting BD initiatives</li><li>Preparation of proposals</li><li>Provision of practical and economic solutions to clients</li><li>Preparation of technical reports associated with the project scope of work</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>University degree or diploma in a related discipline (i.e. geoscience or civil engineering, etc.); a post-graduate degree would be considered an asset</li><li>Minimum of <li>Willing to work extended and irregular hours within western Canada when necessary;</li><li>Currently registered or eligible to register as a member of APEGA;</li><li>Ability to work on multiple projects and meet established deadlines;</li><li>Effective interpersonal skills, a strong client-service focus and the ability to work in a team environment are essential;</li><li>Strong business development skills;</li><li>Experience using specialized equipment and software (e.g. GeoStudio or equivalent) would be considered an asset;</li><li>Strong report writing and verbal communication skills in the English language; and</li><li>Valid driver’s licence with a clean driving abstract.</li> </ul> <strong>Experience in the following areas would be an asset:</strong> <ul> <li>Slope Stability, mitigation design and monitoring</li><li>Terrain Mapping</li><li>Landslide Detection</li><li>Slope Hazard Assessment</li><li>Fluvial Geomorphology</li><li>Flood Hazard Assessment</li><li>Hydrologic Modelling</li><li>River Surveying</li><li>Debris Flows</li><li>Foundation Design</li><li>Retaining wall design</li><li>Mining</li><li>Infrastructure design</li><li>Site Investigation- drilling</li> </ul> Our commitment to excellence extents do our workplace where we offer a flexible work environment, competitive compensation and benefits including a generous RRSP program and an employee Share Ownership Plan, in-house training programs, a strong emphasis on health and safety, support for continuing education and professional development and the opportunity to work with and learn from senior technical experts and professionals. <br/><br/> For more information, please visit our website at www.snclavalin.com <br/><br/> While SNC-Lavalin would like to thank all those that apply, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.<br/><br/><strong>Worker Type</strong>Employee<strong>Job Type</strong>Regular<br/><br/>At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

Title: Project Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>ROLE:</strong> <br/><br/> As Project Engineer, your primary role will be to work with the Manager of Engineering and the rest of the team to successfully deliver projects to clients in the municipal and land development industries. In addition, you will work with and support the business development and marketing aspects of the team. <br/><br/> <strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Successful completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering from an accredited University.</li> <li>5 plus years’ experience in engineering discipline, specifically in municipal and land development.</li> <li>Must be a registered member of the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA).</li> <li>Experience with Civil 3D software.</li> <li>Experience in Stormwater Management design is an asset.</li> <li>Strong presentation, verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.</li> <li>Business development drive and entrepreneurial acumen.</li> <li>Strong technical skills and attention to detail.</li> </ul> <strong>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with engineering manager, project managers, engineers and drafting technicians to successfully deliver quality projects on-time and on-budget for a variety of land development and municipal projects.</li> <li>Design of various municipal and land development projects.</li> <li>Review technical drawings, details, and specifications to ensure quality and oversight.</li> <li>Supervise junior engineers and technologists.</li> <li>Prepare proposals.</li> <li>Develop relationships for partnering with other firms.</li> <li>Develop business opportunities with existing and potential clients.</li> </ul> <strong>COMPANY INFORMATION:</strong> <br/><br/> Since 1983, Watt Consulting Group has been a multi-disciplinary civil engineering, transportation planning and land survey practice, operating out of offices in Calgary, Victoria, Vancouver, Kelowna, Edmonton and Lloydminster. We provide transportation planning, engineering and geomatics services to a wide variety of public and private sector clients throughout Western Canada. We strive to achieve our Vision of being a recognized leader in the creation of vibrant and livable communities. You will be joining a team that is passionate about what they do and who hold themselves to a high standard of excellence. We take our work to “<strong>HEART</strong>”. These are the values we hold high and strive to live by every day: Honesty, Excellence, Accountability, Respect and Teamwork. <br/><br/> <em>If you are looking for an exciting opportunity and to grow your career in a dynamic organization, owned and led by employees, submit your resume to careers@wattconsultinggroup.com.</em> <br/><br/> <em>Ownership opportunities will also be available to the successful candidate.</em> <br/><br/> <em>We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. WATT Consulting Group is an equal opportunity employer</em>.

Title: Process Engineer Specialist
Job_Description: <em>Do you want to work with one of Canada’s top oil and gas companies represented by an award-winning staffing agency? Look no further and join the Spirit circle today!</em> <br/><br/> <strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong> <br/><br/> Our large oil and gas company is currently recruiting a Process Engineer Specialist for a 1 year contract. <br/><br/> This position is located in Calgary, AB. Local candidates are preferred, however, non-local candidates will be considered, but must be willing to secure their own accommodations/relocation, as there is no relocation/living allowance provided. <br/><br/> <strong>MAIN FUNCTIONS</strong> <br/><br/> Evaluate and comment on discipline engineering work performed both internally and by Contractors and sub-contractors to ensure that work is being executed in accordance with project specifications, Company standards, and regulatory requirements. Facilitates effective execution of discipline engineering and design routines that align with the project's goals, objectives, and procedures. Assures accurate and timely communication among the Project Team and Company Functions on discipline engineering activities, progress, and issues. In addition to technical ability, they should demonstrate sound communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills. <br/><br/> <strong>TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Facilitate and coordinate discipline engineering technical work products</li> <li>Coordination and communication of various issues among the Company and contractor's engineering team that affect the discipline engineering design, safety, and regulatory compliance of the work</li> <li>Evaluate / comment work performed by the Contractor and sub-contractors to insure that the work is being executed in accordance with project specifications, Company standards, and regulatory requirements. Includes review of discipline design drawings and documents</li> <li>Identify and assess deviations to Contract Technical Specifications and regulatory requirements</li> <li>Ensure that such deviations will be processed according to project procedures; maintains Deviation Control Log</li> <li>Steward discipline engineering queries from the Contractor and sub-contractors as well as technical information requests</li> <li>Keep Lead Engineer or Engineering Manager informed of discipline engineering progress, deviations, and execution concerns</li> <li>Participate in discipline engineering reviews at Contractor's and subcontractor's locations</li> <li>Drives and promotes capital efficiency in engineering design</li> <li>Support internal Company engineering general interest or Global Practice initiatives as requested by Supervisor</li> </ul> <strong>SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS</strong>  <ul> <li>Closely related professional experience</li> <li>Bachelors degree in Chemical Engineering or related engineering specialty, or equivalent professional experience</li> <li>Broad and extensive knowledge of discipline design standards, specifications, codes, and appropriate safety criteria</li> <li>Ability to adapt to tight deadlines, heavy workloads, and frequent changes in priorities</li> <li>Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of software programs</li> <li>Read, write, and speak fluent English, especially as it applies to technical and business communications</li> <li>10 to 20 years of related experience is required</li> </ul> <strong>**We thank all applicants for applying, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted directly**</strong>

Title: .NET Web Developer
Job_Description: <p> <strong>ITN International</strong> has an opening for a self-motivated and ambitious .NET Web Applications Developer to join their Events Solutions team. ITN Technologies is a unique global events company that provides technology applications for Fortune 100 companies and major association events. We’re an international events technology company.</p> <p>Responsibilities: </p> <p>· Develop engaging event application websites for clients and shows all over the world. </p> <p>· Work closely with project managers and an experienced team of developers to deliver other technology solutions in response to customer needs. </p> <p>· Be knowledgeable in creating public-facing sites from inception to completion: managing the design, development, testing and implementation. </p> <p>· Work well under pressure and react to quick turnaround times when called upon to generate ad hoc reports, create and submit scripts for any data changes. </p> <p>· Maintain legacy applications while new solutions are developed. </p> <p><br></p> <p>Technical Requirements: </p> <p>· NET 4.0/4.5+, C#, ASP.NET Web Forms/MVC, T-SQL, JavaScript, Web Services (SOAP and REST), Entity Framework 6 </p> <p>· Preferred Skills: </p> <p>· Front-end: Advanced JavaScript, Angular, Bootstrap</p> <p> · Services: WCF, WebApi, Azure API Apps, </p> <p>· Experience with Microsoft Azure products and services. </p> <p>· Experience with VSTS, TFS, Git and Continuous integration </p> <p>· Strong with design patterns and general software architecture. </p> <p>· General love of development and can quickly adopt new technologies. </p> <p>· Excellent troubleshooting and debugging skills. </p> <p>· Excellent oral and written communication skills. </p> <p>· Attention to detail and thoroughness a must. </p> <p>· Ability to travel both domestic and internationally a plus. </p> <p>Preferred candidates should have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a closely related field and five years of progressively responsible work experience related to Internet application development. Additional experience or certifications may be substituted for education on a case by case basis. Any Microsoft certifications a plus. All applicants must have a minimum of 3 years of experience in developing applications. <strong>All applicants must live in the Calgary, Alberta area. Only apply if you live in the Calgary, Alberta area.</strong> This position will require the applicant to spend some time weekly in the office located in the Calgary downtown beltline and some international travel to the events we service. By becoming an ITN team member you will be joining a diverse group of international professionals all focused on delivering best-of-class solutions to clients around the world. </p>

Title: Instrumentation & Controls Engineering Lead
Job_Description: <em>Do you want to work with one of Canada’s top oil and gas companies represented by an award-winning staffing agency? Look no further and join the Spirit circle today!</em> <br/><br/> <strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong> <br/><br/> Our large oil and gas company is currently recruiting an Instrumentation & Controls Engineering Lead for a 1 year contract. <br/><br/> This position is located in Calgary, AB. Local candidates are preferred, however, non-local candidates will be considered, but must be willing to secure their own accommodations/relocation, as there is no relocation/living allowance provided. <br/><br/> <strong>MAIN FUNCTIONS</strong> <br/><br/> Evaluate and comment on discipline engineering work performed both internally and by Contractors and sub-contractors to ensure that work is being executed in accordance with project specifications, company standards, and regulatory requirements. Facilitates effective execution of discipline engineering and design routines that align with the project's goals, objectives, and procedures. Assures accurate and timely communication among the Project Team and other Company functions on discipline engineering activities, progress, and issues. In addition to technical ability, they should demonstrate sound communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills. <br/><br/> <strong>TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES</strong>  <ul> <li>Facilitate and coordinate discipline engineering technical work products</li> <li>Coordination and communication of various issues among the company's and contractor's engineering team that affect the discipline engineering design, safety, and regulatory compliance of the work</li> <li>Evaluate / comment work performed by the Contractor and sub-contractors to insure that the work is being executed in accordance with project specifications, company standards, and regulatory requirements. Includes review of discipline design drawings and documents</li> <li>Identify and assess deviations to Contract Technical Specifications and regulatory requirements; ensure that such deviations will be processed according to project procedures; maintains Deviation Control Log.</li> <li>Steward discipline engineering queries from the Contractor and sub-contractors as well as technical information requests</li> <li>Keep Lead Engineer or Engineering Manager informed of discipline engineering progress, deviations, and execution concerns</li> <li>Participate in discipline engineering reviews at Contractor's and subcontractor's locations</li> <li>Drives and promotes capital efficiency in engineering design</li> <li>Support internal engineering general interest or Global Practice initiatives as requested by Supervisor</li> </ul> <strong>SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS</strong>  <ul> <li>Closely related professional experience</li> <li>Bachelors degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or related engineering specialty, or equivalent professional experience</li> <li>Broad and extensive knowledge of discipline design standards, specifications, codes, and appropriate safety criteria</li> <li>Ability to adapt to tight deadlines, heavy workloads, and frequent changes in priorities</li> <li>Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of software programs</li> <li>Read, write, and speak fluent English, especially as it applies to technical and business communications</li> </ul> <strong>**We thank all applicants for applying, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted directly**</strong>

Title: Software/Firmware Developer , Junior
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> An excellent opportunity for a junior Software Developer in Calgary to join a team of engineers working on a Military Communications System. The purpose of this position is to work with the development team to develop capabilities in the areas of networking, system management, radio voice and data services, or test automation. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <br/><br/> The responsibilities and range of activities will vary, but in general include: <ul> <li>Design, code, test, integrate and document software/firmware solutions.</li> <li>Apply principles and techniques of computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis for the development of complex systems and architectures.</li> <li>Analyze code to determine behavior of legacy systems.</li> <li>Implement new functionality in deployed systems.</li><li>Participate in technical reviews as a reviewer or author.</li><li>Work with hardware, firmware, system and test engineers to identify defects, resolve issues, and perform verification activities.</li><li>Work with system engineers to determine behavior and plan for new functionality in the deployed system.</li> <li>Maintain the code base for a legacy deployed system.</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience <ul> <li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.</li> <li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills.</li><li>Strong knowledge of development using C++.</li> <li>Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision.</li>  </ul> Education <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required.</li><li>Candidates with diplomas will be considered with adequate additional experience.</li> </ul> Assets <ul> <li>Experience working in both Linux and Windows development environments.</li> <li>Experience in scripting languages such as Python.</li>  </ul> Other <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Water Resources Engineer
Job_Description: Water Resources Engineer<br/><br/>Dillon is a well established, employee-owned professional consulting firm operating across Canada and internationally. We provide a wide range of consulting and design services related to the infrastructure, real estate, resource, industrial and government sectors in Canada and abroad. <br/><br/> We are currently seeking candidates for the position of <strong>Water Resources Engineer</strong> in our <strong>Calgary</strong> office.<br/><br/>Responsibilities  <ul>  <li>Strong leadership and project management of stormwater management projects for land development and/or public sector clients.</li> <li>Management and leadership of client relationships, developing new business opportunities, and the geographic expansion of Dillon’s services.</li>  <li>Leadership of technical training and professional guidance to our growing professional and technical staff within the Calgary office.</li> <li>Input to the career development of more junior staff, including technical direction, training recommendations, coaching and mentoring.</li> <li>Contribution to Dillon’s corporate profile through active participation in professional associations and committees.</li> <li>Business travel upon request.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  <li>A degree in water resources or civil engineering. A post graduate degree in water resources engineering would be considered an asset.</li> <li>Licensed to practice as a professional engineer, or eligible to be licensed within six months in the province of Alberta.</li> <li>Minimum of 10 years' experience in water resources engineering.</li> </ul>  Experience  <ul>  <li>Highly proficient in the preparation of watershed studies, master drainage plans, stormwater management plans, and site servicing plans.</li> <li>Expert knowledge of industry standard hydrologic and hydraulic modeling software packages.</li> <li>Proficient in the analysis, design and contract administration of stormwater management infrastructure for green-field developments and in retrofit situations.</li> <li>Extensive knowledge of local municipality standards, specifications, tendering and approvals process.</li> <li>Demonstrated abilities in multidisciplinary project teamwork and coordination.</li> <li>Proven skills in client relationship and business development.</li> <li>Exceptional communication, report writing, organization and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Proficient in project proposal preparation and presentations.</li> <li>International experience would be an asset.</li> </ul>  Related Services<br/><br/>Water Resources Engineering
