Title: DevOps Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>Title</strong> <br/><br/> DevOps Engineer, Product Development and Delivery <br/><br/> <strong>Summary</strong> <br/><br/> We are seeking an outstanding DevOps Engineer to drive cloud automation and provide operational support of commercial software products within the Identity and Access Management domain. The DevOps Engineer fills a critical role within our product delivery team, and will partner with Software Engineers to design, implement, and execute cloud automation and operational support processes. This DevOps Engineer will be working directly with emerging public cloud technologies on a highly visible business-critical platform; providing substantial opportunity for technical skills development and career growth. <br/><br/> <strong>General Job Duties</strong> <ul> <li>Participate as part of a product development organization to design and implement cloud operations processes for moderately complex software platforms.</li><li>Follow industry good DevOps practices to ensure high quality of service.</li><li>Report to management on project status, identify issues that may impede attainment of goals, and accept direction on corrective measures.</li><li>Foster inter-team cooperation as part of a project/program.</li><li>Continuously expand knowledge in area of specialization.</li><li>Perform other duties as required.</li> </ul> <strong>Specific Job Duties</strong> <ul> <li>Operate as a DevOps Engineer in a product development and delivery team for a cloud-based Identity and Access Management (IAM) services platform.</li><li>Assist in analyzing requirements and providing comprehensive cloud automation solutions to ensure high QoS.</li><li>Provide operational support for production and pre-production software systems hosted in the public cloud.</li><li>Drive process improvement through cloud automation.</li><li>Support and champion the Agile Scrum development methodology.</li><li>Collaborate with Software Development Leads and Engineers, Product Managers, Business Analysts, and IT Leadership.</li> </ul> <strong>Education/Experience Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>Experience in production software system administration.</li><li>Background in both Linux/Unix and Windows environments.</li><li>Experience with automation/configuration management using Ansible or an equivalent.</li><li>Working knowledge of coding/scripting (eg. Java or C#, Python, Unix shell scripting)</li><li>Understanding of IT Operations best practices in mission-critical high-availability systems.</li><li>Ability to engage self-guided analysis and problem solving.</li><li>Passion and curiosity for solving technical problems.</li><li>Experience with public cloud infrastructure is a major plus (eg. AWS or Azure)</li><li>Professional certification is a plus.</li> </ul> <strong>Organizational Relationships</strong> <ul> <li>Reports to DevOps manager.</li><li>Interacts with other colleagues at all levels in the conduct of day-to-day activities.</li> </ul> <strong>External Relationships</strong> <ul> <li>Actively participates in industry forums and user groups.</li> </ul> <strong>FLSA Status – US Only</strong> <ul> <li>Exempt</li> </ul> We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Please refer to the <strong>EEO is the Law Poster & Supplement, Right to Work and Pay Transparency Policy. IHS Markit is a participant in E-Verify (see links below)</strong>. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment drug testing. <br/><br/> EEO is the Law <br/> EEO is the Law Supplement <br/> Right to Work <br/> Pay Transparency Policy <br/> E-Verify<br/><br/>Current ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.

Title: Principal Quality Assurance Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>Department overview:</strong> <br/><br/> Financial Risk Analytics is part of the IHS Markit group and provides industry leading risk analytics solutions to sell side institutions within the financial markets. Risk management and risk regulation is continuously driving demand for more accurate calculations and risk system vendors are continuously striving for improvements in performance and scalability. The product has been designed, built and continuously improved over a ten year period. It is carefully architected to scale from running on a single laptop for demonstration purposes right through to running on 1,000+ core distributed grids. <br/><br/> Financial Risk Analytics provides solutions for Credit Risk PFE, Market Risk VaR and sensitivities, Credit Value Adjustment (CVA), Initial Margin (IM) and regulatory calculations such as EC, RC, IRC and CRM, <br/><br/> <strong>Position summary</strong> <br/><br/> IHS Markit is seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst to join the Financial Risk Analytics group. The successful candidate will be involved in all aspects of testing with emphasis on test automation. We are looking for a pragmatic advocate of quality and someone that is willing to take a lead role. As part of the Quality Assurance team, you will help develop automated tests for our suite of windows and linux software including grid-based simulation software. A programming (mandatory) and an investment banking background (ideal) as you work closely with financial engineering, product development groups, and work directly to support our customers. We are looking for a methodical problem solver that is comfortable mentoring and working with a team. <br/><br/> <strong>Duties & accountabilities</strong> <ul> <li>Develop detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts to support regression, functional, load and stress testing for rest, client/server, and computational grid-based applications.</li><li>Automation of testing including updates to and creation of automated test scripts for system, load and performance testing.Design and maintain automated test frameworks, including support of agile and test-driven development</li><li>Conduct full product testing (component, system, integration, performance, etc.) including automation of the testing wherever possible.</li><li>Help define and develop Quality Assurance strategies</li><li>Identify, document and track software defects to resolution</li><li>Establish and maintain multi-platform test environments</li><li>Support customers on all Financial Risk Analytics products</li> </ul> <strong>Business competencies</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Education and experience</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline</li><li>Strong knowledge of Quality Assurance concepts and methodologies</li><li>Minimum 8 years of testing experience in a software development organization</li><li>Understanding of the operating and data models of risk solutions, particularly in investment banking</li> </ul> <strong>Commercial awareness</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent knowledge of REST and network application testing.</li><li>Strong analytical ability and programming skills (preferably in PowerShell, Python)</li><li>Experience with performance and load testing tools.Jmeter expertise.</li><li>Experience with agile software development methodologies and test-driven development</li><li>Working knowledge Hadoop would be valuable.HBase, HDFS, Yarn, Hive, etc.</li><li>Exposure to Apache NiFi, Apache Kafka.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Windows, Windows Server platforms and Linux.</li> </ul> <strong>Personal competencies</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Personal impact</strong> <ul> <li>Strong organizational, planning, and analytical skills</li> </ul> <strong>Communication</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Must be able to communicate at a senior level with all areas of the company within the financial services risk management domain</li> </ul> <strong>Teamwork</strong> <ul> <li>Strong collaboration skills in a team environment</li> </ul> We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Please refer to the <strong>EEO is the Law Poster & Supplement, Right to Work and Pay Transparency Policy. IHS Markit is a participant in E-Verify (see links below)</strong>. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment drug testing. <br/><br/> EEO is the Law <br/> EEO is the Law Supplement <br/> Right to Work <br/> Pay Transparency Policy <br/> E-Verify<br/><br/>Current ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.

Title: Server / Storage Hardware Repair Field Engineer

We work with many of the world’s largest companies and government organizations to solve their most pressing IT and business challenges. We specialize in providing integrated, leading-edge solutions to clients in the government, financial services and commercial markets. Our offerings include cloud and infrastructure services, application services, security solution and high-end server technology. We have more than 20,000 associates serving clients around the world. For more information, visit www.unisys.com. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong>  <ul> <li>Respond to technical service hardware repair requests on enterprise-level servers, storage sub-systems and drives and networking devices at client locations in the area.</li>   <li>Resolve clients’ questions or problems in the areas of system configurations, product functionality and technical troubleshooting.</li> <li>Serve as primary support liaison between company and customer.</li> <li>Performs installs, moves, adds and changes as required</li> <li>Installs and maintains enterprise servers, mainframe, high-end networking and complex product configurations, servers, storage-subsystems and drives</li> <li>Takes responsibility for additional follow-up, testing and troubleshooting services or problem escalation.</li> <li>Maintains a high degree of professionalism in actions, demeanor and dress.</li> <li>Ensures a high level of customer satisfaction throughout the service delivery transaction.</li>  </ul> <strong>Technical and Behavioral Skills</strong>  <ul> <li>High school diploma or GED required</li> <li>Background investigation and drug screen required</li> <li>2 or more years of experience in a field service support role deploying and supporting server and storage systems such as Dell, HP or IBM servers, Cisco networking, and Hitachi or EMC storage arrays.</li> <li>Must have valid driver’s license and reliable vehicle with appropriate insurance (required)</li> <li>Ability to troubleshoot and repair enterprise-level software and hardware issues. Excellent problem solving skills where problems may be complex or hard to diagnose.</li> <li>Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills to work effectively with internal and external customers</li> <li>A+, HP, Cisco, Dell and EMC certifications are highly desired</li> <li>Must be available for after-hours on-call rotation</li> <li>Must be available for varying shifts on a rotating basis.</li>  </ul> Unisys is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). M/F/Disabled/Veterans.</div>  <br/>

Title: Desktop Support Engineer

Trafigura sources, stores, transports and delivers a range of raw materials (including oil and refined products and metals and minerals) to clients around the world. Trafigura has achieved substantial growth over recent years, growing revenue from USD12 billion in 2003 to USD136.4 billion in 2017. The Group has been connecting its customers to the global economy for more than two decades, growing prosperity by advancing trade.   <ul> <li>LI-TR<br/><br/>Main Purpose<br/><br/>To provide effective and skilled IT assistance across the region. training and new user inductions.</li> <li>Install and troubleshoot authorized software.</li> <li>Ensuring security and upgrades are applied correctly and kept up to end user equipment.</li> <li>Antivirus installation on all end User equipment</li> <li>Responsible for logging and tracking warranty repairs</li> <li>Reporting faults and maintaining records on server and site outages.</li> <li>Completing internal user/desk moves including peripherals and printers.</li> <li>Patching of network and phones</li> <li>Ensuring neat and well maintained Desks, Meeting, patch and server rooms.</li> <li>Ensure all IT equipment in meeting rooms are neat and functional state.</li> <li>Complete daily site checks</li> <li>Submit weekly reports to the Regional End User Support Manager.</li> <li>Requesting and tracking of IT purchases.</li> <li>Providing basic support and troubleshooting on APC and related UPS/Cabinet Power equipment.</li> <li>Prepare documents, meeting materials and correspondence</li> <li>Perform basic administrative support duties as required to meet specific operational objectives</li> <li>Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned by the Regional End User Support Manager</li> <li>Assist with weekend on call support as and when required or as assigned by the Regional End User Support Manager</li> <li>Additional responsibilities as requested by the Regional End User Support Manager</li> <li>Work extra hours to meet deadlines, as required and where reasonable</li> <li>Provide assistance as required to the Regional End User Support Manager</li> <li>Provide assistance and support to colleagues in IT-related matters</li> <li>Ensure that a high level of customer service and support is provided to all internal and external customers<br/><br/>Knowledge Skills and Abilities<br/><br/>• 5 plus years’ experience in providing End User IT Support with-in a high pressure environment. Financial services/trading floor end user support experience would be advantageous.</li> <li>Strong communication and customer service skills across all levels of an organization. Proven ability to support end users on all levels, as well as collaborate with all levels of IT staff.</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to work independently and exercise strong technical and business judgment in mission critical IT support functions with-in financial services trading environments.</li> <li>Strong diagnostic/ troubleshooting skills must have an abiding curiosity and interest in IT.</li> <li>Driven to provide superior support. Demonstrated a true ownership mentality to service and problem resolution.</li> <li>Ability to be on-call on a scheduled basis; or as sometimes required work long hours to resolve client issues.</li> <li>Be able to travel at very short notice to any and all countries where there are active operations.</li> <li>Strong knowledge of Win 7 & 10 and Active Directory.</li> <li>Strong working knowledge of industry standard End User imaging and packaging.</li> <li>Strong understanding of trading platforms would be advantageous.</li> <li>Proven expertise in integrating with Excel plug-ins, troubleshooting broken links, effectively working with vendor<br/><br/>Key Relationships</li>  </ul>

Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is growing their Calgary team and currently have new opportunities for System Engineers, P3 for our EvO program. We are staffing for an existing program to deliver a world class next-generation secure communications system for the Ministry of Defence (MoD) in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. Our Calgary team is developing key software and hardware products as part of this offering to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. <br/><br/> The program includes system design, software and hardware design, system integration, and system validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. The system engineering team consists of several design teams, each focusing on a specific set of software or hardware components and services. This program is being delivered using a Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be system engineer within an Agile Release Train that has been established to define and develop the system solution. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <br/><br/> The responsibilities and range of activities will vary, but in general will include: <ul> <li>Participate in an interdisciplinary integrated project team environment under the supervision of more senior engineers and leads</li><li>Perform system requirements analysis</li><li>Perform system design and/or analysis functions based on requirements</li><li>Define SAFe Features that describe the work to be executed.</li><li>Prepare and review system specifications, system design documents, and interface design documents</li><li>Provide design information to hardware and software engineers implementing the system</li><li>Prepare and review test plans, procedures and results</li><li>Investigate defects and propose solutions</li><li>Support the change management process as the system design evolves</li><li>Document the analysis, design and test in accordance with development standards</li><li>Plan activities/tasks for each design iteration</li><li>Report progress against plans</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Experience is required in a number of the following areas:</li><li>4+ years of experience in systems engineering or similar discipline</li> <li>Disciplined approach to system engineering with knowledge of the full system life cycle</li><li>Experience with model based design tools (PTC Integrity Modeler in particular) and SysML</li><li>DOORS Requirements Management</li><li>Rational Team Concert</li><li>Tactical Communications and Networking Systems</li><li>Information Management Systems</li><li>Voice and Multimedia</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li><li>Enthusiastic contributor, willing to learn new skills and take on ownership of work</li><li>Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision</li><li>Experience with Agile product development methods</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Senior Design Engineer
Job_Description: <div><div> <p> </p>  <p><br> At <strong>exp</strong>, we know that great experiences start with the right people. We believe that work should be challenging, and the challenge should be fun. We also believe that exponential possibilities are more likely to occur with a respectful, satisfying and empowering company. We value and respect our employees - their experience and expertise as well as their energy, passion and diversity - and their innovative approach to work and to life.</p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong> <br> Your Challenge</strong><br>  </p>  <p><strong>Exp</strong> Global Inc. is searching for a Senior Design Engineer to join our Land Development / Infrastructure team in our Calgary, AB office. Reporting to the Discipline Manager, the successful applicant will undertake detailed design work in conjunction with Project Managers for large-scale development projects.</p>  <p><br>  <br> <strong>Your Responsibilities</strong></p>  <p> </p>  <p>Lead the design process and provide design oversight for complex Land Development and Infrastructure projects including large scale residential, industrial, and commercial developments in and around Calgary.</p>  <p> </p>  <p>Duties will include:<br> •Provide detailed engineering design solutions and input on the design process for key complex projects, including providing support to Project Managers and other design team members<br> •Write, sign and seal reports/drawings as required<br> •Review project designs, specifications, and contract documents at a Project Manager’s direction<br> •Monitor project schedule and budgets within your area of responsibility and report status to the senior project manager on a regular basis<br> •Liaise with clients, municipal approving authorities and contractors, as needed<br> •Pursue the obtaining of all necessary approvals and permits for projects, including those from municipalities and provincial (Alberta) agencies<br> •Have a strong working knowledge and extensive experience in AutoCAD Civil 3D<br> •Participate in business development efforts including writing and pricing proposal efforts, securing new projects/clients, as needed<br> •Coordinate design and field staff required for internal project teams, including directing, coordinating, and reviewing work done by staff<br> •Ensure health and safety policies are adhered to at all sites and report to Manager and Joint Health and Safety Committee Members</p>  <p><br>  </p>  <p><strong>The Skills and Knowledge You Bring</strong></p>  <p> </p>  <p>•Professional Engineer (P.Eng) or eligibility for license/equivalent<br> •Minimum 10 years of experience in the Land Development industry, with a focus on large development projects<br> •Brownfield redevelopment experience is an asset<br> •Strong detail orientation<br> •University Bachelor’s degree in Civil engineering<br> •Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills<br> •Project Management experience<br> •Fully conversant with Microsoft software applications<br> •Organized, works well under pressure and able to deal with situations with tact<br> •A valid driver's license and vehicle is required<br> •Demonstrated ability to perform individually or as a member of project teams<br> •Ability to multi-task is critical, must be able to meet deadlines<br>  </p>  <p> </p>  <p><strong>What exp Can Offer</strong></p>  <p><br>  <br> With a mission to understand, innovate, partner and deliver, <strong>exp </strong>provides professional, technical and strategic advisory services related to the world's built and natural environments in six key practice areas: Buildings, Earth & Environment, Energy, Industrial, Infrastructure, and Sustainability. Our heritage dates back to 1906, and today more than 3,300 creative professionals across North America and the globe provide the expertise and experience needed to deliver successful projects for clients.</p>  <p> <br> Our promise is to offer you a challenging career in a positive and dynamic work environment, and it's a promise we take seriously.<br>  </p>  <p>Join a dynamic team at <strong>exp</strong> that provides you with innovative projects, the capacity to develop your career, a full range of benefits, flexible working hours, and much more! When you explore what <strong>exp</strong> has to offer, you’ll find exponential possibilities.<br>  <br> For more information or to apply: www.exp.com<br>  <br> #LI-AO1</p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>

interfaces</li>  <li>Experience with Oracle ERP</li> </ul>

Title: Developers, Digital
Job_Description: <div><div>Helping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you? <br/><br/><strong>Developer – Digital</strong><br/><br/>We can transform banking, reimagine it, make banking work for people. We’re on journey to make meaningful impacts on an industry that has the power to transform a person’s life. When we talk about transformation at ATB Financial, we’re not just talking about pie in the sky ideas, we’re listening and collaborating to bring those ideas to life. To put it simply, we’re on a mission to reinvent how banking can support people's’ lives. We’re going to provide meaningful solutions to problems, deepen our connection with customers and while we’re at it, transform ourselves from the inside out.  <br/><br/> We need collaborative visionaries and executors who are eager to listen to our customers in order to do things other banks wouldn’t do. We’re building a team of relentless, passionate and inquisitive ATB transformers to build our bench strength in disrupting ourselves before we get disrupted.  <br/><br/> Want to be a part of our story? If you’re looking for an organization where you can use your talents to do remarkable things, you may be the alpha to our beta and we encourage you to read on. <br/><br/> <strong>TEAM TRANSFORMATION:</strong> <br/><br/> To learn more about us and what each of our areas focus on, including who our fearless leaders are, connect with us at https://atbalphabeta.com/ or here. <br/><br/> <strong>THE OPPORTUNITY:</strong> <br/><br/> In Digital we are on a journey building world class solutions using open technologies. We need exceptional, creative and entrepreneur developers to help us build these solutions powering ATB into the future of banking. Specifically a developer will: <ul> <li>Contribute to the delivery of high-quality, sustainable software that enhance ATB’s digital solutions, in alignment with ATB’s digital banking and customer experience strategies</li> <li>Closely collaborate with others in a squad model with peers and supporting business areas </li> <li>Be a champion for ATB’s software development lifecycle (SDLC) and processes supporting continuous delivery </li> <li>Contribute to proper development practices, including creating and maintaining documentation, adhering to change management requirements and quality standards</li> <li>Challenge the status quo and seek out opportunities to build simpler, smarter tools</li> <li>Advance your knowledge and skills, actively seeking out learning opportunities and sharing knowledge with others</li> <li>Continuously assess new technology and emerging delivery methodology trends and make recommendations to leadership team for review</li> <li>Provide on-call support when required in a rotational basis within the team</li> <li>Adapt to change and work in an agile manner.</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>As the ideal candidate you possess the following:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience developing web applications using modern frameworks, programming languages and technologies such as:   <ul> <li>HTML5 </li> <li>CSS3 </li> <li>JavaScript </li> <li>React </li> <li>Angular </li> <li>Ember</li> </ul>  </li> <li>And/or have experience implementing solutions to consume and expose API’s with programming languages such as:   <ul> <li>Node </li> <li>Java/SpringBoot, </li> <li>or similar languages </li> </ul>  </li> <li>Knowledge of running and deploying applications to Docker, Kubernetes and Cloud Native technologies</li> <li>Proven experience with databases (SQL Server, DB2, MySQL,etc.)</li> <li>Solid understanding of various development processes/tools including continuous delivery, branching strategies, code reviews, Jenkins, SVN, GIT</li> <li>Well versed in security best practices as it relates to software development and operational support</li> <li>Knowledge of software patterns such as MVC, Builder, Factories, Singleton</li> <li>Awareness of Mobile development (Mobile Web, Android, iOS) would be beneficial</li> <li>Knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, along with supporting tools and practices, such as Jenkins, DevOps, Test Driven Development and agile</li> <li>Experience with collaboration tools such as Slack, G-Suite, JIRA, Confluence and others</li> <li>Proven experience in a technology related position or field is an asset, but </li> </ul> <strong>ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>You focus on impact over hard work:</strong> what isn't of a concern is the hours you work, but your results and impact on team members and customers</li> <li><strong>You like to solve difficult problems, together:</strong> no one said transforming banking was going to be easy, but we’re collectively reimagining it and there are no solo heroes welcome</li> <li><strong>You operate with a mentality of Build-Measure-Learn:</strong> our agile mindset is not just for our technical teams, it's a mindset that every one of us is asked to operate from. We move fast, we make mistakes but we measure the impact, learn, grow and change as a result </li> <li><strong>You focus on 10X and leave the incremental thinking at home:</strong> if something doesn't have significant impact, you are the person to challenge whether or not it's worth doing</li> <li><strong>You do it with passion or not at all:</strong> you’re inspired by our purpose and you see the link between yourself and the work you are doing to transform banking </li> </ul> As a team member with the Transformation team at ATB, you can expect: <ul> <li>No day will ever be the same - we’re learning, iterating and making big steps towards our vision of transforming an entire industry, everyday</li> <li>The ability to grow a career within an inspiring, impact focused culture where you are surrounded by changemakers and leaders that empower you to use your voice to make banking work for people</li> <li>To be a part of the energy of an organization that is unlike any other, where you may pinch yourself on the daily and wonder how you got so lucky</li> <li>Bragging rights! You get to call yourself a Transformer and an ATBer and know you play a direct role in helping us become a cutting edge financial institution (it’s going to feel more like a technology company, but either way it’s hella cool.) </li> </ul> So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of? <br/><br/> <strong>Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it. <br/> To learn more visit atb.com.</strong> <br/><br/> To read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page. <br/><br/> Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the high number of resumes we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> If your application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview.  <br/><br/> Please click the following link for information on communities where ATB thrives. <br/><br/> #LI-PRIO</div>  </div>  <br/>Apply

Title: Wireless Telecommunication Engineer
Job_Description: <div><div><em>Cima+ is looking for a <strong>Telecommunication Wireless Engineer</strong> for our Calgary, Edmonton or Vancouver office</em> <br/><br/> We are interested in qualified individuals, with 7 or more years of experience in multiple aspects of wireless communication. CIMA+ is involved with a various set of clients with a wide variety of requirements. Main clients include large Oil and Gas industries, transit operators, health care institutions, first responders, municipalities and colleges/Universities. If you like diversity, this position is for you. The successful candidate should have broad technical expertise in telecommunication with a special focus on wireless communication. The candidate demonstrates strong organization skills and excellent interpersonal abilities. <br/><br/> We are looking for an individual who wants to be challenged and is ready to join a dynamic growing team. CIMA+ is a well-established, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm established in Eastern Canada that has been rapidly expanding operations into Western Canada. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong>  <ul>  <li>Be involved in all phases and types of telecommunication projects with emphasis on wireless projects including:  <ul>   <li>Needs assessment;</li>  <li>Specifications;</li>  <li>Conceptual design;</li>  <li>Cost Estimations;</li>  <li>Detailed design;</li>  <li>Procurement;</li>  <li>Installation supervision;</li>  <li>Test plans and validation</li> </ul>  </li> <li>Responsible for major account and project management</li>    <li>Develop and maintain relationship with existing and new clients</li>    <li>Participate actively in the proposal process</li>    <li>Oversee the on-site system installation. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Qualifications / Experience</u></strong></li>    <li>Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent</li>    <li>Minimum 7 years of relevant experience and P.Eng. Licence;</li>    <li>Experience designing, installing and validating systems in heavy industrial environment is highly desirable.</li>    <li>Experience in a Transit environment is considered an asset.</li>    <li>Experience with many of the following technologies is required:  <ul>   <li>Microwave point-to-point (licence and unlicensed) links.</li>  <li>Point to Multipoint wireless technologies.</li>  <li>Wifi / WiMax</li>  <li>Land Mobile radio systems (P25, DMR, NXDN, TETRA)</li>  <li>Cellular technologies including LTE and DAS.</li>  <li>Working knowledge of Ethernet/IP Switching and routing (VLANs, OSPF, MPLS)</li>  <li>RF Propagation analysis using modern software suites like (E.g. iBwave suite, pathloss 4.0/5.0).</li> </ul>  </li> <li>The candidate should demonstrate experience in  <ul>   <li>building and maintaining a relationship with a client;</li>  <li>creating network architectures;</li>  <li>creating high level and detailed design solutions;</li>  <li>participating in feasibility studies;</li>  <li>creating test plans;</li>  <li>supervising installation;</li>  <li>validating the installed systems;</li>  <li>project management skills.</li> </ul>  </li> <li>Experience in greenfield and brownfield installations.</li>    </ul> Experience working for an engineering firm would be considered an asset</div> </div><div></div> <br/> Apply Now!

Title: Junior Software Developer (Pason Power)
Job_Description: The Role<br/><br/>The Pason Power team focuses on the monitoring and intelligent control of distributed energy storage systems. There will be a number of potential applications ranging from installation of energy storage with solar/PV systems to utility companies looking to build a responsive and adaptable electrical grid. You will have the opportunity to combine your experience with Pason’s in data acquisition and embedded control systems combined with cutting edge Internet of Things (IoT) and cloud technologies to provide a best in class solution.<br/><br/>Essential Duties and Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Work as a part of an agile scrum team, contributing to the development of the Pason Power product line</li> <li>Contribute to the development of Pason Power web applications and monitoring & control systems</li> <li>Work alongside data science engineers to improve and optimize control system algorithms</li> <li>Maintain and extend reliable communications with external hardware devices using protocols such as Modbus, CANbus, Zigbee, etc</li> <li>Further the integration with cloud services and IoT transport mechanisms</li> <li>Write unit and integration tests</li> <li>Contribute to support for production issues</li> <li>Participate in team technical discussions</li> <li>Participate in Code Reviews</li> <li>Participate and contribute in weekly Agile meetings, discuss and present work accomplished and provide constructive feedback to help improve the team</li> <li>Contribute to our evolving development environment through research, experiment with new technologies and attend conferences or courses. Educate your peers on what you have learned.</li> <li>Travel to our Houston office 1-2 weeks per year to spend time working in person with the technical team there</li> </ul>  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities<ul> <li>Proficiency in any of the following programming languages: Python, JavaScript, Java or C/C++/C#</li> <li>Experience working with hardware / IoT device control systems</li> <li>Experience with Test Driven Development / Behavioral Driven Development</li> <li>Experience providing leadership in technical teams</li> <li>Familiar with RESTful APIs</li> <li>Exposure to code versioning tools such as Git</li> <li>Exposure to Linux</li> <li>Ability to work in a team or as an ndividual.</li> <li>Familiar with container technologies (Docker)</li> <li>Familiar with messaging protocols such as MQTT or AMQP</li> <li>Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience</li> <li>NoSQL database experience (MongoDB, DynamoDB, InfluxDB, etc)</li> <li>Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc)</li> <li>Agile/Scrum experience</li> </ul>

Title: Open Text Content Server Developer
Job_Description: <strong>OPEN TEXT CONTENT SERVER DEVELOPER</strong>   <ul> <li>Gather and document business requirements for enhancements and defects.</li>  <li>Provide estimate of effort required to design, build, and test.</li>  <li>Design, build, and test enhancements and defect fixes. 2+ years experience developing for OpenText Content Management.</li></ul>   <ul> <li>Should have worked/good understanding of Content server suite 16 (including xECM, CRT, ADN, Transmittal management, Archive Center, Records Management)</li>  <li>Should have OScript exposure and able to customize standard OpenText features.</li>  <li>Should be good at OpenText Web Services, Rest API.</li>  <li>Should be good at designing Workflows and Web reports.</li>  <li>Experience documenting business requirements.</li>  <li>Experience estimating effort.</li> </ul>  <strong>KEY SKILLS:</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience with Oil and Gas industry</li>  <li>Experience with engineering documents</li>  <li>Fluency in English</li>  <li>Ability to work independently</li> </ul>

Title: Co-op Student, Facilities Engineering Centre of Excellence

At Husky,we respect diversity and embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness anddifferent perspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achievethis, individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilitiesand we encourage applications from everyone including visible minorities,Aboriginal people, women, and persons with disabilities. About Husky: One of Huskys advantages is that weare an integrated oil and gas company. From exploration to development,production, refining and marketing, weve got it all! Combine this with a rangeof learning and development tools and an inclusive work environment, and youare well-positioned for a successful career at Husky. We have training, mentoring andcareer development programs and resources to help you develop both personallyand professionally as an employee or a leader. We offer many internal leadershipand business skills courses along with tuition reimbursement programs forqualified employees. Every year, a significant number of our employees are ableto take on new roles within the company thanks to our strong focus on hands-onlearning and development. #LI-DNP Job Student Primary Location CA-AB-Calgary

Title: GIS Web and Desktop Developer
Job_Description: GIS Web and Desktop Developer <br/><br/> Manpower is currently hiring a GIS Web and Desktop Developer to fill a long-term contract for our client in Calgary. <br/><br/> Summary of Key Responsibilities include (job functions include but are not limited to): <br/><br/> Collaborate with project team to convert existing Building Central web application based on Silverlight to new web application using ESRIs JavaScript API and Web App Builder, Dojo, Backbone, JavaScript, JQuery <br/> Investigation and publication of the 3D building wireframe extractions to internal city business groups aligned to the 3D Corporate strategy. <br/> Improve integration with other internal source systems <br/> GIS development assignments on other project(s) under the same portfolio (IT-CS-Project Centre Corp. Services) <br/> Code development, and all phases of testing (unit, system, integration, and performance / load). <br/> Documentation and training on the modified process for business and technical stakeholders. <br/> Updated technical and process documentation as required. <br/> Collaborate on work planning following city methodology. <br/> Resolution of bugs during testing. <br/> Report progress to the IT Lead and IT Analyst assigned to the project. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications and Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience mentioned below <br/> Technical Requirements: ESRIs JavaScript API technology, includes build test, and deploy a web application using ArcGIS API for JavaScript, ArcGIS Server platform to incorporate ready-to-use content and online services that allow end users to visualize, query, and analyze data ESRIs Web App Builder technology, SQL and Oracle, ArcMap, ArcCatalog, ArcObjects, ArcSDE Geodatabase , HTML5 and ArcObjects, Visual Studio 2017, Dojo, Backbone, JavaScript, JQuery. <br/> Proficiency with C#.Net <br/> Proficiency in ArcGIS desktop extensions development <br/> Strong written and verbal communication skills. <br/> Proven experience with Responsive GIS Web UI Design. <br/> Excellent understanding of SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle). <br/> Telerik Kendo UI for JQuery. <br/> Implementing 3D data in web GIS environment <br/> Experience with ArcGIS enterprise geodatabase environment. <br/> Experience with development tools and technologies like Blacksmith, Web Trend, Style Library. <br/><br/> Please apply online and/or create and manage your profile at www.manpowerab.ca. Alternatively, you can email us directly at Divya.singh@manpower.com or contact us at 403-269-6936 & ask for our Professional team. <br/><br/> You can also follow us on Facebook (@manpower.alberta), Instagram (Manpower.AB), twitter (@ManpowerAB) & LinkedIn (Manpower Alberta) for more information on our current Companies and Job postings.

Title: Intermediate Software Developer (Pason Power)
Job_Description: The Role<br/><br/>The Pason Power team focuses on the monitoring and intelligent control of distributed energy storage systems. There will be a number of potential applications ranging from installation of energy storage with solar/PV systems to utility companies looking to build a responsive and adaptable electrical grid. You will have the opportunity to combine your experience with Pason’s in data acquisition and embedded control systems combined with cutting edge Internet of Things (IoT) and cloud technologies to provide a best in class solution.<br/><br/>Essential Duties and Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Work as a part of an agile scrum team, contributing to the development of the Pason Power product line</li> <li>Contribute to the development of Pason Power web applications and monitoring & control systems</li> <li>Work alongside data science engineers to improve and optimize control system algorithms</li> <li>Maintain and extend reliable communications with external hardware devices using protocols such as Modbus, CANbus, ZigBee, etc.</li> <li>Further the integration with cloud services and IoT transport mechanisms</li> <li>Write unit and integration tests</li> <li>Troubleshoot and provide timely solutions for production issues</li> <li>Understand and contribute to the development of system architecture</li> <li>Participate in Code Reviews</li> <li>Participate in team technical discussions, challenge ideas and present solutions and approaches to be considered by the team</li> <li>Participate and contribute in weekly Agile meetings, discuss and present work accomplished and provide constructive feedback to help improve the team</li> <li>Contribute to our evolving development environment through research, experiment with new technologies and attend conferences or courses. Educate your peers on what you have learned.</li> <li>Travel to our Houston office 1-2 weeks per year to spend time working in person with the technical team there</li> </ul>  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities   <ul> <li>Expertise in any of the following programming languages: Python, JavaScript, Java, C/C++ or C#</li> <li>Experience with the React.js framework</li> <li>Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git</li> <li>Proficiency in Linux</li> <li>Experience working with hardware / IoT device control systems</li> <li>Experience with Test Driven Development / Behavioral Driven Development</li> <li>Experience providing leadership in technical teams</li> <li>Experience working with protocols such as Modbus, CANbus, ZigBee etc.</li> <li>Familiar with RESTful APIs</li> <li>Familiar with container technologies (Docker)</li> <li>Familiar with messaging protocols such as MQTT or AMQP</li> <li>Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience</li> <li>NoSQL database experience (MongoDB, DynamoDB, InfluxDB, etc.)</li> <li>Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc.)</li> <li>A knack for benchmarking and optimization</li> <li>Agile/Scrum experience</li> <li>Experience in integration and unit testing</li> <li>Ability to work in a team or as an individual.</li> </ul>

Title: Developer
Job_Description: <div><div> <p><strong>YOUR OPPORTUNITY:</strong><br> The Information Systems (IS) Developer Analyst is responsible for the analysis, design and building of systems through the development of application logic, user interfaces, data interfaces, data conversion scripts and reports. An IS Developer Analyst works under the guidance and direction of IS Business Systems Analyst to support the portfolio of applications for IS</p>  <p><strong>COMPETITIVE SALARY - STOCK OPTIONS - STOCK SAVINGS PLAN - ANNUAL BONUSES – BENEFITS!</strong></p>  <p><strong>HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?</strong><br> • Participate in supporting and enhancing the portfolio of applications for Oil Sands<br> • Analyzing, designing and developing applications<br> • Developing and maintaining functional/technical specifications and documentation<br> • Troubleshooting problems that occur in the everyday use of applications<br> • Fixing program bugs and/or data errors identified during troubleshooting<br> • Manage multiple tasks at the same time with high levels of effectiveness<br> • Demonstrate the ability to handle complex work</p>  <p><strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong><br> • Highly developed analytical skills<br> • Excellent interpersonal, team and communication skills<br> • Strong multi-tasking and prioritizing abilities<br> • A post-secondary degree in Computer Science or a related field of study<br> • Demonstrated proficiency in N-tier application analysis, design and development using Microsoft VB.NET/ASP.Net, Web Services/APIs<br> • Experience with Oracle SQL and Oracle PL/SQL, MSRS, MS Orchestrator<br> • Familiarity with product licensing and compliance<br> • Between 5 – 10 years of experience as a Programmer Analyst</p>  <p>To see related Information Technology roles at CNRL, visit: www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Information-Technology</p>  <p><strong>About Canadian Natural</strong><br> At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." As a leading oil and gas producer, our diverse combination of assets include light oil, heavy oil, in situ oil sands production, oil sands mining and upgrading facilities, and natural gas. At Canadian Natural, safety is a core value. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.</p>  <p>Canadian Natural Resources Limited - CNRL - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.</p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>

Title: Reliability Engineer
Job_Description: Our role is to provide top level technical talent to some of the planets strongest companies in the energy and technology industries, as well as the public sector. This is where you come in. We have a distinctly different approach to our contractor engagement and have a team of specialists to ensure success on your assignment. <br/> Our Calgary Downtown Energy client is seeking a Reliability Engineer to support with a push of 6-7 projects that require execution in 2018. As a Reliability Engineer, you will be responsible for analyzing SAGD oil sands operating data, maintenance history, and reliability data to identify opportunities and propose recommendations. This role will work alongside 4 other Reliability Engineers with blended experience in both Analytics and Steam who are highly collaborative, share knowledge, and driven to impact the bottom line. <br/> With standard working hours, this is a 10-month contract, based out of our clients Calgary office with some travel to Sunrise Oilsands required (once every several months). The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, focused, collaborative, and highly analytical with the ability to read, analyze, and identify data into tangible information. <br/> Job Responsibilities include:Analyze equipment performance based on operating data and maintenance history. Ensure that equipment is operating close to design parameters to identify efficiency degradation, optimize energy consumption, and minimize waste. <br/> Periodically review equipment maintenance records to identify recurring problems. Evaluate preventive (PM) and predictive (PdM) maintenance programs and recommend solutions. <br/> Review SAP data and make recommendations about the quality of data - problem description, cause and damage codes, and work description. High quality SAP data is essential to applying reliability concepts and analytics. <br/> Perform asset criticality review and validate existing FMEA to confirm relevance of the FMEA <br/> Apply engineering concepts and operational knowledge to resolve equipment performance and reliability issues. <br/><br/> Qualifications:4 to 6 years of experience with SAGD technologies and processes <br/> Knowledgeable about Defect Elimination (DE), Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) and Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA) processes <br/> Demonstrated experience with developing business cases based on reliability data <br/> Knowledgeable about the concepts of Lean Six Sigma (LSS) <br/> Good working knowledge of MS Office <br/> Proficiency within SAPs PPM module <br/> Effective interpersonal, innovation, and organizational skills <br/> Strong presentation skills; the ability to understand audiences and relay messages/goals in a way thats understood <br/><br/> Education/Experience:2 or more years of experience with conventional and/or heavy oil production, and/or refining technologies and processes <br/> P.Eng or eligibly to register as a P.Eng <br/> Experience working within reliability software such as Meridium <br/> Knowledgeable about condition monitoring technologies such as vibration, ultrasound, infrared, and lubricant analysis <br/><br/> <strong>About the Ian Martin Group:</strong> <br/> Founded by engineers to support the needs of technical organizations, the Ian Martin Group has been creating authentic connections around meaningful work since 1957. As North Americas most progressive recruitment and project-staffing firm, we specialize in engineering and IT recruiting to help organizations of all sizes hire better. The Ian Martin Group is a certified B Corporation, which means we meet comprehensive standards that measure our impact on employees, suppliers, community, and the environment. <br/> We will review applications as they are received, and we will contact candidates whose skills and experience best suit this role. <br/> <strong>EWEMI</strong>

Title: Site Reliability Engineer
Job_Description: <div><strong>Who You’ll Work With</strong> <br/><br/> The Cisco AMP engineering team is composed of highly skilled individuals who are comfortable working in a fast paced and technically challenging environment. The AMP team is a highly performant group that are involved with all stages of the product development process from solving complex engineering problems to working directly with customers. <br/><br/> Cisco enjoys a unique position and is leveraging an unprecedented capability to secure the network through intelligence derived from data collected on a global scale. Engineers on the ThreatGRID and Cisco Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) teams are leading the way in their capacity to invent, prove-out, and enable new technologies in big data analytics and threat intelligence. <br/><br/> <strong>What You'll Do</strong> <br/><br/> This is an exciting opportunity to work with the Cisco AMP engineering group based in Calgary to maintain, grow and scale the AMP infrastructure. The successful candidate will play a key role in supporting our AWS footprint through SaltStack. In addition, the selected applicant will be responsible for monitoring our production environment and resolving issues through established playbooks. <br/><br/> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Minimum Qualifications</em> <ul> <li>4+ years experience in the administration of enterprise-grade AWS infrastructures</li><li>Familiarity with software orchestration: SaltStack</li><li>Very strong Debian Linux system administration skills</li><li>Experience in Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana</li><li>Proficiency in infrastructure, service and application monitoring tools</li><li>Ability to be on-call 24x7</li> </ul> <em>Desired Skills</em> <ul> <li>Familiarity with JVM performance monitoring using JMX</li><li>Familiarity with Kafka and Zookeeper</li><li>Python background</li><li>Experience with Datadog</li> </ul> <strong>Why Cisco</strong> <br/><br/> We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren't afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. <br/><br/> We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.</div>

Title: Applications Engineer, Agriculture
Job_Description: Our customers have ideas. Lots of them. Turning those ideas into a competitive advantage is what we do. As part of the Hexagon group of companies, NovAtel's integrated global positioning solutions deliver success time and time again on land, sea and in the air. We help many of the world's leading companies stay in the lead by consistently delivering OEM global satellite positioning products that are recognized for their technical innovation, unsurpassed quality and industry-leading customer support. <br/><br/> Applications Engineering provides general product and application support for NovAtel Hardware and Software, and on related GNSS & INS topics, along with field services to NovAtel’s worldwide customer base. <strong>While part of the Applications Engineering team, this position will have a focus on supporting NovAtel’s Precision Agriculture market.</strong> <br/><br/> The team also provides other services internally and externally to Customers, Sales, Product Management, Project Management and Marketing to help ensure the cohesive and comprehensive delivery of products and materials. Working closely with internal engineering teams ensures escalated issues are resolved in a timely manner while continuing to be the customer liaison and maintaining the customer interface. <br/><br/> As our <strong> Applications Engineer, Agriculture</strong> you would be responsible for: <ul> <li>Providing front line product and application support on NovAtel Hardware, Software, and related GNSS & INS topics to internal and external customers</li><li>Providing customer training, demonstrations, technical assistance, and technical sales support</li><li>Liaising with other departments regarding technical matters</li><li>Formulating and implementing procedures and plans for resolving problems</li><li>Performing software testing, verification, bug reports, and field trial coordination</li><li>Reviewing technical documentation materials and manuals</li><li>Generating application notes for frequently asked questions and knowledge base</li> </ul> <strong>Must-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Geomatics or Electrical Engineering degree with 2+ years of related industry experience</li><li>Self-motivated team player with proven problem solving skills.</li><li>Outgoing and energetic with exceptional people skills.</li><li>Multi-tasking with excellent verbal and written skills.</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel, worldwide.</li> </ul> <strong>Key Success Factors:</strong> <ul> <li>High attention to detail and highly organised</li><li>Strong multitasker with keen ability to prioritize</li><li>Comfortable working individually but know when to ask for help</li><li>Work well in a collaborative environment</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Background includes experience working directly with customers, preferably in the delivery of support or services</li><li>Background includes experience in GNSS and INS systems installation and/or troubleshooting in precision agriculture related applications.</li> </ul>

Title: Civil Engineer/Technologist

Working within the Transportation team, this position is ideal for someone who wants to learn from experienced professionals and have the opportunity to grow a career with a leading design firm. <br/><br/> The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  <ul> <li>Using Civil3D to develop roadways, highways, intersections, transit, utilities and other transportation project designs and 3D design models</li>  <li>Develop project specific design criteria and verify that applicable codes and engineering standard practices are being met</li>  <li>Ensure that quality project designs are completed on time and on budget through implementation of quality reviews</li>  <li>Take direction from Management and Project Managers</li>  <li>Efficiently work as part of a multi-disciplinary team</li>  <li>Independently evaluating, selecting, and applying standard engineering techniques, procedures and criteria and using judgement in making minor adaptations and modifications</li>  <li>Overseeing\Managing certain aspects of design for roadway projects</li>  <li>Develop reports, plans, specifications and cost estimates</li>  <li>Participate in developing project proposals</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>Technical or Associates degree or equivalent.</li>  <li>4+ years of experience of direct transportation engineering design and strong familiarity of Canadian design standards</li>  <li>Strong proficiency in CIVIL 3D and AutoTURN for roadway design and other design software</li>  <li>Experience includes transportation project related contract specifications and interdisciplinary coordination</li>  <li>Strong analytical, verbal and written communication skills</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Undergraduate Engineering degree or diploma from a recognized post-secondary institution</li>  <li>8+ years of direct experience with transportation engineering design and strong familiarity of Canadian design standards</li>  <li>Proficiency in Civil 3D and AutoTURN</li>  <li>Proficiency with 3D corridor Modeling using Civil3D</li>  <li>Design experience with Alberta Transportation, City of Calgary, British Columbia Ministry of Transportation</li>  <li>Skills in MicroStation/InRoads and other design software are advantageous</li>  <li>Familiarity with stormwater/utility design, erosion and sediment control design</li>  <li>Familiarity of Microsoft Office</li>  <li>Member of Professional Association with either APEGA or ASET</li> </ul> <strong>What We Offer</strong> <br/><br/> AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. <br/><br/> At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees. <br/><br/> <em>NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES: Please note that AECOM does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, AECOM explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM.</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Job Category</em></strong> <em>Engineering - Transportation</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Business Group</em></strong> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Country</em></strong> <em>Canada</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Position Status</em></strong> <em>Full-Time</em> <br/><br/> <strong><em>Requisition/Vacancy No.</em></strong> <em>178646BR</em> <br/><br/> <em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.</em>

Title: Assistant Professor, Micro/Nano Systems Fabrication and Integration, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering
Job_Description: <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> The <strong>Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering</strong> (ECE) in the Schulich School of Engineering at the University of Calgary is pleased to invite applications for a tenure-track position at the rank of <strong>Assistant</strong> <strong>Professor</strong> in the area of Micro/Nano Systems Fabrication and Integration with an anticipated start date of <strong>September 1, 2018</strong>. <br/><br/> Position Description <br/><br/> Applicants must have a doctoral degree, or will have earned a doctoral degree by the anticipated start date, in Electrical Engineering or in a closely related discipline. <br/><br/> Applicants must demonstrate potential for excellence in Micro/Nano systems research within the University of Calgary strategic research areas. The successful candidate must have demonstrated experimental research and hands-on fabrication experience in at least one of the following: <ul> 	<li>Biomedical microsystems engineering,</li>	<li>Electrical bio-systems,</li>	<li>Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS), Bio-MEMS, and/or Radio Frequency-MEMS</li>	<li>Micro-sensors and micro-sensor fabrication.</li> </ul> Relevant professional experience with industry will be considered an asset. <br/><br/> The successful candidate will be expected to establish and lead an externally funded research program and supervise graduate students, develop an independent experimental research program in his/her area of expertise, leverage the capabilities of the Schulich School of Engineering clean-room facility (https://schulich.ucalgary.ca/research/facilities-and-centres/microsystems-hub) for his/her research, and, with time, assume responsibility for directing the facility by representing and promoting it nationally and internationally and interfacing with industrial partners. <br/><br/> Applicants must also demonstrate potential for excellence in teaching. The successful applicant will be expected to teach at both the undergraduate and graduate levels. He or she will be expected to develop a graduate level course in his/her area of expertise to complement the offerings of the Department. In addition to the research and teaching responsibilities, the successful individual will participate in professional and university service. <br/><br/> Applicants must be registered (or be eligible for registration) as a Professional Engineer with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) within two years of initial appointment. <br/><br/> <strong>Applications are encouraged as soon as possible, but will be accepted until June 8, 2018.</strong> <br/><br/> Interested individuals are requested to submit a detailed curriculum vitae, vision statement for leveraging Microsystems hub capabilities (maximum one page), statement of research interests (maximum two pages), statement of teaching focus and philosophy (maximum two pages), copies of all academic transcripts, and the name and contact information of at least three referees to: <br/><br/> Dr. Abraham Fapojuwo, Chair, Hiring Committee <br/> Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering <br/> Schulich School of Engineering <br/><br/> Applications should be sent via email to Heather Hanley (heather.hanley@ucalgary.ca). <br/><br/> Salary is competitive and will be determined according to the successful applicant's accomplishments, experience, and qualifications. <br/><br/> About the Department <br/><br/> The Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering offers BSc degrees in Electrical and Software Engineering. The Department also offers MEng, MSc, and PhD degrees in Electrical, Computer and Software Engineering with specializations in software engineering, energy and environment, environmental engineering, and energy and environmental systems. The Department is home to 600 undergraduate students, approximately 200 graduate students, and 42 faculty members including 6 research chairs. The Department is a research leader in a variety of areas including power- and energy-control systems, radio systems, telecommunications and wireless technologies, micro/nano technology systems, bioelectricity, biomedical instrumentations and image processing, and software engineering. The successful applicant is expected to work collaboratively with existing faculty members having mutual research interests on finding practical solutions to real-world problems. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their academic and professional success while they are here. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority. In this connection, at the time of your application, please answer the following question: Are you a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident of Canada? (Yes/No)</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> To learn more about academic opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Academic Careers website</strong>. For more information about the Faculty of Science visit <strong>Careers in the Faculty of Science.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>About Calgary, Alberta</strong> <br/><br/> Calgary is one of the world's cleanest cities and has been named one of the world's most livable cities for years. Calgary is a city of leaders - in business, community, philanthropy and volunteerism. Calgarians benefit from a growing number of world-class dining and cultural events and enjoy more days of sunshine per year than any other major Canadian city. Calgary is less than an hour's drive from the majestic Rocky Mountains and boasts the most extensive urban pathway and bikeway network in North America.

Title: Instrumentation & Control Systems Engineer
Job_Description: Category : Engineering <br/> Location/City : AB - Edmonton <br/>  <br/> Athenian Group is a full-service placement agency providing Professional Technical Recruitment, Staffing and Payroll services to Canadaâ?'s top Consulting, Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction companies.Our focus is on providing businesses with the highest quality of worker for both contract and permanent staff positions.Our client, is a leading Engineering, Procurement, Construction Company with expertise in oil sands, refining, petrochemicals and pipeline segments and covers both operational and engineering aspectsCurrently we are recruiting for;INSTRUMENTATION & CONTROL SYSTEMS ENGINEERYou are a motivated self-starter and team contributor with eight plus (8+) yearsâ progressive Instrumentation & Controls Engineering experience, within an EPC and/or industrial plant environment (Petrochemical focus).KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & EXPERIENCE	Identify / prepare key deliverables (P&IDs, CWPs, MRs, Control Narratives, Shut-down Keys, etc.) conforming to internal and external requirements throughout various project stages (scoping studies, detailed design, etc.).	Develop Instrumentation & Controls engineering specific project requirements through the preparation of design basis documents (design criteria) and identifying / confirming standards and specifications to be used.	Must be willing and able to travel to client facilities as required to scope jobs, attend project meetings and execute deliverables.	Demonstrated ability to interface between the engineering disciplines, project engineer, project manager and the client to ensure timely delivery and accuracy of information.	Work with discipline engineers and designers to ensure technical integrity and designs per Company and client standards / specifications.	Embrace and support a coaching / learning environment with a focus on knowledge transfer and increasing technical competencies of the department.	Attend process hazard analysis and SIL/LOPA meetings and provide recommendations on selected processes and control system implementation per project / client specifications.	Ensure recommendations are in accordance with industrial regulations	Prepare Man-Hour Estimates and Define project deliverables.	Ability to efficiently contribute to the development of all project deliverables.	Plan / Monitor / Review: project scope, schedule, costs, and quality of completed work (e.g. key drawings, design concepts, calculations, etc.).	Program and maintain existing process control systems, specifically Experion PKS, Honeywell TPS/TDC 3000, Emerson DeltaV, Allen Bradley PLC, Triconex SIS, Moore Quadlog SIS/BMS etc...	Ensure the timely resolution of technical issues, technical requests for information and the support for process control and application related problems	Provide Commissioning & Start Up (C&SU) support to sustaining projects	Apply continuous improvement techniques to optimize control systems reliability and performance	Develop, manage and sustain control system performance related to Key Performance Indicators (KPI's)EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:	Degree in a related engineering discipline such as Electrical, Computer, Computer Process Control or Instrumentation is required	8+ years related experience	Previous EPC experience required	Previous Oil Sands Extraction, Oil refinery / Upgrading experience required	Alberta P.Eng. or P.L.(Eng.) status is mandatory	Working knowledge (hands-on programming and configuration) of Honeywell DCS platforms	Working knowledge (hands-on programming and configuration) of Triconex PLC platform	Motivated, self-starter with ability to work under minimal supervision	Hands on experience of Basic Process Control System (BPCS), PLC and Safety Systems - hardware and software configuration	Experience with Honeywell Experion PKS/ TPS/TDC3000 System, Emerson DeltaV System, Triconex SIS, Moore Quadlog SIS GE Mark V/VI and Allen Bradley PLCs is an asset	Experience in installing, troubleshooting and maintaining communications between various control systems using industrial communication protocols like Object linking and embedding process control (OPC) and Modbus is an asset	Experience in maintenance/construction and commissioning/operations support would be an assetIf you or someone you know is interested in this position, please contact;Jason Wahljason@atheniangroup.caEdmonton â 780-499-5959Calgary â 403-969-9962North America â 877-596-5522

Title: Project Engineer
Job_Description: ServiceCalgary, AB<br/><br/>Startec Refrigeration Services is a thriving privately owned company headquartered in Calgary that produces custom mission critical compression and refrigeration systems for a variety of industries. Startec devotes their industry leading expertise in refrigeration & compression technologies to solve their clients’ most technically challenging needs. We create reliable solutions for extreme operating conditions and provide exceptional service, which is a cornerstone of our business. <br/><br/> We are currently recruiting an experienced Project Engineer to join the Startec team. The Project Engineer ensures that Startec satisfies its’ customers’ needs in an efficient and professional manner. This role provides engineering and technical support to the Service department, sales and directly to the customer and acts as liaison between Service and the engineering group in the compression and process division.<br/><br/><strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>  <ul> <li>P.Eng. designation with minimum five years’ experience in refrigeration and/or piping applications</li><li>Project management experience, a PMP designation would be an asset</li><li>Good knowledge of ASME/ANSI/codes, knowledge of CSA B-52 codes an asset</li><li>Microsoft Windows operating systems; Microsoft Office Suite, engineering design and drawing software</li><li>Strong technical, analytical and problem-solving capabilities.</li><li>Ability to communicate, influence, negotiate and resolve conflict</li><li>Capable of working with minimal direct supervision</li><li>Good interpersonal and communication skills.</li><li>Excellent organizational skills.</li> </ul>  <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Provide engineering support to the Startec Service group as required</li><li>Work directly with the Construction Manager in the project management execution of large capital projects to ensure projects are completed in accordance with acceptable engineering practices and Startec best practices.</li><li>Responsible for major equipment/component approval for all projects to ensure adherence to engineering best practices</li><li>Responsible for responding to bid technical clarifications during sales cycle</li><li>Resolve issues, provide direction and conduct quality assurance checks on project deliverables</li><li>Participate in pre-contract liaison with customer and may participate in negotiating with key customers regarding contract terms and conditions</li><li>Oversee drafting to prepare layouts and detail drawings</li><li>Responsible for project documentation including manuals and operating/control descriptions</li><li>Support the service group with commissioning and field issues</li><li>Keeping ahead of developments in the refrigeration industry by reading relevant journals, attending specialized training, industry conferences and courses</li> </ul>  <strong>JOB DUTIES:</strong><br/><br/><ul> <li>Prepare and maintain the project schedule identifying tasks, timelines and resources required for various projects</li><li>Maintain project cost control</li><li>Develop project bill of materials and approve all projects drawings</li><li>Provide help and advice to customers either directly or through use of internal resources</li><li>Analyze and compare customer, supplier, and Startec design specifications to identify areas on quotations and proposals where there are exceptions and/or additional costs.</li><li>Assist with inquiries from Startec sales agents and Startec customers related to requests for quotation</li><li>Mentor and assist with the development of junior engineering personnel</li><li>Develop and maintain relationship with major component suppliers</li><li>Negotiate price and delivery as required during development of quotation and standard product development</li><li>Investigate and solve customer problems where applicable to support operational activity</li><li>Develop standard product lines and design standards for refrigeration applications, including component selection, cost estimate and design.</li> <li>Develop process to include research & development, gathering market intelligence, and integration with Startec engineering and QC standards.</li><li>Preparation, review, and publication of design standards for refrigeration applications</li> </ul> We offer competitive wages, training, flexibility, and a dynamic and exciting work environment. Specialized technical training will be provided to the successful candidate. Please apply directly or forward your resume, quoting the job title above, in confidence to careers@startec.ca <br/><br/> It is mandatory for all applicants to complete the Pro.file People Survey below when submitting their application. Please proceed using the link below: <br/><br/> <strong>http://www.profileperformancesystem.com/survey.html?SL=55677</strong> <br/><br/> We thank you for your application and interest in our organization. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Systems Developer
