</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with unit testing frameworks such as NUnit would be an asset;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Proven technical ability supported by strong analytical and problem solving skills;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to work effectively as part of a team as well as independently in a self-directed mode;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong interpersonal and communication skills;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>The ability to work well in a fast paced environment through exceptional time management skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritize duties;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Oilfield experience, specifically in the Energy Services sector, would be an asset.</DIV></LI></UL>

Title: Senior Software Developer (Monitoring & Control Systems)
Job_Description: The Role<br/><br/>The Pason Power team focuses on the monitoring and intelligent control of distributed energy storage systems. There will be a number of potential applications ranging from installation of energy storage with solar/PV systems to utility companies looking to build a responsive and adaptable electrical grid. You will have the opportunity to combine your experience with Pason’s in data acquisition and embedded control systems combined with cutting edge Internet of Things (IoT) and cloud technologies to provide a best in class solution.<br/><br/>Essential Duties and Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Work as a part of a scrum team, contributing to the development of the Pason Power product line</li> <li>Provide mentorship and guidance to other software developers</li> <li>Enhance and extend our IoT software platform at the edge which monitors and controls power electronics hardware and stationary battery systems</li> <li>Work alongside data science engineers to improve and optimize control system algorithms</li> <li>Maintain and extend reliable communications with external hardware devices using protocols such as Modbus, CANbus, Zigbee, etc</li> <li>Further the integration with cloud services and IoT transport mechanisms</li> <li>Write unit and integration tests</li> <li>Implement security best practices and protection regarding edge device and cloud communications</li> <li>Troubleshoot and provide timely solutions for production issues</li> <li>Understand and contribute to the development of system architecture</li> <li>Participate in Code Reviews</li> <li>Participate in team technical discussions, challenge ideas and present solutions and approaches to be considered by the team</li> <li>Participate and contribute in weekly Agile meetings, discuss and present work accomplished and provide constructive feedback to help improve the team</li> <li>Contribute to our evolving development environment through research, experiment with new technologies and attend conferences or courses. Educate your peers on what you have learned.</li> <li>Travel to our Houston office 1-2 weeks per year to spend time working in person with the technical team there</li> </ul>  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities<ul> <li>Expertise in any of the of the following programming languages: Python, JavaScript, Java, C/C++ or C#</li> <li>Experience working with hardware / IoT device control systems</li> <li>Experience with Test Driven Development / Behavioral Driven Development</li> <li>Experience providing leadership in technical teams</li> <li>Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git</li> <li>Proficiency in Linux</li> <li>Experience in integration and unit testing</li> <li>Ability to work in a team or as an individual.</li> <li>Experience doing code review Familiar with RESTful APIs</li> <li>Familiar with container technologies (Docker)</li> <li>Familiar with messaging protocols such as MQTT or AMQP</li> <li>Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience</li> <li>NoSQL database experience (MongoDB, DynamoDB, InfluxDB, etc)</li> <li>Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc)</li> <li>A knack for benchmarking and optimization</li> <li>Agile/Scrum experience</li> </ul>

Title: Senior Project Engineer – Process – Engineered Systems –
Job_Description: <div><div> Senior Project Engineer – Process – Engineered Systems – Calgary SE</div><br/>  <div> <div>  <div> <strong>Openings</strong> 1</div> <div> <strong>Location Name</strong> Enerflex - Canada - Alberta - Calgary <br/> Calgary, Alberta, CA</div> <div> <strong>Operating Unit</strong> Enerflex - Canada</div> <div> <strong>Date Posted</strong> May 02, 2018</div> <div> <strong>Profession</strong> Engineering</div> <div> <strong>Experience Level</strong> Not Specified</div> <div> <strong>Job Type</strong> Permanent, Full Time</div> <div> <strong>Education Level</strong> University - Bachelors</div> <div> <strong>Job ID</strong> job-3184</div> </div><div> Position Summary</div> <div><strong>Company Profile:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex is the single source supplier for natural gas compression, oil and gas processing, refrigeration systems and electric power equipment – plus in-house engineering and mechanical services expertise. The Company’s broad in-house resources provide the capability to engineer, design, manufacture, construct, commission and service hydrocarbon handling systems. Enerflex’ s expertise encompasses field production facilities, compression and natural gas processing plants, processing plants, refrigeration systems and electric power equipment serving the natural gas production industry. Headquartered in Calgary, Canada, Enerflex has more than 2,000 employees globally and operates in over seven regions around the world. <br/><br/> Enerflex puts its Values of Integrity, Commitment, Creativity and Success into action in all aspects of business. The Company values passionate people who want to put their career into overdrive. We will help match your skills with a position that challenges you to reach new heights, rewards you for outstanding performance and allows you to grow with the Company throughout your life-long career. Join the Enerflex team and apply now. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Enerflex is looking for a <strong>Senior</strong> <strong>Project Engineer - Process</strong> to lead engineering projects in a high energy manufacturing environment. Reporting directly to the Manager, Process Engineering, this role would be in charge of designing and building large million dollar plus gas processing facilities.This individual will mentor junior engineers and work with our fabrication department to see the project come to life in our facility every day, responsible for all aspects of their team’s projects from design through to commissioning. <br/><br/> Candidate must be able to work in a customer centred team environment. Focus is on projects being accurate, complete and timely. <br/><br/> With a foundation of integrity, the candidate would use commitment and creativity to drive our organization forward. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> This role will offer the right candidate variety in their daily work life, learning opportunities and the chance to add value to our current gas processing projects. We require someone with strong communication skills, matched with sound problem solving and decision making skills. Your ability to lead by influence, mentor, be organized, establish clear objectives and monitor key measures, will enable you to deliver the results you need to be successful in this role. You must be able to work effectively within a multi-stakeholder environment and seek to be collaborative on all fronts.  <ul> <li>Design process flow and piping / instrument diagrams</li> <li>Review general arrangements and 3D model</li> <li>Ensure accuracy, completeness and timeliness on responsible projects</li> <li>Take part in HAZOP and SIL review meetings</li> <li>Implement project specifications</li> <li>Size PSV’s and control valves based on process information</li> <li>Size vessels and piping based on process information</li> <li>Complete final checks on P&ID’s Models and other project deliverables</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>10+ Years of experience with an Engineering Degree or Technical Diploma</li> <li>Professional engineer designation</li> <li>Working knowledge of gas processing and fabrication</li> <li>Experience in plant layout and how it relates to equipment design</li> <li>Experience sizing pumps, heat exchangers, Air coolers, and compressors required</li> <li>Experience in pressure vessel and piping design is required</li> <li>ASME Section VIII and B31.3 helpful but not required</li> <li>Experience sizing pressure relief valves, control valves and piping is required</li> <li>Experience with Hysis process simulation software will be considered an asset</li> </ul> <strong>What Enerflex Offers You:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive Compensation</li> <li>Employer Paid Health and Dental Benefits</li> <li>Employee Share Purchase Program</li> <li>Employer Matched Pension Program</li> <li>Vacation and Flex Days</li> <li>Safety Focused Culture</li> <li>Incentive Programs</li> <li>Professional Development Opportunities</li> </ul> <strong>Interested:</strong> Please apply online at www.enerflex.com Careers & Training → Current Openings.</div> <div> <div> Facebook <br/>  Twitter <br/>  Print <br/>  Email <br/><br/> 0Share</div>  </div><br/>  <div> Powered by <br/> Hire Ground Software</div><br/>   <div> Technical Support for Applying Online</div> </div> 	</div>  <br/>

Title: Sr. HV Substation Engineer
Job_Description: Recognized as a leader in the EPC industry and ranked as the #2 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine for the second consecutive year , we who provide planning, design, build, and maintenance of upstream and midstream oil and gas facilities and infrastructure. With over 5,000 employees across North America, we service exploration, production, storage, and transportation of crude oil and natural gas to end users, both offshore and onshore. We bring together many different aspects including Pipeline and Facilities groups, onshore and offshore offices, and engineering services to help meet the demands of our clients. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/><br/> Senior engineer position that independently applies advanced engineering techniques and analysis within the discipline. Develops designs that require innovation and ingenuity. Work is performed with minimal supervision and has considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments. <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Carry out the responsibilities of a Lead Engineer on small to medium sized projects or Area Lead on large sized projects or provide technical support / leadership on a project. Promote workshare execution</li><li>Perform studies and develop scope of work and execution of the engineering work</li> <li>Power system studies using PSS/E, CYME, ETAP, SKM.</li><li>Power system modelling experience for the following types of studies:</li>  <ul> <li>Load Flow & Short Circuit.</li><li>Motor Starting (Synchronous and Induction).</li> <li>Grounding.</li><li>Coordination Studies.</li><li>Power Factor Correction.</li><li>Harmonic Analysis.</li><li>Stability.</li> </ul>  <li>Power system modelling using EMTP/ATP or equivalent software for:</li>  <ul> <li>TRV.</li><li>Switching Surge.</li><li>Insulation Coordination.</li><li>Pipeline Induction.</li><li>Philosophy development, settings development and logic development for high voltage transmission line and substation protection.</li><li>Substation Physical Layout/Arrangement.</li> </ul>  <li>Coordinate project electrical activities with a utility and other disciplines for their area of responsibility</li><li>Develop and maintain electrical project schedule, progress reports and cost estimates. Execute change management proces</li><li>Supervise Juniors & Intermediate electrical engineers and designers. Interface with design group to monitor and control project schedule, electrical hours and electrical cost for their area of responsibilites</li><li>Ensure consistency and integrity of electrical design throughout project and review design for logic and functionalites</li><li>Perform pre-commissioning and start-up activities for electrical systems</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering required</li><li>Minimum of 7-9 years' experience with specifications, engineering, design, construction and start-up for low and medium voltage plant distribution systems with EPC consulting firms for small to large oil & gas related projects or power plant projects is required</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills required</li><li>Experience in motors and VFD design is required</li><li>Membership with APEGA or eligible to get membership in APEGA is required</li><li>Eligibility for a Professional Engineering certification is required</li><li>Advanced MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) preferred</li> </ul> At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.

Title: Building Electrical Engineer
Job_Description: <div><div> <strong>Building Electrical Engineer</strong> <br/><br/> <em>CIMA+ is currently seeking applications for an experienced<strong> Building Electrical Engineer</strong> from qualified individuals who are interested in becoming a member of our Buildings Engineering group in Edmonton and Calgary, Alberta.</em> <br/><br/> We are looking for an individual who wants to be challenged and is ready to join a dynamic team that is rapidly expanding. CIMA+ is a well-established, employee-owned, multidisciplinary, Canadian engineering firm established in Eastern Canada that has expanded operations into Western Canada. <br/><br/> CIMA+ is proud to have reached the prestigious Best Employers in Canada’s Platinum Level, which is exclusively reserved for organizations that have achieved the best results in the Aon Hewitt survey for six consecutive years. We offer a highly competitive compensation package with excellent benefits, merit-based bonuses as well as a flexible and friendly working environment where committed individuals can thrive. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Key Responsibilities</u></strong>   <ul>  <li> Lead building electrical engineering services for commercial, institutional, educational, healthcare, government, recreational and light industrial facility projects.</li> <li> Lead a team of electrical engineers and technologists on assigned projects.</li> <li> Assist the Buildings Practice Leader with the growth and development of the electrical team.</li> <li> Be a technical resource in building electrical design, and leverage that knowledge to mentor and develop junior engineers and technologists.</li> <li> Prepare technical specifications and contract documents for bidding and construction.</li> <li> Conduct quality assurance reviews on building electrical design work completed by others.</li> <li> Keep current on new products, technologies and design processes.</li> <li> Coordinate work with architects, other engineering disciplines, and Owner representatives.</li> <li> Contribute to business development, marketing and liaising with Clients and Architects.</li> <li> Assist in determining the scope and fee for proposed engineering services.</li> <li> Lead proposal efforts for building electrical and multi-discipline project pursuits. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong></li> <li> Undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited post-secondary institution.</li> <li> Professional Engineer registered in Canada, and eligible for professional registration in Alberta.</li> <li> 10+ years of progressive experience in building electrical design.</li> <li> Experience working in a consulting engineering environment.</li> <li> Experience as electrical design lead and able to direct and oversee a team of engineers and technologists on projects.</li> <li> Experience in sizing and specifying of power distribution components and primary/secondary switchgear for medium (under 35 kV) and low (600 V and under) voltage systems.</li> <li> Experience in sizing and specifying grounding systems and lightening protection systems.</li> <li> Experience in critical power systems including generators and UPS, substations, transformers, metering, motor control and motor control centers.</li> <li> Experience in carrying out power system studies including: short circuit, arc flash, load flow, harmonics, and grounding.</li> <li> Experience in hazard classification studies and the design of intrinsically safe electrical systems.</li> <li> Experience in lighting and lighting controls design including a strong understanding of lighting concepts and terms.</li> <li> Experience in low tension system design such as fire alarm, intrusion alarm, telephone, public address, nurse-call systems, data, access control and CCTV.</li> <li> Able to articulate the electrical design requirements and oversee the progression of electrical system layouts in Autodesk® Revit and AutoCAD MEP.</li> <li> Experience in leading, coaching and mentoring staff.</li> <li> In-depth understanding of regulations, codes and standards associated with building electrical design.</li> <li> General understanding of building mechanical and building structural systems.</li> <li> Team player and independent worker.</li> <li> Professional, energetic, organized and action-oriented.</li> <li> Experience in using Microsoft office products including MS Excel and MS Word.</li> <li> Excellent English communication skills, both verbal and written.</li> <li> Experience in estimating engineering fees and schedules.</li> <li> Experience in writing engineering reports, proposals, letters and technical specifications.</li> <li> Proven success in developing business with new and existing clients, and maintaining positive relationships.</li> <li> Experience in project management and controls, with a proven record of client satisfaction and financial success.</li> <li> Experience in monitoring and adapting to industry trends and changing market conditions.</li> <li> Able to travel without restrictions.</li> <li> Willingness to engage in lifelong learning. <br/><br/> <strong>The following are considered assets:</strong>   <ul>    <li> LEED Accredited Professional (LEED AP), Fellow or Green Associate.</li> <li> Experience in Building Information Modeling (BIM).</li> <li> Experience in conducting field reviews and/or building condition assessments.</li> <li> Experience in Life Cycle Costing (LCC).</li> <li> Experience with electrical engineering software packages such as ETAP, AGI 32 or ElumTools.</li> <li> Experience on projects certified to LEED, Living Building Challenge (LBC), Passive House, and/or Green Globes.</li> </ul>  </li>   </ul>  </div> </div><div></div> <br/> Apply Now!

Title: Systems Integration Engineer
Job_Description: Due to continued growth, iSolutions Consulting is looking for a System Integration Specialist with experience in the Upstream Oil & Gas and / or Power Industries to join our team. <br/><br/> The System Integration Specialist position is an Engineering position which requires advanced knowledge in a wide range of software systems employed by iSolutions. The ideal candidate would have experience working with OSISoft PI, Aspentech IP.21 or Honeywell PHD Data historians. The System Integration Specialist is responsible for commissioning these systems, implementing process graphics, constructing data integrations to and from underlying control systems such as Emerson DeltaV or Rockwell FactoryTalk. Knowledge of high availability data historian architectures is important to this role. <br/><br/> The System Integration Specialist will be responsible for performing the duties listed below including: <br/><br/> • Plant and Corporate Historian Commissioning   <ul> <li>Plant and Corporate Historian Data Integrations</li> <li>Designing and implementing software solutions that leverage historian data</li> <li>Quality assurance/regression testing of software solutions</li> <li>System architecture design and documentation</li> <li>Conducting customer stakeholder meetings / solution walk-throughs</li> <li>Leading junior-level resources through system commissioning tasks and quality assurance procedures <br/><br/> In addition to utilizing vendor-supplied integration packages, the need will occasionally arise to write custom code for interfacing with these systems. For this reason, working experience with one or more of the following software technologies is required: <br/><br/> • ASP.Net 2.0+,</li> <li>ADO.Net</li> <li>SQL Server 2005+</li> <li>Oracle PL/SQL</li> <li>SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) <br/><br/> The position requires a Bachelors degree in Instrumentation Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Process Control Engineering, Computer Science Software or Electrical Engineering or a related field and at least 4 years relevant experience. Relevant experience with the upstream Oil and Gas and or power industries is required. <br/><br/> iSolutions services a large number of name-brand customer in the oil & gas and power domains. We offer our consultants access to interesting and challenging work assignments, performance based compensation & fast-tracked career progression for those with the drive to succeed. <br/><br/> iSolutions Inc. is a Data Management consulting company that specializes in designing, implementing and supporting real-time, historian based, reporting and integration solutions for Oil/Gas and Power Generation/Transmission companies. Our implementations allow clients to make educated, site specific production and operational decisions based on the analysis of real time data from integrated field and plant systems.</li>  </ul>

Title: Reliability Engineer
Job_Description: Our role is to provide top level technical talent to some of the planets strongest companies in the energy and technology industries, as well as the public sector. This is where you come in. We have a distinctly different approach to our contractor engagement and have a team of specialists to ensure success on your assignment. <br/> Our Calgary Downtown Energy client is seeking a Reliability Engineer to support with a push of 6-7 projects that require execution in 2018. As a Reliability Engineer, you will be responsible for analyzing SAGD oil sands operating data, maintenance history, and reliability data to identify opportunities and propose recommendations. This role will work alongside 4 other Reliability Engineers with blended experience in both Analytics and Steam who are highly collaborative, share knowledge, and driven to impact the bottom line. <br/> With standard working hours, this is a 10-month contract, based out of our clients Calgary office with some travel to Sunrise Oilsands required (once every several months). The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, focused, collaborative, and highly analytical with the ability to read, analyze, and identify data into tangible information. <br/> Job Responsibilities include:Analyze equipment performance based on operating data and maintenance history. Ensure that equipment is operating close to design parameters to identify efficiency degradation, optimize energy consumption, and minimize waste. <br/> Periodically review equipment maintenance records to identify recurring problems. Evaluate preventive (PM) and predictive (PdM) maintenance programs and recommend solutions. <br/> Review SAP data and make recommendations about the quality of data - problem description, cause and damage codes, and work description. High quality SAP data is essential to applying reliability concepts and analytics. <br/> Perform asset criticality review and validate existing FMEA to confirm relevance of the FMEA <br/> Apply engineering concepts and operational knowledge to resolve equipment performance and reliability issues. <br/><br/> Qualifications:4 to 6 years of experience with SAGD technologies and processes <br/> Knowledgeable about Defect Elimination (DE), Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) and Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA) processes <br/> Demonstrated experience with developing business cases based on reliability data <br/> Knowledgeable about the concepts of Lean Six Sigma (LSS) <br/> Good working knowledge of MS Office <br/> Proficiency within SAPs PPM module <br/> Effective interpersonal, innovation, and organizational skills <br/> Strong presentation skills; the ability to understand audiences and relay messages/goals in a way thats understood <br/><br/> Education/Experience:2 or more years of experience with conventional and/or heavy oil production, and/or refining technologies and processes <br/> P.Eng or eligibly to register as a P.Eng <br/> Experience working within reliability software such as Meridium <br/> Knowledgeable about condition monitoring technologies such as vibration, ultrasound, infrared, and lubricant analysis <br/><br/> <strong>About the Ian Martin Group:</strong> <br/> Founded by engineers to support the needs of technical organizations, the Ian Martin Group has been creating authentic connections around meaningful work since 1957. As North Americas most progressive recruitment and project-staffing firm, we specialize in engineering and IT recruiting to help organizations of all sizes hire better. The Ian Martin Group is a certified B Corporation, which means we meet comprehensive standards that measure our impact on employees, suppliers, community, and the environment. <br/> We will review applications as they are received, and we will contact candidates whose skills and experience best suit this role. <br/> <strong>EWEMI</strong>

Title: Civil Engineer - Senior Level
Job_Description: Summary <br/><br/> Barr is seeking an engineer with demonstrated experience leading, managing, and mentoring multi-discipline project teams. Project assignments may include the following: leading, managing, and executing work on public and private infrastructure projects; leading project teams in planning and/or designing major engineering projects; preparing and making presentations to clients and potential clients; successfully leading, managing, and delivering projects on time and on budget; leading the work of the project team including engineers, drafters, and designers; and coordinating with other disciplines. <br/><br/> The position also includes planning and executing business development efforts. Typical business development activities include building and maintaining client relationships, tracking marketing leads and project opportunities, developing and presenting proposals and presentations, and networking and sharing Barr’s capabilities with existing and potential clients. The work may at times involve short-term out-of-town assignments. <br/><br/> NOTE: Applicants must be able to work in locations that feature rough terrain typical of construction sites and facilities that have limited accessibility, moving machinery, and other conditions typical of industrial facilities. Assignments may involve work on waste disposal sites and sites requiring cleanup of hazardous materials. A physical exam may be required; safety training will be provided. <br/><br/> Minimum Qualifications  <ul> <li>BS in Civil Engineering or related degree</li>   <li>10 or more years of relevant work experience</li> <li>Professional member of the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) or ability to obtain membership within one year</li> <li>Flexible working style, self-initiative, self-motivation, and a willingness to work with teams to meet clients' needs and project schedules</li> <li>Demonstrated experience meeting timelines and achieving project expectations</li>   <li>Demonstrated client relationship development skills</li> <li>Conscientiousness concerning the accuracy, appropriateness, and timeliness of results</li> <li>Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills</li> <li>Demonstrated technical project leadership, management, and organizational skills</li> <li>Legal authorization to work in Canada without the need for sponsorship</li> <li>Legal authorization to work in the U.S. without the need for sponsorship</li> <li>Acceptable driving record</li> </ul> Preferred Qualifications  <ul>  <li>15 or more years of relevant work experience</li> <li>Alberta public infrastructure or transportation related work experience</li> <li>Mining infrastructure related work experience</li> <li>Demonstrated project leadership and management experience on multi-discipline project teams</li> <li>Demonstrated strong business-development skills</li> <li>Engineering consulting or related experience</li> <li>M.S. in Civil Engineering or closely-related discipline</li> <li>Familiarity with AutoCAD and Civil 3D or other CADD-based civil design software</li> <li>Knowledge and experience in related disciplines such as Geotechnical or Structural Engineering</li> </ul> Barr Engineering and Environmental Science Canada, Ltd. reserves the right to consider other legitimate, non-discriminatory factors that are not specifically listed. <br/><br/> We require proof of eligibility to work in Canada. <br/><br/> Barr Engineering Company strives to make www.barr.com accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance with completing the application process, please call 952-832-2600, or toll free at 800-632-2277. <br/><br/> Barr is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Optimization Engineer/Technican
Job_Description: Company Description<br/><br/>We are people passionate about innovative<strong>energy efficiency</strong><strong>,</strong> providing a valuable, operationally-focused energy management solution to the market, and making a contribution to a healthier planet. We are driven to improve energy performance for our customers by monitoring and managing their energy spend through the automation of their daily building systems operational activities. We do this to save our customers money, reduce their carbon footprint and make the world a better place for future generations. <br/><br/> Shift Energys Energy Optimization System [EOS] automates the real time tuning of independent energy systems for large building complexes. The worlds leading building managers are using Internet-based Big Data and low cost IoT sensors to drive down energy operational costs. <br/><br/> <strong>Shift Energy is part of the Mariner Partners group of companies</strong>, known for investing in and building technology companies with themes of big data, software innovation, commitment to customer success and developing international growth markets. In addition to Shift Energy, Mariner Partners consists of Mariner xVu, Mariner Innovations and East Valley Ventures: <ul> <li><strong><em>Mariner xVu</em></strong> is the world leader in Software Defined Monitoring for managed and unmanaged IP video, streaming and broadband/Wi-Fi networks. Our software helps operators centrally manage the complexity required to deliver new video services with real-time visibility into subscriber experience anywhere.</li><li><strong><em>East Valley</em></strong>, the start-up acceleration division of Mariner Partners, has made over 30 investments, with multiple exits, including Q1 Labs, Internet Security for Banking, sold to IBM; and Radian6, Marketing Cloud Analytics sold to SalesForce.com. The organization specializes in mentoring and providing support to entrepreneurs.</li><li><strong><em>Mariner Innovations</em></strong> is a leading provider of professional IT services, offering unique expertise in application development, information security, data management and support/maintenance services across communications, industrial, utility and the public sector</li> </ul> Founded in 2003, Mariner Partners head office is located in Saint John, New Brunswick. We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work our team and our customers are located in major cities across Canada and in North and South America and Europe. <br/><br/> <strong>Why Mariner Partners?</strong> <br/><br/> We believe in making a positive impact in the communities where we live and work our team is located in major cities all across Canada, throughout the US and internationally. We are proud to be headquartered here, and are passionate about growing a strong technology sector here in Atlantic Canada and beyond. We offer competitive compensation; benefits packages and training and development. <br/><br/> We are proud to have been recognized by <em>Progress</em> magazine as one of Atlantic Canadas TOP 101 companies, ranking #46 on 2015s list, up from #62 in 2014. <br/><br/> We recognize that empowered employees are more innovative, more efficient, deliver better customer service and can flat out-perform conventional organizations. Our people have built products for national deployments at the worlds largest TV and Internet companies and leading real estate, financial and government organizations. <br/><br/> We are looking for passionate IT professionals who are curious about data, who love solving problems for customers and who want to grow their careers. <br/><br/> <strong>Join our growing team!</strong><br/><br/>Job Description<br/><br/>Shift Energy is growing and we are looking for an Optimization Engineer/Technician to join us. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong><ul> <li>Design and develop advanced control sequences for energy saving in large buildings including venues, hospitals etc.</li><li>Implement EOS in buildings, including collecting technical documentation, determining building schedules, choosing appropriate energy saving strategies, configuring EOSs optimization logic for a particular building and writing custom code as required</li><li>Train building operators on the use of EOS. Communicate the changes that EOS will make to buildings to building operators and owners. Respond to customer complaints and concerns.</li><li>Measure the energy savings from EOS implementations.</li><li>Travel to EOS customer sites as required</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Mechanical or Electrical engineering diploma or degree</li><li>Strong grades or demonstrated aptitude for computer programming, thermodynamics, controls, and electric circuits</li><li>Building/Industrial controls familiarity HVAC, Chillers, Ice Plants, etc.</li><li>Knowledge & Experience with Java based programming (groovy scripting) considered an asset</li><li>Customer service experience preferred</li><li>Key characteristics: self-starter, customer focused, goal oriented, innovative, collaborative, analytical, problem-solver</li><li>Ability to quickly learn and understand new products and technologies</li> </ul>

Title: DCS Technologist/Engineer
Job_Description: <div>DCS Technologist/Engineer</div>  <p>True North Automation provides a wide range of fully customized, vendor-neutral industrial engineering and automation solutions to companies across Canada, throughout the United States and around the world. Our corporate mantra of "Vision, Talent and Technology" defines both who we are as a company and why you'd want to work at True North. We employ some of the most skilled and versatile people in our industry, who consistently design advanced solutions that when deployed allow our customers to have modern, reliable control and monitoring systems.</p>  <p>Fueled by the momentum of our vendor-neutral, relationship based, people-focused model, True North is poised for strong continued growth. Proud to be recognized by PROFIT Magazine on the prestigious PROFIT HOT 50 list makes us one of Canada's Top Growth Companies. True North has many compelling reasons to join our team. Not only do we provide our employees with high engagement in their work, we offer an environment that will treat you more like a friend than a numbered employee. Team building is a core value at True North, you can lace up your skates and join the company hockey team, or enjoy our annual Christmas party at Banff's Rimrock Hotel. At True North we play as hard as we work and we endeavour to include everyone.</p>  <p>Position</p>  <p>We are currently recruiting for a <strong>DCS Technologist/Engineer</strong>.</p>  <p>The ideal candidate will have the following:</p>  <ul>  <li>Minimum 5 years experience in mid to large size projects</li>  <li>Experience with SAGD facilities</li>  <li>Participate in P&ID and HAZOP, and other design reviews</li>  <li>Prepare Functional Requirements, Detail Design Specifications, and Software Test Plans</li>  <li>Participate in Alarm Rationalizations and Alarm Management reviews</li>  <li>FAT, SAT and commissioning activities.</li>  <li>Technical skills in Emerson DeltaV, Honeywell Experion, ABB 800xA or Yokogawa DCS systems</li>  <li>Configure control strategies and shutdown keys</li>  <li>Prepare and follow Control Narratives</li>  <li>Able to travel to site for commissioning and start-up activities</li>  <li>Provide team mentorship, training and coaching</li>  </ul>  <p>Please submit your cover letter and resume with "DCS Technologist/Engineer" as the subject line to careers@truenorthautomation.com</p>  <p>We thank all interested applicants, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.</p>

Title: Geotechnical Engineer - Advanced Numerical Modelling
Job_Description: <div><div>As a <strong>Geotechnical Engineer with advanced numerical modeling capability,</strong> you will be joining our close-knit Geotechnical Engineering team who are working on our strong portfolio of major water supply and hydropower dams, mine waste and tailings storage facilities, and infrastructure projects in Canada and internationally. In this role, you will collaborate with our talented professionals who are committed to delivering high quality engineering solutions to our clients. <br/><br/> KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. <br/><br/> <strong>This role will give you the opportunity to:</strong>  <ul> <li>Gain experience working on our portfolio of projects including water supply and hydropower dams, mine waste and tailings storage facilities, and geohazard risk mitigation.</li>  <li>Develop and oversee site investigations and monitoring programs, complete engineering studies, and undertake conceptual to detailed engineering designs.</li>  <li>Lead and oversee advanced 2D and 3D numerical static and dynamic modeling assignments.</li>  <li>Use your problem-solving and modeling skills to find innovative solutions to complex technical issues.</li>  <li>Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry.</li>  <li>Work in a dynamic One Team company culture that supports career development.</li>  <li>Contribute to the growth of the Resources Group and engage and mentor junior staff.</li>  <li>Build and maintain strong relationships with our Clients and our multidisciplinary project teams.</li>  <li>Travel primarily in Western Canada and potentially to our overseas project locations.</li> </ul> <strong>If you have more than five years of relevant experience and are registered or eligible to register as a Professional Engineer in Canada, and hold a</strong><strong> Masters degree or Ph.D. in geotechnical engineering with a strong emphasis on numerical modeling and analysis, preferably related to dams,</strong><strong> tailings management in the oil sands, mining, hydropower or related industries, we want to hear from you!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We value your:</strong>  <ul> <li>Working knowledge and demonstrated practical application of advanced 2D and 3D numerical static and dynamic modeling software, including FLAC, to define the problem and develop solutions.</li>  <li>Solid understanding of soil and rock characteristics and behavior.</li>  <li>Technical experience in dam engineering and tailings and mine waste engineering including liquefaction susceptibility and deformation assessments.</li>  <li>Strong initiative, innovation and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive toward long-term success.</li>  <li>Superior verbal and written communication skills including your experience in writing engineering reports and technical papers, preparing and delivering technical presentations to clients and Review Boards, and overseeing preparation of design drawings.</li>  <li>Exceptional team spirit, interpersonal skills and your ability to build long-term, successful relationships with our clients and our project teams.</li> </ul> <strong>About Us:</strong> <br/><br/> Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, geotechnical, hydropower, water resources, transportation, oil & gas, and environmental sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. <br/><br/> From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton, and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the, Mining, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Oil and Gas industry. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. <br/><br/> We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Are you up to the challenge?</em></strong> <br/><br/> If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number <strong>1331-A18</strong>. <br/><br/> We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.</div> </div><div></div>

Title: Junior System Integration (V&V) Engineer
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is staffing for an exciting opportunity to deliver a world class secure next-generation communications system for the Ministry of Defence (MoD) in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Calgary is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. Software will be developed for Windows 10 laptops, tablets and for General Dynamics developed hardware products running Linux. The project includes all phases including System Design, Software and Hardware Design, System Integration, and System Validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. <br/><br/> The systems integration and verification and validation (SI V&V, or SI) team will consist of several smaller integration teams, each focusing on integration a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Systems integration teams will work closely with the software development teams and will follow the Scrum framework for software development. As a member of a Scrum team, the successful candidates will work together to design, implement, and test software features for the product. <br/><br/> Typical Duties <br/><br/> The responsibilities and range of activities will vary depending on experience, but in general will include: <ul> <li>Work cooperatively within a Scrum team or with multiple Scrum teams to take on new integration test tasks</li><li>Perform detailed design, implementation, and test activities in order to complete Sprint tasks</li><li>Share knowledge and skills with other Scrum (development and test) team members</li><li>Development of acceptance test cases and procedures that validate hardware, firmware, software, and system functionality</li><li>Ability to review system, subsystem and product requirement specifications, interface control documents, design documents and use cases in order to develop test cases</li><li>Executing test cases in a lab environment; analyzing, interpreting and documenting results</li><li>Writing defect and test summaries and test reports to demonstrate progress and communicate this as required</li><li>Some generation and maintenance of test scripts for automated testing</li><li>Analysis and management of requirements mapping to test cases</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience <ul> <li>Some understanding of test engineering, ideally with knowledge of SAFe agile and/or iterative development methods</li><li>Demonstrate strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Demonstrate strong problem solving and an ability to conduct detail analysis leading to good conclusions</li><li>Enthusiastic contributor, willing to learn new skills, and takes pride and ownership of work</li><li>Ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision</li><li>Has a desire to learn, and ideally experience in; defining, developing and executing integration tests for communications and networking systems.</li><li>Experience investigation and working collaboratively to resolve software defects</li><li>Experience with test engineering processes and tools</li><li>Knowledge and use of requirements writing tools and test writing tools, an asset</li><li>Familiarity with radios, voice/data networks and Internet Protocols (IP), an asset</li><li>Willing to develop knowledge and skills in automated test frameworks and implemented automated integration testing</li><li>An ability to adapt quickly</li> </ul> Education <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required</li><li>Candidates with diplomas will be considered with adequate additional experience</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Site Reliability Engineer
Job_Description: The Role<br/><br/>Pason is seeking a Site Reliability Engineer to join the team in improving the reliability of Pason’s DataHub infrastructure. This role requires a combination of Linux system administration, configuration management (Ansible and Puppet) as well as scripting and automation skills to support Pason’s goals of improved uptime and disaster recovery timeframes. In addition, a solid understanding of Dev/Ops and Agile principles including Continuous Integration and Test-Driven Development in a cloud-based environment are highly valued.<br/><br/>Essential Duties and Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Ensure our cloud infrastructure is running without interruption and with proper monitoring and visibility</li> <li>Collaborate with developers to design fault-tolerant, load balanced services that can be deployed automatically to various cloud providers</li> <li>Identify and remove all manual deployment steps from existing services by moving all configuration to version control and configuration management systems</li> <li>Manage and evolve our OpenStack private cloud platform</li> <li>Improving disaster recovery timeframes and capabilities by migrating services to Ubuntu, Puppet and Amazon Web Services</li> <li>Improve system health and recovery times by improving monitoring and system visibility for all systems</li> <li>Participate in an 24/7 on-call rotation</li> </ul>  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities   <ul> <li>Experience with the following technologies: Python, Bash, OpenStack, AWS, MySQL, Linux (Ubuntu), VMWare, InfluxDB</li> <li>Experience with configuration management and version control (Puppet, SVN, Git) is highly valued</li> <li>Experience with Amazon EC2 and S3</li> <li>Experience working with load balancers</li> <li>Experience working with or on software development teams</li> <li>Organizational skills and the ability to work on multiple tasks & projects and adapt to frequent change</li> <li>Ability to work as a member of a team and independently with limited direct supervision in a self-motivated and self-directed manner</li> <li>Self-awareness, with a desire for constant self-improvement</li> <li>Strong advocate for quality on the team and motivated to deliver top quality results</li> <li>Strong problem-solving skills</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment</li> </ul>

Title: Verification & Validation Engineer
Job_Description: As Software Verification & Validation (V&V) Engineer, reporting to the V&V team lead, you will influence business success by applying your extensive engineering background and expertise in software testing strategies within a high-tech industry. Your work will impact all phases of the product development and deployment lifecycle. You will support planning activities and deliverables for ongoing release cycles; supporting an exciting new range products; carry out tasks and activities across the product verification teams located in Calgary. <ul> <li>Execute test deliverables in collaboration with multidisciplinary teams and our global customer base.</li><li>Develop validation and verification plans for Safety Critical Systems products.</li><li>Develop test specifications, test reports, test metrics and validation protocols for integration and performance testing.</li><li>Implement and document effective processes to enable robust validation and verification of software products.</li><li>Execute tests using automated and manual verification methods for both software and hardware.</li><li>Establish test case traceability to requirements and specifications.</li><li>Support testing done across the hardware, software and systems disciplines to ensure new products meet or exceed their performance and quality goals.</li><li>Collaborate with other team members to set up and execute technology demonstrations to existing and potential new customers.</li><li>Conduct occasional dynamic testing of GPS/GNSS technology.</li> </ul> <strong>Must-Have:</strong> <ul>  <li>Post-secondary degree in a technical field, preferably in Computer Science, Electrical, Computer, Software Engineering.</li> <li>Validation and Verification experience within a cross functional development team environment.</li> <li>Software test tool development experience (including use of C/C++, Python, LabView).</li> <li>5+ years of experience in a high technology manufacturing environment.</li> <li>Knowledge of GPS/GNSS technology</li> <li>Valid Driver's License</li> <li>Ability to travel approximately 10% (mostly North America, possibly international)</li>  </ul> <strong>Key Success Factors:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.</li><li>Ability to clearly communicate ideas and solutions to others.</li><li>Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.</li><li>Ability to multitask and manage multiple project paths.</li><li>Strong English language communication skills, both oral and written.</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>An understanding of real time operating systems and embedded firmware development</li> <li>Understanding of signal processing algorithms</li><li>Knowledge of, or some experience in, the automotive industry</li><li>Knowledge of ISO 26262/ASPICE PAM 3.0</li> </ul> NovAtel designs, manufactures and sells high precision OEM positioning technology. Our GNSS products and services are used in more than 60 countries around the globe to deliver precise positioning solutions in precision agriculture, defense, mapping, autonomous vehicles, survey and many other industries.

Title: Java Programmer/Developer
Job_Description: <div>As the <strong>Java</strong> <strong>Programmer</strong>, you will lead the development of application systems by translating business requirements into effective technology solutions. You serve as the senior development expert for application development projects, reporting to the Project Manager.<p></p> <p>- Manages development of assigned application projects – in this case eCommerce and mobile!</p> <p>- Provides technical expertise in the identification, evaluation and development of cost effective and efficient applications.<br> - Designs and develops application architecture & technical specifications, and helps define infrastructure requirements.<br> - Works with the business analysts to translate presentation formats into user interfaces, web interfaces, reports and forms.<br> - Performs unit testing.</p> <p>- Provides hands-on development and support for critical business applications.<br> - Serves as escalation contact for application system problems or outages.<br> - Makes recommendations and implements solutions to eliminate future production problems and service outages.<br> - Performs configuration and implementation of vendor supplied application software.<br> - Works with the infrastructure team to identify and correct application performance issues.</p> <p>We value your…</p> <p>- 3+ years of experience writing <strong>Java</strong>-based websites.<br> - Experience using WebSphere or Sterling Applications.<br> - In-depth knowledge of systems development methodologies, database systems and development techniques.<br> - Strong interpersonal skills to communicate technical and design strategies to developers<br> - Strong problem solving and analysis skills.</p></div>

Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, is staffing for an exciting opportunity to deliver a world class secure next-generation communications system for the Ministry of Defence (MoD) in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Calgary is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. The project includes all phases including System Design, Software and Hardware Design, System Integration, and System Validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. <br/><br/> The systems integration and verification and validation team will consist of several smaller integration teams, each focusing on integration a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Systems integration teams will work closely with the software development teams and will follow the Scrum framework for software development. As a member of a Scrum team, the successful candidates will work together to design, implement, and test software features for the product. <br/><br/> Typical Duties <br/><br/> The responsibilities and range of activities will vary, but in general will include: <ul> <li>Continually refine Sprint backlog into smaller tasks</li><li>Work cooperatively with the Scrum team to take on new tasks</li><li>Perform detailed design, implementation, and unit testing activities in order to complete Sprint tasks</li><li>Ensure completed tasks meet the Definition of Done and the Acceptance Criteria</li><li>Share knowledge and skills with other Scrum (development and test) team members</li><li>Participate in the refinement of the Product Backlog</li><li>Review of system, subsystem and product requirement specifications, interface control documents, design documents and use cases</li><li>Development of feature acceptance test cases and procedures that validate hardware, firmware, software, and these together</li><li>Executing test cases in a lab environment; STP, OSPF, RIP, BGP, TCP, UDP, CFP, IGMP, ICMP, 802.1q, VLAN), an asset</li><li>Exposure to automated testing (eg. powershell / bash / python / robot framework), an asset</li><li>Previous work with Linux system level services (DNS, DHCP, Email) and Linux networking, an asset</li><li>Understanding of web app development (websockets, RESTful web services, selenium), an asset</li> </ul> Education <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required. Title: Dynamics AX Developer
Job_Description: <div><div><strong> <br/> Dynamics AX Developer</strong><br/>  <div> <div> Job Category <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Developer</strong> </div><br/>  <div> Job Location <br/><br/> <strong> <br/> Calgary, AB</strong> </div><br/>  <div> Last Updated <br/><br/> <strong>15/05/18 3:33 PM</strong> </div> </div> </div>  <br/>Apply Now</div><br/>  <div><strong>Dynamics AX Developer</strong> <br/> <strong>Reference No. 1533</strong> <br/><br/> The AX Developer will be responsible for the design and development of modifications or extensions to standard Dynamics AX as well unit testing and the creation of supporting documentation. AX implementation</li>  <li>Work closely with the functional consultants in converting business requirements into Dynamics AX solutions</li>  <li>Build technical solutions using modern development network and hardware support staff and business users</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications & Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years' experience in full lifecycle Dynamics AX implementation</li>  <li>3+ years' experience in customizing Dynamics AX 2012</li>  <li>Ability to understand, communicate, and interpret client business processes and requirements.</li>  <li>Experience in designing, diagrams, and flow data charts.</li> </ul> <strong>The Ideal Candidate</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience with and/or training on Dynamics AX7</li>  <li>Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of an organization.</li>  <li>Ability to establish priorities, work independently and proceed with objectives with little supervision</li> </ul> _______________________ <br/> <strong>Who we Title: Senior Oracle PL/SQL and Oracle Developer

We invite you to review the position requirements below and apply today if your skills match our need.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities include:</strong></p> <p>Ensures the quality of software products delivered to customers (software performs to specifications, software has been thoroughly tested)</p> <p>Follows required corporate processes and policies.</p> <p>Creates system documentation</p> <p>Appropriately documents code</p> <p>Creates and executes test plans</p> <p>Translates functional designs into technical designs</p> <p>Creates or contributes to project estimates</p> <p>Completes projects on time</p> <p>Creates and manages software release schedules</p> <p>Ensures appropriate source code versioning and control</p> <p>Creates, maintains and supports development tools</p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Technical Skills Required:</strong></p> <p>Smart Plant Materials</p> <p>PL/SQL</p> <p>Oracle</p> <p>TOAD</p> <p>Please forward your resume at <strong><em>hrca@datasourcesystems.com.</em></strong></p>

Title: Site Reliability Engineering - Junior
Job_Description: <div> <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><br/>  <div>Replicon's Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team has a focus on automating the smooth operation of Replicon's Cloud Platform. We strive to accomplish projects such as fully automating a continuous delivery process, building highly resilient infrastructure components, and introducing & practicing Chaos Engineering.</div><br/>  <div>Junior SRE team members are software developers who love automating work, rather than doing tedious work themselves. They're deeply interested in the infrastructure upon which a complex system runs, rather than just building software features. They are expected to learn quickly, bring new ideas and concepts into the team, and always look for a solution rather than focusing on a problem. They are heavily supported by our amazing senior team members.</div><br/>  <div><strong>What responsibilities does the SRE team have?</strong></div>   <ul>  	<li>Implement new infrastructure systems to provide new operational and business capabilities supporting our platform and product</li> <li>Remove impediments in the engineering processes to support high frequency, low risk software deployments</li> <li>Promotes an environment of continuous improvement throughout the engineering organization</li> <li>Ensures that production and pre-production systems are strongly secured</li> <li>Optimizes the costs of running our cloud platform on AWS</li> <li>Participates in the on-call rotation to triage critical production incidents, reduce incident severity, and document incident in detail for product team follow-up</li> </ul>  <div><strong>What does your day-to-day work in this role look like?</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>Work in a small scrum team of about six colleagues to:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Understand high-level requirements for new systems and capabilities</li> <li>Break down work into manageable tasks, using a combination of technical design documentation and Jira for task tracking</li> <li>Implement new systems, which is primarily a mix of node.js coding, Terraform infrastructure-as-code, bash or PowerShell scripting, and occasionally some C#</li> <li>Give and receive code reviews, working with colleagues to ensure the highest quality work is accomplished</li> </ul>  <div><strong>In addition to this routine work, you'll often have to:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Participate in retrospectives and post-incident reviews to figure out how the team, department, and organization can improve</li> <li>Provide support, incident resolution, and code reviews for other teams</li> <li>Perform on-call drills and training exercises to sharpen skills in incident management and resolution</li> </ul>  <div><strong>What qualifications should you have?</strong></div>   <ul>  	<li>You are eager to learn new technologies and systems, and can grasp new concepts very quickly</li> <li>You are able to mentally leap between different technology platforms and environments smoothly</li> <li>You have worked hands-on performing software development on a web application; preference to experience with node.js or C# platforms</li> <li>You are familiar with systems design and architecture in a large-scale web application (multi-tier, microservices, load balancing)</li> <li>You have knowledge or experience working with cloud platforms (preference: AWS)</li> <li>You're always uncomfortable when working in a project without a version control system in-place (preference: git)</li> <li>You've worked with database systems (preference: PostgreSQL)</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
