Title: PLC / DCS Engineers / Technologists All Levels
Job_Description: <div>PLC / DCS Engineers / Technologists All Levels</div>  <p>True North Automation provides a wide range of fully customized, vendor-neutral industrial engineering and automation solutions to companies across Canada, throughout the United States and around the world. Our corporate mantra of "Vision, Talent and Technology" defines both who we are as a company and why you'd want to work at True North. We employ some of the most skilled and versatile people in our industry, who consistently design advanced solutions that when deployed allow our customers to have modern, reliable control and monitoring systems.</p>  <p>Fueled by the momentum of our vendor-neutral, relationship based, people-focused model, True North is poised for strong continued growth. Proud to be recognized by PROFIT Magazine on the prestigious PROFIT HOT 50 list makes us one of Canada's Top Growth Companies. True North has many compelling reasons to join our team. Not only do we provide our employees with high engagement in their work, we offer an environment that will treat you more like a friend than a numbered employee. Team building is a core value at True North, you can lace up your skates and join the company hockey team, or enjoy our annual Christmas party at Banff's Rimrock Hotel. At True North we play as hard as we work and we endeavour to include everyone.</p>  <p>Position</p>  <p>We are currently recruiting for <strong>PLC and DCS Engineers / Technologists</strong>. This challenging opportunity is to be an integral part of our controls and automation team. The successful candidate will be responsible for specification, configuration and commissioning of PLC and DCS systems.</p>  <p>Main Responsibilities</p>  <ul>  <li>Design and configuration of PLC and DCS systems.</li>  <li>Manage scope, schedule and budget on projects.</li>  <li>Participate in P&ID, HAZOP and other design reviews.</li>  <li>Provide high quality written documentation and engineering work packages.</li>  <li>Perform ongoing maintenance and support on previous projects.</li>  <li>Commissioning, testing and troubleshooting remotely and on-site.</li>  <li>Maintain 100% customer satisfaction.</li>  </ul>  <p>Qualifications</p>  <ul>  <li>Bachelors in Engineering or Diploma in Technology in a related field.</li>  <li>PLC Experience with one of the following: Rockwell, Schnieder / Modicon, GE and Siemens or others.</li>  <li>DCS Experience with one of the following: ABB, Honeywell Experion, DeltaV or others.</li>  <li>Communication Experience with one of the following: DeviceNet, Modbus, Profibus, FFieldbus or others.</li>  <li>Strong software computer proficiencies: MS Office,SQL, VBScript, Access an asset.</li>  <li>Able to adapt to various situations quickly, while adhering to daily deadlines.</li>  <li>Superb communication written and spoken.</li>  <li>Availability to Travel approximately 20% of the time with a valid driver's license.</li>  <li>Experience in Oil / Gas, Manufacturing, Mining, Forestry, Waste Water, Water, Food and Beverage.</li>  </ul>  <p>Please submit your cover letter and resume with "PLC / DCS Engineers / Technologists" as the subject line to careers@truenorthautomation.com</p>  <p>We thank all interested applicants, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.</p>

Title: Senior Systems Engineer - Traction Power - AMENDMENT
Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div> <div><strong>As the Senior Systems Engineer, you will report to the Rail Systems Coordinator who has the overall responsibility for engineering, operation and maintenance of the electrical aspect of the Rail Systems, including traction power, signals & communications, and control systems. As a Department ID (DeptID) Owner, you will also be responsible and accountable for the operating budget for all maintenance service contracts (approximate annual contract values are over $5 million). Major duties include:</strong></div><ul>	<li>	<div>Prepare and control engineering safety standards, specifications, design guidelines, procedures and practices to be used in the construction and maintenance of traction power systems for the Light Rail Transit (LRT) system. The process involves liaising with regulatory agencies, contractors, industrial associations and City business units.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Build and lead a team of technical professionals to deliver traction power design, maintenance, and construction engineering support for transit projects.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Provide technical support and advice to project engineers in Transit Capital Construction, Rail Systems and Engineering Support groups. Present Transit’s interests and concerns on maintenance and operational issues.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Assist in the selection process of consultants and contractors carrying out traction power design and construction.</div></li>	</ul></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Qualifications</strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>An Electrical Engineering degree, and current licensure as Professional Engineer with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA), or licensure by the first day of work.</div></li>		<li>	<div>A minimum of 8 years of directly related experience, including working knowledge in traction power systems design standards, is required.</div></li>		<li>	<div>You demonstrate sound knowledge of the principles, theories, concepts and practices of system engineering. This must include the application of principles related to conceptual design, requirements definition, design, testing, and project management.</div> </li>		 <li> <div><strong>Success in this role requires:</strong></div><ul> <li> <div>Expert analytical thinking and problem-solving skills to breakdown complex system problems and develop recommendations.</div></li>  <li> <div>Solid interpersonal and communication skills to build trust by consulting and liaising with others.</div></li>  <li> <div>The ability to apply a team approach as needed to achieve solutions on moderately complex technical issues.</div></li> </ul>	</li> </ul>  <div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Pre-employment Requirements</strong> </strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></div><div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.</div></li>	</ul></div> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div> <div> <div>Union: Exempt</div>  <div>Business Unit: Calgary Transit</div> </div> <div> <div>Position Type: Permanent</div> <div>Location: 1417C 33 Street S.W.</div></div> <div> <div>Compensation: Engineer Level F $88,307 - 148,777 per annum</div> <div>Days of Work: This position typically works a 5 day</div> <div>work week, earning 1 day off in each 3 week cycle.</div></div> <div> <div>Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week</div></div> <div> <div>Audience: Internal/External</div> <div>Apply By: May 24, 2018</div></div> <div> <div>Amendment: Closing Date</div>  <div>Job ID #: 300727</div></div> </div> <div>About our organization</div> </div> </div> </div></div>

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job_Description: Showpass is a ticketing and event management software company. We empower venue and event organizers to create a rich, connected experience for their customers through next-generation technology. We combine cutting-edge software and hardware for seamless on- and offline sales, while delivering event management tools on the same integrated platform. <br/><br/> <strong><em>But what makes us different?</em></strong> <br/><br/> Showpass offers a unique platform for collaboration between the key groups that power events. From venues, to organizers, to street teams, to event attendees, we are focused on bringing people together through the magic of live events. We also happen to be powered by a very talented team fostering innovation, creativity and disruption. These pillars support the Showpass culture which is built on a love for events, and all things food. That’s what makes us the fastest growing Canadian ticketing company. <br/><br/> <strong>THE ROLE:</strong> Full Stack Developer (full-time permanent role) <br/><br/> T<strong>HE LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> <strong>THE PERKS:</strong>   <ul>   <li>A unique and fun place to work – flexible hours and vacation policy, in-house chef, fully stocked snack and fresh pressed juice bar, gym membership, dog-friendly office and parking</li> <li>Competitive compensation and benefits package</li>  </ul>  <strong>THE RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>   <ul>   <li>Work with developers and designers to make exciting new features and elegant pages</li> <li>Learn new technologies, frameworks and concepts in a short period of time</li> <li>Assist production deployment and provide post-production support and troubleshooting</li> <li>Participate in routine standups, code reviews and testing parties</li> <li>Write clean code in a testable, reliable and sustainable way</li> </ul>  <strong>THE QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>   <ul>   <li>Post secondary education in engineering or computer science would be an asset</li> <li>Minimum 1 year experience working in a technology or software company</li> <li>Must have experience working with the following technologies: Python, Django or similar (Flask, Rails, Node.js, Go), Git, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Docker, Kubernetes, Fabric, Chef or other infrastructure automation tools, AngularJS or similar frontend frameworks (Backbone, Ember, Polymer)</li> <li>Strong testing and debugging skills</li> <li>Must work great in a team and also as an individual contributor</li> <li>Ability to champion new ideas and develop creative approaches</li> <li>Analytical thinker with the ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment</li> <li>Must have the hustle and drive to take initiative and make things happen!</li> </ul>  <strong>NOTE: We will only contact qualified candidates of interest.</strong>

Title: Instrumentation & Automation Engineer
Job_Description: Category : Engineering<br>Location/City : AB - Calgary<br><br>Athenian Group is a full-service placement agency providing Professional Technical Recruitment, Staffing and Payroll services to Canadaâ?'s top Consulting, Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction companies.Our focus is on providing businesses with the highest quality of worker for both contract and permanent staff positions.Our client, is a leading Engineering, Procurement, Construction Company with expertise in oil sands, refining, petrochemicals and pipeline segments and covers both operational and engineering aspectsCurrently we are recruiting for a Calgary based;INSTRUMENTATION & AUTOMATION ENGINEERThe Instrumentation & Automation Engineer, is accountable to provide control system technical support to Automation, Process Engineering, Operations, Reliability and other stakeholders in Energy & Utilities area.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES	Program and maintain existing process control systems, specifically Experion PKS, Honeywell TPS/TDC 3000, Emerson DeltaV, Allen Bradley PLC, Triconex SIS, Moore Quadlog SIS/BMS etc...	Ensure the timely resolution of technical issues, technical requests for information and the support for process control and application related problems	Provide Commissioning & Start Up (C&SU) support to sustaining projects	Apply continuous improvement techniques to optimize control systems reliability and performance	Develop, manage and sustain control system performance related to Key Performance Indicators (KPI's)	Apply Corporate and industry standards such as Instrument Society of America (ISA), International Electrical Code(IEC), Canadian Standards Association (CSA), etc. in the execution of work	Support Incident Learning and Prevention (ILP) and Management Of Change (MOC) processes	Develop and or support automation best practices/standards/guidelinesEDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:	Degree in a related engineering discipline such as Electrical, Computer, Computer Process Control or Instrumentation is required	Professional Engineering status from APEGA or eligible to receive it within one year	Hands on experience of Basic Process Control System (BPCS), PLC and Safety Systems - hardware and software configuration	Experience with Honeywell Experion PKS/ TPS/TDC3000 System, Emerson DeltaV System, Triconex SIS, Moore Quadlog SIS GE Mark V/VI and Allen Bradley PLCs is an asset	Experience in installing, troubleshooting and maintaining communications between various control systems using industrial communication protocols like Object linking and embedding process control (OPC) and Modbus is an asset	Experience in maintenance/construction and commissioning/operations support would be an asset	Prior experience within Oil sands Extraction, Upgrading, Refineries, Petro Chemicals, boilers and other Utilities industriesSKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:	Knowledge of digital buses like Profibus, DeviceNet, Foundation Fieldbus would be an asset	Knowledge of Regulatory and Discrete controls, including motor control, valve control and other regulatory controls	Knowledge of the preparation and review of control deliverables, such as Control narratives, logic diagrams, Cause/Effect diagram, Wiring diagrams, etc.	Knowledge of networks, switches, fiber back-bone and other control system infrastructures, including process control network security	Self-motivated with excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skillsIf you or someone you know is interested in this position please contact;Jason Wahljason@atheniangroup.caEdmonton â 780-499-5959Calgary â 403-969-9962North America â 877-596-5522<br><br>

Title: Senior Software Developer - FGL Sports - Calgary, AB
Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the digital evolution of retail in Canada? <br/><br/> Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. <br/><br/> As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies as a Senior Software Developer at Canada’s premier sporting goods retailer, FGL. FGL owns the most recognizable sporting goods brands in the country including Sport Chek, Sports Experts, National Sports, Pro Hockey Life and Atmosphere. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do</strong> <br/><br/> In this role, you will be expected to: <br/><br/> Collaborate actively with the business analyst (BA) in the design of: <ul> <li>Fully integrated systems, which may include applications, databases, and related systems</li><li>Alternative solutions to existing applications</li><li>Effective and efficient interfaces to systems, applications, and databases</li><li>Conduct feasibility studies, proof-of-concept prototypes</li><li>Provide high-level development during the initial stages of a project</li><li>Provide & meet estimated time of accomplishment for assigned tasks</li><li>Evaluate and enhance the efficiency of existing programs, anticipating future user needs</li><li>Ensure system integrity, efficiency, and security</li><li>Provide and supervise unit, integrated, and volume testing</li><li>Maintain and support assigned systems to ensure minimal downtime and loss of productivity, service</li><li>Maintain and support associated databases, models, and technical documentation</li><li>Lead a small team of developers to achieve the above goals</li> </ul> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a high performing individual who: <ul> <li>Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit, a bias for action, and a desire to work with key stakeholders to drive innovation in the retail environment and in-store e-commerce;</li><li>Is direct and truthful, and builds trust and credibility with co-workers, vendors, and customers by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values</li><li>Demonstrates a desire to help and is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs</li><li>Is committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives, and working collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objective</li><li>Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups</li><li>Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused</li><li>Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation</li><li>If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then FGL Sports is definitely the place to be</li> </ul> <strong>What you’ve done</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum 10 years of experience as a developer</li><li>5 years working experience designing and building applications using Java</li><li>Fundamental understanding of Java design concepts and design patterns</li><li>Strong understanding of the J2EE ecosystem including proven experience with Application Servers (Apache Tomcat) and standard Java technologies such as JNDI, JMS, JMX, and the Spring Framework</li><li>Experience with the MEAN stack (MongoDB/MariaDB, Express, Angular, Node.js)</li><li>Experience building and debugging client/server Internet systems and architecture</li><li>Strong understanding of Git</li>  <ul> <li>Solid knowledge of at least one SQL programming environment</li><li>SQL Server 2005-2012</li><li>Oracle 9i-12c</li><li>MariaDB or MySQL 10</li> </ul>  <li>Experience in native Android application development</li>  <ul> <li>Android Studio, Gradle, Maven</li><li>User Interfaces Layouts</li><li>SQLite</li> </ul>  <li>Local Services, External Services, Content Providers, Account Manager Integration Spring Mobile, Corodva (nice to have)</li><li>Proficient understanding of Linux operating systems (RHEL 6.x, 7.x) and development environments</li><li>Understanding of security, encryption, and compression best practice</li><li>Experience developing and deploying to at least one cloud platform</li>  <ul> <li>AWS</li><li>Azure</li><li>Google Cloud</li><li>Kubernetes/Docker</li> </ul>  <li>Experience with DevOps environments</li><li>Bamboo, Jenkins, Ansible</li>  </ul> <strong>Why us</strong> <br/><br/> Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and the commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat. <br/><br/> To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn. <br/><br/> FGL Sports is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Title: SAP ABAP Developer
Job_Description: <p>We are looking for Sr. SAP ABAB Developer with following skill set: <strong>SAP</strong> ECC 6.0, ABAP, ABAP Objects, ALE/IDOCS, BAPI, Interfaces, Enhancements (BADI’s/User Exits), Conversions, Reports, Dialog Programs, ALV • Programming using classic ABAP techniques to support interfaces, reports, enhancements, and conversions; as well as have skill in developing in one of the newer facets of the <strong>SAP</strong> development tools like WebDynpro, Document Builder, Adobe Interactive Forms • Effective Programming and/or Performance tuning Activities. • Logical and analytical skills, requirements gathering and analysis, at least 1-2 full lifecycle implementation experience • Strong communication skills • Minimum of 4 years in <strong>SAP</strong> Development, including full lifecycle implementation work experience Web Dynpro, <strong>SAP</strong> Visual Composer, <strong>SAP</strong> Smart Forms, Adobe Interactive Forms, Document Builder, EDI, UNIX, Middleware • Knowledge of PCM, PBF, BW, Business Objects, BWA.</p>

Title: Engineering Branch Manager
Job_Description: Description <br/>  <br/> At Williams Engineering we realize that having the right people is paramount to our ability to provide exceptional service to our clients. As our people are the most important part of our business; we make sure they are provided with fair compensation, training, advancement opportunities, in a positive team environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Purpose:</strong> Responsible for providing strategic direction to the branch, cross-discipline marketing and business development, and developing a strong team of engineers and technologists to support the ongoing growth of the organization. <br/><br/> This role serves as an integral link between the Regional Director and the Engineering Director by providing both inter-disciplinary coordination and client leadership at the branch level. <br/><br/> <strong>Specific Responsibilities Include:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Service Line Accountabilities – Workload Management and Engineering Quality</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Regional Accountabilities - Client Relationships and Operational Management</strong> <br/><br/> With advice from the Team Lead(s), forecast workload for staffing targets and participate in recruitment and termination of staff. <br/><br/> Lead the preparation of proposals for major projects. <br/><br/> Manage cost and time components of each discipline to ensure profitability. <br/><br/> Working with the Regional Director to support the development of lasting relationships with clients. <br/><br/> Overseeing the design process provide effective options and solutions to design problems, and ensuring quality engineering. <br/><br/> Prepare and maintain business plans for the branch that are in alignment with the company and service line business and strategic plan objectives. <br/><br/> In conjunction with the Branch Administrator, Team Leads, and other WEC managers develop standards and procedures for, quality, efficiency, safety, cost reduction, client service and ensure they are followed by your branch. <br/><br/> Coordinate branch workload with other branches as necessary to optimize performance of each service line. <br/><br/> Contribute to, and coordinate with, marketing and business development initiatives that cross regional and geographic boundaries. <br/><br/> Communicate effectively with clients to identify needs and evaluate alternative solutions. <br/><br/> Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships. <br/><br/> Manage, motivate, train, mentor, and discipline direct reports according to company policies and guidelines. <br/><br/> Develop direct reports’ Career Paths and provide performance appraisals, with input from the Regional Director. <br/><br/> Employees are required to adhere to the company and client safety policies and practices in effect at any given time. <br/>  <br/> <strong>Education</strong>   <ul>   <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or diploma in Engineering Technology.</li> </ul>  <strong>Qualifications</strong>   <ul>   <li>12+ years’ experience in Consulting Engineering or related field.</li> <li>Experience in a leadership, supervisory or mentorship role.</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills; a person who listens well, respects diversity of opinions and has an open, clear and succinct communication style.</li> <li>Strong presentation and project management skills.</li> <li>The ability to recognize and accurately define problems and solutions by collecting data and establishing facts to draw valid conclusions.</li> <li>A results oriented and decisive individual with the ability to delegate effectively.</li> <li>A people oriented leader with a reputation for successfully attracting, mentoring and motivating a team.</li> <li>Understand the principles of sustainable infrastructure and apply them when involved with projects, as well as business development</li> <li>Effective organizational and time management skills in handling multiple priorities, performing a variety of tasks, and meeting required deadlines.</li> <li>Strong contacts in the engineering community and a persuasive presentation and communication style.</li> <li>Experience and good judgement to plan and accomplish ambitious but achievable goals.</li> <li>Ability to represent the company to the staff, clients and community by ensuring the best image is presented.</li> <li>Understands basic revenue models, P/L, and cost-to-completion projections and makes decisions accordingly.</li>   <li>Understands our pricing model and billing procedures.</li>   <li>Ability to facilitate team and client meetings effectively.</li>   <li>Possesses strong understanding in the area of at least one engineering discipline.</li>   <li>Application knowledge of WEC systems and programs (including Gnosis, Vision, Career Path, Office 365, Newforma, Planifi, Octiv, MS Dynamics, discipline specific drafting/design software, etc.)</li></ul>

Title: SCADA Engineer / Technologist All Levels
Job_Description: <div>SCADA Engineer / Technologist All Levels</div>  <p>True North Automation provides a wide range of fully customized, vendor-neutral industrial engineering and automation solutions to companies across Canada, throughout the United States and around the world. Our corporate mantra of "Vision, Talent and Technology" defines both who we are as a company and why you'd want to work at True North. We employ some of the most skilled and versatile people in our industry, who consistently design advanced solutions that when deployed allow our customers to have modern, reliable control and monitoring systems.</p>  <p>Fueled by the momentum of our vendor-neutral, relationship based, people-focused model, True North is poised for strong continued growth. Proud to be recognized by PROFIT Magazine on the prestigious PROFIT HOT 50 list makes us one of Canada's Top Growth Companies. True North has many compelling reasons to join our team. Not only do we provide our employees with high engagement in their work, we offer an environment that will treat you more like a friend than a numbered employee. Team building is a core value at True North, you can lace up your skates and join the company hockey team, or enjoy our annual Christmas party at Banff's Rimrock Hotel. At True North we play as hard as we work and we endeavour to include everyone.</p>  <p>Position</p>  <p>We are currently recruiting for a <strong>SCADA Engineer / Technologist</strong>. This challenging opportunity is to be an integral part of our SCADA project team. The successful candidate will be responsible for specification, configuration and commissioning of SCADA systems.</p>  <p>Main Responsibilities</p>  <ul>  <li>Design and configuration of complete SCADA systems from the RTU's to the Host.</li>  <li>Manage project scope, schedule and budget on projects.</li>  <li>Perform ongoing maintenance and support on previous projects.</li>  <li>Commissioning, testing and troubleshooting remotely and on-site.</li>  <li>Maintain 100% customer satisfaction.</li>  </ul>  <p>Qualifications</p>  <ul>  <li>Bachelors in Engineering or a Diploma in Technology in a related field.</li>  <li>Experience with one or more of the following: FactoryLink, ClearSCADA, PcView, CygNet, Factory Talk, SCADAvantage</li>  <li>Experience with one or more of the following: SCADAPack's, Fisher ROC's, Bristol's, ABB Totalflow's.</li>  <li>Experience in all types of communications and networking: MDS, Freewave and others an asset.</li>  <li>Strong software computer proficiencies: MS Office, SQL, VBScript, Access.</li>  <li>Superb written and spoken communication skills.</li>  <li>Able to adapt to various situations quickly, while adhering to daily deadlines.</li>  <li>Availability to Travel approximately 20% of the time and a valid driver's license.</li>  <li>Experience in Oil/Gas, Manufacturing, Mining, Forestry, Waste Water, Water, Food and Beverage an asset.</li>  </ul>  <p>Please submit your cover letter and resume with "SCADA Engineer / Technologist" as the subject line to careers@truenorthautomation.com</p>  <p>We thank all interested applicants, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.</p>

Title: Systems Developer
Job_Description: <P><B>Summary:</B></P> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <DIV>Reporting to the Manager of IT, within Information Technology, the Systems Developer (located in Calgary, Alberta) will be responsible for the outstanding coding of the AX2012 Global HR module and associated integrations at Ensign. This position requires a creative person who is an exciting team player, with a strong technical background, and excellent verbal and written communications skills. Candidates must be able to analyze system design, address quality assurance, question issues, and work through problems on a day to day basis.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>Position Responsibilities:</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Designing, building, testing and maintaining the various applications, and customizations in the Dynamics AX2012 modules, as well as the integration between the various applications and Dynamics AX2012;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Building the Benefits module in AX2012; the benefits integration from AX2012 to Avanti (Canadian payroll system); the integration from AX2012 to Meridian (Australia payroll system); and any other development requirements for the Global HRMS AX2012;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Working closely with IT Business Analysts and the HRIS and Compensation Analyst to determine if business and functional requirements are met;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Working with project managers to determine schedules and estimates;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Preparing technical documentation;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Providing technical support and problem resolution expertise.</DIV></LI></UL> <P> <DIV><B>Note: </B></DIV> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <DIV>Some travel may be required.</DIV> <DIV>This is a 12 month temporary contract.</DIV> <P></P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Mathematics or Engineering discipline or equivalent experience;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>5 – 7 years development experience in the object oriented language of C#, with a focus on integration;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Expertise in Microsoft Dynamics AX2012;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Understanding of ERP systems and the ability to learn quickly;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with Microsoft integration and reporting technologies SSIS, SSRS, OBI and/or Business objects, SQL and OLAP; </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with unit testing frameworks such as NUnit would be an asset;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Proven technical ability supported by strong analytical and problem solving skills;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to work effectively as part of a team as well as independently in a self-directed mode;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong interpersonal and communication skills;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>The ability to work well in a fast paced environment through exceptional time management skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritize duties;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Oilfield experience, specifically in the Energy Services sector, would be an asset.</DIV></LI></UL>

Title: Geotechnical / Civil Engineer
Job_Description: <div><div>As a <strong>Geotechnical / Civil Engineer</strong>, you will be joining our close-knit Geotechnical/Civil Engineering team working on world-class mining projects which are at the leading edge of emerging technologies in the industry. In this role, you will collaborate with our talented professionals who are committed to delivering high quality engineering solutions to our clients. <br/><br/> KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada, United States and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and Saskatchewan and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. <br/><br/> <strong>This role will give you the opportunity to:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work on a variety of projects including tailings dam design, mine and tailings planning support, mine pit slope design, embankment dams and earthworks design, site characterization, geohazard risk assessment and control, terrain analysis, slope stability assessments, seepage analyses, numerical modeling, and foundation design.</li>  <li>Lead project designs including the preparation of technical reports and the development of construction drawings and tender packages.</li>  <li>Build and develop strong relationships with our Clients, our multidisciplinary project teams, sub-contractors and other project stakeholders.</li>  <li>Use your problem-solving skills to find innovative solutions to technical issues.</li>  <li>Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry.</li>  <li>Work in a dynamic One Team company culture that supports career development.</li>  <li>Contribute to the growth of the Resources Group and engage and mentor junior staff.</li>  <li>Travel primarily in Western Canada and potentially to our overseas project locations.</li> </ul> <strong>If you are registered or eligible to register as a Professional Engineer in Canada, have a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Geotechnical or Civil Engineering and a minimum of 6 years of related tailings and dam engineering experience in mining, we want to hear from you!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We value your:</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong initiative and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive towards achieving long-term success.</li>  <li>Demonstrated leadership, project management, decision-making and coaching skills, especially your ability to engage, train and mentor young professionals.</li>  <li>Flexibility, adaptability and willingness to travel and passion for learning.</li>  <li>Ability to work in a performance focused, collaborative team environment.</li>  <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills including your experience in writing technical reports and preparing tender documents.</li>  <li>Experience in various design software, such as Slope/W or Seep/W.</li>  <li>Experience with 2D and 3D numerical modeling programs relating to slope stability and deformation analysis such as Clara or FLAC.</li>  <li>Ability to execute projects to meet Client requirements.</li>  <li>Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to build long-term, successful relationships with our clients.</li>  <li>Strong business acumen.</li> </ul> <strong>About Us:</strong> <br/><br/> Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, geotechnical, hydropower, water resources, transportation, oil & gas, and environmental sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. <br/><br/> From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton, and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the, Mining, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Oil and Gas industry. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. <br/><br/> We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Are you up to the challenge?</em></strong> <br/><br/> If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number 1324-A18. <br/><br/> We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.</div> </div><div></div>

Title: Vertica Presales Engineer - Big Data Products
Job_Description: Vertica Presales Engineer - Big Data Products, Canada<br/><br/><strong>Job Description:</strong> <br/><br/> PRESALES ENGINEER, BIG DATA PRODUCTS <br/><br/> Micro Focus <br/><br/> Toronto, Ontario, Canada or other Canadian locations <br/><br/> Discover the new Micro Focus – now the world’s 7th largest pure-play software company. By combining HPE Software and Micro Focus offerings, we have built a brand new company with a stronger, bigger portfolio that delivers customer-centered innovation. We are now uniquely positioned to help enterprise customers solve their most pressing business problems and operate in the Hybrid environment—from mainframe to mobile to cloud. <br/><br/> Our portfolio spans the following areas: <br/><br/> <strong>DevOps | IT Operations| Cloud | Security | Information Governance | Big Data, Machine Learning, and Analytics</strong> <br/><br/> Take charge of your future and join our dynamic, motivated sales team as we go to market with a best-in-class portfolio that will help shape the world’s software landscape. <br/><br/> #discoverthenew <br/><br/> <strong>Are you a data rockstar?</strong>  Do you want to work with the world's best data analytics platform founded by Turing Award winner Dr. Michael Stonebraker with customers such as Uber, AT&T, Cerner, Dreamworks, and Intuit? <br/><br/> Join our sales engineering team responsible for breaking down the technical barriers for adopting the Vertica platform and focused on being the trusted adviser to our customers. <br/><br/> You are a self-starter and a go-getter. <br/><br/> You love solving challenging data, analytics, or machine learning problems in an extremely demanding customer facing position. <br/><br/> You will partner with a world class sales and engineering team and make an immediate impact. <br/><br/> You will be a hands-on customer facing technologist and not just be slinging slideware. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> - Communicate and demonstrate the Vertica story, vision, and technology to prospects and customers <br/><br/> - Work hands-on with prospects and customers to show business value throughout the sales cycle, from demo to proof of concept to solution architecture to customer success <br/><br/> - Continuously learn quickly evolving technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP), Machine Learning <br/><br/> - Become the voice of our customers internally to drive product enhancements and road map <br/><br/> - Travel approximately 50% <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> - Bachelor's degree in a technical area or equivalent practical experience <br/><br/> - Proven extensive experience to develop strong relationships with key decision makers & influencers within elite organizations <br/><br/> - Expert in Data Warehousing, Big Data, or BI / Analytics <br/><br/> - Excellent communication and presentation skills to present to both technical and executive audiences, whether impromptu on a white-board or using presentations and demos <br/><br/> - Highly effective listening and critical thinking skills <br/><br/> - Hands-on, complex problem solver <br/><br/> - Have the technical chops and innate curiosity to learn new technologies quickly in the dynamic big data and analytics space <br/><br/> <strong>The Unique Value of Micro Focus</strong> <br/><br/> At Micro Focus we provide our customers with a best-in-class portfolio of enterprise-grade scalable software with analytics built in. We put customers at the center of our innovation and build high quality products that our teams can be proud of. <br/><br/> Through our breadth of solutions, we are uniquely positioned to help our customers solve business problems and deliver against the needs and opportunities of Hybrid IT, from mainframe to mobile to cloud. We’re a pure-play software company –we have a level of focus that other technology companies don’t have, we are designed from the ground up to build, sell and support software. <br/><br/> We also have the strong operational foundation, proven over a combined 40 years of experience, to deliver on our commitments to our customers. Our scale is global—we have the reach and the capabilities to support customers in a global market. We are the 7th largest software company in the world, and the largest technology company listed on the FTSE. With 4,000 employees working on R&D, we can focus on innovating in solving the most complex technology problems for customers. <br/><br/> At its heart, Hybrid IT is about letting customers choose what’s right for them, without the need to compromise. Our job is to help them, and to enable that hybrid model to bridge the old and the new to maximize the value of existing investments. <br/><br/> Micro Focus is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Prospective employees will receive consideration without discrimination because of race, colour, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. <br/><br/> *LI-JG1 <br/><br/> <strong>Job:</strong><br/><br/>Sales<br/><br/><strong>Job Level:</strong><br/><br/>Expert<br/><br/><strong>Micro Focus is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.</strong> <br/><br/> Micro Focus will comply with all applicable laws related to the use of arrest and conviction records, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws and will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

Title: Front End Developer - International Software Company
Job_Description: Seequent is a world leader in the development of data visualization software. Our solutions (including Leapfrog and Blockbuster) enable people to create rich stories and uncover valuable insights from geological data, and ultimately make better decisions about their earth, environment and energy challenges. <br/><br/> Our primary development centres are in New Zealand (head office), Canada and South Africa. We also have offices in Australia, Chile, Brazil, Peru, Russia and the UK. The development team in Calgary is seeking a Front-End Developer to support our web-based communication and visualization product, View. <br/><br/> As an experienced Front-End Developer, you see the web as a powerful communication and visualization tool. You have developed in the web space but are looking to really hone your craft and work in web applications that leverage 2D, 3D and 4D visualization. You are well versed in current web technologies and have a good appreciation for design and aesthetics. You want to learn by doing and you live for steep learning curves. <br/><br/> In this role, you will bring and maintain a significant knowledge, competence and capability in front-end web development and you work efficiently with designers and product owners. <br/><br/> You build general, tested code, and refactor as you go. You can plan quickly and test quickly - you know the plan will change.<br/><br/>You will own the forward-facing component of a web application. You will help organize/execute the release of this application and ensure that features are continually tested. You identify and communicate risks and opportunities to business.<br/><br/><strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Minimum 3 years demonstrated development experience with hand-coding HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript</li> <li>University degree in computer science and/or compelling and extensive experience in real-world applications</li> <li>Confident oral and written communication skills in English</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to develop and build sustainable working relationships</li> <li>Team-oriented attitude and good conflict management skills</li> <li>Ability to manage your own workload effectively and to work efficiently alongside team members</li> <li>Balanced and informed approach to problem solving</li> <li>Tenacity, persistence and focus with the ability to prioritize between multiple tasks</li> <li>Ability to work in a quickly growing, fast paced and constantly changing environment</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Our 3D modelling products and collaborative technology are used for projects such as road and rail tunnel construction, groundwater detection and management, geothermal exploration, resource evaluation and estimation, and subterranean storage of spent nuclear fuel. <br/><br/> Seequent's global team is diverse – we’re geologists, software engineers, sales people and communication specialists. We’re technical experts who are driven by the challenges our customers face. We leverage the experience of our people to solve the highly complex problems of today, and work toward the bigger solutions of tomorrow. <br/><br/> We offer market competitive salaries and support continuing growth and education. <br/><br/> If what we do is something that would get you out of bed in the morning, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Intermediate Geotechnical Engineer
Job_Description: At Golder, we thrive on challenges. <br/><br/> <strong> Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.</strong>  <br/><br/> Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment? <br/><br/> Golder has a new opportunity for an <strong>Intermediate Geotechnical Engineer</strong> to join our team on a <strong>full time</strong> basis. **This position is based <strong>London, Ontario</strong>** <br/><br/> An overview of your role will include:  <ul> <li> Preparation of technical proposals and reports</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Mentoring and/or directing junior staff on projects</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Design, manage, and undertake a wide variety of geotechnical investigation programs, of various scales</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Assisting in the development of client relationships, business plan development</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Managing technical and financial aspects of geotechnical assignments ranging to as much as $20,00 0</li>  </ul>  <strong>You will have a background in:</strong>  <ul> <li> University graduate with a degree in Geotechnical, Geological or Civil (Geotechnical) Engineering (Master's preferred)</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Currently registered or eligible for registration with PEO</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> A minimum of 5 years of relevant working experience since graduation</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> A sound base in the applicable of Geotechnical Engineering to problem solving</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Experience in problem-solving with common industry commercial computer software for foundation design, slope stability and finite element/difference analyses</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Strong interpersonal communication and critical thinking skills</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Strong written and oral communication skills</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Experience with solving field construction testing and engineering problems</li>  </ul> <br/><br/> <strong> Your benefits at Golder will include:</strong>   <ul> <li> Competitive benefits and remuneration packages</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Option to purchase shares in Golder</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Employee owned structure - own the business, own the result</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> On the job training, mentoring and coaching</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Global projects and travel opportunities</li>  </ul>  <br/><br/> <strong> One of Canada's Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 11 consecutive years</strong>  <br/><br/> Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 40 countries, Golder's 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors. <br/><br/> Golder is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. As such, Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities, upon request. <br/><br/> <strong> To learn more about our company and culture click here to view</strong>  <strong> The Promise of Golder</strong>  <strong> video.</strong>  <br/>

Title: Front-End Web Developer
Job_Description: Autodata Solutions is looking for a <strong>Senior Front-End Web Developer</strong> in our Calgary, AB office! <br/><br/> We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. This is an opportunity for a Senior Leader manage both sides and define not only how the application looks, but how it works. You will translate the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application while integrating SEO principals into your design. Through collaboration with our backend developers, you will integrate REST service endpoints to the UI through AJAX calls and design the expected output from the services. MUST have solid previous experience with ReactJS to join this project. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop new user-facing features while buiding reusable code and libraries for future use</li> <li>Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs</li> <li>Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability</li> <li>Integrate user interfaces with backend REST services</li> <li>Execute effectively in a high-volume, fast-changing work environment while managing multiple time-critical issues</li> <li>Act as technical advisor to business owners, project management, UX Designers</li> <li>Troubleshoot issues with code, integrations, and other related website properties</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years of hands-on experience designing and building React.js applications</li> <li>5+ years professional experience with web markup, including HTML5, CSS3, and Javascript up to and including ECMAScript 6</li> <li>Demonstrable experience implementing SEO principles and ensuring that the application will adhere to them</li> <li>Good understanding of build tools, including Gulp, Bower, Webpack, and Yeoman</li> <li>Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery</li> <li>Good understanding of other advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS (vs 1 and 2), KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, Meteor, DurandalJS etc.</li> <li>Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX</li> <li>Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus</li> <li>Working knowledge of NodeJS, including Express, Meteor, and other modules</li> <li>Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git / Mercurial / SVN</li> </ul> For more information about Autodata, please visit our company website: www.autodata.net. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified. Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please specify.

Title: Senior Field Engineer - Infrastructure
Job_Description: <strong>Career Opportunity Senior Field Engineer Infrastructure</strong> <br/><br/> Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, youll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. Youll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. <br/><br/> We rank among Canadas largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If youre eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. <br/><br/> As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). <br/><br/> <u><strong>About The Role</strong></u> <br/><br/> <em><strong>As a Senior Field Engineer at Graham you will:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Assist Project Managers and Estimators in pursuing and securing new work.</li> <li>Take an active role in transitioning new projects from the pursuit phase to the execution phase with the support of the Project Manager and Superintendent.</li> <li>Take on a field-based leadership role during the execution of projects, supporting the Superintendent and Project Manager in any capacity required to ensure that the projects objectives are successfully achieved.</li> <li>Assist with the development and maintenance of project schedules using P6 software.</li> <li>Assist in the development and monitoring of project budgets and overall project performance.</li> <li>Implement project-specific safety and quality plans and update them as required during the project.</li> <li>Assist the Superintendent in developing workface plans for critical construction tasks.</li> <li>Manage project documentation requirements; proactively address submittals, RFIs, and other project documentation in order to ensure that construction work can proceed without delay.</li> <li>Assist with surveying and project layout as required; maintain and update red-line drawings.</li> <li>Assist with coordinating subcontractors, vendors, and field staff.</li> <li>Attend relevant project meetings and liaise with clients and consultants to the extent required.</li> <li>Prepare memos, letters, meeting minutes, subcontracts, and other forms and documents.</li> <li>Assist with estimating and soliciting subcontractors and/or suppliers for information and pricing</li> </ul> <em><strong>To be Successful at Graham, you will have the following qualifications and experience:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Have a degree relevant to the construction industry. Civil, Structural, or Mechanical engineering is preferred. A Professional Engineering designation is considered an asset.</li> <li>5 - 8 years of relevant construction field experience.</li> <li>Willing to relocate and/or travel to projects in various locations throughout Alberta.</li> <li>Experience working at a General Contractor, including construction management knowledge of projects in the water/wastewater and/or transportation sectors.</li> <li>Good communication, problem-solving, organizational and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Computer literate in Microsoft Office, Primavera P6, and AutoDesk.</li> </ul> <em><strong>Compensation and Benefits:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary with annual bonus potential</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan.</li> <li>Ownership and long term equity opportunities</li> </ul> <u><strong>About Us</strong></u> <br/><br/> <em><strong>What we can offer you:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Strong commitment to safety in the workplace</li> <li>Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector</li> <li>Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America</li> </ul> Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. <br/><br/> <strong>We're Building careers, not filling jobs.</strong> <br/><br/> View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. <br/><br/> Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Graham Management Services LP <br/><br/> 10840 27th Street SE <br/><br/> Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 <br/><br/> Fax: 403.570.5190

Title: Civil Engineer EIT
Job_Description: Your Opportunity <p>Our Water sector, which brings together many of the world’s top engineers and scientists, sees water a bit differently—as a single holistic system rather than as unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. We use this perspective to help communities tap into water’s potential. Throughout the life cycle of capture, use, reuse, and discharge, our team optimizes every facet of a water system.</p> <p> </p> <p>Whether a project calls for planners, designers, construction managers, or facility operators, we have the right experts to provide creative, yet practical, water solutions. Through our cost-effective strategies, we’re helping communities increase their water efficiency and protect their water resources for future generations. Join our team as we create new ways to tap into water’s vast potential.</p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p>Stantec is currently looking to add a<strong> Civil</strong> <strong>Engineer in Training</strong> to support our growing Water Resources practice. We encourage you to apply if you possess or would like to gain experience in a broad range of water-related engineering projects, with specific emphasis on industrial stormwater management water resources infrastructure projects. Applicants should be capable of working effectively with teams and clients, and be willing to learn from peers and supervisors</p> <p> </p> Your Duties <p>• Cooperatively support multidisciplinary teams on small- to mid-sized projects and work on several projects concurrently.</p> <p>• Perform preliminary and detailed analysis for industrial stormwater runoff.</p> <p>• Perform detailed analysis for hydraulic and hydrologic modeling using PCSWMM modeling software.</p> <p>• Preparation of studies, design criteria, design reports, plans and specifications, and quality assurance reviews of related designs and construction plans to ensure technical accuracy.</p> <p>• Inspect construction for compliance with design drawings and specifications.</p> <p>• Assist in project administration including writing reports, gathering information, preparing proposals and budgets, and completing progress reports.</p> <p>• Evaluate alternatives and resolve technical questions.</p> <p>• Work in a manner to ensure your personal safety and that of fellow employees by following company health and safety guideline and policies.</p> <p> </p> Your Capabilities and Credentials <ul>  <li>Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Civil or Water Resources Engineering.</li>  <li>Registration as an Engineer-in-Training with APEGA or qualifications to obtain this registration at the start of employment.</li>  <li>Strong organizational skills and multitasking ability. </li>  <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work with engineering staff at all levels. </li>  <li>Ability to prepare complete, concise and organized engineering calculations and analyses.</li>  <li>Desire to grow in your career in a challenging environment that fosters self-improvement though leadership, mentoring, and a diversity of experience.</li>  <li>Strong willingness to be a part of a large global engineering company, and to work with teams in other offices around the world.</li> </ul> <p>You will be based out of Calgary, but the position may require occasional project travel throughout western Canada</p> <p>Qualified candidates who are highly motivated and eager to commit to Stantec's strategic initiative to become a Top 10 global design firm should submit their resume and cover letter online at www.stantec.com/careers. </p> <p> </p>

Title: Post Doctoral Fellowship, Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering
Job_Description: <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Area</strong>: Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments <br/> <strong>Duration</strong>: 2 years <br/> <strong>Start</strong> <strong>Date</strong>: As soon as possible, until the position is filled <br/> <strong>Annual</strong> <strong>Stipend</strong>: $45,000 CAD/year <br/><br/> The <strong>Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering</strong> in the <strong>Schulich School of Engineering</strong> at the University of Calgary is accepting applications for a Postdoctoral Fellow in “Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments”<strong>.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Focusing on Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments, the R&D project is to address the challenges of accurately communicating/displaying multi-dimensional information to human users in the most efficient and effective manner. Based on a Virtual-Reality (VR) platform of interactive and visual analytics, a key aspect of the project is accommodating human cognitive constraints to achieve new insights about highly complex multisensory data and to handle ill-defined and unstructured phenomena. <br/><br/> The project is funded by the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council (NSERC) of Canada. The working environment includes the Schulich School of Engineering at the University of Calgary. The Postdoctoral Fellow will have opportunities to engage in research collaborating closely with researchers/engineers/scientists from national and international research institutes and industry. The position offers a unique multidisciplinary opportunity to be part of cutting edge R&D on VR applications. <br/><br/> R&D Objectives: The research of the Postdoctoral Fellow will focus on the following objectives: <ul> 	<li>Neural mechanisms of multi-sensory integration for facilitating interactive and visual analytics of complex data;</li>	<li>Algorithms of the multi-sensory integration based upon the neural mechanisms;</li> 	<li>Evaluation of the prototype of VR systems.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> 	<li>PhD in the computer science, engineering, or other related fields: The applicant must have completed (or be within three months of completing) their degree. Applicants who hold the degree must have obtained it within the last five years or have been actively working in a related field.</li>	<li>Brain-Machine Interfaces (BMI) and neurosciences: Sound experience in BMI and good knowledge of neurosciences are essential. Familiarization with EEG devices, eye trackers and associated data processing are very desirable. Preference will be given to applicants with demonstrated BMI research activities.</li> 	<li>Software development: Solid and demonstrated software development experience is essential. Working knowledge of Machine Learning would be desirable.</li> 	<li>Usability Engineering: Knowledge of testing and evaluating the usability of software/hardware systems is desirable. Knowledge and experience of VR technologies would be an asset.</li> 	<li>Communication: The applicant must possess excellent English written and verbal communication. The role will involve a significant amount of communication between varying levels of personnel in academia and industries. The applicant must be capable of communicating potential complex concepts in terms understandable by the various groups involved.</li>	<li>Working Style: The applicant must be capable of working in a self-directed/motivated manner and within a team environment.</li> </ul> <strong>Application details:</strong> <br/><br/> Send (via email) a letter of interest, a CV, and samples of publications to: <br/><br/> Prof. Yaoping Hu <br/> Email: huy@ucalgary.ca <br/> Dept. of Electrical and Computer Engineering <br/> Schulich School of Engineering <br/> University of Calgary <br/> 2500 University Drive, NW <br/> Calgary, Alberta, Canada T2N 1N4 <br/><br/> <strong>Applications will be accepted until the position is filled.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> To learn more about postdoctoral scholar opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Postdoc Careers website</strong>. For more information about the Schulich School of Engineering visit <strong>Careers in the Schulich School of Engineering</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> To succeed as one of Canada’s top universities, where new ideas are created, tested and applied through first-class teaching and research, the University of Calgary needs more of the best minds in our classrooms and labs. We’re increasing our scholarly capacity by investing in people who want to change the world, bringing the best and brightest to Calgary to form a global intellectual hub and achieve advances that matter to everyone. <br/><br/> <strong>About Calgary, Alberta</strong> <br/><br/> Calgary is one of the world's cleanest cities and has been named one of the world's most livable cities for years. Calgary is a city of leaders – in business, community, philanthropy and volunteerism. Calgarians benefit from the strongest economy in the nation and enjoy more days of sunshine per year than any other major Canadian city. Calgary is less than an hour’s drive from the Rocky Mountains and boasts the most extensive urban pathway and bikeway network in North America. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.</em>
