Title: Fracture Mechanics Program Engineer
Job_Description: Your Opportunity<br/><br/>Finding efficient, safe, and economical ways to develop and deliver oil and gas is an ongoing challenge. From the Arctic to the Canadian oil sands and the US shale plays, our Oil & Gas team partners with clients to provide engineering, procurement, construction management (EPCM), integrity, permitting, survey, and environmental services across the upstream, midstream, and downstream oil and gas industry. We design and support the lifecycle maintenance of facilities, pipelines, terminals, and refineries, as well as critical infrastructure like processing plants and field facilities. Through our partnerships, industry experience, and use of technology, we develop new and inventive ways to solve emerging issues, meet regulations, and increase productivity. Explore your career options with us. <br/><br/> We are currently seeking a <strong>Fracture Mechanics Program Engineer</strong> to join our <strong>Oil & Gas</strong> group in <strong>Southeast <strong>Calgary.</strong> </strong> <br/><br/> The Fracture Mechanics Program Engineer shall have strong technical, organizational and people skills, with a focus on integration of fracture mechanics into the integrity assessments and integrity program development. At all times, the focus will be efficient, timely and high quality deliverables to the client through an attention to details. <br/><br/> The role will require selection and application of appropriate materials testing, Fitness-for-Service and engineering methods and principles to conduct detailed engineering assessment of material imperfections relating to steel and pipe manufacturing, construction and joining as well as environmental and mechanical effects. Project experience with low-frequency long seam ERW and fatigue will be an asset. The candidate shall have a strong work ethic, enjoy working in a team environment and will desire to have a career in the integrity management field.<br/><br/>Your Duties   <ul>   <li>Application of Pipeline Facility Fitness-for-Service codes and standards</li> <li>Project management, responsible for overall project cost, schedule and deliverables</li> <li>Sharing knowledge through informal presentations and one-on one coaching & mentoring</li> <li>Set an example through responsible, safety-conscious conduct</li> <li>Meet all requirements of Client and Stantec Quality Systems</li> <li>Strengthen technical knowledge through on-the-job, informal and formal training</li> <li>Be familiar with and ensure appropriate industry-accepted methods are utilized at all times</li> <li>Be familiar with applicable codes and regulations</li> <li>Liaise and interact with Stantec peers</li> <li>Establish and maintain positive client relationships</li> </ul>  Your Capabilities and Credentials   <ul>   <li>Graduate or Post-graduate Engineering Degree in Fracture Mechanics</li> <li>Eligible for P.Eng. registration with APEGA</li> <li>3+ years of laboratory experience in tensile, Charpy V-notch, CTOD, metallurgical and fractography analysis</li> <li>Crack Defect assessment experience, including application of CorLas, BS7910, API 579, API 1104, CSA Z662 Annex K</li> <li>BMT Flawcheck and Quest Signal software</li> <li>Experience with Canadian standards, practices and applicable legislation</li> <li>Demonstrated technical proficiency</li> <li>Strong interpersonal, communication, analytical and problem solving skills</li> <li>Demonstrated process improvement skills</li> <li>Demonstrated initiative, flexibility and adaptability</li> </ul> <em>We would like to thank all candidates who apply; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.</em>

Title: Web Developer
Job_Description: Web Developer<br/><br/>Pandell is growing and back on the search for more great Developers!! We're looking for an Intermediate PHP Developer who is smart, ambitious, and passionate about their craft. Picture yourself building a successful career at Pandell - working alongside our expanding team of talented, driven team members.<br/><br/>Why Work at Pandell?   <ul>   <li><strong>Winner of Alberta's Best Workplaces (Benefits, Perks & Incentives)</strong></li> <li>Profit sharing</li> <li>Flexible hours / Casual work environment</li> <li>Training budget</li> <li>Competitive benefits package</li> <li>Fully stocked kitchen</li> <li>Games room & lounge area</li> <li>Awesome new development machines (full accessories & dual monitor)</li> <li>Rebates for personal fitness and electronics purchases</li> <li>And much more - Check out our Life at Pandell video!</li> </ul>  The Ideal Candidate   <ul> <li>3+ years of PHP software development experience</li> <li>Will have strong technical skills in the following web based technologies: PHP and PHP frameworks, JavaScript, jQuery, MySQL</li> <li>Experience with the following is also preferable: C#, SQL Server, TypeScript, React, Git, ASP.NET</li> <li>Is passionate, self-motivated and excels at delivering high quality code, using multiple styles of programming</li> <li>Has a strong understanding of team development including source control technology, product deployment strategies, and team software design</li> </ul>  <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Review, analyze, program, and deploy software products</li> <li>Use tools as provided for proper software source code management and business operations</li> <li>Provide software design and architectural input</li> </ul> Please note this is a Calgary based position and not available for remote work.<br/><br/>Interested in this career?<br/><br/>Send your resume to careers@pandell.com. <br/><br/> Please include the position for which you are applying in the subject line of your e-mail. <br/><br/> Remote work is not available for this position.

Title: Junior Geotechnical or Civil Engineer
Job_Description: <div><div>Reporting to the Team Lead, you will be a key team member in a close-knit civil/geotechnical team that provides Engineering solutions to our Clients in Alberta, Canada and around the world. <br/><br/> You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of large-scale, world-class projects involving the design, construction and operations for oil sands and mining projects and a wide range of civil engineering projects including roads, railways, water resource dams, oil and gas facilities and heavy civil infrastructure. <br/><br/> KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada, United States and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and Saskatchewan and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. <br/><br/> <strong>This role will give you the opportunity to:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work on a variety of local and international projects that may include site characterization, geohazard risk assessment and control, terrain analysis, slope stability, numerical modeling, foundation design, tailings dam design, mine and tailings planning, mine pit slope design, embankment dams and earthworks design.</li>  <li>Get involved in site investigation and drilling programs, core logging, lab testing, instrumentation installations and monitoring and data review and analysis.</li>  <li>Build and develop strong relationships with multidisciplinary project teams, sub-contractors, clients, and other project stakeholders.</li>  <li>Use your problem-solving ability to find innovative solutions to technical challenges.</li>  <li>Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry in a supportive, dynamic company culture that supports career development.</li>  <li>Travel to various project sites in Alberta and British Columbia with potential opportunities to travel internationally on mining projects.</li> </ul> <strong>If you have a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Geotechnical or Civil Engineering, are registered, or are eligible to register as an Engineer-In-Training in the province of Alberta, and have up to 24 months of related work experience we want to hear from you!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We value your:</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong initiative, innovation and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive toward long-term success.</li>  <li>Flexibility, adaptability and willingness to learn and travel.</li>  <li>Being able to work as part of an established team.</li>  <li>Interpersonal, decision-making and technical skills.</li>  <li>Experience in CAD software, such as AutoCAD and Civil 3D.</li>  <li>Experience in various design software, such as Slope/W, Seep/W, Soil Vision, FLAC.</li>  <li>Ability to manage workload to meet Client requirements.</li> </ul> <strong>About Us:</strong> <br/><br/> Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, hydropower, environmental, transportation, geotechnical, oil & gas, and water resources sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. <br/><br/> From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the Oil and Gas industry, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Mining. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. <br/><br/> We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Are you up to the challenge?</em></strong> <br/><br/> If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number 1342-A18. <br/><br/> We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.</div> </div><div></div>

Title: Test Engineer
Job_Description: Contribute to the company’s success by automating the testing of hardware and software to improve the consistency and coverage of testing on all Frac Automation products. <ul>  <li>Design, Document, Implement, and maintain test automation systems.</li> <li>Track and improve quality metrics.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <li> Professional Engineer or Professional Technologist</li> <li>Bachelor of Science or related degree from an accredited university or technical school.</li><li>A minimum of 2 years experience writing and creating test automation software in a manufacturing environment.</li><li>Experience in designing cables, and fixtures used to automate testing of products.</li><li>Knowledge of programming languages like C/C++, C# (.net), VB, Java, LabView.</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint</li><li>Knowledge and understanding of schematics, P&IDs, process flow diagrams Strong analytical and troubleshooting.</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel as required, approx. up to 4 weeks per year.</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel to fracturing jobs and manufacturing sites.</li> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Comprehensive benefits including paid vacations and holidays, supplemental healthcare including paramedical and health savings account, dental; vision, prescriptions, Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) with generous company match, long and short term disability and life insurances, etc.,

Title: Mobile Application Developer
Job_Description: Showpass is a ticketing and event management software company. We empower venue and event organizers to create a rich, connected experience for their customers through next-generation technology. We combine cutting-edge software and hardware for seamless on- and offline sales, while delivering event management tools on the same integrated platform. <br/><br/> <strong><em>But what makes us different?</em></strong> <br/><br/> Showpass offers a unique platform for collaboration between the key groups that power events. From venues, to organizers, to street teams, to event attendees, we are focused on bringing people together through the magic of live events. We also happen to be powered by a very talented team fostering innovation, creativity and disruption. These pillars support the Showpass culture which is built on a love for events, and all things food. That’s what makes us the fastest growing Canadian ticketing company. <br/><br/> <strong>THE ROLE:</strong> Mobile Application Developer (full-time permanent role) <br/><br/> <strong>THE LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> <strong>THE PERKS:</strong>   <ul>   <li>A unique and fun place to work – flexible hours and vacation policy, in-house chef, fully stocked snack and fresh pressed juice bar, gym membership, dog-friendly office and parking</li> <li>Competitive compensation and benefits package</li>  </ul>  <strong>THE RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>   <ul>   <li>Build new apps using Swift and Kotlin with AR features</li> <li>Deliver the best user experience to meet the needs of current users and gain new users</li> <li>Integrate peripheral hardwares to mobile application</li> <li>Work closely with backend developers and UX designers to effectively build app features</li> <li>Manage app releases on App Store and Google Play</li> <li>Troubleshoot and debug apps</li> <li>Participate in routine standups, code reviews and testing parties</li> <li>Write clean code in a testable, reliable and sustainable way</li> </ul>  <strong>THE QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>   <ul>   <li>Post secondary education in engineering or computer science would be an asset</li>   <li>Experience with published apps is required</li> <li>Experience with the following technologies is required: Objective C or Java, Javascript, HTML and CSS, REST API, Git and Github, Unit testing</li> <li>Experience with the following technologies would be an asset: Swift, Kotlin, continuous integration, ARKit/ARCore</li> <li>Experience working in a technology or software company would be an asset</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Strong testing and debugging skills</li> <li>Must work great in a team and also as an individual contributor</li> <li>Ability to champion new ideas and develop creative approaches</li> <li>Analytical thinker with the ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment</li> <li>Must have the hustle and drive to take initiative and make things happen!</li> </ul>  <strong>NOTE: We will only contact qualified candidates of interest.</strong>

Title: SharePoint Developer

or related discipline</li> </ul> <strong>DevFacto can offer you:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salaries, group benefits, profit sharing</li> <li>Challenging projects and leading-edge technologies</li> <li>Extensive training</li> <li>Flexible hours, creative workspaces with games and a fully stocked kitchen</li> <li>Regular team social events including Friday happy-hours and monthly team outings</li> <li>Award-Winning Culture</li> </ul> If this sounds like a match made in heaven, we want to hear from you!

Title: Senior Civil / Structural Engineer
Job_Description: Senior Civil / Structural Engineer<br/><br/>Calgary, AB, Canada <br/><br/> <strong>Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Canam Group is the largest fabricator of steel components in North America. Specialized in designing construction solutions and fabricating customized products since 1961, Canam Group takes part in an average of 10,000 construction projects each year in one activity sector divided into three groups of products and services: buildings, structural steel and bridges. The Corporation operates 25 plants across North America and employs over 4,650 people in Canada, the United States, Romania and India. <br/><br/> Canam currently has an opportunity for a permanent, full-time, professional Senior Civil/Structural Engineer based in our Calgary steel joist and deck facility. <br/><br/> <strong>As a member of our engineering team, your responsibilities include:</strong> <ul> <li>Design steel building components in accordance with the relevant Building Codes and ensure all projects meet codes, legal guidelines, environmental directives, and health and safety requirements;</li><li>Design building components through the use of computer software and a thorough understanding of software or hand calculations;</li><li>Clarify and resolve discrepancies with engineering documents on production lines;</li><li>Study and validate contract requirements, raise queries and request clarification where necessary;</li><li>Redesign members for greater economy and compare design weight with sales weight;</li><li>Understand and have the ability to improve methods and processes within the organization;</li><li>Possess the ability to design specialty components without supervision;</li><li>Review contract documents and draft work for completeness and proper depiction of special loading conditions;</li><li>Give clear instructions to drafters on jobs to ensure that designs are understood;</li><li>Provide technical support to design and shop order technicians;</li><li>Meet shop schedule requirements;</li><li>Lead the responsibility for field modifications, repair sketches and solving field problems including site visits;</li><li>Review approval and erection drawings and give final approval;</li><li>Confirm the accuracy of work produced by junior engineers;</li><li>Convey information effectively and communicate with all levels of internal and external stakeholders, engage clients, co-workers, contractors and internal staff members;</li><li>Participate in design meetings and suggest improvements to design engineering practices.</li> </ul> <strong>The successful candidate will possess:</strong> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering with at least eight (8) years of design experience and two (2) years’ experience in Structural Steel or Design Built projects;</li><li>A Professional Engineer License in Alberta and other Canadian provinces;</li><li>Proficient with western Canadian construction methods, health and safety, and legal, municipal, provincial and national building codes;</li><li>Exceptional organizational and English communication skills (verbal and written);</li><li>The ability to manage multiple priorities is essential.</li> </ul> Punctuality, maturity, reliability, and ability to work well under pressure with frequent interruptions while delivering exceptional customer service is essential to excel in this role. <br/><br/> <strong>Remuneration:</strong> <br/><br/> In this full time permanent position, you will receive competitive remuneration, company benefits, profit sharing, as well as excellent opportunities for training. <br/><br/> Canam Group Inc. appreciates your interest in this position. Please note, that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. We reserve the right, upon the candidate’s written authorization and at the company’s expense, to perform criminal, credit and job-related medical background checks as part of the hiring process.

Title: UX Designer/Developer (GUI)
Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> The General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada User Experience team delivers a safe and user-friendly experience across all hardware and software deliverables, from the simplest devices to the most complex systems. We take an interdisciplinary and iterative approach to development, focused on understanding and meeting human needs. We actively do this through collaboration, frequent prototyping and user engagement. <br/><br/> Typical Duties <ul> <li>Participate in an interdisciplinary integrated project team environment</li><li>Work closely with software, firmware, within the UX, Human factors + Design group to develop specialized Graphical User Interface (GUI) firmware on military embedded hardware devices or software designs using the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) development process</li><li>This is a cross-discipline role of bridging a GUI design role with firmware and software development to ensure a positive end user experience</li><li>Identify and create software user interface requirements and analysis of implementation</li><li>Prepare and review design documents</li><li>Code and peer review software</li><li>Document the analysis, design and test activities in accordance with development standards</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience <ul> <li>Experience with cross-platform GUI frameworks such as Qt, and HTML 5Experience with firmware application development using the C++ programming language</li><li>Experience using GUI prototyping tools such as Axure</li><li>Strong interest and experience with Graphical User Interface design, UX and/or Human Computer Interaction</li><li>Relevant experience with software development processes and tools</li><li>Able to translate, and coordinate a GUI experience to the development team, including the creation of assets to facilitate development</li><li>Experience with embedded processors, particularly the ARM platform, is an asset</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li><li>Enthusiastic contributor, willing to learn new skills and takes on ownership of work</li><li>Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision</li> </ul> Education <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or higher in Human Factors Engineering, Industrial Design, Kinesiology, Computer Science, Systems Design, Ergonomics, Psychology or related discipline with course work in human factors engineering/ergonomics/human computer interaction</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Engineering Manager
Job_Description: Longview Aviation Asset Management (LAAM) was established in 2016 to provide attractive financing and lease options, as well as trade-in aircraft capabilities, for aircraft supported and manufactured by Viking Air Limited (Viking). <br/><br/> In 2018, LAAM, in partnership with Viking, formally launched the CL-415EAF "Enhanced Aerial Firefighter" conversion program. The CL-415EAF combines the proven performance of the CL-215 airframe with modern upgrades to create the next generation of the worlds only purpose-built aerial firefighter and multi-mission amphibious platform. <br/><br/> We are immediately seeking an experienced Aerospace Engineering Manager to join our rapidly expanding team in Calgary. <br/><br/> The Engineering Manager is responsible for managing the Methods Engineering functions. Implements industry-standard continuous improvement methodologies to ensure that the product consistently meets all required quality standards while reducing production costs and cycle times. <br/><br/> <strong>MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop & manage a Methods Team in a production plant environment</li> <li>Develop & plan for manufacturing plan deliverables such as product flow, layout, cycle, visual aids, workbooks instructions, tooling, etc.</li> <li>Assess risks and develop a mitigation plan for processes and equipments (FMEAs)</li> <li>Analyse & optimize material flow.</li> <li>Manages development, implementation, optimization and build sequence planning, documentation, provisioning and tooling requirements for parts or assemblies.</li> <li>Manages METs in root cause analysis of production issues and errors.</li> <li>Conduct business/process analysis as required</li> <li>Use sound benchmarking principals and techniques as required for analysis</li> <li>Maintain and develop knowledge of new manufacturing processes within the aerospace industry and in the plant</li> <li>Possess a sound understanding of basic industrial engineering principles as they relate to work study, process analysis and resource planning</li> <li>Leading METs developing and revising Engineering Masters (EMs), planning documents and workbooks ensuring that they properly define HOW the aircraft assembly, subassemblies and parts are manufactured in accordance with the type design by,</li> <li>Identifying tool and equipment requirements for their accountable work areas and to participate in their specifying, sourcing, acquisition and implementation,</li> <li>Defining standard work under LAAM work instructions</li> <li>Supporting Production in solving tactical problems.</li> <li>Defining parts repair processes</li> </ul> <u>Repair Design</u>  <ul> <li>Develop repair designs / solutions for non-conformances</li> <li>Perform analysis in support of repair dispositions</li> <li>Recommend and develop permanent design changes for recurring non-conformances and drawing errors</li> <li>Develop and implement repairs using the standard repair manual</li> <li>Manage flow of repair solutions to meet the production priorities</li> <li>Provide status reports on the development of repair solutions</li> </ul> <u>Engineering Support</u>  <ul> <li>Evaluate and resolve engineering-related production problems</li> <li>Investigate defective, damaged, or malfunctioning parts, assemblies, equipment, or systems to determine nature and scope of problem</li> <li>Support methods engineering and design change using the ECN process</li> <li>Provide engineering support to quality control, material, production, and other department personnel</li> </ul> <strong>EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:</strong>  <ul> <li>Degree or diploma in Engineering; or equivalent combination of education and experience (e.g., senior Aircraft Maintenance Engineer)</li> <li>5-10 years of progressive hands-on experience in a manufacturing environment, preferably in the aerospace industry</li> <li>Knowledge of the repair, fabrication and assembly of aircraft parts</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Working knowledge of cost accounting and cost estimating</li> <li>Experience in an AMO environment would be an asset.</li> </ul> <strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>Knowledge of Aerospace engineering and manufacturing principles and techniques.</li> <li>Ability to apply sound engineering principles to operational and process design issues.</li> <li>Ability to read and interpret aircraft engineering drawings.</li> <li>Ability to communicate well orally and in writing.</li> <li>Ability to communicate and document information using a computer and required software.</li> <li>Ability to manage and act on multiple projects and priorities at one time.</li> <li>Ability to work effectively either independently or with others on flexible work assignments.</li> </ul> <strong>JOIN THE TEAM AND BENEFIT FROM:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary</li> <li>Full extended health and benefit plan</li>   <li>The opportunity to join an organization from the ground floor</li>   <li>Great task diversity and unique challenges</li> <li>Company RRSP matching</li>  </ul> Interviews start ASAP! Apply today for consideration! (No cover letter required)

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Job_Description: <div><div> <p><strong>YOUR OPPORTUNITY:</strong><br> The Business Systems Analyst performs a combination of three functions: business analysis, systems analysis, and project management. As a Business Systems Analyst you will be responsible for managing the customer relationship between IS, and one or more business areas, implementing new applications, as well as supporting and maintaining a portfolio of existing applications. A Business Systems Analyst may also provide guidance and direction to Systems Analysts and Developers.</p>  <p><strong>COMPETITIVE SALARY - STOCK OPTIONS - STOCK SAVINGS PLAN - ANNUAL BONUSES – BENEFITS!</strong></p>  <p><strong>HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?</strong><br>  • Manage the customer relationship between IS and specific business areas<br>  • Support, maintain, enhance and/or upgrade a portfolio of custom and package applications<br>  • Analyze requests for new functionality, and document business cases to justify new application investments<br>  • Develop estimates of effort for design of new, and/or modification to existing, application components<br>  • Design application components to automate and streamline business processes and functions<br>  • Business area planning that includes scheduling and management of application projects<br>  • Understand the architecture of the applications within the groups portfolio<br>  • Plan, assign and monitor daily work assignments for Systems Analysts, Developers and Developer Analysts<br>  • Develop and maintain technical specifications and documentation<br>  • Troubleshoot and repair problems that occur in the everyday use of an application<br>  • Develop cost estimates for the annual IS capital and sustainment budgets</p>  <p><strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong><br>  • Typically 8+ years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst and Systems Analyst, preferably in Production Accounting, PAS/PRISM AND Field Data Collection<br>  • Post-secondary degree in Computer Sciences is preferred<br>  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills<br>  • Highly developed analytical skills<br>  • Demonstrated proficiency in business modeling, process modeling, data modeling, and effort/cost modeling and estimating<br>  • Demonstrated proficiency in N-tier application analysis, design and development using the appropriate development environments and tools (Java Enterprise, Tomcat, MS VB.NET/ASP.Net, MS SSRS, and/or Oracle 11C&12C and PL/SQL<br>  • General proficiency with SQL and database query tools such as Microsoft Access and/or SQL+<br>  • Strong multi-tasking and prioritizing abilities<br>  • Exceptional Project Management skills</p>  <p>To see related Information Technology roles at CNRL, visit: http://www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Information-Technology</p>  <p><strong>ABOUT CANADIAN NATURAL</strong><br> At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." As a leading oil and gas producer, our diverse combination of assets include light oil, heavy oil, in situ oil sands production, oil sands mining and upgrading facilities, and natural gas. At Canadian Natural, safety is a core value. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.</p>  <p>Canadian Natural Resources Limited - CNRL - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.</p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>

Title: Engineering Branch Manager
Job_Description: At Williams Engineering we realize that having the right people is paramount to our ability to provide exceptional service to our clients. As our people are the most important part of our business; we make sure they are provided with fair compensation, training, advancement opportunities, in a positive team environment. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Purpose:</strong> Responsible for providing strategic direction to the branch, cross-discipline marketing and business development, and developing a strong team of engineers and technologists to support the ongoing growth of the organization. <br/><br/> This role serves as an integral link between the Regional Director and the Engineering Director by providing both inter-disciplinary coordination and client leadership at the branch level. <br/><br/> <strong>Specific Responsibilities Include:</strong><br/>  <div><strong>Service Line Accountabilities – Workload Management and Engineering Quality</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Regional Accountabilities - Client Relationships and Operational Management</strong></div> <div>With advice from the Team Lead(s), forecast workload for staffing targets and participate in recruitment and termination of staff. <br/><br/> Lead the preparation of proposals for major projects.</div> <div>Manage cost and time components of each discipline to ensure profitability. <br/><br/> Working with the Regional Director to support the development of lasting relationships with clients. </div> <div>Overseeing the design process provide effective options and solutions to design problems, and ensuring quality engineering. <br/><br/> Prepare and maintain business plans for the branch that are in alignment with the company and service line business and strategic plan objectives.</div> <div>In conjunction with the Branch Administrator, Team Leads, and other WEC managers develop standards and procedures for, quality, efficiency, safety, cost reduction, client service and ensure they are followed by your branch. <br/><br/> Coordinate branch workload with other branches as necessary to optimize performance of each service line.</div><div>Contribute to, and coordinate with, marketing and business development initiatives that cross regional and geographic boundaries.</div> <div> Communicate effectively with clients to identify needs and evaluate alternative solutions.</div> <div>Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships.</div> <div> Manage, motivate, train, mentor, and discipline direct reports according to company policies and guidelines.</div> <div> Develop direct reports’ Career Paths and provide performance appraisals, with input from the Regional Director.</div><div> Employees are required to adhere to the company and client safety policies and practices in effect at any given time.</div>   <ul> <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or diploma in Engineering Technology.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>12+ years’ experience in Consulting Engineering or related field.</li><li>Experience in a leadership, supervisory or mentorship role.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills; a person who listens well, respects diversity of opinions and has an open, clear and succinct communication style.</li><li>Strong presentation and project management skills.</li><li>The ability to recognize and accurately define problems and solutions by collecting data and establishing facts to draw valid conclusions.</li><li>A results oriented and decisive individual with the ability to delegate effectively.</li><li>A people oriented leader with a reputation for successfully attracting, mentoring and motivating a team.</li><li>Understand the principles of sustainable infrastructure and apply them when involved with projects, as well as business development</li><li>Effective organizational and time management skills in handling multiple priorities, performing a variety of tasks, and meeting required deadlines.</li><li>Strong contacts in the engineering community and a persuasive presentation and communication style.</li><li>Experience and good judgement to plan and accomplish ambitious but achievable goals.</li><li>Ability to represent the company to the staff, clients and community by ensuring the best image is presented.</li><li>Understands basic revenue models, P/L, and cost-to-completion projections and makes decisions accordingly.</li> <li>Understands our pricing model and billing procedures.</li> <li>Ability to facilitate team and client meetings effectively.</li> <li>Possesses strong understanding in the area of at least one engineering discipline.</li> <li>Application knowledge of WEC systems and programs (including Gnosis, Vision, Career Path, Office 365, Newforma, Planifi, Octiv, MS Dynamics, discipline specific drafting/design software, etc.)</li> </ul>

Title: Business Development Analyst
Job_Description: Reporting to the VP of Corporate Development, the Business Development Analyst will support the organization’s growth by helping Tundra acquire companies. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong> <br/> The responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:  <ul>  <li>Research potential acquisition targets and the related market segments</li> <li>Initiating contact and fostering relationships with potential acquisition targets</li>  <li>Preparing business plans, financial models and competitor analysis</li> <li>Executing NDA’s and preparing LOI’s</li> <li>Assist with due diligence and implementation/integration plans</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong>  <ul> <li>University or college degree in Business, Finance or related field CBV, CPA, MBA or CFA preferred</li></ul>  <ul>  <li>Minimum 2 years of industry experience</li> <li>Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and work positively under pressure</li> <li>Ability to be pro-active and anticipate the needs of the team</li> <li>Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail</li> <li>High proficiency in Microsoft office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)</li> </ul>  <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> We offer a base salary with benefits and a generous compensation package. We have a strong philanthropic presence within Alberta and work closely with charities such as The Kids Cancer Care Foundation of Alberta, motionball and others. We are always looking to provide our employees with different opportunities to give back to the community, often during work hours.

Title: Systems Developer
Job_Description: <P><B>Summary:</B></P> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <DIV>Reporting to the Manager of IT, within Information Technology, the Systems Developer (located in Calgary, Alberta) will be responsible for the outstanding coding of the AX2012 Global HR module and associated integrations at Ensign. This position requires a creative person who is an exciting team player, with a strong technical background, and excellent verbal and written communications skills. Candidates must be able to analyze system design, address quality assurance, question issues, and work through problems on a day to day basis.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>Position Responsibilities:</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Designing, building, testing and maintaining the various applications, and customizations in the Dynamics AX2012 modules, as well as the integration between the various applications and Dynamics AX2012;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Building the Benefits module in AX2012; the benefits integration from AX2012 to Avanti (Canadian payroll system); the integration from AX2012 to Meridian (Australia payroll system); and any other development requirements for the Global HRMS AX2012;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Working closely with IT Business Analysts and the HRIS and Compensation Analyst to determine if business and functional requirements are met;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Working with project managers to determine schedules and estimates;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Preparing technical documentation;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Providing technical support and problem resolution expertise.</DIV></LI></UL> <P> <DIV><B>Note: </B></DIV> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <DIV>Some travel may be required.</DIV> <DIV>This is a 12 month temporary contract.</DIV> <P></P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Mathematics or Engineering discipline or equivalent experience;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>5 – 7 years development experience in the object oriented language of C#, with a focus on integration;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Expertise in Microsoft Dynamics AX2012;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Understanding of ERP systems and the ability to learn quickly;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with Microsoft integration and reporting technologies SSIS, SSRS, OBI and/or Business objects, SQL and OLAP; </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with unit testing frameworks such as NUnit would be an asset;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Proven technical ability supported by strong analytical and problem solving skills;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to work effectively as part of a team as well as independently in a self-directed mode;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong interpersonal and communication skills;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>The ability to work well in a fast paced environment through exceptional time management skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritize duties;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Oilfield experience, specifically in the Energy Services sector, would be an asset.</DIV></LI></UL>

Title: SAP ABAP Developer
Job_Description: <p>We are looking for Sr. SAP ABAB Developer with following skill set: <strong>SAP</strong> ECC 6.0, ABAP, ABAP Objects, ALE/IDOCS, BAPI, Interfaces, Enhancements (BADI’s/User Exits), Conversions, Reports, Dialog Programs, ALV • Programming using classic ABAP techniques to support interfaces, reports, enhancements, and conversions; as well as have skill in developing in one of the newer facets of the <strong>SAP</strong> development tools like WebDynpro, Document Builder, Adobe Interactive Forms • Effective Programming and/or Performance tuning Activities. • Logical and analytical skills, requirements gathering and analysis, at least 1-2 full lifecycle implementation experience • Strong communication skills • Minimum of 4 years in <strong>SAP</strong> Development, including full lifecycle implementation work experience Web Dynpro, <strong>SAP</strong> Visual Composer, <strong>SAP</strong> Smart Forms, Adobe Interactive Forms, Document Builder, EDI, UNIX, Middleware • Knowledge of PCM, PBF, BW, Business Objects, BWA.</p>

Title: Sales Development Trainee
Job_Description: Our new Calgary North Profit Centre has an immediate opening for an energetic, results driven team player in a Sales Development Trainee position. <br/><br/> EMCO Corporation is one of Canada’s largest integrated distributors of products for the construction industry. EMCO offers products in the distinct categories of plumbing and heating, waterworks, industrial, oilfield supply and HVAC (heating, ventilation and air conditioning). EMCO strives to satisfy the needs of its customers with a focused product assortment, transported and sold through an extensive network of locations across Canada. <br/><br/> Our Sales Development Program teaches new hires with little-to-no industry experience every aspect of the business. You’ll spend your first 18 months in the Profit Center learning exactly how the business operates – from shipping and receiving, counter / customer service, to operations management. Then you’ll get to know our customers, spending your next two and a half years learning inside sales and outside sales. <br/><br/> <strong>What we offer:</strong>  <ul> <li>A world-class sales leadership development program</li> <li>Great mentors and on-the-job training</li> <li>Growth potential with competitive salary, benefits, and profit sharing</li> <li>A career with a solid, stable company with strong core values</li> </ul> <strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Phase 1 – Warehouse Logistics</strong> – Learn the products we sell and how they get from the vendor to the customer and understand the role of sales support. <br/><br/> <strong>Phase 2 – Operations</strong> – Get involved in our customer service, counter sales, order management, inventory and pricing controls, credit management, financial statements, and more… <br/><br/> <strong>Phase 3 – Contractor & Showroom Sales/Project Management</strong> – Assisting customers with various customer service issues in addition to managing residential & commercial projects. <br/><br/> <strong>Phase 4 – Outside Sales/Account Management</strong> – Learn how to find new business opportunities, sell our products, negotiate contracts, and build customer and vendor relationships. <br/><br/> <strong>Job Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Post-Secondary Education</li> <li>Positive attitude and results oriented mindset</li> <li>Work well in and support a team based environment</li> <li>Work well with minimal supervision</li> <li>Excellent customer service, interpersonal, organizational and communication skills</li> <li>Proficient with computers and the internet</li> <li>Valid Driver’s license with clean abstract</li> </ul> Those interested in applying for a position should forward their resume with cover letter.

Title: Geotechnical / Civil Engineer
Job_Description: <div><div>As a <strong>Geotechnical / Civil Engineer</strong>, you will be joining our close-knit Geotechnical/Civil Engineering team working on world-class mining projects which are at the leading edge of emerging technologies in the industry. In this role, you will collaborate with our talented professionals who are committed to delivering high quality engineering solutions to our clients. <br/><br/> KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada, United States and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and Saskatchewan and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. <br/><br/> <strong>This role will give you the opportunity to:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work on a variety of projects including tailings dam design, mine and tailings planning support, mine pit slope design, embankment dams and earthworks design, site characterization, geohazard risk assessment and control, terrain analysis, slope stability assessments, seepage analyses, numerical modeling, and foundation design.</li>  <li>Lead project designs including the preparation of technical reports and the development of construction drawings and tender packages.</li>  <li>Build and develop strong relationships with our Clients, our multidisciplinary project teams, sub-contractors and other project stakeholders.</li>  <li>Use your problem-solving skills to find innovative solutions to technical issues.</li>  <li>Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry.</li>  <li>Work in a dynamic One Team company culture that supports career development.</li>  <li>Contribute to the growth of the Resources Group and engage and mentor junior staff.</li>  <li>Travel primarily in Western Canada and potentially to our overseas project locations.</li> </ul> <strong>If you are registered or eligible to register as a Professional Engineer in Canada, have a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Geotechnical or Civil Engineering and a minimum of 6 years of related tailings and dam engineering experience in mining, we want to hear from you!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We value your:</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong initiative and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive towards achieving long-term success.</li>  <li>Demonstrated leadership, project management, decision-making and coaching skills, especially your ability to engage, train and mentor young professionals.</li>  <li>Flexibility, adaptability and willingness to travel and passion for learning.</li>  <li>Ability to work in a performance focused, collaborative team environment.</li>  <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills including your experience in writing technical reports and preparing tender documents.</li>  <li>Experience in various design software, such as Slope/W or Seep/W.</li>  <li>Experience with 2D and 3D numerical modeling programs relating to slope stability and deformation analysis such as Clara or FLAC.</li>  <li>Ability to execute projects to meet Client requirements.</li>  <li>Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to build long-term, successful relationships with our clients.</li>  <li>Strong business acumen.</li> </ul> <strong>About Us:</strong> <br/><br/> Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, geotechnical, hydropower, water resources, transportation, oil & gas, and environmental sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. <br/><br/> From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton, and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the, Mining, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Oil and Gas industry. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. <br/><br/> We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Are you up to the challenge?</em></strong> <br/><br/> If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number 1324-A18. <br/><br/> We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.</div> </div><div></div>

Title: Vertica Presales Engineer - Big Data Products
Job_Description: Vertica Presales Engineer - Big Data Products, Canada<br/><br/><strong>Job Description:</strong> <br/><br/> PRESALES ENGINEER, BIG DATA PRODUCTS <br/><br/> Micro Focus <br/><br/> Toronto, Ontario, Canada or other Canadian locations <br/><br/> Discover the new Micro Focus – now the world’s 7th largest pure-play software company. By combining HPE Software and Micro Focus offerings, we have built a brand new company with a stronger, bigger portfolio that delivers customer-centered innovation. We are now uniquely positioned to help enterprise customers solve their most pressing business problems and operate in the Hybrid environment—from mainframe to mobile to cloud. <br/><br/> Our portfolio spans the following areas: <br/><br/> <strong>DevOps | IT Operations| Cloud | Security | Information Governance | Big Data, Machine Learning, and Analytics</strong> <br/><br/> Take charge of your future and join our dynamic, motivated sales team as we go to market with a best-in-class portfolio that will help shape the world’s software landscape. <br/><br/> #discoverthenew <br/><br/> <strong>Are you a data rockstar?</strong>  Do you want to work with the world's best data analytics platform founded by Turing Award winner Dr. Michael Stonebraker with customers such as Uber, AT&T, Cerner, Dreamworks, and Intuit? <br/><br/> Join our sales engineering team responsible for breaking down the technical barriers for adopting the Vertica platform and focused on being the trusted adviser to our customers. <br/><br/> You are a self-starter and a go-getter. <br/><br/> You love solving challenging data, analytics, or machine learning problems in an extremely demanding customer facing position. <br/><br/> You will partner with a world class sales and engineering team and make an immediate impact. <br/><br/> You will be a hands-on customer facing technologist and not just be slinging slideware. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> - Communicate and demonstrate the Vertica story, vision, and technology to prospects and customers <br/><br/> - Work hands-on with prospects and customers to show business value throughout the sales cycle, from demo to proof of concept to solution architecture to customer success <br/><br/> - Continuously learn quickly evolving technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP), Machine Learning <br/><br/> - Become the voice of our customers internally to drive product enhancements and road map <br/><br/> - Travel approximately 50% <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> - Bachelor's degree in a technical area or equivalent practical experience <br/><br/> - Proven extensive experience to develop strong relationships with key decision makers & influencers within elite organizations <br/><br/> - Expert in Data Warehousing, Big Data, or BI / Analytics <br/><br/> - Excellent communication and presentation skills to present to both technical and executive audiences, whether impromptu on a white-board or using presentations and demos <br/><br/> - Highly effective listening and critical thinking skills <br/><br/> - Hands-on, complex problem solver <br/><br/> - Have the technical chops and innate curiosity to learn new technologies quickly in the dynamic big data and analytics space <br/><br/> <strong>The Unique Value of Micro Focus</strong> <br/><br/> At Micro Focus we provide our customers with a best-in-class portfolio of enterprise-grade scalable software with analytics built in. We put customers at the center of our innovation and build high quality products that our teams can be proud of. <br/><br/> Through our breadth of solutions, we are uniquely positioned to help our customers solve business problems and deliver against the needs and opportunities of Hybrid IT, from mainframe to mobile to cloud. We’re a pure-play software company –we have a level of focus that other technology companies don’t have, we are designed from the ground up to build, sell and support software. <br/><br/> We also have the strong operational foundation, proven over a combined 40 years of experience, to deliver on our commitments to our customers. Our scale is global—we have the reach and the capabilities to support customers in a global market. We are the 7th largest software company in the world, and the largest technology company listed on the FTSE. With 4,000 employees working on R&D, we can focus on innovating in solving the most complex technology problems for customers. <br/><br/> At its heart, Hybrid IT is about letting customers choose what’s right for them, without the need to compromise. Our job is to help them, and to enable that hybrid model to bridge the old and the new to maximize the value of existing investments. <br/><br/> Micro Focus is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Prospective employees will receive consideration without discrimination because of race, colour, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. <br/><br/> *LI-JG1 <br/><br/> <strong>Job:</strong><br/><br/>Sales<br/><br/><strong>Job Level:</strong><br/><br/>Expert<br/><br/><strong>Micro Focus is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.</strong> <br/><br/> Micro Focus will comply with all applicable laws related to the use of arrest and conviction records, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws and will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

Title: SCADA Engineer / Technologist All Levels
Job_Description: <div>SCADA Engineer / Technologist All Levels</div>  <p>True North Automation provides a wide range of fully customized, vendor-neutral industrial engineering and automation solutions to companies across Canada, throughout the United States and around the world. Our corporate mantra of "Vision, Talent and Technology" defines both who we are as a company and why you'd want to work at True North. We employ some of the most skilled and versatile people in our industry, who consistently design advanced solutions that when deployed allow our customers to have modern, reliable control and monitoring systems.</p>  <p>Fueled by the momentum of our vendor-neutral, relationship based, people-focused model, True North is poised for strong continued growth. Proud to be recognized by PROFIT Magazine on the prestigious PROFIT HOT 50 list makes us one of Canada's Top Growth Companies. True North has many compelling reasons to join our team. Not only do we provide our employees with high engagement in their work, we offer an environment that will treat you more like a friend than a numbered employee. Team building is a core value at True North, you can lace up your skates and join the company hockey team, or enjoy our annual Christmas party at Banff's Rimrock Hotel. At True North we play as hard as we work and we endeavour to include everyone.</p>  <p>Position</p>  <p>We are currently recruiting for a <strong>SCADA Engineer / Technologist</strong>. This challenging opportunity is to be an integral part of our SCADA project team. The successful candidate will be responsible for specification, configuration and commissioning of SCADA systems.</p>  <p>Main Responsibilities</p>  <ul>  <li>Design and configuration of complete SCADA systems from the RTU's to the Host.</li>  <li>Manage project scope, schedule and budget on projects.</li>  <li>Perform ongoing maintenance and support on previous projects.</li>  <li>Commissioning, testing and troubleshooting remotely and on-site.</li>  <li>Maintain 100% customer satisfaction.</li>  </ul>  <p>Qualifications</p>  <ul>  <li>Bachelors in Engineering or a Diploma in Technology in a related field.</li>  <li>Experience with one or more of the following: FactoryLink, ClearSCADA, PcView, CygNet, Factory Talk, SCADAvantage</li>  <li>Experience with one or more of the following: SCADAPack's, Fisher ROC's, Bristol's, ABB Totalflow's.</li>  <li>Experience in all types of communications and networking: MDS, Freewave and others an asset.</li>  <li>Strong software computer proficiencies: MS Office, SQL, VBScript, Access.</li>  <li>Superb written and spoken communication skills.</li>  <li>Able to adapt to various situations quickly, while adhering to daily deadlines.</li>  <li>Availability to Travel approximately 20% of the time and a valid driver's license.</li>  <li>Experience in Oil/Gas, Manufacturing, Mining, Forestry, Waste Water, Water, Food and Beverage an asset.</li>  </ul>  <p>Please submit your cover letter and resume with "SCADA Engineer / Technologist" as the subject line to careers@truenorthautomation.com</p>  <p>We thank all interested applicants, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.</p>

Title: Junior Structural (Bridges) Engineer
Job_Description: <strong>ISL Engineering and Land Services Ltd.</strong> is an award-winning full-service consulting firm dedicated to working with all levels of government and the private sector to deliver planning and design solutions for transportation, water, and land projects. <br/><br/> Our commitment to client success is built on a strong foundation: we know the communities we serve. This local knowledge, combined with our range of expertise and depth of experience, helps us meet the unique challenges of every project and better understand the role of sustainable solutions in all phases of a project’s life cycle. <br/><br/> ISL Engineering and Land Services is proud to be among Canada’s 30 most environmentally-conscious employers as well as a Platinum Level Small and Medium Best Employer in Canada. ISL supports diversity and is an employment equity employer. <br/><br/> ISL offers opportunities for career development, an employer paid benefits plan, Group RRSP program and competitive salaries with opportunities for an annual bonus.<br/><br/>ISL Engineering and Land Services is seeking a full time Junior Structural Engineer to join our Calgary Bridges team. A strong interest in bridge projects, organizational skills, and good communication skills are a real asset. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Responsibilities:</u></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Design of bridge structures and related components including:   <ul>   <li>Superstructure design</li>  <li>Substructure and foundation design</li>  <li>Retaining wall design</li> </ul>  	</li> <li>Structural analysis and design from the preliminary design phases through to construction;</li>  <li>Use of modelling and analysis software (SAP, CSiBridge, MIDAS);</li>  <li>Preparation of structural calculations and analysis models (SAP, CSiBridge, MIDAS);</li>  <li>Prepare and review mark-ups required for drawing production;</li>  <li>Follow and Participate in Engineering Process and Quality Management Procedures;</li>  <li>Preparation of tender, specifications and contract documents;</li>  <li>Report/proposal writing;</li>  <li>Construction field reviews and site audits;</li>  <li>Assist with construction administration;</li>  <li>Related duties as assigned. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Requirements:</u></li>  </strong>  <li>Degree in Civil Engineering, structural specialization;</li>  <li>Must have experience in prestressed and post-tensioned concrete design;</li>  <li>Highly motivated, enthusiastic team player;</li>  <li>Able to work independently and as an engaged team member;</li>  <li>Excellent verbal and communications skills;</li>  <li>Able to organize time to meet various project deadlines.</li> </ul> <strong>Want to find out more about this or other ISL career opportunities?</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Visit us online at www.islengineering.com</strong>

Us:</strong> <br/><br/> Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the water resources, hydropower, municipal, mining, transportation, geotechnical, oil & gas, and environmental, sectors. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. <br/><br/> We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. Title: Front End Developer - International Software Company
Job_Description: Seequent is a world leader in the development of data visualization software. Our solutions (including Leapfrog and Blockbuster) enable people to create rich stories and uncover valuable insights from geological data, and ultimately make better decisions about their earth, environment and energy challenges. <br/><br/> Our primary development centres are in New Zealand (head office), Canada and South Africa. We also have offices in Australia, Chile, Brazil, Peru, Russia and the UK. The development team in Calgary is seeking a Front-End Developer to support our web-based communication and visualization product, View. <br/><br/> As an experienced Front-End Developer, you see the web as a powerful communication and visualization tool. You have developed in the web space but are looking to really hone your craft and work in web applications that leverage 2D, 3D and 4D visualization. You are well versed in current web technologies and have a good appreciation for design and aesthetics. You want to learn by doing and you live for steep learning curves. <br/><br/> In this role, you will bring and maintain a significant knowledge, competence and capability in front-end web development and you work efficiently with designers and product owners. <br/><br/> You build general, tested code, and refactor as you go. You can plan quickly and test quickly - you know the plan will change.<br/><br/>You will own the forward-facing component of a web application. You will help organize/execute the release of this application and ensure that features are continually tested. You identify and communicate risks and opportunities to business.<br/><br/><strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Minimum 3 years demonstrated development experience with hand-coding HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript</li> <li>University degree in computer science and/or compelling and extensive experience in real-world applications</li> <li>Confident oral and written communication skills in English</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to develop and build sustainable working relationships</li> <li>Team-oriented attitude and good conflict management skills</li> <li>Ability to manage your own workload effectively and to work efficiently alongside team members</li> <li>Balanced and informed approach to problem solving</li> <li>Tenacity, persistence and focus with the ability to prioritize between multiple tasks</li> <li>Ability to work in a quickly growing, fast paced and constantly changing environment</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Our 3D modelling products and collaborative technology are used for projects such as road and rail tunnel construction, groundwater detection and management, geothermal exploration, resource evaluation and estimation, and subterranean storage of spent nuclear fuel. <br/><br/> Seequent's global team is diverse – we’re geologists, software engineers, sales people and communication specialists. We’re technical experts who are driven by the challenges our customers face. We leverage the experience of our people to solve the highly complex problems of today, and work toward the bigger solutions of tomorrow. <br/><br/> We offer market competitive salaries and support continuing growth and education. <br/><br/> If what we do is something that would get you out of bed in the morning, we would love to hear from you.

following technologies: AngularJS, Angular Material, Javascript, jQuery, SCSS, Bootstrap, Ionic</li><li>Experience working with the following technologies would be an asset: Python, Django, Swift or similar (Flask, Rails, Node.js, Go)</li><li>Experience creating prototypes, storyboards, user flows, etc.</li><li>Strong problem solving, testing and debugging skills</li><li>Analytical thinker with the ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment</li><li>Must have a clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design</li><li>Be passionate about all things UI/UX and other areas of development and innovation</li><li>Research and showcase knowledge in the industrys latest trends and technologies</li><li>Exude confidence when collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders to regularly deliver design solutions for approval</li><li>Be willing to learn from and share knowledge/experience with the rest of the team</li> <li>Ability to champion new ideas and develop creative approaches</li><li>Must have the hustle and drive to take initiative and make things happen!</li> </ul> <strong>NOTE: We will only contact qualified candidates of interest</strong>

Title: Software Developer - Contract
Job_Description: DevFacto is eagerly seeking a Senior Software Developer to join us for a placement opportunity with one of our clients. <br/><br/> Were looking for people with a broad range of skills. Bringing a clients vision to life means youll wear a lot of hats. Title: Intermediate Geotechnical Engineer
Job_Description: At Golder, we thrive on challenges. <br/><br/> <strong> Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.</strong>  <br/><br/> Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment? <br/><br/> Golder has a new opportunity for an <strong>Intermediate Geotechnical Engineer</strong> to join our team on a <strong>full time</strong> basis. **This position is based <strong>London, Ontario</strong>** <br/><br/> An overview of your role will include:  <ul> <li> Preparation of technical proposals and reports</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Mentoring and/or directing junior staff on projects</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Design, manage, and undertake a wide variety of geotechnical investigation programs, of various scales</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Assisting in the development of client relationships, business plan development</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Managing technical and financial aspects of geotechnical assignments ranging to as much as $20,00 0</li>  </ul>  <strong>You will have a background in:</strong>  <ul> <li> University graduate with a degree in Geotechnical, Geological or Civil (Geotechnical) Engineering (Master's preferred)</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Currently registered or eligible for registration with PEO</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> A minimum of 5 years of relevant working experience since graduation</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> A sound base in the applicable of Geotechnical Engineering to problem solving</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Experience in problem-solving with common industry commercial computer software for foundation design, slope stability and finite element/difference analyses</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Strong interpersonal communication and critical thinking skills</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Strong written and oral communication skills</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Experience with solving field construction testing and engineering problems</li>  </ul> <br/><br/> <strong> Your benefits at Golder will include:</strong>   <ul> <li> Competitive benefits and remuneration packages</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Option to purchase shares in Golder</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Employee owned structure - own the business, own the result</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> On the job training, mentoring and coaching</li> </ul>  <ul> <li> Global projects and travel opportunities</li>  </ul>  <br/><br/> <strong> One of Canada's Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 11 consecutive years</strong>  <br/><br/> Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 40 countries, Golder's 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors. <br/><br/> Golder is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. As such, Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities, upon request. <br/><br/> <strong> To learn more about our company and culture click here to view</strong>  <strong> The Promise of Golder</strong>  <strong> video.</strong>  <br/>
