Title: Commercial Business Development Manager
Job_Description: The CBDM works collaboratively with the Commercial Account Manager (CAM) and District Commercial Banking Team to seamlessly transfer new customer relationships, with the supporting Customer Action Plan, to the CAM for future revenue generation, in accordance with bank standards and policies and will support retention efforts for this set of customers where warranted. The CBDM will address the customer’s business needs with an emphasis on providing holistic banking solutions across their Operational Business Management Cycle using the RM “The BMO Way” process (The Complete Conversation). This entails identifying and selling appropriate solutions across: Financing, Deposit, Cash Management (Payment and Collections) solutions as well as the referral of complex sales of financing, cash management and Personal/PCG product needs to the appropriate partner (e.g. CFD). In addition, the CBDM will partner with the Cash Management Specialist (CMS) to develop non-standard pricing /negotiated customer proposals that meet profitability standards and ensure that customer loyalty objectives are achieved through the delivery of exceptional service. <br/><br/> The CBDM will ensure credit decisions and recommendations are in accordance with sound credit-granting principles as described in the Commercial Lending Process and in compliance with Bank Policies & Procedures, and ensure compliance with internal and external requirements and regulations. The CBDM plays a strong role as a knowledgeable and experienced professional in the success of the District and is responsible for enhancing BMO’s presence within the community. <br/><br/> <strong>Risk Management</strong>  <ul> <li>Protect the Bank’s assets and maintain quality of the Banks lending portfolio by adhering to Commercial lending processes, policies & procedures, legal and ethical requirements and regulations, audit requirements, and established risk guidelines. Ensure all Commercial Banking Business is in conformity with Bank Policies and other guidelines</li>   <li>Accountable for risk management and minimizing losses through monitoring and control reports, (managing quality of information, analysis, profitability and credit recommendations, ensuring all legal, regulatory, ethical and compliance requirements, audits, and verifications are completed in accordance with Bank Policies & Procedures (i.e. hand off deal with no trailing deficiencies)) in executing sales of credit/non-credit products and services to Commercial customers and prospects</li>   <li>Document and follow-up on any discrepancies to procedures, with significant operational risk and escalate, as required</li>   <li>Respond to questions and/or resolve issues raised through audits and quality checks, to ensure lending decisions are adequately documented, clearly communicated and followed</li>   <li>Exercise individually held Commercial Recommendation Discretionary Limits (i.e.: overdrafts, credit applications), ensuring credit decisions and recommendations are in accordance with sound credit-granting principles and in compliance with the Bank’s policies and related procedures (i.e.: Lending Directives, Commercial Lending Policy, etc.); completing analysis; confirming security valuations; completing and approving credit applications for authorizations under Commercial Lending Policy</li>   <li>Adhere to Know Your Customer Rules and Bank Policies & Procedures for the prevention of loss due to fraud, counterfeiting, money laundering, or defalcation; identify and report suspicious and other reportable transactions or patterns of activity that are suspected to be related to money laundering</li>   <li>Maintain up-to-date knowledge and understanding of Commercial products, processes, and relevant legal, regulatory and technology requirements, including BASEL II risk rating requirements.</li>  </ul> <strong>Planning</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop, implement, review and revise short (3 – 12 months) and long term (1 – 2 year) rolling sales strategies and tactical plans, focusing on identifying profitable business prospects and creating a network of referral sources for the assigned territory that will result in meeting or exceeding sales, service, revenue, share of wallet and loyalty targets.</li>   <li>Apply territory management, relationship selling and relationship expansion strategy and performance to potential Commercial Banking customers ensuring comprehensive, holistic financial solutions</li>   <li>Review and monitor sales, revenue and share of wallet performance against plan, identify gaps, develop appropriate action plans (as appropriate) and share best practices.</li>   <li>Contribute to District Business Plan (as appropriate), regarding new business opportunities, increased profitability and new customer business growth potential, based on knowledge of local marketplace.</li>   <li>Review sales and service plans on an ongoing basis to reflect opportunities and changes in the competitive local market environment; develop an action plan, and update CBAM on any changes that may impact the Area/District Business Plan</li>   <li>Plan, implement and maintain an effective business development and community involvement strategy to protect and expand profitable Commercial businesses, utilizing an extensive network of referral resources</li>   <li>Develop and co-ordinate individual relationship planning, implementation and review activities with key BMO Partner Groups (Corporate Finance, PCG, Transactional Credit, Personal Banking) identifying opportunities to ensure customer’s needs and expectations are profitably met and/or exceeded. Outline to the CAM and CBAM in the Relationship hand off , any significant risk or untoward factors that could impair the ongoing success of the customer from information garnered in relationship and business generation activities.</li>  </ul> <strong>Business Development, Sales and Service</strong>  <ul> <li>Obtain and utilize market/industry/customer knowledge to proactively maximize sales, customer share of wallet increase cash management penetration, revenue per customer and customer loyalty for all new customers</li>   <li>Complete proactive, focused, profitable sales of commercial solutions based on referrals/prospects, and knowledge of the assigned territory to improve share of wallet and market share</li>   <li>Concurrently support commercial market share expansion, customer experience and share of wallet objectives to achieve revenue growth, share of wallet, acquisition, cash management sales, and customer loyalty objectives leveraging the RM The BMO Way process and The Complete Conversation</li>   <li>Be highly visible in the marketplace to proactively, and with a long-term focus, develop an internal and external network of referral sources that effectively generates prospects for new business to maintain a consistent pipeline of prospective customers for future execution. This will include Corporate Finance Account Managers, financial investors, financial professionals & consultants.</li>   <li>Provide prospective commercial customers holistic banking solutions to meet their banking needs across the customers’ entire Operational Business Management Cycle: Make Payments, Collect Funds, Manage Deposits and Financing</li>   <li>Establish linkages with PCG Partners, Headquarters and “Industry Specialty” Groups, to leverage sales and referral opportunities, improve share of wallet, and to maximize customer experience and profitability to the bank</li>   <li>Contribute to the Bank’s business objectives and increasing share of wallet through direct market intervention by way of sales calls (individually and jointly with DVP, Commercial Account Managers, CMS), establishing a personal referral network and other business development activities.</li>   <li>Accountable for proactive, focused sales of Commercial solutions and services, based on referrals/prospects, knowledge of local market,</li>   <li>Develop an understanding of cross channel sales referral processes, local market, and existing business relationships to maximize balance acquisition, share of wallet, revenue, and to acquire new Commercial customers</li>   <li>Establish and enhance the Bank’s profile by participating in meaningful and focused business and community activities and seeking out and creating opportunities to generate new Commercial business</li>   <li>Apply resourceful business development and relationship management sales and service principles, practices and techniques, to support the achievement of target level sales of Commercial lending ,deposit products and services, including complex cash management solutions</li>   <li>Champion a sales environment that achieves consistent, superior customer service and good working relationships with Commercial Account Manager, Customer Service Officers (CSO’s), , Cash Management Specialist (CMS), Personal Banking and PCG Banking partners</li>   <li>Leverage technology, applications and tools to identify and refer profitable sales opportunities and to ensure optimal effectiveness, efficiency, and delivery of Commercial products and services</li>   <li>Accompany and support the District Vice-President and Commercial Account Manager with customer interactions, and relationship building</li>   <li>Develop and co-ordinate individual relationship planning, implementation and review activities with key BMO Partner Groups (Corporate Finance, PCG, Personal Banking) identifying opportunities to ensure customer’s needs and expectations are profitably met and/or exceeded. Outline to the CAM and CBAM in the Relationship hand off , any significant risk or untoward factors that could impair the ongoing success of the customer from information garnered in relationship and business generation activities.</li>   <li>Effectively transition the relationship management of all new customers to the appropriate CAM at the appropriate time and in accordance with bank standards.</li>   <li>Provide timely and effective problem resolution, escalating customer issues as necessary as per the established Problem Resolution Process</li>   <li>Respond to questions and/or issues raised relative to customers that have been handed off to the Commercial Account Manager ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction.</li>  </ul> <strong>Role Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Commercial Credit Qualification with Limits</li>   <li>L1- Working/L2 In-Depth understanding of Commercial Products, Commercial Lending Process, Commercial Lending Directives, enterprise credit risk policies and standards and all supporting processes and technology</li>   <li>L2 -Designated Real Estate Account manager (DREAM) designation is required for this role with the DREAM designation level aligned to the portfolio customers being managed (ie. Portfolio requirement to manage customers with construction risk vs. no construction risk).</li>  </ul> <strong>Preferred:</strong> Credit adjudication experience. Good understanding of capital structuring to support the identification of referral <br/><br/> We’re here to help <br/><br/> At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. <br/><br/> As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. <br/><br/> To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com. <br/><br/> BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Front-End Web Developer
Job_Description: Autodata Solutions is looking for a <strong>Senior Front-End Web Developer</strong> in our Calgary, AB office! <br/><br/> We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. This is an opportunity for a Senior Leader manage both sides and define not only how the application looks, but how it works. You will translate the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application while integrating SEO principals into your design. Through collaboration with our backend developers, you will integrate REST service endpoints to the UI through AJAX calls and design the expected output from the services. MUST have solid previous experience with ReactJS to join this project. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop new user-facing features while buiding reusable code and libraries for future use</li> <li>Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs</li> <li>Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability</li> <li>Integrate user interfaces with backend REST services</li> <li>Execute effectively in a high-volume, fast-changing work environment while managing multiple time-critical issues</li> <li>Act as technical advisor to business owners, project management, UX Designers</li> <li>Troubleshoot issues with code, integrations, and other related website properties</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years of hands-on experience designing and building React.js applications</li> <li>5+ years professional experience with web markup, including HTML5, CSS3, and Javascript up to and including ECMAScript 6</li> <li>Demonstrable experience implementing SEO principles and ensuring that the application will adhere to them</li> <li>Good understanding of build tools, including Gulp, Bower, Webpack, and Yeoman</li> <li>Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery</li> <li>Good understanding of other advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS (vs 1 and 2), KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, Meteor, DurandalJS etc.</li> <li>Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX</li> <li>Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus</li> <li>Working knowledge of NodeJS, including Express, Meteor, and other modules</li> <li>Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git / Mercurial / SVN</li> </ul> For more information about Autodata, please visit our company website: www.autodata.net. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified. Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please specify.

Title: Senior Field Engineer - Infrastructure
Job_Description: <strong>Career Opportunity Senior Field Engineer Infrastructure</strong> <br/><br/> Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, youll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. Youll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. <br/><br/> We rank among Canadas largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If youre eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. <br/><br/> As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). <br/><br/> <u><strong>About The Role</strong></u> <br/><br/> <em><strong>As a Senior Field Engineer at Graham you will:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Assist Project Managers and Estimators in pursuing and securing new work.</li> <li>Take an active role in transitioning new projects from the pursuit phase to the execution phase with the support of the Project Manager and Superintendent.</li> <li>Take on a field-based leadership role during the execution of projects, supporting the Superintendent and Project Manager in any capacity required to ensure that the projects objectives are successfully achieved.</li> <li>Assist with the development and maintenance of project schedules using P6 software.</li> <li>Assist in the development and monitoring of project budgets and overall project performance.</li> <li>Implement project-specific safety and quality plans and update them as required during the project.</li> <li>Assist the Superintendent in developing workface plans for critical construction tasks.</li> <li>Manage project documentation requirements; proactively address submittals, RFIs, and other project documentation in order to ensure that construction work can proceed without delay.</li> <li>Assist with surveying and project layout as required; maintain and update red-line drawings.</li> <li>Assist with coordinating subcontractors, vendors, and field staff.</li> <li>Attend relevant project meetings and liaise with clients and consultants to the extent required.</li> <li>Prepare memos, letters, meeting minutes, subcontracts, and other forms and documents.</li> <li>Assist with estimating and soliciting subcontractors and/or suppliers for information and pricing</li> </ul> <em><strong>To be Successful at Graham, you will have the following qualifications and experience:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Have a degree relevant to the construction industry. Civil, Structural, or Mechanical engineering is preferred. A Professional Engineering designation is considered an asset.</li> <li>5 - 8 years of relevant construction field experience.</li> <li>Willing to relocate and/or travel to projects in various locations throughout Alberta.</li> <li>Experience working at a General Contractor, including construction management knowledge of projects in the water/wastewater and/or transportation sectors.</li> <li>Good communication, problem-solving, organizational and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Computer literate in Microsoft Office, Primavera P6, and AutoDesk.</li> </ul> <em><strong>Compensation and Benefits:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary with annual bonus potential</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan.</li> <li>Ownership and long term equity opportunities</li> </ul> <u><strong>About Us</strong></u> <br/><br/> <em><strong>What we can offer you:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Strong commitment to safety in the workplace</li> <li>Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector</li> <li>Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America</li> </ul> Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. <br/><br/> <strong>We're Building careers, not filling jobs.</strong> <br/><br/> View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. <br/><br/> Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Graham Management Services LP <br/><br/> 10840 27th Street SE <br/><br/> Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 <br/><br/> Fax: 403.570.5190

Title: Civil Engineer EIT
Job_Description: Your Opportunity <p>Our Water sector, which brings together many of the world’s top engineers and scientists, sees water a bit differently—as a single holistic system rather than as unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. We use this perspective to help communities tap into water’s potential. Throughout the life cycle of capture, use, reuse, and discharge, our team optimizes every facet of a water system.</p> <p> </p> <p>Whether a project calls for planners, designers, construction managers, or facility operators, we have the right experts to provide creative, yet practical, water solutions. Through our cost-effective strategies, we’re helping communities increase their water efficiency and protect their water resources for future generations. Join our team as we create new ways to tap into water’s vast potential.</p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p>Stantec is currently looking to add a<strong> Civil</strong> <strong>Engineer in Training</strong> to support our growing Water Resources practice. We encourage you to apply if you possess or would like to gain experience in a broad range of water-related engineering projects, with specific emphasis on industrial stormwater management water resources infrastructure projects. Applicants should be capable of working effectively with teams and clients, and be willing to learn from peers and supervisors</p> <p> </p> Your Duties <p>• Cooperatively support multidisciplinary teams on small- to mid-sized projects and work on several projects concurrently.</p> <p>• Perform preliminary and detailed analysis for industrial stormwater runoff.</p> <p>• Perform detailed analysis for hydraulic and hydrologic modeling using PCSWMM modeling software.</p> <p>• Preparation of studies, design criteria, design reports, plans and specifications, and quality assurance reviews of related designs and construction plans to ensure technical accuracy.</p> <p>• Inspect construction for compliance with design drawings and specifications.</p> <p>• Assist in project administration including writing reports, gathering information, preparing proposals and budgets, and completing progress reports.</p> <p>• Evaluate alternatives and resolve technical questions.</p> <p>• Work in a manner to ensure your personal safety and that of fellow employees by following company health and safety guideline and policies.</p> <p> </p> Your Capabilities and Credentials <ul>  <li>Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Civil or Water Resources Engineering.</li>  <li>Registration as an Engineer-in-Training with APEGA or qualifications to obtain this registration at the start of employment.</li>  <li>Strong organizational skills and multitasking ability. </li>  <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work with engineering staff at all levels. </li>  <li>Ability to prepare complete, concise and organized engineering calculations and analyses.</li>  <li>Desire to grow in your career in a challenging environment that fosters self-improvement though leadership, mentoring, and a diversity of experience.</li>  <li>Strong willingness to be a part of a large global engineering company, and to work with teams in other offices around the world.</li> </ul> <p>You will be based out of Calgary, but the position may require occasional project travel throughout western Canada</p> <p>Qualified candidates who are highly motivated and eager to commit to Stantec's strategic initiative to become a Top 10 global design firm should submit their resume and cover letter online at www.stantec.com/careers. </p> <p> </p>

Title: Web Developer
Job_Description: Web Developer<br/><br/>Pandell is growing and back on the search for more great Developers!! We're looking for an Intermediate PHP Developer who is smart, ambitious, and passionate about their craft. Picture yourself building a successful career at Pandell - working alongside our expanding team of talented, driven team members.<br/><br/>Why Work at Pandell?   <ul>   <li><strong>Winner of Alberta's Best Workplaces (Benefits, Perks & Incentives)</strong></li> <li>Profit sharing</li> <li>Flexible hours / Casual work environment</li> <li>Training budget</li> <li>Competitive benefits package</li> <li>Fully stocked kitchen</li> <li>Games room & lounge area</li> <li>Awesome new development machines (full accessories & dual monitor)</li> <li>Rebates for personal fitness and electronics purchases</li> <li>And much more - Check out our Life at Pandell video!</li> </ul>  The Ideal Candidate   <ul> <li>3+ years of PHP software development experience</li> <li>Will have strong technical skills in the following web based technologies: PHP and PHP frameworks, JavaScript, jQuery, MySQL</li> <li>Experience with the following is also preferable: C#, SQL Server, TypeScript, React, Git, ASP.NET</li> <li>Is passionate, self-motivated and excels at delivering high quality code, using multiple styles of programming</li> <li>Has a strong understanding of team development including source control technology, product deployment strategies, and team software design</li> </ul>  <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Review, analyze, program, and deploy software products</li> <li>Use tools as provided for proper software source code management and business operations</li> <li>Provide software design and architectural input</li> </ul> Please note this is a Calgary based position and not available for remote work.<br/><br/>Interested in this career?<br/><br/>Send your resume to careers@pandell.com. <br/><br/> Please include the position for which you are applying in the subject line of your e-mail. <br/><br/> Remote work is not available for this position.

Title: Post Doctoral Fellowship, Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering
Job_Description: <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Area</strong>: Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments <br/> <strong>Duration</strong>: 2 years <br/> <strong>Start</strong> <strong>Date</strong>: As soon as possible, until the position is filled <br/> <strong>Annual</strong> <strong>Stipend</strong>: $45,000 CAD/year <br/><br/> The <strong>Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering</strong> in the <strong>Schulich School of Engineering</strong> at the University of Calgary is accepting applications for a Postdoctoral Fellow in “Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments”<strong>.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Job Description:</strong> <br/><br/> Focusing on Human Interaction and Analytics within Virtual Environments, the R&D project is to address the challenges of accurately communicating/displaying multi-dimensional information to human users in the most efficient and effective manner. Based on a Virtual-Reality (VR) platform of interactive and visual analytics, a key aspect of the project is accommodating human cognitive constraints to achieve new insights about highly complex multisensory data and to handle ill-defined and unstructured phenomena. <br/><br/> The project is funded by the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council (NSERC) of Canada. The working environment includes the Schulich School of Engineering at the University of Calgary. The Postdoctoral Fellow will have opportunities to engage in research collaborating closely with researchers/engineers/scientists from national and international research institutes and industry. The position offers a unique multidisciplinary opportunity to be part of cutting edge R&D on VR applications. <br/><br/> R&D Objectives: The research of the Postdoctoral Fellow will focus on the following objectives: <ul> 	<li>Neural mechanisms of multi-sensory integration for facilitating interactive and visual analytics of complex data;</li>	<li>Algorithms of the multi-sensory integration based upon the neural mechanisms;</li> 	<li>Evaluation of the prototype of VR systems.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> 	<li>PhD in the computer science, engineering, or other related fields: The applicant must have completed (or be within three months of completing) their degree. Applicants who hold the degree must have obtained it within the last five years or have been actively working in a related field.</li>	<li>Brain-Machine Interfaces (BMI) and neurosciences: Sound experience in BMI and good knowledge of neurosciences are essential. Familiarization with EEG devices, eye trackers and associated data processing are very desirable. Preference will be given to applicants with demonstrated BMI research activities.</li> 	<li>Software development: Solid and demonstrated software development experience is essential. Working knowledge of Machine Learning would be desirable.</li> 	<li>Usability Engineering: Knowledge of testing and evaluating the usability of software/hardware systems is desirable. Knowledge and experience of VR technologies would be an asset.</li> 	<li>Communication: The applicant must possess excellent English written and verbal communication. The role will involve a significant amount of communication between varying levels of personnel in academia and industries. The applicant must be capable of communicating potential complex concepts in terms understandable by the various groups involved.</li>	<li>Working Style: The applicant must be capable of working in a self-directed/motivated manner and within a team environment.</li> </ul> <strong>Application details:</strong> <br/><br/> Send (via email) a letter of interest, a CV, and samples of publications to: <br/><br/> Prof. Yaoping Hu <br/> Email: huy@ucalgary.ca <br/> Dept. of Electrical and Computer Engineering <br/> Schulich School of Engineering <br/> University of Calgary <br/> 2500 University Drive, NW <br/> Calgary, Alberta, Canada T2N 1N4 <br/><br/> <strong>Applications will be accepted until the position is filled.</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> To learn more about postdoctoral scholar opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Postdoc Careers website</strong>. For more information about the Schulich School of Engineering visit <strong>Careers in the Schulich School of Engineering</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> To succeed as one of Canada’s top universities, where new ideas are created, tested and applied through first-class teaching and research, the University of Calgary needs more of the best minds in our classrooms and labs. We’re increasing our scholarly capacity by investing in people who want to change the world, bringing the best and brightest to Calgary to form a global intellectual hub and achieve advances that matter to everyone. <br/><br/> <strong>About Calgary, Alberta</strong> <br/><br/> Calgary is one of the world's cleanest cities and has been named one of the world's most livable cities for years. Calgary is a city of leaders – in business, community, philanthropy and volunteerism. Calgarians benefit from the strongest economy in the nation and enjoy more days of sunshine per year than any other major Canadian city. Calgary is less than an hour’s drive from the Rocky Mountains and boasts the most extensive urban pathway and bikeway network in North America. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.</em>

Title: Business Development Director – Franchising
Job_Description: <DIV>Join our growing team and help make us the Bank of Business in Canada</DIV> <br/> <DIV>We’re on a journey to become the ‘bank of choice’ for the franchising sector. We’re looking for enthusiastic people with the business development, sales and analytical skills to provide industry-leading financial solutions that continue to differentiate BMO in this growing and diverse sector.</DIV>  <br/> <DIV>BMO’s financing programs meet the unique needs of franchise networks from start-up to multi-unit consolidations. We’re building our reputation in the franchising sector, and opportunities to provide banking and financing solutions are available. Our holistic approach to the franchising sector is complemented by our partnership with BMO Business Banking, BMO Retail Banking, BMO Private Banking and BMO Capital Markets.</DIV>  <br/> <DIV>BMO expansion includes introducing Business Development Directors as franchising sector market leaders into six regions nationally with high concentrations of franchise networks.</DIV>  <br/> <DIV>What is the opportunity?</DIV> <br/> <DIV>Reporting directly to the Head, Franchise Sector, the Business Development Director is accountable for the implementation of the franchising sector strategy to optimize the client experience and loyalty, drive sales results and maximize sustainable profitability in alignment with BMO’s risk appetite.</DIV>  <br/> <DIV>What will you do?</DIV> <br/> <DIV>The Business Development Director acts as the industry segment leader for their designated geographic region. They will represent BMO in external communications including promotional opportunities including industry conferences and symposia, on professional committees and in community activities, all to network for profitable client relationships.</DIV>  <br/><strong><DIV>The Business Development Director will:</DIV> <br/> </strong>  <li>Generate new and profitable business in the franchise industry segment;</li> <li>Define the desired client experience within their region;</li> <li>Maintain an active outreach with key clients and prospects, and to work collaboratively with the district business banking team to identify prospective clients, drive growth and aid in retention efforts of the franchise portfolio;</li> <li>Leverage partnerships with internal BMO parties such as retail and private bankers to deliver a holistic offering and enhanced client experience;</li> <li>Provide leadership on all matters related to financing solutions for the franchise sector for the region’s business bank and all banking partners;</li> <li>Develop and manage relationships with key influencers and partners in the franchise ecosystem for the region, which includes regional and national sponsorships.</li> What you bring to the table: <br/><br/> • Demonstrated history of business development and sales. <br/><br/> • Experience and demonstrated strong knowledge of the franchise industry. <br/><br/> • Inclusive of a minimum of 3 years’ relationship management experience providing business banking solutions to franchise networks. <br/><br/> • Established presence in the franchise ecosystem. <br/><br/> • Comfortable when interacting with business leaders, up to the C-suite level. <br/><br/> • Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written. <br/><br/> • Strong negotiation skills. <br/><br/> • Strong due diligence skills, including loan structure terms & conditions. <br/><br/> We’re here to help <br/><br/> At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. <br/><br/> As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. <br/><br/> To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com. <br/><br/> BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Field Engineer - Infrastructure
Job_Description: <strong>Career Opportunity Field Engineer Infrastructure</strong> <br/><br/> Graham is a growing, dynamic and innovative construction solutions provider with history of success dating back to 1926. As an employee-owned company, youll be able to capitalize on our collective success by becoming an owner yourself. Youll also be able to take advantage of professional development, learning and growth opportunities, while working on exciting, leading-edge projects. <br/><br/> We rank among Canadas largest construction companies, are a Platinum Member of Canadas 50 Best Managed Companies and are seeking top tier talent to further strengthen our capabilities. We provide a collaborative and caring culture and the necessary tools and support for you to succeed, both personally and professionally. If youre eager to work on innovative projects, be part of a great team and become an employee-owner, Graham is the place for you. <br/><br/> As a member of our Infrastructure group, you will provide insight and innovative construction solutions to ensure the successful execution of various infrastructure projects, such as: roadways, highways and interchanges; bridges and overpasses; water and wastewater treatment facilities; transmission lines; general/public transportation including airports, seaports and light rail transit lines (LRTs); and conventional and alternative power generation like wind farms and district energy facilities. You will also further hone your skills operating under various delivery methods including Design-Build, P3 (Public-Private Partnership), Construction Management and IPD (Integrated Project Delivery). <br/><br/> <u><strong>About The Role</strong></u> <br/><br/> <em><strong>As a Field Engineer at Graham you will:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Assist Project Managers and Estimators in pursuing and securing new work.</li> <li>Take an active role in transitioning new projects from the pursuit phase to the execution phase with the support of the Project Manager and Superintendent.</li> <li>Take on a field-based leadership role during the execution of projects, supporting the Superintendent and Project Manager in any capacity required to ensure that the projects objectives are successfully achieved.</li> <li>Assist with the development and maintenance of project schedules using P6 software.</li> <li>Assist in the development and monitoring of project budgets and overall project performance.</li> <li>Implement project-specific safety and quality plans and update them as required during the project.</li> <li>Assist the Superintendent in developing workface plans for critical construction tasks.</li> <li>Manage project documentation requirements; proactively address submittals, RFIs, and other project documentation in order to ensure that construction work can proceed without delay.</li> <li>Assist with surveying and project layout as required; maintain and update red-line drawings.</li> <li>Assist with coordinating subcontractors, vendors, and project support staff.</li> <li>Attend relevant project meetings and liaise with clients and consultants to the extent required.</li> <li>Prepare memos, letters, meeting minutes, subcontracts, and other forms and documents.</li> <li>Assist with estimating and soliciting subcontractors and/or suppliers for information and pricing</li> </ul> <em><strong>To be Successful at Graham, you will have the following qualifications and experience:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Degree in Engineering or Diploma in Engineering Technology.</li> <li>2 - 5 years of relevant construction field experience.</li> <li>Willing to relocate and/or travel to projects in various locations throughout Alberta.</li> <li>Experience working at a General Contractor, including construction management knowledge of projects in the water/wastewater and/or transportation sectors.</li> <li>Good communication, problem-solving, organizational and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Computer literate in Microsoft Office, Primavera P6, and AutoDesk.</li> </ul> <em><strong>Compensation and Benefits:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Competitive salary with annual bonus potential</li> <li>Comprehensive benefits package including dental, optical and medical and company matched pension plan.</li> <li>Ownership and long term equity opportunities</li> </ul> <u><strong>About Us</strong></u> <br/><br/> <em><strong>What we can offer you:</strong></em>  <ul> <li>Strong commitment to safety in the workplace</li> <li>Grounded and family-oriented workplace in a progressive environment that is at the forefront of a fast evolving business sector</li> <li>Commitment to the training and wealth of opportunities for career development across job categories, project types and locations around North America</li> </ul> Graham is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Graham does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by country, regional or local law. <br/><br/> <strong>We're Building careers, not filling jobs.</strong> <br/><br/> View available job opportunities and submit your application online at http://careers.grahambuilds.com/. <br/><br/> Applications will only be accepted as online submissions through the Graham website. <br/><br/> <em><strong>Please, no unsolicited resumes or phone inquiries from agencies, thank you.</strong></em> <br/><br/> Graham Management Services LP <br/><br/> 10840 27th Street SE <br/><br/> Calgary, AB T2Z 3R6 <br/><br/> Fax: 403.570.5190

Title: Fracture Mechanics Program Engineer
Job_Description: Your Opportunity<br/><br/>Finding efficient, safe, and economical ways to develop and deliver oil and gas is an ongoing challenge. From the Arctic to the Canadian oil sands and the US shale plays, our Oil & Gas team partners with clients to provide engineering, procurement, construction management (EPCM), integrity, permitting, survey, and environmental services across the upstream, midstream, and downstream oil and gas industry. We design and support the lifecycle maintenance of facilities, pipelines, terminals, and refineries, as well as critical infrastructure like processing plants and field facilities. Through our partnerships, industry experience, and use of technology, we develop new and inventive ways to solve emerging issues, meet regulations, and increase productivity. Explore your career options with us. <br/><br/> We are currently seeking a <strong>Fracture Mechanics Program Engineer</strong> to join our <strong>Oil & Gas</strong> group in <strong>Southeast <strong>Calgary.</strong> </strong> <br/><br/> The Fracture Mechanics Program Engineer shall have strong technical, organizational and people skills, with a focus on integration of fracture mechanics into the integrity assessments and integrity program development. At all times, the focus will be efficient, timely and high quality deliverables to the client through an attention to details. <br/><br/> The role will require selection and application of appropriate materials testing, Fitness-for-Service and engineering methods and principles to conduct detailed engineering assessment of material imperfections relating to steel and pipe manufacturing, construction and joining as well as environmental and mechanical effects. Project experience with low-frequency long seam ERW and fatigue will be an asset. The candidate shall have a strong work ethic, enjoy working in a team environment and will desire to have a career in the integrity management field.<br/><br/>Your Duties   <ul>   <li>Application of Pipeline Facility Fitness-for-Service codes and standards</li> <li>Project management, responsible for overall project cost, schedule and deliverables</li> <li>Sharing knowledge through informal presentations and one-on one coaching & mentoring</li> <li>Set an example through responsible, safety-conscious conduct</li> <li>Meet all requirements of Client and Stantec Quality Systems</li> <li>Strengthen technical knowledge through on-the-job, informal and formal training</li> <li>Be familiar with and ensure appropriate industry-accepted methods are utilized at all times</li> <li>Be familiar with applicable codes and regulations</li> <li>Liaise and interact with Stantec peers</li> <li>Establish and maintain positive client relationships</li> </ul>  Your Capabilities and Credentials   <ul>   <li>Graduate or Post-graduate Engineering Degree in Fracture Mechanics</li> <li>Eligible for P.Eng. registration with APEGA</li> <li>3+ years of laboratory experience in tensile, Charpy V-notch, CTOD, metallurgical and fractography analysis</li> <li>Crack Defect assessment experience, including application of CorLas, BS7910, API 579, API 1104, CSA Z662 Annex K</li> <li>BMT Flawcheck and Quest Signal software</li> <li>Experience with Canadian standards, practices and applicable legislation</li> <li>Demonstrated technical proficiency</li> <li>Strong interpersonal, communication, analytical and problem solving skills</li> <li>Demonstrated process improvement skills</li> <li>Demonstrated initiative, flexibility and adaptability</li> </ul> <em>We would like to thank all candidates who apply; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.</em>

Title: Junior Geotechnical or Civil Engineer
Job_Description: <div><div>Reporting to the Team Lead, you will be a key team member in a close-knit civil/geotechnical team that provides Engineering solutions to our Clients in Alberta, Canada and around the world. <br/><br/> You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of large-scale, world-class projects involving the design, construction and operations for oil sands and mining projects and a wide range of civil engineering projects including roads, railways, water resource dams, oil and gas facilities and heavy civil infrastructure. <br/><br/> KCB is an established, award winning company with a global influence whose success is based on delivering solutions to the toughest technical challenges facing our clients. KCB continues to grow and has an exciting future in several strategic markets in Canada, United States and internationally. This role will give you the opportunity to help us grow the Resources Group in Alberta and Saskatchewan and advance your career in our One Team culture that values a winning attitude, continual learning and innovation, adaptability and flexibility, engagement, and having fun. <br/><br/> <strong>This role will give you the opportunity to:</strong>  <ul> <li>Work on a variety of local and international projects that may include site characterization, geohazard risk assessment and control, terrain analysis, slope stability, numerical modeling, foundation design, tailings dam design, mine and tailings planning, mine pit slope design, embankment dams and earthworks design.</li>  <li>Get involved in site investigation and drilling programs, core logging, lab testing, instrumentation installations and monitoring and data review and analysis.</li>  <li>Build and develop strong relationships with multidisciplinary project teams, sub-contractors, clients, and other project stakeholders.</li>  <li>Use your problem-solving ability to find innovative solutions to technical challenges.</li>  <li>Receive on-going guidance and mentorship from leaders in the industry in a supportive, dynamic company culture that supports career development.</li>  <li>Travel to various project sites in Alberta and British Columbia with potential opportunities to travel internationally on mining projects.</li> </ul> <strong>If you have a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Geotechnical or Civil Engineering, are registered, or are eligible to register as an Engineer-In-Training in the province of Alberta, and have up to 24 months of related work experience we want to hear from you!</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>We value your:</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong initiative, innovation and commitment to technical excellence as well as your enthusiasm and drive toward long-term success.</li>  <li>Flexibility, adaptability and willingness to learn and travel.</li>  <li>Being able to work as part of an established team.</li>  <li>Interpersonal, decision-making and technical skills.</li>  <li>Experience in CAD software, such as AutoCAD and Civil 3D.</li>  <li>Experience in various design software, such as Slope/W, Seep/W, Soil Vision, FLAC.</li>  <li>Ability to manage workload to meet Client requirements.</li> </ul> <strong>About Us:</strong> <br/><br/> Klohn Crippen Berger (KCB) is a multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and environmental services in the mining, hydropower, environmental, transportation, geotechnical, oil & gas, and water resources sectors. We offer a full range of services from our offices in Canada, Australia, Peru and Brazil. KCB is a member of the Louis Berger Group, a leading international consulting firm with more than 80 offices worldwide. Klohn Crippen Berger is a platinum member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. <br/><br/> From our offices in Calgary, Edmonton and Saskatoon, our Alberta Group works on challenging projects in the Oil and Gas industry, Oil Sands developments, Water, Power and Transportation markets, and Mining. We are a leader in tailings management, dam design, multi-disciplinary civil engineering services, geotechnical and foundation engineering, hydrogeology, hydrotechnical, and environmental and reclamation services. <br/><br/> We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We offer competitive salaries commensurate with experience and an attractive flexible benefits package designed to suit your individual needs. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Are you up to the challenge?</em></strong> <br/><br/> If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé and covering letter quoting the job reference number 1342-A18. <br/><br/> We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted.</div> </div><div></div>

Title: Project Development Manager

The Manager, Project Development will be responsible to promote, develop and manage Clark Builders strategic relationships to seek and attract business to ensure growth and success of the Southern Alberta Business Unit, and Clark Builders as a whole. This includes seeking opportunities across Western Canada. <br/><br/> <strong>Duties/Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li><div>Execute the business development strategy to achieve growth targets</div></li><li><div>Initiate and maintain excellent relationships with new and existing clients in the primary strategic area of focus; seniors, healthcare, commercial, institutional, public assembly, residential, education</div></li><li><div>Recognize opportunities for business that may arise in secondary areas of focus: self perform concrete, metal building solutions, metal cladding solutions, solar and energy</div> </li><li><div>Understand client needs and be able to communicate with confidence how Clark Builders can successfully meet those objectives</div></li><li><div>Research in order to identify emerging market opportunities and monitor competitor activities</div> </li><li><div>Review and understand request for proposals in order to complete pre-qualification requirements for projects and attend pre-bid meetings</div></li><li><div>Work with the Estimating and Project Development team to provide and create proposal content, complete prequalification documents to successful outcomes, manage pre-construction estimates and create development strategies to secure projects</div></li><li><div>Help develop and implement market strategies and identify target market groups and areas</div></li><li><div>Attend pre-award meetings as required and assist in the negotiation of final contracts</div></li><li><div>Identify new work leads and manage lead follow-up, record keeping and information distribution</div></li><li><div>Follow up with clients after the award of a project to ensure superior customer service and identify opportunities for additional work</div></li><li><div>Assist other members of the in the development and creation of effective promotional literature for the business unit</div></li><li><div>Work with associations, industry and community groups to help develop the Clark Builders brand</div></li><li><div>Coordinate and facilitate Clark Builders industry outreach and networking events</div></li><li><div>Other duties and responsibilities as required</div></li> </ul> <strong>Skills & Knowledge:</strong> <ul> <li><div>Track record of success with excellent relationships in the commercial construction business community</div> </li><li><div>Well-established network of industry contacts</div> </li><li><div>Strong personal motivation and business development skills needed to proactively generate and win major project opportunities</div></li><li><div>Proven ability to build strategic relationships with high level influencers</div> </li><li><div>Resource development experience</div></li><li><div>Superior communication skills (verbal, written & presentation)</div></li><li><div>Friendly, outgoing demeanour with strong diplomatic skills to deal with a large variety of personalities with an ability to explain, defend and present ideas</div></li><li><div>Strong team player who is able to work effective with a wide array of individuals</div> </li><li><div>Excellent organizational, analytical and negotiation skills</div></li><li><div>Capable of working under pressure to meet deadlines and prioritize work</div> </li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications & Experience:</strong> <ul> <li><div>Post Secondary Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Business</div> </li><li>A minimum of 10+ years relevant experience with a commercial construction company</li><li>Existing relationships with key stakeholders in the specific sectors of focus considered a definite asset</li><li>Strong knowledge and understanding of industrial site construction will be considered as asset</li><li>Proven track record in delivering and managing the preconstruction process for complex projects</li><li>Experience with estimating, project management, and/or preconstruction</li><li>Experience and success with RFQ/RFP response creation, content development, and execution from submission to award.</li> </ul>

Title: Data Virtualization Developer
Job_Description: <strong><em>Cadeon Inc</em></strong>. is the Trusted Authority on turning Information into money. We equip our clients to leverage their information which enables them to become highly efficient companies. We are seeking like-minded, dynamic, focused and creative individuals to join our growing team as we expand our workforce in our Calgary headquarters. <br/><br/> <strong><em>Cadeon Inc</em></strong>. is seeking a <strong>Data Virtualization Developer</strong> to support the design, development and delivery of data integration capabilities using tools like TIBCO Data Virtualization and /or Denodo. <br/><br/> <strong>Required Skills</strong><strong>:</strong> <ul> <li>At least 3+ years of development experience with Data Virtualization</li><li>Should have hand on experience with TIBCO Data Virtualization (former Cisco DV / Composite) AND / OR Denodo</li><li>Should have technical experience with TIBCO Data Virtualization (former Cisco DV / Composite) AND / OR Denodo</li><li>Experience with Java, Web Services / Service Bus and XML knowledge</li><li>Strong development, analytical and structured problem-solving skills</li><li>Experience with Oracle and SQL Server Databases. specifications into virtualization views and/or underlying code.</li><li>Strong ability to develop meaningful, repeatable and consistent quality checks throughout the development process.</li><li>Experience implementing security (Authentication and Authorizations) in Data Virtualization views</li><li>Must have a working knowledge of how to migrate code across environments (Dev QA PROD)</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to Have's:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with BI / Analytics tools such as TIBCO Spotfire, Power BI, Tableau, Qlikview, etc.</li><li>Degree in Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent</li><li>Experience in Business Intelligence</li><li>Experience in automation</li><li>Experience in oil & gas upstream, midstream and/or downstream business</li><li>Experience in Finance or working with financial data</li> </ul> <strong>Client Facing Skill-set:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience at working both independently, and in a team-oriented, cross functional collaborative environment is essential</li><li>Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Must have strong communication skills as this candidate will interface with the business clients directly</li><li>Able to actively address business requests, clearly communicate commitments, issues, completion dates and provides meaningful status to project stakeholders</li><li>Must have strong written and effective verbal communication skills</li><li>Ability to build relationships and work effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues at all levels</li><li>Strong analytical/problem solving skills with the ability to plan, prioritize and execute in a fast/ high-pressured environment</li><li>Ability to work independently and under minimal supervision while demonstrating strong self-management and self-organization skills</li><li>Close attention to detail; commitment to accuracy</li><li>Upstream, Midstream or Downstream Oil and Gas domain knowledge would be a strong advantage</li> </ul> Our employees are considered the most valued part of our organization. We demonstrate this commitment to our employees by offering a competitive salary and a comprehensive employee benefits package.

Title: Specialist Business Systems - SAP Developer
Job_Description: <ul>  <li>Req ID: 70704</li> <li>Department: Information Services</li> <li>Job Type: Full-Time</li> <li>Position Type: Non-Union</li> <li>Location: Calgary, Alberta</li> <li>Country: Canada</li> <li>% of Travel: 0-10%</li> <li># of Positions: 1.00</li> <li>Job Available to: Internal & External</li> <li>Deadline to apply: 05/16/2018</li> </ul>  Canadian Pacific is a transcontinental railway in Canada and the United States with direct links to major ports on the west and east coasts, providing North American customers a competitive rail service with access to key markets in every corner of the globe. CP is growing with its customers, offering a suite of freight transportation services, logistics solutions and supply chain expertise. Visit cpr.ca to see the rail advantages of CP. <br/><br/> <strong>PURPOSE OF THE POSITION:</strong> <br/> Located in Calgary, reporting to the Manager Rail Assets and Operations Solutions - Yard Management, the Business Systems Specialist - SAP Lead Developer (ABAP) will review requirements, analyze, estimate, prioritize, plan, design, build, test, deploy and maintain the required functionality in support of business processes and procedures. <br/><br/> <strong>POSITION ACCOUNTABLITIES:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Lead a team of developers;</li> <li>Writing new and modifying existing ABAP code;</li> <li>Performance tuning ABAP code and use of best practices;</li> <li>Development of OData services and methods for use with Fiori and/or SAPUI5;</li> <li>Responsible for developing system technical specifications;</li> <li>Developing and executing tests to confirm the functionality;</li> <li>Creating necessary documentation and delivering knowledge transfer sessions;</li> <li>Use of Solution Manager CHARM;</li> <li>Working with other teams to ensure that continued effective integration of SAP, Transportation Management (TM), Sales and distribution (SD), Plant Maintenance (PM), Human Resources (HR), Business Intelligence (BI) and operation systems is achieved;</li> <li>Support of SAP modules: YL, TM, EWM, MM, SD, PM</li>  <li>Communicating in a team environment;</li> </ul>  <strong>POSITION REQUIREMENTS:</strong>   <ul>  <li>University degree or equivalent in Engineering or Computer Science;</li> <li>SAP Certification in SAP ABAP NW;</li> <li>A minimum (10) ten years of enterprise development experience;</li> <li>A minimum of (5) five years of experience in implementing and maintaining SAP ABAP;</li> <li>Experience in implementing and providing ongoing support of SAP version 4.7 Enterprise or higher;</li> </ul>  <strong>Preferred Skills</strong>  <ul>  <li>Knowledge on ABAP, FPM, BOPF and/or SAP DSM is nice to have.</li> <li>Strong familiarity with SAP implementation methodologies, including ASAP;</li> <li>Extensive experience designing and configuring the key integration points between the SAP modules;</li> <li>Preferred applicants will have knowledge on SAP BRF+, SAP BPM, SAP BRM and be certified in at least one module of the SAP Business Suite;</li> <li><strong>Required:</strong> ABAP OO, ABAP, WDA, FBI, FPM, BOPE, Fiori/SAPUI5/Odata,;</li>  <li><strong>Nice to Have:</strong> Web Development, HTTP/HTTPs, Javascript, XML, JSON, ALE, Adobe Forms, System Integration and business processes, Workflow, Proxies, AIF, Business Process Modelling, .Net, Security (encryption), Packaging, visual studio 2010+, Active Directory;</li> <li><strong>Development Knowledge:</strong> EWM, MM, SD highly considered</li> <li><strong>Soft Skills:</strong> Strong leadership skills and the ability to multi-task within a dynamic workplace;</li> <li>Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills;</li> <li>Excellent time-management skills and the ability to deliver quality results with an aggressive timeline.</li> </ul>  <strong>WHAT CP HAS TO OFFER:</strong>  <ul>  <li>Flexible and competitive benefits package</li> <li>Competitive company pension plan</li> <li>Employee Share Purchase Plan</li> <li>Performance Incentive Program</li> <li>Annual Fitness Subsidy</li> </ul>  <strong>ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:</strong> <br/> As an employer with national presence, the possibility does exist that the location of your position may be changed based on organizational requirements. <br/><br/> <strong>Background Investigation:</strong> <br/> The successful candidate will need to successfully complete the following clearances:  <ul>  <li>Criminal history check</li> <li>Reference check</li> </ul>  <strong>Management Conductor Program:</strong> <br/> Becoming a qualified conductor or locomotive engineer is the single best way for a management employee to learn the business at CP. You may be required to obtain a certification or to maintain your current certification/qualification as a conductor or locomotive engineer. <br/><br/> CP is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of employment equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals. All applicant information will be managed in accordance with the federal Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act ("PIPEDA"). <br/><br/>

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst / Developer
Job_Description: About Vista<br/><br/>Recognized as one of Canadas top employers and Best Managed Companies, Vista Projects is a full service engineering, procurement and project management company serving Western Canadas oil sands and conventional oil and gas producers for over 30 years. Our continued growth comes from an experienced team of professionals who have an absolute commitment to providing our clients with exceptional service. We specialize in facility engineering design for thermal heavy oil (SAGD, CSS), enhanced oil recovery, and sustaining capital projects. Over the years, we have earned our reputation as a trusted leader in thermal energy projects, working on some of the most successful in-situ heavy oil projects in the oil sands.<br/><br/>Main Duties and Competencies<br/><br/>The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for the development and maintenance of the company business intelligence portal, and related business applications. This is a fantastic opportunity for either a tech savvy business graduate, or a business savvy developer to elevate their career. <br/><br/> This role combines business analysis, front-end and back-end development to deliver a challenging and engaging position where the successful candidate will be able to see their contributions come to life within a fast-paced and dynamic workplace. <br/><br/> If a role where you are empowered and supported to move from opportunity identification, through conceptualization, development and testing in weeks and not years sounds up your alley read on. <br/><br/> Duties will include:  <ul> <li>Creative problem solving</li> <li>Design and develop business intelligence reporting tools, visualizations and applications across all parts of Vistas business</li> <li>Maintain and work within Vistas data warehouse. Participate in the design, development and analysis of the data warehouse</li> <li>Assist in the selection, deployment and maintenance of third party business applications</li> <li>Maintain and develop new and legacy code for proprietary business applications</li> <li>Complete ad-hoc BI reporting for a variety of stakeholders</li> <li>Document business processes, relationships and software</li> <li>Design, code and test SQL queries to provide information to internal teams</li> <li>Identify process improvement opportunities within the organization</li> <li>Complete data integrity audits</li> <li>Complete security audits</li> <li>Other duties as required.</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>Undergraduate degree in one of: Business, Commerce, Accounting, Management Information Systems or Engineering OR post-secondary diploma in Software Development, Web Development</li> <li>Strong understanding of best-in-class business processes (HR, Accounting, Finance etc)</li> <li>Advanced knowledge of relational databases (RDB) and SQL (one of tSQL, MySQL, Postres etc)</li> <li>Must be trustworthy, discreet, detail focused and action orientated.</li> <li>Must be comfortable working autonomously, as well as in a team-development environment. Must be comfortable working with a remote team</li> </ul>  <strong>Preferred:</strong>   <ul> <li>Demonstrated experience in programming in either PHP or Python</li> <li>Previous development experience in either Logi Analytics, Tableau, SiSense</li> <li>Three plus years of post-graduate professional work experience</li> </ul>  What We Offer<br/><br/>An opportunity with Vista is not just a job; it is a chance to work with colleagues who are among the most recognized and accomplished in the industry.<br/><br/>Vista offers all employees   <ul> <li>A stimulating, fast-paced and challenging work environment where you will contribute to the most successful oil and gas projects in Western Canada;</li> <li>An opportunity to be a part of an entrepreneurial, technically skilled team which has established leadership in innovative engineering;</li> <li>A strong value-based philosophy that provides an informal, close-knit team environment, where you and your family feel like a part of our organization, and not just an employee number;</li> <li>Competitive compensation and benefits, including a performance-linked variable pay program;</li> <li>Company-sponsored social events and team sports;</li> <li>Flexible work schedules, half-day Fridays and free parking (excludes downtown office);</li> <li>An organization that values and encourages diversity;</li> <li>Shareholder opportunities are a long-term potential for exceptional employees.</li> </ul>  How To Apply<br/><br/>Please submit a cover letter concisely demonstrating how your skills and experience align with our job posting. <br/><br/> <strong>Note:</strong> <em>As part of the interview process there will be a technical testing component which will take up to two hours and can be completed at home on your own timelines. Candidates may be required to complete a security clearance procedure prior to offer.</em>

Title: Senior Developer, Markit Analytics
Job_Description: <strong>Department overview:</strong> <br/><br/> Financial Risk Analytics is part of the IHS Markit group and provides industry leading risk analytics solutions to sell side institutions within the financial markets. Risk management and risk regulation is continuously driving demand for more accurate calculations and risk system vendors are continuously striving for improvements in performance and scalability. The product has been designed, built and continuously improved over a ten year period. It is carefully architected to scale from running on a single laptop for demonstration purposes right through to running on 1,000+ core distributed grids. <br/><br/> Financial Risk Analytics provides solutions for Credit Risk PFE, Market Risk VaR and sensitivities, Credit Value Adjustment (CVA), Initial Margin (IM) and regulatory calculations such as EC, RC, IRC and CRM, <br/><br/> <strong>Position summary</strong> <br/><br/> Markit is currently investing in their technology platform to develop a number of new revenue-generating products, leveraging open source projects and big data technologies. These include new visualisation, risk aggregation and smart data initiatives that address new data, risk, and regulatory requirements and are highly visible and strategic within the organisation. <br/><br/> These initiatives are using best-of-breed technologies, such as Hadoop, Spark, HDFS, and HBase along with in-house-developed technologies. The successful candidate will be working in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment, building commercial products which are at the heart of the business. <br/><br/> Markit is looking for a highly-skilled Big Data developer proficient in the JVM ecosystem, with strong analysis and troubleshooting skills; Scala is the language of choice. The candidate needs to be able to design, develop, profile and debug a highly-available, distributed system. <br/><br/> Markit follows agile software development processes with the emphasis on delivering high-quality, tested and demo-able code at the end of each sprint. <br/><br/> <strong>Duties & accountabilities</strong> <br/><br/> Design and implement Big Data platforms for batch and real-time analytics. <br/><br/> Interpret and analyse business use-cases and feature requests into technical designs and development tasks. <br/><br/> Take ownership of development tasks; participate in regular backlog grooming, sprint planning, design and code review meetings. <br/><br/> Be an active contributor in system architecture and design discussions, with a focus on system performance. <br/><br/> Produce high-quality work, always following quality standards such as unit testing, integration tests and documented code. <br/><br/> Be delivery-focused, have a passion for technology, and enjoy offering new ideas and approaches. <br/><br/> Work with distributed teams in multiple locations worldwide. <br/><br/> <strong>Business competencies</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Education and experience</strong> <br/><br/> Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or a related discipline, or equivalent experience. <br/><br/> Strong software development experience in Scala and Java <br/><br/> Be able to demonstrate experience with a key role in Big Data projects. <br/><br/> Good knowledge of Apache Spark. <br/><br/> Experienced in the Hadoop ecosystem (HDFS, Hive, HBase). <br/><br/> Hadoop optimisation, including storage file formats, data transmission techniques and partitioning. <br/><br/> Linux and scripting <br/><br/> Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Business Intelligence (BI) tools and SQL is an advantage. <br/><br/> <strong>Commercial awareness</strong> <br/><br/> Knowledge of credit risk and market risk management workflows is useful but not required. <br/><br/> Management requirements <br/><br/> You can effectively provide technical direction and estimates to fulfil requirements. <br/><br/> You can coordinate teams across time zones to effectively manage deliveries. <br/><br/> You follow relevant technology trends and actively evaluate new technologies to improve the product. <br/><br/> You get a lot of satisfaction from on-time delivery. <br/><br/> Happy clients are really important to you. <br/><br/> <strong>Personal competencies</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Personal impact</strong> <br/><br/> You love to solve complex problems, whether that's making the user experience as responsive as possible or understanding complex client requirements. <br/><br/> <strong>Communication</strong> <br/><br/> You can confidently present your own ideas and solutions, as well as guide technical discussions. <br/><br/> You can effectively communicate with external clients <br/><br/> <strong>Teamwork</strong> <br/><br/> Your welcoming attitude encourages people to approach you when they have a problem you can help them solve. <br/><br/> We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Please refer to the <strong>EEO is the Law Poster & Supplement, Right to Work and Pay Transparency Policy. IHS Markit is a participant in E-Verify (see links below)</strong>. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment drug testing. <br/><br/> EEO is the Law <br/> EEO is the Law Supplement <br/> Right to Work <br/> Pay Transparency Policy <br/> E-Verify<br/><br/>Current ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.

Title: Senior Air Quality Scientist/Engineer
Job_Description: SLR is a multi-disciplinary environmental consulting firm that specializes in provision of these services within the following business sectors in Canada and the world: Built Environment, Industry, Infrastructure, Mining & Minerals, Oil & Gas, Power and Waste Management. SLR is one of a very small number of truly international specialist environmental consultancies. <br/><br/> The SLR Canadian air team is a fast growing specialty service. We specialize in modelling, monitoring, testing and emission inventories. This team is supported by a very large international air team that brings expertise to the Canadian group in all of these services. <br/><br/> As an employee controlled company, in which many of our staff have a share, SLR offers rewarding careers to all of its staff and values and rewards customer care and commitment as well as technical expertise. SLR provides a healthy and dynamic work environment, challenging career opportunities and competitive compensation and benefit packages. <br/><br/> For more information, please visit http://www.slrconsulting.com.: <br/><br/> <strong>Role:</strong> <br/><br/> SLR has an opportunity for a Senior level Air Environmental Engineer/Scientist in our Calgary, AB office. The role will consist of: <ul> <li>Senior level position in the air assessment groups at SLR.</li> <li>Working with Project and Principal staff to complete a wide variety of assessments as required.</li><li>Project management, Project Delivery and Quality Control</li> </ul> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> The successful candidate will be involved with air quality projects. The work involved will be predominantly office based activities with site visits and client meetings. Occasional travel mostly within Canada but potentially internationally will be required. <br/><br/> <strong>Technical Skills / Abilities / Experience:</strong> <ul> <li>10 to 15 years of air quality and/or greenhouse gas assessment work experience</li><li>Experience with air quality modelling software e.g. AERMOD or CALPUFF</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential with demonstrated skill in technical report writing.</li><li>Willingness and ability to travel and conduct fieldwork.</li><li>Ability to work alone in remote locations and adapt to conditions/resources.</li> </ul> <strong>Education / Qualifications / Memberships:</strong> <ul> <li>Degree in engineering (e.g., environmental, geological, civil), science, chemistry or mathematics.</li><li>Professional status or eligibility for professional status with a professional organization preferred (i.e. APEGA, P.Chem., P.Geo., P.Bio.).</li> </ul> <strong>Personal Attributes:</strong> <ul> <li>Demonstrated team player with excellent interpersonal skills</li><li>Strong attention to detail and accuracy</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills</li><li>Team player who demonstrates a co-operative spirit with colleagues and management</li><li>Optimistic and positive attitude</li><li>Ability to manage multiple priorities & deadlines</li> </ul>  <strong>Job Posted by ApplicantPro</strong> <br/>
