Title: Front-end Developer (Web), Marketing, University Relations
Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> The <strong> Marketing team</strong> within <strong> University Relations</strong> is currently seeking a Full-time Limited Term <strong> Front-end Developer (Web)</strong> ,for approximately 1 year. <br/><br/> This position reports to the Associate Director, Digital Experience. <br/><br/> Working with, and guided by, the Senior Experience Designer, this role collaborates on UX concepts or visual designs and turns them into operational and interactive digital elements which work across multiple platforms while following the experience standards. The work includes responsibility for shared, global and custom user experience elements and their technical implementation regardless of backend technology (eg, global CSS, Javascript). The role requires the management of competing interests and deadlines, and the ability to manage multiple projects with shifting priorities within a SCRUM based development environment. The ideal candidate for this position will have a combination of creativity and technical expertise. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Key Responsibilities</strong> (job functions include but are not limited to): <ul> 	<li>Understand and apply effective use of digital design and display technologies for digital applications and/or websites while adhering to university brand standards</li> 	<li>Determine technical solutions for experience challenges including the coding of the appropriate solution in a way it can be reusable by others on campus across multiple technologies and/or devices</li> 	<li>Strive to attain industry standards in digital usability</li> 	<li>Provide input into the front-end prototype</li> 	<li>Find development solutions for approved prototypes</li> 	<li>Work with the senior experience designer and back-end developers to build processes and procedures that ensure a robust and well-tested build</li> 	<li>Work with development teams in a SCRUM, Agile or Waterfall environment</li> 	<li>Provide input on project scope and timelines</li> 	<li>Deliver against the timelines and scope of the project</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications / Requirements:</strong> <ul> 	<li>Minimum of 4 years' experience as a front-end web developer and designer in the digital space with a particular focus on organizations with both central and distributed authoring models</li> 	<li>Undergraduate degree or diploma in a related field of study such as visual communications, web or digital design, graphic design, or a related field</li> 	<li>Intermediate technical and digital production experience in all of the following areas with a bias towards front-end development: HTML5, CSS3, SASS, JavaScript, jQuery / jQuery Mobile and Adobe Creative Suite</li> 	<li>Intermediate technical expertise and experience in mobile-first frameworks with a primary focus on Bootstrap 3 as well as experience with Drupal 8 and Twig templating, ReactJS and CSS Grid, PHP</li> 	<li>Strong knowledge of best practices for digital design and an understanding of the principles of responsive and accessible design</li> 	<li>Experience working from design flats and rapid prototyping tools such as Axure, as well as agile collaboration systems such as Jira within SCRUM, Agile and waterfall development teams</li> 	<li>Experience with code storage, versioning and promotion using Git</li> 	<li>Familiarity with both Mac and PC platforms as well as mobile operating systems such as iOS and Android for platform-testing purposes</li> 	<li>Ability to effectively manage multiple projects/tasks of varying complexities; ability to work autonomously and under pressure, as required</li> 	<li>Demonstrated interest in remaining at the forefront of trends and technologies; willingness to experiment with new ideas and tools</li> 	<li>Strong communications and interpersonal skills are required to work with area team members and to sustain strong relationships with internal clients and external vendors</li>  </ul> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  May 21, 2018 <br/><br/> <em>We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> This position is part of the AUPE bargaining unit, and falls under the <em><strong>Technical Job Family, Phase I</strong></em>. <br/><br/> To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Management and Staff Careers website</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.</em>

Title: Java Developer
Job_Description: Autodata Solutions is looking for five <strong>Java Developers</strong> to join their growing Calgary team! <br/><br/> Autodata offers professional services, custom software and data management solutions to some of the world’s largest automotive companies. We assist our clients with merchandising product lineups. Engaged by both Marketing and IT our solutions need to be cutting edge while achieving a high standard of quality. In the competitive, ever changing automotive industry, our clients look to us to find awesome ways to get products to market first and entice target consumers to shop. <br/><br/> <strong>Who We are Looking For:</strong> <br/><br/> To work with our team, you need to be a quick thinker with fresh ideas, take pride in your strong technical skills and come prepared to deliver fast, deliver often, and do it right. Most of all, we need to have a blast doing what we love. We are welcoming everyone to join our group of brilliant nerds on our adventure to excellence. <br/><br/> <strong>What to Expect:</strong>  <ul> <li>Gear up and join in on research & development proof of concepts</li> <li>Lead and mentor teams while delivering amazing software</li> <li>Influence road map of systems based on technology direction and customer needs</li> <li>Vigilantly maintain current knowledge with latest technology trends</li> <li>Buddy up with Analysts, Architects, Testers and Project Management to improve on standards and best practices.</li> <li>Own it!</li> </ul> <strong>At a minimum you need:</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years of experience with JVM based languages</li> <li>Strong verbal and written communication</li> <li>Proficiency in SQL-like languages</li> <li>Strength to build followership through inspiration</li> <li>A habit for delivering quality software using automated testing (Unit, Integration, System, Performance, etc.)</li> <li>Architectural wisdom of applications on the web</li> <li>Passion to build distributed, reliable, scalable, low-latency REST web services.</li> <li>To keep your cool under pressure; focused on the solution</li> <li>Thirst to work in a fast-paced & dynamic environment</li> <li>Uncompromising willingness to learn</li> </ul> <strong>Equally Important:</strong>  <ul> <li>Spidey sense preventing future issues with new and existing designs</li> <li>Practiced mastery of continuous deployment, containerization, on premise and cloud systems</li> <li>Exposure to machine learning</li> <li>Number nerd - analytics, performance metrics, statistics</li> <li>Open source is sliced bread</li> <li>Experience with A/B Testing</li> <li>Desire to show off your skills</li> </ul> For more information about Autodata, please visit our company website at www.autodata.net. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified. Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please specify.

Title: Senior Transportation Engineer
Job_Description: <p>Posting Number ARA-SRTRNS/15 </p>  <p>Senior Transportation Engineer<br>  </p>  <p>Planning, design, and construction administration of transportation infrastructure projects (i.e. traffic impact and other related engineering assessments, intersection engineering, highway design and construction, standard bridge construction, etc.). We require a candidate that has strong interpersonal skills, experience in project management, business development, people and resource management and proposal writing.</p>    <p>SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE<br>  •	B.Sc. in Civil Engineering.<br>  •	Registration with APEGA.<br>  •	10+ years of previous project management and design experience.<br>  •	Knowledge of design, construction specifications, construction estimating, contract preparation, and contract administration.<br>  •	Familiar with the use of Softree, Alberta Transportation, City of Calgary and TAC design guides and other road design software programs will be an asset.<br>  •	Strong ability to multi-task and deal effectively with multiple opportunities and deadlines.<br>  •	Solutions driven, able to prioritize and make decisions in a timely manner.<br>  •	Exceptional interpersonal skills, proven ability to maintain positive relationships with clients, and team members in order to maximize cooperation and achievement of deliverables.<br>  •	Combination of relevant experience and education will be considered.</p>  <p>KEY RESPONSIBILITIES<br>  •	Lead engineering design work, and construction administration for transportation infrastructure projects for rural or urban roads and highways.<br>  •	Complete traffic impact studies and functional planning assignments.<br>  •	Preliminary engineering of new roadways and pavement rehabilitation projects. <br>  •	Participate in road inspections and coordinate construction activities.<br>  •	During construction you may be required to be outside of the Calgary head office approximately 60% of the time. <br>  •	Liaise with existing clients and ensure their expectations are met.<br>  •	Lead scope changes through active communication and actions.<br>  •	Ensure exceptional communication with clients and internal team members to ensure timely flow of information, actions, deliverables, timelines and budgets.<br>  •	Mentor and supervise internal team members comprised of engineers, technologists, and project personnel.<br>  •	Oversee the preparation and review of contract and tender documents.<br>  •	Lead the preparation of proposal documents.<br>  •	Identify and develop new business opportunities.<br>  •	Recruitment of staff and building a team.</p>    <p>This full time permanent position offers a competitive salary with benefits including health and dental. Salary will be commensurate with experience.</p>  <p>Interested applicants are encouraged to apply by faxing or emailing a resume and cover letter to (403) 735-6035 or hiring@araeng.com. We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value of diverse workforce. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those candidates whose background closely matches the opportunity will be contacted for an interview.</p>  <p>Interested applicants are invited to reply, quoting position of interest, to:</p>  <p>Human Resources Co-ordinator,<br>  Finda Centre<br>  22 Royal Vista Drive N.W.<br>  Calgary, Alberta, Canada, T3R 0N2</p>  <p>Fax: 403-735-6035</p>  <p>E-mail: hiring@araeng.com </p>  <p>ARA Engineering Ltd. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.</p>  <p>Competition will close when suitable candidates are found.</p>  <p>Thank you for your interest in ARA Engineering Ltd.</p>

Title: Electronics/Hardware Engineer
Job_Description: As part of our continued growth, we are seeking an <strong>Electronics Engineer</strong> to join our development team. As the ideal candidate, you enjoy exploring new technologies and are well-versed in bringing hardware products that provide an exceptional user experience, to market. Your broad experience with all aspects of electronics design, including both schematic and layout, gives you the skills to take a concept from requirement analysis and design through to implementation, validation, manufacturing and deployment. <br/><br/> You are diligent, proactive and have a reputation for taking an innovative approach when solving difficult problems. You enjoy collaborating with small teams and have the resourcefulness, initiative and intuition to navigate through the challenges of new product development in an entrepreneurial environment. You take ownership of your deliverables and take pride in the knowledge that your designs will have an impact on end-users. <br/><br/> <strong>What you will do</strong>  <ul> <li>Work with the project team to evaluate customer and market requirements, and propose architectural solutions that will complement Nureva’s software product suite to accomplish project goals.</li>   <li>Establish a hardware development strategy based on overall system architecture and deliverables</li> <li>Design and implement electronics designs (schematic/layout) to meet functional requirements, along with performance and quality metrics. This may include a range of features, including DSP/Microcontrollers, power regulation, sensor integration, and user interface.</li> <li>Generate schedules and budgets for hardware development activities</li> <li>Create and maintain design documentation</li> <li>Develop and execute design test plans to verify system performance and quality.</li> <li>Work with the NPI team to support volume manufacturing.</li> <li>Support and contribute to Nureva’s evolving end-to-end product development processes by applying relevant best practices to ensure consistent delivery of quality products</li> <li>Maintain a comprehensive awareness of the technology landscape and identify opportunities for future product portfolio enhancements.</li> <li>Contribute to Nureva’s growing intellectual property portfolio</li> </ul> <strong>What you bring</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in engineering or a related discipline</li> <li>8+ years’ relevant experience in electronics hardware design</li> <li>Proven ability to perform both schematic and layout for microcontroller or DSP based electronics designs using Altium or similar tools.</li> <li>Experience with analog and digital designs, including interfaces using USB, I2C, SPI, UART, Ethernet, Bluetooth and others.</li> <li>Solid grasp of the concepts surrounding Design for Manufacture, and EMC mitigation methods.</li> <li>Must be familiar with, and able to operate a wide range of electronics test equipment.</li> <li>Requires knowledge of IPC standards and electronics manufacturing methods.</li> <li>Good verbal and written communication skills.</li> <li>Proven interpersonal and communications skills in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.</li> <li>Experience with audio design will be considered an asset.</li> </ul> We offer a competitive total compensation package, an open and collaborative office in downtown Calgary and a great team environment. <br/><br/> Apply online by close of business on <strong>May 18, 2018</strong>. Please outline how you will make a difference on our team. We will spend time to help you understand the role and our company to ensure we are a good fit for you.

<STRONG>As our ideal candidate you’ll also have:</STRONG>  <ul> <LI>College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science or management information systems is directed</LI><LI>Strong customer service orientation</LI><LI>Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment</LI><LI>Delivery of high quality security and network integration services from peers, and colleagues</LI><LI>Ability to prioritize and work well under pressure</LI><LI>Ability to pay close attention to detail</LI> </ul>  <STRONG>How Do We Hire Great People?</STRONG> <br/><br/> We believe in matching the right people for the right role. Completing the PI tool will take no more than 10 minutes of your time. <br/><br/> If we see a match with your skills and our open roles, we will reach out to you to schedule time to talk so that we can learn more about you and you can learn about us. Title: Senior Developer

Thats why our work begins and ends with our clients customers. We listen to them. Validate with them. We even include them in our design process. By creating customer experiences that are simple, valuable, entertaining, and convenient, we deliver measurable results for some of the worlds most admired brands. <br/><br/> <strong>Today were 950 people in 11 offices on 4 continents.</strong> <br/><br/> We love diverse points of view, open minds, and people who are passionate, driven, and real. And we love all things digital, too. <br/><br/> <strong>Senior Developer</strong> <br/><br/> The Critical Mass tech team is looking for an inspired & motivated Senior Front-End Developer to join our team. In all cases were taking advantage of everything HTML5 & CSS3 have to offer, as well as the latest in responsive grid frameworks, templating engines and various JavaScript patterns for reusability and performance. Ideal candidates must have extensive experience in responsive HTML and CSS development, dont necessarily need to be an expert in JavaScript, but some experience and a deep passion to improve your craft is a must. The role will be mentored by a Tech Lead. Candidates will be working hand in hand with Creative and UX to fulfill client requests. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Rapid prototyping with code, using modern front-end frameworks and a digital pattern library</li> <li>Deliver solutions balancing technical and business requirements. Experience has taught you what works. Your long history in the game helps you choose the best mix of proven and cutting-edge technology.</li> <li>Interacting with project teams to understand business and user requirements</li> <li>Maintaining high coding standards and practices and exercise quality control on all aspects of web development</li> <li>Problem-solving in all areas of web development</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>6+ years demonstrated development experience with hand-coding advanced HTML, CSS, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript</li> <li>Experience developing with modern front-end tools and frameworks such, e.g. AngularJS,</li> <li>Backbone.js, SASS/LESS, Node.js</li> <li>Package manager and automation tool experience (npm, gulp, grunt)</li> <li>Demonstrated understanding of Responsive Web Design principles</li> <li>Proficiency with Semantic HTML Markup</li> <li>Accessibility knowledge (WCAG 2.0 Level AA) preferred</li> <li>Experience diagnosing and solving cross-browser/cross-platform issues</li> <li>Experience working with cross-functional and cross-office teams</li>  </ul>

If you are an IT professional with Entrepreneurial aspirations and want to be the lead for applications development, this may be a job opportunity for you. Our company is looking for an Application Software Programmer / Developer with a background in the developing, implementation and ongoing support of process control and general accounting application software.  A working knowledge of Telco billing systems and PBX/VOIP Systems is an asset.  Other job activities include working directly with the clients to enhance products and provide customization's. Our Products The Application Systems have been designed to manage, audit and control all aspects of Telecommunication Infrastructure and expense for large Fortune 1000 corporate, government and institutional clients. Our clients require a full suite of Software programming and related Support / professional services.   The Core applications include: Call Detail Recording / Accounting Telecom Inventory Management TELCO Electronic Invoice Process (TELUS Ebod, Bell Canada OBM, Rogers Wireless, TELUS Mobility, Bell Mobility) Telecom Expense Management (TEM) Telecom Work Order Processing (Telecom Adds/Moves/Change)   JOB DESCRIPTION We are seeking a unique individual to drive our core software development of existing applications under the direction of the senior systems designer. Applicants with entrepreneurial skill sets will be an asset. For the successful employee, there will be options for equity positions in in our company as a Junior partner. Our products are designed in the Sunbelt PLB language and a 4GL program generator – Systemaker from InfoPro. The candidate needs to learn this core language (PLB) and Development tool in the delivery of their job duties. (See Sunbelt PLB and InfoPro Web Pages for more detail). The job requires an individual who has a desire to work in a dynamic environment in all facets of the application software design and development. The job also allows the individual to work in the ongoing development of the product as well as new conceptual software design.  JOB DUTIES Core ongoing Applications Development Learning and excelling at programming with the existing Development tools; the PLB Language and InfoPro Systemaker, Kermit Script, Perl, CSV2.xls General module design and programming Maintain the existing application systems Keep up with the New development of both Development tool and Language to transform these applications into a WEB & Mobile based application using a MySQL back-end Ongoing Software Customizations for individual clients and projects Develop new applications using these tools. Take the application to the next level (Web / mobile / MySQL)  Qualification A mandatory requirement to have the ability to learn new programming language and development tools (Sunbelt PLB and InfoPro Systemaker) Minimum 10 years’ experience in Applications Software design, programming and development A background in accounting software Knowledge and experience working with Voice Telecom, PBX/VOIP technologies (Cisco, Avaya) and Telco billing systems is an asset Working knowledge of Linux and Microsoft is preferred Working knowledge of Linux and Microsoft is preferred Knowledge of; Telecom Billing Systems Telco Inventory Systems Telco Work Oder systems Telco Billing systems PBX and VOIP Technologies     We offer a competitive Compensation Package with full benefits, flex time as well as a casual work space.  Offices are in south Calgary. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those selected for an interview will contacted.     Keywords: Software premier services in integration architecture and development and business intelligence solutions.    Bring your depth knowledge and experience in InfoSphere DataStage and we will provide you exciting work complemented with training opportunities to expand your career horizons.   Our mission is to “Be the leader in delivering integrated and information management services for businesses aiming for excellence.”   Are you ready to join us?   DataStage Developer Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:   ·         Provide onsite consulting to various Groundswell clients for long and short term projects and sustainment engagements. ·         Create data deliverables for specific projects through rewriting existing ETL processes using DataStage and create new processes to support opportunity is $75k - $90k Cdn depending upon experience.   Our total compensation package includes group benefits, eligibility for performance bonus, profit sharing, and paid vacation.  This is a full-time permanent role (40 hour per week) based in Calgary, Alberta. Title: Android Developer
Job_Description: Android Developer   					Posted date [Jan-05-17]  					 (ID: 89176)  				 Robots and Pencils  				               					  » See all jobs by this advertiser        | More     Back|					 								         This post has expired! It was posted more than 60 days ago.    At Robots and Pencils, we’re expanding and looking for an Android Developer to join our talented  and world class robot team.  Who you are: You are someone who prefers to communicate through code.  You love to create and have a strong desire to learn. You have strong opinions but that are weakly held; you are humble yet confident. In fact, you’re the first to pass along the latest headache busting library from Square to your colleagues just minutes after sending a link to a mind clarifying blog post from Romain Guy. You can speak to language best practices and are not afraid of anonymous inner-classes. You never overlook the saved instance state and have contemplated the tradeoffs between activities, fragments and views. You have knowledge of how a RESTful web service works, what makes it RESTful and how it can be accessed from Android. You are also diligent about meeting allocated budgets and can work within time constraints, but you will never sacrifice quality. What you’ll do:  Design, program and test software. Author and maintain relevant documentation for developers, clients and users. Develop and refine prototypes to confirm requirements. Program according to project plans (versions, sprints). Test according to pre-determined test plans. Support release and post-release activities, such as support, versioning and maintenance. Collaborate with our pencils (designers) to create interfaces that conform to the Google design guidelines. Peer review other team members’ code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own code. Support sales and project managers with technical insights, leading to the creation of budgets and schedules for projects.  Desired skills and experience:  5+ years of delivering software with preference given to those who have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent Solid understanding and practical knowledge of the full mobile development and application life cycle Solid understanding of Android UX/UI guidelines and best practices Experience with Android using Android Studio and JAVA Experience with a distributed Version Control System Experience with mobile development issues related to performance optimisation, caching and security Excellent communications skills with the ability to share insights and expectations with clients, stakeholders and colleagues, both locally and remotely  Work perks  Working alongside smart, talented people who will push you and help you grow. Support for professional development and access to as many books as you can read. A great work environment and health benefits. Fun activities (like book club and board game nights), biweekly Robo Brews and team parties.  To Apply:  https://robotsandpencils.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=84 About Robots and Pencils Robots and Pencils is an app development company known for its top-ranking consumer apps, transformative enterprise apps and world-first learning platforms. Started in 2009, Robots and Pencils has more than 250 apps used by over 77 million people worldwide, and was named one of North America’s Technology Fast 500 by Deloitte in 2014. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
